name: NOAH'S ARK ( TOLWORTH ) PRE-SCHOOL
activities: Noah's Ark Pre-School provides stimulating and enjoyable surroundings for children aged 2.5 - 4 years and works towards the Governments National Early Learning goals.  It assists in the development of communication and language, literacy, mathematics, personal, emotional and social development, understanding the world, physical and creative development. This is achieved through play and teaching.
objects: TO ENHANCE THE DEVELOPMENT AND EDUCATION OF CHILDREN PRIMARILY UNDER STATUTORY SCHOOL AGE BY ENCOURAGING PARENTS TO UNDERSTAND AND PROVIDE FOR THE NEED OF THEIR CHILDREN THROUGH COMMUNITY GROUPS BY:-  (A) OFFERING APPROPRIATE PLAY, EDUCATION, CARE FACILITIES AND FAMILY LEARNING, TOGETHER WITH THE RIGHT OF PARENTS TO TAKE RESPONSIBILITY FOR AND TO BECOME INVOLVED IN THE ACTIVITIES OF SUCH GROUPS. THE PRE-SCHOOL WILL ENSURE THAT SUCH GROUPS OFFER OPPORTUNITIES FOR ALL CHILDREN WHATEVER THEIR RACE, CULTURE, RELIGION, MEANS OR ABILITY  (B) ENCOURAGING THE STUDY OF THE NEEDS OF SUCH CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES AND PROMOTING PUBLIC INTERESTS IN AND RECOGNITION OF SUCH NEEDS IN THE LOCAL AREA  (C) INSTIGATING AND ADHERING TO AND FURTHERING THE AIMS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PRE SCHOOL LEARNING ALLIANCE

name: SAVE A CHILD'S HEART
activities: To provide funds for medical care and treatment for children from developing countries. To provide funds for the training of medical personnel from developing countries for the benefit of such children.
objects: TO PROVIDE FUNDS FOR THE MEDICAL CARE AND TREATMENT OF CHILDREN FROM DEVELOPING COUNTRIES WHO NEED AND MIGHT OTHERWISE NOT RECEIVE SUCH CARE AND TREATMENT AND FOR MEDICAL RESEARCH TO BENEFIT SUCH CHILDREN (2) TO PROVIDE FUNDS DIRECTED TO THE EDUCATIONAND TRAINING IN MEDICINE AND MEDICAL RESEARCH OF PERSONS FROM DEVELOPING COUNTRIES IN THEIR OWN COUNTRY AND/OR ELSEWHERE FOR THE BENEFIT OF SUCH CHILDREN (3) TO PROMOTE THE EDUCATION AND TRAINING IN MEDICINE AND MEDICAL RESEARCH OF PERSONS FROM DEVELOPING COUNTRIES IN THEIR OWN COUNTRY OR ELSEWHERE IN ORDER TO ENABLE THEM TO ACQUIRE AND DEVELOP THESE SKILLS WHICH MAY ASSIST THEM TO IMPROVE THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE AND WELL BEING IN ALL RESPECTS AND THOSE OF THEIR COMPATRIOTS AND OTHERS

name: DOBCROFT AFTER SCHOOL HOURS CARE (DASH)
activities: Provision of a safe, friendly environment for the daily care, recreation and learning of children aged 4 to 11 years during out of school hours.
objects: 1. TO PROVIDE A SAFE, FRIENDLY ENVIRONMENT FOR THE DAILY CARE, RECREATION AND LEARNING OF CHILDREN AGED 4-11 YEARS DURING OUT OF SCHOOL HOURS 2. SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS THE TRUSTEES IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION THINK FIT

name: AL-HASSAN EDUCATION CENTRE
activities: Supplementary classes. Youth sports club. Luncheon club for elders. Prayer facilities. Funeral service. We aim to bring cohesion within the community obtained death registration with Leeds City Council.
objects: THE RELIEF OF POVERTY AND OF PEOPLE WHO ARE AGED, ILL OR DISABLED, THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION, THE ADVANCEMENT OF RELIGION, AND OTHER PURPOSES BENEFICIAL TO THE COMMUNITY.

name: THE CONNECTION AT ST MARTIN-IN-THE-FIELDS
activities: We work with over 4,500 homeless people and those in insecure accommodation in Central London. Our day and night centre in Trafalgar Square provides services to help people move into housing or special support as well as employment and training.
objects: FOR THE RELIEF OF POOR PERSONS AND FOR FURTHERING ANY SIMILAR CHARITABLE PURPOSES OR SUPPORTING ANY CHARITABLE INSTITUTION ESTABLISHED FOR SIMILAR PURPOSES

name: FOUNDATION FOR THE SOCIOLOGY OF HEALTH AND ILLNESS
activities: To promote and improve for the public benefit social scientific research, education and scholarship in the field of the sociology of health and illness
objects: THE OBJECTS FOR WHICH THE CHARITY IS ESTABLISHED ARE FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT TO PROMOTE AND IMPROVE SOCIAL SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH, EDUCATION AND SCHOLARSHIP IN THE FIELD OF THE SOCIOLOGY OF HEALTH AND ILLNESS

name: THE NETWORK CHURCH
activities: Our responsibility as a church is to build and nurture a Christian community, serve those outside the community in a variety of different ways, and provide a forum for those who do not know God to explore the possibility of a relationship with him. We support and encourage those with a faith to deepen their relationship with God, and to increase their positive contribution to society.
objects: (A) TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH IN  ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATEMENT OF BELIEFS APPEARING IN  THE SCHEDULE HERETO IN THE COUNTY OF HERTFORDSHIRE AND IN SUCH OTHER PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM  TIME TO TIME THINK FIT (2) TO RELIEVE PEERSONS WHO ARE IN CONDITIONS OF NEED OR HARDSHIP OR WHO ARE AGED OR SICK AND TO RELIEVE THE DISTRESS CAUSED THEREBY IN THE SAID COUNTY AND IN SUCH OTHER PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIMETHINK FIT (C)  TO PROMOTE AND FULFIL SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES BENEFICIAL TO THE COMMUNITY IN  THE SAID COUNTY AND IN SUCH OTHER PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT

name: THE NETWORK CHURCH
activities: Our responsibility as a church is to build and nurture a Christian community, serve those outside the community in a variety of different ways, and provide a forum for those who do not know God to explore the possibility of a relationship with him. We support and encourage those with a faith to deepen their relationship with God, and to increase their positive contribution to society.
objects: (A) TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH IN  ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATEMENT OF BELIEFS APPEARING IN  THE SCHEDULE HERETO IN THE COUNTY OF HERTFORDSHIRE AND IN SUCH OTHER PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM  TIME TO TIME THINK FIT (2) TO RELIEVE PEERSONS WHO ARE IN CONDITIONS OF NEED OR HARDSHIP OR WHO ARE AGED OR SICK AND TO RELIEVE THE DISTRESS CAUSED THEREBY IN THE SAID COUNTY AND IN SUCH OTHER PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIMETHINK FIT (C)  TO PROMOTE AND FULFIL SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES BENEFICIAL TO THE COMMUNITY IN  THE SAID COUNTY AND IN SUCH OTHER PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT

name: THE INTERNATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF HYDROLOGICAL SCIENCES LIMITED
activities: To publish and disseminate a journal of hydrological sciences and also a series of hydrological conference proceedings and books to advance the knowledge of hydrology internationally.  Many of these publications are distributed free of charge to universities and research establishments in developing countries.
objects: TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND RESEARCH IN HYDROLOGY FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT AND TO PUBLISH THE USEFUL RESULTS OF SUCH RESEARCH

name: THORNHILL LEES COMMUNITY CENTRE ASSOCIATION
activities: Mums and toddlers; over 50s, IT classes; luncheon clubs; youth clubs and activities; College courses; room hire for weddings, training courses, conferences and meetings; art group; history group; keep fit; karate.
objects: ANY CHARITABLE PURPOSES FOR THE GENERAL BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF THORNHILL LEES IN THE COUNTY OF WEST YORKSHIRE IN PARTICULAR BY PROVIDING A COMMUNITY CENTRE FOR THE SAID INHABITANTS

name: BUTTERSHAW MILLENNIUM GREEN TRUST
activities: Looks after and maintains a grassed open space in the centre of a large housing estate
objects: THE TRUSTEES SHALL HOLD THE TRUST FUND AND ITS INCOME UPON TRUST TO APPLY THEM TO THE PROVISION OF THE PROPERTY AND SHALL ACCORDINGLY HOLD ANY PROPERTY TO PROVIDE AND MAINTAIN AN OPEN SPACE TO BE KNOWN AS "BUTTERSHAW MILLENNIUM GREEN" FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS AND TO BE USED FOREVER AS AN AREA FOR INFORMAL RECREATION, PLAY OR OTHER LEISURE-TIME OCCUPATIONS, A MEETING AREA OR PLACE FOR COMMUNITY EVENTS AND FOR ANY OTHER LAWFUL PURPOSE CONSISTENT WITH THESE TRUSTS AND FOR THE GENERAL BENEFIT OF THE COMMUNITY

name: ROYAL AIR FORCES ASSOCIATION HERTFORD AND DISTRICT BRANCH
activities: The Hertford & District Branch is one of many Branches that form part of a national network that make up of the overall RAF Association. The primary purpose is to raise funds to support the Welfare needs of serving and non serving members of the RAF Association.
objects: AS PER RAFA (226686)

name: THE ALTON COLLEGE FOUNDATION
activities: To award scholarships and development grants to stimulate, encourage and reward excellence amongst 6th Form students at Alton College, Hampshire. To provide equipment for Alton College that can not be funded by Government.
objects: A) TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF STUDENTS ATTENDING ALTON COLLEGE ("THE COLLEGE") BY PROVIDING OR ASSISTING IN THE PROVISION OF EQUIPMENT AND FACILITIES INCLUDING BUT NOT RESTRICTED TO GIFTS GRANTS LOANS SCHOLARSHIPS BURSARIES AND PRIZES NOT USUALLY PROVIDED FOR BY THE STATUTORY AUTHORITIES; AND B) TO SUPPORT SUCH CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS ARE CONNECTED WITH THE COLLEGE AS THE DIRECTORS OF THE CHARITY ("THE DIRECTORS") SHALL FROM TIME TO TIME IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION DETERMINE

name: CHRISTIAN FELLOWSHIP SCHOOL TRUST
activities: The objects of the School/Trust are to promote education based on Christian principles for children aged 4-16. Our aim is to support Christian families in the upbringing of their children. We purposely keep our fees low so that there is no sense of being elitist and by so doing we seek to serve ordinary folk as opposed to the rich and famous.
objects: THE PROMOTION OF EDUCATION BASED ON CHRISTIAN PRINCIPLES

name: CHANGE, GROW, LIVE
activities: CGL provides a range of services to support individuals, families and communities whose lives are adversely affected by crime, substance misuse, homelessness, anti-social behaviour, domestic violence, social deprivation and lack of opportunity. The Charity works with challenging service users with complex needs, including those with entrenched drug habits and offending behaviour.
objects: TO RELIEVE POVERTY IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY THROUGH THE PROVISION OF HOUSING, TO RELIEVE SICKNESS AND TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION AND TRAINING  (FOR MORE INFORMATION SEE MEMORANDUM OF ASSOCIATION)

name: THE GREGSON FAMILY CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: General Charitable Purposes
objects: TO PAY OR APPLY THE WHOLE OR ANY PART OR  PARTS OF THE CAPITAL THEREOF AND THE INCOME THEREOF TO OR TOWARDS OR FOR THE BENEFIT OF SUCH CHARITABLE INSTITUTION OR INSTITUTIONS OR CHARITABLE FOUNDATION OR FOUNDATIONS OR CHARITABLE PURPOSES WITHIN THE UNITED KINGDOM AND IN SUCH MANNER AND IN SUCH PROPORTIONS AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME IN THEIR DISCRETION DETERMINE.

name: THE CHESTER CLERGY FAMILY CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: Relief of need, hardship & distress, and promotion of education, family life and recreation among the families of clergy & licensed lay workers of the Church of England in the Diocese of Chester.
objects: 1. THE RELIEF OF NEED HARDSHIP AND DISTRESS AMONG THE FAMILIES OF CLERGY, ORDINANDS, AND OF LICENSED LAY WORKERS OF THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND FOR THE TIME  BEING SERVING IN THE DIOCESE OF CHESTER.  2. THE PROMOTION OF THE EDUCATION OF THE FAMILIES OF CLERGY, ORDINANDS, AND OF LICENSED LAY WORKERS OF THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND FOR THE TIME BEING SERVING IN THE  DIOCESE OF CHESTER AND WHO ARE IN FINANCIAL NEED.  3. THE PROMOTION OF THE FAMILY LIFE AND RECREATION OF THE CLERGY, ORDINANDS, AND OF LICENSED LAYWORKERS OF THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND FOR THE TIME BEING SERVING IN THE  DIOCESE OF CHESTER AND THEIR FAMILIES AND WHO ARE IN FINANCIAL NEED.

name: JUST TRUST
activities: GRANTMAKING: For charitable work overseas. All grant applications must be made through our website. The projects we support are aimed at producing lasting change, particularly through small-scale self-help initiatives, to some of the poorest sections of society. We also have concern for the victims of violence and for the promotion of peace.
objects: FOR SUCH CHARITABLE OBJECT OR OBJECTS IN ANY PART OF THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION THINK FIT

name: SUTTON POYNTZ MISSION HALL MANAGEMENT TRUST
activities: Runs a village hall for the benefit of the local community, including many activities & social occasions.
objects: THE PROPERTY HEREBY DEMISED TOGETHER WITH SUCH OTHER PROPERTY AS MAY BE ACQUIRED BY THE TRUSTEES SHALL BE HELD UPON TRUST FOR THE PURPOSES OF A VILLAGE HALL FOR THE USE OF THE INHABITANTS OF THE PARISH OF PRESTON CUM SUTTON POYNZ IN THE COUNTY OF DORSET WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF POLITICAL RELIGIOUS OR OTHER OPINIONS INCLUDING USE FOR MEETINGS LECTURES AND CLASSES AND FOR OTHER FORMS OF RECREATION AND LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE OF THE SAID INHABITANTS.

name: HADLEY WOOD ASSOCIATION
activities: To promote the benefit and improve the conditions of life of the inhabitants of Hadley Wood and neighbourhood... to advance eductation and provide facilities in the interest of social welfare. To secure the preservation, protection, development and improvement of features of historic or public interest in the area. To maintain and manage any property or land owned or leased by the Association.
objects: (1) TO PROMOTE THE BENEFIT AND IMPROVE THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE OF THE INHABITANTS OF HADLEY WOOD AND NEIGHBOURHOOD ("THE AREA OF BENEFIT") WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF SEX, POLITICAL, RELIGIOUS OR OTHER OPINIONS BY ASSOCIATING THE LOCAL AUTHORITIES, VOLUNTARY ORGANISATIONS AND THE INHABITANTS OF HADLEY WOOD IN A COMMON EFFORT TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND PROVIDE FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION AND LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR THESAID INHABITANTS.  (2) TO SECURE THE PRESERVATION, PROTECTION, DEVELOPMENT AND IMPROVEMENT OF FEATURES OF HISTORIC OR PUBLIC INTEREST IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT.  (3) TO MAINTAIN AND MANAGE, OR CO-OPERATE WITH ANY LOCAL STATUTORY AUTHORITY IN THE MAINTENANCE AND MANAGEMENT OF ANY PROPERTY OR LAND OWNED OR LEASED BY THE ASSOCIATION AND BODIES ASSOCIATED WITH THE ASSOCIATION IN FURTHERANCE OF THE ABOVE OBJECTS.

name: SIKH COMMUNITY CARE PROJECT
activities: Sikh community care project provides services for the social / health/ recreational /  and cultural activities, to improve the quality of life of its members.SCCP provides training opportunities for women from Asian backgrounds. S.C.C.P runs elderly programme specifically targeting elderly from South Asian Communities,providing support,advice and guidance to access health and social care provision
objects: THE PROJECT'S OBJECTS ARE TO PROVIDE FACILITIES IN THE INTEREST OF SOCIAL WELFARE, PARTICULARLY THE PROVISION OF AN ADVICE CENTRE, KEEP FIT AND YOGA CLASSES, LANGUAGE CLASSES, ART AND CRAFT ACTIVITIES, CULTURALLY SPECIFIC DANCING ACTIVITIES, HEALTH CARE, A LUNCH CLUB AND OTHER COMMUNITY BASED ACTIVITIES, WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR MEMBERS OF THE PUBLIC AT LARGE. THESE FACILITIES SHOULD PARTICULARLY, BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY, REFLECT THE NEEDS OF THE SIKH COMMUNITY IN THE LONDON BOROUGH OF WALTHAM FOREST.

name: NORTHAMPTONSHIRE ACRE
activities: We are a countywide, independent charity, working with rural communities in Northamptonshire to improve their quality of life.  Through community engagement and development we support communities to reduce rural isolation and vulnerability and work with them to create a vibrant, sustainable future for all. We are one of 38 Rural Community Councils working across England, making up the ACRE Network
objects: TO PROMOTE ANY CHARITABLE PURPOSES TO IMPROVE THE LIFE OF THE PEOPLE IN THE COUNTY OF NORTHAMPTON PARTICULARLY THE RURAL COMMUNITIES

name: NORTHAMPTONSHIRE ACRE
activities: We are a countywide, independent charity, working with rural communities in Northamptonshire to improve their quality of life.  Through community engagement and development we support communities to reduce rural isolation and vulnerability and work with them to create a vibrant, sustainable future for all. We are one of 38 Rural Community Councils working across England, making up the ACRE Network
objects: TO PROMOTE ANY CHARITABLE PURPOSES TO IMPROVE THE LIFE OF THE PEOPLE IN THE COUNTY OF NORTHAMPTON PARTICULARLY THE RURAL COMMUNITIES

name: WILTSHIRE ARCHAEOLOGICAL AND NATURAL HISTORY SOCIETY
activities: The WANHS objects are to educate the public by promoting, fostering interest in, exploration, research and publication on the archaeology, art, history and natural history of Wiltshire for the public benefit.  An accredited and designated museum, library and art gallery with temporary exhibitions are open to the public throughout the year and an education service provides activities for all ages.
objects: TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC BY PROMOTING, FOSTERING INTEREST IN EXPLORATION, RESEARCH AND PUBLICATION ON THE ARCHAEOLOGY, ART, HISTORY  AND NATURAL HISTORY OF WILTSHIRE FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT

name: MISSION SUPPORT FUND
activities: Financial support for the advancement of the Christian religion in Europe and the former USSR
objects: TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN RELIGION, TO RELIEVE POVERTY AND SICKNESS GENERALLY, AND TO ADVANCE EDUCATION.

name: INDEPENDENT TRANSPORT COMMISSION
activities: The commission, which began work in 2000, is a business/transport/academic think tank researching and publishing reports on longer term transport and land issues.
objects: (A) TO RESEARCH ECONOMIC, SOCIAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL ASPECTS OF TRAVEL, TRANSPORT AND LAND USE POLICY IN THE UNITED KINGDOM.    (B) TO ADVANCE PUBLIC EDUCATION IN MATTERS RELATING TO TRANSPORT AND LAND USE, AND IN PARTICULAR TO MAKE RECOMMENDATIONS ON POSSIBLE SOLUTIONS TO TRANSPORT AND LAND USE ISSUES.    (C) TO BROADCAST THESE FINDINGS BY REPORTS AND OTHER PRACTICAL MEANS

name: ANJUMAN-E-JAMALI (BRADFORD)
activities: TO MOTIVATE ADVANCE AND PROPAGATE EDUCATION AND LEARNING, INCLUDING THE ADMINISTRATION AND ORGANISATION OF RELIGIOUS AND TEMPORAL AFFAIRS, OF THE DAWOODI BOHRA JAMAAT OF BRADFORD
objects: THE TRUSTEES SHALL HOLD THE TRUST FUND AND ITS INCOME UPON TRUST TO APPLY THEM FOR ANY CHARITABLE PURPOSES FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE COMMUNITY AND IN PARTICULAR THE MEMBERS OF THE DAWOODI BOHRA JAMAT OF BRADFORD AND IN PARTICULAR FOR THE FOLLOWING PURPOSES: 1. THE PREACHING AND PRACTISING OF THE ISLAMIC RELIGION IN CONFORMITY WITH AL-QURAN, ISLAMIC SHARIAT AND THE FATIMI (FATIMID) PHILOSOPHY, CULTURE AND TRADITIONS, ALL AS INTERPRETED BY AL-DAI AL-MUTLAQ. 2. THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION. 3. THE RELIEF OF NEED, HARDSHIP AND DISTRESS. 4. THE PROVISION AND ASSISTANCE IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR THE RECREATION AND OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATIONS OF THE SAID BENEFICIARIES PARTICULARLY FOR WOMEN AND YOUNG PEOPLE IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFAREAND SO THAT THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE MAY BE IMPROVED.

name: IMMANUEL PRESBYTERIAN CHURCH, CAERAU
activities: To establish and build up a Christian Church according to the teaching of Scripture.   To express the Christian life within and outside the fellowship of the Church.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN RELIGION.

name: APPLEFORD PARISH TRUST CHARITY
activities: Money held in trust to benefit village and villagers in Appleford, Oxfordshire. Grant applications from village organisations  considered on request (from income), grants for larger amounts require village vote. Book grant scheme run through village magazine.
objects: THE TRUSTEES SHALL HOLD THE TRUST FUND ON TRUST FOR SUCH CHARITABLE PURPOSES FOR THE GENERAL BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF THE PARISH OF APPLEFORD IN THE COUNTY OF OXFORDSHIRE FOR WHICH PROVISION IS NOT MADE FROM PUBLIC RATES AND TAXES AS THE TRUSTEESSHALL THINK FIT

name: HALTON COMMUNITY TRANSPORT
activities: To provide transport for disabled people and community groups.
objects: TO PROVIDE RELIEF TO THE INHABITANTS OF THE BOROUGH OF HALTON AND ITS ENVIRONS WHO HAVE NEED BECAUSE OF AGE, MENTAL OR PHYSICAL DISABILITY, OR POVERTY, AND IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT SO AS TO LIMIT THE GENERALITY OF THE FOREGOING; [A] TO PROVIDE AND MAINTAIN NON-PROFIT COMMUNITY TRANSPORT SERVICES; AND [B] TO ASSIST THE CHARITABLE WORK OF ORGANISATIONS AND BODIES ENGAGED IN PROMOTING THE RELIEF OF SUCH PERSONS THROUGH THE PROVISION OF APPROPRIATE SERVICES.

name: FRIENDS OF HAYNES MISSION HALL
activities: THE PRESERVATION, MANAGEMENT AND OPERATION OF HAYNES MISSION HALL FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PEOPLE OF HAYNES AND THE SURROUNDING AREA.  WE PROVIDE A FACILITY FOR EDUCATION AND RECREATION.
objects: A) TO PRESERVE THE HAYNES MISSION HALL FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PEOPLE OF HAYNES AND THE SURROUNDING AREA FOR THEIR SPIRITUAL, INTELLECTUAL, MORAL AND SOCIAL WELL-BEING; AND B) TO PROVIDE FACILITIES FOR THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION AND RECREATION OR LEISURE-TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE OF THE PEOPLE OF HAYNES AND THE SURROUNDING AREA.

name: FRIENDS OF GRAVES PARK
activities: To assist other Trusts with interests in Graves Park in enhancing and maintaining the park for leisure, education and conservation in conjunction with the local community and in particular the citizens of Sheffield. To preserve the fauna and flora for the benefit and enjoyment of park users. To act as a conduit in raising funds to achieve those objects.
objects: (1) TO ASSIST OTHER TRUSTS WITH INTERESTS IN GRAVES PARK IN ENHANCING AND MAINTAINING THE PARK FOR LEISURE, EDUCATION AND CONSERVATION IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE LOCAL COMMUNITY (2) TO PRESERVE THE FLORA AND FAUNA FOR THE BENEFIT AND ENJOYMENT OF THE PARK USERS

name: (HASTE) HELP AFRICAN SCHOOLS TO EDUCATE
activities: We build schools and provide furniture and educational aids
objects: THE TRUSTEES SHALL HOLD THE TRUST FUND AND ITS INCOME UPON TRUST TO APPLY THEM FOR THE FOLLOWING OBJECTS: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF CHILDREN IN AFRICA THROUGH THE PROVISION OF FINANCIAL AND MATERIAL ASSISTANCE.

name: MANCHESTER HISTORIC BUILDINGS TRUST
activities: The current activity is the maintenance and operation as a heritage attraction of 84 Plymouth Grove, Manchester, the home of Mrs Elizabeth Gaskell. The house is open to the public and runs a programme of activities and events.
objects: TO PRESERVE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE TOWNSPEOPLE OF THE TEN DISTRICTS WHICH FORM THE COUNTY OF GREATER MANCHESTER AND OF THE NATION AT LARGE, WHATEVER OF THE HISTORICAL, ARCHITECTURAL AND CONSTRUCTIONAL HERITAGE MAY EXIST IN AND AROUND THE TEN DISTRICTSOF GREATER MANCHESTER AFORESAID IN THE FORM OF BUILDINGS (INCLUDING ANY BUILDING AS DEFINED SECTION 336(10 OF THE TOWN AND COUNTRY PLANING ACT 1990) OF PARTICULAR BEAUTY OR HISTORICAL, ARCHITECTURAL OR CONSTRUCTIONAL INTEREST

name: SHREE DARJI GNATI MANDAL (S.D.) LEICESTER
activities: Navratri, Diwali, an annual Childrens Xmas party, social events for all our members, including religious and informative seminars.
objects: TO PROMOTE CULTURAL, RELIGIOUS, SOCIAL, LINGUISTIC AND ECONOMIC WELFARE OF DARJI COMMUNITY IN UK, PREDOMINATELY IN LEICESTERSHIRE AND SURROUNDING AREAS

name: R.D.M. PARAKKANVILAI FUND
activities: Fund raising and collecting donations to fulfil the objects of the charity
objects: TO SUPPORT THE CHARITABLE WORK OF THE RURAL DEVELOPMENT MOVEMENT (R.D.M.) IN PARAKKANVILAI, A REGISTERED SOCIETY IN KANYAKUMARI DISTRICT, SOUTH INDIA. TO SUPPORT SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS THE TRUSTEES FROM TIME TO TIME DECIDE.

name: AQUAID LIFELINE FUND
activities: The relief of poverty and the advancement of education of children and other needy people in Malawi largely by making grants to Aquaid Lifeline Malawi, an independent charity based in Malawi which is responsible for the day to day relief work.
objects: THE RELIEF OF POVERTY AND THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION OF CHILDREN AND OTHER VICTIMS OF NATURAL DISASTERS IN MALAWI

name: ST BEDE HOME AND SCHOOL ASSOCIATION
activities: The St Bede Home and School Association provides support to St Bede C of E Primary school in Winchester. It's object is to advance the education and wellbeing of pupils of the school.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF PUPILS IN THE SCHOOL.

name: EASTFIELD SCHOOL ASSOCIATION
activities: Eastfield School Association raises funds to support Eastfield Infant and Nursery School
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUPILS OF THE SCHOOL BY PROVIDING AND ASSISTING IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR EDUCATION AT THE SCHOOL ( NOT NORMALLY PROVIDED BY THE LOCAL EDUCATION AUTHORITY)

name: MADANI GIRLS' SCHOOL
activities: TO ADVANCE EDUCATION BY PROVIDING AND MAINTAINING AN ISLAMIC SCHOOL/COLLEGE OR AN EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTE FOR GIRLS. .
objects: 1. TO ADVANCE EDUCATION BY PROVIDING AND MAINTAINING AN ISLAMIC SCHOOL/COLLEGE OR AN EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTE FOR GIRLS. 2. TO ADVANCE EDUCATION BY PROVIDING PRIMARY EDUCATION FOR BOYS AND GIRLS WITHIN AN ISLAMIC ENVIRONMENT. 3. TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND TRAINING BY PROVIDING AND MAINTAINING ESTABLISHMENTS WHICH WILL PROVIDE TRAINING AND EDUCATIONAL COURSES FOR WOMEN IN AN ISLAMIC ENVIRONMENT, IN PARTICULAR THOSE FROM THE LONDON BOROUGH OF TOWER HAMLETS AND IN GENERAL TO PROVIDE THE SAME FOR MUSLIM WOMEN THROUGHOUT THE UNITED KINGDOM AND ABROAD.

name: KEY TO THE DOOR PROJECT
activities: Key To The Door work with the most hard to reach families across the boroughs of Oldham, Rochdale and Tameside in Greater Manchester. We provide training and workshop opportunities and encourage progression by offering appropriate learning environments suitable for the needs of young parents. Our motto is "If at first you don't succeed, try and try again!".
objects: TO PROMOTE THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF OLDHAM (HEREINAFTER CALLED THE AREA OF BENEFIT) WHO ARE IN NEED AND IN PARTICULAR OF HOMELESS YOUNG PEOPLE WITHOUT DISTINCTION NATIONALITY, RACE, COLOUR, DISABILITY, SEX, SEXUAL ORIENTATION OR POLITICAL, RELIGIOUS OR OTHER OPINIONS BY ASSOCIATING THE SAID INHABITANTS AND THE LOCAL AUTHORITIES, VOLUNTARY AND OTHER ORGANISATIONS IN A COMMON EFFORT TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND TRAINING, RELIEVE POVERTY AND TO PROVIDE FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR HOUSING SUPPORT, RECREATION AND LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE OF THE SAID INHABITANTS

name: THE BATH ISLAMIC SOCIETY LIMITED
activities: BISL was established to serve the religious, educational, recreational, cultural, economic and social life of Muslims in B&NES. It aims to reduce inequalities in the community, encourage participation in public/community life, promote good relations between people of different cultural and religious groups and work with mainstream partners to build an environment of equality and social cohesion.
objects: THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE ISLAMIC FAITH, THE ADVANCEMENT OF ISLAMIC EDUCATION AND THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR RECREATION AND LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE AND WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE OF THE ISLAMIC COMMUNITY IN BATH AND SURROUNDING AREA.

name: CROSS STREET CHAPEL MANCHESTER
activities: The provision of religious and spiritual activities.
objects: THE PROMOTION OF PURE RELIGION IN THE WORSHIP OF GOD AND THE SERVICE OF HUMAN KIND IN THE SPIRIT OF JESUS CHRIST. NO DOCTRINAL TEST SHALL BE IMPOSED UPON ITS MINISTER(S), ITS MEMBERS OR OTHERS WHO ATTEND ITS SERVICES

name: BRIGHT HORIZONS
activities: Due to financial difficulties (lack of children at playgroup)Bright Horizons Playgroup are no longer in operation. They ceased operating at the end of the Summer Term 2020.
objects: THE AIM OF THE GROUP IS TO EMBODY THE VISION OF PATA THROUGH THE ENHANCEMENT OF THE DEVELOPMENT, CARE AND EDUCATION OF CHILDREN PRIMARILY UNDER STATUTORY SCHOOL AGE AND ALSO OF CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE OF SCHOOL AGE BY ENCOURAGING PARENTS TO UNDERSTAND AND PROVIDE FOR THE NEEDS OF THEIR CHILDREN THROUGH COMMUNITY (VOLUNTARY MANAGED) GROUPS AND BY:  (A) OFFERING APPROPRIATE PLAY FACILITIES AND TRAINING COURSES, TOGETHER WITH THE RIGHT OF PARENTS TO TAKE RESPONSIBILITY FOR AND TO BECOME INVOLVED INTHE ACTIVITIES OF SUCH GROUPS, ENSURING THAT SUCH GROUPS OFFER OPPORTUNITIES FOR ALL CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE, WHATEVER THEIR RACE, CULTURE, RELIGION, MEANS OR ABILITY  (B) ENCOURAGING THE STUDY OF THE NEEDS OF SUCH CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES AND PROMOTING PUBLIC INTEREST IN AND RECOGNITION OF SUCH NEEDS IN THE LOCAL AREA

name: RYE AND DISTRICT COUNCIL FOR VOLUNTARY SERVICE
activities: Provides support services to local voluntary groups and develops services to meet local needs
objects: 1. TO PROMOTE ALL OR ANY CHARITABLE PURPOSES FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE COMMUNITY WITHIN THE AREA OF BENEFIT AND IN PARTICULAR THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION, THE FURTHERANCE OF HEALTH AND THE RELIEF OF POVERTY, DISTRESS AND SICKNESS. 2. WITHOUT LIMITATION TO THE GENERALITY OF THE FOREGOING TO PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR ORGANISATIONS WITH CHARITABLE OBJECTS IN ORDER TO ASSIST THESE ORGANISATIONS IN THEIR CHARITABLE WORK. 3. TO PROMOTE AND ORGANISE CO-OPERATION IN THE ADVANCEMENT OF THESE PURPOSES AND TO BRINGTOGETHER IN COUNCIL REPRESENTATIVES OF THE VOLUNTARY ORGANISATIONS, STATUTORY AUTHORITIES AND INDIVIDUALS WITHIN THE AREA OF BENEFIT.

name: THE ROYAL AIR FORCE BENEVOLENT FUND
activities: (a) Providing relief and assistance to past and present members of the Royal Air Force and their dependants who are in need as a result of poverty, disability, sickness, infirmity or otherwise. (b) enhancing the morale and well being of serving members of the Royal Air Force (c)Maintaining the RAF war memorial on the Victoria embankment, London.
objects: A) THE MAINTENANCE, UPKEEP AND REPAIR OF THE WAR MEMORIAL KNOWN AS THE RAF MEMORIAL SITUATED AT THE VICTORIA EMBANKMENT, LONDON; AND  B) THE RELIEF AND ASSISTANCE BY ALL AVAILABLE MEANS OF ALL OR ANY OF THE FOLLOWING CLASSES OF BENEFICIARIES WHO ARE IN NEED OF SUCH RELIEF OR ASSISTANCE BY REASON OF POVERTY, DISABILITY, SICKNESS, INFIRMITY OR OTHERWISE, NAMELY:-  I) ALL PERSONS OF ALL RANKS WHO ARE OR HAVE OR SHALL HAVE BEEN AT ANY TIME OR SHALL BE AT ANY TIME MEMBERS OF THE ROYAL AIR FORCE, THE ROYAL AUXILIARY AIR FORCE, THE ROYAL AIR FORCE RESERVES, THE WOMEN'S ROYAL AIR FORCE, THE WOMEN'S AUXILIARY AIR FORCE OR THE AIR FORCE OR AUXILIARY AIR FORCE OF ANY PRESENT OR FORMER COLONY DOMINION OR DEPENDENT TERRITORY OF GREAT BRITAIN OR MEMBERS OFANY FORMER ORGANISATION THE PLACE OF WHICH HAS SUBSTANTIALLY BEEN TAKEN BY THE SAID ORGANISATIONS OR ANY OF THEM, OR MEMBERS OF ANY FUTURE ORGANISATIONS WHICH HEREAFTER SHALL SUBSTANTIALLY TAKE THE PLACE OF THE SAID ORGANISATIONS OR ANY OF THEM; ANDII) ALL PERSONS WHO SHALL AT ANY TIME HAVE BEEN OR BE WIDOWS, WIDOWERS, CHILDREN OR OTHER DEPENDANTS OF ANY OF THE PERSONS ABOVE REFERRED TO; AND  (C) THE PROMOTION OF THE EFFICIENCY OF THE ROYAL AIR FORCE PRINCIPALLY BY, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, PROVIDINGSUPPORT AND ASSISTANCE BY ANY MEANS TO ANY PERSONS WHO ARE SERVING IN THE ROYAL AIR FORCE AND THEIR DEPENDANTS WITH A VIEW TO ENHANCING THE MORALE AND WELL BEING OF SERVING MEMBERS OF THE ROYAL AIR FORCE.

name: TOTASINGH DHALIWAL CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: The advancement of education, the relief of poverty and relief of sickness within the area of benefit in the Republic of India
objects: THE TRUSTEES SHALL HOLD THE TRUST FUND AND ITS INCOME UPON TRUST TO APPLY THEM FOR THE FOLLOWING OBJECTS; NAMELY THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION, THE RELIEF OF POVERTY AND RELIEF OF SICKNESS WITHIN THE AREA OF BENEFIT IN THE REPUBLIC OF INDIA

name: LONDON REVIVAL CHURCH
activities: Activities with Youth, families and the public in general. Promoting well being for all.
objects: 1. TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN RELIGION BY THE PUBLICATION AND PROCLAMATION OF THE GOSPEL OF GRACE EOF GOD AS REVEALED IN THE HOLY SCRIPTURES IN ORDER  TO EXTEND THE CHRISTIAN FAITH IN LONDON AND ELSEWHERE AS THE CHURCH COUNCIL MAY FROM TIME TO TIME DETERMINE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE DOCTRINAL BASIS OF BELIEF SET OUT BELOW. 2.  TO PROVIDE A SPIRITUAL HOME FOR CHRISTIANS OF ANY RACE, NATION, AGE AND SOCIAL BACKGROUND. 3. TO ENCOURAGE AND TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR ALL MEMBERS TO EXERCISE THEIR GOD-GIVEN GIFT OF LIFE TO BUILD UP THE BODY OF CHRIST. 4. TO FURTHER THE CAUSE OF CHRIST LOCALLY AN INTERNATIONALLY.

name: PORTOBELLO ORCHESTRA
activities: Amateur community orchestra.
objects: THE OBJECT OF THE SOCIETY SHALL BE TO PROMOTE, IMPROVE, DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN PUBLIC EDUCATION IN AND APPRECIATION OF THE ART AND SCIENCE OF MUSIC IN ALL ITS ASPECTS BY THE PRESENTATION OF PUBLIC ORCHESTRAL CONCERTS; AND FOR THE GENERAL PURPOSES OF SUCH CHARITABLE BODIES OR FOR SUCH OTHER PURPOSES AS SHALL BE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE AS THE COMMITTEE MAY FROM TIME TO TIME DECIDE.

name: CLIFTON MOOR OUT OF SCHOOL CLUB
activities: Social and leisure activities are provided in a safe, child friendly environment.  Providing alongside the school, wrap around childcare for both working and non working families
objects: TO PROVIDE THE NECESSARY FACILITIES FOR THE DAILY CARE, RECREATION AND EDUCATION OF CHILDREN DURING OUT OF SCHOOL HOURS AND SCHOOL HOLIDAYS; TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION AND TRAINING OF THE PERSONS IN THE PROVISION OF SUCH CARE, EDUCATION AND RECREATIONALFACILITIES

name: THURROCK CENTRE FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING
activities: Provides support to enable disabled people to live independent lives by providing advice, support and advocacy.  The Charity also manages employment support projects enabling disabled people to become more work ready.
objects: THE RELIEF OF NEED OF DISABLED PEOPLE BY:  1. THE PROVISION OF ADVICE, SUPPORT, ASSISTANCE AND OPPORTUNITIES 2. ENCOURAGING AND SUPPORTING INDEPENDENT LIVING AND INDEPENDENCE BY PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES.

name: THE WAYLAND PARTNERSHIP DEVELOPMENT TRUST
activities: The Wayland Partnership comprises the Market Town of Watton, its hinterland of 13 parishes and key community organisations such as the Chamber of Commerce, the Youth Council, the Tourism Association etc. The Partnership exists to promote the economic, social, environmental and cultural well-being of the Wayland area.
objects: FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF WAYLAND (WAYLAND COMPRISING THE PARISH OF WATTON AND NEIGHBOURING PARISHES AND IN THESE OBJECTS IS CALLED "THE AREA OF BENEFIT"):  (1) TO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THOSE WHO ARE IN CONDITIONS OF FINANCIAL HARDSHIP.  (2) TO RELIEVE UNEMPLOYMENT FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT IN SUCH WAYS AS MAY BE THOUGHT FIT IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT, INCLUDING ASSISTANCE TO FIND EMPLOYMENT.  (3) TO PROVIDE AND ASSIST IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR RECREATION AND OTHER LEISURE-TIME OCCUPATION IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE AND WITH THE OBJECTS OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE OF THOSE PERSONS FOR WHOM THE FACILITIES ARE INTENDED.  (4) TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND TRAINING.  (5) TO IMPROVE AND BEAUTIFY THE TOWN OF WATTON AND SUCH OTHER PLACES IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT AS THE CHARITY MAY DECIDE WITH A VIEW TO IMPROVING THE QUALITY OF LIFE OF THE INHABITANTS OF THE AREA OF BENEFIT PROVIDED THAT IN SO DOING THE CHARITY SHALL NOT RELIEVE ANY LOCAL AUTHORITY OR OTHER BODY OF ITS STATUTORY OBLIGATIONS.  (6) TO PROVIDE AND TO ASSIST IN THE PROVISION, MAINTENANCE AND IMPROVEMENT IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT OF HOUSING, TRANSPORT AND OTHER SERVICES FOR THOSE WHO HAVE NEED OF THEM PROVIDED THAT IN SO DOING THE CHARITY SHALL NOT RELIEVE ANY LOCAL AUTHORITY OR OTHER BODY OF ITS STATUTORY OBLIGATIONS IN PROVIDING SUCH SERVICES.  (7) TO FURTHER SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT AS THE CHARITY MAY DECIDE.

name: MARCH CIVIC TRUST
activities: Advance education, relieve poverty, sickness and distress, provide facilities in the interests of social welfare for recreation and other leisure time occupation with the object of improving the conditions of life of the inhabitants of March.
objects: THE PURCHASE OF MARCH TOWN HALL MARKET SQUARE MARCH CAMBS FOR THE USE OF THE PEOPLE OF MARCH FOR PUBLIC AND OTHER MEETINGS AND EXHIBITIONS AND DISPLAYS.

name: ETERNITY DOWNHAM MARKET
activities: The advancement of the Christian Religion in accordance with the statement of the Fundemental Truths of the Assemblies of God in Great Britain and Ireland. Such other charitable purposes as shall further the attainment of the above object. The furtherance of other charitable work consistent with the churches statement.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CHURCH ARE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC:  A) TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATEMENT IN SUCH WAYS AND IN SUCH PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE CHURCH COUNCIL FROM TIME TO TIME MAY THINK FIT;  B) TO RELIEVE SICKNESS AND FINANCIAL HARDSHIP AND TO PROMOTE AND PRESERVE GOOD HEALTH BY THE PROVISION OF FUNDS, GOODS OR SERVICES OF ANY KIND INCLUDING THROUGH THE PROVISION OF COUNSELLING AND SUPPORT IN SUCH PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLDAS THE CHURCH COUNCIL FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT; AND  C) TO ADVANCE EDUCATION IN SUCH WAYS AND IN SUCH PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE CHURCH COUNCIL FROM TIME TO TIME MAY THINK FIT.

name: CREDO ARTS COMMUNITY
activities: the promotion of arts through public performance and workshops
objects: ARE TO PROMOTE, IMPROVE, DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN PUBLIC EDUCATION IN AND APPRECIATION OF THE ART AND SCIENCE OF DRAMATIC AND ARTISTIC PRODUCTIONS IN ALL ASPECTS BY THE PRESENTATION OF PUBLIC PERFORMANCES; AND FOR THE GENERAL PURPOSES OF SUCH CHARITABLE BODIES OR FOR SUCH OTHER PURPOSES AS SHALL BE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE AS THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MAY FROM TIME TO TIME DECIDE.

name: AAINA WOMEN'S GROUP
activities: General charitable purposes Education/Training Relief of poverty Arts /Culture Sport/recreation Economic/Community development/Employment Women of a particular ethnic or racial origin Women of other defined groups Provides services (e.g Support/Counselling) Provides advocacy/advice/information
objects: THE ASSOCIATION IS ESTABLISHED TO PROMOTE ANY CHARITABLE PURPOSE FOR THE BENEFIT OF SOUTH ASIAN, MUSLIM AND REFUGEE WOMEN AND CHILDREN, INCLUDING THE RELIEF OF POVERTY, SICKNESS AND DISTRESS, THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION AND THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR RECREATION AND OTHER LEISURE TIME ACTIVITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE AND IN ORDER TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE OF THE SAID BENEFICIARIES.

name: THE SOUTH SHIELDS GILBERT AND SULLIVAN OPERATIC SOCIETY
activities: WE PERFORM AMATEUR PRODUCTIONS AROUND THE SOUTH SHIELDS AREA.
objects: TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC IN THE DRAMATIC AND OPERATIC ARTS , TO FURTHER THE DEVELOPMENT OF PUBLIC APPRECIATION AND TASTE IN THE SAID ARTS (TO ASSIST AND FURTHER SUCH CHARITABLE INSTITUTIONS AND CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS THE COMMITTEE SHALL FROM TIME TO TIMEDETERMINE)

name: ST. RADIGUNDS COMMUNITY CENTRE COMPANY
activities: Manages St. Radigunds Community Centre located in the St Radigunds Ward of Dover.  Activities include the provision of hire-able space for private functions, community events and wellbeing professionals to run activities, Health Professionals and Agencies to provide training, community services and support Groups.  Also delivers community events for all ages, including a youth club and play group.
objects: THE CHARITY'S OBJECTS ARE IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE TO IMPROVE THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE OF THE INHABITANTS OF ST RADIGUNDS WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF POLITICAL, RELIGIOUS OR OTHER OPINIONS BY THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR CHARITABLE SERVICES, RECREATION AND OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION.

name: CLUN PARENT AND TODDLER GROUP
activities: Play and activity sessions for 0 - 5 year olds (pre school age)
objects: TO ENHANCE THE DEVELOPMENT AND EDUCATION OF CHILDREN PRIMARILY UNDER STATUTORY SCHOOL AGE BY ENCOURAGING PARENTS TO UNDERSTAND AND PROVIDE FOR THE NEEDS OF THEIR CHILDREN THROUGH COMMUNITY GROUPS

name: EVERYMAN THEATRE CARDIFF LIMITED
activities: The charity's objects are to advance the public knowledge and appreciation of literature and drama by means of public performances.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE PUBLIC KNOWLEDGE AND APPRECIATION OF LITERATURE AND DRAMA BY MEANS OF PUBLIC PERFORMANCES.

name: TOTTINGTON & DISTRICT E TOWNSWOMEN'S GUILD
activities: Provide or assist in the provision of facilities for recreation or other leisure time occupation for women. To raise money for a chosen charity each year.
objects: FOR SUCH PURPOSES GENERALLY AS MAY FROM TIME TO TIME BE CHARITABLE ACCORDING TO THE LAW OF ENGLAND AND WALES AND MORE SPECIFICALLY (WITHOUT PREJUDICE TO THE GENERALITY OF THE FOREGOING):- 1. TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF WOMEN IRRESPECTIVE OF RACE CREEDAND PARTY SO AS TO ENABLE THEM TO MAKE THE BEST CONTRIBUTION TOWARDS THE COMMON GOOD. 2. TO EDUCATE SUCH WOMEN IN THE PRINCIPLES OF GOOD CITIZENSHIP AND IN ALL PUBLIC QUESTIONS BOTH NATIONAL AND INTERNATIONAL. 3. TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC BY CARRYING OUT RESEARCH INTO ANY PUBLIC QUESTIONS WHETHER LOCAL NATIONAL OR INTERNATIONAL, AND PUBLISHING THE USEFUL RESULTS OF SUCH RESEARCH. 4. TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC BY PROMOTING PUBLIC UNDERSTANDING OF ANY SUBJECT OF EDUCATIONALVALUE WHERE WOMEN HAVE PARTICULAR KNOWLEDGE OR EXPERIENCE. 5. TO PROVIDE OR ASSIST IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION FOR SUCH WOMEN IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE AND WITH A VIEW TO IMPROVING THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE.

name: INTERAKTIVE
activities: Current activities for children with autistic spectrum disorder and their families: summer and Easter holiday playschemes and a year-round programme of events including trampolining, climbing, swimming, bowling, ice-skating, horse riding,  and annual summer picnic and Christmas party. Conference for parents and local professionals.
objects: (I) TO RELIEVE CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE WITH AUTISTIC SPECTRUM DISORDERS AND OTHER RELATED OR SIMILAR CONDITIONS, PARTICULARLY BY THE PROVISION OF SUPPORT AND ASSISTANCE TO SUCH PERSONS, THEIR FAMILIES AND CARERS (II) TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN AUTISTIC SPECTRUM DISORDERS AND OTHER RELATED OR SIMILAR CONDITIONS, PARTICULARLY THROUGH THE RESEARCH INTO THEIR CAUSES, PREVENTION, ALLEVIATION AND MANAGEMENT, AND TO DISSEMINATE THE USEFUL RESULTS OF SUCH RESEARCH.

name: GLEBELANDS PRE-SCHOOL AND OUT OF SCHOOL CLUB
activities: We provide childcare and education for children aged between 2 and 11 in the form of  breakfast club, pre-school sessions, lunch wrap around care and after school club sessions.
objects: TO ENHANCE THE DEVELOPMENT AND EDUCATION OF CHILDREN PRIMARILY UNDER STATUTORY SCHOOL AGE BY ENCOURAGING PARENTS TO UNDERSTAND AND PROVIDE FOR THE NEEDS OF THEIR CHILDREN

name: THE ROAD HAULAGE ASSOCIATION BENEVOLENT FUND
activities: The Road Haulage Association Benevolent Fund works to help people in hardship who are, or have been, connected with the Association. This includes members and former members of the RHA, their employees and former employees, as well as their dependants. It also covers employees and former employees of the RHA.
objects: THE TRUSTEES SHALL HOLD THE TRUST FUND AND THE INCOME THEREOF UPON TRUST FOR THE RELIEF OF POVERTY AMONGST INDIVIDUAL MEMBERS AND EMPLOYEES FOR THE TIME BEING AND FORMER MEMBERS AND EMPLOYEES OF THE ASSOCIATION AND THE EMPLOYEES OF SUCH INDIVIDUAL MEMBERS OR FORMER MEMBERS AND THE DEPENDANTS OF SUCH EMPLOYEES MEMBERS AND THEIR OWN EMPLOYEES AS AFORESAID IN SUCH MANNER AND IN SUCH PROPORTIONS AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION DETERMINE.

name: WARWICKSHIRE INDEPENDENT ADVOCACY ALLIANCE
activities: Independent Advocacy helps empower people to lead a full life through innovation. We empower people as a way to make them less vulnerable, improve their self-esteem and become more confident. Independent Advocacy delivers a range of work including Kinder Communities, Advocacy, Information, Advice, Corporate Appointee work , Digital Champions etc.
objects: THE OBJECTS FOR WHICH THE COMPANY IS ESTABLISHED ARE TO BE EFFECTED WITHIN THE UNITED KINGDOM, ("THE AREA OF BENEFIT") AND ARE TO PROMOTE THE RELIEF OF PERSONS RESIDING IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT BEING PERSONS IN NEED OF SUCH RELIEF BY REASON OF AGE, ILLNESS, PHYSICAL SENSORY DISABILITY, MENTAL DISTRESS, LEARNING DISABILITIES OR OTHER DISADVANTAGES BY DEVELOPING SUPPORTING PROMOTING AND PROVIDING A VARIETY OF ADVOCACY, REPRESENTATION, APPOINTEE AND OTHER SERVICES TO SUCH PEOPLE TO ENABLE THEM TO MANAGE THEIR AFFAIRS IN A WAY WHICH WILT IMPROVE THEIR OVERALL QUALITY OF LIFE  AND TO PROMOTE SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS MAY BE BENEFICIAL TO SUCH PERSONS

name: BURY CHORAL SOCIETY
activities: The study and practice of choral music in order to foster public knowledge and appreciation of such music by means of public performance.
objects: THE STUDY AND PRACTISE OF CHORAL MUSIC IN ORDER TO FOSTER PUBLIC KNOWLEDGE AND APPRECIATION OF SUCH MUSIC BY MEANS OF PUBLIC PERFORMANCE

name: PALS (PARTNERS FOR ACTIVE LEISURE SCHEME) WEST BERKSHIRE
activities: Provision of activities for children/young people with physical disabilities, from the age of five to twenty five.
objects: To relieve the needs of children and young people aged 5 to 25 with physical disabilities by providing leisure and recreational activities to enable them gain in confidence and self-esteem and to achieve their potential in every aspect of their lives.

name: THE TURNER FOUNDATION
activities: General public
objects: 1) THE TRUSTEES SHALL HOLD THE CAPITAL AND INCOME OF THE TRUST FUND UPON TRUST TO APPLY THE INCOME, AND ALL OR SUCH PART OR PARTS OF THE CAPITAL, AT SUCH TIME OR TIMES AS IN SUCH MANNER TO OR FOR THE BENEFIT OF SUCH EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE OBJECTS AND PURPOSES IN ANY PART OF THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES MAY IN THEIR DISCRETION THINK FIT. 2) THE TRUSTEES MAY IN THEIR DISCRETION, FOR THE PERIOD OF 21 YEARS FROM THE DATE OF THIS DEED INSTEAD OF APPLYING THE INCOME OF THE CHARITY IN ANY YEAR, ACCUMULATE ALL OR ANY PART OF SUCH INCOME AT COMPOUND INTEREST BY INVESTING THE SAME, AND THE RESULTING INCOME, IN ANY AUTHORISED INVESTMENTS AND HOLD THE SAME AS AN ACCRETION TO AND AS PART OF THE CAPITAL OF THE CHARITY, WITHOUT PREJUDICE TO THEIR RIGHT TO APPLYTHE WHOLE OR ANY PART OF SUCH ACCUMULATED INCOME IN ANY SUBSEQUENT YEAR AS IF THE SAME WERE INCOME OF THE CHARITY ARISING IN THE THEN CURRENT YEAR.

name: ROSAE
activities: The poor in Bangladesh are unable to afford basic GP services that we take for granted in the UK. ROSAE decided to support a series of healthcare Centres throughout the country. The prototype of these centres was established in 1997 & now provides medical care to around 20,000 people, mostly women & children. ROSAE plans to help these healthcentres increase in number & exoand their activities.
objects: RELIEF OF SICKNESS AND ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION BY (1) ESTABLISHING AND MAINTAINING HOSPITALS  AND MEDICAL CLINICS (11) INSTALLATIONS FOR VOCATION TRAINING CENTRES.

name: AGE CONCERN MANCHESTER
activities: In pursuit of the "relief of elderly people" "in and around the City of Manchester", the organisation aims not only to provide direct assistance through its own service structure, but also seeks to influence the nature, style, client group and location of services provided by others, particularly the statutory agencies with responsibilities for meeting the needs of Manchester's older people.
objects: TO PROMOTE THE RELIEF OF ELDERLY PEOPLE IN ANY MANNER THAT NOW OR HEREAFTER MAY BE DEEMED BY LAW TO BE CHARITABLE IN AND AROUND THE CITY OF MANCHESTER

name: ROTHSCHILD FOUNDATION (HANADIV) EUROPE
activities: The Foundation is established to advance any charitable purpose and to benefit any charity as the trustees in their discretion think fit, primarily by the provision of grants and loans for such charitable purposes which are for the benefit of the Jewish community either in Israel or elsewhere in the world.
objects: TO ADVANCE ANY CHARITABLE PURPOSE AND TO BENEFIT ANY CHARITY AS THE TRUSTEES IN THEIR DISCRETION THINK FIT, PRIMARILY, BUT WITHOUT PREJUDICE TO THE GENERALITY OF THE FOREGOING, BY THE PROVISION OF GRANTS AND LOANS FOR SUCH CHARITABLE PURPOSES OR CHARITIES WHICH ARE FOR THE CHARITABLE BENEFIT OF THE JEWISH COMMUNITY EITHER IN ISRAEL OR ELSEWHERE IN THE WORLD.

name: LIMMUD
activities: Limmud is a unique model of cross-communal, grass-roots, volunteer-driven Jewish learning and leadership development. Volunteers and participants come to our educational events from all walks of life, age-range and connection to the Jewish community. We aim to enable each person to go "one step further on their own Jewish journey" and make their contribution to the community.
objects: TO PROMOTE, IMPROVE AND DEVELOP JEWISH EDUCATION FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT

name: THE JOSEPH STOREHOUSE TRUST
activities: Humanitarian aid organisation with aims to raise awareness & financial aid to help meet the physical, educational and spiritual needs in communities as identified by the trustees.
objects: 3.1 TO RELIEVE THOSE IN CONDITIONS OF NEED, HARDSHIP OR DISTRESS OR WHO ARE AGED OR SICK  3.2 TO PROMOTE OR PROVIDE EDUCATION (INCLUDING VOCATIONAL TRAINING)  3.3 TO PROMOTE SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE OBJECTS AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL FROM TIME TO TIME DETERMINE

name: EVERSHEDS SUTHERLAND (INTERNATIONAL) CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: The objectives of trust are to support charitable institutions and objectives at the Trustees discretion.

activities: Provision of pre-school childcare

name: WINDERMERE COMMUNITY CHURCH
activities: A Community Church providing a Christian witness and spiritual encouragement to the church, its members and the community.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CHURCH ARE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC:  A)	TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATEMENT IN SUCH WAYS AND IN SUCH PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE CHURCH COUNCIL FROM TIME TO TIME MAY THINK FIT;  B)	TO RELIEVE SICKNESS AND FINANCIAL HARDSHIP AND TO PROMOTE AND PRESERVE GOOD HEALTH BY THE PROVISION OF FUNDS, GOODS OR SERVICES OF ANY KIND INCLUDING THROUGH THE PROVISION OF COUNSELLING AND SUPPORT IN SUCH PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLDAS THE CHURCH COUNCIL FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT; AND  C)	TO ADVANCE EDUCATION IN SUCH WAYS AND IN SUCH PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE CHURCH COUNCIL FROM TIME TO TIME MAY THINK FIT.

name: LONDON SPANISH STREATHAM PARK CONGREGATION OF JEHOVAH'S WITNESSES
activities: Arranging meetings for public worship, which includes bible education and training in Christian living. Preaching the Christian message to the public within the congregation area. Distributing bibles and other religious literature. All of these services and facilities are provided without charge.
objects: THE PRACTICE AND ADVANCEMENT OF CHRISTIANITY FOUNDED ON THE HOLY BIBLE, INCLUDING THE PREACHING OF THE GOOD NEWS OF GOD'S KINGDOM BY JESUS CHRIST WITHIN THE CONGREGATION AREA AND THE HOLDING OF MEETINGS FOR PUBLIC CHRISTIAN WORSHIP.

name: HERSHAM YOUTH TRUST
activities: Provide all our communities young people a warm, safety, creative, friendly youth led environment embracing all different, all equal, all welcome. To provide meaningful informed advice, assistance, help and support to empower all. Recreational and leisure time activities, experiences and opportunities, so to develop their skills, capacities and capabilities to enable them to fully participate.
objects: TO HELP YOUNG PEOPLE IN HERSHAM, SURREY, ESPECIALLY BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY THROUGH LEISURE TIME ACTIVITIES, SO TO DEVELOP THEIR PHYSICAL, MENTAL AND SPIRITUAL CAPACITIES THAT THEY MAY GROW TO FULL MATURITY AS INDIVIDUALS AND MEMBERS OF SOCIETY. IN THIS CLAUSE HERSHAM MEANS HERSHAM NORTH AND SOUTH WARDS AS DEFINED FOR ELECTORAL PURPOSES.

name: REGIONAL STUDIES ASSOCIATION
activities: The RSA runs an events programme and funds Research Networks, Researcher Grants, conference bursaries and other awards. We publish: Regional Studies, Spatial Economic Analysis, Territory Politics Governance, Regional Studies Regional Science, Area Development and Policy, Regions magazine and the Regions and Cities book series. With an international membership we recognise excellence in our field.
objects: 1)TO PROMOTE EDUCATION IN THE FIELD OF REGIONAL STUDIES (THOSE STUDIES WHICH RELATE TO THE ECONOMIC, PHYSICAL AND SOCIOLOGICAL PROBLEMS OF DEVELOPMENT IN MAJOR AREAS) BY THE EXCHANGE OF IDEAS AND INFORMATION 2) TO STIMULATE AND AID STUDIES AND RESEARCH INTO REGIONAL PLANNING, DEVELOPMENT AND FUNCTIONS AND TO DISSEMINATE THE RESULTS OF SUCH RESEARCH

name: KENT COMMUNITY FOUNDATION
activities: The Foundation encourages and enables a culture of effective giving to support thriving local communities.  In the main, we raise and distribute funds to meet the needs of the community in Kent and Medway. We act as a bridge between good causes in the county and individuals and organisations with the means and commitment to support them.
objects: 3 THE OBJECTS FOR WHICH THE CHARITY ARE ESTABLISHED ARE: 3.1 THE PROMOTION OF ANY CHARITABLE PURPOSES FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE COMMUNITY IN THE COUNTY OF KENT AND THE BOROUGH OF MEDWAY AND IN PARTICULAR THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION THE PROTECTION OF GOOD HEALTH BOTH MENTAL AND PHYSICAL AND THE RELIEF OF POVERTY AND SICKNESS; 3.2 OTHER EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE PURPOSES IN THE UNITED KINGDOM AND ELSEWHERE WHICH ARE IN THE OPINION OF THE TRUSTEES BENEFICIAL TO THE COMMUNITY INCLUDING THOSE IN THE AREA OFBENEFIT.

name: WJB CHILTERN CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: To hold income and capital for the purposes of the former employees of WJB Chiltern Group and MRI Moores Rowland LLP, or any other individual in financial need or suffering from financial hardship.
objects: 1.THE TRUSTEES SHALL HOLD THE CAPITAL AND INCOME OF THE TRUST FUND UPON TRUST TO APPLY THE INCOME, AND ALL OR SUCH PART OR PARTS OF THE CAPITAL, AT SUCH TIME TIME OR TIMES AND IN SUCH MANNER AS THE TRUSTEES MAY IN THEIR DISCRETION THINK FIT FOR OR TOWARDS THE PROVISION OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO THE PARTNERS AND EMPLOYEES AND THE FORMER AND RETIRED PARTNERS AND EMPLOYEES OF WJB CHILTERN GROUP PLC AND OF ITS SUBSIDIARY AND ASSOCIATED COMPANIES AND OF THE ACCOUNTANCY PRACTICE MRI MOORES ROWLAND OR SUCH OTHER COMPANY OR COMPANIES OR FIRM OR FIRMS AS MAY HAVE SUCCEEDED TO OR BE CARRYING ON THEIR BUSINESS OR PRACTICE AND THE RESPECTIVE FAMILIES, RELATIVES AND DEPENDANTS OF SUCH PERSONS AS ARE IN FINANCIAL NEED OR ARE SUFFERING FINANCIAL HARDSHIP AND/OR FOR THE BENEFIT OF SUCH EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE OBJECTS AND PURPOSES IN ANY PART OF THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES MAY IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION THINK FIT. 2. THE TRUSTEES MAY IN THEIR DISCRETION, FOR THE PERIOD OF 21 YEARS FROM THE DATE OF THIS DEED, INSTEAD OF APPLYING THE INCOME OF THE CHARITY IN ANY YEAR, ACCUMULATE ALL OR ANY PART OF SUCH INCOME AT COMPOUND INTEREST BY INVESTING THE SAME, AND THE RESULTING INCOME, IN ANY AUTHORISED INVESTMENTS AND HOLD THE SAME AS AN ACCRETION TO AND AS PART OF THE CAPITAL OF THE CHARITY, WITHOUT PREJUDICE TO THEIR RIGHT TO APPLY THE WHOLE OR ANY PART OF SUCH ACCUMULATED INCOME IN ANY SUBSEQUENT YEAR AS IF THE SAME WERE INCOME OF THE CHARITY ARISING IN THE THEN CURRENT YEAR.

name: RELATE NOTTINGHAMSHIRE

We deliver services at Relate premises and outposts, and in the community when funding is available for project work.
objects: 4. 1) TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC CONCERNING THE BENEFITS OF SECURE COUPLE RELATIONSHIPS, MARRIAGE AND FAMILY LIFE IN ORDER TO IMPROVE THE EMOTIONAL SEXUAL AND SPIRITUAL WELL-BEING OF INDIVIDUALS WHICH IS DERIVED FROM COMMITTED RELATIONSHIPS  4. 2) TO SEEK TO ENHANCE THE GOOD HEALTH, BOTH MENTAL AND PHYSICAL, OF ADULTS AND CHILDREN BY -  4.2.1 INCREASING PUBLIC AWARENESS OF THE BENEFIT OF COMMITTED COUPLE RELATIONSHIPS, MARRIAGE AND FAMILY LIFE, AND,  4.2.2 WORKING TO PREVENT POVERTY, HARDSHIP AND DISTRESS CAUSED BY THE BREAKDOWN OF SUCH RELATIONSHIPS,  4.3) TO PROVIDE COUNSELLING, ADVICE, EDUCATION, GUIDANCE AND RELIEF TO ADULTS AND/OR CHILDREN IN RELATION TO ANY ASPECT OF CONTEMPORARY LIFE OR WORK WHICH:  4.3.1 MAY PREJUDICE THEIR PHYSICAL OR MENTAL WELL BEING, OR,  4.3.2 INFLUENCE, EITHER DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY, THEIR PRESENT OR FUTURE FAMILY OR COUPLE RELATIONSHIP;  4.4) TO ADVANCE CITIZENSHIP AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT  4.5) TO RELIEVE THOSE IN NEED BY REASON OF YOUTH, AGE, ILL-HEALTH, DISABILITY, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR OTHER DISADVANTAGE; AND  4.6) TO PROMOTE RESEARCH INTO ALL OF THE ABOVE OBJECTS AND TO MAKE THE RESULTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC

objects: 1. TO PRESERVE THE BUILDING KNOWN AS WEST HOUSE, WEST END LANE, PINNER AND TO ESTABLISH AND MAINTAIN IT AND ITS GROUNDS FOR THE BENEFIT AND EDUCATION OF THE INHABITANTS OF THE LONDON BOROUGH OF HARROW AND THE PUBLIC IN GENERAL IN EACH OF THE FOLLOWINGWAYS (1) AS A MUSEUM AND GALLERY (11) AS A PERMANENT HOME FOR THE COLLECTION OF THE WILLIAM HEATH ROBINSON TRUST. name: IN-COMMUNITY CARE FOR ORPHANS
activities: I-CCO UK works with a team in Zambia to identify children and families living in poverty who have been affected by the HIV/AIDS epidemic, and who are most in need of support. We provide these families with essential food items, clothes and healthcare, and pay for school fees, books and uniforms for the children. This is financed by fundraising, general donations and a child sponsorship programme.
objects: TO RELIEVE HARDSHIP AND POVERTY AND TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF ORPHANS IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT.

name: CICELY SAUNDERS INTERNATIONAL
activities: Our mission is to promote research to improve the care and treatment of all patients with progressive illness and to make high-quality palliative care available to everyone who needs it: be it in hospice, hospital or home. There is no other charity specifically concerned with carrying out work to identify and promote best practice in palliative care.
objects: TO INVESTIGATE, PROMOTE AND ADVANCE HIGH STANDARDS OF CLINICAL PRACTICE, RESEARCH AND EDUCATION IN PALLIATIVE CARE, IN PARTICULAR BY 1) ADVANCING STANDARDS OF HIGH QUALITY CARE FOR PATIENTS WITH PROGRESSIVE ILLNESS AND THEIR FAMILIES, WHEREVER THE PERSON IS CARED FOR; 2) CONDUCTING, SUPPORTING, FUNDING AND COMMISSIONING WORLD-CLASS RESEARCH IN EFFECTIVE, PERSON-CENTRED AND SPIRITUALLY SYMPATHETIC FORMS OF PALLIATIVE CARE, IN PARTICULAR, PERFECTING RELEVANT AND ROBUST METHODS TO SET AN INTERNATIONAL GOLD STANDARD OF PALLIATIVE CARE RESEARCH 3) INVESTIGATING AND PROMOTING HIGH QUALITY CARE FOR PATIENTS WITH CANCER AND NON-CANCER PROGRESSIVE ILLNESS AND FROM SECTIONS OF SOCIETY WHICH MISS OUT ON THE BEST IN PALLIATIVE CARE; 4) PROVIDING POST-GRADUATE AND UNDERGRADUATE EDUCATION FOR DOCTORS, NURSES AND OTHER PROFESSIONALS IN THE FIELD;AND 5) PROMOTING PUBLIC UNDERSTANDING OF PALLIATIVE CARE AND THE AVAILABLE TREATMENTS AND SERVICES AND INFLUENCING PRACTICE NATIONALLY AND INTERNATIONALLY ON CARE TOWARDS THE END OF LIFE

name: CORNWALL COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT LIMITED
activities: CRCC'S MISSION IS TO ENABLE CORNISH COMMUNITIES TO BE VIBRANT, SUSTAINABLE AND INCLUSIVE.
objects: A) TO PROMOTE ANY CHARITABLE PURPOSES FOR THE BENEFIT OF COMMUNITIES IN THE GEOGRAPHICAL COUNTY OF CORNWALL, INCLUDING THE ISLES OF SCILLY, BY  (ITNER ALIA) ASSISTING THE WORK OF STATUTORY AUTHORITIES AND VOLUNTARY ORGANISATIONS ENGAGED IN ADVANCING EDUCATION, FURTHERING HEALTH OR THE PROVISION OF HOUSING AND EMPLOYMENT, RELIEVING POVERTY, HOMELESSNESS, DISTRESS OR SICKNESS, IMPROVING THE SKILL OF COUNTRY CRAFTSMEN, OR IN PURSUING ANY OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES; AND    B) TO PROMOTE AND ORGANISE CO-OPERATION IN THE ACHIEVEMENT OF THE SAID PURPOSES AND TO THAT END TO BRING TOGETHER IN COUNCIL REPRESENTATIVES OF THE AUTHORITIES AND ORGANISATIONS ENGAGED IN THE FURTHERANCE OF THE SAID PURPOSES WITHIN THE GEOGRAPHICAL COUNTY OF CORNWALL AND THE ISLES OF SCILLY.

name: HOUSE OF MERCY
activities: House Of Mercy provides accommodation to single homeless people. The charity also provides day centre facilities.
objects: THE PROVISION OF RELIEF FOR PEOPLE IN NECESSITOUS CIRCUMSTANCES WHO ARE HOMELESS OR LIVING IN INADEQUATE ACCOMMODATION AND INCLUDING (BUT WITHOUT PREJUDICE TO THE PROVISION OF OTHER FORMS OF RELIEF) THE PROVISION OF HOUSING, ACCOMMODATION, DAY CARE, FOOD, ADVICE AND COUNSELLING.

name: GATEWAY CHURCH
activities: The charitable company exists as a church. It carries out the typical activities of a Christian church; e.g. public worship, teaching &training, prayer, projects of a charitable nature, the extension of the Christian faith in Leeds and beyond, the spiritual and practical support of other Christian churches and its own congregation.
objects: TO RELIEVE AGED PERSONS AND PERSONS IN CONDITIONS OF NEED HARDSHIP SICKNESS OR DISTRESS ARISING THEREFROM WHETHER IN CONNECTION WITH HOUSING OR ACCOMMODATION OR SHELTER OR ANY OTHER PURPOSE (WHETHER BY WAY OF LOAN GIFT THE PROVISION OF ACCOMMODATION OR SHELTER OR IN ANY OTHER WAY) IN LEEDS AND IN SUCH OTHER PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT

name: THROUGH THE ROOF CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: THROUGH THE ROOF GIVES ADVICE AND PRODUCES WRITTEN RESOURCES, AS WELL AS TRAINING, TO EQUIP CHURCHES AND OTHER ORGANISATIONS TO BE INCLUSIVE OF DISABLED PEOPLE AND THEIR FAMILIES. WE DO THIS THROUGHOUT THE UK AND IN AFRICA. WE DONATE MOBILITY AIDS TO THOSE IN NEED IN AFRICA. OUR VISION IS TO MAKE THE GOOD NEWS OF THE CHRISTIAN MESSAGE ACCESSIBLE TO ALL.
objects: (A)  TO ADVANCE CHRISTIAN FAITH PARTICULARLY AMONGST PERSONS WITH PHYSICAL AND OTHER DISABILITIES IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATEMENT OF BELIEFS APPEARING IN THE SCHEDULE HERETO IN THE UNITED KINGDOM AND ELSEWHERE AS THE DIRECTORS OF THE CHARITY (HEREI00N CALLED "THE TRUSTEES") MAY FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT AND TO FULFIL SUCH OTHER PURPOSES WHICH ARE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE ACCORDING TO THE LAW OF ENGLAND AND WALES AND ARE CONNECTED WITH THE CHARITABLE WORK OF THE CHARITY.    (B)  TO RELIEVE AND ASSIST PERSONS WITH PHYSICAL AND OTHER DISABILITIES AND IN DOING SO TO PROMOTE THE INTEGRATION AND PARTICIPATION OF SUCH PERSONS IN CHURCH LIFE IN THE UNITED KINGDOM AND ELSEWHERE AND TO PROMOTE AN AWARENESS OF THE NEEDS OF SUCH PERSONS AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSES TO THOSE NEEDS AMONGST CHURCHES AND CHRISTIANS IN THE UNITED KINGDOM AND ELSEWHERE AND TO TRAIN CHRISTIANS IN WAYS OF SERVING AND HELPING  PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES IN THE UNITED KINGDOM AND ELSEWHERE AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT.

name: HORSFORTH MINIBUS FUND
activities: To provide a community transport service for such of the inhabitants of Horsforth and the surrounding area who are in need of such a service because of youth, age, sickness or disability (mental or physical) or poverty or because of a lack of availability of adequate and safe public passenger services.
objects: TO PROVIDE A COMMUNITY TRANSPORT SERVICE FOR SUCH OF THE INHABITANTS OF HORSFORTH AND THE SURROUNDING AREA WHO ARE IN NEED OF SUCH A SERVICE BECAUSE OF YOUTH, AGE, SICKNESS OR DISABILITY (MENTAL OR PHYSICAL) OR POVERTY OR BECAUSE OF A LACK OF AVAILABILITY OF ADEQUATE AND SAFE PUBLIC PASSENGER SERVICES

name: FRYERS MILLENNIUM GREEN TRUST
activities: A Millennium Green for the benefit of local inhabitants to use as a green and recreational amenity.
objects: PROVIDE AND MAINTAIN AN OPEN SPACE TO BE KNOWN AS "FRYERS MILLENNIUM GREEN" FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS AND TO BE USED FOREVER AS AN AREA FOR INFORMAL RECREATION PLAY OR OTHER LEISURE-TIME OCCUPATIONS A MEETING AREA OR PLACE FOR COMMUNITY EVENTS AND FOR ANY OTHER LAWFUL PURPOSE CONSISTENT WITH THESE TRUSTS AND FOR THE GENERAL BENEFIT OF THE COMMUNITY.

name: THE STARS FOUNDATION
activities: Stars Foundation invests in organisations and ideas that transform the lives of disadvantaged children, young people and their communities globally. In all our work, we seek to champion and amplify the efforts of those working on the front line in the fight against poverty.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CHARITY ARE THE GENERAL PURPOSES OF SUCH CHARITABLE BODIES OR FOR SUCH OTHER PURPOSES FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE COMMUNITY AS SHALL BE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE AS THE TRUSTEES FROM TIME TO TIME SHALL DECIDE.

name: THE KOINONIA YOUTH TRUST
activities: The Koinonia Youth Trust manages The Box - A Social Space and Information Point for young people in Epping, Essex. The Box provides a range of services for young people aged 11 - 25.
objects: TO PROVIDE OR ASSIST IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR THE RECREATIONAL AND EDUCATIONAL USE OF CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE UNDER THE AGE OF 25 WHO ARE RESIDENT IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT IN ORDER TO ADVANCE THEIR EDUCATION AND DEVELOPMENT AND IMPROVE THEIRCONDITIONS OF LIFE.

name: MEDIC MALAWI
activities: Built/funds Hospital in Malawi which provides OPD, Dental, Maternity, paediatrics, mobile clinics, Nutrition Rehabilitation Unit, health education programmes, HIV/AIDS Testing and Counselling. Operating theatre. Helps with orphan care in the community and in purpose-built orphanage. Assists with kindergarten, primary/secondary schools, Mchinji orphanage.
objects: 1) THE RELIEF OF SICKNESS OF PERSONS LIVING IN THE MTUNTHAMA AREA OF MALAWI; 2) THE RELIEF OF NEED, HARDSHIP AND DISTRESS OF THE CHILDREN OF MCHINJI MISSION ORPHANAGE, MALAWI.

name: ST ALBANS ROUND TABLE CHARITABLE TRUST FUND

name: THE ESTUARY LEAGUE OF FRIENDS
activities: Estuary League of Friends has been supporting the community since 1987 and are based in Topsham Devon, serving the local area. Our aim is to work to improve the quality of life of those in need of care, comfort and support in our community. We support those who have been disadvantaged, through terminal illnesses, disablement, as well as the elderly, frail, and those with debilitating illnesses.
objects: (A) THE ADVANCEMENT OF HEALTH BY RELIEVING SICKNESS AND PRESERVING HEALTH AMONGST THE PEOPLE LIVING PERMANENTLY OR TEMPORARILY IN EXETER AND EAST DEVON;  (B) THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION TO RESIDENTS OF EXETER AND EAST DEVON BY THE PROVISION OF A LIBRARY; (C) TO PROVIDE OR ASSIST IN THE PROVISIONS OF FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION OF INDIVIDUALS LIVING PERMANENTLY OR TEMPORARILY IN EXETER AND EAST DEVON WHO HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIESBY REASON OF YOUTH , AGE INFIRMITY OR DISABILITY, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR SOCIAL CIRCUMSTANCES WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THEIR CONDITION OF LIFE. IN FURTHERANCE OF THESE OBJECTS BUT NOT OTHERWISE THE TRUSTEES SHALL HAVE POWER TO ESTABLISH OR SECURETHE ESTABLISHMENT OF A COMMUNITY CENTRE AND LIBRARY AT TOPSHAM IN DEVON AND TO MAINTAIN AND MANAGE SUCH A BUILDING FOR THE ACTIVITIES PROMOTED BY THE CHARITY IN FURTHERANCE OF THE ABOVE OBJECTS.

name: THE GAMBIAN PENCIL PROJECT
activities: Fundraising to provide funds to advance education for the children in The Gambia by assisting in the provision of facilities not normally provided by the local education authority. and  to relieve poverty by the provision of financial assistance:  to parents to help them pay towards advancing the education of their children and to provide food assistance in local communities
objects: (A) TO ADVANCE EDUCATION BY ASSISTING IN THE PROVISION OF A NURSERY SCHOOL, AND ADVANCING THE EDUCATION OF THE CHILDREN ATTENDING THE NURSERY SCHOOL BY PROVIDING AND ASSISTING IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR EDUCATION NOT NORMALLY PROVIDED BY THE LOCAL EDUCATION AUTHORITY. (B) TO RELIEVE POVERTY BY THE PROVISION OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO PARENTS WHO ARE UNABLE TO AFFORD EDUCATION FOR THEIR CHILDREN, TO HELP THEM PAY TOWARDS ADVANCING THE EDUCATION OF THEIR CHILDREN.

name: THE GAMBIAN PENCIL PROJECT
activities: Fundraising to provide funds to advance education for the children in The Gambia by assisting in the provision of facilities not normally provided by the local education authority. and  to relieve poverty by the provision of financial assistance:  to parents to help them pay towards advancing the education of their children and to provide food assistance in local communities
objects: (A) TO ADVANCE EDUCATION BY ASSISTING IN THE PROVISION OF A NURSERY SCHOOL, AND ADVANCING THE EDUCATION OF THE CHILDREN ATTENDING THE NURSERY SCHOOL BY PROVIDING AND ASSISTING IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR EDUCATION NOT NORMALLY PROVIDED BY THE LOCAL EDUCATION AUTHORITY. (B) TO RELIEVE POVERTY BY THE PROVISION OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO PARENTS WHO ARE UNABLE TO AFFORD EDUCATION FOR THEIR CHILDREN, TO HELP THEM PAY TOWARDS ADVANCING THE EDUCATION OF THEIR CHILDREN.

name: THE FRIENDS OF ST MARY'S CHURCH, STANDON
activities: To assist including by raising funds in the conservation and development of the buildings, fixtures, fittings, contents and churchyard of St Mary's Church Standon. To assist in the maintenance of the churchyard and to encourage and support all that is done to add to the beauty and usefulness of the church. To meet these objects to raise funds by events and donations.
objects: TO ASSIST IN THE MAINTENANCE, REPAIR, RESTORATION, PRESERVATION, IMPROVEMENT, BEAUTIFICATION AND RECONSTRUCTION FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC OF THE CHURCH OF ST MARY'S STANDON, ITS MONUMENTS, FIXTURES, FITTINGS, FURNITURE, STAINED GLASS, ORNAMENTS AND OTHER CHATTELS AND ITS CHURCHYARD.

name: AMMANFORD EVANGELICAL CHURCH
activities: The principle object of the Church is the advancement of the Christian faith in Carmarthenshire and beyond. The Church is involved in a wide range of teaching, educational and social activities for its members, for young people and for the socially disadvantaged.
objects: (A) TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATEMENT OF BELIEFS APPEARING IN THE SCHEDULE HERETO IN CARMARTHENSHIRE AND IN SUCH OTHER PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE DIRECTORS OF THE CHARITY (HEREIN CALLED "THE TRUSTEES") MAY FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT AND TO FULFIL SUCH OTHER PURPOSES WHICH ARE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE ACCORDING TO THE LAW OF ENGLAND AND WALES AND ARE CONNECTED WITH THE CHARITABLE WORK OF THE CHARITY; (B) TO RELIEVE PERSONS WHO ARE IN CONDITIONS OF NEED OR HARDSHIP OR WHO ARE AGED OR SICK AND TO RELIEVE THE DISTRESS CAUSED THEREBY IN THE SAID LOCATION AND IN SUCH OTHER PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT; (C) TO ADVANCE EDUCATION IN ACCORDANCEWITH CHRISTIAN PRINCIPLES BY SUCH MEANS AS THE TRUSTEES MAY CONSIDER APPROPRIATE INCLUDING BY MEANS OF ESTABLISHING AND OPERATING ANY EDUCATIONAL ESTABLISHMENT OR ESTABLISHMENTS IN THE SAID LOCATION AND IN SUCH OTHER PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THEWORLD AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT.

name: ROWDEFORD CHARITY TRUST
activities: The Trust works with Rowdeford School to provide facilities and appropriate infrastructure to help provide the students and young people from the community with the life skills and experience to better equip them for adult life. Our objective is to break down barriers between people with special needs, the wider community and the workplace.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES OR SPECIAL NEEDS, ESPECIALLY BY DEVELOPING, RENOVATING AND CONSERVING THE BUILDINGS AND GROUNDS OF ROWDEFORD SCHOOL.

name: JESUS HOUSE
activities: Worship Services. Advancement of the Christian religion worldwide The relief of poverty worldwide Local Community Projects including a community centre and community-focused events. Provision of grants to other charitable and voluntary organisations.
objects: 1. THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE CHRISTIAN RELIGION WORLDWIDE; 2. THE RELIEF OF POVERTY WORLDWIDE.

name: THE JOHN BROWNE CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: The trust is primarily a grant making organisation. However, the trustees intention for the immediate future is to retain the major part of the trust's income and capital to generate a realistic endowment. the current target funding is ·1,000,000.
objects: FOR OR TOWARDS SUCH CHARITABLE PURPOSES, AND TO MAKE DONATIONS TO SUCH CHARITABLE INSTITUTION OR INSTITUTIONS

activities: Kirklees Citizens Advice provides advice and information to the residents of Kirklees. This includes generalist advice and specialist advice on debt and benefits.
objects: TO PROMOTE ANY CHARITABLE PURPOSE FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT BY THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION, THE PROTECTION AND PRESERVATION OF HEALTH AND THE RELIEF OF POVERTY, SICKNESS AND DISTRESS IN PARTICULAR, BUT WITHOUT LIMITATION, FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE COMMUNITY IN KIRKLEES AND SURROUNDING AREAS

name: MANOR PARK & EAST HAM AFRICAN CARIBBEAN ASSOCIATION
activities: The charity provides a befriending scheme where by volunteers visit housebound and lonely isolated elderly people providing support and help for the elderly in their homes. The charity also provides education in  African and Caribbean culture to young children and people of African and Caribbean origin in and around the London Borough of Newham.
objects: THE COMPANY'S OBJECT ("THE OBJECTS") ARE: A) TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC AND IN PARTICULAR PEOPLE OF AFRICAN AND CARIBBEAN ORIGIN IN AND AROUND THE LONDON BOROUGH OF NEWHAM IN ALL ASPECTS OF AFRICAN AND CARIBBEAN CULTURE, AND THEREBY PROMOTE GOOD RACE RELATIONS AND ENDEAVOUR TO ELIMINATE DISCRIMINATION  ON GROUNDS OF RACE AND TO ENCOURAGE EQUALITY OF OPPORTUNITY BETWEEN DIFFERENT RACIAL GROUPS; AND B) TO RELIEVE PERSONS OF AFRICAN AND CARIBBEAN ORIGIN IN THE SAID AREA WHO ARE IN NEED, POVERTY AND DISTRESS, IN PARTICULAR THROUGH THE PROVISION OF A BEFRIENDING SCHEME PROVIDING ADVICE AND SUPPORT...

name: THE BURLTONS COOKES AND SAYERS ALMSHOUSES
activities: Provision of almshouses.
objects: FOR THE PURPOSE OF PROVIDING FOR THOSE ITEMS OF ORDINARY MAINTENANCE AND REPAIR OF THE ALMSHOUSES BELONGING TO THE CHARITY AND PROVIDING FOR THE EXTRAORDINARY REPAIR, IMPROVEMENT OR REBUILDING OF THE ALMSHOUSES OF THE CHARITY AND FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE RESIDENTS IN THE ALMSHOUSES OF THE CHARITY OR ANY OF THEM IN SUCH MANNER AS THE TRUSTEES THINK FIT FROM TIME TO TIME.

name: FRIENDS OF ROCK PARK
activities: Assist Local Council with the maintenance of the park and provide voluntary help with simple tasks such as clearing paths, planting and caring for planted areas.
objects: THE RESTORATION, PRESERVATION, DEVELOPMENT AND PROMOTION FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC OF THE LAND AND THOSE BUILT FACILITIES IN THE AREA KNOWN AS THE ROCK PARK, WHICH EXTENDS FROM THE RIVER ITHON ON ITS WESTERN BOUNDARY TO THE RAILWAY LINE ON ITS EASTERN BOUNDARY AND INCLUDING THE MONTPELLIER PARK WHICH IS CONTIGUOUS WITH THE ROCK PARK VIA A RAILWAY UNDERPASS, AS DETERMINED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE HISTORICAL CHARACTER ORIGINALLY ENVISAGED BY ITS VICTORIAN CREATORS.

name: KESWICK MUSEUM AND ART GALLERY
activities: Trusteeship of museum building and collections
objects: TO PROVIDE AND MAINTAIN A PUBLIC MUSEUM TO ADVANCE EDUCATION.

name: DAVID AND JULIA HUNTER CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: We make grants worldwide to charities and charitable objects.  Please note that we only rarely make grants in response to unsolicited appeals.
objects: FOR SUCH CHARITABLE INSTITUTION OR INSTITUTIONS OR SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE OBJECT OR OBJECTS IN ANY PART OF THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL IN THEIR DISCRETION THINK FIT.

activities: Provision of services pertaining to the Jewish Religion
objects: THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE JEWISH  RELIGION (THE RELIGIOUS OBJECT); AND  TO MAINTAIN, REPAIR, RESTORE, PRESERVE, IMPROVE AND BEAUTIFY AND RECONSTRUCT FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC THE FABRIC OF THE SYNAGOGUE AT PRINCES ROAD LIVERPOOL, ITS MONUMENTS, FIXTURES, FITTINGS, FURNITURE, STAINED GLASS, ORNAMENTS, RECORDS AND OTHER CHATTELS AND ITS CEMETERIES (THE MAINTENANCE OBJECT).

name: BRITISH BENGALI WELFARE ASSOCIATION
activities: THE ASSOCIATION IS ESTABLISHED TO: (I) RELIEVE NEED PARTICULARLY AMONGST PEOPLE LIVING IN THE LONDON BOROUGH OF TOWER HAMLETS, ELSEWHERE IN THE UNITED KINGDOM AND IN BANGLADESH PARTICULARLY, BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY, BRITISH-BENGALI AND OTHER ETHNIC MINORITY PEOPLE BY THE PROVISION OF ADVICE AND INFORMATION ON HOUSING, WELFARE BENEFITS, COUNCIL TAX, THE FILLING OUT OF FORMS, JOB APPLICATIONS AND SKILLS AND BY THE PROVISION OF TRANSLATION SERVICES AND OTHER ASSISTANCE. (II) ADVANCE EDUCATION PARTICULARLY AMONGST BRITISH-BENGALI AND OTHER ETHNIC MINORITY PEOPLE SPECIALLY  LIVING IN THE LONDON BOROUGH OF TOWER HAMLETS AND GREATER LONDON BY THE PROVISION OF SUPPLEMENTARY CLASSES, MOTHER TONGUE CLASSES, ART CLASSES AND EDUCATIONAL ADVICE TO PARENTS. (III) ASSIST CHILDREN, YOUNG, ADULT AND ELDERLY PEOPLE OF BRITISH BENGALI AND OTHER ETHNIC MINORITIES OF THE UNITED KINGDOM AND BANGLADESH AND SPECIALLY THE LONDON BOROUGH OF TOWER HAMLETS THROUGH THEIR LEISURE ACTIVITIES TO EDUCATE AND TO DEVELOP THEIRPHYSICAL, MENTAL AND SPIRITUAL CAPACITIES THAT THEY MAY GROW UP WITH FULL MATURITY AS INDIVIDUALS AND MEMBERS OF SOCIETY AND THAT THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE MAY BE IMPROVED AND ALSO TO ACHIEVE THE PROTECTION AND PRESERVATION OF PUBLIC HEALTH BY THE PROVISION OF ADVICE CONCERNING LEGAL AND ILLEGAL DRUGS.
objects: THE ASSOCIATION IS ESTABLISHED TO: (I) RELIEVE NEED PARTICULARLY AMONGST PEOPLE LIVING IN THE LONDON BOROUGH OF TOWER HAMLETS, ELSEWHERE IN THE UNITED KINGDOM AND IN BANGLADESH PARTICULARLY, BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY, BRITISH-BENGALI AND OTHER ETHNIC MINORITY PEOPLE BY THE PROVISION OF ADVICE AND INFORMATION ON HOUSING, WELFARE BENEFITS, COUNCIL TAX, THE FILLING OUT OF FORMS, JOB APPLICATIONS AND SKILLS AND BY THE PROVISION OF TRANSLATION SERVICES AND OTHER ASSISTANCE.
