objects: THE RELIEF OF THE NEEDS OF PEOPLE WITH DOWN'S SYNDROME BY THE PROVISION FOR SUCH PEOPLE OF FACILITIES, SERVICES AND OPPORTUNITIES THAT WILL MAXIMISE THEIR PARTICIPATION IN SOCIETY, AND ANY OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSE CONNECTED WITH DOWN'S SYNDROME.

name: ALL SAINTS CHILDREN'S VENTURES LIMITED
activities: The provision of childcare,education and training in the Borough of Sefton, Merseyside.
objects: (1)  TO PROMOTE AND ADVANCE GOOD QUALITY PLAY OPPORTUNITIES FOR CHILDREN IN OUT-OF-SCHOOL SETTINGS IN THE BOROUGH OF SEFTON, MERSEYSIDE.  THIS INCLUDES PROMOTING AND ADVANCING THE CARE & EDUCATION OF SUCH CHILDREN. (2)  TO PROMOTE AND ADVANCE THE TRAINING OF PERSONS IN PROVIDING PLAY, CARE & EDUCATION FOR CHILDREN IN OUT-OF-SCHOOL SETTINGS IN THE BOROUGH OF SEFTON, MERSEYSIDE.

name: GEMACH LTD
activities: The Charity was set up with the aim of supporting religious Jewish educational institutions and charitable organisations whose objectives fall within the objectives of the Charity, by making donations and grants available to them.
objects: (A)  THE ADVANCEMENT AND FURTHERANCE OF THE JEWISH RELIGION AND JEWISH RELIGIOUS EDUCATION AND THE ALLEVIATION OF POVERTY AMONG THE JEWISH COMMUNITY THROUGHOUT THE WORLD. (B)  OTHER CHARITABLE ACTIVITIES THAT THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME DETERMINE.

name: CFC FAMILY MINISTRIES
activities: Evangelize families of their faith under the power of the Holy Spirit. We have the renewal of Couples (Married & Living-In), Singles, Youth and Kids. They undergo a series of talks and eventually, commit themselves to a new life with Jesus Christ.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN RELIGION IN PARTICULAR, BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY, IN RELATION TO MARITAL AND FAMILY MATTERS, THROUGHOUT THE WORLD

name: WARREN HOUSE GROUP AT DARTINGTON
activities: The Dartington Service Design Lab (Trading name of Charity) is an independent charity that brings science and evidence to bear on policy and practice in children's services to improve the health and development of children and young people.
objects: TO RELIEVE POVERTY AND SICKNESS, ADVANCE EDUCATION AND PROTECT AND PRESERVE THE HEALTH OF NEEDY PERSONS, ESPECIALLY VULNERABLE CHILDREN, YOUNG PEOPLE AND THEIR FAMILIES.

name: DYSCOVER LIMITED
activities: Dyscover is a charity offering long-term support, hope and opportunity to people who are isolated by communication problems after a stroke or head injury (a language disorder called Aphasia), and their families. Dyscover builds working relationships with and delivers its specialist services to health and social care workers, public, private and third sector organisations and the general public.
objects: 1. THE RELIEF OF PERSONS WHO ARE DYSPHASIC. 2. THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR RECREATIONAL OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION FOR PERSONS WHO ARE DYSPHASIC IN ORDER TO IMPROVE THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE.

name: MEETING THE NEEDS
activities: The relief of poverty, sickness and distress in particular, but not exclusively, in Romania, Moldova and Bulgaria and to or for such other charitable purposes as the trustees shall decide
objects: THE RELIEF OF POVERTY, SICKNESS AND DISTRESS IN PARTICULAR, BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY, IN ROMANIA, MOLDOVA AND BULGARIA AND TO OR FOR SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL DECIDE.

name: BLACKPOOL CENTRE FOR THE UNEMPLOYED AND RESIDENTS ADVICE SERVICE
activities: Supporting people across Blackpool the BCFU specifically supports, represents and campaigns for the most vulnerable and those socially excluded in our community including homeless, travelers, offenders, long term unemployed, those facing redundancy and disabled. Services include Welfare Rights Advice, Education and Training, Form FIlling, Employment support,
objects: TO PROMOTE ANY CHARITABLE PURPOSE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC AND PARTICULARLY PEOPLE LIVING OR WORKING IN THE BLACKPOOL AREA BY THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION AND THE RELIEF OF POVERTY IN PARTICULAR BY THE PROVISION OF ADVICE, ADVOCACY AND TRAINING.

name: GOLDENHAR SUPPORT GROUP
activities: Operates throughout the UK.  Support Group for families affected by Goldenhar Syndrome.
objects: THE RELIEF OF SICKNESS AND THE PROTECTION AND PRESERVATION OF THE HEALTH OF PERSONS AFFECTED BY GOLDENHAR SYNDROME AND ANY RELATED CONDITION AND THEIR FAMILIES AND CARERS IN PARTICULAR BY BUT NOT RESTRICTED TO (A) THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE EDUCATION OF THE MEDICAL PROFESSION AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC INTO GOLDENHAR SYNDROME AND ITS IMPLICATIONS FOR THE FAMILY. (B) THE PROMOTION OF RESEARCH INTO THE CAUSES, EFFECTS, TREATMENT AND MANAGEMENT OF GOLDENHAR SYNDROME AND TO DISSEMINATE THE USEFUL RESULTS THEREOF.

name: LIGHT FOR THE LAST DAYS
activities: Advance the Christian faith through the production of a magazine, leaflets and website available to the general public. Comment on current events in the light of the prophecies of the Bible. This material is translated into a number of languages and distributed in the countries mentioned above. Give aid and help to countries in Africa, India and Israel.
objects: (A)  TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATEMENT OF BELIEFS APPEARING IN THE SCHEDULE HERETO IN LONDON AND IN SUCH OTHER PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT AND TO FULFIL SUCH OTHER PURPOSES WHICH ARE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE ACCORDING TO THE LAW OF ENGLAND AND WALES AND ARE CONNECTED WITH THE CHARITABLE WORK OF THE TRUST (B)  TO RELIEVE PERSONS WHO ARE IN CONDITIONS OF NEED OR HARDSHIP OR WHO ARE AGED OR SICK AND TO RELIEVE THE DISTRESS CAUSED THEREBY IN THE SAID LOCATION AND IN SUCH OTHER PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT.

name: SHEEP MUSIC LTD
activities: A&M Extract:- To encourage and develop knowledge, enjoyment and understanding of the arts including but not limited to music, dance, drama, film, storytelling, musical theatre, literature, poetry, visual art and craft To promote and advance the training and education of young people particularly but not exclusively in the Border counties of Powys, Herefordshire and Shropshire
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN THE ARTS, INCLUDING THE ARTS OF OTHER CULTURES, PARTICULARLY THE ARTS OF MUSIC, DANCE, FILM, STORYTELLING, MUSICAL THEATRE, LITERATURE, POETRY AND VISUAL ART AND CRAFT.

name: TEENS AND TODDLERS TRADING AS POWER2 LTD
activities: Power2 is a leading youth development charity. We believe there is no greater cost to society than unfulfilled potential.  We support children and young people at key transition points to achieve their potential by developing crucial life skills, boosting confidence and improving self-esteem. Our two main programmes are the award-winning Teens & Toddlers programme and the Young Leaders programme.
objects: TO FOSTER AND SUPPORT THE EDUCATION, HEALTH, OPPORTUNITY AND DEVELOPMENT OF CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE.

name: THE FRIENDS OF MORSTON CHURCH
activities: To raise money for the maintenance and repair of All Saints Church, Morston, Norfolk, England.
objects: TO MAINTAIN REPAIR RESTORE AND PRESERVE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC THE FABRIC OF ALL SAINTS CHURCH, MORSTON, NORFOLK, ITS MONUMENTS, FIXTURES, FITTINGS, FURNITURE, STAINED GLASS, ORNAMENTS AND OTHER CHATTELS  AND ITS CHURCHYARD

name: REDEEMED CHRISTIAN CHURCH OF GOD (RCCG) LIBERTY CHRISTIAN CONNECTIONS
activities: To seek the advancement of the Christian religion in accordance with the teachings of the Redeemed Christian Church of God and to educate people in the Word of God. To teach the knowledge of Jesus Christ all over the Redbridge and Essex county and beyond
objects: 2.2.1 - THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE CHRISTIAN FAITH WORLDWIDE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE DOCTRINES SET OUT IN THE STATEMENT OF FAITH CONTAINED IN THE SCHEDULE. 2.2.2 - THE RELIEF OF POVERTY.

name: THE CHALLENGE DISABILITY SPORTS CLUB
activities: Coaching children and young adults with a disability and their siblings,  Athletics (Track And Field)
objects: TO PROMOTE THE HEALTH AND WELFARE OF DISABLED PEOPLE BY PROVIDING SUITABLE FACILITIES, AND ORGANISING AND ENCOURAGING THEIR PARTICIPATION IN SPORTING ACTIVITIES AND COMPETITIONS.

name: FIRTH PARK CENTRE FOR LIFE
activities: To provide facilities for use by the local community for educational and training programmes.
objects: 1.  TO PROMOTE THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF THE CITY OF SHEFFIELD, AND IN PARTICULAR THOSE INHABITANTS LIVING IN FIRTH PARK AND ALL IMMEDIATE ADJACENT DISTRICTS THERETO ("THE AREA OF BENEFIT") BY BRINGING TOGETHER THE STATUTORY, VOLUNTARY AND OTHER ORGANISATIONS AND INHABITANTS IN A COMMON EFFORT TO: 1.  RELIEVE POVERTY 2.  ADVANCE EDUCATION AND TRAINING 3.  PROVIDE FACILITIES IN THE INTEREST OF SOCIAL WELFARE AND FOR THE LEISURE AND SPARE TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE OBJECTS OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE OF THE SAID INHABITANTS. 2.  TO MAINTAIN AND MANAGE A CENTRE FOR THE ACTIVITIES OF THE CHARITY REQUIRED TO ACHIEVE THESE OBJECTS.

name: MISSION MOLDOVA
activities: We have been operating here in West Cornwall for the past 14 years sending Humanitarian Aid to Moldova or Romania.The cost of  transport for each trip is -?4,500  we are send two lorries a year. Members of our Charity visit Moldova at least once a  year these trips are self funded. Our aim is to help those less fortunate than ourselves.We thank the people for their continued support to our Charity
objects: (A) TO RELIEVE PERSONS WHO ARE IN CONDITIONS OF NEED OR HARDSHIP OR WHO ARE AGED OR SICK AND TO RELIEVE THE DISTRESS CAUSED THEREBY IN MOLDOVA AND IN SUCH OTHER PARTS OF EASTERN EUROPE OR THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT. (B) TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION BY SUCH MEANS AS THE TRUSTEES MAY CONSIDER APPROPRIATE INCLUDING BY MEANS OF ESTABLISHING AND OPERATING ANY EDUCATIONAL ESTABLISHMENT OR ESTABLISHMENTS IN THE SAID LOCATION AND IN SUCH OTHER PARTS THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES MAYFROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT.

name: SHARING LIFE TRUST
activities: Provision of services and support for people in poverty and need, both in the UK and Overseas.
objects: FOR THE RELIEF OF POVERTY

name: WESLEYAN REFORMED CHURCH FUND
activities: Our church is open to all members of the public for Christian worship meetings, also for funeral, weddings and baptism services. We also hold regular social events, (fayres, concerts etc) where everyone is welcome. We give support to local and other charities.
objects: FURTHERING THE RELIGIOUS AND OTHER CHARITABLE WORK OF THE SAID ST. JAMES' WESLEYAN REFORM CHURCH, AT CRADLEY HEATH, IN THE COUNTY OF WEST MIDLANDS

name: WEST CORNWALL WOMEN'S AID
activities: Refuge accommodation for women and children who have experienced domestic violence, provision of an outreach service for women affected by domestic violence, domestic violence helpline, counselling service, therapeutic group work.
objects: TO PROVIDE FOR THE RELIEF OF POVERTY, DISTRESS AND SUFFERING EXPERIENCED BY WOMEN AND THEIR CHILDREN WHO HAVE BEEN ABUSED IN A DOMESTIC SITUATION; TO ENCOURAGE WOMEN WHO HAVE BEEN ABUSED TO DETERMINE THEIR OWN FUTURES AND TO HELP THEM ACHIEVE THIS; TORECOGNISE AND CARE FOR THE EMOTIONAL AND PHYSICAL NEEDS OF THE CHILDREN INVOLVED; TO ESTABLISH AND RUN A REFUGE FOR ABUSED WOMEN AND THEIR CHILDREN TO UNDERTAKE RESEARCH, EDUCATE AND INFORM THE PUBLIC, THE MEDIA, OTHER SERVICE PROVIDERS AND AUTHORITIES IN THE FIELD OF DOMESTIC ABUSED TO RECRUIT AND TRAIN VOLUNTARY WORKERS TO SUPPORT ABUSED WOMEN AND THEIR CHILDREN.

name: CLERKS STAPLES CHARITY
activities: To pay the salary of Parish Clerk and other Church Officials
objects: TO PAY SUCH SUITABLE ANNUAL SALARY AS MAY FROM TIME TO TIME BE FIXED AND ASSIGNED BY THE TRUSTEES TO THE DULY APPOINTED PARISH CLERK, OFFICIATING AND ADMINISTERING IN THE PARISH CHURCH OF GREAT STANMORE. ALSO TO THE SEXTON, PEW OPENERS, AND OTHER DULYAPPOINTED OFFICIALS OFFICIATING AND ADMINISTERING IN THE AFORESAID CHURCH SEE SCHEME FOR FURTHER DETAILS

name: PARENTS' ASSOCIATION MERCHANT TAYLORS' GIRLS' SCHOOL AND STANFIELD SCHOOL
activities: The aims and objectives of the association are as follows: to encourage the co operation of parents of the Schools' pupils in all mattes which promote the welfare of the schools; to promote social interaction between parents of the schools including new parents
objects: THE AIMS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE ASSOCIATION ARE AS FOLLOWS:!  2.1 TO ENCOURAGE THE CO-OPERATION OF THE PARENTS OF THE SCHOOLS' PUPILS IN ALL MATTERS WHICH  CONCERN THE WELFARE OF THE SCHOOLS;!  2.2 DEVELOPING EFFECTIVE RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN THE STAFF, PARENTS AND OTHERS ASSOCIATED  WITH THE SCHOOLS;!  2.3 ENGAGING IN ACTIVITIES OR PROVIDING FACILITIES OR EQUIPMENT WHICH!  SUPPORT THE SCHOOL AND ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUPILS.!  2.4 PROMOTE SOCIAL INTERACTION BETWEEN PARENTS OF THE SCHOOLS.!  2.5 TO PURSUE SUCH GOALS AND OBJECTIVES AGREED PERIODICALLY WITH THE SCHOOLS.!  2.6 TO PURSUE PROJECTS OR UNDERTAKINGS FOR THE WELFARE OR BENEFIT OF THE SCHOOLS.!  2.7 TO INTEGRATE WITH OTHER AFFILIATED OR ALLIED BODIES WITHIN THE SCHOOLS' COMMUNITY.!

name: PETER SCOTT GALLERY CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: The Peter Scott Gallery Charitable Trust was established by a Declaration of Trust dated 8th November 2001, for the  (A) Preservation, protection and improvement for the Public Benefit of all Paintings, prints,works of art, ceramics owned by, associated with or displaced in the Peter Scott Gallery of the University of Lancaster.
objects: (A) THE PRESERVATION PROTECTION AND IMPROVEMENT FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT OF ALL PAINTINGS, PRINTS, WORKS OF ART, CERAMICS, PORCELAIN, SCULPTURE AND OTHER CHATTELS OF ITEMS OF NATIONAL, HISTORIC, ARTISTIC OR SCIENTIFIC INTEREST OWNED BY ASSOCIATED WITH OR DISPLACED IN THE PETER SCOTT GALLERY OF THE UNIVERSITY OF LANCASTER. (B) FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE GENERAL PUBLIC THE PRESERVATION OF A COLLECTION ("THE COLLECTION") OF PAINTINGS SCULPTURE AND OTHER CHATTELS OR ITEMS OF NATIONAL, HISTORIC, ARTISTIC OR SCIENTIFIC INTEREST AND THE ENCOURAGEMENT OF THE PROVISION OF ACCESS TO AND THE STUDY OF SUCH ITEMS BY THE GENERAL PUBLIC. (C) TO ADVANCE EDUCATION BY THE CREATION MAINTENANCE AND FUNDING OF GRANTS, BURSARIES, SCHOLARSHIPS, PRIZES AND REWARDS FOR MEMBERS OF THE GENERAL PUBLIC TO INCREASE THEIR KNOWLEDGE, APPRECIATION AND ENJOYMENT OF THE COLLECTION AND FOR EDUCATIONAL AND RESEARCH PURPOSES GENERALLY IN RELATION TO THE COLLECTION. (D) THE ORGANISATION OR PROVISION, OR ASSISTANCE IN THE ORGANISATION OR PROVISION OF FACILITIES WHICH WILL ENABLE MEMBERS OF THE GENERAL PUBLIC TO HAVE ACCESS TO THE COLLECTION. (E) THE EDUCATION OF THE GENERAL PUBLIC AND IN PARTICULAR, BUT WITHOUT PREJUDICE TO THE GENERALITY OF THE FOREGOING THE INCREASE OF THEIR KNOWLEDGE, UNDERSTANDING AND APPRECIATION OF ANY MATTERS OF HISTORIC, ARTISTIC, ARCHITECTURAL, ANAESTHETIC OF SCIENTIFIC INTEREST AND THE USE OF THE COLLECTION TO FUTURE SUCH AIMS.

name: HEALTH ENERGY ADVICE TEAM LIMITED
activities: DELIVER PROJECTS THAT  TARGET THE MOST VULNERABLE IN OUR COMMUNITIES BY PROVIDING EQUAL ACCESS TO  FREE, CONFIDENTIAL, ADVICE , SUPPORT & ADVOCACY TO ASSIST PEOPLE WHO ARE SOCIALLY / ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED.  PROVIDE A PACKAGE OF HOLISTIC SUPPORT FOR WOMEN AND GIRLS WHO ARE SUFFERING FROM DOMESTIC ABUSE, RAISE AWARENESS BOTH LOCALLY AND NATIONALLY, PROVIDE TRAINING FOR FRONT LINE STAFF.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CHARITY ARE TO PROMOTE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF MERSEYSIDE AND ITS SURROUNDING AREA ANY CHARITABLE PURPOSE WHICH ENHANCES THE POTENTIAL AND QUALITY OF LIFE FOR THOSE WHO ARE DISADVANTAGED FROM SOCIETY BY REASON OF POVERTY, SPECIAL NEEDS OR OTHER CIRCUMSTANCES BY ANY OF THE FOLLOWING MEANS: 3.1 THE PRESERVATION AND PROTECTION OF GOOD HEALTH 3.2 THE RELIEF OF POVERTY, HARDSHIP AND DISTRESS AMONGST THOSE IN NECESSITOUS CIRCUMSTANCES 3.3 THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION ANDTHE PROVISION OF FREE ADVICE AND ASSISTANCE ON WELFARE BENEFITS, HOUSING PROBLEMS, DEBT AND ENERGY EFFICIENCY 3.4 THE ADVANCEMENT OF SUCH CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS ARE BENEFICIAL TO THE COMMUNITY IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT

name: BRITISH SUPPORTERS OF EPHRAT/YCL
activities: Makes grants to Israeli charity offering help, advice and financial aid to pregnant women considering abortion.
objects: 2.2.1 THE RELIEF FROM POVERTY; AND 2.2.2 THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION;

name: OPTIONS WELLBEING TRUST
activities: ADVICE INFORMATION & COUNSELLING FOR  A WIDE RANGE OF ISSUES INCLUDING CONCERNED 'OTHER'S ' SPECIALISING IN  ADDICTIONS  particularly Alcohol and Gambling. Counselling for anyone suffering from Psychological and Emotional distress; employment and relationship problems  etc etc . Training & Development for individuals and organisations
objects: PRIMARILY IN THE COUNTY OF HAMPSHIRE:  I) TO PRESERVE AND PROTECT MENTAL HEALTH BY THE PROVISION OF A COUNSELLING SERVICE TO ALL SECTIONS OF THE COMMUNITY WHO ARE SUFFERING FROM PSYCHOLOGICAL OR EMOTIONAL DISTRESS,EMPLOYMENT OR RELATIONSHIP PROBLEMS AND PARTICULARLY PROBLEMS RELATING TO ADDICTIONS;  II) TO PROMOTE, PRESERVE AND PROTECT PHYSICAL AND MENTAL GOOD HEALTH IN THE WORKPLACE BY THE PROVISION OF TRAINING, EDUCATION AND A COUNSELLING SERVICE FOR BOTH EMPLOYERS AND EMPLOYEES;  III) TO PROVIDE EDUCATION AND TRAINING FOR THOSE INVOLVED IN COUNSELLING; AND,  IV) TO CONDUCT STUDY AND RESEARCH IN TO METHODS OF COUNSELLING AND IN PARTICULAR COGNITIVE BEHAVIOURAL THERAPY (CBT) AND TO PUBLISH THE RESULTS OF SUCH STUDY AND RESEARCH.

name: THE NEWCASTLE UPON TYNE CHURCH OF ENGLAND INSTITUTE TRUST
activities: The advancement of Christian learning and education through libraries & resource centres, and to promote religion and education within the diocese of Newcastle consistent with the Christian faith. Also to provide opportunities for recreation and refreshment to employees, officers & licence-holders within the diocese of Newcastle.
objects: THE TRUSTEES SHALL HOLD THE TRUST FUND AND ITS INCOME UPON TRUST TO APPLY THEM FOR THE FOLLOWING OBJECT ("THE OBJECT") IN THE ANGLICAN DIOCESE OF NEWCASTLE ("THE AREA OF BENEFIT"):- TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE ADVANCEMENT OF CHRISTIAN LEARNING AND EDUCATION IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY THROUGH LIBRARIES RESOURCE CENTRES AND SIMILAR INSTITUTIONS AND BY MEANS OF SPONSORED LECTURES AND RESEARCH.NG THAT SUCH GROUPS OFFER OPPORTUNITIES FOR ALL CHILDREN REGARDLESS OF RACE, CULTURE, RELIGION OR MEANS 3.2)ENCOURAGING THE STUDY OF THE NEEDS OF SUCH CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES AND PROMOTING PUBLIC INTEREST IN AND RECOGNITION OF SUCH NEEDS IN THE LOCAL AREAS 3.3) INSTIGATING AND ADHERING TO AND FURTHERING THE AIM OF THE PRE-SCHOOL LEARNING ALLIANCE.

name: HORN OF AFRICA HUMAN RIGHTS AND REHABILITATION FORUM
activities: ++Â++º+-ª	Provision of information and advice on welfare benefits ++Â++º+-ª	Assessment with form-filling, providing translation and interpretation services . ++Â++º+-ª	Enabling clients to access health and social services ++Â++º+-ª	Organising seminars, workshops meetings and conferences  ++Â++º+-ª	Collecting and disseminating information to raise awareness of human rights issues     in the Horn of Africa.
objects: 1. THE RELIEF OF PERSONS WHO ARE IN CHARITABLE NEED, WHETHER BECAUSE OF POVERTY , OLD AGE OR PHYSICAL OR MENTAL ILLNESS BY THE PROVISION OF ADVICE AND INFORMATION, FINANCIAL AID, EDUCATIONAL OR REHABILITATIONAL ASSISTANCE, 2. THE PROMOTION OF HUMAN RIGHTS FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC BY:-  (A) RELIEVING THE CHARITABLE NEEDS OF VICTIMS OF HUMAN RIGHTS ABUSES; AND (B) RAISING AWARENESS OF AND ADVANCING THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC ABOUT HUMAN RIGHTS AND HUMAN RIGHTS ABUSES THROUGH THE USE OF THE PUBLICATIONS, HOLDING LECTURES, SEMINARS AND CONFERENCES, PROVIDED THAT THIS DOES NOT EXTEND TO PROMOTING DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY A CHANGE IN THE LAW OR GOVERNMENT POLICY OR THE ADMINISTRATIVE DECISIONS OF GOVERNMENT AUTHORITIES. "HUMAN RIGHTS" IS DEFINEDAS MEANING THOSE HUMAN RIGHTS SET OUT IN THE UNIVERSAL DECLARATION OF HUMAN RIGHTS ADOPTED AS RESOLUTION 217A (III) BY THE UNITED NATIONS GENERAL ASSEMBLY ON 10 DECEMBER 1948. 3. THE PROVISION OF RECREATIONAL FACILITIES PROVIDED IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR THE PUBLIC AT LARGE OR PERSONS WHO BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH , AGE, INFIRMITY OR DISABLEMENT, POVERTY OR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES ARE IN NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES.

name: THE HUDDERSFIELD CHORAL SOCIETY
activities: Performance of choral music.
objects: TO PROMOTE CHORAL MUSIC AND, FOR THE PURPOSES OF THAT OBJECTIVE, TO FORM AND MAINTAIN A CHOIR, A YOUTH CHOIR AND A YOUNG VOICES' CHOIR AND TO PROMOTE THE STUDY, PRACTICE AND PERFORMANCE OF CHORAL WORKS AND TO GIVE CONCERTS IN HUDDERSFIELD AND AT SUCH OTHER PLACE OR PLACES IN THE UNITED KINGDOM OF GREAT BRITAIN AND NORTHERN IRELAND AND ELSEWHERE AS MAY BE DETERMINED BY THE COMMITTEE OF THE SOCIETY FROM TIME TO TIME

name: PLYMOUTH MUSIC ZONE LIMITED
activities: PMZ's an award winning charity using music to reach out and transform the lives of some of the most disadvantaged children, young people and vulnerable adults. Music Leaders deliver music workshops and training using music as a tool to reduce social isolation and improve the emotional wellbeing and interpersonal skills of many of the most marginalised groups, including the elderly and disabled.
objects: TO PROMOTE, MAINTAIN, IMPROVE AND ADVANCE EDUCATION BY THE ENCOURAGEMENT OF THE ARTS INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, THE ARTS OF DRAMA, MIME, DANCE, SINGING AND MUSIC.

name: THE AFGHAN DOSTI SOCIETY
activities: The issuing of "Mahabbat" newsletter on a regular basis. Organisation of multiple cultural events throughout the year. ADS, beside other Afghan societies in the UK are in cooperation and try to be beneficial to their members as well as all of the Afghan community.
objects: (1) TO RELIEVE THOSE PERSONS WHO ARE IN NEED BY REASON OF FINANCIAL HARDSHIP, SICKNESS AND DISTRESS, BY PROVIDING INFORMATION, ADVICE AND GUIDANCE FOR SUCH PERSONS;  (2) TO ADVANCE EDUCATION TO RAISE THE ACHIEVEMENT OF AFGHAN PUPILS AND STUDENTS ATTENDING SCHOOLS AND COLLEGES IN KENSINGTON AND CHELSEA AND NEIGHBOURING BOROUGHS (3) TO PROVIDE FACILITATES FOR RECREATIONAL AND OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION FOR THE PUBLIC IRRESPECTIVE OF THE ETHNIC ORIGIN, GENDER OR RELIGIOUS BELIEF IN THE INTEREST OFSOCIAL WELFARE AND WITH THE OBJECT OF  IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE OF THE SAID PERSON

name: THE CLUSTER CARE GROUP
activities: Day centre, one day per week, to help & support, elderly/older people, to bring them together for company, friendship and activities.
objects: THE RELIEF OF THE AGED PEOPLE FROM THE VILLAGES OF CROPREDY, CLAYDON, HANWELL, GREAT BOURTON, LITTLE BOURTON, MOLLINGTON AND WARDINGTON IN ANY MANNER WHICH NOW IS OR HERE AFTER MAY  BE DEEMED BY LAW TO BE CHARITABLE IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY THE PROVISION OF A DAY CENTRE.

name: DUDLEY STROKE ASSOCIATION
activities: To provide help advice, support, information to people who have suffered a stroke & family and friends. To raise awareness into stroke and its effects & how to reduce the risk. Promote setting up of groups to help people & their family/carer.
objects: TO PROMOTE THE RELIEF OF PERSONS WHO ARE IN NEED AFTER A STROKE AND THEIR CARERS THROUGH THE PROVISION OF ADVICE, INFORMATION, EDUCATION AND SUPPORT.

name: THE BARNABAS SPORTS TRUST
activities: The Cockington Capers Cross Country run with permission & help from the Torbay Coast & Countryside Trust.  The continuing development of the Barnabas Sports Trust Soccer School. Integration of a new academy.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN RELIGION ESPECIALLY IN AND THROUGH SPORT AND IN PARTICULAR (BUT WITHOUT LIMITATION) FOOTBALL.

name: SNOW-CAMP
activities: Snow-Camp is a youth charity established in 2003 to provide disadvantaged young people from London's inner-city areas with the chance to experience skiing and snowboarding combined with a life-skills course designed to enable young people attending to reflect on the key issues that impact on their lives.
objects: TO HELP AND EDUCATE YOUNG PEOPLE THROUGH THE PROVISION LEISURE TIME ACTIVITIES IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY SNOWSPORTS SO AS TO DEVELOP THEIR PHYSICAL AND MENTAL CAPACITIES SO THAT THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE MAY IMPROVE, AND BY PROVIDING SUPPORT AND ACTIVITIES WHICH DEVELOP THEIR SKILLS, CAPACITIES AND CAPABILIITES TO ENABLE THEM TO PARTICIPATE IN SOCIETY AS INDEPENDENT, MATURE AND RESPONSIBLE INDIVIDUALS.?

name: BUSY BEES NURSERY & PRE SCHOOL LIMITED
activities: Childcare & Education for Children aged between 3 months and 5 years
objects: TO ENHANCE THE DEVELOPMENT AND EDUCATION OF CHILDREN PRIMARILY UNDER STATUTORY SCHOOL AGE BY ENCOURAGING PARENTS TO UNDERSTAND AND PROVIDE FOR THE NEEDS OF THEIR CHILDREN THROUGH COMMUNITY GROUPS AND BY:- 1. OFFERING APPROPRIATE PLAY, EDUCATION AND CARE FACILITIES AND TRAINING COURSES, TOGETHER WITH THE RIGHT OF PARENTS TO TAKE RESPONSIBILITY FOR AND TO BECOME INVOLVED IN THE ACTIVITIES OF SUCH GROUPS, ENSURING THAT SUCH GROUPS OFFER OPPORTUNITIES FOR ALL CHILDREN WHATEVER THEIR RACE, CULTURE, RELIGION, MEANS OR ABILITY; 2. ENCOURAGING THE STUDY OF THE NEEDS OF SUCH CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES AND PROMOTING PUBLIC INTEREST IN AND RECOGNITION OF SUCH NEEDS; 3. INSTIGATING AND ADHERING TO AND FURTHERING THE AIMS AND OBJECTS OF THE PRE-SCHOOL LEARNING ALLIANCE.

name: RESPONSE ORGANISATION
activities: The principal activities are the provision of accommodation, care and support in community based settings in the Thames Valley for people with enduring mental health needs. The charity provides services in the following general categories: Supported tenancies, Adult care homes, Domiciliary Care services
objects: THE CHARITY'S OBJECTS ("THE OBJECTS") ARE:  (1) TO RELIEVE SERVICE USERS AND FORMER SERVICE USERS OF NHS AND OTHER MENTAL HEALTH HOSPITALS AND UNITS AND OTHER PERSONS IN THE COMMUNITY WITH MENTAL HEALTH NEEDS WHO ARE SICK, CONVALESCENT, DISABLED, HANDICAPPED, INFIRM OR IN NEED OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE ("THE USERS") IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY PROVIDING OR ASSISTING IN THE PROVISION OF HOSTELS, GROUP AND REGISTERED CARE HOMES AND OTHER FORMS OF ACCOMMODATION, DAY CENTRES, AMENITIES, FACILITIES, BUILDINGS AND EQUIPMENT FOR THE SUPPORT OF THE USERS AND THE EFFICIENT OPERATION OF THE HOSPITALS AND POST-HOSPITAL CARE;  (2) TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN ALL MATTERS RELATING TO HOSPITALS, HOSPITAL MANAGEMENT AND MENTAL HEALTH ANDTO PROMOTE RESEARCH AND THE DISSEMINATION OF THE USEFUL RESULTS OF SUCH RESEARCH; AND  (3) TO FURTHER SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE USERS AS THE TRUSTEES SEE FIT FROM TIME TO TIME.

name: THE ROTARY CLUB OF BRAINTREE RIVERS TRUST FUND
activities: General Charity
objects: FOR RELIEF OF POOR AND NEEDY OR SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS THE CLUB SHALL IN DULY CONSTITUTED MEETING FROM TIME TO TIME DETERMINE.

name: HARRISON HOUSING
activities: Relief of the aged poor by provision of housing and associated amenities and management of other almshouse charities
objects: (1) THE RELIEF OF THE AGED POOR AND IN PARTICULAR, BUT WITHOUT PREJUDICE TO THE GENERALITY OF THE FORGOING, BY THE PROVISION OF HOUSING AND ASSOCIATED AMENITIES; AND  (2) SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS THE TRUSTEES (AS DEFINED IN THE ARTICLES OF ASSOCIATION OF THE COMPANY) SHALL FROM TIME TO TIME DECIDE.

name: ORIGINAL CLUB
activities: Teaching and training of young adult and children in the art of martial art, teaching them self discipline, self defence, self confidence and self control in the communities where located in deprive area.
objects: TO PROMOTE COMMUNITY PARTICIPATION IN HEALTHY RECREATION , IN PARTICULAR BY THE PROVISION OF TRAINING AND FACILITIES FOR TAEKWONDO AND OTHER SPORTS

name: THE ROYAL DRAWING SCHOOL
activities: To facilitate and promote the practice of drawing from observation; we believe that this is crucial for all aspects of visual learning, thinking and practice. We aim to fill a gap left by the steady erosion of observational drawing from the study of art in higher education and in schools by offering tuition and resources to art students, artists, children and the public.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CHARITY ARE SUCH PURPOSES AS ARE CHARITABLE UNDER THE LAW OF ENGLAND AND WALES AND IN PARTICULAR (BUT WITHOUT LIMITATION) THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN THE ARTS OF DRAWING, PAINTING, FINE ART, SCULPTURE, PRINT MAKING, FASHION AND DESIGN.

name: SEARCH AND RESCUE ASSISTANCE IN DISASTERS
activities: We are a specialist disaster response and humanitarian assistance charity that supports both domestic and international communities in times of need affected by disasters natural and man-made. We train and equip dedicated volunteers and members of the public to provide assistance and support to the emergency services
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CHARITY ARE, FOR PUBLIC BENEFIT:-    UPON RECEIPT OF A REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE, TO PROVIDE;  3.1 RELIEF AND ASSISTANCE TO PEOPLE IN ANY PART OF THE WORLD WHO ARE VICTIMS OF ANY DISASTER NATURAL OR MAN-MADE OR CATASTROPHE THROUGH THE RAPID DEPLOYMENT OF VOLUNTEER PERSONNEL SUITABLY TRAINED AND EQUIPPED IN DISASTER RESPONSE TO PROVIDE, BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY; URBAN SEARCH AND RESCUE, HUMANITARIAN AID AND DISASTER RELIEF BETWEEN THE MOMENT A DISASTER OR CATASTROPHE OCCURS AND THE POINT AT WHICH CONVENTIONAL DISASTER RELIEF ORGANISATIONS ARE ABLE TO RESPOND, AND ON AN ON-GOING BASIS.    3.2 DISASTER RISK REDUCTION, PREPAREDNESS TRAINING AND MITIGATION INTERVENTIONS; AND TO TRAIN VOLUNTEERS TO FORM RESPONSE TEAMS IN ANY PART OF THE WORLD AFFECTED OR AT RISK FROM DISASTERS.    3.3 RELIEF AND ASSISTANCE TO PEOPLE IN THE UNITED KINGDOM WHO ARE THE VICTIMS OF ANY DISASTER NATURAL OR MAN-MADE OR CATASTROPHE BY PROVIDING VOLUNTEER PERSONNEL REFERRED TO IN ARTICLE 3.1 TO SUPPORT WHERE NEEDED TO RESPONSES OF THE EMERGENCY SERVICES AND OTHER NATIONAL AND REGIONAL ORGANISATIONS TO SUCH OCCURRENCES.    3.4 THE ADVANCEMENT OF COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT AND RESILIENCE BY PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES FOR VOLUNTEERS TO HELP MEET THE NEEDS OF LOCAL COMMUNITIES IN THE UNITED KINGDOM, AS IDENTIFIED BY AND IN CO-OPERATION WITH THE EMERGENCY SERVICES AND VOLUNTARY ORGANISATIONS, AND IN DOING SO, TO ALSO PROVIDE VOLUNTEERS WITH THE OPPORTUNITIES TO ACQUIRE, PRACTICE AND GAIN CONFIDENCE IN THE SKILLS REQUIRED TO CARRY OUT THE PURPOSES REFERRED TO IN ARTICLE 3.3    3.5 PROTECT AND PRESERVE LIFE

name: ISLAMIC NETWORK
activities: Our aim is to empower and support Mosques to provide a service that engages and nurtures young people of faith and no faith in their community. We do this through a range of community, networking and leadership development activities.
objects: THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE ISLAMIC RELIGION

name: MIND IN MID HERTS
activities: The main aim of Mind is to improve the life of anyone experiencing mental health difficulties.  In liaison with various other statutory and voluntary agencies, we aim to enable our service users to lead a healthier, happier, more independent life.
objects: TO PROMOTE THE PRESERVATION AND THE SAFEGUARDING OF MENTAL HEALTH AND TO ASSIST IN RELIEVING AND REHABILITATING PERSONS SUFFERING FROM MENTAL DISORDER OR CONDITIONS OF EMOTIONAL OR MENTAL DISTRESS REQUIRING ADVICE OR TREATMENT IN ASSOCIATION WITH MIND(THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION FOR MENTAL HEALTH) ("NATIONAL MIND") IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE AIMS AND OBJECTS OF NATIONAL MIND

name: SOMALI EDUCATION & CULTURAL DEVELOPMENT PROJECT
activities: 1. Youth activities and outings trips 2. Supplementary Education 3. Educational and cultural events 4. Information and resource centre
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF SOMALIS PRIMARILY CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE AGED 5 TO 17 BY THE PROVISION OF A SUPPLEMENTARY SCHOOL AND TRAINING COURSES FOR ALL AGES. THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR RECREATION  AND LEISURE ACTIVITIES FOR SOMALI PEOPLE WHOHAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES BY REASON OF THEIR AGE INFIRMITY OR DISABLEMENT, POVERTY OR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE.

name: EIRIOL
activities: Eiriol provides a range of appropriate independent, dedicated advocacy services using trained advocates.
objects: TO RELIEVE THE EFFECTS OF MENTAL HEALTH PROBLEMS AMONGST PEOPLE LIVING IN WALES, IN PARTICULAR WEST WALES, THROUGH THE PROVISION OF A COMPREHENSIVE, INDEPENDENT ADVOCACY SERVICE.

name: MERSEYSIDE EMPLOYMENT LAW LIMITED
activities: 1.  Specialist advice,casework and advocacy to individuals in the areas of Employment Law & Discrimination law. 2.   Advice, training and support to community & voluntary sector organisations in the areas of Employment Law, Discrimination Law and Human Resources. 3.  Provision of Volunteering whereby individuals can gain skills, knowledge, training and improved employment opportunities.
objects: THE PROMOTION OF ANY CHARITABLE PURPOSE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE COMMUNITY IN THE AREA OF MERSEYSIDE AND IN PARTICULAR TO:  1. RELIEVE POVERTY BY THE PROVISION OF ADVICE AND ADVOCACY IN EMPLOYMENT AND DISCRIMINATION LAW TO THOSE PERSONS OTHERWISE UNABLE TO ACCESS SUCH ADVICE AND ADVOCACY.  2. PROMOTE THE EFFICIENCY AND EFFECTIVENESS OF CHARITIES BY THE PROVISION OF ADVICE AND TRAINING IN EMPLOYMENT AND DISCRIMINATION LAW.  3. ADVANCE EDUCATION BY IMPROVING THE KNOWLEDGE OF EMPLOYMENT AND DISCRIMINATION LAW AND ITS OPERATION OF PERSONS RESIDENT OR EMPLOYED IN MERSEYSIDE.

name: YMCA NORFOLK TRUST PROPERTY
activities: Owns the property used to accommodate and support homeless people
objects: FOR SUCH PURPOSES AS SHALL BE CONSISTENT WITH THE OBJECTS OF THE NORWICH YOUNG MENS CHRISTIAN ASSOCIATION SO LONG AS THE SAID ASSOCIATION SHALL ENDEAVOUR TO PROMOTE THE SPIRITUAL MENTAL AND PHYSICAL IMPROVEMENT OF YOUNG MEN AND SO LONG AS NOTHING INCONSISTENT WITH THE CHRISTIAN RELIGION SHALL BE TAUGHT OR ENCOURAGED.

name: BURY LAKE YOUNG MARINERS LIMITED
activities: Bury Lake Young Mariners is committed to the development of young people through the medium of sailing and other water based sports.
objects: (A) TO ORGANISE, PROVIDE OR ASSIST IN THE ORGANISATION AND PROVISION OF FACILITIES WHICH WILL ENABLE AND ENCOURAGE PUPILS OF SCHOOLS, UNIVERSITY AND YOUTH GROUPS IN HERTFORDSHIRE AND THE SURROUNDING AREA TO SAIL OR PLAY OTHER GAMES AND SPORTS AND THEREBY TO ASSIST IN ENSURING THAT DUE ATTENTION IS GIVEN TO THE PHYSICAL EDUCATION AND DEVELOPMENT OF SUCH PUPILS AS WELL AS TO THE DEVELOPMENT AND OCCUPATION OF THEIR MINDS, AND WITH A VIEW OF FURTHERING THE ABOVE OBJECTS: (I) TO PROVIDE OR ASSIST IN THE PROVISION OF SAILING, GAMES OR SPORTS EQUIPMENT OF EVERY KIND FOR THE USE OF SUCH PUPILS AS AFORESAID (II) TO PROVIDE OR ASSIST IN THE PROVISION OF COURSES, LECTURES, DEMONSTRATIONS AND COACHING FOR PUPILS OF SCHOOLS AND THE UNIVERSITIES IN THE AREAOF BENEFIT AND TO PROVIDE THE SAME FOR TEACHERS WHO ORGANISE OR SUPERVISE SAILING, PLAYING AND COACHING OF SAILING AND OTHER GAMES OR SPORTS AT SUCH SCHOOLS AND UNIVERSITIES AS AFORESAID (III) TO PLAN, LAY OUT, MANGE, EQUIP, MAINTAIN OR ASSIST IN THEPLANNING, LAYING OUT, MANAGING, EQUIPMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF APPROPRIATE ACCOMMODATION AND OTHER FACILITIES TO BE USED FOR THE TEACHING AND LEARNING OF SAILING OR THE TEACHING AND PLAYING OF OTHER SPORTS AND GAMES BY SUCH PUPILS AS AFORESAID.  (B) TOORGANISE, PROVIDE OR ASSIST IN THE ORGANISATION OR THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR PHYSICAL RECREATION IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT (WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR BOYS AND GIRLS UNDER THE AGE OF24 YEARS AND WHO, BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, SOCIAL  OR ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES.

name: BRISTOL BAPTIST COLLEGE
activities: Delivering religious education and training to those preparing for Ministry (generally but not exclusively in the Baptist denomination), to others furthering their theological education and to those preparing for service in Children, Families and Youth Ministry (both Christian and secular based). Providing a Christian resource centre for study and development.
objects: TO PROMOTE THE RELIGIOUS EDUCATION OF PERSONS (PARTICULARLY BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY THOSE PROFESSING THEMSELVES TO BE BAPTISTS) TO ENABLE THEM TO EXERCISE THEIR GIFTS WITH THE GREATER USEFULNESS IN THE CHRISTIAN MINISTRY.

name: RAYS OF SUNSHINE
activities: Granting wishes for seriously and terminally ill children between the ages of 3-18 throughout the United Kingdom
objects: TO RELIEVE THE SUFFERING AND NEEDS  OF CHILDREN AND YOUNG ADULTS WHO HAVE ILLNESSES OR DISABILITIES CAUSING LIMITED LIFE EXPECTANCY OR WHO SUFFER FROM LONG TERM PHYSICAL OR MENTAL DISABILITIES (INCLUDING LEARNING DIFFICULTIES).

name: THE GARDEN GATE
activities: To provide a garden or gardens for recreational, educational or therapeutic use for residents of Barnoldswick and the surrounding area; to help the well-being of people with needs,  to offer other volunteer activities to maintain and develop the project for the benefit of the community..
objects: 1.  TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION AND PROMOTE THE WELFARE OF PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES IN BARNOLDSWICK AND SURROUND AREA, PRIMARILY BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY THE PROVISION OF SKILLED TRAINING AND FACILITATION TO ENABLE THEM TO DEVELOP THEIR MENTAL, PHYSICAL AND SPIRITUAL CAPACITY THAT THEY MAY FULLY REALISE THEIR FULL POTENTIAL AS INDIVIDUALS AND MEMBERS OF SOCIETY AND SO THAT THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE MAY BE IMPROVED. 2.  FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC IN THE AREA STATED ABOVE, IN AN EFFORT TO ADVANCE EDUCATION, AND IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE, TO PROVIDE A GARDEN, OR GARDENS, FOR RECREATIONAL, EDUCATIONAL OR THERAPEUTIC USE WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR THE SAID INHABITANTS.

name: THE PARSON CROSS COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT FORUM
activities: The Charity  provides an advice/information sign posting service to residents living in its area of benefit, also provides and supports activities that improve peoples health, well being and quality of life The Charity also acts as an umbrella organisation to ensure residents are consulted in the many regeneration and re-devolopment plans in the area.
objects: THE PROMOTION FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT OF COMMUNITY REGENERATION IN AREAS OF SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC DEPRIVATION OF NORTH SHEFFIELD IN THE COUNTY OF SOUTH YORKSHIRE, AND IN PARTICULAR THE NEIGHBOURHOODS OF NEW AND OLD PARSON CROSS, BY ALL OR ANY OF THE FOLLOWING MEANS:  PROVIDED THAT SUCH POWERS SHALL NOT EXTEND TO RELIEVING ANY LOCAL AUTHORITY OR OTHER BODIES OF A STATUTORY DUTY. 1.  THE RELIEF OF POVERTY IN SUCH WAYS AS MAY BE THOUGHT FIT. 2.  THE ADVANCEMENT OF TRAINING AND EDUCATION, PARTICULARLYAMONGST THOSE WHO SEEK TO ACCESS JOBS OR FURTHER AND OR HIGHER EDUCATION. 3.  THE PROVISION OF ASSISTANCE AND OR MAINTENANCE OF CARE SERVICES FOR DEPENDENTS, SUCH AS ELDERLY RELATIVES OR CHILDREN, TO THOSE ENTERING EMPLOYMENT OR EDUCATION OR TRAINING, IN CIRCUMSTANCES OF FINANCIAL OR OTHER CHARITABLE NEED. 4.  THE CREATION OF OPPORTUNITIES FOR EMPLOYMENT AND SELF-EMPLOYMENT AND TO PROMOTE AND PROVIDE BUILDINGS, LAND AND FACILITIES ON SUCH TERMS AS ARE NECESSARY FOR THE NURTURING OF SELF-SUSTAINABLE ACTIVITIES. 5.  THE PROVISION OF GRANTS AND LOANS TO ORGANISATIONS HAVING SIMILAR CHARITABLE PURPOSES FOR THE SOCIAL WELFARE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF THE SAID AREAS. 6.  THE PROVISION OF SUITABLE HOUSING FOR THOSE WHO ARE IN NEED, PARTICULARLY FOR ELDERLY AND DISABLED, AND TO MAKE ADAPTATIONS AND IMPROVEMENTS TO HOUSING IN PUBLIC OR CHARITABLE OWNERSHIP. 7.  THE MAINTENANCE AND IMPROVEMENT AND OR PROVISION OF PUBLIC AMENITIES, SUCH AS PARKS AND GARDENS, PUBLIC MEETING ROOMS, SPORTS GROUNDS, LEISURE FACILITIES, INFORMATION POINTS, STREET SIGNS AND STREET FURNITURE, AND SIMILAR PUBLIC SPACE AMENITY. 8.  THE PROVISION OF RECREATIONAL FACILITIES FOR THE PUBLIC ANT LARGE OR THOSE WHO BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, AGE, INFIRMITY, OR DISABLEMENT, POVERTY OR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES, HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES. 9.  THE PROTECTION OR CONSERVATION OF THE ENVIRONMENT. 10. THE PROMOTION AND PROVISION OF OPPORTUNITIES AND FACILITIES THAT IMPROVE AND MAINTAIN PUBLIC HEALTH. 11. SUCH OTHER MEANS AS MAY FROM TIME TO TIME BE DETERMINED, SUBJECT TO THE PRIOR CONSENT OF THE CHARITY COMMISSIONERS FOR ENGLAND AND WALES.

name: CON BRIO
activities: Giving charity concerts. Holding various fund raising events
objects: A.  THE STUDY AND PRACTICE OF CHORAL MUSIC IN ORDER TO FOSTER PUBLIC KNOWLEDGE AND APPRECIATION OF SUCH MUSIC BY MEANS OF PUBLIC PERFORMANCE.  B.  TO ASSIST AND SUPPORT SUCH CHARITABLE INSTITUTIONS OR PURPOSES AS THE COMMITTEE SHALL FROM TIME TO TIME DETERMINE.

name: AL-MARKAZUL-ILMI
activities: The object and activities of the trust are to establish and operate an institution for the advancement of education in both secular and the Islamic faith.
objects: 1.  THE NAME OF THE TRUST IS AL-MARKAZUL-ILMI.  2.  THE OBJECTS OF THE TRUST ARE TO ADVANCE EDUCATION IN BOTH SECULAR AND THE ISLAMIC FAITH.  3.  THE TRUSTEES MUST USE THE INCOME (AND MAY USE THE CAPITAL) OF THE TRUST IN PROMOTING THE OBJECTS.

name: THE TREVETHIN FESTIVALS CHARITY
activities: TFC arranges, creates and promotes Festivals and events, artistc, musical, cultural and craft workshops and groups to be continually developing resource for the Community and the wider Valley neighbourhood in the County Borough of Torfaen in South Wales. Our team are all volunteers.
objects: FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE GENERAL POPULATION OF TREVETHIN, ST CADOC'S, PENYGARN AND THE WIDER NEIGHBOURHOOD, IN THE COUNTY OF TORFAEN ("THE INHABITANTS") AS THE ORGANISATION AND MANAGEMENT TEAM SEE FIT IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE FOREGOING BY:  (A)  ADVANCING PUBLIC EDUCATION IN THE ARTS (IN ALL THEIR FORMS) INCLUDING THE ARRANGEMENT, CREATION AND PROMOTION OF FESTIVALS AND OTHER ARTISTIC EVENTS; AND  (B)  PROMOTING FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE SAID INHABITANTS THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION OF INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES BE REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, AGE, INFIRMITY OR DISABLEMENT, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES OR FOR THE THE PUBLIC AT LARGE IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE AND WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE OF THE SAID INHABITANTS.

name: BASINGSTOKE AMATEUR OPERATIC SOCIETY
activities: Operatic Society
objects: TO PROMOTE, IMPROVE, DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN PUBLIC EDUCATION IN AN APPRECIATION OF ART AND SCIENCE IN ALL ASPECTS BY THE PRESENTATION OF MUSICAL PRODUCTIONS FOR THE GENERAL PURPOSES IF SUCH CHARITABLE BODIES OR FOR SUCH PURPOSES AS SHALL BE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE AS THE TRUSTEES FROM TIME TO TIME DECIDE.

name: RURAL COMMUNITY RESPONDERS
activities: RESPONDING TO LIFE THREATENING EMERGENCY CALLS WHEN REQUIRED TO BY THE EAST OF ENGLAND AMBULANCE SERVICE. AIDING & EDUCATING THE COMMUNITY ON THE IMPORTANCE OF BASIC LIFE SUPPORT.
objects: 1.  TO RELIEVE PERSONS SUFFERING INJURY OR ILLNESS, IN THE AREA COVERED BY SUFFOLK COASTAL DISTRICT COUNCIL OR IN ANY OTHER AREA AGREED, BY THE PROVISION OF AN EMERGENCY MEDICAL CARE, INCLUDING THE NECESSARY EQUIPMENT IN SUPPORT OF THE AMBULANCE SERVICE.  2.  TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN FIRST AID, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY THE PROVISION OF TRAINING IN THE PRINCIPLES AND PRACTICES OF FIRST AID.

name: PRO LABORE DEI
activities: Care for the poorest of the poor, the homeless, abandoned orphans, aged poor, widows, lonely, spiritually poor etc. by feeding, clothing, educating, sheltering, or providing vocational training, care for the lepers, blind, deaf & dumb as well as accident victims.  We also hope to develop within the community at large respect for those who are destitute and a sense of responsibility towards them
objects: 1. THE RELIEF OF POVERTY, SICKNESS AND DISTRESS IN SUCH PARTS OF THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES THINKS FIT, PARTICULARLY BUT NOT LIMITED TO, OYO STATE, NIGERIA.  2. TO FURTHER THE EDUCATION (INCLUDING VOCATIONAL TRAINING AND WORK RELATED TRAINING) OF POOR FAMILIES, WITH THE SPECIFIC PURPOSE OF HELPING THEM TO BECOME SELF-RELIANT AND SELF SUPPORTING WORKING FAMILIES.  3. TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN RELIGION AND IN PARTICULAR CATHOLICISM THROUGH SUCH ACTIVATES AS PRAYER, MASSES AND OTHER SUCH SERVICES.

name: DONTCHEV FOUNDATION
activities: The Foundation provides grants to students attending UK universities as well as universities abroad. Dontchev Foundation sponsors the construction of new building of school complex including kindergarden, primary school, junior high-school, high-school and a sports center named "Bulgarsko Shkolo".
objects: TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND RELIEVE POVERTY AND TO PROMOTE SUCH OTHER PURPOSES AS ARE NOW OR MAY HEREAFTER BE DEEMED BY ENGLISH LAW TO BE CHARITABLE

name: RIPPLE AFRICA
activities: RIPPLE Africa aims to improve the standard of education and healthcare, to preserve and sustainably develop the environment, and to create opportunities for the local community around Mwaya on the northern lakeshore of Lake Malawi. We provide a hand up, not a hand out.
objects: 1. TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF CHILDREN IN MALAWI AND GREATER AFRICA IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE PROVISION OF SCHOOLS, VOLUNTEER TEACHING ASSISTANTS, EQUIPMENT;  2. TO PRESERVE AND PROTECT THE GOOD HEALTH OF PEOPLE IN MALAWI AND GREATER AFRICA;  3. TO PRESERVE AND PROTECT THE ENVIRONMENT IN MALAWI AND GREATER AFRICA, AND TO PROMOTE BETTER METHODS OF AGRICULTURE AND MANAGEMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES;  4. TO RELIEVE POVERTY BY HELPING PEOPLE IN MALAWI AND GREATER AFRICA TO START THEIR OWN SUSTAINABLE BUSINESSES.

name: CONGOLESE WOMEN'S TABITHA ASSOCIATION
activities: advocacy/advice/information Interpreting/Translation service
objects: TO RELIEVE NEED AMONGST IMMIGRANTS AND REFUGEES, PARTICULARLY FRENCH SPEAKING REFUGEES, BY THE PROVISION OF ADVICE, ADVOCACY, INFORMATION AND TRANSLATION SERVICES; TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH AND TO RELIEVE POVERTY, SUFFERING AND DISTRESS IN ACCORDANCE WITH CHRISTIAN PRINCIPLES.  (A) THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION  (B) THE RELIEF OF PERSONS WHO ARE IN CONDITIONS OF POVERTY, SICKNESS BY PROVIDING SUCH PERSONS WITH ADVICE, REPRESENTATION, TRANSLATION AND INTERPRETING SERVICES AND OTHER ASSISTANCE IN MATTERS SUCH AS MONEY DEBTS, WELFARE BENEFITS, HOUSING, HEALTH, EDUCATION, TRAINING AND EMPLOYMENT IN ORDER THAT THEY MAY PARTICIPATE FULLY IN SOCIETY

name: THE ROCK OF AGES CHRISTIAN ASSEMBLY TRUST
activities: We hold christian meetings where we teach christian values. We organise conferences on education and advise on medical issues.  We also provide assistance to the poor, sick and elderly.
objects: I THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE CHRISTIAN RELIGION BOTH IN THE UNITED KINGDOM AND OVERSEAS  II THE ADVANCEMENT FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT OF RELIGIOUS OR OTHER EDUCATION;  III THE RELIEF OF THE AGED POOR SICK OR DISABLED

name: MANCHESTER CARERS FORUM
activities: Manchester Carers Forum acts as a voice of carers in raising awareness of the challenges which face carers. We support carers through peer support networks and by bringing carers together to reduce isolation.  We work at a strategic partnership level with carers support networks, local government and healthcare commissioning to ensure carers get the best support possible.
objects: To relieve those who are sick elderly, disabled, handicapped or otherwise infirm by the provision of advice and support to Carers in Greater Manchester.  To advance the education of the public by raising awareness in all matters relating to the care of those who are sick, elderly, disabled, handicapped or otherwise infirm and their Carers.  To do all such other charitable things in the pursuit of the objects stated above.

name: MANCHESTER CARERS FORUM
activities: Manchester Carers Forum acts as a voice of carers in raising awareness of the challenges which face carers. We support carers through peer support networks and by bringing carers together to reduce isolation.  We work at a strategic partnership level with carers support networks, local government and healthcare commissioning to ensure carers get the best support possible.
objects: To relieve those who are sick elderly, disabled, handicapped or otherwise infirm by the provision of advice and support to Carers in Greater Manchester.  To advance the education of the public by raising awareness in all matters relating to the care of those who are sick, elderly, disabled, handicapped or otherwise infirm and their Carers.  To do all such other charitable things in the pursuit of the objects stated above.

name: WINSLOW ACTIVITY CLUB
activities: Winslow Activity Club is a small voluntary group who provide a limited but vital service to the profoundly physically and mentally disabled people in the Aylesbury area. Sessions include a range of activities such as, arts and crafts, aromatherapy and music.
objects: TO PRESERVE AND PROTECT THE HEALTH OF PERSONS SUFFERING FROM MENTAL OR PHYSICAL ILLNESS OF ANY DESCRIPTION OR IN NEED OF REHABILITATION AS A RESULT OF SUCH ILLNESS, BY THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES TO DEVELOP SELF-ADVOCACY, PERSONAL CHOICE AND SELF-AWARENESS.

name: ST KEW PLAYING FIELD TRUST
activities: Provides facilities for recreation and leisure activities for the inhabitants of St Kew Parish.
objects: TO PROVIDE FACILITIES FOR RECREATION AND LEISURE ACTIVITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE, FOR THE INHABITANTS OF THE PARISH OF ST KEW, WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF POLITICAL, RELIGIOUS OR OTHER OPINIONS, BY THE PROVISION AND MAINTENANCE OF A PLAYING FIELD

name: COVENANT LIFE CHURCH LEICESTER
activities: To promote the proclamation and furtherance of the Gospel of Jesus Christ Our Lord, the preaching and teaching of the Christian faith, and to support ministry at home and overseas. In addition, the charity seeks the relief of those in need, hardship and distress or who are aged or sick.
objects: (A)  THE PROCLAMATION AND FURTHERANCE OF THE GOSPEL OF GOD CONCERNING HIS SON JESUS CHRIST OUR LORD AND THE PREACHING AND TEACHING OF THE CHRISTIAN FAITH  (B) THE RELIEF OF PERSONS WHO ARE IN CONDITIONS OF NEED HARDSHIP AND DISTRESS OR WHO ARE AGED ORSICK.

name: THE ASHTON GROUP THEATRE
activities: The organisations objects and principal activities are to promote, maintain, improve and advance education of the public in the art of drama and the other arts and to encourage the development of drama though drama productions and educational workshop programmes.
objects: TO PROMOTE, MAINTAIN, IMPROVE AND ADVANCE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN THE ART OF DRAMA AND THE OTHER ARTS AND IN PARTICULAR TO ENCOURAGE AND FOSTER THE STUDY, PERFORMANCE, KNOWLEDGE UNDERSTANDING, APPRECIATION AND DEVELOPMENT OF DRAMA THROUGH THE MEDIUM OF DRAM PRODUCTIONS AND EDUCATIONAL WORKSHOP PROGRAMMES. ALSO TO ENCOURAGE THE ARTS OF DRAMA, MIME, DANCE, SONG, AND MUSIC, AND TO FORMULATE, PREPARE AND ESTABLISH SCHEMES THEREFOR, PROVIDED THAT ALL OBJECTS OF THE COMPANY SHALL BE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE.

name: KINGDOM CONCEPTS MINISTRIES
activities: The charity holds regular seminars, workshops and conferences that deal with many topics such as personal development, finance, health and issues facing our community.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATEMENT OF BELIEFS APPEARING IN THE SCHEDULE HERETO IN BIRMINGHAM AND IN SUCH OTHER PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT AND TO FULFIL SUCH OTHER PURPOSES WHICH ARE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE ACCORDING TO THE LAWS OF ENGLAND AND WALES AND ARE CONNECTED WITH THE CHARITABLE WORK OF THE CHARITY.

name: THE CROSS BARN ODIHAM
activities: The Cross Barn is a cultural and social hub for the inhabitants of Odiham and the surrounding area. The Barn can be hired  for a range of community activities eg talks, meetings, concerts, fitness sessions etc as well as private functions such as family celebrations. Increasingly the Barn is providing a range of entertainment eg cinema and other social events to the community.
objects: TO PROMOTE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF THE PARISH OF ODIHAM AND THE SURROUNDING AREA THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION OF INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, AGE, INFIRMITY OR DISABLEMENT, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES OR FOR THE PUBLIC AT LARGE IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE AND WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITION OF LIFE OF THE SAID INHABITANTS.

name: KENYA COMMUNITY SUPPORT NETWORK
activities: -Information Advice and guidance on issues such as Immigration, sexual health including HIV/AIDS, welfare benefit, housing, access to further education, training, and basic counselling
objects: (A) TO RELIEVE POVERTY, SICKNESS AND DISTRESS AMONG KENYANS AND OTHER KISWAHILI SPEAKERS RESIDENT IN THE UNITED KINGDOM AND KENYA.  (B) TO PROMOTE RESEARCH INTO THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE OF THE INHABITANTS OF KENYANS AND REFUGEES THEREFROM AND TO DISSEMINATE THE RESULT OF SUCH RESEARCH.

name: MOP FOUNDATION
activities: Established in 2004, MOP Foundation promotes Iranian art and culture to a wider audience outside of Iran, and strives to make a notable contribution to its long-term advancement worldwide.  This is accomplished by establishing programmes in modern and contemporary Iranian art, music, media and academia in partnership with world-class institutions.
objects: (A) TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN KNOWLEDGE AND UNDERSTANDING OF PERSIAN CULTURE AND PERSIANATE WORLD, AND  (B) FOR THE BENEFIT OF SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES OR CHARITABLE INSTITUTIONS IN ANY PART OF THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME IN THEIR DISCRETION THINK FIT.

name: WOODLEY PLAYERS THEATRE COMPANY
activities: Woodley Players Theatre Company perform a mix of plays and Gilbert and Sullivan operettas near to Woodley, Stockport, England, UK. The society aims to achieve the highest possible standards and over the last ten years has attracted high calibre actors, singers and musicians from a wide area, affording a warm welcome to all.
objects: TO PROMOTE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF STOCKPORT AND THE SURROUNDING AREA THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION OF INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, AGE, INFIRMITY ORDISABLEMENT, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR SOCIAL OR ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES OR FOR THE PUBLIC AT LARGE IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE AND WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITION OF LIFE OF SAID INHABITANTS.

name: RE BUILD (BURY)
activities: Collection of second hand furniture for redistribution to disadvantaged households. Sale of surplus reuseable furniture and bric-a-brac to people in financial hardship and the general public. Community Re-Paint scheme. Volunteering, training and work experience opportunities. Practical training workshops for disadvantaged individuals of all ages. Community development and partnership working.

activities: In accordance with the terms of the Trust , the available income is paid to named Hospice for the purposes specified. The Trustees have complied with the duty in Section 4 of the Charity Act 2006 to have due regard to public benefit guidance published by the Charity Commission.

name: PIONEERS LEADING THE WAY
activities: Pioneers Leading the Way is an Eduactional charity that recruits, trains, CRB checks and places volunteer mentors.  The mentors provide one to one support for young people in varying localities throughout Birmingham.  Pioneers facilitate the training for Mentors including in house mentor preparotory training, Accreditation with Asdan CVQ, work based experience and career advice.

THE PROMOTION AND UNDERTAKING OF RESEARCH INTO ISSUES SUCH AS EDUCATION, CRIME, HEALTH AND SOCIAL WELFARE AFFECTING ALL COMMUNITIES/ETHNICITIES AND THE DISSEMINATION OF ANY USEFUL RESULTS.  3. THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE CAPACITY AND SKILLS OF THE MEMBERS/VOLUNTEERS IN SUCH A WAY THAT THEY ARE BETTER ABLE TO IDENTIFY AND HELP MEET THEIR NEEDS AND TO PARTICIPATE MORE FULLY IN SOCIETY.

name: V. I. SAHARA GROUP
activities: Parent/carer's of V.I. children meet on a regular basis to support each other, to share and discuss various issues related to them in a friendly environment.Aromatherapy is provided to the carers to de stress themselves. The charity also runs an out of school Urdu/Arabic Braille Club for V.I. children, where they learn Arabic Braille skills, mother-tongue to be able communicate effectively.
objects: FOR THE RELIEF OF VISUALLY IMPAIRED CHILDREN AND VISUALLY IMPAIRED ADULTS WHERE POSSIBLE, THEIR FAMILIES AND CARERS BY PROVIDING ADVICE, SUPPORT AND OTHER ASSISTANCE AND SERVICES FOR SUCH CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES AND CARERS.

name: GRANGE INTERLINK LIMITED

objects: 1. TO PROMOTE THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF HORTON GRANGE WHICH SHALL INCLUDE AREAS OR POCKETS OF NEIGHBOURHOODS AS FOLLOWS: LISTERHILLS, PRINCEVILLE, LIDGET GREEN, MORLEY STREET, GRANTHAM ROAD, CECIL AVENUE,  INGLEBY ROAD, WITHIN THE DISTRICT OF BRADFORD AND THE NEIGHBOURHOOD HEREOF  (HEREINAFTER CALLED THE "AREA OF BENEFIT") WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF AGE, ABILITY, SEX, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, RACE OR OF POLITICAL, RELIGIOUS OR OTHER OPINIONS, BY ASSOCIATING TOGETHER THE SAID INHABITANTS AND THE LOCAL AUTHORITIES, VOLUNTARY AND OTHER ORGANISATIONS IN A COMMON EFFORT TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND TO PROVIDE FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION AND LEISURE-TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR SAID INHABITANTS;  2. TO ESTABLISH, OR SECURE THE ESTABLISHMENT OF, A COMMUNITY CENTRE (HEREINAFTER CALLED "THE CENTRE") AND TO MAINTAIN AND MANAGE THE SAME (WHETHER ALONE OR IN CO-OPERATION WITH ANY LOCAL AUTHORITY OR OTHER PERSON OR BODY) IN FURTHERANCE OF THESE OBJECTS.  3. TO PROMOTE SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS MAY FROM TIME TO TIME BE DETERMINED  4. THE ASSOCIATION SHALL BE NON-PARTY IN POLITICS AND NON-SECTARIAN IN RELIGION

PROVIDING SUPPORT FOR COMMUNITIES/LOCALS (OVERSEAS) TO BUILD COMMUNAL BATHS, TOILETS AND BORE HOLES FOR DRINKING WATER.

name: ETHNIC MINORITIES WIDOWS/WIDOWERS ORGANISATION UK LIMITED
activities: We make donations of household goods such as clothing & cooking utensils. We provide domestic support, run a charity shop. We visit people (elderly & vulnerable widows & widowers & their families). We help every widows & widowers with their other needs but not money (cash) because we are in debt. We will help with finance fund when the shop picks up and we've cleared our debt.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CHARITY ARE TO PROVIDE CHARITABLE ASSISTANCE TO AFRICAN, CARIBBEAN AND OTHER ETHNIC MINORITIES, WIDOWS, WIDOWERS AND THEIR CHILDREN AGED BETWEEN ONE AND FIFTEEN YEARS WHO ARE IN NEED PRIMARILY, BUT NOT NECESSARILY AS A CONSEQUENCE OF THE LOSS OF THEIR SPOUSE OR PARENT, THROUGH THE PROVISION OF ASSISTANCE, ADVICE, INFORMATION, COUNSELLING, SUPPORT, TRANSLATING AND INTERPRETING IN MATTERS SUCH AS LOSS OF A SPOUSE, ADVOCACY, MONEY, DEBTS, WELFARE BENEFITS, HOUSING, HEALTH, EDUCATION, TRAINING AND EMPLOYMENT.

name: LINK AGE SOUTHWARK
activities: Link Age Southwark provides friendly volunteer support to older people. We help people stay connected with their communities, alleviate loneliness and improve wellbeing through: one-to-one befriending; activity groups with volunteer transport; practical support including light gardening and help with odd jobs; intergenerational work with local schools; specialist services for people with dementia.
objects: TO ASSIST IN THE RELIEF OF NEED, HARDSHIP AND DISTRESS WITHIN SOUTH LONDON

name: HALTON AND ST HELENS VOLUNTARY AND COMMUNITY ACTION

Projects across both boroughs include volunteer centres, training, funding advice, network support, health and social care involvement and a community accountancy service.
objects: TO PROMOTE ANY CHARITABLE PURPOSES FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC, PRINCIPALLY BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY IN THE LOCAL GOVERNMENT AREA OF HALTON AND ST HELENS AND ITS ENVIRONS (HEREINAFTER CALLED THE "AREA OF BENEFIT"), AND IN PARTICULAR BUILD THE CAPACITY OFTHIRD SECTOR ORGANISATIONS AND PROVIDE THEM WITH THE NECESSARY SUPPORT, INFORMATION AND SERVICES TO ENABLE THEM TO PURSUE OR CONTRIBUTE TO ANY CHARITABLE PURPOSE. TO PROMOTE GOOD PHYSICAL, MENTAL AND SPIRITUAL HEALTH THROUGH THE PRACTICE OF MEDITATION  & YOGA.

name: JOSEPH CYRIL BAMFORD FOUNDATION
activities: Charity is currently inactive
objects: 3. THE TRUSTEES MUST APPLY THE INCOME OF THE CHARITY IN FURTHERING THE FOLLOWING OBJECT ("THE OBJECTS"):  3.1 THE RELIEF OF PERSONS SUFFERING FROM:  - HEARING LOSS (INCLUDING WITHOUT LIMITATION SENSORINEURAL HEARING LOSS DUE TO OVER EXPOSURE TO HIGH INTENSITY NOISE LEVELS IN THE WORKING ENVIRONMENT (INDUSTRIAL DEAFNESS));  - IMPAIRMENT OF VISION; AND  CANCER;  INCLUDING WITHOUT LIMITATION:  3.1:1 THE PROMOTION OF RESEARCH INTO THE CAUSES AND TREATMENT OF SUCH ILLNESSES AND INJURIES;  3.2 THE PREVENTION OF SUFFERING BY THE PROMOTION OF GOOD PRACTICE IN INDUSTRY TO AVOID ACCIDENTS, INJURIES AND ILLNESSES (INCLUDING WITHOUT LIMITATION INDUSTRIAL DEAFNESS); AND  3.3 SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL THINK FIT.

To subsidise school trips and the purchasing of other items and resources to enhance the educational experience and environment of the pupils at the school.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUPILS OF FURZEFIELD PRIMARY SCHOOL BY PROVIDING AND ASSISTING IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES NOT REQUIRED TO BE PROVIDED BY THE LOCAL EDUCATION AUTHORITY  FOR EDUCATION AT THE SCHOOL

name: REDEEMED CHRISTIAN CHURCH OF GOD CHAPEL OF GLORY INTERNATIONAL
activities: To seek the advancement of the Christian religion in accordance with the teachings of the Redeemed Christian Church of God and to educate people in the Word of God. To teach the knowledge of Jesus Christ all over Watford and beyond.
objects: 2.2.1 THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE CHRISTIAN FAITH WORLDWIDE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE DOCTRINES SET OUT IN THE STATEMENT OF FAITH CONTAINED IN THE SCHEDULE.  2.2.2 THE RELIEF OF POVERTY

name: INCLUSION INTERNATIONAL
activities: Member Support .Knowledge Sharing, promote the exchange of experiences, resources and practices.Research & Monitoring -  in each of the CRPD priority areas.Partnership Building ? develop a thriving and diverse network of families, researchers, civil society organizations, governments and international institutions on disability and inclusion.Policy Development and Engagement
objects: TO ADVANCE THE RELIEF OF PERSONS WITH INTELLECTUAL DISABILITY, WITHOUT REGARD TO NATIONALITY, RACE OR CREED, BY SECURING ON THEIR BEHALF FROM ALL POSSIBLE SOURCES, THE PROVISION OF RESIDENTIAL, EDUCATIONAL TRAINING, EMPLOYMENT AND SUPPORT SERVICES.

name: SAFELIVES
activities: SafeLives, formerly known as CAADA is a national charity supporting a strong multi-agency response to domestic abuse. SafeLives provides practical tools, training, guidance, quality assurance, policy and data insight to support professionals and organisations working with domestic abuse victims. The aim is to protect the highest risk victims and their children.
objects: THE OBJECTS FOR WHICH THE CHARITY IS ESTABLISHED ARE TO ADVANCE FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT IN THE UNITED KINGDOM OR ELSEWHERE SUCH PURPOSES AS ARE RECOGNISED AS EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE AND IN PARTICULAR (BUT WITHOUT PREJUDICE TO THE GENERALITY OF THOSE OBJECTS) TO PROMOTE BEST PRACTICE AND UNDERSTANDING AMONG THE PUBLIC, VOLUNTARY AND STATUTORY AGENCIES IN ALL MATTERS RELATING TO DOMESTIC ABUSE AND FAMILY VIOLENCE, ITS CAUSES, REMEDIES AND PREVENTION

name: KHODORKOVSKY FOUNDATION
activities: The charity supports the Podmoskovny Lyceum, a boarding school for 168 socially deprived children, situated outside of Moscow, Russia, and provides grants for student scholarships in Russia and the UK.
objects: TO ADVANCE EDUCATION IN THE RUSSIAN FEDERATION THROUGH, INTER ALIA, THE PROVISION OF SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS AND THE MAKING OF DONATIONS TO EDUCATIONAL ESTABLISHMENTS AND TO PROMOTE SUCH  OTHER PURPOSES AS ARE NOW OR MAY HEREAFTER BE DEEMED BY ENGLI0SH LAW TO BE CHARITABLE.

name: CROSS CULTURAL MINISTRY IN WOKING
activities: VARIOUS TRAINING COURSES AND OTHER ACTIVITIES (SUCH AS SOCIAL AND PRAYER GATHERINGS) TO SUPPORT THE WORK OF CROSS CULTURAL MINISTRY.
objects: I) TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC INCLUDING THE CHURCHES IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT ABOUT CULTURAL AND RELIGIOUS ISSUES IN AN ETHNICALLY MIXED COMMUNITY;  II) TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN RELIGION AND UPHOLD ITS FAITH IN THE CROSS-CULTURAL CONTEXT OF THE AREA OF BENEFIT

name: GREATER THAME U3A
activities: To encourage and enable older people no longer in full-time paid employment to help each other share their knowledge, skills, interests and experience.
objects: 1.  TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC AND IN PARTICULAR THE EDUCATION OF OLDER PEOPLE NO LONGER IN FULL TIME GAINFUL EMPLOYMENT IN THAME. AND ITS SURROUNDING LOCALITY.  2.  THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR LEISURE TIME AND RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR THE ABOVE PERSONS IN THE INTERESTS OF THEIR SOCIAL WELFARE.

name: THE HCA INTERNATIONAL FOUNDATION
activities: The relief of sickness and the preservation and protection of good health by the provision of financial and other assistance for medical facilities, medical education and research.
objects: THE RELIEF OF SICKNESS AND THE PRESERVATION AND PROTECTION OF GOOD HEALTH BY THE PROVISION OF FINANCIAL AND OTHER ASSISTANCE FOR MEDICAL FACILITIES MEDICAL EDUCATION AND RESEARCH IN THE UK AND OVERSEAS.

name: ACKERS ADVENTURE
activities: Provision of outdoor activities including skiing, climbing, abseiling, canoeing, zip wire, fan descender, orienteering, jungle challenge, bush craft, disc golf, team building & archery. Duke of Edinburgh Awards. School holiday club. Residential centre for overnight stays. Also manages the site as open space for the community.
objects: THE GENERAL BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF THE WEST MIDLANDS AND ELSEWHERE IN SUCH CHARITABLE WAYS AS THE TRUSTEES THINK FIT.

name: SOCIETY OF ST LUKE
activities: Visiting individuals or receiving them at the HQs.  Fund raising, social events, training events and providing a place of quiet and refreshment in a spiritual environment.
objects: 1) TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATEMENT OF BELIEF AS SET OUT IN THE CONSTITUTION.  2) TO RELIEVE SICKNESS IN PARTICULAR BY SUPPORTING THE WORK OF "FATHER ANDEWEG INSTITUTE FOR DEAF"  IN BEIRUT, LEBANON AND " THE HOLY LAND INSTITUTE FOR THE DEAF" IN SALT, JORDAN.

name: CIRCLE CARE AND SUPPORT
activities: The Charity is the care and support partner of Clarion Housing Group.  The Charity's activities are centred around four service areas: Older People, Young People's Services, Tenancy Support Services and Learning Disability Support Services.
objects: TO PROVIDE CARE AND ASSOCIATED SERVICES FOR THE RELIEF OF NEED AND SUFFERING AND FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE COMMUNITY:  (A)  TO PERSONS IN NECESSITOUS CIRCUMSTANCES UPON TERMS APPROPRIATE TO THEIR MEANS; AND  (B)  TO AGED, DISABLED, HANDICAPPED (WHETHER MENTALLY OR PHYSICALLY)  OR CHRONICALLY SICK PERSONS AND PERSONS WHO ARE OR HAVE BEEN SUBJECT TO DEPENDENCY ON OR ABUSE OF ALCOHOL, DRUGS OR OTHER ITEMS OR SUBSTANCES.

name: AFRICAN AGRICULTURAL TECHNOLOGY FOUNDATION
activities: RELIEF OF POVERTY IN SUB-SAHARAN AFRICA BY: IMPROVING FOOD SECURITY; FACILITATING PARTNERSHIPS FOR TRANSFER AND USE OF AGRICULTURAL TECHNOLOGIES BY SMALLHOLDER/RESOURCE-POOR FARMERS. DEVELOPING, ARRANGING AND EFFECTING ACCESS BY SMALLHOLDER FARMERS TO EXISTING AGRICULTURAL TECHNOLOGIES THAT CAN BE ADAPTED FOR THEIR BENEFIT.
objects: THE RELIEF OF POVERTY IN AFRICA BY:  (1)  IMPROVING FOOD SECURITY;  (2)  FACILITATING PARTNERSHIPS FOR THE TRANSFER AND USE OF APPROPRIATE AGRICULTURAL TECHNOLOGIES BY SMALLHOLDER FARMERS AND, IN PARTICULAR, RESOURCE-POOR FARMERS;  (3)  DEVELOPING,  ARRANGING AND EFFECTING ACCESS BY SMALLHOLDER FARMERS AND, IN PARTICULAR RESOURCE-POOR FARMERS, TO EXISTING AGRICULTURAL TECHNOLOGIES THAT CAN BE ADAPTED TO OR FOR THEIR BENEFIT.  FOOD SECURITY IS DEFINED BY THE UN'S FOOD AND AGRICULTURAL ORGANISATIONAS EXISTING WHEN ALL PEOPLE AT ALL TIMES, HAVE PHYSICAL AND ECONOMIC ACCESS TO SUFFICIENT, SAFE AND NUTRITIOUS FOOD TO MEET THEIR DIETARY NEEDS AND FOOD PREFERENCES FOR AN ACTIVE AND HEALTHY LIFE.

name: NEPHROTIC SYNDROME TRUST (NEST)
activities: Raise awareness of Nephrotic Syndrome and raise funds for further research and development by the research team at Bristol Royal Children's Hospital.
objects: TO PROMOTE RESEARCH OR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC BY THE PROMOTION AND FUNDING RESEARCH INTO THE CAUSES AND TREATMENT FOR NEPHROTIC SYNDROME CARRIED OUT AT THE SPECIALIST KIDNEY UNIT OF BRISTOL CHILDREN'S HOSPITAL.

name: YOUTH DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVES
activities: We are dedicated to the development. We implement various programs such as TRAININGS FOR WORK, STUDY AND JOB CONNECTION, CONSULTANCY. Through these we provide a welcoming social context. our main work is to fill skills gap in people who may have dropped out of school or left school early and facing unemployment barrier or unable to connect with other people. Sport activities are our outreach tool.
objects: THE RELIEF OF POVERTY, HARDSHIP AND DISTRESS AND THE PRESERVATION AND PROTECTION AMONG REFUGEES, ORPHANS AND VICTIMS OF WARS OR STATE OR ETHNIC CONFLICTS, NATURAL CALAMITIES OR FAMINE THROUGH THE APPLICATION OF SPORT AMONG THE YOUNG PEOPLE OF THESE COMMUNITIES AND THE PROVISION OF FINANCIAL OR MATERIAL ASSISTANCE TO THOSE IN NEED IN EUROPE AND AFRICA.

name: JUDY APPLEMAN FOUNDATION
activities: Raising funds largely through informal concerts. Distributing the proceeds to educational and music charities and the provision of an annual scholarship in memory of Judy Appleman.
objects: A)  TO ADVANCE, IMPROVE, DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN PUBLIC EDUCATION AND APPRECIATION OF THE ART, SCIENCE AND DEVELOPMENT OF MUSIC AND THE ARTS IN ALL ASPECTS BY THE PRESENTATION OF PUBLIC EVENTS SUCH AS CONCERTS AND RECITALS, AS WELL AS SUPPORTING THE COMPOSITION OF NEW LITURGICAL MUSIC AND OTHER ASSOCIATED CHARITABLE ACTIVITIES.  B)  OTHER CHARITABLE ACTIVITIES THAT THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME DETERMINE.

name: COMMUNITY TRAINING ASSISTANCE AND SUPPORT (CTAS) LIMITED
activities: The Charity is dedicated to the advancement of education, the relief of poverty, hardship and 							 distress and the preservation of good health among communities (particularly in Nepal) by such 							 exclusively charitable means as the trustees shall from time to time determine.
objects: THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION, THE RELIEF OF POVERTY, HARDSHIP AND DISTRESS AND THE PRESERVATION OF GOOD HEALTH AMONG COMMUNITIES (PRIMARILY IN NEPAL), BY SUCH EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE MEANS AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL FROM TIME TO TIME DETERMINE

name: THE ROYAL TUNBRIDGE WELLS FESTIVALS LIMITED
activities: In the Royal Borough of Tunbridge Wells and the towns and villages of the Kent and Sussex Weald:  - to provide outreach programmes of music and entertainment for the benefit of the young, old and underprivileged members of the community, and  - to provide festivals of the arts and entertainments.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE GENERAL PUBLIC IN THE ARTS IN GENERAL, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY MEANS OF FESTIVALS AND WORKSHOPS IN THE BOROUGH OF ROYAL TUNBRIDGE WELLS

name: UNDERSTANDING ISLAM UK
activities: Charity arranges educational activities for adults and children. It also arranges public meetings inviting guest speakers from UK or abroad. It maintains a website for the benefit of general public and its members where it also provides a QnA service about issues related to Islam. It gives financial grants to research and educational institutes including religious and non-religious institutions.
objects: THE ORGANISATION'S OBJECTIVES ARE:  (1). THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE MESSAGE OF ISLAM AS UNDERSTOOD BY THE COLLECTIVITY OF THE  COMPANIONS OF PROPHET MUHAMMAD(PBUH) PASSED ON TO THE SUBSEQUENT MUSLIM GENERATIONS,  SOLELY THROUGH INFORMATION, EDUCATION AND DIALOGUE; USING ONLY NON POLITICAL MEANS.  (2). TO ESTABLISH AND MAINTAIN AN ISLAMIC CENTRE SOLELY FOR THE PURPOSE OF PROVIDING  RELIGIOUS EDUCATION FOR ALL AND SUNDRY WITH A VIEW TO INSTILL HARMONY AMONG DIFFERENT  MUSLIM GROUPS AND INCULCATE PEACE AND UNDERSTANDING BETWEEN THOSE WHO FOLLOW FAITH AND  THOSE WHO DON'T.  (3). TO PROVIDE RELIGIOUS EDUCATION TO CHILDREN ENSURING THAT THEY BECOME PEACE LOVING,  CARING AND CIVILISED CITIZENS OF BRITISH SOCIETY. PROVISION OF SUCH EDUCATION OF CHILDREN WILL  BE PART OF THE ISLAMIC CENTRE.  (4). TO PROMOTE INTEGRATION AND GOOD CITIZENSHIP IN THE COMMUNITY.

name: CRAGHEAD DEVELOPMENT TRUST LIMITED
activities: CDT currently runs a childcare centre,  a family centre and is a landlord of three properties in Craghead offering reasonable rents to their local tenants.
objects: TO PROMOTE THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF CRAGHEAD AND SURROUNDING DISTRICTS WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF SEX, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, RACE OR OF POLITICAL RELIGIOUS OR OTHER OPINIONS BY ASSOCIATING TOGETHER THE SAID INHABITANTS AND THE LOCAL AUTHORITIES, VOLUNTARY AND OTHER OPINIONS BY ASSOCIATING TOGETHER THE SAID INHABITANTS AND THE LOCAL AUTHORITIES, VOLUNTARY AND OTHER ORGANISATIONS IN A COMMON EFFORT TO ADVANCE EDUCATION, PROVIDE SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC REGENERATION AND RELIEVE POVERTY BY PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION AND LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE PRIMARY OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR THE SAID INHABITANTS.

name: THE ARTS SOCIETY SOLENT
activities: The Society promotes education of fine arts by holding monthly lectures on a wide variety of arts-related subjects, visits to places of interest and study days.   This year sponsored a professional artist to hold workshops for a day in a local school.  Donations to Bay House School and Baycroft School Art Departments.   Ongoing church and conservation work.
objects: D) THE PROMOTION AND ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN THE CULTIVATION,  APPRECIATION AND STUDY OF THE DECORATIVE AND FINE ARTS;  E) THE CONSERVATION AND PRESERVATION OF THE ARTISTIC HERITAGE OF THE UNITED KINGDOM AND  OTHER COUNTRIES FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC;  F) THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE ARTS, CULTURE AND HERITAGE IN PARTICULAR, BUT WITHOUT LIMITATION,  THE DECORATIVE AND FINE ARTS.

name: THE MOMC-LEIGH PARK CRAFTS INITIATIVE TRUST LIMITED
activities: Making Space is a visual arts charity working in the socially deprived area of Leigh Park. We provide hands-on, participatory workshops for all age groups and levels of experience with a focus on community work. We also provide studio space and business support for craft makers and visual artists.
objects: 3A (I)  TO PROMOTE, MAINTAIN, IMPROVE AND ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC AND IN PARTICULAR THE DISADVANTAGED PUBLIC BY THE ENCOURAGEMENT OF THE ARTS GENERALLY AND IN PARTICULAR THE VISUAL ARTS OF FINE ART, SCULPTURE, CRAFTS, 3D ARTS, DRAWING, DIGITAL ARTS, FILM MAKING, VIDEO MAKING AND PHOTOGRAPHY.  (II)  THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATIONS, PARTICULARLY FACILITIES FOR THE PRODUCTION AND EXHIBITION OF THE VISUAL ARTS AND CRAFTS WITH THE OBJECT OF GIVING THE WIDEST POSSIBLE ACCESS TO THE ARTS BY ALL MEMBERS OF THE PUBLIC.

name: THE HATHERN BAND
activities: We are a Brass Band based in the village of Hathern in North Leicestershire. We have 4 Bands - Hathern Band (the main 1st Section contesting Band), Hathern Youth Band (age ranges from 8 - 19years) Hathern Training Band (mostly children but some adults, all at early learning stage) and Hathern Concert Brass (a non contesting band).
objects: (I)  TO PROMOTE, IMPROVE, DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN PUBLIC EDUCATION IN THE APPRECIATION OF THE ART AND SCIENCE OF BRASS BAND MUSIC IN ALL ITS ASPECTS TO PEOPLE OF ALL AGES BY THE PRESENTATION OF PUBLIC CONCERTS AND RECITALS AND BY SUCH OTHER WAYS AS SHALLBE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE AS THE CHARITY, THROUGH ITS EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE, SHALL FROM TIME TO TIME DETERMINE;  (II)  TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE IN PARTICULAR TO LEARN, APPRECIATE AND PARTICIPATE IN BRASS BAND MUSIC.

name: HINDU SAMAJ SWINDON
activities: HINDU SAMAJ-SWINDON - REPRESENTING THE HINDU COMMUNITY IN SWINDON, WILTSHIRE. KEY OBJECTIVES: 1. COMMUNITY WELFARE & DEVELOPMENT THROUGH MUTUAL SUPPORT AND NETWORK. 2. FACILITATION OF SOCIAL, CULTURAL AND FAITH NEEDS OF COMMUNITY. 3. COMMUNITY REPRESENTATION. 4. PROMOTING A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF THE HINDU COMMUNITY IN THE LOCAL WIDER COMMUNITY. 5. TO PROMOTE COMMUNITY COHESION
objects: A) TO PROMOTE THE BENEFIT OF THE HINDU COMMUNITY IN SWINDON AND DISTRICT (HEREAFTER CALLED THE COMMUNITY), BY ASSOCIATING TOGETHER THE SAID INHABITANTS AND THE LOCAL AUTHORITIES, VOLUNTARY AND OTHER ORGANISATIONS IN A COMMON EFFORT TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND TO PROVIDE FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE AND RECREATION AND LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION, WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITION OF LIFE FOR THE SAID INHABITANTS;  B) TO ESTABLISH OR SECURE THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A COMMUNITY CENTREAND TO MAINTAIN AND MANAGE THE SAME (WHETHER ALONE OR IN CO-OPERATION WITH ANY LOCAL AUTHORITY OR OTHER PERSON OR BODY) IN FURTHERANCE OF THESE OBJECTS:  C) TO PROMOTE SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS MAY FROM TIME TO TIME BE DETERMINED.

name: ASHA TRUST (SRI LANKA)
activities: The Principal Objective of Asha Trust is the relief of poverty, hardship and distress and the promotion of good health amoungst children and adults in Sri Lankaby the provision of resources and assitance. objects: THE RELIEF OF POVERTY, HARDSHIP AND DISTRESS AND THE PROMOTION AND PROTECTION OF GOOD HEALTH AMONGST CHILDREN AND ADULTS IN SRI LANKA ('THE BENEFICIARIES') BY THE PROVISION OF RESOURCES AND ASSISTANCE, WHETHER FINANCIAL OR OTHERWISE, EITHER TO THE BENEFICIARIES DIRECTLY OR TO LOCAL AGENCIES WORKING IN RELIEF OF SUCH PERSONS.

name: THE TRANSATLANTIC INSTITUTE
activities: Research on international affairs as they relate to Europe and the Americas and international organisations. Our research is published in the press (or other media), in hardcopy form, or via our website.
objects: THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC BENEFIT IN THE SCIENCES OF INTERNATIONAL RELATIONS POLITICS ECONOMICS JURISPRUDENCE SOCIAL POLICY SECURITY DEFENCE MILITARY INTELLIGENCE STRATEGY AND TACTICS AS THEY RELATE TO THE AFFAIRS OF THE STATES OF EUROPE AND OF THE AMERICAS AND OF INTERNATIONAL ORGANISATIONS AND TREATIES BINDING SUCH STATES PARTICULARLY BUT WITHOUT PREJUDICE TO THE FOREGOING BY RESEARCH AND STUDY OF SUCH SCIENCES AND BY PUBLICATION OF THE RESEARCH AND STUDY.

name: IMAN TRUST
activities: General Charitable Purposes Education/Training Religious activities and sermons Enhancing religious harmony
objects: 1) TO ADVANCE ISLAMIC RELIGION BY ESTABLISHMENT OF AN ISLAMIC CENTRE AND FACILITIES FOR THE PRACTICE OF ISLAMIC RELIGION AND COMMUNITY ACTIVITIES.  2) ADVANCEMENT OF ISLAMIC EDUCATION BY PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR ISLAMIC EDUCATION FOR CHILDREN AND ADULTS.  3) PROMOTING RELIGIOUS HARMONY.

name: THE NORTH WESTERN NATURALISTS' UNION
