activities: Useful Vision aims to create positive opportunities for visually impaired children and their families. We do this by running events & activities, educational courses and by offering information & family support.
objects: TO PROMOTE ANY CHARITABLE PURPOSES FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC, INCLUDING (BUT NOT SO AS TO LIMIT THE GENERALITY OF THE FOREGOING) TO RELIEVE SICK AND DISABLED CHILDREN, PARTICULARLY BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY CHILDREN WITH BLINDNESS, VISION IMPAIRMENT AND/OR CANCER AND TO SUPPORT THEIR FAMILIES BY PROVIDING OR ASSISTING IN THE PROVISION OF RESPITE, RECUPERATIVE OR HOSPICE CARE, GRANTS, HOLIDAYS, EQUIPMENT, RECREATIONAL OR LEISURE ACTIVITIES, TRIPS, OUTINGS, AMENITIES AND FACILITIES FOR OR DESIGNED TOIMPROVE THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE OF SUCH PERSONS.

activities: The company is principally engaged to empower all women, in particular minority ethnic women by developing and implementing a range of activities in the Nuneaton and Bedworth area.

name: CHURCHGATE CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: The objects of the trust are to: +ö+ç+¦	The advancement of education +ö+ç+¦	The promotion of moral or spiritual improvement, in particular but not exclusively by the provision of facilities to religious foundations +ö+ç+¦	The relief of poverty +ö+ç+¦	The relief of sickness or disability
objects: FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC IN ANY PART OF THE WORLD SUCH CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS THE TRUSTEES MAY IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION SEE FIT, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY:  (A)  THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION;  (B)  THE PROMOTION OF MORAL OR SPIRITUAL IMPROVEMENT, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES TO RELIGIOUS FOUNDATIONS;  (C)  THE RELIEF OF POVERTY;  (D)  THE RELIEF OF SICKNESS OF DISABILITY;  (E)  THE PRESERVATION OF BUILDINGS OR SITES OF HISTORIC OR ARCHITECTURALIMPORTANCE;  (F)  THE RELIEF AND ASSISTANCE OF PEOPLE WHO ARE THE VICTIMS OF WAR OR NATURAL DISASTER, TROUBLE OR CATASTROPHE; AND  (G)  TO PROVIDE OR ASSIST IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR THE INHABITANTS OF THE AREA OF BENEFIT WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF SEX OR OF POLITICAL, RELIGIOUS OR OTHER OPINIONS.

name: MIRACLE CENTRE ASSEMBLIES OF GOD (UK)
activities: Promote Christainity and place of worship for members of the community. Provide pre and post marital counselling, parenting and family life, job and carrier guidance to all manner of persons. Give grants and financial aid to single parents and children from need homes. Establish a childcare and after school club that will serve working parents. Organise youth sporting competitions.
objects: (A) TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATEMENT OF BELIEFS APPEARING IN THE SCHEDULE HERETO IN LONDON AND IN SUCH OTHER PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT AND TO FULFIL SUCH OTHER PURPOSES WHICH ARE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE ACCORDING TO THE LAW OF ENGLAND AND WALES AND ARE CONNECTED WITH THE CHARITABLE WORK OF THE TRUST  TO RELIEVE PERSONS WHO ARE IN CONDITIONS OF NEED OR HARDSHIP OR WHO ARE AGED OR SICK AND TO RELIEVE THE DISTRESS CAUSED THEREBY IN THE SAID LOCATION AND IN SUCH OTHER PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT  (C) TO ADVANCE EDUCATION IN ACCORDANCE WITH CHRISTIAN PRINCIPLES BY SUCH MEANS AS THE TRUSTEES MAY CONSIDER APPROPRIATE INCLUDING BY MEANS OF ESTABLISHING AND OPERATING ANY EDUCATIONAL ESTABLISHMENT OR ESTABLISHMENTS IN THE SAID LOCATION AND IN SUCH OTHER PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT

name: THE NEW TESTAMENT ASSEMBLY
activities: This charity provides :- (a) luncheon club (b) outreach befriending service (c) mental health drop in centre (d) home and respite care (e) computer classes (f) youth activities.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN RELIGION IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE BELIEFS AND PRACTICES OF THE NTA FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC

name: BETHEL PRESBYTERIAN CHURCH (REFORMED) CARDIFF WEST
activities: The object of Bethel presbyterian church is to advance the Christian Religion in acordance with the doctrinal standards of the Church. Regular public meetings for worship and teaching are maintained together with the celebration of the Lord`s supper. A Sunday School is held each Sunday morning to instruct children, both from the church and the surrounding community.
objects: A) THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE CHRISTIAN RELIGION (AS EXPRESSED IN THE WESTMINSTER CONFESSION OF FAITH 1647, WITH LARGER AND SHORTER CATECHISMS, AS INTERPRETED BY THE EVANGELICAL PRESBYTERIAN CHURCH IN ENGLAND AND WALES) FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT, AND  B) THERELIEF OF HARDSHIP OF THE SICK AND NEEDY  IN CARDIFF BUT ALSO MORE WIDELY IN ENGLAND AND WALES AND THROUGHOUT THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT.

name: HOME-START SHEPWAY
activities: Volunteer home visiting service offering emotional and practical support for parents with young children including - Building Bright Futures Project - Enhanced New Beginnings Domestic Abuse Project - Big Hopes Big Futures Project - Young Parent Service
objects: (A)TO SAFEGUARD, PROTECT AND PRESERVE GOOD HEALTH, BOTH MENTAL AND PHYSICAL, OF CHILDREN AND PARENTS OF CHILDREN  (B)TO PREVENT CRUELTY TO OR MALTREATMENT OF CHILDREN  (C)TO RELIEVE SICKNESS, POVERTY AND NEED AMONGST CHILDREN AND PARENTS OF CHILDREN  (D)TO PROMOTE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN BETTER STANDARDS OF CHILD CARE  WITHIN THE AREA OF SHEPWAY AND ITS ENVIRONS.

name: THE TLC - TENDER LOVING CARE GROUP
activities: THE PRESERVATION AND PROTECTION OF THE PHYSICAL AND MENTAL HEALTH OF THE INHABITANTS OF DAVENTRY AND THE SURROUNDING AREAS BY THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION AND LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION  WITH THE OBJECT OFIMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE AND THUS AVOIDING SOCIAL EXCLUSION FOR ANYONE UNDERGOING  TREATMENT FOR MENTAL HEALTH,
objects: THE PRESERVATION AND PROTECTION OF THE PHYSICAL AND MENTAL HEALTH OF THE INHABITANTS OF DAVENTRY AND THE SURROUNDING AREAS BY THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION AND LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION  WITH THE OBJECT OFIMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE AND THUS AVOIDING SOCIAL EXCLUSION FOR ANYONE UNDERGOING  TREATMENT FOR MENTAL HEALTH,

name: COVENTRY, FRENCH CONGREGATION OF JEHOVAH'S WITNESSES
activities: Arranging meetings for public worship, which includes Bible education and training in Christian living. Preaching the Christian message to the public within the congregation area.Distributing Bibles and other religious literature. All of these services and facilities are provided without charge.
objects: THE PRACTICE AND ADVANCEMENT OF CHRISTIANITY FOUNDED ON THE HOLY BIBLE, AS UNDERSTOOD BY THE DENOMINATION OF CHRISTIANS KNOWN AS JEHOVAH'S WITNESSES, INCLUDING THE PREACHING OF THE GOOD NEWS OF GOD'S KINGDOM BY JESUS CHRIST WITHIN THE CONGREGATION AREA AND THE HOLDING OF MEETINGS.

name: HOME-START NEWARK
activities: Home-Start Newark offers a simple preventative service to families under pressure who have at least one child under 5 years old.  We offer support in the home by volunteers who are all parents themselves, offering  friendship,practical help and a much needed listening ear.  Helping parents by reducing isolation,  building confidence and theirfore increasing the well-being of children
objects: A) TO SAFEGUARD, PROTECT AND PRESERVE THE GOOD HEALTH, BOTH MENTAL AND PHYSICAL OF CHILDREN AND PARENTS OF CHILDREN;  B) TO PREVENT CRUELTY TO OR MALTREATMENT OF CHILDREN;  C) TO RELIEVE SICKNESS, POVERTY AND NEED AMONGST CHILDREN AND PARENTS OF CHILDREN;  D) TO PROMOTE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN BETTER STANDARDS OF CHILD CARE  WITHIN THE AREA OF NEWARK AND ITS ENVIRONS.

name: THE KATHERINE BOLT BEQUEST
activities: To support the work of The Lonsdale Trust Wallasey (Reg Charity No 213990).
objects: TO FURTHER THE OBJECTS OF THE CHARITY KNOWN AS THE LONSDALE TRUST WALLASEY (213990)

name: CHILD DYNAMIX
activities: Child Dynamix vision is to see communities where children and young people thrive, we do this by creating environments and delivering activities which enable children and young people to identify and realise both their aspirations and potential. Our work is predominantly based within the City of Hull which is currently ranked as the 9th deprived Local Authority areas out of 354 Local Authorities.
objects: TO PROMOTE SOCIAL REGENERATION BY PROVIDING RELIEF IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY TO CHILDREN, YOUNG PEOPLE AND THEIR FAMILIES WHO ARE RESIDENT OR EMPLOYED ACROSS THE HUMBER SUB-REGION WHO HAVE NEED BECAUSE OF AGE, MENTAL OR PHYSICAL DISABILITY, POVERTY OR ADDICTION

name: BICESTER CHORAL AND OPERATIC SOCIETY
activities: HIGHLIGHTS FROM THE PAST 5 YEARS 2013: HELLO DOLLY 2014: VERDI REQUIEM  / HANDEL MESSIAH 2015: IOLANTHE   / ROSSINI PETITE MESSE SOLENELLE 2016: CARMEN THE MUSICAL  /  JENKINS ARMED MAN 2017 HMS PINAFORE
objects: TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC IN THE CHORAL, ORCHESTRAL, DRAMATIC AND OPERATIC ARTS, AND TO FURTHER THE DEVELOPMENT OF PUBLIC APPRECIATION AND TASTE IN THE SAID ARTS.

name: GLOUCESTERSHIRE COUNSELLING SERVICE
activities: To provide affordable professional counselling to the community of Gloucestershire To provide professional training in psychodynamic counselling to the people of Gloucestershire and its surrounds
objects: (A)  THE RELIEF OF PEOPLE SUFFERING FROM EMOTIONAL OR PSYCHOLOGICAL DISTRESS OR RELATIONSHIP PROBLEMS PRINCIPALLY TO THE COMMUNITY OF GLOUCESTERSHIRE AND ITS SURROUNDS BY THE PROVISION OF HIGH QUALITY PYSCHODYNAMIC COUNSELLING.  (B)  TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND TRAINING IN COUNSELLING AND TO PROMOTE AWARENESS OF THE EFFECTIVENESS OF COUNSELLING.

name: Notting Hill Genesis Community Foundation
activities: The charity approves grants and fundraising in line with the corporate objectives of Notting Hill Genesis and the obligations of two trust funds (Eastwood Trust and Knowles Trust).
objects: 3 THE CHARITY'S OBJECTS (THE "OBJECTS") ARE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THOSE LIVING IN LOCAL AUTHORITY AREAS IN WHICH THE GENESIS HOUSING GROUP OWNS OR MANAGES OR PLANS TO OWN OR MANAGE HOUSING STOCK AND NEIGHBOURING LOCAL AUTHORITY AREAS (THE "AREA OF BENEFIT") ALL OR ANY OF THE FOLLOWING CHARITABLE PURPOSES :-  3.1 THE PROMOTION FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC OF URBAN AND/OR RURAL REGENERATION IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT WHERE THERE IS SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC DEPRIVATION BY ALL OR ANY OF THE FOLLOWING MEANS:  3.1.1 THE RELIEF OF FINANCIAL HARDSHIP;  3.1.2 THE RELIEF OF UNEMPLOYMENT;  3.1.3 THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION, TRAINING OR RETRAINING, PARTICULARLY AMONG UNEMPLOYED PEOPLE, AND PROVIDING UNEMPLOYED PEOPLE WITH WORK EXPERIENCE;  3.1.4 THE PROVISION OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE OR BUSINESS ADVICE OR CONSULTANCY IN ORDER TO PROVIDE TRAINING AND EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR UNEMPLOYED PEOPLE IN CASES OF FINANCIAL OR OTHER CHARITABLE NEED THROUGH HELP:  (I) IN SETTING UP THEIR OWN BUSINESS, OR  (II) TO EXISTING BUSINESSES;  3.1.5 THE CREATION OF TRAINING AND EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES BY THE PROVISION OF WORKSPACE, BUILDINGS, AND/OR LAND FOR USE ON FAVOURABLE TERMS;  3.1.6 THE PROMOTION OF EQUALITY AND DIVERSITY FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE  PUBLIC BY   PROMOTING THE ELIMINATION OF  DISCRIMINATION ON GROUNDS OF  RACE , RELIGION, DISABILITY  OR ETHNIC ORIGIN  BY  RAISING AWARENESS AND UNDERSTANDING  OF THE BACKGROUND, QUALITIES  AND NEEDS  OF INDIVIDUALS LIVING IN AND ORGANISATIONS ANDGROUPS OPERATING IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT AND  BY PROMOTING ATTITUDES, CUSTOMS AND PRACTICES  IN FAVOUR OF EQUALITY;  3.1.7 THE MAINTENANCE, IMPROVEMENT OR PROVISION OF PUBLIC AMENITIES INCLUDING COMMUNITY HALLS AND OTHER PREMISES AVAILABLE FOR USE BY THE COMMUNITY OR ANY SECTOR OF IT;  3.1.8 THE PROVISION OF HOUSING FOR THOSE WHO ARE IN CONDITIONS OF NEED AND THE IMPROVEMENT OF HOUSING IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR OR IN CHARITABLE OWNERSHIP;  3.1.9 THE PROVISION OF RECREATIONAL FACILITIES FOR THE PUBLIC ATLARGE OR THOSE WHO BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, AGE, INFIRMITY OR DISABLEMENT, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES, HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES; 3.1.10 THE PROTECTION OR CONSERVATION OF THE ENVIRONMENT;  3.1.11 THE PROVISION OF PUBLIC HEALTH FACILITIES AND CHILDCARE;  3.1.12 THE PROMOTION OF PUBLIC SAFETY AND THE PREVENTION OF CRIME INCLUDING IN PARTICULAR FOSTERING ANTI SOCIAL BEHAVIOUR MEASURES AND PRESERVING PUBLIC ORDER THROUGH THE PROVISION OF SERVICES DIRECTED TOWARDS MEDIATION AND CONCILIATION BETWEEN PEOPLE, ORGANISATIONS AND GROUPS WHO ARE INVOLVED IN DISPUTES OR INTERPERSONAL CONFLICTS WHERE THAT DISPUTE OR CONFLICT RESULTS FROM OR MAY LEAD TO ACTS OF NUISANCE, VANDALISM, RACIAL ABUSE OR BREACH OF THE PEACE; AND  3.1.13 SUCH OTHER MEANS AS MAY FROM TIME TO TIME BE DETERMINED SUBJECT TO THE PRIOR WRITTEN CONSENT OF THE CHARITY COMMISSIONERS FOR ENGLAND AND WALES.  3.2 TO DEVELOP THE CAPACITY AND SKILLS OF THE MEMBERS OF THE COMMUNITY IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT WHERETHERE IS SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC DEPRIVATION IN SUCH A WAY THAT THEY ARE BETTER ABLE TO IDENTIFY, AND HELP MEET, THEIR NEEDS AND TO PARTICIPATE MORE FULLY IN SOCIETY; AND  3.3 TO FURTHER SUCH OTHER PURPOSES AS ARE CHARITABLE ACCORDING TO THE LAW OF ENGLAND AND WALES AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME DETERMINE.

name: OCEAN STARS TRUST
activities: TO RELIEVE SUFFERING AMONG DISADVANTAGED SRI LANKAN PEOPLE.  WE AIM TO DO THIS BY PROVIDING THE PEOPLE WITH THE SKILLS NECESSARY  TO REBUILD THEIR LIVES.
objects: THE RELIEF OF FINANCIAL NEED AND SUFFERING AMONG VICTIMS OF NATURAL AND OTHER KINDS OF DISASTER IN THE FORM OF MONEY (OR OTHER MEANS DEEMED SUITABLE) FOR PERSONS, BODIES OR ORGANISATIONS IN SRI LANKA

name: CHRIST CHURCH COMMUNITY PROJECT
activities: We provide a variety of services for the community of Matchborough,Redditch and surrounding areas including:- *Parenting courses,  *Adult education courses *Community Youth involvement groups *Older person's clubs *Local Police Surgery *Working with other groups in the community to fulfill our aims *Community newsletter 3 times a year
objects: TO PROMOTE THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF THE MATCHBOROUGH ESTATE REDDITCH AND ITS SURROUNDING AREAS WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF SEX, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, RACE AND POLITICAL RELIGIOUS OR OTHER OPINIONS, BY ASSOCIATING TOGETHER THE SAID INHABITANTS AND THE LOCAL AUTHORITIES, VOLUNTARY AND OTHER ORGANISATIONS IN A COMMON EFFORT TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND TO PROVIDE FACILITIES IN THE INTEREST OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION AND LEISURE-TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR THE SAID INHABITANTS ACCORDING TO OUR STATEMENT OF FAITH AS SET OUT IN APPENDIX 1.

name: H.E.A.T FOUNDATION LTD
activities: In South India we are working with local charity and together we have built a school. We will be funding to build additional classrooms. We are helping 354 boys and girls to be educated.  In Pakistan we are paying school fees, uniforms and books for 114 children to attend full-time education. We also have an evening centre for 92 children who are unable to attend full-time education.
objects: TO PROMOTE ANY CHARITABLE PURPOSES FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE COMMUNITY IN THE POORER PARTS OF THE WORLD ('THE AREA OF BENEFIT') AND, IN PARTICULAR, THE ADVANCEMENT OF HEALTH, EDUCATION, AND TRAINING FOR THE RELIEF OF POVERTY, DISTRESS AND SICKNESS, AND IN FURTHERANCE OF THE SAID PURPOSES TO PROMOTE AND ORGANISE CO-OPERATION IN THE ACHIEVEMENT OF THE SAME AND TO THAT END TO BRING TOGETHER REPRESENTATIVES OF THE VOLUNTARY ORGANISATIONS AND STATUTORY AUTHORITIES WITHIN THE AREA OF BENEFIT.

name: WYE VALLEY SOCIETY
activities: The Society promotes the conservation, protection and improvement of the Wye Valley Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. It scrutinises planning applications and where necessary makes representations, including to planning enquiries. The Society arranges public meetings on environmental issues and arranges visits, for example to local farms, to improve local education and knowledge.
objects: TO PROMOTE THE CONSERVATION, PROTECTION AND IMPROVEMENT OF THE WYE VALLEY'S PHYSICAL AND NATURAL ENVIRONMENT AND THAT OF IMMEDIATELY SURROUNDING AREAS WITH PARTICULAR REGARD TO THE WYE VALLEY AREA OF OUTSTANDING NATURAL BEAUTY AND IMMEDIATELY SURROUNDING AREAS.

name: BARRA HALL COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT COMMITTEE
activities: To promote the positive use of Barra Hall Park and it's facilities including the Hall itself. To continue to work to enhance and restore the park to its former glory. To provide activities and events for our community to participate in and enjoy.
objects: TO PROMOTE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF HAYES AND HARLINGTON AND THE SURROUNDING AREA THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION OF INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, AGE, INFIRMITY OR DISABLEMENT, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES OR FOR THE PUBLIC AT LARGE IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE AND WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE OF THE SAID INHABITANTS..

name: NORTH DORSET DISABILITY INFORMATION SERVICE (NORDDIS)
activities: THE RELIEF OF ALL  DISABLED PERSONS AND THEIR CARERS WITHIN DORSET AND THE SURROUNDING AREAS BY THE PROVISION OF AN ADVICE AND INFORMATION SERVICE THE PROVISION OF A SHOP FACILITY STOCKING A LARGE CHOICE OF AIDS FOR DAILY LIVING AND AN EQUIPMENT LOAN/HIRE SERVICE ALL OUR VOLUNTEERS ARE UNPAID
objects: TO RELIEVE PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES LIVING IN DORSET AND SURROUNDING AREAS SO THAT THEY MAY LEAD ACTIVE AND FULFILLING LIVES INTEGRATED IN SOCIETY.

name: CALDBECK PLAY AREA ASSOCIATION
activities: Continuing to explore opportunties to provide a play area for the children of Caldbeck
objects: TO PROVIDE AND MAINTAIN A RECREATIONAL GROUND FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF THE PARISH OF CALDBECK AND THE SURROUNDING AREA

name: HARROGATE CHURCH HOUSE TRUST
activities: To advance the Christian religion, to relieve poverty, to advance education and to further any other charitable purpose by making grants to Churches and in such other ways as the trustees think fit.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN RELIGION, TO RELIEVE POVERTY, TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND TO FURTHER ANY OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSE BY MAKING GRANTS TO CHURCHES AND IN SUCH OTHER WAYS AS THE TRUSTEES THINK FIT.

name: REDBRIDGE EDUCATION & SOCIAL WELFARE SUPPORT GROUP
activities: Some of our main are: healthy eating classes, swimming, keep fit and classes, drop in session, ESOL classes, support members with other training needs and job searching.
objects: 1. TO RELIEVE THOSE WHO ARE IN NEED THROUGH THE PROVISION OF ADVICE, INFORMATION AND COUNSELLING AND IN SUCH OTHER WAYS AS THE CHARITY THROUGH ITS EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MAY DECIDE.  2. TO PROVIDE AND ASSIST IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES AND ACTIVITIES FOR EDUCATION, RECREATION AND OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION IN THE INTEREST OF SOCIAL WELFARE AND WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE OF CHILDREN, WOMEN, ELDERLY AND DISABLED PEOPLE FROM MULTI CULTURAL BACKGROUND

name: SOLIDARITY CATALYST LIMITED
activities: RELIEF OF POVERTY IN SUCH WAYS AS MAY BE THOUGHT FIT, INCLUDING ASSISTANCE TO FIND EMPLOYMENT ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION, TRAINING OR RETRAINING
objects: THE PROMOTION FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT OF URBAN OR RURAL REGENERATION IN AREAS OF SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC DEPRIVATION WITHIN GREATER MANCHESTER BY ALL OR ANY OF THE FOLLOWING MEANS:  A)	THE RELIEF OF POVERTY IN SUCH WAYS AS MAY BE THOUGHT FIT;  B)	THE RELIEF OF UNEMPLOYMENT IN SUCH WAYS AS MAY BE THOUGHT FIT, INCLUDING ASSISTANCE TO FIND EMPLOYMENT;  C)	THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION, TRAINING OR RETRAINING, PARTICULARLY AMONG UNEMPLOYED PEOPLE, AND PROVIDING UNEMPLOYED PEOPLE WITH WORK EXPERIENCE;  D)	THE PROVISION OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, OR BUSINESS ADVICE OR CONSULTANCY IN ORDER TO PROVIDE TRAINING AND EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR UNEMPLOYED PEOPLE IN CASES OF FINANCIAL OR OTHER CHARITABLE NEED THROUGH HELP:  I)	IN SETTING UPTHEIR OWN BUSINESS, OR  II)	TO EXISTING BUSINESSES;  E)	THE CREATION OF TRAINING AND EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES BY THE PROVISION OF WORKSHOPS, BUILDINGS AND / OR LAND FOR USE ON FAVOURABLE TERMS.

name: CELESTIAL CHURCH OF CHRIST GOD'S LOVE IS ETERNAL PARISH
activities: We are in the business of spreading the gospel of our Lord Jesus Christ, ensuring that the love peace and justice represented by the Lord is propagated throughout England and Wales
objects: THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE CHRISTIAN FAITH, BOTH WITHIN THE UK AND OVERSEAS, BY SUCH EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE MEANS AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL FROM TIME TO TIME DETERMINE.

name: GAYTON CHURCH HERITAGE TRUST
activities: Initiating, developing and organising activities which will sustain and expand the use of the church as a community facility. Developing a close working relationship with the Parochial Church Council. Informing parishioners and the general public of the objectives, activities and progress of the GCHT. Fund-raising through donations, covenants, social events and funding organisations.
objects: THE PRESERVATION, REPAIR, RESTORATION, MAINTENANCE AND/OR IMPROVEMENT FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT OF THE FABRIC, MAJOR FITTINGS AND ORNAMENTS OF THE PARISH CHURCH OF ST. MARY THE VIRGIN, GAYTON, NORTHANTS, ITS CHURCHYARD AND ANCILLARY BUILDINGS, TOGETHER WITH THE PROVISION OF SUCH ADDITIONAL FACILITIES TO ENHANCE PUBLIC WORSHIP AND COMMUNITY USE OF THE CHURCH AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL FROM TIME TO TIME DETERMINE.

name: CAMBRIDGE CHINESE COMMUNITY CENTRE
activities: The charity aims to promote the benefit of the community of Cambridge. By associating together the Chinese people and the local authorities and other organisations in a common effort to relieve poverty and sickness, advance education, promote racial harmony and provide facilities for recreation and leisure time occupation with the object of improving the conditions of life of the said community.
objects: TO PROMOTE THE BENEFIT OF THE COMMUNITY OF CAMBRIDGE, PARTICULARLY BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY THE CHINESE COMMUNITY, BY ASSOCIATING TOGETHER THE CHINESE PEOPLE AND THE LOCAL AUTHORITIES AND OTHER ORGANISATIONS IN A COMMON EFFORT TO RELIEVE POVERTY AND SICKNESS, ADVANCE EDUCATION, PROMOTE RACIAL HARMONY AND PROVIDE FACILITIES FOR RECREATION AND LEISURE-TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE OF THE SAID COMMUNITY.

name: Blind without Borders
activities: To promote community participation in healthy recreation, mainly amongst blind or partially sighted people within Greater London. To provide training sessions for playing Goalball regularly and also to take part in such sports activities from time-to-time.  Membership of London Goalball Club is open to all visually impaired persons, in London.
objects: THE PROMOTION WITHIN THE GREATER LONDON AREA OF COMMUNITY PARTICIPATION IN HEALTHY RECREATION, IN PARTICULAR AMONG BLIND OR PARTIALLY SIGHTED PERSONS, BY THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR PLAYING GOALBALL AND OTHER SPORTS.

name: THE FOWLER FOUNDATION FOR CHILDREN WITH AIDS
activities: The relief of sickness among children suffering from Hiv/Aids, in particular but not by way of limitation by the provision of support, accommodation, medicine, food and clothing. The advancement of education among children with Hiv/Aids based on Christian values and in a Christian environment.
objects: 1. THE RELIEF OF SICKNESS AMONG CHILDREN SUFFERING FROM HIV/AIDS, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT BY WAY OF LIMITATION BY THE PROVISION OF SUPPORT, ACCOMMODATION, MEDICINE, FOOD AND CLOTHING.  2. THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION AMONG CHILDREN WITH HIV/AIDS BASED ON CHRISTIAN VALUES AND IN A CHRISTIAN ENVIRONMENT.

name: SIERRA LEONE - DEVELOPMENT ACTION SUPPORT AGENCY (DASA)
activities: DASA work with Children/young people, people with disabilities, makes grant to individuals, elderly/old people, education/training, economic/community/development/employment, and support the disadvantage and poor in the United Kingdom Sierra Leone community in Sierra Leone.
objects: (I)  THE RELIEF OF POVERTY HARDSHIP AND DISTRESS AMONG THE INHABITANTS OF SIERRA LEONE BY THE PROVISION OF AGRICULTURAL EQUIPMENT AND TOOLS, SEEDS AND OTHER NECESSITIES TO ENABLE THEM TO GROW FOOD AND AT THE DISCRETION OF THE TRUSTEES BY THE PROVISIONOF OTHER MATERIALS OR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE.    (II)  THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION AMONG THE INHABITANTS OF SIERRA LEONE, IN PARTICULAR WOMEN, CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE, BY THE PROVISION OF ASSISTANCE IN MEETING THE COST OF ACCESSING EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES AND BY THE PROVISION OF INFORMATION AND ADVICE ON RELATED SUBJECTS.    (III)  THE PRESERVATION AND PROTECTION OF GOOD HEALTH AMONG THE INHABITANTS OF SIERRA LEONE BY THE PROVISION OF HEALTHCARE INFORMATION, IN PARTICULAR RELATING TO HIV/AIDS,TOGETHER WITH CONTRACEPTIVES AND OTHER BASIC HEALTH SUPPLIES.

name: ENFIELD LGBT NETWORK
activities: We are a consortium of voluntary/statutory sector organisations & individuals living or working in the borough. Our aim is to improve services for the Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual & Trans people of Enfield. We do this through providing support services directly to our community and by supporting other service providers in making their services more appropriate to the needs of the LGBT community.
objects: (1) TO PROMOTE THE BENEFIT OF MEMBERS OF THE LESBIAN, GAY, BISEXUAL & TRANSGENDERED COMMUNITY WITHIN THE LONDON BOROUGH OF ENFIELD AND SURROUNDING AREAS (THE BENEFICIARIES) BY ASSOCIATING TOGETHER LOCAL AUTHORITIES, VOLUNTARY BODIES AND THE SAID  BENEFICIARIES IN A COMMON EFFORT TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND RELIEVE POVERTY, HARDSHIP AND DISTRESS AMONG THE BENEFICIARIES, WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THEIR CONDITIONS OF  LIFE.  (2) TO PROMOTE SUCH OTHER GENERAL CHARITABLE PURPOSES FOR THE BENEFIT OF THELESBIAN, GAY, BISEXUAL & TRANSGENDERED COMMUNITY WITHIN THE LONDON BOROUGH OF ENFIELD AND SURROUNDING AREAS AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL FROM TIME TO TIME DETERMINE.

name: BRITISH EYE RESEARCH FOUNDATION
activities: Fight for Sight funds pioneering research into the prevention and treatment of blindness and eye disease.
objects: 1. TO CARRY OUT RESEARCH INTO AND TO MAKE GRANTS FOR THE PURPOSE OF RESEARCH INTO AND PROMOTE BY ALL AVAILABLE MEANS THE STUDY OF DISEASE IN RELATION TO THE EYE AND ALLIED SUBJECTS AND GENERALLY TO IMPROVE THE STANDARD OF KNOWLEDGE OF THE MEANS OF PREVENTION, DIAGNOSIS AND METHODS OF TREATMENT AND CURE THEREOF; AND  2. TO DO ALL OTHER THINGS AS ARE INCIDENTAL OR CONDUCIVE TO THE ATTAINMENT OF THE ABOVE OBJECTS AND ARE CONSIDERED TO BE CHARITABLE WITHIN THE LAWS OF ENGLAND AND WALES.

name: Melin Community Trust
activities: Volunteer support Technology centre Walking group Support local groups neighbourhood watch support Christmas street lighting & event Mayday in Melin fete working with various youth projects environment enhancement & clean-ups local community magazine produced when able advice services & training provided through Melin advice centre Support Initiatives set by Government Agencies
objects: (1) TO PROMOTE THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF MELINCRYDDAN / NEATH EAST AND NEIGHBOURING AREAS TOGETHER DEFINED BY THE BOUNDARIES OF THE COUNTY BOROUGH OF NEATH PORT TALBOT (HEREINAFTER CALLED "AREA OF BENEFIT") WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF GENDER, RACE,ABILITY SEXUAL ORIENTATION, AGE OR OF POLITICAL, RELIGIOUS OR OTHER OPINIONS, BY ASSOCIATING TOGETHER THE SAID INHABITANTS AND THE LOCAL AUTHORITIES, STATUTORY AUTHORITIES, VOLUNTARY AND OTHER ORGANISATIONS IN A COMMON EFFORT TO ADVANCE THE AREA OF BENEFIT ECONOMICALLY, SOCIALLY, ENVIRONMENTALLY, CULTURALLY AND THROUGH THE PROVISION OF OPPORTUNITIES, INCLUDING THOSE IN THE FIELDS OF EDUCATION AND TRAINING, WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF THE LIFE OF THE SAID INHABITANTS.  (2)  TO PROMOTE URBAN REGENERATION FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE SAID INHABITANTS IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT (AN AREA OF SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC DEPRIVATION) BY ALL OR ANY OF THE FOLLOWING MEANS:  (A)  THE RELIEF OF FINANCIAL HARDSHIP:  (B)  THE RELIEF OF UNEMPLOYMENT:  (C)THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION, TRAINING OR RETRAINING, PARTICULARLY AMONG UNEMPLOYED PEOPLE, AND PROVIDING UNEMPLOYED PEOPLE WITH WORK EXPERIENCE:  (D)  THE MAINTENANCE, IMPROVEMENT OR PROVISION OF PUBLIC AMENITIES:  (E)  THE PROVISION OF OR ASSISTANCE IN THE PROVISION OF RECREATIONAL FACILITIES FOR THE PUBLIC AT LARGE OR THOSE WHO  BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, AGE, INFIRMITY OR DISABLEMENT, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES, HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES:  (F)  THE PROTECTION  OR CONSERVATION OF THE ENVIRONMENT:  (G)  THE PROMOTION OF PUBLIC SAFETY AND PREVENTION OF CRIME:  (3)   TO ENCOURAGE PARTICIPATION OF THE SAID INHABITANTS IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT IN THE REGENERATION OF THE COMMUNITY.

name: BELZ COMMUNITIES
activities: The charity provides educational & recreation services to members of the Orthodox Jewish faith. It runs after school activities for children, provides support for the elderly.
objects: A) TO PROMOTE, ADVANCE AND PROVIDE STRICTLY ORTHODOX JEWISH EDUCATION AND TO GENERALLY FURTHER AND PROMOTE ALL ACTIVITIES IN CONNECTION THEREWITH.  B) TO PROMOTE AND ADVANCE RELIGION IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE DOCTRINES AND PRINCIPLES OF ORTHODOX JUDAISM.C) TO PROMOTE THE RELIEF OF POVERTY AMONGST PERSONS OF THE JEWISH FAITH.  D) TO FURTHER SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES WHICH THE TRUSTEES MAY DETERMINE ARE CONNECTED WITH THE ABOVE CLAUSES.

name: TUBBS TURF MANAGEMENT COMMITTEE
activities: Tubbs Turf Management Committee is a charity formed to manage and run Tubbs Turf, a small multi sports facility within the village of Kingswood Gloucestershire. The charities main function is  is to maintain the facility for the benefit of the residence of the Parish of Kingswood Gloucestershire.
objects: THE PROPERTY AND THE TRUST FUND AND ITS INCOME SHALL BE APPLIED FOR THE PURPOSES OF A RECREATION GROUND AND GARDENS FOR THE USE OF THE INHABITANTS OF THE PARISH OF KINGSWOOD WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF SEX, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, AGE, DISABILITY, NATIONALITY,RACE OR POLITICAL, RELIGIOUS OR OTHER OPINIONS, INCLUDING USE OF THE PROPERTY FOR THE PLAYING OF BALL GAMES, COACHING OR OTHER APPROPRIATE FORMS OF RECREATION AND LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION AS APPROVED FROM TIME TO TIME BY THE CHARITY IN THE  INTERESTSOF SOCIAL WELFARE AND WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR THE SAID INHABITANTS.

name: FRIENDS OF EZRA
activities: Fundraising from individuals and organisations to enable the charity to have funds to make donations in accordance with its' objectives.
objects: A) TO ADVANCE JEWISH RELIGIOUS EDUCATION IN THE UNITED KINGDOM  B) TO PROMOTE THE WELFARE OF JEWS IN ANY MANNER WHICH IS NOW OR HEREINAFTER MAY BE DEEMED TO BE CHARITABLE IN PARTICULAR BY THE PROVISION OF ASSISTANCE IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION FOR SUCH PERSONS WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE.  C) OTHER CHARITABLE ACTIVITIES THAT THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME DETERMINE.

name: THE TUTBURY CASTLE TRUST
activities: Advance the education of the public in the subject of Tutbury Castle and environs.  Promote and support research into the history and archaeology.  Develop educational material and resources.
objects: (A) THE PROMOTION AND SUPPORT OF RESEARCH INTO THE HISTORY AND ARCHAEOLOGY OF TUTBURY CASTLE AND OF THE HONOUR OF TUTBURY; (B) THE PROMOTION OF INTEREST IN AND AWARENESS OF THE LOCAL HISTORICAL ENVIRONMENT; (C) THE DEVELOPMENT AND DISSEMINATION OF EDUCATIONAL MATERIAL AND RESOURCES ON THE SUBJECT

name: STUDENTS FOR GLOBAL HEALTH
activities: Students for Global Health is a student network tackling global and local health inequalities through education, advocacy and community action. We have over 30 branches in universities across the UK, many nationally run activities (comprising projects and campaigns) and several national working groups.
objects: THE CHARITY'S OBJECTS ("THE OBJECTS") ARE:  THE PROMOTION OF HEALTH FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY SEEKING TO REDUCE INEQUALITIES IN HEALTH (AND HEALTHCARE) IN THE UK AND ABROAD;  THE ADVANCEMENT OF HEALTH EDUCATIONIN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY INCREASING AWARENESS OF GLOBAL HEALTH ISSUES AMONGST HEALTHCARE STUDENTS AND THE WIDER COMMUNITY WITH THE AIM TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY AND STANDARD OF GLOBAL HEALTH (AND HEALTHCARE).

name: GLOBAL HARVEST MINISTRIES
activities: RELIGIOUS ACTIVITIES
objects: THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE CHRISTIAN FAITH

name: THE STORE HOMELESSNESS PROJECT - A CHRISTIAN MINISTRY TO THE HOMELESS
activities: Ministering to the homeless people generally between the ages of 17-30, but not limited to this age group. The relief of poverty, hardship and distress within the Torridge and North Devon area of benefit, in particular among the homeless.
objects: 4.1  THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE CHRISTIAN FAITH WITHIN THE AREAS OF TORRIDGE AND NORTH DEVON (THE AREA OF BENEFIT) BY SUCH EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE MEANS AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL FROM TIME TO TIME DETERMINE.    4.2  THE RELIEF OF POVERTY HARDSHIP AND DISTRESS WITHIN THE AREA OF BENEFIT, IN PARTICULAR AMONG THE HOMELESS AND/OR THOSE SUFFERING AS A RESULT OF SUBSTANCE ABUSE OR DEPENDENCY, BY THE PROVISION OF MATERIAL OR FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE, TEMPORARY ACCOMMODATION AND ABLUTION FACILITIES OR BY SUCH OTHER EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE MEANS AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL FROM TIME TO TIME DETERMINE.

name: FASHION AWARENESS DIRECT
activities: FAD offers young people the opportunity to get ahead in their creative careers.  We strive for a more inclusive fashion industry and believe that talented young people should be able to progress and thrive, regardless of their personal circumstances, financial situation or ethnic background. We specialise in professional fashion workshops, competitions, mentoring and live industry experiences.
objects: THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION IN FASHION DESIGN AND RELATED SUBJECTS IN GENERAL AND IN PARTICULAR BY PROVIDING AN ANNUAL FASHION COMPETITION AS A MEANS OF PROMOTING ACHIEVEMENT AND ENCOURAGING INTEREST IN THE SUBJECT.

name: MAGGIE HIGGINS MEMORIAL SCHOOL CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: The advancement of education by the provision of financial support and equipment to the Maggie Higgins Memorial in the Thiruannamalai District of Tamil Nadu in particular.
objects: 1. THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION BY THE PROVISION OF FINANCIAL SUPPORT AND EQUIPMENT TO THE MAGGIE HIGGINS MEMORIAL SCHOOL IN THE THIRUVANNAMALAI DISTRICT OF TAMIL NADU IN PARTICULAR.  2. THE RELIEF OF POVERTY, SICKNESS AND DISTRESS BY THE PROVISION OFFACILITIES WHICH WILL PROMOTE GOOD HEALTH BY PROVIDING HEALTH EDUCATION AND HEALTH CARE, INCLUDING PREVENTATIVE CARE.

name: DOWNLAND VOLUNTEER GROUP
activities: We provide transport for persons in the Downland areas of West Berkshire who are elderly, sick or disabled or who are otherwise in need. We take people to Hospitals, Doctors' Surgeries, Dentists, Opticians, to social meetings and to anywhere else that may be appropriate.
objects: TO RELIEVE PERSONS IN THE DOWNLAND AREAS WHO ARE ELDERLY, SICK OR DISABLED OR WHO ARE OTHERWISE IN NEED BY THE PROVISION OF VOLUNTEERS TO ASSIST SUCH PERSONS IN ANY WAY THAT MAY BE REQUIRED

name: HEADSTART4BABIES LIMITED
activities: We aim to raise awareness of plagiocephaly and brachycephaly, providing help and advice to families faced with either condition. We also aim to raise funds to assist families on low incomes to proceed with treatment.
objects: THE RELIEF OF SICKNESS AMONG CHILDREN IN THE UK WHO ARE SUFFERING FROM PLAGIOCEPHALY AND/OR BRACHYCEPHALY BY THE PROVISION OF INFORMATION AND ADVICE TO PARENTS, CARERS AND HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONALS ON NON-INVASIVE HELMET THERAPY AND AT THE DISCRETION OF THE TRUSTEES BY THE PROVISION OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE IN MEETING THE COSTS OF SUCH THERAPY.

name: BUILD A FUTURE IN KENYA
activities: General fund raising activities
objects: TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND TO PRESERVE AND PROTECT GOOD HEALTH AMONG DISABLED AND ECONOMICALLY AND SOCIALLY DISADVANTAGED ORPHANS IN KENYA, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY:  A) PROVIDING, OR ASSISTING IN THE PROVISION OF, THE NECESSARY FACILITIES AND ITEMS FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE ORPHANS  B) SUPPORTING THE BY GRACE DISABLED ORPHANS CENTRE IN NAIROBI TO FURTHER THE SAME.

name: SAFE CHILD AFRICA
activities: Works with Nigerian Partner Organisations to save and transform the lives of vulnerable and stigmatised children; provide education and raise literacy levels of less privilaged children. Through advocacy and campaigning we promote a greater understanding of child rights and aim to prevent abuse of children today.
objects: FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT, TO PROMOTE ANY CHARITABLE PURPOSES FOR THE BENEFIT OF PEOPLE IN NIGERIA WITH PARTICULAR REGARD WHERE APPROPRIATE TO THOSE PURPOSES IN THE UNITED NATIONS CONVENTION ON THE RIGHTS OF THE CHILD INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO:    (I)THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION AND PUBLIC KNOWLEDGE IN RESPECT OF CHILD RIGHTS IN NIGERIA;    (II) THE RELIEF OF POVERTY, SICKNESS AND DISTRESS IN NIGERIA; AND    (III) THE PRESERVATION OF HEALTH AMONG CHILDREN LIVING IN NIGERIA AND THE PROTECTION FROMABUSE AND ALL OTHER INJURIOUS HUMILIATING AND DEGRADING TREATMENT (INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO STREET CHILDREN AND CHILDREN WHO HAVE BEEN ACCUSED OF WITCHCRAFT AND WIZARDRY IN THE NIGER DELTA REGION OF NIGERIA).

name: BETHANY CITY CHURCH SUNDERLAND
activities: Independant evangelical church seeking to reach the people of the north east of England
objects: (A) TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATEMENT OF BELIEFS APPEARING IN THE SCHEDULE HERETO IN SUNDERLAND AND IN SUCH OTHER PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT AND TO FULFIL SUCHOTHER PURPOSES WHICH ARE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE ACCORDING TO THE LAW OF ENGLAND AND WALES AND ARE CONNECTED WITH THE CHARITABLE WORK OF THE TRUST  (B) TO RELIEVE PERSONS WHO ARE IN CONDITIONS OF NEED OR HARDSHIP OR WHO ARE AGED OR SICK AND TO RELIEVETHE DISTRESS CAUSED THEREBY IN THE SAID LOCATION AND IN SUCH OTHER PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT

name: SHREE RAJ SAUBHAG SATSANG MANDAL UK
activities: Raj Saubhag is committed to:  Promotion of Jain philosophy  Support educational projects in rural areas mainly in Gujarat India. Support institutions specialising in rehabilitation of physically disadvantaged children. Support provison of medical services through institutions Generally help those below the poverty line No individual grants are made
objects: PRIMARILY, BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY WITHIN SAYLA, SURENDRANAGAR DISTRICT OF GUJARAT, INDIA;  1. THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE JAIN RELIGION;  2. THE RELIEF OF POVERTY, SICKNESS AND DISTRESS AMONGST PEOPLE IN NEED;  3. THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION, IN PARTICULAR OF CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE;  4. THE RELIEF OF FINANCIAL NEED AND SUFFERING AMONG VICTIMS OF NATURAL OR OTHER KINDS OF DISASTER IN THE FORM OF MONEY (OR OTHER MEANS DEEMED SUITABLE) FOR PERSONS, BODIES, ORGANISATIONS AND/OR COUNTRIES AFFECTED, INCLUDING THE PROVISION OF MEDICAL AID;  5. TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN THE CONSERVATION, PROTECTION AND IMPROVEMENT OF THE PHYSICAL AND NATURAL ENVIRONMENT;  6. TO PROMOTE HUMANE BEHAVIOUR TOWARDS ANIMALS BY PROVIDING APPROPRIATE CARE, PROTECTION, TREATMENT AND SECURITY FOR ANIMALS WHICH ARE IN NEED OF CARE AND ATTENTION BY REASON OF SICKNESS, MALTREATMENT, POOR CIRCUMSTANCES OR ILL USAGE.

name: FAMILY COUNSELLING TRUST
activities: Provides information, assistance and guidance for children, young people and families of limited means in Dorset, Somerset, Wiltshire and Hampshire to receive counselling, commissioning counsellors on a case by case basis and meeting the costs as far as possible; provides counselling for families on higher incomes while meeting less costs.
objects: 1 THE RELIEF OF SICKNESS AND THE PRESERVATION OF HEALTH AMONGST PEOPLE RESIDING PERMANENTLY OR TEMPORARILY IN THE UNITED KINGDOM BY PROVIDING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE FOR, AND FACILITATING ACCESS TO MENTAL HEALTH COUNSELLING, THERAPY AND OTHER SUCH SUPPORT SERVICES WHICH ARE DEEMED CHARITABLE ACCORDING TO THE LAWS OF ENGLAND AND WALES.  2.  TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN THE SUBJECT OF MENTAL HEALTH PROBLEMS AND TREATMENTS AVAILABLE.  3. FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE TRAINEE PRACTITIONERS ENROLLED ON MENTAL HEALTH COUNSELLING, THERAPY AND/SUPPORT OR ASSOCIATED COURSE IN PARTICULAR BY PROVIDING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO ASSIST THEM WITH THE COST OF TRAINING.

name: BRADFORD COUNSELLING SERVICES
activities: We provide a completely confidential counselling service for people aged 13 and over and on any issue. Our aim is to provide an affordable, safe and confidential environment for people to talk about their deepest personal issues and enable them to make changes in their lives and behaviour that are right for them.
objects: TO RELIEVE AND PREVENT SUFFERING CAUSED BY MENTAL OR PHYSICAL ILL HEALTH OR BY SOCIAL OR ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES, BY ESTABLISHING AND MAINTAINING A CONFIDENTIAL COUNSELLING SERVICE FOR PEOPLE OF ALL AGES BUT PRIMARILY FOR YOUNG PEOPLE BETWEEN THE AGES OF 13 AND 25, AND TO PROVIDE TRAINING IN COUNSELLING SKILLS AND PERSONAL DEVELOPMENT.

name: RAISE LIMITED
activities: We provide welfare rights and debt advice and casework assistance, and financial inclusion advice by home visit and telephone to Housing Association tenants in Merseyside, and to other residents of Liverpool, and training in welfare rights, debt and financial literacy to the general public. We also provide support to social housing tenants aimed at improving their financial confidence.
objects: TO RELIEVE POOR PERSONS BY THE PROVISION TO SUCH PERSONS OF LEGAL AND ADVICE SERVICES WHICH THEY COULD NOT OTHERWISE OBTAIN THROUGH LACK OF MEANS; AND  TO PROMOTE AND ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC BY THE IMPROVEMENT AND DIFFUSION OF KNOWLEDGE AND PRACTICE OF THE LAW AND ADMINISTRATION OF JUSTICE HAVING REGARD ESPECIALLY TO THOSE AREAS OF LAW AND PRACTICE WHICH ARE OF CONCERN TO POOR PEOPLE AND WHICH ARE DIRECTED TO RELIEF OF POVERTY; AND  TO PROMOTE OTHER CHARITABLE OBJECTS FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE COMMUNITY.

name: 7 WAVES COMMUNITY RADIO
activities: Provision of multi media training together with the operation of a community radio station
objects: 3.1 TO ADVANCE EDUCATION FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT IN THE WIRRAL AND SURROUNDING AREAS;  3.2 TO ASSIST THOSE PERSONS WHO ARE UNEMPLOYED OR OTHERWISE DISADVANTAGED, BY PROVIDING TRAINING WHICH ASSISTS SUCH PERSONS TO BECOME SELF SUPPORTING, GAIN EMPLOYMENT OR MOVE ON TO FURTHER EDUCATION.  3.3 TO ASSIST ANY CHARITABLE BODY OR BODIES, WHICH ASSISTANCE MAY INCLUDE INFORMING THE COMMUNITY OF THE COMPANY'S OR THEIR ACTIVITIES;  3.4 SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE OBJECTS AS MAY FROM TIME TO TIME BE DETERMINED BY THE TRUSTEES.

name: BRIGHTWELL-CUM-SOTWELL WOMEN'S INSTITUTE
activities: Monthly meetings with a wide selection of speakers;2 x book groups, quilting group, garden visits, day visits to Denman College, fund-raising lunches, stall at village fete, theatre trips, WI outings, walks, fundraising for ACWW and local projects eg: Village Shop fund.
objects: TO ENABLE WOMEN WHO ARE INTERESTED IN ISSUES ASSOCIATED WITH RURAL LIFE, INCLUDING ARTS, CRAFTS AND SCIENCES, TO IMPROVE AND DEVELOP CONDITIONS OF RURAL LIFE, TO ADVANCE THEIR EDUCATION IN CITIZENSHIP, IN PUBLIC QUESTIONS BOTH NATIONAL AND INTERNATIONAL, IN MUSIC, DRAMA AND OTHER CULTURAL SUBJECTS AND IN ALL BRANCHES OF AGRICULTURE, HANDICRAFTS, HOME ECONOMICS, HEALTH AND  SOCIAL WELFARE. IT SEEKS TO GIVE WOMEN THE OPPORTUNITY OF WORKING TOGETHER THROUGH THE WOMEN'S INSTITUTE ORGANISATION, AND OFPUTTING INTO PRACTICE THOSE IDEALS FOR WHICH IT STANDS.

name: ACTION FOR ULNES WALTON
activities: ACTIVIES FOR YEAR 07/08 INCLUDED FLY TYING COURSE AND PLANTING OF A FRUIT AND NUT HEDGE TO PROVIDE A WILD-LIFE HABITAT AND ALSO A WILLOW ARBOUR BENCH FOR PEOPLE TO ENJOY. WE HAVE ALSO BEEN WORKING ON WALKING LEAFLETS TO PROVIDE BOTH LOCALS AND VISITORS WITH CIRCULAR ROUTES THEY MAY WISH TO TAKE THROUGH OUR COUNTRYSIDE. WE ALSO HELD A BREATHING PLACES OPEN DAY AND TOOK PART IN THE VILLAGE GALA DAY
objects: (I) FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF ULNES WALTON AND SURROUNDING AREAS, (WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF SEX, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, RACE OR POLITICAL, RELIGIOUS OR OTHER OPINIONS) BY ASSOCIATION WITH LOCAL AUTHORITIES, VOLUNTARY ORGANISATIONS AND INHABITANTS IN A COMMON EFFORT, PRIMARILY BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY, BY THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION, THE PROMOTION, PROTECTION, PRESERVATION AND IMPROVEMENT OF THE NATURAL AND BUILT ENVIRONMENT; AND  (II) BY THE PROVISION OR ASSISTANCE IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATIONS WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE OF THE SAID INHABITANTS.HARITABLE PURPOSE WHICH THE COMPANY SHALL CONSIDER CALCULATED TO PROMOTE ITS OBJECTS OR ANY OF THEM.  (D) ADVANCE GRANTS AND SCHOLARSHIPS TO SUITABLE QUALIFIED STUDENTS TO UNDERTAKE RESEARCH.

name: NEWTOWN COMMUNITY LEARNING CENTRE
activities: The charity provides daycare and holiday club places and manages facilities on Newtown school campus for the benefit of the local community. It is also a main partner in Carlisle West Children's Centre which develops family services in the area.
objects: 1) TO PROMOTE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF NEWTOWN WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF SEX, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, RACE OR POLITICAL, RELIGIOUS OR OTHER OPINIONS, BY ASSOCIATING TOGETHER THE SAID INHABITANTS AND THE LOCAL AUTHORITIES, VOLUNTARY AND OTHER ORGANISATIONS IN A COMMON EFFORT TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND TO PROVIDE FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION AND OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE OF THE SAID INHABITANTS;  II) TO ESTABLISH OR SECURE THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A COMMUNITY CENTRE (HEREINAFTER CALLED "THE CENTRE") AND TO MAINTAIN AND MANAGE THE SAME (WHETHER ALONE OR IN CO-OPERATION WITH ANY LOCAL AUTHORITY OR PERSON OR BODY) IN FURTHERANCE OF THESE OBJECTS.

name: AANCHAL WOMEN'S AID LTD
activities: The companys objects and principal activities are to:  To provide support, assistance and advice to women and children who have experienced or who are experiencing domestic violence; and The advancement of education and other charitable purposes which help and benefit the community.
objects: (I) TO PROVIDE SUPPORT, ASSISTANCE AND ADVICE TO WOMEN WHO HAVE EXPERIENCED OR WHO ARE EXPERIENCING DOMESTIC VIOLENCE;  (II) TO PROVIDE SUPPORT, ASSISTANCE AND ADVICE TO THE CHILDREN OF WOMEN WHO HAVE EXPERIENCED OR WHO ARE EXPERIENCING DOMESTIC VIOLENCE; AND  (III) THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION AND OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES WHICH HELP AND BENEFIT THE COMMUNITY.

name: SCHOOLS AROUND THE WORLD
activities: The activities undertaken vary from area to area and school to school depending on what is required.  They all have one thing in common, to increase 'inspirations for aspirations'.  So far this has been done through a variety of educational activities.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF CHILDREN AND YOUNG ADULTS UNDER THE AGE OF 25 WHOSE OPPORTUNITIES ARE LIMITED BY SOCIAL, DOMESTIC OR FINANCIAL CIRCUMSTANCES BY PROVIDING OR ASSISTING IN THE PROVISION OF A FORMAL EDUCATION AND/OR BY THE PROVISION OF OPPORTUNITIES FOR WORK AND CULTURAL EXPERIENCES OUTSIDE A FORMAL EDUCATION TO ENHANCE THEIR OVERALL DEVELOPMENT AND LEARNING.

name: BRIDPORT AREA OLDER PEOPLES FORUM
activities: We provide recreational and leisure time activities for older people in Bridport and the surrounding area.
objects: THE RELIEF OF OLDER PEOPLE IN BRIDPORT AND SURROUNDING AREAS OF DORSET (THE BENEFICIARIES) BY ASSOCIATING VOLUNTARY, STATUTORY AND OTHER AGENCIES AND INDIVIDUALS IN A COMMON EFFORT TO RELIEVE POVERTY HARDSHIP AND DISTRESS AND PRESERVE AND PROTECT THE GOOD HEALTH OF THE BENEFICIARIES AND TO PROVIDE FACILITIES FOR RECREATION AND LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE.

name: Citizens Advice South Essex Limited
activities: To provide free, impartial and confidential advice and information to our clients on a range of issues that may include debt, welfare benefits, housing, employment, health and relationships.
objects: The Charity's objects are to promote any charitable purpose for the public benefit by the advancement of education, the protection and preservation of health and the relief of poverty, sickness and distress in particular, but without limitation, for the benefit of the community in the local authority areas of Basildon, Brentwood, Castle Point, Rochford, Thurrock and surrounding areas.

name: CHILD BRAIN INJURY TRUST
activities: The Child Brain Injury Trust provides support, information and training for anyone affected by childhood acquired brain injury throughout the United Kingdom.
objects: THE RELIEF OF BRAIN INJURED CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES BY PROVIDING TREATMENT, SUPPORT AND REHABILITATION, PROMOTING RESEARCH INTO THE CAUSES AND TREATMENT OF BRAIN INJURIES, ADVANCING PUBLIC KNOWLEDGE AND UNDERSTANDING OF BRAIN INJURIES TO CHILDREN AND IN SUCH OTHER WAYS AS THE TRUSTEES THINK FIT

name: THE (DAYALBAGH) RADHASOAMI SATSANG ASSOCIATION OF EUROPE
activities: We do Satsang (Prayer) and cultural activities for children.Quiz pro gramme. Celebrations of special  religious events.
objects: (I)  TO ADVANCE THE RADHASOAMI FAITH FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC AND IN PARTICULAR BY -  (A)  PROVIDING FACILITIES FOR PROPAGATION OF RADHASOAMI FAITH AND TO DISSEMINATE ITS TEACHINGS.  (B)  MAKING ARRANGEMENT FOR THE HOLDING OF SATSANG AND CELEBRATIONS OF BHANDARAS THROUGHOUT THE AREA OF OPERATION OF THE ASSOCIATION.  (C)  DOING ALL SUCH THINGS AS MAY BE CONDUCIVE FOR THE PROMOTION OF RELIGIOUS IDEALS AND SERVICE TO MANKIND AMONG THE PUBLIC AT LARGE.  (D)  HELPING SABHA IN KEEPING GENERAL CONTROL ON THE CONDUCT OF SATSANGIS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE SATSANG'S IDEALS.  (E)  CULTIVATING A SPIRIT OF COOPERATION AND ORGANISED ACTION IN AND AMONG BRANCH SATSANGS IN GENERAL AND SATSANGIS IN PARTICULAR AND OTHER SATSANG INSTITUTIONS OF THE REGION(II)  TO RELIEVE NEEDS ARISING AS A RESULT OF FINANCIAL HARDSHIP, SICKNESS, OLD AGE OR YOUTH.

name: THE HELP UGANDA TRUST
activities: Works with local charities and individuals in Uganda to relieve poverty and sickness and to provide education for children and others in need. The charity works particularly closely with the St Michael's Children Home in Nsambya. The charity also seeks to raise awareness in the UK of issues of poverty in Uganda.
objects: THE RELIEF OF POVERTY AND SICKNESS AND THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION WHETHER GENERALLY OR INDIVIDUALLY OF CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE IN UGANDA, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY THE CHILDREN OF THE ST MICHAEL'S CHILDREN'S HOME IN NSAMBYA, KAMPALA, BY MAKING GRANTS OF MONEY FOR PROVIDING OR PAYING FOR ITEMS, SERVICES OR FACILITIES OR THROUGH THE PROVISION OF GOODS OR SERVICES OR GRANTS.

name: WYVERN COMMUNITY TRANSPORT
activities: Wyvern Community Transport provides fully accessible transport to permanent residents of Rochford District and Castle Point Borough on an individual basis who are unable to access public transport.
objects: TO PROVIDE A COMMUNITY TRANSPORT SERVICE FOR SUCH OF THE INHABITANTS OF ROCHFORD DISTRICT AND SURROUNDING AREAS WHO ARE IN NEED OF SUCH A SERVICE BECAUSE OF AGE, SICKNESS OR DISABILITY (MENTAL OR PHYSICAL), OR POVERTY, OR BECAUSE OF A LACK OF AVAILABILITY OF ADEQUATE AND SAFE PUBLIC PASSENGER SERVICES

name: KINGS CHURCH DARLINGTON
activities: The charity exists to advance the Christian faith and also bring relief to persons in conditions of need, hardship or distress or who are aged or sick. Further objectives are the advancement of education on the basis of Christian principles, and to provide or assist in the provision of facilities in the interests of social welfare.
objects: 1. THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE CHRISTIAN FAITH IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE ARTICLES OF FAITH SET OUT IN ARTICLE 34;  2. THE RELIEF OF PERSONS WHO ARE IN CONDITIONS OF NEED, HARDSHIP OR DISTRESS OR WHO ARE AGED OR SICK;  3. THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION ON THE BASIS OF CHRISTIAN PRINCIPLES; AND  4. TO PROVIDE OR ASSIST IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION OF INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, AGE,INFIRMITY OR DISABILITY, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES OR FOR THE PUBLIC AT LARGE WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE.

name: WARNING ZONE LIMITED
activities: Education of children and adults in relation to safety issues in all aspects of everyday life through the operation of a safety education centre. Working with other bodies to improve the quality of life by: encouraging public involvement in the prevention and solution of crime; reduction of crime and anti social behaviour; and education, information and practical assistance on crime prevention.
objects: 3.1 TO EDUCATE CHILDREN AND ADULTS GENERALLY AND IN PARTICULAR THOSE CHILDREN AND ADULTS RESIDING IN LEICESTER, LEICESTERSHIRE AND RUTLAND AND NEIGHBOURING COUNTIES AND TO FOSTER THEIR AWARENESS OF SAFETY ISSUES IN EVERYDAY LIFE INCLUDING (BUT NOT LIMITED TO) SAFETY IN THE HOUSE OF WORKPLACE, IN EDUCATIONAL ESTABLISHMENTS, ON THE ROADS, OR DURING ANY LEISURE ACTIVITIES.  3.2 TO WORK IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE PRIVATE, PUBLIC AND VOLUNTARY SECTORS OF THE COMMUNITY TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE IN LEICESTER, LEICESTERSHIRE AND RUTLAND AND NEIGHBOURING COUNTIES BY:  A) ENCOURAGEMENT OF GREATER PUBLIC PARTICIPATION IN THE PREVENTION AND SOLUTION OF CRIME;  B) ASSISTING IN MEASURES DESIGNED TO REDUCE THE LEVEL OF CRIME;  C) THE PROVISION OF EDUCATION, INFORMATION AND PRACTICAL ASSISTANCE ON CRIME PREVENTION.

OFFERING APPROPRIATE PLAY EDUCATION AND CARE FACILITIES AND TRAINING COURSES, TOGETHER WITH THE RIGHT OF PARENTS TO TAKE RESPONSIBILITY FOR AND TO BECOME INVOLVED IN THE ACTIVITIES OF SUCH GROUPS, ENSURING THAT SUCH GROUPS OFFER OPPORTUNITIES FOR ALL CHILDREN WHATEVER THEIR RACE, CULTURE, RELIGION, MEANS OR ABILITY;  2. ENCOURAGING THE STUDY OF THE NEEDS OF SUCH CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES AND PROMOTING PUBLIC INTEREST AND RECOGNITION OF SUCH NEEDS;  3. INSTIGATING AND ADHERING TO AND FURTHERING THE AIMS OF THE PRE-SCHOOL LEARNING ALLIANCE

objects: A TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES OF NOTTINGHAMSHIRE, IN PARTICULAR THE PROVISION OF LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES, TRAINING AND SUPPORT PROJECTS;  B TO RELIEVE SICKNESS AND DISTRESS, AND TO PROMOTE GOOD HEALTH BY MEANS OF AWARENESS AND EDUCATIONAL PROJECTS;  C TO RELIEVE POVERTY, BY MEANS OF, BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY, DEVELOPMENT OF AND SUPPORT FOR SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT PROJECTS IN THE AREAS OF THE WORLD, PARTICULARLY IN SOUTH ASIA.

name: WORLD REPAIRERS GLOBAL NETWORK AKA CHRIST THE REPAIRER'S MINISTRY
activities: The advancement of the Christian religion for the benefit of the public in accordance with the doctrines appearing in the schedule attached to the constitution in particular but not exclusively through the provision of missionary work worldwide and to relieve financial hardship of the poor and underprivileged worldwide.
objects: 1. THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE CHRISTIAN RELIGION FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE DOCTRINES APPEARING IN THE SCHEDULE ATTACHED TO THE CONSTITUTION IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY THROUGH THE PROVISION OF MISSIONARY WORK WORLDWIDE; AND  2. TO RELIEVE FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OF THE POOR AND UNDERPRIVILEGED WORLDWIDE.

name: THE LALIBELA EDUCATIONAL TRUST
activities: The charity gives grants to poor children and families in Lalibela, Ethiopia. This to enable the children to attend school and to complete their further education and professional training in  establishments outside Lalibela, but in Ethiopia. A health fund has also been set up for the students and their families.
objects: TO RELIEVE POVERTY AND PROMOTE THE EDUCATION OF CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE IN ETHIOPIA

name: THE PETER EDWARDS MUSEUM AND LIBRARY TRUST
activities: LIBRARY AND MUSEUM, CULTURE

name: TROPICAL BIOLOGY ASSOCIATION
activities: Advance public education & promote for the benefit of the public, conservation, protection & improvement of the physical and natural environment in particular in the tropics
objects: TO ADVANCE PUBLIC EDUCATION AND TO PROMOTE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC THE CONSERVATION, PROTECTION AND IMPROVEMENT OF THE PHYSICAL AND NATURAL ENVIRONMENT IN PARTICULAR IN THE TROPICS BY THE FOLLOWING MEANS:  1) TO ESTABLISH, SUPPORT AND CARRY OUT DEMAND-DRIVEN PROGRAMS IN EDUCATION AND RESEARCH RELATING TO THE ECOLOGY AND CONSERVATION OF TROPICAL ECOSYSTEMS;  2) TO BUILD THE CAPACITY OF TROPICAL INSTITUTIONS FOR TEACHING AND RESEARCH IN TROPICAL BIODIVERSITY;  3) TO MAINTAIN A WORLD-WIDE NETWORK OF BIOLOGISTS ACTIVE IN THE FIELD OF TROPICAL BIOLOGY AND CONSERVATION;  4) TO CARRY OTHER GENERAL ACTIVITIES IN THE AREA OF EDUCATION, RESEARCH AND CONSERVATION IN THE TROPICS AND SUB TROPICS.

name: PET RESCUE WELFARE ASSOCIATION
activities: Providing rescue and re-homing for abandoned, stray, unwanted animals in need of care and protection. To provide veterinary care, rehabilitation and a safe place, to promote humane behaviour towards animals. Provide training in animal care for all peoples.
objects: *  FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC TO RELIEVE THE SUFFERING OF ANIMALS IN NEED OF CARE AND ATTENTION AND, IN PARTICULAR, TO PROVIDE AND MAINTAIN RESCUE HOMES OR OTHER FACILITIES FOR THE RECEPTION, CARE AND TREATMENT OF SUCH ANIMALS.  *  TO PROMOTE HUMANE BEHAVIOUR TOWARDS ANIMALS BY PROVIDING APPROPRIATE CARE, PROTECTION, TREATMENT AND SECURITY FOR ANIMALS WHICH ARE IN NEED OF CARE AND ATTENTION BY REASON OF SICKNESS, MALTREATMENT, POOR CIRCUMSTANCES OR ILL USAGE AND TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC IN MATTERSPERTAINING TO ANIMAL WELFARE IN GENERAL AND THE PREVENTION OF CRUELTY AND SUFFERING AMONG ANIMALS.

name: DHAMMA NIKETHANAYA INTERNATIONAL COMMUNITY CENTRE FOR EDUCATION MEDITATION PSYCHOTHERAPY AND COUNSELLING
activities: Promotion & preservation of health: Mental health through Mindfulness based Meditation, counselling, psychotherapy & stress managements. Education based on scientific evidence: to alleviate poverty & sickness. Social welfare facilities for recreation or leisure. Buddhism & Cultural activities for young & adult. Sponsoring children & providing emergency help at difficult times to rebuild lives.
objects: A) PROMOTION OF THE BUDDHIST FAITH.  B) THE PROMOTION AND PRESERVATION OF GOOD HEALTH.  C) THE RELIEF OF POVERTY AND SICKNESS.  D) TO PROVIDE OR ASSIST IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES IN THE INTEREST OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION OF INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, AGE, INFIRMITY OR DISABILITY, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR SOCIAL CIRCUMSTANCES WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THEIR CONDITION OF LIFE.

name: MANZINI YOUTH CARE

name: FAMILY SPACE IN HESTERS WAY LTD
activities: Provision of contact services and parenting support at Cheltenham Child Contact Centre. Befrienders programme working with Health Visitors and Children Centres providing outreach family support to parents with 0-4s as well as group support for these parents with a creche provided. Also Stay and Play groups for local parents and their 0-3s to help prepare for playgroup and school.
objects: THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION PARTICULARLY IN THE AREA OF GOOD FAMILY RELATIONSHIPS AND THE PRESERVATION AND PROTECTION OF GOOD HEALTH OF CHILDREN AND PARENTS OFTEN IN THE CONTEXT OF A FAMILY CRISIS OR BREAK-UP

activities: To support young people in North Yorkshire

activities: Godly Play UK is a Christian movement centred on childhood spirituality ? providing training, advice and support for those who use the Godly Play method to transform thinking and practice for the whole of life.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT SO AS TO LIMIT THE GENERALITY OF THE FOREGOING BY MEANS OF A METHOD OF CHRISTIAN EDUCATION AND SPIRITUAL DIRECTION USING RELIGIOUS LANGUAGE AND SYMBOL TO HELP PEOPLE BECOME MORE AWARE OF THE MYSTERYOF GOD'S PRESENCE IN THEIR LIVES IN SUCH PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT AND TO FULFIL SUCH OTHER PURPOSES WHICH ARE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE ACCORDING TO THE LAW OF ENGLAND AND WALES AND ARE CONNECTED WITH THE CHARITABLE WORK OF THE TRUST.

activities: a.Advocacy and interpreting services b.Referring clients to appropriate social and community service providers c.Advice and training for citizenship course for Somali community d.Advice, Information and Guidance to young Somali people on drug misuse, prevention and rehabilitation programmes e.Employment and Work opportunity f.Health Awareness Programmes g.Football training for young people
objects: (3.1)  TO PROMOTE, ADVANCE AND PROVIDE OR ARRANGE FOR THE PROVISION OF EDUCATION AND TRAINING FOR EMPLOYMENT AND SELF-EMPLOYMENT FOR THE INHABITANTS OF THE SOMALI COMMUNITY IN BOW AND BETHNAL GREEN.  (3.2)  TO RELIEVE THE CHARITABLE NEEDS OF THE SOMALI PEOPLE, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY ASSISTING THEM TO CUT ACROSS THE BARRIERS  OF THEIR LANGUAGE, RACE OR CULTURE AND BY PROVIDING SUPPORT AND ADVICE ON ISSUES RELATED TO THEIR YOUTH, CULTURE AND ON SUCH OTHER AREAS WHICH THEY MAY HAVE DIFFICULTY IN ACCESSING. name: MICAHS CALL INTERNATIONAL
activities: Supporting local churches in their understanding and response to the Gospel of Jesus Christ: sharing Gods justice and mercy with the poor worldwide.
objects: (1)  THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE CHRISTIAN FAITH IN ACCORDANCE WITH MICAH'S CALL  BASIS OF BELIEF THROUGHOUT THE WORLD B Y WAY OF PROVIDING FINANCIAL SUPPORT AND FAITH-RELATED INFORMATION AND ACTIVITIES. name: YESODEY HATORAH PRIMARY GIRLS SCHOOL TRUST
activities: The objectives of the charity are the advancement of the Orthodox Jewish religion and education, particularly by maintaining the Yesodey Hatorah Primary Girls School, an Independent School serving the Stamford Hill Jewish community of North London.
objects: 3.1 THE ADVANCEMENT OF ORTHODOX JEWISH RELIGION ORTHODOX JEWISH RELIGIOUS EDUCATION AND EDUCATION IN GENERAL AND IN PARTICULAR (BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY) BY SUPPORTING THE CHARITABLE ACTIVITIES OF THE SCHOOL  3.2 THE RELIEF OF POVERTY SICKNESS AND INFIRMITY AMONG PERSONS OF THE JEWISH FAITH  3.3 SUCH OTHER PURPOSES AS ARE CHARITABLE ACCORDING TO ENGLISH LAW AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION DETERMINE  3.4 THE TRUSTEES SHALL HOLD THE CAPITAL AND INCOME OF THE TRUST FUNDUPON TRUST TO APPLY THE INCOME AND ALL OR SUCH PART OR PARTS OF THE CAPITAL AT SUCH TIME OR TIMES AND IN SUCH A MANNER AS THE TRUSTEES MAY IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION THINK FIT FOR OR TOWARDS SUCH OF THE OBJECTS OF THE CHARITY AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME AT THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION DETERMINE INCLUDING PAYMENTS BY WAY OF GIFT OR LOAN (WITH OR WITHOUT INTEREST) TO INDIVIDUAL PERSONS IN ANY PART OF THE WORLD PROVIDED THAT SUCH PERSONS QUALIFY AS OBJECTS OF THE CHARITY AND IN PARTICULAR FOR THE CHARITABLE ACTIVATES OF THE SCHOOL AS DETERMINED BY ENGLISH LAW

name: PATT FOUNDATION LTD
activities: PATT Foundation currently works to campaign for better environmental practices, take action against climate change, implement small to medium tree planting projects as well as set up school tree nurseries, provide environmental education and fund community development projects in rural communities centred on tree planting and reforestation.
objects: 3.  THE CHARITY IS ESTABLISHED TO FURTHER OR PROMOTE THE FOLLOWING OBJECTS:-  (A)  TO BETTER PRESERVE AND ENHANCE THE NATURAL ECOLOGY AND ENVIRONMENT OF THE WORLD AND IN PARTICULAR PRESERVE A SUSTAINABLE ECOLOGY BY ENCOURAGING THE PLANTING OF TREES TOREDUCE AND MITIGATE THE HARMFUL EFFECTS OF GREENHOUSE GASES AND TO ENSURE THE BENEFIT OF MANKIND AS A WHOLE BY BUILDING A SUSTAINABLE ECOLOGICAL ENVIRONMENT.  (B)  TO ADVANCE PUBLIC EDUCATION IN ALL ASPECTS OF HUMAN KNOWLEDGE CONCERNING OR RELATING TO NATURE, THE NATURAL ENVIRONMENT AND THE ECOLOGY OF THE WORLD; AND  (C)  TO RELIEVE OR ASSIST IN THE RELIEF OF POVERTY AND SICKNESS THROUGHOUT THE WORLD; AND  (D)  TO FURTHER OR PROMOTE SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS THE CHARITY SHALL FROM TIMETO TIME DETERMINE.

name: F PIPER WILL TRUST
activities: Payments are made to : - St. Gluvias With Penryn and Falmouth Parish Church as set out in the terms of the late Mr Fred Piper's Will dated 2 December 1960 and Codicil dated 5 November 1970.
objects: FROM AND AFTER THE DEATH OF THE SURVIVOR OF THE BENEFICIARIES THE BANK SHALL PAY AND DIVIDE THE SAID INCOME EQUALLY BETWEEN THE RESPECTIVE FABRIC FUNDS OF THE CHURCHES OF THE PARISHES OF KING CHARLES THE MARTYR FALMOUTH AFORESAID AND ST.GLUVIAS IN THEBOROUGH OF PENRYN IN THE SAID COUNTY OF CORNWALL TO BE USED IN EACH CASE FOR THE MAINTENANCE RENOVATION OR REPAIR OF THE SAID RESPECTIVE PARISH CHURCHES OR THE FURNITURE FITTINGS OR ORGANS THEREOF RESPECTIVELY IN SUCH MANNER AS THE RESPECTIVE PAROCHIAL CHURCH COUNCILS SHALL THINK FIT AND THE PAYMENT OF SUCH INCOME TO OR FOR THE CREDIT OF THE SAID RESPECTIVE FABRIC FUNDS OR TO THE RESPECTIVE TREASURERS THEREOF SHALL BE A FULL AND SUFFICIENT DISCHARGE TO THE BANK WHICH SHALL NOT BE BOUND TO INQUIREHOW THE SAID INCOME HAS BEEN APPLIED.

name: LISTENING EAR (MERSEYSIDE)
activities: Listening Ear provides a range of free, caring and confidential opportunities for you to share your concerns with trained Listeners and Counsellors
objects: 4. THE CHARITY'S OBJECTS (THE OBJECTS) ARE:    4(1) THE RELIEF OF PERSONS IN ENGLAND AND WALES WHO ARE IN CONDITIONS OF POVERTY, SICKNESS AND DISTRESS, WITH THE PURPOSE OF RELIEVING SUCH PERSONS.  4(2) TO PROMOTE, ORGANISE AND FACILITATE CO-OPERATION AND PARTNERSHIP WORKING BETWEEN THIRD SECTOR, STATUTORY AND OTHER RELEVANT BODIES IN THE ACHIEVEMENT OF THE ABOVE PURPOSES WITHIN THE AREA OF BENEFIT.  4(3) FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS ARTICLE 4:    (A) 'THIRD SECTOR' MEANS CHARITIES, VOLUNTARY ORGANISATIONS AND SOCIAL ENTERPRISES.    (B) 'CHARITIES' ARE ORGANISATIONS WHICH ARE ESTABLISHED FOR EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE PURPOSES IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE LAW OF ENGLAND AND D WALES.    (C) 'VOLUNTARY ORGANISATIONS AND SOCIAL ENTERPRISES' ARE INDEPENDENT ORGANISATIONS, WHICH ARE ESTABLISHED FOR PURPOSES THAT ADD VALUE TO THE COMMUNITY AS A WHOLE, OR A SIGNIFICANT SECTION OF THE COMMUNITY, AND WHICH ARE NOT PERMITTED BY THEIR CONSTITUTION TO MAKE A PROFIT FOR PRIVATE DISTRIBUTION. VOLUNTARY ORGANISATIONS AND SOCIAL ENTERPRISES DO NOT INCLUDE LOCAL GOVERNMENT OR OTHER STATUTORY AUTHORITIES.

name: GURDWARA BABA SANG JI TRUST
activities: Gurdwara Baba Sang is aiming to address the Spiritual, Moral and Social needs of the community. The charity's objectives are to advance the Sikh religion in the area in accordance with the teaching and tenets of Sri Guru Granth Sahib Ji including the celebration of Sikh religious festivals, conduct and the advancement of education in the Sikh religion for the benefit of the local Sikh Community.
objects: (1) TO ADVANCE THE SIKH RELIGION IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE TEACHINGS AND TENETS OF SRI GURU GRANTH SAHIB JI; AND  (2) TO ACQUIRE PROPERTY FOR ANY ESTATE OR INTEREST FOR USE AS A GURDWARA FOR THE CELEBRATION OF SIKH RELIGIOUS FESTIVALS, FOR THE CONDUCT AND REGISTRATION OF MARRIAGES AND FOR THE CONDUCT OF FUNERAL RITES IN ACCORDANCE WITH SIKH RELIGIOUS OBSERVANCES; AND  (3) THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION IN THE SIKH RELIGION; AND  (4) THE PROVISION IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE OF FACILITIES FOR RECREATION AND OTHER LEISURE-TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE OF PERSONS RESIDENT IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT.

activities: To advance education in the visual arts through the disssemination of information, the provision of courses, seminars, events and exhibitions available to the general public living and visiting Nidderdale
objects: 1) TO ADVANCE EDUCATION IN THE VISUAL ARTS THROUGH THE DISSEMINATION OF INFORMATION, THE PROVISION OF COURSES, SEMINARS, EVENTS AND EXHIBITIONS AVAILABLE TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC LIVING IN AND VISITING NIDDERDALE;  2) TO PROMOTE FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT OFTHE INHABITANTS OF NIDDERDALE THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION OF INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, AGE, INFIRMITY OR DISABLEMENT, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES OR FOR THE PUBLIC AT LARGE IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE AND WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITION OF LIFE OF THE SAID INHABITANTS;  3) THE PROMOTION OF ANY CHARITABLE PURPOSE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT AS THE TRUSTEES IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION THINK FIT.

name: THE COFFER FOUNDATION
activities: To provide funds for the development of education and sport or medical research, particularly cancer research.
objects: A) TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC IN THE ART OF SCIENCE OF MUSIC, DANCING AND THE PERFORMING ARTS;  B) TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC IN THE FIELDS OF PAINTING, DRAWING, ILLUSTRATION AND VISUAL ARTS;  C) TO EDUCATE AND ASSIST YOUNG PERSONS THROUGH THEIR WORK OR LEISURETIME ACTIVITIES SO AS TO DEVELOP THEIR PHYSICAL, MENTAL AND SPIRITUAL CAPACITIES;  D) TO ADVANCE EDUCATION BY AWARDING OR PROVIDING SCHOLARSHIPS, EXHIBITIONS, BURSARIES OR MAINTENANCE ALLOWANCES TO ANY SCHOOL, UNIVERSITY OR OTHER EDUCATIONAL OR CHARITABLE ESTABLISHMENT APPROVED BY THE TRUSTEES OR TO PERSONS IN NEED OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE;  E) TO RELIEVE POVERTY AND ILL-HEALTH IN ALL THEIR FORMS AND THE CAUSES OF SUCH POVERTY AND ILL-HEALTH PARTICULARLY BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY FOR VICTIMS OF TERRORISM AND OTHER FORMS OF TRAUMA;  F) TO PROTECT AND PRESERVE HEALTH BY PROVIDING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO MEDIAL RESEARCH;  G) TO RELIEVE HOMELESSNESS;  H) TO FURTHER SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES IN ISRAEL AS THE TRUSTEES IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION DETERMINE.

name: KENT MUSLIM WELFARE ASSOCIATION LIMITED
activities: The KMWA has become a source of support and knowledge to its diverse Muslim community, as well as an enriching initiative to help serve the wider host community and strenghten community cohesion.
objects: (A) TO PROPAGATE THROUGH PEACEFUL MEANS THE RELIGION AND TRADITION OF ISLAM IN ACCORDANCE TO THE TEACHINGS OF THE HOLY QURAN AND SUNNAH AND THE LAWS OF SHARIA.  (B) IN ADHERENCE TO THE ABOVE BUT NOT OTHERWISE, TO ESTABLISH, ACQUIRE AND MAINTAIN PREMISES FOR MOSQUES AND CENTRES FOR FACILITATING REGULAR CONGREGATIONAL PRAYERS, TEACHING SEMINARS (WAAZ) AND RELIGIOUS GATHERINGS FOR ALL MUSLIMS.  (C) TO PROVIDE RELIGIOUS FACILITIES MENTIONED AS ABOVE, WITH AN EQUALITY OF OPPORTUNITY TO ALL MUSLIMS WHOBELIEVE IN THE KALIMA, "LA ELLAHA ILLAL-LAH MOHAMMED-UR-RASOOL ALLAH". THE FINALITY OF PROPHET MOHAMMED (SAS) IS PARAMOUNT TO THIS BELIEF.  (D) TO PROVIDE AND PROMOTE THE ISLAMIC RELIGION AND CULTURAL EDUCATION AND TRADITION TO GROUPS OF ALL AGES ANDSEXES, BY CREATING INSTITUTIONAL FACILITIES FOR THIS PURPOSE.
