name: EAST SOMERSET SOCIETY OF MODEL AND EXPERIMENTAL ENGINEERS (LTD)
activities: Design, building and upkeep of the railway's infrastructure. Construction and maintenance of  various locomotive types and rolling stock. Educational talks for members. Education and training of young people in the building and running the railway. Public running days for members of the public. Open Weekends for members of other model engineering societies.
objects: THE ADVANCEMENT OF PUBLIC EDUCATION THROUGH THE CONSTRUCTION AND OPERATION OF MODELS OF ENGINEERING IN PARTICULAR THROUGH PROVISION OF TALKS, PUBLIC EXHIBITIONS, DEMONSTRATIONS AND FACILITIES FOR CONSTRUCTION, DEVELOPMENT AND RUNNING ENGINEERING MODELS.

name: GLADRAGS COMMUNITY COSTUME TRUST
activities: Provides affordable costume hire, educational resource boxes and practical assistance to: schools/ colleges, community/ youth groups, charities/ not for profit organisations, amateur/ fringe arts.  Delivers a Community Outreach Programme of educational sewing-based workshops; interactive storytelling / reminiscence/ dressing-up activities.  Promotes costume re-use, by re-styling or rehoming.
objects: 3.1)     EDUCATING THE PUBLIC IN HISTORICAL AND WORLD DRESS BY PROVIDING LOW COST COSTUMES AND RELATED RESOURCES AS AN EDUCATIONAL TOOL.  3.2)     TO ADVANCE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC BY PROVIDING VARIOUS COSTUMES AND RELATED RESOURCES AT LOW COST AS ANEDUCATIONAL TOOL.

name: REEPHAM PRE SCHOOL
activities: Offering appropriate play facilities and learning facilities for children aged between 2 and a half to 5 years of age.
objects: THE AIMS OF THE PRE-SCHOOL ARE TO ENHANCE THE DEVELOPMENT AND EDUCATION OF CHILDREN PRIMARILY UNDER STATUTORY SCHOOL AGE BY ENCOURAGING PARENTS TO UNDERSTAND AND PROVIDE FOR THE NEEDS OF THEIR CHILDREN THROUGH COMMUNITY GROUPS AND BY:  (A) OFFERING APPROPRIATE PLAY, EDUCATION AND CARE FACILITIES, FAMILY LEARNING AND EXTENDED HOURS GROUPS, TOGETHER WITH THE RIGHT OF PARENTS TO TAKE RESPONSIBILITY FOR AND TO BECOME INVOLVED IN THE ACTIVITIES OF SUCH GROUPS, ENSURING THAT SUCH GROUPS OFFER OPPORTUNITIES FOR ALL CHILDREN WHATEVER THEIR RACE, CULTURE, RELIGION, MEANS OR ABILITY;  (B) ENCOURAGING THE STUDY OF THE NEEDS OF SUCH CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES AND PROMOTING PUBLIC INTEREST IN AND RECOGNITION OF SUCH NEEDS IN THE LOCAL AREAS.

name: TS WARRIOR CADET
activities: HIKING    SWIMMING   ORIENTEERING  CANOEING   ABSEILING  FIRST AID  CAMPING ROPE WORK  POWER BOATING  BAND PARADE   COMBAT SKILLS  RIFLE SHOOTING  CAMOUFLAGE  RAFTING  IT & COMMS  CEREMONIAL DRILL.
objects: TO PROMOTE THE DEVELOPMENT OF YOUNG PERSONS IN ACHIEVING THEIR FULL PHYSICAL, INTELLECTUAL, SOCIAL AND SPIRITUAL POTENTIAL PARTICULARLY BY EDUCATING SUCH PERSONS IN ALL ASPECTS OF SEAMANSHIP AND SEAFARING.

name: MERSEYSIDE JEWISH COMMUNITY CARE
activities: Merseyside Jewish Community Care aims to provide a comprehensive welfare service for Jewish individuals and families in Merseyside, and organisations and professionals who interact with the Community.
objects: 1 THE ASSISTANCE OF JEWISH PEOPLE IN MERSEYSIDE WHO ARE IN NEED OF SUCH ASSISTANCE BY  REASON OF POVERTY, HARDSHIP, DISTRESS, SOCIAL DISADVANTAGE, MENTAL OR PHYSICAL INFIRMITY  OR DISABILITY OR OLD AGE; AND  2 THE RELIEF OF SICKNESS AND THE PROMOTION AND PRESERVATION OF GOOD HEALTH OF JEWISH  PEOPLE IN MERSEYSIDE BY THE PROVISION OF GOODS, SERVICES, SUPPORT AND ADVICE.  (THE WORDS "JEWISH" AND "MERSEYSIDE" SHALL FROM TIME TO TIME BE DECIDED BY THE CHARITY ACCORDING TO THE INDIVIDUAL CIRCUMSTANCESAND AT ITS ABSOLUTE AND UNFETTERED DISCRETION.)

name: KINSHIP CARERS
activities: Our project supports families raising children when their biological parents can no longer do so due to alcohol and drug misuse, bereavement, imprisonment, mental health issues etc.  We support the young person and the kinship carers offering respite, one to one and group work, training courses, coffee mornings, pamper days.
objects: THE RELIEF OF NEED AMONG FAMILIES AFFECTED BY DRUG AND ALCOHOL ABUSE, PARTICULARLY, BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY, BY THE PROVISION OF SUPPORT, ADVICE AND EDUCATION FOR THE MEMBERS OF THOSE FAMILIES WHO MAY BENEFIT FROM SUCH SERVICES.

name: LONDON YOUTH ROWING LTD
activities: London Youth Rowing (LYR) is a ground breaking sports initiative - developing young people through physical activity and opening access to rowing at all levels. LYR is an inclusive programme for young people of all abilities, social, ethnic and economic backgrounds. LYR operates across London delivering innovative programmes, training and evaluation for schools, youth clubs and community groups.
objects: THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES AND SERVICES FOR INDOOR, OUTDOOR AND ADAPTIVE ROWING AND OTHER SPORTS OR ACTIVITIES TO IMPROVE HEALTH, FITNESS OR WELL-BEING OF YOUNG PEOPLE (HEREINAFTER 'YOUTH ROWING') IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE WITH THE OBJECT OFIMPROVING THE CONDITION OF LIFE OF YOUNG PEOPLE WHO BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, DISABILITY, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR SOCIAL OR ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES.

name: NORTH WALSHAM HIGH SCHOOL TRUST
activities: At present we are supporting English as a Foreign Language class for members of the local community whose first language is not english.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUPILS OF NORTH WALSHAM HIGH SCHOOL & PARTNER SCHOOLS BY PROVIDING OR ASSISTING IN THE PROVISION OF EDUCATION, RECREATION AND OTHER CHARITABLE FACILITIES IN AUGMENTATION OF SUCH PROVISION FINANCED BY LOCAL OR NATIONAL GOVERNMENT

name: AGE CONCERN SOUTHAMPTON
activities: We provide support and services to all older people, and those who care for them, in the City of Southampton.  We inform older people of their rights and choices and encourage independent living.  We promote positive ageing and the right of older people to play an active part in the development of the City.
objects: TO PROMOTE THE RELIEF OF ELDERLY PEOPLE IN ANY MANNER WHICH NOW OR HEREAFTER MAY BE DEEMED BY LAW TO BE CHARITABLE IN AND AROUND SOUTHAMPTON (HEREINAFTER CALLED ôTHE AREA OF BENEFITö).

name: NORTHUMBERLAND DOMESTIC ABUSE SERVICES
activities: NDAS provides practical and emotional support to all survivors of domestic abuse in Northumberland at any time in their lives.  We can offer practical help and emotional support, see www.nda.services for more information, or telephone us on 01434 608030.
objects: TO RELIEVE THE DISTRESS AND SUFFERING OF WOMEN AND CHILDREN IN NORTHUMBERLAND WHO HAVE EXPERIENCED DOMESTIC ABUSE.

name: BLACKBURN WITH DARWEN HEALTHY LIVING
activities: Provision of facilities, services, support, training, education and information in order to encourage the development of a more positive attitude to health, to lead healthy lifestyles and to improve the quality of life for residents principally in the borough of Blackburn with Darwen and throughout all boroughs in England and Wales.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE COMPANY SHALL BE TO PROVIDE, OR IN CONJUNCTION WITH OTHER LIKE-MINDED ORGANISATIONS, TO ASSIST IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES, SERVICES, SUPPORT, TRAINING, EDUCATION AND INFORMATION IN ORDER TO PRESERVE AND PROTECT THE GOOD HEALTH OF THOSE INHABITANTS RESIDING IN, PRINCIPALLY, THE  BOROUGH OF BLACKBURN AND DARWEN, AND THROUGHOUT ALL BOROUGHS IN ENGLAND AND WALES IN AN EFFORT TO ENCOURAGE SAID INHABITANTS TO DEVELOP A MORE POSITIVE ATTITUDE TO HEALTH, TO LEAD HEALTHY LIFESTYLES AND TO IMPROVE THEIR QUALITY OF LIFE

name: THE RESCUE TRUST OF NORTH WEST GOLDEN RETRIEVER CLUB
activities: WE REHOME GOLDEN RETRIEVERS WHEN THEIR OWNERS CAN NO LONGER COPE AND SUPPORT OLDER GOLDEN RETRIEVERS IN FOSTER HOMES. THE CHARITY HAS A STALL THAT WE TAKE ROUND VARIOUS FETES RAISING MONEY TO HELP WITH MEDICAL COSTS FOR THOSE OWNERS WHO CANNOT AFFORD VETERINARY FEES FOR THE OLDER GOLDENS THAT THEY HAVE GIVEN NEW HOMES TO.
objects: FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC TO RELIEVE THE SUFFERING OF GOLDEN RETRIEVERS WHO ARE IN NEED OF CARE AND ATTENTION BY THE PROVISION OF A REHOMING SERVICE  THE PROVISION OF FREE MEDICAL AND SURGICAL TREATMENTS FOR ANIMALS WHOSE OWNERS ARE UNABLE TO AFFORD THE FUSS OF PRIVATE VETERINARY SURGEONS

name: BILLINGSHURST FAMILY CHURCH
activities: A) To advance the Christian faith B) To releive sickness & financial hardship & to promote & preserve good health C)To provide or assist in the provision of facilities in the interests of social welfare
objects: A) TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATEMENT OF FAITH IN THE SCHEDULE HERETO ATTACHED IN SUCH WAYS IN BILLINGSHURST AND THE SURROUNDING VILLAGES AND IN SUCH OTHER PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES FROM TIMETO TIME MAY THINK FIT;  B) TO RELIEVE SICKNESS AND FINANCIAL HARDSHIP AND TO PROMOTE AND PRESERVE GOOD HEALTH BY THE PROVISION OF FUNDS, GOODS OR SERVICES OF ANY KIND, INCLUDING THROUGH THE PROVISION OF COUNSELLING AND SUPPORT IN BILLINGSHURST AND THE SURROUNDING VILLAGES AND IN SUCH OTHER PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES FROM TIME TO TIME MAY THINK FIT.  C) TO PROVIDE OR ASSIST IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION OR OTHER  LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION OF INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, AGE, INFIRMITY OR DISABILITY, FINANCIAL  HARDSHIP OR SOCIAL CIRCUMSTANCES WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE IN BILLINGSHURT AND THE SURROUNDING VILLAGES AND IN SUCH OTHER PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM AND THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT.

name: THE CHRISTOPHER GABLE CHARITABLE TRUST LIMITED
activities: Arts and culture
objects: 3.1.1     TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN THE ARTS OF BALLET, MIME, CONTEMPORARY DANCE, DRAMA, MUSIC, OPERA, SINGING AND SIMILAR AND ANCILLARY ARTS; AND  3.1.2     TO PROMOTE FURTHER AND HIGHER EDUCATION IN AND KNOWLEDGE, UNDERSTANDING AND APPRECIATION OF THE ARTS OF BALLET, MIME, CONTEMPORARY DANCE, DRAMA, MUSIC, OPERA, SINGING AND SIMILAR AND ANCILLARY ARTS.  PRIMARILY BY SUPPORTING AND PROVIDING FACILITIES FOR THE CENTRAL SCHOOL OF BALLET CHARITABLE TRUST LIMITED (REGISTERED CHARITY NUMBER 285398).

name: PEBBLES PROJECT UK LIMITED
activities: Pebbles Project aims to enable children from agricultural communities in the Western Cape of South Africa to reach their full potential by offering a range of educational, health, nutrition, community and protection programmes and services.  Pebbles supports children from conception through to young adulthood.
objects: 3.  THE CHARITY'S OBJECTS ('THE OBJECTS') ARE TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF CHILDREN OF ALL RACE GROUPS BETWEEN THE AGES OF 2 YEARS AND 12 YEARS WITH SPECIAL EDUCATIONAL NEEDS OR WHOSE LIVES ARE AFFECTED BY ALCOHOL IN THE REPUBLIC OF SOUTH AFRICA, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY THE PROVISION OF TRAINING FOR PARENTS, CRECHE WORKERS AND PRIMARY SCHOOL TEACHERS WHO WILL BE WORKING WITH SUCH CHILDREN.

name: THE LIBRA FOUNDATION
activities: Libra's team has been taking UK students to work with disadvantaged children in Romania for 15 years.  Our work has been focussed on disabled children in the Children's Centres in Onesti and Bradet and on social integration projects for young people in Moinesti, Comanesti and Manastirea Casin.  Libra also takes out professional therapists to share best practice with carers, teachers and parents.
objects: 1)     TO RELIEVE PERSONS WHO ARE SUFFERING HARDSHIP OR WHO BY REASONS OF DISABILITY OR THEIR SOCIAL OR ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES ARE DISADVANTAGED OR IN NEED OF ASSISTANCE IN ROMANIA OR ELSEWHERE;  2)     TO BROADEN THE EDUCATION AND SKILLS OF YOUNG PEOPLE BY WORKING WITH OR LIVING WITH OR ASSISTING PERSONS REFERRED TO IN SUBCLAUSE (1) INCLUDING THE PROVISION OF EXPERIENCE FOR THE YOUNG PEOPLE WITH CHILDREN LESS FORTUNATE THAN THEMSELVES IN PLACES SUCH AS THE ALEXANDRA CENTRE OR ELSEWHERE;  3)     TO EDUCATE AND IMPROVE THE SKILL OF CARERS OF PERSONS REFERRED TO IN SUBCLAUSE (1);  4)     TO ENCOURAGE LOCAL VOLUNTEERS TO SUPPORT SUCH CARERS TO ENABLE THE RELIEF OF PERSONS REFERRED TO IN SUBCLAUSE (1) TO BE LOCALLY SUSTAINABLE.  5)     SUCH OTHERPURPOSES CHARITABLE IN LAW;

name: INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT FOUNDATION TRUST
activities: To relive financial hardship, sickness and poor health amongst Bangladeshi citizens, to work for the eradication of poverty through international assisted programmes Bangladeshi Development and Charity Foundation UK support local Mosque-based, community-oriented initiatives in Bangladesh and as these responses develop we anticipate our grant level to increase dramatically over the coming years.
objects: 1)     TO ADVANCE EDUCATION;  2)     TO RELIEVE SICKNESS AND TO PROMOTE AND PROTECT GOOD HEALTH;  3)     TO RELIEVE POVERTY;  4)     THE RELIEF OF FINANCIAL NEED AND SUFFERING AMONG VICTIMS OF NATURAL OR OTHER KINDS OF DISASTER;  5)     TO PROVIDE OR ASSIST IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION OF INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, AGE INFIRMITY OR DISABILITY, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR SOCIAL CIRCUMSTANCES WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE.  6)     TO PROMOTE GOOD RELATIONS BETWEEN PERSONS OF DIFFERENT RACIAL GROUPS, FAITH GROUPS AND AGES.

name: PEACE DIRECT
activities: Peace Direct finds, funds & promotes local peacebuilding. We find & fund committed, pragmatic and effective individuals and organisations working at the frontline of conflict.  We support and promote their work, believing it is critical their message is heard and their knowledge shared. We believe that local peacebuilding should be at the centre of all strategies for managing conflict resolution.
objects: 1.TO PROMOTE CONFLICT RESOLUTION AND RECONCILIATION FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT WITH A VIEW TO RELIEVING SUFFERING, POVERTY AND DISTRESS AND BUILDING AND MAINTAINING SOCIAL COHESION AND TRUST WITHIN AND BETWEEN COMMUNITIES BY:    A. INVESTIGATING AND IDENTIFYING PROBABLE CAUSES OF CONFLICT  B. EXAMINING PROBABLE SOLUTIONS TO THE CONFLICT  C. MEDIATING WITH PARTIES TO THE CONFLICT AND OTHERS TOGETHER TO DISCUSS POSSIBLE SOLUTIONS ENABLING THEM TO BUILD RELATIONSHIPS OF TRUST  D. RECOMMENDING TO THEPARTIES INVOLVED MEASURES WHICH ARE LIKELY TO RESULT IN THE RESOLUTION OR PREVENTION OF THE CONFLICT OR THE REDUCTION OF ANY HUMANITARIAN CRISIS THAT MAY ENSUE FROM THE CONFLICT    PROVIDED THAT ALL ACTIVITIES SHALL BE BALANCED AND SHALL MAINTAIN OR ENHANCE THE CHARITY'S COMMITMENT TO REMAINING IMPARTIAL, RESPECT FOR THE RULE OF LAW, INTERNATIONALLY RECOGNISED HUMAN RIGHTS AND PRINCIPLES OF NON-VIOLENCE.    2.TO PROMOTE EQUALITY AND DIVERSITY AND RACIAL AND RELIGIOUS HARMONY FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT BY:    A. ADVANCING EDUCATION AND RAISING AWARENESS IN EQUALITY AND DIVERSITY  B. PROMOTING ACTIVITIES TO FOSTER UNDERSTANDING BETWEEN PEOPLE FROM DIVERSE BACKGROUNDS AND TO PROMOTE GOOD RELATIONS  C. PROMOTING KNOWLEDGE AND MUTUAL UNDERSTANDING BETWEEN DIFFERENT RACIAL AND RELIGIOUS GROUPS  D. CULTIVATING A SENTIMENT IN FAVOUR OF EQUALITY AND DIVERSITY    3. TO PROMOTE DOMESTIC HUMAN RIGHTS BY:    A. OBTAINING REDRESS FOR THE VICTIMS OF HUMAN RIGHTS ABUSE  B. CONTRIBUTING TO THE SOUND ADMINISTRATION OF HUMAN RIGHTS LAW  C. PROMOTING RESPECT FOR HUMAN RIGHTS AMONG INDIVIDUALS  D. ELIMINATING INFRINGEMENTS OF HUMAN RIGHTS    IN THIS CLAUSE 'DOMESTIC HUMAN RIGHTS' SHALL MEAN THOSE RIGHTS WHICH ARE ENSHRINED OR INCORPORATED INTO THE DOMESTIC LAW OF THE COUNTRY IN WHICH IT IS PROPOSED TO PROMOTE THOSE RIGHTS.

name: CIRCLES SOUTH EAST
activities: The object of the charity is to relieve the needs and promote the rehabilitation, treatment, education and care of persons who have committed, or who are likely to commit offences, particularly sexual offences, against others, and the families of such persons and others affected by such offences.
objects: TO RELIEVE THE NEEDS AND PROMOTE THE REHABILITATION, TREATMENT, EDUCATION AND CARE OF PERSONS WHO HAVE COMMITTED OR ARE LIKELY TO COMMIT OFFENCES, PARTICULARLY SEXUAL OFFENCES, AGAINST OTHERS AND THE FAMILIES OF SUCH PERSONS AND OTHERS AFFECTED BY SUCH OFFENCES.

name: COLDHARBOUR MILL TRUST LIMITED
activities: The charity aims to provide a public working museum celebrating the history of the woollen textile industry for the advancement of public education, to preserve Coldharbour Mill as a building of historic and architectural value for public benefit, and to continue textile production.
objects: A) TO PROVIDE FOR THE ADVANCEMENT TO PUBLIC EDUCATION (IN PARTICULAR IN THE WOOLLEN INDUSTRY) BY THE PROVISION OF A PUBLIC WORKING MUSEUM COMPRISING SUCH EXHIBITS OR ITEMS AS MAY FROM TIME TO TIME BE COMPRISED IN THE TRUST FUND AND TO PRESERVE THE SAME AS A COLLECTION ("THE COLLECTION");  B) TO PRESERVE COLDHARBOUR MILL AT UFFCULME IN THE COUNTY OF DEVON FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT AS A BUILDING OF HISTORIC AND ARCHITECTURAL VALUE.

name: GHANA UNION
activities: The Charity is a general welfare, cultural and educational one for Ghanaians in the UK and Ghana and the general public in the UK.  It organises workshops and seminars on Ghanaaian cultural heritage for Ghanaians, especially the youth in the Diaspora.
objects: (1) THE PREVENTION OR RELIEF OF POVERTY AMONG GHANAIANS IN THE UK AND GHANA  (2) THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION OF GHANAIANS OF ALL AGES IN THE UK AND GHANA  (3) THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE CULTURAL HERITAGE OF GHANA AMONG GHANAIANS OF ALL AGES AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC IN THE UK  (4) THE RELIEF OF THOSE GHANAIANS IN NEED BY REASON OF YOUTH, AGE, GENDER, ILL-HEALTH, DISABILITY, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR OTHER DISADVANTAGE IN GHANA AND THE UK

name: APPLECAST LIMITED
activities: CAST NW provides educational opportunities, training, entry to employment courses and constructive leisure opportunities to clients as a means of increasing social inclusion, promoting employment and reducing offensive and anti-social behaviour. CAST provides individual learning plans leading to nationally accredited educational programmes through OCN course including information technology.
objects: (1) TO PROVIDE OR ASSIST IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION OF INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, AGE INFIRMITY OR DISABILITY, FINANCIALHARDSHIP OR SOCIAL CIRCUMSTANCES WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE AND DEVELOPING THEIR MENTAL, PHYSICAL AND MORAL CAPABILITIES;  (2) TO PROMOTE EDUCATION AND PROVIDE TRAINING IN SUCH WAYS AS THE TRUSTEES THINK FIT, INCLUDING (BUT WITHOUT PREJUDICE TO THE GENERALITY OF THE FOREGOING) THE PROVISION OF TRAINING TO DEVELOP VOCATIONAL SKILLS RELATING TO AGRICULTURE, FARMING, HORTICULTURE AND ANIMAL HUSBANDRY;  3) TO ASSIST IN SUCH WAYS AS THE TRUSTEES THINK FIT ANY ORGANISATIONWHOSE AIMS INCLUDE ADVANCING EDUCATION BY DEVELOPING THEIR MENTAL, PHYSICAL AND MORAL CAPABILITIES THROUGH LEISURE TIME ACTIVITIES.

name: ST JUDE'S C OF E SCHOOL P.T.A
activities: Fund raising activities such as raffles, xmas and summer fairs, uniform sales, cake sales & quiz nights. Support of school by providing funds for improvements to equipment and supplies for educational and recreational purposes.
objects: THE OBJECT OF THE ASSOCIATION [THE OBJECTS) IS TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF PUPILS IN THE SCHOOL IN PARTICULAR BY:    2.1 DEVELOPING EFFECTIVE RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN THE STAFF, PARENTS AND OTHERS ASSOCIATED WITH THE SCHOOL;    2.2 ENGAGING IN ACTIVITIESOR PROVIDING FACILITIES OR EQUIPMENT WHICH SUPPORT THE SCHOOL AND ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUPILS.

name: ENGAGE VOLUNTARY SECTOR DEVELOPMENT
activities: THE CHARITY RUNS A SERIES OF PROJECTS THAT BENEFIT THE LOCAL COMMUNITY, INCLUDING A CVS, VOLUNTEER CENTRE AND FURNITURE RE-USE PROJECT.
objects: A)  TO PROMOTE ANY CHARITABLE PURPOSES FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE COMMUNITY IN THE LOCAL GOVERNMENT DISTRICT OF WEST SOMERSET AND ITS NEIGHBOURHOOD (HERINAFTER CALLED "THE AREA OF BENEFIT") AND, IN PARTICULAR, THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION, THE PROTECTION OF HEALTH AND THE RELIEF OF POVERTY, DISTRESS AND SICKNESS.  B)  TO PROMOTE AND ORGANISE CO-OPERATION IN THE ACHIEVEMENT OF THE ABOVE PURPOSES AND TO THAT END TO BEING TOGETHER IN COUNCIL REPRESENTATIVES OF THE VOLUNTARY ORGANISATIONS AND STATUTORY AUTHORITIES WITHIN THE AREA OF BENEFIT.

name: RALEIGH LTD
activities: The charity's objects are to advance religion in accordance with the Orthodox Jewish faith and for such other purposes as are recognised by English Law as charitable.
objects: TO ADVANCE RELIGION IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE ORTHODOX JEWISH FAITH AND FOR SUCH OTHER PURPOSES AS ARE RECOGNISED BY ENGLISH LAW AS CHARITABLE AND IN FURTHERANCE OF THE  AFOREMENTIONED OBJECTS BUT NOT OTHERWISE:  (A) THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE ORTHODOX JEWISH FAITH.  (B) THE ADVANCEMENT OF ORTHODOX JEWISH RELIGIOUS EDUCATION.  (C) THE RELIEF OF POVERTY SICKNESS AND INFIRMITY AMONGST MEMBERS OF THE JEWISH FAITH; AND.  (D) SUCH OTHER PURPOSES AS ARE CHARITABLE ACCORDING TO ENGLISH LAW.

name: GALLERY 37 FOUNDATION LTD
activities: The Gallery 37 Foundation is a not-for-profit company limited by guarantee and a registered charity, with a mission to enable young people in Birmingham (with a special focus on those disadvantaged) to fulfill their creative potential through engagement with the arts.
objects: TO PROMOTE, MAINTAIN, IMPROVE AND ADVANCE EDUCATION BY THE ENCOURAGEMENT OF THE ARTS IN BIRMINGHAM THROUGH PARTICIPATION AND TRAINING FOR ALL AGES AND ALL COMMUNITIES IN CREATIVE ARTS ACTIVITY AND SKILLS (INCLUDING WITHOUT LIMITATION, VISUAL ARTS AND CRAFTS, DIGITAL ARTS AND PERFORMING ARTS, INCLUDING THE ARTS OF DRAMA, MIME, DANCE, CARNIVAL, SINGING AND MUSIC.

name: NEWTOWN SPORTS CLUB
activities: To maintain a multi-sports facility for the people of Newtown
objects: THE CHARITY'S OBJECTS  ("THE OBJECTS") ARE TO PROVIDE AND MAINTAIN IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE THE RECREATION GROUND AND PLAYING FIELD AND APPURTENANCES AT THE RECREATION GROUND, POOL ROAD, NEWTOWN, POWYS FOR THE USE OF THE INHABITANTS OF NEWTOWN AND ITS NEIGHBOURHOOD

name: SHASSAB SEERAT-UN-NABI WELFARE TRUST
activities: The trust is a family run trust based in the UK. It concentrates its work in the UK and Overseas to support the public. The main objectives and aims are to provide charitable relief and assistance to orphans and widows, promote awareness of Islamic knowledge and provide assistance in education and social/medical terms.
objects: TO PROVIDE RELIEF AND ASSISTANCE IN ANY MANNER THAT IS CHARITABLE TO ORPHANS AND WIDOWS WHO ARE IN NEED.  TO ADVANCE THE ISLAMIC RELIGION IN CREATING AWARENESS ABOUT THE LIFE OF THE PROPHET MOHAMMED P.B.U.H. TO PROVIDE TRANSLATION OF THE HOLY QURAN INTHE MONTH OF RAMADAN.  TO TEACH THE RELIGION OF ISLAM IN A WAY THAT WOULD NOT CREATE ANY OFFENCE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC THROUGH HOLDING TEACHING SESSIONS.

name: THE ELIZABETH FARMOR TRUST
activities: To advance the education of pupils at Farmor's School
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUPILS AT THE SCHOOL BY PROVIDING AND ASSISTING IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR EDUCATION AT THE SCHOOL ("THE OBJECT")

name: GOLDMAN SACHS GIVES (UK)
activities: The charity is a grant making charity, providing grants to a wide range of charitable projects in the UK and abroad, funded principally by donations made by affiliate and subsidiary companies of The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc and by current and former senior employees of The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc, and its affiliates and subsidiaries.
objects: TO PROMOTE FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION, THE RELIEF OF POVERTY, THE ADVANCEMENT OF RELIGION AND ANY OTHER EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE PURPOSE.

name: MAZZINI GARIBALDI FOUNDATION
activities: The Charity makes grants to support individuals and groups, particularly those within the Italian Community and those of Italian descent.
objects: 1 TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC AND IN PARTICULAR THE ITALIAN COMMUNITY  IN THE UNITED KINGDOM:  I  IN THE SUBJECTS OF LITERATURE, SCIENCE AND ART; AND  II BY PROVIDING AND ASSISTING IN THE ESTABLISHMENT OF LECTURES, CLASSES, EXAMINATIONS, BURSARIES AND SCHOLARSHIPS

name: MARUVA TRUST
activities: Its activities include support groups, life skills training, counselling, community outreach team, adolescent corners in community clinics, Zvandiri House training and support centre and the development and distribution of child-friendly resource materials for HIV positive children and teenagers.
objects: TO ADVANCE IN LIFE AND RELIEVE THE NEEDS OF PEOPLE WITH HIV THROUGH THE PROVISION OF HEALTH, EDUCATION AND SUPPORT SERVICES DESIGNED TO IMPROVE THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE  TO PROMOTE SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE OBJECTS AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL FROM TIME TO TIME DETERMINE WITHOUT ANY FORM OF DISCRIMINATION, EG GENDER, RELIGION, RACE ETC

name: AR-RAHMAN CHARITY FOUNDATION
activities: Advancement of Education and Training Anti Poverty work
objects: TO PROMOTE THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC IN SUCH WAYS AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL THINK FIT BY:  A THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION AND TRAINING;  B THE RELIEF OF POVERTY, SICKNESS AND DISTRESS;  C THE PROVISION OF RECREATIONAL FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIALWELFARE WITH OBJECT OF IMPROVING THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE; AND  D THE RELIEF AND ASSISTANCE FO PEOPLE IN ANY PART OF THE WORLD WHO ARE THE VICTIMS OF WAR OR NATURAL DISASTER, TROUBLE, OR CATASTROPHE IN PARTICULAR BY THE SUPPLY OF MEDICAL AID TO SUCHPERSONS.

name: HOPE CHURCH SOUTH BEDFORDSHIRE TRUST
activities: AS A CHURCH WE AIM TO BE WELCOMING AND OUTREACHING THROUGH OUR SUNDAY, MID-WEEK MEETINGS AND AGE SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES INCLUDE  CHILDREN AND YOUTH ACTIVITIES.WE ALSO RUN ALPHA (TO HELP PEOPLE DISCOVER MORE ABOUT THEIR BELIEFS) AND CAP MONEY COURSES (HELPING PEOPLE WITH BASIC BUDGETING). WE ARE  ACTIVE IN OUR COMMUNITY AND LOCAL SCHOOLS. WE OPERATE NATIONALLY AND OCCASIONALLY INTERNATIONALLY.
objects: TO ADVANCE CHRISTIANITY IN BEDFORDSHIRE AND ELSEWHERE, BY ANY MEANS OR MEDIUM THAT IS OR MAY BECOME AVAILABLE, IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATEMENT OF DOCTRINE SET OUT IN THE SCHEDULE.  TO RELIEVE PEOPLE WHO ARE IN CHARITABLE NEED BECAUSE OF SICKNESS OR POOR HEALTH, AGE, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR SOME OTHER REASON BY ANY PROPER MEANS AS THE TRUSTEES THINK FIT AND INCLUDING ( WHERE APPROPRIATE BUT NOT BY WAY OF LIMITATION ) THE PROVISION OF ADVICE; THE PROMOTION OF GOOD PRACTICES TO COMBAT SUCH CONDITIONSAND THE PROVISION OF RESOURCES TO ALLEVIATE OR PREVENT SUCH NEED.  TO ADVANCE EDUCATION BOTH GENERAL AND VOCATIONAL FOR CHILDREN OR ADULTS BUT ALWAYS WITHIN THE PRINCIPLES OF THE CHRISTIAN FAITH ( THE OBJECTS ).  THE TRUSTEES MUST USE THE INCOME AND MAY USE THE CAPITAL OF THE TRUST IN PROMOTING THE OBJECTS...

name: ADFER BAN A CHWM
activities: ABC's aim is to turn derelict vernacular buildings into affordable homes for local families in rural Wales; to reinvigorate the community; to focus on buildings that are generally not listed, that represent the people and activities that have defined the area and given it its character over the years.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CHARITY ARE TO PRESERVE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PEOPLE OF CARMARTHENSHIRE, POWYS, WALES AND OF THE NATION, THE HISTORICAL, ARCHITECTURAL AND CONSTRUCTIONAL HERITAGE THAT MAY EXIST IN AND AROUND CARMARTHENSHIRE, POWYS AND WALES IN BUILDINGS (INCLUDING ANY STRUCTURE OR ERECTION, AND ANY PART OF A BUILDING AS SO DEFINED) OF PARTICULAR BEAUTY OR HISTORICAL, ARCHITECTURAL OR CONSTRUCTIONAL INTERESTS.

name: RCI MISSIONS
activities: Christian Ministry and Outreach Worship, Teaching and Prayer Services Outreach in respect of Conventions  Programmes and other Church Meeting & Events Relief to Persons in Need Prayer Support  Welfare Support Empowering Through Christian Principles  Social and Community Support  Pastoral Care and Social Support  Counselling  Visitation
objects: THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE CHRISTIAN FAITH BY PROMOTION OF ANY EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE PURPOSES ACCORDING TO THE LAW OF ENGLAND AND WALES AND IN PARTICULAR (BUT WITHOUT PREJUDICE TO THE GENERALITY OF THE FOREGOING WORDING):  1 TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATEMENT OF BELIEFS IN EAST, SOUTH, WEST AND NORTH LONDON, THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD (THE 'AREA OF BENEFIT') IN SUCH WAYS AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT AND TO FULFIL SUCH OTHER PURPOSES WHICH ARE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE ACCORDING TO THE LAW OF ENGLAND AND WALES AND AE CONNECTED WITH THE CHARITABLE WORK OF THE TRUST.  2 TO RELIEVE PERSONS WHO ARE IN CONDITIONS OF NEED OR HARDSHIP OR WHO ARE AGED OR SICK AND TO RELIEVE THE DISTRESS CAUSED THEREBY IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT.  3 TO ADVANCE EDUCATION IN ACCORDANCE WITH CHRISTIAN PRINCIPLES INCLUDING BY MEANS OF ESTABLISHING AND OPERATING ANY EDUCATIONAL ESTABLISHMENT OR ESTABLISHMENTS IN THE AREA OF BENEFITAS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT.  4 TO PROVIDE FACILITIES FOR RECREATIONAL AND OTHER LEISURE-TIME OCCUPATION IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR PERSONS WHO HAVE NEED BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH POVERTY OR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES AND WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO THINK FIT.

name: THE MUMME-ACKFORD CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: PROVIDES GRANTS FOR INDIVIDUALS AND ORGANISATIONS
objects: THE OBJECTS ARE SUCH CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS THE TRUSTEES, FROM TIME TO TIME, SHALL THINK FIT.  THE TRUSTEES MUST USE THE INCOME AND MAY USE THE CAPITAL OF THE CHARITY IN PROMOTING THE OBJECTS

name: JAMAATUL ISLAMIYAH SOCIETY
activities: Education / Training Relief of Poverty Overseas aid / Famine relief Religious activities Arts / culture Sport / recreation
objects: TO ADVANCE THE ISLAMIC RELIGION IN BRITAIN AND WORLDWIDE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC THROUGH THE HOLDING OF PRAYER MEETINGS, LECTURES, TEACHING NATURES, PUBLIC CELEBRATION OF RELIGIOUS FESTIVALS, PRODUCING AND/OR DISTRIBUTING LITERATURES ON ISLAMIC FAITH TO ENLIGHTEN OTHERS ABOUT THE ISLAMIC RELIGION.  2 TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN THE ISLAMIC FAITH.  3 THE RELIEF OF FINANCIAL HARDSHIP, EITHER GENERALLY OR INDIVIDUALLY OF PEOPLE LIVING OR WORKING IN BRITAIN AND WORLDWIDE BY PROVIDING SUCH PERSONS WITH GOODS/SERVICES, MAKING GRANTS OF MONEY FOR PROVIDING OR PAYING FOR ITEMS, SERVICES OR FACILITIES WHICH THEY COULD NOT OTHERWISE AFFORD THROUGH LACK OF MEANS.  4 TO UNDERTAKE ANY OTHER ACTIVITIES INCIDENTAL TO THE REALISATION OF THE ABOVE-MENTIONED OBJECTS.

name: GORDON MOODY ASSOCIATION
activities: To provide advice, education and high quality and innovative therapeutic support to problem gamblers and those affected by problem gambling, through residential, online and outreach services. The charity offers a unique and intensive residential treatment programme in the UK for those gamblers most severely addicted as well as online support and advice to problem gamblers outside Great Britain.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CHARITY ARE TO BENEFIT THE PUBLIC BY RELIEF OF THE NEEDS OF THOSE SUFFERING AS A RESULT OF PROBLEM GAMBLING AND BY ASSISTING THOSE ALLEVIATING THE SAME AND BY RESEARCH INTO ITS CAUSES, EFFECTS AND ALLEVIATION AND BY EDUCATION OF THEPUBLIC ACCORDINGLY IN ALL RESPECTS IN CONGRUENCE WITH THE LAW OF CHARITY OF ENGLAND AND WALES FROM TIME TO TIME

name: S M D C
activities: RAISING MONEY FOR LOCAL AND MASONIC CHARITIES.
objects: TO APPLY BOTH THE CAPITAL AND INCOME OF THE FUND TO OR THE RELIEF OF SUCH POOR AND DISTRESSED BROTHERS MASONS OR THEIR POOR AND DISTRESSED WIDOWS AND CHILDREN OR TO OR THE BENEFIT OF SUCH MASONIC CHARITIES OR OTHER CHARITABLE INSTITUTION SOCIETIES ANDOBJECTS AS THE SMDC SHALL IN DULY CONSTITUTED MEETING FROM TIME TO TIME DIRECT.

name: SCIENTIFIC COMMITTEE ON ANTARCTIC RESEARCH
activities: The charity has two main objectives:  a) advance and promote scientific knowledge, understanding and education on any aspect of; and b) initiate, facilitate, co-ordinate and encourage international scientific research activity in;       i)the Antarctic region; ii)on the role of the Antarctic region in the Earth system; and  iii)on the effect of global change on the Antarctic region.
objects: THE CHARITY'S OBJECTS ( THE OBJECTS ) ARE;  1) TO ADVANCE AND PROMOTE SCIENTIFIC KNOWLEDGE, UNDERSTANDING AND EDUCATION ON ANY ASPECT OF THE ANTARCTIC REGION, ON THE ROLE OF THE ANTARCTIC REGION IN THE EARTH SYSTEM, AND ON THE EFFECT OF GLOBAL CHANGE ON THE ANTARCTIC REGION; AND.  2) TO INITIATE, FACILITATE, CO-ORDINATE AND ENCOURAGE INTERNATIONAL SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH ACTIVITY IN THE ANTARCTIC REGION, ON THE ROLE OF THE ANTARCTIC REGION IN THE EARTH SYSTEM, AND ON THE EFFECT OF GLOBAL CHANGE ON THEANTARCTIC REGION;

name: ROSA FUND
activities: Rosa is the first UK-wide fund for women's initiatives. Rosa's vision is of equality and justice for women and girls in the UK. We aim to raise and distribute money to women's initiatives and influence other to do the same. We fund initiatives in the priority areas of economic justice, equal representation, health & well-being, and safety.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CHARITY ARE TO FURTHER ANY PURPOSES WHICH ARE CHARITABLE UNDER THE LAWS OF ENGLAND AND WALES FROM TIME TO TIME, INCLUDING TO PROMOTE THE EFFICIENCY AND EFFECTIVENESS OF CHARITIES AND THE EFFECTIVE USE OF CHARITABLE RESOURCES, WITH PARTICULAR REFERENCE TO CHARITIES WORKING WITH WOMEN OR ADDRESSING ISSUES THAT AFFECT WOMEN.

name: KENILWORTH LIONS LIMITED
activities: Activity involves re-cycling of furniture, white goods and other saleable items to raise charitable funds by the collection of donated items for reuse and sale Support disadvantaged community members in Coventry, Warwickshire and its environs in hardship or distress by the provision of furniture and effects  Apply funds to benefit of other organisations established for charitable purposes
objects: TO HOLD FUNDS AND ITS INCOME TO APPLY THEM FOR ANY PURPOSE WHICH IS CHARITABLE ACCORDING TO THE LAW AND ENGLAND AND WALES WHETHER FOR THE BENEFIT OF ANY INDIVIDUAL OR GROUP OF PEOPLE OR FOR THE BENEFIT OF OTHER ORGANISATIONS ESTABLISHED FOR CHARITABLEPURPOSES.

name: THE LITTLE CHARITY
activities: The principal object of the charity is to provide relief of poverty, the advancement of education, the advancement of religion and any other purposes which are exclusively charitable.
objects: THE RELIEF OF POVERTY, THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION, THE ADVANCEMENT OF RELIGION AND ANY OTHER PURPOSES WHICH ARE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE ACCORDING TO THE LAW OF ENGLAND AND WALES AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME DETERMINE.

name: WILLETT CHARITABLE TRUST BISHOPSTONE
activities: Administer and manage the Village Green for the inhabitants of the area of benefit
objects: TO ADMINISTER AND MAINTAIN AN OPEN SPACE TO BE KNOWN AS BISHOPSTONE VILLAGE GREEN FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF THE AREA OF BENEFIT AND TO BE USED FOREVER AS AN AREA FOR INFORMAL RECREATION PLAY OR OTHER LEISURE-TIME OCCUPATIONS, A MEETING PLACE FOR COMMUNITY EVENTS AND FOR ANY OTHER LAWFUL PURPOSE CONSISTENT WITH THESE TRUSTS AND FOR THE GENERAL BENEFIT OF THE COMMUNITY.

name: HEART JEWEL KADAMPA BUDDHIST CENTRE
activities: Our activities include teaching meditation to Buddhists and non-Buddhists. Providing courses at the Centre in Matlock Bath and in the branches in the region. The aim of teaching Buddhist Meditation and practice is to help people find methods to alleviate stress and find greater happiness.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CHARITY ("THE OBJECTS") ARE TO PROMOTE THE BUDDHIST FAITH UNDER THE  SPIRITUAL GUIDANCE OF THE ELECTED GENERAL SPIRITUAL DIRECTOR OF THE NEW KADAMPA  TRADITION - INTERNATIONAL KADAMPA BUDDHIST UNION PRINCIPALLY THROUGH THE ACTIVITIES OF  TEACHING, STUDY, PRACTICE AND THE OBSERVANCE OF MORAL DISCIPLINE ALL WITHIN THE MAHAYANA  BUDDHIST TRADITION OF ATISHA AND JE TSONGKHAPA AS TAUGHT BY VENERABLE GESHE KELSANG  GYATSO, THE FOUNDER OF THE NEW KADAMPA TRADITION - INTERNATIONAL KADAMPA BUDDHIST  UNION, THROUGH THE CONTINUOUS IMPLEMENTATION OF THE THREE NEW KADAMPA TRADITION  STUDY PROGRAMMES: THE GENERAL PROGRAMME, THE FOUNDATION PROGRAMME, AND THE  TEACHER TRAINING PROGRAMME, ALL AS DEFINED IN SCHEDULE A OF THIS MEMORANDUM.

name: RHYTHMS OF LIFE INTERNATIONAL
activities: We provide food, clothing, toiletries and support to London's homeless. Our volunteers serve meals 365 days a year as well as handing out clean clothes, sleeping bags and personal hygiene products. We also provide a range of classes for the homeless, including IT, life skills, and English as a foreign language, to people to rebuild their confidence and find employment.
objects: THE RELIEF AND ASSISTANCE OF PEOPLE IN ANY PART OF THE WORLD WHO ARE THE VICTIMS OF WAR OR NATURAL DISASTER, TROUBLE, OR CATASTROPHE IN PARTICULAR BY THE SUPPLY OF MEDICAL AID TO SUCH PERSONS.  TO RELIEVE FINANCIAL HARDSHIP AND SICKNESS, TO PROMOTE AND PROTECT GOOD HEALTH AND TO ADVANCE EDUCATION IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY PROVIDING SHELTER, FOOD, WAR FACILITIES AND EDUCATION.

name: LOWTHER CASTLE AND GARDENS TRUST
activities: Restoring and conserving Lowther Castle and gardens, promoting public access to this nationally significant building and offering access to high quality information about the site, covering history, conservation, economics and culture.
objects: 3.1.1  TO MANAGE, RESTORE AND PRESERVE FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT LOWTHER CASTLE IN CUMBRIA TOGETHER WITH ITS ANCILLARY BUILDINGS AND ITS GARDENS ARBORETA WOODLANDS AND PARK OR SUCH PART OR PARTS THEREOF AS SHALL FROM TIME TO TIME BE HELD BY THE CHARITY (WHICH PREMISES AS FROM TIME TO TIME HELD BY THE CHARITY ARE HEREINAFTER REFERRED TO AS "LOWTHER") AND TO PROMOTE FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT THE STUDY AND APPRECIATION OF LOWTHER AS A PLACE OF HISTORIC ARCHITECTURAL AND HORTICULTURAL INTEREST AND NATURAL BEAUTY;  3.1.2  TO PRESERVE FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT SUCH PICTURES STATUES FURNITURE BOOKS SILVERWARE ARCHIVES AND OTHER CHATTELS BEING OF HISTORIC OR ARTISTIC INTEREST AS THE CHARITY CONSIDERS IT APPROPRIATE TO ACQUIRE (WHETHER ON LEASE OR LOAN OR BY WAY OF GIFT OR PURCHASE OR OTHERWISE) AND TO KEEP AT LOWTHER OR ELSEWHERE (ALL SUCH CHATTELS BEING HERINAFTER REFERRED TO AS "THE CHARITY'S CHATTELS") AND TO PROMOTE FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT THE STUDY AND APPRECIATION OF THE CHARITY'S CHATTELS AS FEATURESOF HISTORIC OR ARTISTIC INTEREST;  3.1.3  TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN THE ARTS AND SCIENCES PARTICULARLY BY THE ESTABLISHMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF A MUSEUM OR GALLERY;  3.1.4  TO PROMOTE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC THE CONSERVATION, PROTECTION AND IMPROVEMENT OF THE PHYSICAL AND NATURAL ENVIRONMENT OF LOWTHER;  3.1.5  TO FACILITATE AND ENCOURAGE THE USE OCCUPATION AND ENJOYMENT OF THE WHOLE OR ANY PART OF LOWTHER AND THE CHARITY'S CHATTELS FOR SUCH OTHER EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS THE CHARITY FROM TIME TO TIME CONSIDERS APPROPRIATE.

name: STEP (UK) LTD
activities: Step (UK) Ltd is an international development charity, working to improve the lives of vulnerable children in the Kurdish region of Iraq.  We sponsor front-line work such as a children's drop-in centre and more strategic work such as the implementation of the first foster care policy in the region.  We have also sponsored child protection projects in camps for refugees and displaced Iraqi people.
objects: A) THE DEVELOP THE CAPACITY AND SKILLS OF DISADVANTAGED CHILDREN AND ADULTS IN SUCH A  WAY THAT THEY ARE BETTER ABLE TO IDENTIFY, AND HELP MEET, THEIR NEEDS AND TO  PARTICIPATE MORE FULLY IN THEIR SOCIETY.  B) THE RELIEF OF FINANCIAL HARDSHIP AMONGST DISADVANTAGED CHILDREN AND ADULTS  C) TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION AND TRAINING OF DISADVANTAGED CHILDREN AND ADULTS SO AS  TO ADVANCE THEM IN LIFE AND ASSIST THEM TO ADAPT WITHIN THEIR EXISTING OR NEW  COMMUNITY  D) TO PRESERVE AND PROTECT THE PHYSICAL AND MENTAL HEALTH OF DISADVANTAGED CHILDREN  AND ADULTS  E) THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE  OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE OF THOSE PERSONS WHO HAVE NEED OF SUCH  FACILITIES BY REASON OFTHEIR YOUTH, AGE, INFIRMITY OR DISABLEMENT, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP  OR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES.  F) TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND DEVELOP THE CAPACITY AND SKILLS, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT  EXCLUSIVELY BY THE PROVISION OF TRAINING, OF "CARERS" WITHIN PROFESSIONAL BODIES, LAY  PEOPLE AND THOSE WORKING WITHIN GOVERNMENT STRUCTURES IN DEVELOPING COUNTRIES.  G) TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN THE UNITED KINGDOM IN GENERAL ABOUT THE  ISSUES RELATION TO SUCH DISADVANTAGED CHILDREN AND ADULTS.  SUCH WORK AMONG DISADVANTAGED CHILDREN AND ADULTS MAYBE UNDERTAKEN WORLD-WIDE, BUT A  FOCUS WILL REMAIN ON AREAS AFFECTED BY WAR AND INTERNAL CONFLICTS RESULTING IN INCREASED  POVERTY AND DISPLACEMENT

name: BISHOP'S WALTHAM IN BLOOM
activities: Provide planted hanging baskets, tubs and flowerbeds for the visual enhancement of the environment, hold local competitions for the encouragement of participation by the local community
objects: THE CHARITY'S OBJECTS (THE OBJECTS) ARE TO PROMOTE HORTICULTURE AND FLORICULTURE  FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC GENERALLY AND ESPECIALLY THOSE WHO LIVE IN OR VISIT  BISHOP'S WALTHAM BY THE PROVISION OF FLORAL DISPLAYS, SHRUBS, TREES AND  LANDSCAPES INPLACES VISIBLE TO THE PUBLIC AND BY THE HOLDING OF FLORAL  COMPETITIONS.

name: LOYLA URGENT POOR HELP
activities: The relief of financial need and suffering among victims of natural or other kinds of disaster in any part of the world especially in the Sylhet region of Bangladesh, in the form of any means deemed suitable by the trustees.
objects: THE RELIEF OF FINANCIAL NEED AND SUFFERING AMONG VICTIMS OF NATURAL OR OTHER KINDS OF DISASTER IN ANY PART OF THE WORLD, ESPECIALLY THE SYLHET REGION OF BANGLADESH, IN THE FORM OF ANY MEANS DEEMED SUITABLE BY THE TRUSTEES.

name: NOMAD INTERNATIONAL
activities: UK and Africa
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE ASSOCIATION ARE TO:  (A)  PROMOTE THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF THE AREA OF BENEFIT   WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF SEX, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, NATIONALITY, AGE, DISABILITY, RACE OR OF POLITICAL, RELIGIOUS OR OTHER OPINIONS, BY ASSOCIATING TOGETHER THE SAID INHABITANTS AND THE STATUTORY AUTHORITIES, VOLUNTARY AND OTHER ORGANISATIONS IN A COMMON EFFORT TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND TO PROVIDE FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION AND LEISURE-TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR THE SAID INHABITANTS;  (B)  ESTABLISH, OR SECURE THE ESTABLISHMENT, OF A COMMUNITY CENTRE (HEREINAFTER CALLED "THE CENTRE") AND TO MAINTAIN AND MANAGE THE SAME (WHETHER ALONE OR IN CO-OPERATION WITH ANY LOCAL AUTHORITY OR OTHER PERSON OR BODY) IN FURTHERANCE OF THESE OBJECTS;  (C)  PROMOTE SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS MAY FROM TIME TO TIME BE DETERMINED.  THE ASSOCIATION SHALL BE NON-PARTY IN POLITICS AND NON-SECTARIAN IN RELIGION. THE AREA OF  BENEFIT SHALL BE NATIONAL AND OVERSEAS.

name: TANZEEMUS SUNNAH FOUNDATION
activities: Providing general education within Bangladeshi community in the UK and Bangladesh.
objects: TO WORK FOR BETTER PROVISION OF EDUCATION TO THE DISADVANTAGED PEOPLE OF BANGLADESH AND PROVIDE THE MOTHER TONGUE AND CULTURAL EDUCATION TO THE CHILDREN IN THE UNITED KINGDOM.  A TO RELIEVE FINANCIAL HARDSHIP, SICKNESS AND POOR HEALTH AMONGST BANGLADESHI ELDERLY PEOPLE.  B THE RELIEF OF SICKNESS AND THE PRESERVATION OF HEALTH AMONG CITIZENS OF BANGLADESH.  C TO WORK FOR THE ERADICATION  OF POVERTY  THROUGH INTERNATIONAL ASSISTED PROGRAMMERS.

name: THE LAYZELL BURES CHARITY
activities: Provision of farmland for rent at non-commercial rates to prospective young farmers.
objects: THE SUPPORT OF YOUNG PERSONS SETTING OUT IN FARMING WHO ARE IN NEED, AND RELIEF OF UNEMPLOYMENT BY;  THE PROVISION OF LOANS FOR THE PURCHASE OF FARMING EQUIPMENT.  THE PROVISION OF TRAINING OF SUCH PERSONS IN AGRICULTURE AND FARM MANAGEMENT; AND  THE PROVISION OF FARM LAND UPON TERMS APPROPRIATE TO THEIR NEED

name: NWG NETWORK
activities: We are a UK network of practitioners, policy makers and researchers working with children and young people who are at risk, or who have experience of, sexual exploitation, and their families and carers. We offer support and advice; support research and policy development informed by practice; organise practitioners seminars and facilitate the sharing of learning via the internet.
objects: TO PROMOTE, ENABLE, SUPPORT AND DEVELOP THE PROTECTION OF CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE WHO ARE AFFECTED BY SEXUAL EXPLOITATION, HUMAN TRAFFICKING AND MODERN SLAVERY AND THE RELIEF IN NEED OF SUCH PERSONS AFFECTED IN SUCH PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE DIRECTORS FROM TIME TO TIME MAY THINK FIT, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY:  1. PROVIDING A FORUM FOR PROJECTS OR ORGANISATIONS CONCERNED WITH THE RELIEF OF CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE WHO ARE SUFFERING BECAUSE OF SEXUAL EXPLOITATION, MODERN SLAVERY;  2. PROVIDING LINKS INTO CURRENT RESEARCH, POLICY AND PROJECT DEVELOPMENTS WITHIN THE FIELD OF SEXUAL EXPLOITATION, MODERN SLAVERY OF CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE AND OFFERING OPPORTUNITY FOR EXAMPLES OF GOOD, BAD AND DEVELOPING PRACTICE TO BE SHARED AND DISCUSSED;  3. ENCOURAGING THE COORDINATION OF DIFFERENT APPROACHES AND AIMING TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF A COORDINATED POLICY AND PRACTICE CONCERNING CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE AT RISK OF OR SUFFERING SEXUAL EXPLOITATION, MODERN SLAVERY;  4. ENCOURAGING A CHILD CENTRED PRACTICE THAT RECOGNISES AND RESPECTS DIVERSITY;  5. DEVELOPING AN APPROPRIATE SUPPORT NETWORK FOR SERVICES WORKING WITH CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE AT RISK OF OR EXPERIENCING SEXUAL EXPLOITATION, MODERN SLAVERY;  6. ENABLING THE CHARITY TO BE HEARD AS A COLLECTIVE GROUP OF PROJECTS AND ORGANISATIONS WORKING IN THE FIELD OF SEXUAL EXPLOITATION, MODERN SLAVERY;  7. ASSISTING IN THE ERADICATION OF THE SEXUAL EXPLOITATION AND MODERN SLAVERY OF CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE

name: HIGGINSHAW COMMUNITY PROJECT LIMITED
activities: Rugby club from Juniors right through to open age level. Community projects to assist local development. The regeneration of the St Stephens church into a community centre with facilities to assist the development of the Higginshaw community.
objects: THE PROMOTION OF COMMUNITY PARTICIPATION IN HEALTHY RECREATION IN PARTICULAR BY THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR THE PLAYING OF RUGBY LEAGUE FOOTBALL.

name: BRISTOL BAPTIST FUND
activities: 1.	In aid of the stipends of pastors, clerical or lay, of Baptist chapels within the counties of Gloucester, Devon, Cornwall, Somerset or Wiltshire; 2.	In aid of poor students for the Baptist ministry, at Bristol Baptist College or elsewhere; 3.	Towards the support of Bristol Baptist College and its library.
objects: 1.  IN AID OF THE STIPENDS OF PASTORS, CLERICAL OR LAY, OF BAPTIST CHAPELS WITHIN THE COUNTIES OF GLOUCESTER, DEVON, CORNWALL, SOMERSET OR WILTSHIRE;  2)  IN AID OF POOR STUDENTS FOR THE BAPTIST MINISTRY, AT BRISTOL BAPTIST COLLEGE OR ELSEWHERE;  3)  TOWARDS THE SUPPORT OF BRISTOL BAPTIST COLLEGE AND ITS LIBRARY.

name: YORK VINEYARD
activities: We hold Sunday meetings, mid week groups,training events seminars and out reach programmes in which we seek to worship, train ,educate, provide pastoral care and advance the Kingdom of God. We train workers and bring relief to the poor and needy through our compassion ministries in which we provide food and clothing for the homeless, visit the sick and elderly and reach out to the drug addicts.
objects: A)  TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATEMENT OF BELIEFS IN THE SCHEDULE TO THE ARTICLES HERETO ATTACHED INCLUDING BUT NOT BY WAY OF LIMITATION THROUGH THE PLANTING OF OTHER VINEYARD CHURCHES IN SUCH WAYS AND IN SUCH PARTS OF YORK, THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES FROM TIME TO TIME MAY THINK FIT;  B)  TO FURTHER CHRISTIAN EDUCATION IN SUCH PARTS OF YORK, THE UNITED KINGDOM AND THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES FROM TIME TO TIME MAY THINK FIT;  C)  TO RELIEVE SICKNESS AND FINANCIAL HARDSHIP AND TO PROMOTE AND PRESERVE GOOD HEALTH BY THE PROVISION OF FUNDS, GOODS OR SERVICES OF ANY KIND, INCLUDING THROUGH THE PROVISION OF COUNSELLING, TRAINING IN LIFE SKILLS AND SUPPORT IN SUCH PARTS OF YORK, THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES FROM TIME TO TIME MAY THINK FIT;  D)  TO PROVIDE OR ASSIST IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION OF INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, AGE, INFIRMITY OR DISABILITY, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR SOCIAL CIRCUMSTANCES WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE.

name: DARLINGTON ASSOCIATION ON DISABILITY
activities: Darlington Association on Disability was established in 1986 as a voluntary and charitable organisation led by disabled people. It exists to promote independence and choice, and supports disabled people and carers through the provision of services, support and information and by tackling issues locally and nationally. DAD promotes the social model of disability.
objects: 1 TO RELIEVE THE NEEDS OF DISABLED PEOPLE AND CARERS, FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT, RESIDENT IN PARTICULAR, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, DARLINGTON AND THE SURROUNDING AREAS IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY THE PROMOTION OF EQUALITY, DIVERSITY AND INDEPENDENCE THROUGH THE PROVISION OF SERVICES, SUPPORT, INFORMATION AND TRAINING; AND  2 TO DIRECT, PROMOTE AND SUPPORT THE EFFICIENT WORKING OF CHARITABLE ORGANISATIONS, VOLUNTARY BODIES AND STATUTORY BODIES IN THEIR WORK TO RELIEVE DISABILITY ('THE OBJECTS').

name: NORCOT MISSION CHURCH
activities: We are an independent evangelical church situated in Reading on the edge of the Dee Park Estate.
objects: A TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATEMENT OF BELIEFS APPEARING IN THE SCHEDULE HERETO IN READING AND IN SUCH OTHER PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT AND TO FULFIL SUCH OTHER PURPOSES WHICH ARE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE ACCORDING TO THE LAW OF ENGLAND AND WALES AND ARE CONNECTED WITH THE CHARITABLE WORK OF THE TRUST.  B TO RELIEVE SICKNESS AND FINANCIAL HARDSHIP AND TO PROMOTE AND PRESERVE GOOD HEALTH BY THE PROVISION OF FUNDS, GOODS OR SERVICES OF ANY KIND, INCLUDING THROUGH THE PROVISION OF COUNSELLING AND SUPPORT IN READING AND IN SUCH OTHER PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES FROM TIME TO TIME MAY THINK FIT.

name: WORLD OF GRACE MISSION EVANGELIQUE DU SALUT DES AMES DANS LE MONDE ENTIER
activities: We offered Sunday church service on 52 sundays of the year and collected tithes and offerings to pay for the rent of the church; the insurance premiums and to support widows, orphans and churches in Israel and in India.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATEMENT OF BELIEFS APPEARING IN THE SCHEDULE HERE TO IN MILTON KEYNES AND FROM SUCH OTHER PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT AND TO FULFIL SUCH OTHER PURPOSES WHICH ARE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE ACCORDING TO THE LAW OF ENGLAND WALES AND ARE CONNECTED WITH THE CHARITABLE WORK OF TRUST.  TO RELIEVE PERSONS WHO ARE IN CONDITIONS OF NEED OR HARDSHIP OR WHO ARE AGED IN OTHER PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT.

name: HOMEOPATHY IN AFRICA
activities: provision of homeopathic education and clinical training in Ghana.
objects: 1 THE RELIEF AND PREVENTION OF SICKNESS IN VARIOUS PARTS OF AFRICA AND GHANA IN PARTICULAR THROUGH THE PROMOTION OF HOMEOPATHY IN PARTNERSHIP WITH LOCAL COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENTS AND INITIATIVES.  2 COMMUNITY HEALTH EDUCATION IN CONJUNCTION WITH LOCAL HEALTH WORKERS AND PRACTICES  3 SUPPORT IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF HOMEOPATHIC EDUCATION AND VOCATIONAL TRAINING FACILITIES IN AFRICA TOGETHER WITH LOCAL PARTNERS

name: UNIVERSITY JEWISH CHAPLAINCY
activities: UJC is an independent charity that exists solely to provide all Jewish students across the UK with chaplains.  These carefully selected husband and wife teams are available 24/7 to offer practical, welfare, spiritual, educational support, guidance and encouragement to all Jewish students irrespective of background and affiliation.  Whatever your need our chaplains are there for you.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE SOCIAL WELFARE, SPIRITUAL AND EDUCATIONAL NEEDS OF JEWISH STUDENTS AT UNIVERSITIES AND INSTITUTIONS OF HIGHER EDUCATION IN THE UNITED KINGDOM AND TO PROMOTE, IMPROVE AND DEVELOP JEWISH EDUCATION FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT.

name: MADRASA IBRAHIM
activities: THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE ISLAMIC RELIGION; THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION ACCORDING TO THE QURAN, INCLUDING ACADEMIC STUDIES AMONG THE MUSLIM COMMUNITY IN BOLTON.

THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION ACCORDING TO THE QURAN, INCLUDING ACADEMIC STUDIES AMONG THE MUSLIM COMMUNITY IN BOLTON.

name: SECOND CHANCE ASSOCIATION
activities: We support and fund Christian missions in UK and overseas who provide humanitarian aid for the prevention and relief of poverty.  Funds are generated by the sale of second hand goods through our charity shop. We offer training and support to our volunteers and the shop acts as a centre where people meet and make friends.
objects: 1 THE RELIEF OF THOSE WHO ARE IN NEED BY REASON OF YOUTH, AGE, ILL HEALTH, DISABILITY, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR ANY OTHER DISABILITY, FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT, BY MAKING GRANTS TO CHARITIES OR COMMUNITY ORGANISATIONS PROVIDING SUPPORT IN THESE AREAS.  2 THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION IN THE PUBLIC BENEFIT BY MAKING GRANTS TO EDUCATIONAL ESTABLISHMENTS WORKING TO SUSTAIN AND INCREASE INDIVIDUAL AND COLLECTIVE KNOWLEDGE IN THE UK AND OVERSEAS. THE GRANTS ARE TO BE USED IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY TOSUPPORT THE COST OF PROVIDING EDUCATION AND EXTRA -CURRICULAR ACTIVITIES.  3 THE ADVANCEMENT OF CITIZENSHIP THROUGH SUPPORTING YOUTH GROUPS AND THE VOLUNTARY SECTOR BY PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES TO VOLUNTEER IN THE CHARITY'S SHOP AND CHARITY EVENTS, ANDTO GAIN WORK EXPERIENCE. ALSO BY MAKING GRANTS TO YOUTH GROUPS TO SUPPORT THE COSTS OF THEIR WORK AND EVENTS.  4 THE ADVANCEMENT OF CHRISTIANITY BY MAKING GRANTS TO ORGANISATIONS SUPPORTING MISSIONARY AND OUTREACH WORK IN THE UK AND ABROAD.?

name: FRIENDS OF MUSIC AT ST. PETER'S EATON SQUARE LIMITED
activities: The company produces Eaton Square Concerts, featuring outstanding artists in the fine acoustic space of St. Peter's Church Eaton Square.  Discounted tickets are available through local schools to encourage pupils to attend with their parents. The St. Peter's Eaton Square Prize is awarded annually to a promising string quartet in residence at the Royal Academy of Music.
objects: 1)  TO PROMOTE, MAINTAIN, IMPROVE AND ADVANCE EDUCATION PARTICULARLY BY THE ENCOURAGEMENT OF THE ARTS INCLUDING THE ARTS OF OPERA, MUSIC SINGING, DRAMA, BALLET, LITERATURE, SCULPTURE AND PAINTING; AND  2)  TO SUPPORT SUCH CHARITABLE INSTITUTION OR INSTITUTIONS AS THE COUNCIL OF MANAGEMENT OR GOVERNING BODY SHALL IN ITS DISCRETION DETERMINE.

name: VAAD HA EVYONIM
activities: Assists poor families and individuals with urgent needs.
objects: THE RELIEF OF THE SICK-POOR LIVING IN THE UK AND OVERSEAS EITHER GENERALLY OR INDIVIDUALLY THROUGH THE PROVISION OF GRANTS GOODS OR SERVICES.

name: DONCASTER GRAND THEATRE TRUST
activities: We have actively sought to raise the profile of the Theatre and recruit new members to our Friends group by organising history talks with local groups. We have attended events with our exhibition stall. We have run fund raising activities such as sales and continue to hold theatrical events. We continue to engage with other stakeholders to promote the benefits of the Theatre within the community.
objects: TO ACQUIRE, RESTORE AND PRESERVE FOR THE BENEFIT OFTHE PUBLIC AT LARGE THE GRADE 2 LISTED BUILDING KNOWN AS THE DONCASTER GRAND THEATRE; AND  2) TO ADVANCE THE PUBLIC'S EDUCATION, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY INTO THE HISTORY OF THEATRICAL PERFORMANCE WITHIN DONCASTER.

name: GOOD VIBRATIONS (MUSIC) LIMITED
activities: 1. The advancement of education and mental health, in particular but not limited to Indonesian performing arts as a tool to promote, improve, and develop communication skills, teamwork, and creative learning in prisons and other institutions.  2. The promotion of Indonesian classical music, dance, singing and shadow puppetry and related art forms.
objects: 1 ) THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION AND MENTAL HEALTH, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT LIMITED  TO INDONESIAN PERFORMING ARTS AS A TOOL TO PROMOTE, IMPROVE, AND DEVELOP  COMMUNICATION SKILLS, TEAMWORK, AND CREATIVE LEARNING IN PRISONS AND OTHER  INSTITUTIONS;  2 )THE PROMOTION OF INDONESIAN CLASSICAL MUSIC, DANCE, SINGING AND SHADOW  PUPPETRY AND RELATED ART FORMS.

name: KING STANLEY CHURCH OF ENGLAND PRIMARY SCHOOL PARENT, TEACHER AND FRIENDS ASSOCIATION
activities: The purpose of King's Stanley PTFA is to raise money for the benefit of the children of King Stanley school. Various fund rasiing activities have been undertaken including but not restricted to: Summar Fayre, Chirstmas Fayre, Quiz Nights, School discos, Pampering evening, Scarecrow trail, Ice Cream Sales... Donations are given to the school normally for an agreed purpose.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF PUPILS IN THE SCHOOL, IN PARTICULAR BY  DEVELOPING EFFECTIVE RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN THE STAFF, PARENTS AND OTHERS ASSOCIATED WITH THE SCHOOL;  ENGAGING IN ACTIVITIES OR PROVIDING FACILITIES OR EQUIPMENT WHICH SUPPORT THE SCHOOL AND ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF PUPILS.

name: KING STANLEY CHURCH OF ENGLAND PRIMARY SCHOOL PARENT, TEACHER AND FRIENDS ASSOCIATION

Donations are given to the school normally for an agreed purpose.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF PUPILS IN THE SCHOOL, IN PARTICULAR BY  DEVELOPING EFFECTIVE RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN THE STAFF, PARENTS AND OTHERS ASSOCIATED WITH THE SCHOOL;  ENGAGING IN ACTIVITIES OR PROVIDING FACILITIES OR EQUIPMENT WHICH SUPPORT THE SCHOOL AND ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF PUPILS.

name: THE LATIN PROGRAMME-VIA FACILIS
activities: The Latin Programme - Via Facilis improves English literacy in state primary schools through the study of Latin and English grammar. Classes taught range from years 3 to 6. The work done in class and the lesson plans are tailored to meet the needs of both the school and the pupils, with a focus on mixed abilities and different learning strategies.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN THE SUBJECT OF CLASSICS; AND  TO INCREASE OPPORTUNITIES FOR PRIMARY SCHOOL CHILDREN TO RECEIVE AN EDUCATION IN CLASSICS.

name: THE REDEEMED CHRISTIAN CHURCH OF GOD - EAGLES CHRISTIAN CONNECTIONS

objects: 1. TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN RELIGION IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATEMENT OF  BELIEFS ATTACHED TO THIS DOCUMENT AND TO PROMOTE THE TEACHINGS OF JESUS  CHRIST AND TO EVANGELISE IN THE POWER OF HOLY SPIRIT.  2. TO RELIEVE FINANCIAL HARDSHIP.  3. TO ADVANCE EDUCATION WITH A CHRISTIAN ETHOS.  4. TO PROMOTE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC THE PROTECTION OF PEOPLE AND  PROPERTY FROM, AND THE PREVENTION OF, CRIMINAL ACTS IN PARTICULAR BY  WORKING WITH STATUTORY AGENCIES TO COMBAT YOUTH CRIME.  5. TO FURTHER SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE  RESIDENTS OF THE LONDON BOROUGH OF HAVERING AND IN ENGLAND IN GENERAL.

objects: 1)  TO PRESERVE FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT CASTLE CHURCH, STAFFORD BY THE RESTORATION, IMPROVEMENT AND ENHANCEMENT OF ITS FABRIC AND FITTINGS.  2)  TO FURTHER THE RELIGIOUS AND OTHER CHARITABLE WORK OF THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND IN THE ECCLESIASTICAL PARISH OFCASTLE CHURCH, STAFFORD.

name: JERICHO LIVING HERITAGE TRUST
activities: For the benefit of the Jericho community, Oxford residents and the general public; to preserve and enhance the historical heritage in and around Jericho by the provision of educational facilities including the establishment of a Community Centre, a Heritage Centre, the restoration of a working boat yard and a communal open space.  To provide affordable social housing for key workers.
objects: TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND HERITAGE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF JERICHO, OXFORD  AND FOR THE GENERAL PUBLIC BY THE PRESERVATION, RESTORATION, MAINTENANCE, REPAIR AND  ENHANCEMENT OF THE HISTORICAL, ARCHITECTURAL AND BUILT HERITAGE IN AND AROUND JERICHO AND  ITS NEIGHBOURHOOD IN THE FORM OF BUILDINGS, BOATYARDS, WATERWAYS AND OPEN SPACES OF  HISTORICAL, ARCHITECTURAL OR CONSTRUCTIONAL INTEREST; AND  3.2 TO PROVIDE FOR THE ADVANCEMENT OF PUBLIC EDUCATION IN THE SUBJECT OF THE LOCAL AND  NATIONAL HERITAGE ASSOCIATED WITH JERICHO AND ITS NEIGHBOURHOOD BY THE PROVISION OF  EDUCATIONAL AND TRAINING FACILITIES INCLUDING, BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY, THE ESTABLISHMENT AND  MAINTENANCE OF A MUSEUM AND LIVING HERITAGE CENTRE COMPRISING SUCH EXHIBITS ORITEMS  RELATING TO THE HERITAGE OF JERICHO AND ITS NEIGHBOURHOOD AS THE CHARITY MAY FROM TIME  TO TIME HOLD OR RECEIVE; AND  3.3 TO FURTHER OR BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS .OF JERICHO, ITS NEIGHBOURHOOD AND THE CITY OF OXFORD  WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF SEX, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, RACE, OR OF POLITICAL, RELIGIOUS OR OTHER  OPINIONS BY ASSOCIATING TOGETHER THE SAID RESIDENTS AND THE LOCAL AUTHORITIES, VOLUNTARY  AND OTHER ORGANISATIONS IN A COMMON EFFORT TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND TO PROVIDE  FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION AND LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION  WITH THE OBJECTIVE OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR THE RESIDENTS; AND  3.4 TO PROVIDE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE COMMUNITY HOUSING AND ANY ASSOCIATED AMENITIES FOR  PERSON IN CONDITIONS OF NEED UPON TERMS APPROPRIATE TO THEIR MEANS; AND  3 5 TO PROMOTE SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS MAY FROM TIME TO TIME BE DETERMINED

name: CALVARY OUTREACH MINISTRIES WORLDWIDE
activities: Religious Activities
objects: (A) TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATEMENT OF BELIEFS APPEARING IN THE  SCHEDULE HERETO IN LONDON AND IN SUCH OTHER PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE  DIRECTORS OF THE CHARITY (HEREIN CALLED "THE TRUSTEES") MAY FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT (PARTICULARLY  BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY THROUGH EVANGELISM, PRAYER FOR DIVINE HEALING AND DELIVERANCE) AND TO FULFIL  SUCH OTHER PURPOSES WHICH ARE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE ACCORDING TO THE LAW OF ENGLAND AND  WALES AND ARE CONNECTED WITH THE CHARITABLE WORK OF THE CHARITY;  (B) TO RELIEVE PERSONS WHO ARE IN CONDITIONS OF NEED OR HARDSHIP OR WHO ARE AGED OR SICK AND TO  RELIEVE THE DISTRESS CAUSED THEREBY IN LONDON AND IN SUCH OTHER PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR  THE WORLD ASTHE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT.

name: EMPOWERING PEOPLE OFFERING HELP
activities: To help raise money to support the poor in countries such as Zambia, Uganda and India.  Currently got Ralph Turner running the London Marathon to raise money for Esther homes in India
objects: 1 TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE FOLLOWING DOCTRINES - THE BELIEF AND FAITH IN GOD THE FATHER, THE SON AND THE HOLY SPIRIT.  2 THE RELIEF OF FINANCIAL NEEDS AND SUFFERING AMONG VICTIMS OF NATURAL OROTHER KINDS OF DISASTER IN THE FORM OF MONEY (OR OTHER MEANS DEEMED SUITABLE) FOR PERSONS, BODIES, ORGANISATIONS AND/OR COUNTRIES AFFECTED (INCLUDING THE PROVISION OF MEDICAL AID IF NECESSARY).  3 THE RELIEF OF FINANCIAL HARDSHIP, EITHER, GENERALLY OR INDIVIDUALLY FOR PEOPLES OF THE WORLD BY MAKING GRANTS OF MONEY FOR PROVIDING OR PAYING FOR ITEMS, SERVICES OR FACILITIES.  4 THE RELIEF OF THE SICK/POOR PEOPLE OF THE WORLD EITHER GENERALLY OR INDIVIDUALLY THROUGH THE PROVISION OF GRANTS, GOODS ORSERVICES.  5 TO RELIEVE FINANCIAL HARDSHIP, SICKNESS AND HEALTH AMONGST ELDERLY PEOPLE AND CHILDREN.  6 THE RELIEF OF POVERTY AND THE IMPROVEMENT OF THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE IN SOCIALLY AND DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES.

name: THE SHERBET FOUNDATION
activities: The Foundation aims to help individuals and families subject to enforcement action due to financial hardship by awarding an essential household item to help alleviate stress and improve quality of life for them and their family.
objects: THE TRUSTEES SHALL HOLD THE TRUST FUND AND ITS INCOME UPON TRUST TO APPLY THEM TO SUPPORT ANY CHARITY OR CHARITABLE PURPOSE AS THE TRUSTEES IN THEIR DISCRETION THINK FIT, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY THE PROVISION OF GRANTS.

name: MEDWAY AND MAIDSTONE ATHLETIC CLUB
activities: We provide athletics to the community through our membership scheme. Membership of our club is open all sections of the community regardless of race, ethnic origin, nationality, age, disability, gender, occupation, sexual orientation, religion, political or other beliefs.

name: FRIENDS OF THE MOOT HALL CHARITABLE TRUST

objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE GENERAL PUBLIC IN THE SUBJECT OF THE HISTORICAL AND CULTURAL IMPORTANCE OF THE MOOT HALL, MALDON

name: REIGATE METHODIST CHURCH
activities: Provides a Service of Methodist Worship in Reigate every Sunday and at other Christian festivals. Runs annual membership courses. Runs Alpha Courses for those wishing to explore the Christian faith. Provides a summer Holiday Club week for local children. Provides meeting facilities for groups serving the needs of the local community.
objects: The purposes of the Methodist Church are and shall be deemed to have been since the date of union the advancement of -    (a) the Christian faith in accordance with the doctrinal standards and the dicipline of the Methodist Church;    (b) any charitable purpose for the time being of any Connexional, district, circuit, local or other organisation of the Methodist Church;    (c) any charitable purpose for the time being of any society or institution subsiduary or ancillary to the Methodist Church;(d) any purpose for the time being of any charity being a charity subsidiary or ancillary to the Methodist Church.

activities: Christian Church involved in community activities to bring peace to Rossington primarily and secondarily in areas beyond the village.
objects: 2.1. TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATEMENT OF BELIEFS IN  SUCH WAYS AND IN SUCH PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE  TRUSTEES FROM TIME TO TIME MAY THINK FIT;  2.2. TO RELIEVE SICKNESS AND FINANCIAL HARDSHIP AND TO PROMOTE AND PRESERVE GOOD  HEALTH IN SUCH WAYS AND IN SUCH PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS  THE TRUSTEES FROM TIME TO TIME MAY THINK FIT.

name: LAUNCESTON COMMUNITY TRANSPORT PARTNERSHIP
activities: providing transport facilities in Launceston and surrounding parishes for those who are unable to access conventional public transport services
objects: "TO PROVIDE AND MAINTAIN TRANSPORT FACILITIES IN THE AREA OF LAUNCESTON,  AND SURROUNDING PARISHES, FOR THE BENEFIT OF ANY PERSONS WHO HAVE NEED OF  SUCH FACILITIES DUE TO POVERTY, DISABILITY, AGE OR THOSE LIVING IN ISOLATED  AREAS, WHERE THERE IS NO ADEQUATE PUBLIC TRANSPORT FACILITY.

name: INSTITUTE OF CIVIL PROTECTION AND EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT
activities: To promote public safety and protect the lives and property of citizens of the United Kingdom. To advance education in the science or art of civil protection. To provide for the relief of poverty, sickness and distress among those who shall be the victims of or suffer from the effects or aftermath of enemy attacks on civilian populations and/or disasters and emergencies in wartime or peacetime.
objects: 1. TO PROMOTE PUBLIC SAFETY AND TO PROTECT THE LIVES AND PROPERTY OF CITIZENS OF CITIZENS WORLDWIDE.  2. TO ADVANCE EDUCATION IN THE SCIENCE OR ART OF CIVIL PROTECTION.  3. TO PROVIDE FOR THE RELIEF OF POVERTY, SICKNESS AND DISTRESS AMONG THOSE WHO SHALL BE THE VICTIMS OF OR SUFFER FROM THE EFFECTS OR AFTERMATH OF ENEMY ATTACKS ON CIVILIAN POPULATIONS AND/OR DISASTERS AND EMERGENCIES IN WARTIME AND PEACETIME.

name: THE JASPAR FOUNDATION
activities: THE FOUNDATION PROVIDES GRANTS FOR PROJECTS TO RELIEVE PERSONS WHO ARE IN CONDITIONS OF NEED, HARDSHIP OR DISTRESS BY REASON OF THEIR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES AND FURTHER THE EDUCATION OF SUCH PERSONS. IT PROVIDES GRANTS TO INSTITUTIONS AND PROMOTES ACTIVITIES WHICH ADVANCE HINDU RELIGION.
objects: (1)	To relieve persons wheresoever situate who are in conditions of need, hardship or distress as a result of local, national or international disaster or by reason of their social and economic circumstances and to further the education (including social and physical training) of such persons. (2)	To advance the Hindu religion in any part of the World. (3)	To advance such charitable purposes (according to the law of England and Wales) as the trustees see fit from time to time, in particular but not limited to the advancement of health or the saving of lives including but not limited to the making of grants to support medical research or to support those suffering ill health.

name: THE CHIAWA TRUST
activities: Raising funds through a variety of means to send to recipients to promote sustainable development for the benefit of the public through the relief of poverty, improve conditions of socially disadvantaged communities and promote economic growth and regeneration.
objects: TO PROMOTE SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC BY:  A)  THE RELIEF OF POVERTY AND THE IMPROVEMENT OF THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE IN SOCIALLY AND DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES.  B)  THE PROMOTION OF SUSTAINABLE MEANS OF ACHIEVING ECONOMIC GROWTH AND REGENERATION.  SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT MEANS "DEVELOPMENT WHICH MEETS THE NEEDS OF THE PRESENT WITHOUT COMPROMISING THE ABILITY OF FUTURE GENERATIONS TO MEET THEIR OWN NEEDS".

name: THE INTERNATIONAL GUILD OF TOWN PIPERS
activities: The charities main activity is the support and management of a website to advance the education for the public benefit in early music, particularily in the music and history of town bands or Waits. The charity also organises and supports workshops, festivals and performance of early music relevant to Waits bands
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT IN EARLY MUSIC AND HISTORICALLY INFORMED PERFORMANCES IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY IN THE MUSIC OF MEDIEVAL AND RENAISSANCE TOWN WAITS.

name: THE JEROME GATEHOUSE COLLECTION TRUST
activities: To advance the education of the public in the history of military and police bands by the establishment, improvement and maintenance of an archive collection of articles, artefacts, music, information and related items We are presently cataloguing the collection by means of archiving and digitalizing the whole collection to make it more available locally and worldwide through the internet
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN THE HISTORY OF MILITARY AND POLICE BANDS BY THE ESTABLISHMENT, IMPROVEMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF AN ARCHIVE COLLECTION OF ARTICLES, ARTEFACTS, MUSIC, INFORMATION AND RELATED ITEMS.

name: THE CHURCH ON THE BUS
activities: We have provided over 50,000 meals in 10 years to the homeless and needy of Derbyshire. We operate two converted library buses, so those who need food, clothing, toiletries, blankets, sleeping bags and comfort can receive them in an atmosphere of calm, safety and shelter. The food consists of soup, sandwiches, hot drinks and home baking, all of which is provided by a rota of dedicated volunteers.
objects: TO RELIEVE NEED AMONG PEOPLE WHO ARE HOMELESS AND OR FORMER PRISONERS, SICK, SUBSTANCE MISUSERS OR OTHERWISE IN NEED OF HELP BY THE PROVISION OF FOOD, CLOTHING, ADVICE, PRACTICAL HELP AND SUPPORT

name: ZAWIA NAQSHBANDIA MUJADDADIA TRUST

Raise funds to purchase a building for the charity, which will also be made available to the local community
objects: 1 TO PROVIDE OR ASSIST IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES IN THE INTEREST OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION OF INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, AGE, INFIRMITY OR DISABILITY, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR SOCIAL CIRCUMSTANCES WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE.  2 TO ADVANCE THE ISLAMIC RELIGION FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE QURAN AND THE HADITHS OF THE HOLY PROPHET MUHAMMAD (PEACE BY UPON HIM) IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE SCHOOL OF IMAM ABU ANIFA.  3 THE PROMOTION OF RELIGIOUS HARMONY FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC BY  A EDUCATING THE PUBLIC BY RAISING AWARENESS OF THE DISTINCTIVE FEATURES OF ISLAM  B PROMOTING GOOD RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN PERSONS OF DIFFERENT FAITHS  C PROMOTING KNOWLEDGE AND MUTUAL UNDERSTANDING AND RESPECT OF THE BELIEFS AND PRACTICES OF DIFFERENT RELIGIOUS FAITHS  4 TO RELIEVE MEMBERS OF THE MUSLIM COMMUNITY, WHETHER OR NOT RESIDENT IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT, WHO ARE IN CONDITIONS OF NEED, HARDSHIP OR DISTRESS AS A RESULT OF LOCAL, NATIONAL OR INTERNATIONAL DISASTER OR BY REASON OF THEIR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES

name: THE WOOLHOPE DOME ENVIRONMENTAL TRUST
activities: The Trust is active in disbursing small grants for ecological purposes generally totalling up to £10,000 per annum. These are primarily for smallscale projects in the Woolhope Dome area of England but the trustees will also consider applications from a broader geographical area if these fit with the objectives of the trust.
objects: THE TRUSTEES MUST APPLY THE INCOME OF THE CHARITY IN FURTHER THE FOLLOWING OBJECTS ("THE OBJECTS") THE AREA OF BENEFIT SHALL BE WORLD-WIDE BUT PRIORITY SHOULD BE GIVEN TO PROJECTS AND SCHEMES ON OR RELATED TO THE WOOLHOPE DOME BIODIVERSITY ENHANCEMENTAREA OF SOUTHERN HEREFORDSHIRE ("THE AREA OF BENEFIT")  1.  FOR THE ENHANCEMENT OF WILDLIFE CONSERVATION.  2.  FOR THE REMEDIATION OF DERELICT AND CONTAMINATED LAND FOR WILDLIFE CONSERVATION.  3.  FOR THE USE OF RARE OR TRADITIONAL BREED LIVESTOCK TOPROMOTE BIODIVERSITY IN SPECIES-RICH MEADOWS.  4.  FOR THE PUBLIC APPRECIATION AND ENJOYMENT OF THE COUNTRYSIDE INCLUDING DISABLED ACCESS.  5.  FOR THE EDUCATION BOTH FORMAL AND INFORMAL IN ECOLOGY, CONSERVATION AND SUSTAINABLE FARMING AND FORESTRY.6.  FOR GENERAL CHARITABLE PURPOSES.

name: MIDLAND LEGAL SUPPORT TRUST
activities: The Midland Legal Support Trust provides financial support through grants and other support to charitable and other agencies that provide advice, casework or representation in respect of legal issues in the Midlands. The Trust aims to promote and encourage the legal profession to support charities in the legal sector.
objects: 3.1 THE RELIEF OF POVERTY AND DISTRESS AMONG RESIDENTS OF THE MIDLANDS IN ANY  WAY THAT THE TRUSTEES THINK FIT, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THROUGH THE  PROVISION OF FINANCIAL AND OTHER SUPPORT TO CHARITABLE AND OTHER AGENCIES  THAT PROVIDE ADVICE,CASEWORK OR REPRESENTATION IN RESPECT OF LEGAL ISSUES;  AND  3.2 THE PROMOTION OF SUCH OTHER PURPOSES BEING EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE ACCORDING  TO THE LAW OF ENGLAND AND WALES AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME  DETERMINE.

name: THE SOLUTION CENTRE
activities: MEETING TWICE WEEKLY AS A CHURCH TO WORSHIP AND ENCOURAGE SUPPORTERS AND MEMBERS. ALSO HOLDS SUNDAY CLUB FOR CHILDREN AGE 0-14 SUNDAYS 10-11AM; AND WEDNESDAYS 6:30 - 8:30PM
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CHURCH (ôTHE OBJECTSö) ARE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC:  (A) TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH IN SUCH WAYS AND IN SUCH PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE CHURCH COUNCIL FROM TIME TO TIME MAY THINK FIT;  (B) TO RELIEVE SICKNESS AND FINANCIAL HARDSHIP AND TO PROMOTE AND PRESERVE GOOD HEALTH BY THE PROVISION OF FUNDS, GOODS OR SERVICES OF ANY KIND INCLUDING THROUGH THE PROVISION OF COUNSELLING AND SUPPORT IN SUCH PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE CHURCH COUNCIL FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT; AND  (C) TO ADVANCE EDUCATION IN SUCH WAYS AND IN SUCH PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE CHURCH COUNCIL FORM TIME TO TIME MAY THINK FIT.

name: EAST LONDON TABERNACLE BAPTIST CHURCH
activities: ELT Baptist Church's primary objective is the advancement of the Christian faith both in the United Kingdom and overseas by teaching the Bible and promoting prayer and fellowship amongst believers.  It also seeks the advancement for public benefit of religious education and the care of the aged, poor, sick and disabled.

TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN RELIGION FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC THROUGH THE HOLDING OF PRAYER MEETINGS, LECTURES, PRODUCING AND OR DISTRIBUTING LITERATURE AN CHRISTIAN RELIGION TO ENLIGHTEN OTHERS ABOUT THE CHRISTIAN RELIGION.  TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN RELIGION BY MEANS OF BROADCASTING CHRISTIAN MESSAGE OF AN EVANGELISTIC AND TEACHING NATURE.

activities: The Centre for Fun and Families is a voluntary organisation that has pioneered and developed a range of group work programmes to help parents who are having behaviour difficulties with their children or young people. objects: TO EDUCATE FAMILIES AND THE PUBLIC IN BETTER STANDARDS OF CHILD CARE, THE IMPORTANCE OF SOUND RELATIONS BETWEEN PARENTS AND CHILDREN FOR THE MAINTENANCE AND ENRICHMENT OF FAMILY LIFE AND GOOD INTER-PERSONAL COMMUNICATION BETWEEN ADULTS AND CHILDREN PARTICULARLY, THOUGH NOT EXCLUSIVELY WITHIN FAMILIES, AND TO PROMOTE, MAINTAIN, IMPROVE AND ADVANCE THE EDUCATION AND WELFARE OF FAMILIES AND THEIR MEMBERS BEING IN NEED BY REASON OF THEIR CIRCUMSTANCES OR THEIR PHYSICAL, EMOTIONAL OR SPIRITUAL STATE.

name: MAYFIELD NURSERIES
activities: Mayfield is a working horticultural nursery which provides training and therapy for people with mental health issues. We are working with at least 40 people at any time. The nursery is open to the public for plant and other sales, we run a market stall selling plants and produce, and we present at a number of local horticultural shows.
objects: TO PROMOTE THE PRESERVATION OF MENTAL HEALTH AND TO ASSIST IN RELIEVING AND  REHABILITATING PERSONS SUFFERING FROM MENTAL DISORDER OR CONDITIONS OF EMOTIONAL OR  MENTAL DISTRESS REQUIRING ADVICE OR TREATMENT PRINCIPALLY IN SOUTHAMPTON AND ALSO  IN HAMPSHIRE AND BORDERING AREAS IN ASSOCIATION WITH THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION FOR  MENTAL HEALTH (HEREINAFTER CALLED "MIND") AND IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE AIMS AND  OBJECTS OF MIND; AND  THE RELIEF OF PERSONS WITH IMPAIRED MENTAL ABILITY WHETHER RESULTING IN PHYSICAL  MENTAL OR LEARNING DISABILITIES AND PERSONS SUFFERING HARDSHIP OR NEED AS A DIRECT OR  INDIRECT RESULT OF SUCH CONDITION.

We give aid to the victims of calamities.

name: WREN MUSIC
activities: Wren Music works with as many people as possible from all walks of life and especially those excluded from mainstream society, to make music with voice and instruments, using traditional and folk music to inspire creativity, to promote inclusion and to celebrate identity and diversity.

TO PROMOTE SOCIAL INCLUSION FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT BY PREVENTING PEOPLE FROM BECOMING SOCIALLY EXCLUDED, RELIEVING THE NEEDS OF THOSE PEOPLE WHO ARE SOCIALLY EXCLUDED AND ASSISTING THEM TO  INTEGRATE INTO SOCIETY THROUGH FOLKLORE MUSIC AND RELATED ARTS ACTIVITIES, (BEING EXCLUDED FROM SOCIETY, OR PART OF SOCIETY, AS A RESULT OF BEING A MEMBER OF A SOCIALLY AND ECONOMICALLY DEPRIVED COMMUNITY.

name: EAST SHEEN BAPTIST CHURCH
activities: The Church's object is to promote the Christian faith in accordance with the principles of the Baptist denomination, to people of all ages and backgrounds.  This is achieved by holding regular services, meetings and activities. The Church provides appropriate support freely to its members, congregation and the local community.  The Church also supports a number missionary organisations.
objects: The principal purpose of the Church is the advancement of the Christian faith according to the principles of the Baptist denomination.  The Church may also advance education and carry out other charitable purposes in the United Kingdom and/or other parts of the world.

activities: Provide a network for  information &  drop in services for the community. Provide elderly services for people with cultural and language difficulty.
