name: LINCOLN COLLEGE OXFORD
activities: The principal focus of the College's activities is on its academic work: that is, high quality research and the education of new generations of students in a range of subject areas. The College provides facilities for study, in the form of teaching and seminar rooms, lecture theatres, a Library and co-operative access to the laboratory and other facilities provided by Oxford University.
objects: 1. THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION, STUDY AND RESEARCH IN PARTICULAR THROUGH THE PROVISION, SUPPORT AND MAINTENANCE OF A COLLEGE IN OXFORD.  2. THE ADVANCEMENT OF RELIGION INCLUDING THE PROVISION AND SUPPORT OF A CHAPEL IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PRINCIPLES OF THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND.  [UNEM COLLEGIUM AD EXALTIONEM FIDEI ORTHODOXAE ET PROFECTUM SANAE DOCTRINE]

name: TRINITY EARLY LEARNERS
activities: We are a playgroup who offer sessional care to pre-school children.  We are registered with Ofsted.
objects: THE AIMS OF THE PRE-SCHOOL ARE TO ENHANCE THE DEVELOPMENT AND EDUCATION OF CHILDREN PRIMARILY UNDER STATUTORY SCHOOL AGE BE ENCOURAGING PARENTS TO UNDERSTAND AND PROVIDE FOR THE NEEDS OF THEIR CHILDREN THROUGH COMMUNITY GROUPS AND BY:  A) OFFERING APPROPRIATE PLAY, EDUCATION AND CARE FACILITIES AND FAMILY LEARNING GROUPS, TOGETHER WITH THE RIGHT OF PARENTS TO TAKE RESPONSIBILITY FOR AND TO BECOME INVOLVED IN THE ACTIVITIES OF SUCH GROUPS, ENSURING THAT SUCH GROUPS OFFER OPPORTUNITIES FOR ALL CHILDREN, WHATEVER THEIR RACE, CULTURE, RELIGION, MEANS OR ABILITY;  B) ENCOURAGE THE STUDY OF THE NEEDS OF SUCH CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES AND PROMOTING PUBLIC INTEREST IN AND RECOGNITION OF SUCH NEEDS IN THE LOCAL AREAS;  C) INSTIGATING AND ADHERING TOAND FURTHERING THE AIMS AND OBJECTS OF THE PRE-SCHOOL LEARNING ALLIANCE

name: LYVENNET COMMUNITY TRUST
activities: The Trust aims to achieve its objectives through the construction of affordable housing for rental purposes and to be sold via shared ownership schemes.   Construction of such properties is complete.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CHARITY SHALL BE TO CARRY ON A NOT FOR PROFIT BASIS FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE COMMUNITY PRIMARILY IN THE AREA OF THE LYVENNET VALET INCORPORATING THE PARISHES OF CROSBY RAVENSWORTH AND KINGÆS MEABURN (THE ôAREA OF BENEFITö)  4.1 THE PROVISION OF SOCIAL HOUSING AND ASSOCIATED AMENITIES FOR THOSE IN NEED BY REASON OF FINANCIAL HARDSHIP; AND  4.2 SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS MAY BE FROM TIME TO TIME DETERMINED SUBJECT TO THE PRIOR WRITTEN CONSENT OF THE CHARITY COMMISSION.

name: CONNECT CHURCH CHORLEYWOOD
activities: Public Sunday Church Meetings and Midweek Meetings Pastoral Support Helping with and sponsoring local activities in the Community Involvement with a local charity helping disadvantaged people in the local estates Financial support to needy causes globally and locally Sponsoring a church and pastor in India Social Activities
objects: TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATEMENT OF BELIEFS APPEARING IN THE SCHEDULE HERETO, TO HOLD PUBLIC SERVICES AND TO FULFIL SUCH OTHER PURPOSES WHICH ARE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE ACCORDING TO THE LAW OF ENGLAND AND WALES AND ARE CONNECTED WITH THE CHARITABLE WORK OF THE CHARITY

name: ST. JOHN OF JERUSALEM EYE HOSPITAL GROUP
activities: St John of Jerusalem Eye Hospital Group is the main provider of eye care in Jerusalem, the West Bank and Gaza. It is a renowned teaching hospital with medical and nursing training programmes. Research and development are also part of the hospitals' activities.
objects: (A) THE RELIEF OF SICKNESS AND THE PROTECTION AND PRESERVATION OF HEALTH BY PROVIDING EYE CARE FACILITIES AT THE ST. JOHN EYE HOSPITAL IN JERUSALEM AND AT SUCH HOSPITALS AND CLINICS ELSEWHERE AS THE DIRECTORS THINK FIT AND THE MEDICAL AND NURSING EDUCATION AND MEDICAL RESEARCH ACTIVITIES CONNECTED THEREWITH;  (B) THE SUPPORT OF HUMANITARIAN RELIEF ANYWHERE IN THE WORLD;  (C) THE CARRYING ON OF SUCH OTHER EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE ACTIVITIES AS THE DIRECTORS MAY THINK FIT.

name: THE BRAUNSTONE FOUNDATION
activities: NEIGHBOURHOOD BASED CHARITY, WITH BRANCHES RELATING TO EDUCATION, INTO WORK SUPPORT, TRAINING, BUSINESS SUPPORT, SPORT AND PHYSICAL ACTIVITY, COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT AND VOLUNTEERING.
objects: 3.1 THE PROMOTION FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC OF URBAN REGENERATION IN AREAS OF  SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC DEPRIVATION (AND IN PARTICULAR IN BRAUNSTONE) BY ALL OR ANY  OF THE FOLLOWING MEANS:-  A) THE RELIEF OF THOSE IN NEED, BY REASON OF YOUTH, AGE, ILL-HEALTH, DISABILITY,  FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR OTHER DISADVANTAGES;  B) THE RELIEF OF UNEMPLOYMENT;  C) THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION AND TRAINING;  D) THE CREATION OF EMPLOYMENT AND BUSINESS OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH THE  PROVISION OF ADVICE, WORKSPACE, BUILDINGS, AND/OR LAND FOR USE ON  FAVOURABLE TERMS;  E) THE PROVISION OF HOUSING FOR THOSE WHO ARE IN CONDITIONS OF NEED AND THE  IMPROVEMENT OF HOUSING IN THE PUBLIC SECTOR OR IN CHARITABLE OWNERSHIP  PROVIDED THAT SUCH POWER SHALL NOT EXTEND TO RELIEVING ANY LOCAL AUTHORITIES  OR OTHER BODIES OF A STATUTORY DUTY TO PROVIDE OR IMPROVE HOUSING;  F) THE PRESERVATION OF BUILDINGS OR SITES OF HISTORIC OR ARCHITECTURAL IMPORTANCE;  G) THE PROVISION OF RECREATIONAL FACILITIES FOR THE PUBLIC AT LARGE OR THOSE WHO BY  REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, AGE, INFIRMITY OR DISABLEMENT, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR  SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES, HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES;  H) THE PROTECTION OR CONSERVATION OF THE ENVIRONMENT;  I) THE PROVISION OF PUBLIC HEALTH FACILITIES AND CHILDCARE;  J) THE PROMOTION OF PUBLIC SAFETY AND PREVENTION OF CRIME;  K) THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE CAPACITY AND SKILLS OF THE MEMBERS OF THE  COMMUNITY IN SUCH A WAY THAT THEY ARE BETTER ABLE TO IDENTIFY, AND HELP  MEET, THEIR NEEDS AND TO PARTICIPATE MORE FULLY IN SOCIETY; AND  I) THE PROMOTION OF ANY OTHER RECOGNISED CHARITABLE PURPOSE, THROUGH SUCH  OTHER MEANS AS MAY FROM TIME TO TIME BE DETERMINED SUBJECT TO THE PRIOR  WRITTEN CONSENT OF THE CHARITY COMMISSIONERS FOR ENGLAND AND WALES.

name: UK NORTH BLIND SAILING ASSOCIATION
activities: Provision of sailing and training opportunities for blind, visually impaired and other disadvantaged  persons
objects: TO PROVIDE FACILITIES IN THE INTEREST OF SOCIAL WELFARE WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR THOSE BLIND AND VISUALLY IMPAIRED PEOPLE IN NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES THROUGH THE PROVISION OF RECREATIONAL FACILITIES AND EVENTS AND PARTICULARLY BY THE PROVISION OF OPPORTUNITIES AND FACILITIES TO ENABLE THOSE PEOPLE TO PARTICIPATE WITH OTHERS IN SAILING.

name: SWINDON MUSLIM INITIATIVE
activities: 1) THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE ISLAMIC FAITH IN SWINDON FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT.  2) THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO ISLAMIC EDUCATION.  3) TO EDUCATE AND INCREASE PUBLIC UNDERSTANDING ABOUT ISLAM AND THE MUSLIM WAY OF LIFE WITH A VIEW TO PROMOTING RELIGIOUS AND RACIAL HARMONY FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT.  4) TO HELP YOUNG PEOPLE, ESPECIALLY BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY THROUGH LEISURE TIME ACTIVITIES, SO AS TO DEVELOP THEIR CAPABILITIES THAT THEY MAY GROW TO FULL MATURITY AS INDIVIDUALS AND MEMBERS OF SOCIETY.  5) TO PROMOTE FOR THE INHABITANTS OF SWINDON AND THE SURROUNDING AREA THE PROMOTION OF FACILITIES FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION OF INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, AGE, INFIRMITY OR DISABLEMENT, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES OR FOR THE PUBLIC AT LARGE IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE AND WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITION OF LIFE OF THE SAID INHABITANTS.
objects: 1) THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE ISLAMIC FAITH IN SWINDON FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT.  2) THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO ISLAMIC EDUCATION.  3) TO EDUCATE AND INCREASE PUBLIC UNDERSTANDING ABOUT ISLAM AND THE MUSLIM WAY OF LIFE WITH A VIEW TO PROMOTING RELIGIOUS AND RACIAL HARMONY FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT.  4) TO HELP YOUNG PEOPLE, ESPECIALLY BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY THROUGH LEISURE TIME ACTIVITIES, SO AS TO DEVELOP THEIR CAPABILITIES THAT THEY MAY GROW TO FULL MATURITY AS INDIVIDUALS AND MEMBERS OF SOCIETY.  5) TO PROMOTE FOR THE INHABITANTS OF SWINDON AND THE SURROUNDING AREA THE PROMOTION OF FACILITIES FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION OF INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, AGE, INFIRMITY OR DISABLEMENT, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES OR FOR THE PUBLIC AT LARGE IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE AND WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITION OF LIFE OF THE SAID INHABITANTS.

name: ROTTWEILER RESCUE TRUST
activities: Caring, rescuing and rehoming of Rottweilers and providing vetinary care where necessary.  We offer free training and education to Rottweiler owners.
objects: (1) FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC TO RELIEVE THE SUFFERING OF ROTTWEILER DOGS  IN NEED OF CARE AND ATTENTION AND IN PARTICULAR BY RESCUE, CARE AND  TREATMENT, REHABILITATION AND RE-HOMING.  (2) TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN MATTERS RELATING TO THE  WELFARE OF ROTTWEILERS AND THE PREVENTION OF CRUELTY AND SUFFERING TO  THEM.

name: CARE IN MIND
activities: Helping clients with mental health problems identify barriers that prevent them from securing employment. Care in Mind draws up a support plan and this is worked through
objects: THE RELIEF OF UNEMPLOYMENT FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT IN SUCH WAY AS MAY BE FIT INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED, TO ASSISTANCE TO IDENTIFY AND OVERCOME BARRIERS TO EMPLOYMENT AND RAISE ASPIRATIONS AND EMPLOYABILITY OF LOCAL PEOPLE WITH MENTAL HEALTH PROBLEMS AND GENERATIONAL UNEMPLOYMENT ISSUES AND PROMOTE INDEPENDENCE.

name: SKIPTON CAMERATA LIMITED
activities: The company's principal activity is to act as a professional chamber orchestra, providing benefits to the public in general and education to young people.
objects: TO PROMOTE, MAINTAIN, IMPROVE AND ADVANCE EDUCATION PARTICULARLY BY THE  PRODUCTION OF CONCERTS, OPERAS, RECITALS, EDUCATIONAL PLAYS AND THE  ENCOURAGEMENT OF THE ARTS, INCLUDING THE ARTS OF DRAMA, MIME, DANCE,  SINGING AND MUSIC, AND TO FORMULATE, PREPARE AND ESTABLISH SCHEMES  THEREFORE, PROVIDED THAT ALL OBJECTS OF THE COMPANY SHALL BE OF A  CHARITABLE NATURE.

name: JOHN ERIC BYE TRUST
activities: Regular donations to Papworth Hospital to purchase specialist equipment for Heart/Cardiac purposes only.
objects: AS TO THE REMAINING SEVENTY PER CENT (" THE PAPWORTH SHARE") UPON TRUST TO INVEST IT AND TO PROVIDE THE SUM OF ú3000 PER YEAR, FOR THE PERIOD OF 80 YEARS ("THE TRUST PERIOD") OUT OF THE INCOME OR CAPITAL OF THE PAPWORTH SHARE TO PAPWORTH FOR THE PURCHASE OF USEFUL EQUIPMENT TO ASSIST THE SURGEONS IN THEIR WORK PROVIDED THAT THE HOSPITAL REMAINS A SPECIALIST HEART/CARDIAC HOSPITAL OPERATING ON ITS PRESENT SITE AT PAPWORTH ARID IF IT SHOULD PERMANENTLY LEAVE ITS PRESENT SITE AT PAPWORTH OR IF THE SITE IS SOLD OR IF THE SITE IS NOT USED FOR A PERIOD EXCEEDING FIVE YEARS AS  A SPECIALIST HEART/CARDIAC HOSPITAL THEN THE ACCUMULATED INCOME AND CAPITAL OF THE FUND SHALL PASS TO THE BHF ABSOLUTELY. IF THE SPECIALIST HEART/CARDIAC HOSPITAL SHALL TEMPORARILY CEASE TO OPERATE FROM ITS PRESENT SITE THEN THE ANNUAL PAYMENT SHALL BE PAID TO THE BHF FOR THIS TEMPORARY PERIOD. AT THE END OF THE TRUST PERIOD ANY REMAINING CAPITAL OR ACCUMULATED INCOME OF THE PAPWORTH SHARE SHALL PASS TO PAPWORTH FOR THE PURCHASE OF USEFUL EQUIPMENT TO ASSIST SURGEONS IN THEIR WORK PROVIDED THAT THE HOSPITAL IS AT THAT TIME A SPECIALIST HEARTCARDIAC HOSPITAL  OPERATING ON ITS PRESENT SITE AT PAPWORTH BUT IF NOT THEN ACCUMULATED INCOME AND CAPITAL OF THE PAPWORTH SHARE SHALL PASS TO THE BHF ABSOLUTELY. PROVIDED FURTHER THAT AT ANY TIME THE TRUST OF THE PAPWORTH SHARE CAN BE TERMINATED WITH THE AGREEMENT OF BOTH PAPWORTH AND BHF ON ANY TERMS AND IN ANY PROPORTIONS, AGREED BETWEEN THEM.

name: THE INSTITUTION OF POWER ENGINEERS
activities: To advance, for the public benefit, the knowledge of internal combustion engines, gas turbines and their related products and their design, development, application, manufacture, installation, commissioning, operation and maintenance and to promote the exchange of information and ideas that particularly relate to their use amongst the members of the Institution and others.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE INSTITUTION SHALL BE TO ADVANCE, FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT, THE  KNOWLEDGE OF COMPRESSION IGNITION AND SPARK IGNITION INTERNAL COMBUSTION  ENGINES, GAS TURBINES AND THEIR RELATED PRODUCTS AND THEIR DESIGN,  DEVELOPMENT, APPLICATION, MANUFACTURE, INSTALLATION, COMMISSIONING, OPERATION  AND MAINTENANCE AND TO PROMOTE THE EXCHANGE OF INFORMATION AND IDEAS THAT  PARTICULARLY RELATE TO THEIR USE AMONGST THE MEMBERS OF THE INSTITUTION AND  OTHERS.

name: GENDER AND DEVELOPMENT NETWORK
activities: GADN is a diverse, effective and inclusive membership network of leading UK-based non-governmental organisations? (NGO) consultants and academics working on gender, development and women?s rights issues. GADN enables members to share information and expertise, effectively lobby government and international bodies and provide expert advice and comment on policies and projects.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CHARITY ARE TO RELIEVE POVERTY AMONG WOMEN AND GIRLS AND TO  PROMOTE AND PROTECT THEIR HEALTH (WHETHER MENTAL, PHYSICAL, SEXUAL OR EMOTIONAL) BY  ANY MEANS THE TRUSTEES IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION CHOOSE.

name: THE DUNHILL MEDICAL TRUST
activities: The Dunhill Medical Trust makes charitable grants for the furtherance of medical knowledge and research and for care and accommodation of older people, with a particular emphasis on new and innovative projects.
objects: A) FOR THE FURTHERANCE OF MEDICAL KNOWLEDGE AND RESEARCH AND THE PUBLICATION OF THE USEFUL RESULTS THEREOF AND THE PROVISION OF MEDICAL CARE AND FACILITIES IN SUCH MANNER AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL FROM TIME TO TIME IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION THINK FIT. (B) FOR RESEARCH INTO THE CARE OF THE ELDERLY AND THE PUBLICATION OF THE USEFUL RESULTS THEREOF AND THE PROVISION OF ACCOMMODATION AND CARE FOR THE ELDERLY.

name: LONDON SIGN LANGUAGE EAST CONGREGATION OF JEHOVAH'S WITNESSES
activities: Arranging meetings for public worship, which includes Bible education and training in christian living.  Preaching the christian message to the public within the congregation area.  Distributing Bibles and other religious literature.  All of these services and facilities are provided without charge.
objects: The practice and advancement of Christianity founded on the Holy Bible, including the preaching of the good news of god's Kingdom by Jesus Christ within the Congregation Area and the holding of meetings for public Christian worship.

name: LONDON SIGN LANGUAGE EAST CONGREGATION OF JEHOVAH'S WITNESSES
activities: Arranging meetings for public worship, which includes Bible education and training in christian living.  Preaching the christian message to the public within the congregation area.  Distributing Bibles and other religious literature.  All of these services and facilities are provided without charge.
objects: The practice and advancement of Christianity founded on the Holy Bible, including the preaching of the good news of god's Kingdom by Jesus Christ within the Congregation Area and the holding of meetings for public Christian worship.

name: THE GREATER WORLD CHRISTIAN SPIRITUALIST ASSOCIATION
activities: Religious charity, combining churches, support of other charities, teaching, spiritual Healing, church services, including, funerals, christenings marriages, other charitable contributions to communities around the country, creating Ordained Ministers.
objects: THE OBJECTS ARE SUCH OBJECTS AND PURPOSES IN ANY PART OF THE WORLD AS ARE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE AND WHICH ADVANCE RELIGION; ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC OR RELIEVE POVERTY, AND IN PARTICULAR (BUT WITHOUT PREJUDICE TO THE GENERALITY THEREOF) TOSPREAD IN ALL DIRECTIONS THE TRUTH OF SURVIVAL AFTER DEATH; OF SPIRIT COMMUNION; OF HEALING BY THE POWER OF HOLY SPIRIT; TEACH AND DEMONSTRATE THE EXERCISE OF PSYCHIC GIFTS; DISSEMINATE THE TEACHINGS RECEIVED FROM HIGHLY EVOLVED SPIRIT MESSENGERS, AND ESTABLISH THE FOLLOWING BELIEFS AND OBJECTS:  (1)	BELIEF IN ONE GOD WHO IS LOVE.  (2)	ACCEPTANCE OF THE LEADERSHIP OF JESUS THE CHRIST.  (3)	BELIEF THAT GOD MANIFESTS THROUGH THE ILLIMITABLE POWER OF HOLY SPIRIT.  (4)	BELIEF IN THE SURVIVAL OF THE SOUL AND ITS INDIVIDUALITY AFTER PHYSICAL DEATH.  (5)	BELIEF IN COMMUNION WITH GOD, WITH HIS ANGELIC MINISTERS, AND WITH SOULS FUNCTIONING IN CONDITIONS OTHER THAN THE EARTH LIFE.  (6)	BELIEF THAT ALL FORMS OF LIFE CREATED BY GOD INTERMINGLE, ARE INTERDEPENDENT AND EVOLVE UNTIL PERFECTION IS ATTAINED.  (7)	BELIEF IN THE PERFECT JUSTICE OF THE DIVINE LAWS GOVERNING ALL LIFE.  (8)	BELIEF THAT SINS COMMITTED CAN ONLY BE RECTIFIED BY THE SINNER HIMSELF OR HERSELF, THROUGH THE REDEMPTIVE POWER OF JESUSTHE CHRIST BY REPENTANCE AND SERVICE TO OTHERS.  AND TO PLEDGE AT ALL TIMES TO ENDEAVOUR TO BE GUIDED IN THOUGHTS, WORDS AND DEEDS BY THE TEACHING AND EXAMPLE OF JESUS THE CHRIST.

name: ACTION ON ELDER ABUSE
activities: The charity is a specialist organisation focusing exclusively on issues relating to the abuse of older people. We combine influencing, with the provision of information, and with practical help for older people, care providers and government/other statutory bodies.  We provide a helpline and website; media work; training; conferences; membership; project work; and social policy activity.
objects: TO PROMOTE THE RELIEF OF ELDERLY PEOPLE AND PREVENT ELDER ABUSE THROUGH RAISING AWARENESS, EDUCATION, RESEARCH AND THE DISSEMINATION OF INFORMATION.

name: THE BORROWS CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: Grant making
objects: SUCH CHARITABLE PURPOSES FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME DECIDE

name: THE ROYAL AIR FORCE GLIDING AND SOARING ASSOCIATION
activities: The aim of the Association is to promote the efficiency of the RAF by providing an opportunity to indulge in the sport of Gliding and Soaring, thereby encouraging physical fitness and airmanship among all its members.  In achieving this aim special regard is to be paid to bringing gliding and soaring within reach of all members of the RAF with priority to those normally employed on the ground.
objects: THE OBJECTS FOR WHICH THE CHARITY IS ESTABLISHED (THE OBJECTS) ARE TO PROMOTE THE EFFICIENCY OF HER MAJESTY ARMED FORCES BY FOSTERING THE ESPRIT DE CORPS AND RAISING MORALE OF MEMBERS OF THE ROYAL AIR FORCE AND OTHER SERVICES, IN PARTICULAR (BUT NOT BY WAY OF LIMITATION), THROUGH PROMOTING, ENCOURAGING PARTICIPATION IN AND PROVIDING OR ASSISTING IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR GLIDING AND SOARING.

name: HOME-START BUTSER
activities: HOME-START BUTSER SUPPORTS FAMILIES UNDER STRESS WHERE THERE IS AT LEAST ONE CHILD UNDER FIVE YEARS OF AGE.  WE RECRUIT & TRAIN PARENT VOLUNTEERS WHO ARE MATCHED WITH A FAMILY & VISIT THEM IN THEIR OWN HOMES ONCE A WEEK TO OFFER PRACTICAL & EMOTIONAL SUPPORT.  HOME-START BUSTER OPERATES IN EAST HAMPSHIRE IN ENGLAND.
objects: 1.1 THE OBJECTS OF THE CHARITY ARE.  1) TO SAFEGUARD, PROTECT AND PRESERVE THE GOOD HEALTH, BOTH MENTAL AND PHYSICAL OF  CHILDREN AND PARENTS OF CHILDREN;  2) TO PREVENT CRUELTY TO OR MALTREATMENT OF CHILDREN;  3) TO RELIEVE SICKNESS, POVERTY AND NEEDAMONGST CHILDREN AND PARENTS OF CHILDREN;  4) TO PROMOTE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN BETTER STANDARDS OF CHILD CARE;  PRINCIPALLY BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY WITHIN THE AREA OF PETERSFIELD, HORNDEAN AND THEIR  ENVIRONS.

name: SUE RYDER PRAYER FELLOWSHIP (PARMOOR) LIMITED
activities: The charity provides a house and grounds, St Katharine's Parmoor, which is primarily a retreat centre and open to all faiths and denominations. The house and grounds are also used by local old people and youth groups, disadvantaged children, and young people. the grounds are used for training, educating and equipping homeless and disadvantaged young people in horticulture.
objects: 1) THE PROMOTION OF RELIGIOUS HARMONY FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC BY PROMOTING KNOWLEDGE AND MUTUAL UNDERSTANDING AND RESPECT OF THE BELIEFS AND PRACTICES OF DIFFERENT RELIGIOUS FAITHS: AND  2) THE PROMOTION AND PROTECTION OF GOOD HEALTH FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT

name: RUBYS FOUNDATION
activities: The organisation provides: Guidance, Counselling, Mentoring and Signposting Services,  Work Experience and Volunteering Opportunities,  Skills for Life Learning Opportunities for diverse communities of women
objects: 1) TO PROMOTE SOCIAL INCLUSION FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT BY PREVENTING PEOPLE BECOMING SOCIALLY EXCLUDED, RELIEVING THE NEED OF THOSE PEOPLE WHO ARE SOCIALLY EXCLUDED AND ASSISTING THEM TO INTEGRATE INTO SOCIETY;  FOR THE PURPOSE OF THIS CLAUSE SOCIALLY EXCLUDED MEANS BEING EXCLUDED FROM SOCIETY OR PARTS OF A SOCIETY AS A RESULT OF ONE OR MORE OF THE FOLLOWING FACTORS:  UNEMPLOYMENT, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP, YOUTH OR OLD AGE, ILL HEALTH (PHYSICAL OR MENTAL) DISCRIMINATION ON THE GROUNDS OF SEX, RACE, DISABILITY, ETHNIC ORIGIN, RELIGION, BELIEF, POOR EDUCATION OR SKILLS ATTAINMENT, POOR HOUSING

name: LIVERPOOL PRIDE
activities: To support and enable the LGBT community of Merseyside to combat homophobia and promote positive community engagement. This is done through the delivery of community projects and the Annual liverpool Pride festival
objects: THE CHARITY'S OBJECTS ARE TO PROMOTE EQUALITY AND DIVERSITY, ADVANCE EDUCATION AND ELIMINATE DISCRIMINATION IN RELATION TO LESBIAN, GAY, BISEXUAL AND TRANSGENDERED PEOPLE (LGBT) ACROSS LIVERPOOL AND MERSEYSIDE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC BY RAISING AWARENESS OF ISSUES AFFECTING SAID PERSONS AND IN PARTICULAR BY PROMOTING AND STAGING AN ANNUAL FESTIVAL

name: TYNESIDE AND NORTHUMBERLAND MIND
activities: We can provide wellbeing services in Gateshead, North and South Tyneside, Newcastle and Northumberland.  We also have a Primary Care Counselling service in Gateshead.
objects: WITHIN THE AREA OF TYNE & WEAR AND NORTHUMBERLAND  1. TO PROMOTE THE PRESERVATION OF MENTAL HEALTH AND TO ASSIST IN RELIEVING AND REHABILITATING PERSONS SUFFERING FROM MENTAL DISORDER OR CONDITIONS OF EMOTIONAL OR MENTAL DISTRESS REQUIRING ADVICE OR TREATMENT, AND  2. TO PROMOTE THE STUDY OF AND RESEARCH INTO MENTAL HEALTH DISORDER AND EMOTIONAL OR MENTAL DISTRESS AND TO OBTAIN AND MAKE RECORDS OF AND DISSEMINATE TO THE PUBLIC THE USEFUL RESULTS OF SUCH RESEARCH AND TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC IN MATTERS RELATING TO MENTAL HEALTH

name: THE SHAW LANE FOUNDATION
activities: Shaw Lane Community Sports Association (CSA) is a registered charity that supports the local community by providing and managing facilities and providing activities, the charity is based at and is responsible for the management of Shaw Lane Community Sports Centre.
objects: 1. TO PROVIDE IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES AND ACTIVITIES FOR RECREATION OR OTHER  LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION FOR THE GENERAL PUBLIC, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT  EXCLUSIVELY IN THE METROPOLITAN BOROUGH OF BARNSLEY AND ITS  NEIGHBOURHOOD FOR THOSE WHO HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES BY REASON OF  AGE, INFIRMITY, DISABILITY, POVERTY HEALTH OR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES  IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THEIR  CONDITIONS OF LIFE  2. THE PROMOTION OF COMMUNITY PARTICIPATION IN HEALTHY RECREATION IN  PARTICULAR BY THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR PLAYING SPORTS.  3. TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF YOUNG PEOPLE NOT UNDERGOING FORMAL  EDUCATION

objects: THE OBJECTS ARE TO RELIEVE FINANCIAL HARDSHIP, SICKNESS AND POOR HEALTH AMONGST ELDERLY PEOPLE RESIDENT IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT, INCLUDING THE FUNDING AND/OR PROVISION OF SPECIALLY DESIGNED OR ADAPTED HOUSING AND ITEMS, SERVICES OR FACILITIES CALCULATED TO RELIEVE THE NEEDS OF SUCH PERSONS.

objects: THE OBJECTS ARE THE PROMOTION OF COMMUNITY PAQRTICIPATION IN HEALTHY RECREATION AMONGST YOUNG PEOPLE IN SOMERSET AGED 10 TO 17 BY THE PROVISION OF GRANTS FOR THE PLAYING OF CRICKET AT COUNTY AND DISTRICT LEVEL.  THE TRUSTEES MUST USE THE INCOME AND MAY USE THE CAPITAL OF THE CHARITY IN PROMOTING THE OBJECTS.

name: FIRST UNIVERSAL ENTERPRISES LIMITED
activities: To relieve poverty hardship by providing education, training and advice and assistance to those in need of such services by reason of their social and economic circumstances.	FUEL  seeks to transform lives by helping those most in need to gain fulfilling and sustainable employment.

name: ELAYS NETWORK

ADDRESSING INEQUALITIES THROUGH COMMUNITY REPRESENTATION, DEVELOPMENT AND ADVOCACY. WHILE HELPING TO PROMOTE ACTIVE CITIZENS

name: ANDOVER TOWN BAND
activities: To provide an opportunity for anyone to learn to play a musical instrument, to supply free of charge instruments, music, tuition and practice areas and to enable people to play as part of a band. To provide musical entertainment by way of public and fee paying concerts for all who wish to attend and to support other local charities, churches and Homes with fund raising and other activities.
objects: 1.TO PROMOTE, IMPROVE, DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN PUBLIC EDUCATION IN AND APPRECIATION OF THE ART  AND SCIENCE OF MUSIC, PARTICULARLY BRASS BAND MUSIC IN ALL ITS ASPECTS.  2.TO FURTHER SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME DECIDE.

activities: Supporting Local Organisations, Charities and Individuals

name: THE STEVEN BLOCH IMAGE OF DISABILITY CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: For the benefit and/or relief of disabled people in England and Wales and/or promote the understanding of disability in England and Wales including through the arts, writing and journalism as the trustees may in their discretion think fit
objects: TO, OR FOR THE BENEFIT OF,SUCH EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE OBJECTS AND PURPOSES AS ARE FOR THE BENEFIT AND/OR RELIEF OF DISABLED PEOPLE IN ENGLAND AND WALES AND/OR PROMOTE THE UNDERSTANDING OF DISABILITY IN ENGLAND AND WALES INCLUDING THROUGH THE ARTS, WRITING AND JOURNALISM AS THE TRUSTEES MAY IN THEIR DISCRETION THINK FIT.

name: FOXFORD SCHOOL TRUST

objects: THE OBJECT OF THE COMPANY IS TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF ALL LEARNERS CONNECTED WITH THE FOUNDATION MEMBERS OR AT ANY OTHER SCHOOL IN RESPECT OF WHICH THE COMPNAY ACTS OR HAS ACTED AS A FOUNDATION.

name: HOUGHTON - LE - SPRING AND DISTRICT PIPING SOCIETY
activities: We are a group of people with a common interest of playing , performing and teaching the art of the 'Full Scottish Bagpipes, snare, bass and tenor drumming'.  We do this by holding classes for anyone interested in learning to play Bagpipe and Snare, Bass and Tenor drums.  We also perform and compete at Local, National and International Events
objects: 1) TO ADVANCE, IMPROVE, DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN PUBLIC EDUCATION IN, AND APPRECIATION OF,  THE ART AND SCIENCE OF SCOTTISH PIPE BAND MUSIC IN ALL ITS ASPECTS BY ANY MEANS THE TRUSTEES  SEE FIT, INCLUDING THROUGH THE PRESENTATION OF PUBLIC CONCERTS AND RECITALS,  2) TO FURTHER SUCH CHARITABLE PURPOSE OR PURPOSES AS THE TRUSTEES IN THEIR ABSOLUTE  DISCRETION SHALL THINK FIT BUT IN PARTICULAR THROUGH THE MAKING OF GRANTS AND DONATIONS

name: THE GOING BLUE FOUNDATION
activities: to raise awareness of world-wide aquatic pollution, encourage active measures to reduce it, and fund positive and reparative aquatic projects.
objects: A. TO PROMOTE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC THE CONSERVATION PROTECTION  AND IMPROVEMENT OF THE NATURAL ENVIRONMENT BY ENCOURAGING ACTIVE  MEASURES TO REDUCE WORLD WIDE WATER POLLUTION AND THE FUNDING AND  SUPPORT OF POSITIVE AND REPARATIVE AQUATIC PROJECTS.  TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC AND RAISE AWARENESS OF WORLDWIDE  POLLUTION, AND THE DAMAGE DONE TO HUMAN AND AQUATIC LIFE, BY ANY  MEANS THAT THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME DETERMINE, INCLUDING THE  UNDERTAKING AND SUPPORT OF RESEARCH AND THE DISSEMINATION OF THE  USEFUL RESULTS THEREOF.

name: CARMARTHENSHIRE CITIZENS ADVICE BUREAU
activities: Generalist and specialist advice
objects: THE CHARITY'S OBJECTS ARE TO PROMOTE ANY CHARITABLE PURPOSE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE COMMUNITY IN CARMARTHENSHIRE AND SURROUNDING AREAS ("THE AREA OF BENEFIT") BY THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION, THE PROTECTION AND PRESERVATION OF HEALTH AND THE RELIEF OF POVERTY, SICKNESS AND DISTRESS.

name: NORWICH CONTEMPLATIVE FORUM
activities: Offering workshops, group support and resources for Centering Prayer, a method of meditation rooted in the Christian tradition, and opportunities to explore the broader context of Christian wisdom teaching and associated practices. In addition, we plan to offer workshops for cultivating skills in dynamic self-governance and exploring how we can rediscover our place in the ecological lifeworld.
objects: I. THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE CHRISTIAN FAITH FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT IN PARTICULAR BY  PROMOTING THE CHRISTIAN CONTEMPLATIVE TRADITION AND ITS USE AS A PRACTICAL SPIRITUAL  RESOURCE.  2. THE PROMOTION FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC OF THE CONSERVATION, PROTECTION AND  IMPROVEMENT OF THE PHYSICAL AND NATURAL ENVIRONMENT.  3. THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN THE SKILLS AND TECHNIQUES OF  COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT AND COLLABORATIVE DECISION MAKING.

name: HOPE AND LIGHT (UK)
activities: Arranging and operating fund-raising events in the UK, presentations to various meetings (church groups, Rotary Clubs etc ), and recruiting sponsors for individual children in the care of Hope & Light in South Africa. All funds raised in the UK, including Gift Aid, are remitted directly to Hope and Light Community Welfare, a non-profit organization (Section 21 company ) registered in South Africa.
objects: TO RELIEVE POVERTY AND ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF CHILDREN AND  YOUNG PEOPLE IN SOUTH AFRICA BY SUPPORTING THE ACTIVITIES OF HOPE  AND LIGHT COMMUNITY WELFARE A CHARITY IN SOUTH AFRICA, WHICH ARE  EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE LAWS OF ENGLAND AND  WALES.

name: FRIENDS OF WIGAN YOUTH BRASS BAND
activities: To raise funds for Friends of Wigan Youth Brass Band to purchase items such as band uniforms and instrument accessories, and to assist with tuition and band activities. Friends of Wigan Youth Brass Band also fund raises to assist band members in the cost of attending a residential course and a foreign tour.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF YOUNG PEOPLE AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC IN THE ART OF BRAS BAND MUSIC, BY THE PROVISION OF THE NECESSARY FACILITIES AND TRAINING FOR THE YOUNG PEOPLE AND THE PUBLIC PERFORMANCE OF ARANGE OF WORKS.

name: WOTTON-UNDER-EDGE BAPTIST CHURCH
activities: The principal activity is the advancement of the Christian faith according to the principles of the Baptist denomination.  We enable worship and prayer, learning more about the Gospel and developing people's knowledge and trust in Jesus; provide pastoral care, run a debt advice centre and support work with children and adults in the community.
objects: THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE CHRISTIAN FAITH ACCORDING TO THE PRINCIPLES OF THE BAPTIST DENOMINATION. THE CHURCH MAY ALSO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND CARRY OUT OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES IN THE UNITED KINGDOM AND/OR OTHER PARTS OF THE WORLD.

name: FLOWERS BAND
activities: One of the UK's leading Brass Band's! Promoting the art of Brass Band's for the public and the young generations to come.
objects: THE CHARITY'S OBJECTS ('THE OBJECTS')ARE TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION AND APPRECIATION OF THE  PUBLIC IN THE ART AND SCIENCE OF BRASS BAND MUSIC IN ALL ITS ASPECTS BY THE PROVISION OF PUBLIC  CONCERTS AND TRAINING OF PERSONS IN THE STUDY AND PLAYING OF BRASS BAND INSTRUMENTS.

name: THE MARE AND FOAL SANCTUARY
activities: To rescue and provide care for and prevent cruelty and suffering among horses and ponies in need of attention by reason of sickness, maltreatment, ill-usage or other like causes and to provide temporary or permanent homes for such horses and ponies; and to advance the education of the public in matters relating to the welfare of horses and ponies and the prevention of cruelty and suffering
objects: 1. TO RESCUE AND PROVIDE CARE FOR AND PREVENT CRUELTY AND SUFFERING AMONG HORSES AND PONIES THAT ARE IN NEED OF ATTENTION BY REASON OF SICKNESS, MALTREATMENT, ILL USAGE OR OTHER LIKE CAUSES AND TO PROVIDE TEMPORARY OR PERMANENT HOMES FOR SUCH HORSES AND 0001PONIES. 2. TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN MATTERS RELATING TO THE WELFARE OF HORSES AND PONIES AND THE PREVENTION OF CRUELTY AND SUFFERING AMONG HORSES AND PONIES. 3. to relieve those children, young people and adults in need (in particular but not limited to those with physical, mental, social or emotional difficulties or disadvantages) by providing equine-assisted learning and therapeutic activities, in order to enhance their education and make their lives better through (but not limited to) appropriate provision of facilities for riding, handling or coming into contact with horses and ponies.

name: SOUTH MID-SUSSEX COMMUNITY FIRST RESPONDERS
activities: The relief of sickness and the preservation and protection of good health within South Mid-Sussex by the provision of trained volunteers to attend medical emergencies as directed by the South East Coast Ambulance Service or its successors.
objects: THE RELIEF OF SICKNESS AND THE PRESERVATION AND PROTECTION OF GOOD HEALTH IN SOUTH MID-SUSSEX BY THE PROVISION OF TRAINED VOLUNTEERS TO ATTEND MEDICAL EMERGENCIES AS DIRECTED BY THE SOUTH EAST COAST AMBULANCE SERVICE OR ITS SUCCESSORS.

name: LUVELY
activities: LuvEly, a charity based at the Lighthouse Centre. Our doors are open for people of all backgrounds, no matter their personal beliefs or situation in life. We aim to bring together the community, offering practical help and support and tackling isolation. Through social clubs for the elderly, youth clubs and other activities. Love food, tackles food waste and helps those in need,
objects: THE TRUSTEES SHALL APPLY THE INCOME OF THE CHARITY IN FURTHERING THE FOLLOWING OBJECTIVES:  A. TO PROMOTE THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC IN SUCH AREAS AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL THINK FIT BY: THE  ADVANCEMENT OF SOCIAL AND GENERAL, FORMAL AND INFORMAL EDUCATIONAND PROVIDE FOR THE RECREATION OF CHILDREN UP TO 19 YEARS OF AGE AND YOUNG PEOPLE WITH SPECIAL NEEDS UP TO THE AGE OF 25 IN THE DISTRICT OF EAST CAMBS, BY MAKING FACILITIES AND SERVICES AVAILABLE TO THEM OUT OF SCHOOL HOURS AND DURING SCHOOL HOLIDAYS; TO DEVELOP THEIR MENTAL, PHYSICAL AND SPIRITUAL NEEDS; TO HELP THEM IN THEIR FULFILMENT AS MEMBERS OF SOCIETY AND AS INDIVIDUALS TO IMPROVE THEIR SOCIAL AWARENESS AND ENJOYMENT OF LIFE.  B. TO PROVIDE FACILITIES AND SERVICES TO THE WIDER LOCAL COMMUNITY TO ADVANCE SOCIAL COHESION, WELFARE AND ENRICH LIFE PHYSICALLY, EMOTIONALLY AND SPIRITUALLY IN THE LOCALITY BY:  (I) THE RELIEF OF POVERTY, SICKNESS AND DISTRESS;  (II) THE PROMOTION OF GOOD HEALTH;  (III) THE PROVISION OF RECREATIONAL FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE.  C. ANY SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES ACCORDING TO THE LAWS OF ENGLAND AND WALES AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL THINK FIT.

name: THE LYCETT HUMANITARIAN TRUST
activities: Way to Happiness, Truth About Drugs and Youth for Human Rights
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CHARITY ("THE OBJECTS") ARE:  (1)	TO PROMOTE HUMAN RIGHTS (AS SET OUT IN THE UNIVERSAL DECLARATION OF HUMAN RIGHTS AND SUBSEQUENT UNITED NATIONS CONVENTIONS AND DECLARATIONS) THROUGHOUT THE WORLD BY ALL OR ANY OF THE FOLLOWING MEANS:  	(A)	RAISING AWARENESS OF HUMAN RIGHTS ISSUES;  	(B)	PROMOTING SUPPORT FOR HUMAN RIGHTS;  IN FURTHERANCE OF THAT OBJECT BUT NOT OTHERWISE, THE TRUSTEES SHALL HAVE POWER TO ENGAGE IN POLITICAL ACTIVITY PROVIDED THAT THE TRUSTEES ARE SATISFIED THAT THE PROPOSED ACTIVITIES WILL FURTHER THE PURPOSES OF THE CHARITY TO AN EXTENT JUSTIFIED BY THE RESOURCES COMMITTED AND THE ACTIVITY IS NOT THE DOMINANT MEANS BY WHICH THE CHARITY CARRIES OUT ITS OBJECTS;  (2)TO PROMOTE SOCIAL INCLUSION FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT BY PREVENTING PEOPLE FROM BECOMING SOCIALLY EXCLUDED, RELIEVING THE NEEDS OF THOSE PEOPLE WHO ARE SOCIALLY EXCLUDED AND ASSISTING THEM TO INTEGRATE INTO SOCIETY. FOR THE PURPOSE OF THIS CLAUSE, SOCIALLY EXCLUDED MEANS BEING EXCLUDED FROM SOCIETY, OR PARTS OF SOCIETY, AS A RESULT OF ONE OR MORE OF THE FOLLOWING FACTORS: UNEMPLOYMENT, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP, YOUTH OR OLD AGE; ILL HEALTH (PHYSICAL OR MENTAL); SUBSTANCE ABUSE OR DEPENDENCY INCLUDING ALCOHOL AND DRUGS; DISCRIMINATION ON THE GROUNDSOF SEX, RACE, DISABILITY, ETHNIC ORIGIN, RELIGION, BELIEF, CREED, SEXUAL ORIENTATION OR GENDER RE-ASSIGNMENT; POOR EDUCATIONAL OR SKILLS ATTAINMENT; RELATIONSHIP AND FAMILY BREAKDOWN; POOR HOUSING (THAT IS HOUSING THAT DOES NOT MEET BASIC HABITABLE STANDARDS); CRIME (EITHER AS A VICTIM OF CRIME OR AS AN OFFENDER REHABILITATING INTO SOCIETY);  (3)THE FURTHERANCE OF SUCH OTHER OBJECTS OR PURPOSES WHICH ARE CURRENTLY RECOGNISED AS CHARITABLE OR ARE IN THE SPIRIT OF ANY OBJECTS OR PURPOSES CURRENTLY RECOGNISED AS CHARITABLE ACCORDING TO THE LAW OF ENGLAND AND WALES IN ANY PART OF THE WORLD AND IN SUCH MANNER AS THE TRUSTEES MAY IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION THINK FIT.

name: EAQUALS

objects: 3.1 THE ASSOCIATION'S OBJECT (THE "OBJECTS") IS THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT IN PARTICULAR TO IMPROVE THE PROVISION AND QUALITY OF MODERN LANGUAGE EDUCATION AND CULTURAL UNDERSTANDING FOR STUDENTS OF LANGUAGES AND CULTURES BY:  3.1.1 PROVIDING ACCREDITATION OF EDUCATIONAL STANDARDS IN LANGUAGE TEACHING AND OTHER LEARNING SERVICES;  3.1.2 DEVELOPING AND PROMOTING QUALITY STANDARDS FOR THE TEACHING AND TESTING OF MODERN LANGUAGES, CULTURAL AWARENESS AND ASSOCIATED SKILLS;  3.1.3 PROVIDING TRAINING AND SUPPORT FOR TEACHERS AND OTHERS WORKING IN THE FIELD OF MODERN LANGUAGES WITH A VIEW TO FURTHERING THEIR PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT SO AS TO RAISE LANGUAGE TEACHING STANDARDS WORLDWIDE; AND  3.1.4 DEVELOPING AND PRODUCING MATERIALS AND TOOLS TO IMPROVE LANGUAGE TEACHING.

We also wish to develop the self-confidence of the Muslim community in their faith through our events and activities
objects: 1. THE PROMOTION OF RELIGIOUS HARMONY FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC BY:  (A) EDUCATING THE PUBLIC IN DIFFERENT RELIGIOUS BELIEFS INCLUDING AN AWARENESS OF THEIR DISTINCTIVE FEATURES AND THEIR COMMON GROUND TO PROMOTE GOOD RELATIONS BETWEEN PERSONS OF DIFFERENT FAITHS;  (B) PROMOTING KNOWLEDGE AND MUTUAL UNDERSTANDING AND RESPECT OF THE BELIEFS AND PRACTICES OF DIFFERENT RELIGIOUS FAITHS.  2. TO ADVANCE THE ISLAMIC FAITH FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT IN PARTICULAR WITHIN WESTMINSTER AND THE SURROUNDING AREA  3. TO PROMOTE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF WESTMINSTER AND THE SURROUNDING AREA THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION OF INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, AGE, INFIRMITY OR DISABLEMENT, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES OR FOR THE PUBLIC AT LARGE IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE AND WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITION OF LIFE OF THE SAID INHABITANTS.  4. TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND TRAINING FOR THE INHABITANTS OF WESTMINSTER AND SURROUNDING AREA

name: FAMILY LIFE INTERNATIONAL MINISTRIES UK
activities: WE OFFER A BROAD RANGE OF RELIGIOUS & SUPPORT SERVICES TO FAMILIES ( ALL TYPES); COUPLES; ELDERLY; WOMEN; YOUTH AND YOUNG PEOPLE; CHILDREN AND DIFFERENTLY-ABLED PERSONS. OUR SERVICES CAN BE ACCESSED VIA OUR SPECIFIC WING
objects: 3.1 "TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN RELIGION FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATEMENTS OF BELIEF APPEARING IN THE SCHEDULE AND CHRISTIAN DOCTRINES  3.2 "THE PREVENTION OR RELIEF OF POVERTY, MAINLY IN LONDON, AND OTHER PLACES - NATIONALLY OR OVERSEAS BY PROVIDING: GRANTS, ITEMS AND SERVICES TO INDIVIDUALS AND SUPPORTING OTHER CHARITIES OR ORGANISATIONS (LOCAL, NATIONAL AND OVERSEAS) WORKING TO PREVENT OR RELIEVE POVERTY."

name: TOGETHER FOR SHORT LIVES
activities: Providing information to families about the range of care support available Supporting organisations to continue to offer the highest standards of care Raising and distributing essential funding to care organisations Giving a powerful voice to children, families and providers, ensuring their views influence Government policy
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CHARITY ARE, AND ARE SPECIFICALLY RESTRICTED TO, PROMOTING, FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT, THE SUPPORT OF CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE WITH LIFE-LIMITING AND LIFE-THREATENING CONDITIONS AND THEIR FAMILIES, IN SUCH CHARITABLE WAYS AND BY SUCH CHARITABLE MEANS AS THE TRUSTEES THINK FIT, IN ORDER TO ENSURE THAT:    SUCH CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE AND THEIR FAMILIES HAVE AS FULFILLING LIVES AS POSSIBLE; AND    SUCH CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE RECEIVE THE BEST CARE AT THE END OF LIFE

name: THE TUTOR TRUST
activities: The Tutor Trust is a not-for-profit charity based in Manchester that provides tuition to school children in disadvantaged areas.
objects: THE CHARITY'S OBJECTS ("OBJECTS") ARE TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN THE UNITED KINGDOM.

name: THE KISS FOUNDATION UK
activities: The KISS Foundation was set up with a vision of educating and empowering the poor marginalized section of society who do not even get a square meal a day. It will support Kalinga Institute of Social Sciences (KISS), Bhubaneswar, India, which provides 20,000 poor indigenous children with food,education,health facilities,sports FREE OF COST from Class 1 to postgraduation & professional courses..
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE TRUST ARE THE PREVENTION AND RELIEF OF POVERTY AND THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION OF CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE IN INDIA IN SUCH WAYS AS THE TRUSTEES THINK FIT, INCLUDING IN PARTICULAR (BUT WITHOUT LIMITATION) BY:  1.2.1	PROVIDING GRANTS TO SUPPORT THE EDUCATION OF CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE IN INDIA, AND IN PARTICULAR TO SUPPORT EDUCATION AT THE KALINGA INSTITUTE OF SOCIAL SCIENCES ("KISS") AND OTHER EDUCATIONAL ORGANISATIONS IN INDIA;  1.2.2	PROVIDING GRANTS TO SUPPORT THE PROVISION OF HEALTHCARE, ACCOMMODATION AND TRAINING TO CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE IN NEED AT KISS AND OTHER ORGANISATIONS IN INDIA; AND  1.2.3	RAISING AWARENESS OF THE WORK CARRIED OUT BY KISS AND OTHER EDUCATIONAL AND WELFARE ORGANISATIONS IN INDIA.

name: THE WELL HEAD CENTRE
activities: The Centre is a safe and supportive environment for adults aged 18 or over who are suffering an emotional crisis and may benefit from having some time away from their current situation. Accommodation is provided on a short-term basis of up to 5 nights free of charge. Guests must be assessed and referred by either a medical practitioner, a community support worker or the pastor of their church.
objects: TO PROMOTE AND PROTECT GOOD MENTAL HEALTH BY:  A) PROVIDING A SHORT-TERM RESIDENTIAL RETREAT FOR ADULTS OVER 18 YEARS OF AGE FACING AN EMOTIONAL CRISIS IN THEIR LIVES.  B) WORKING IN PARTNERSHIP WITH HEALTH PROFESSIONALS AND OTHER COMMUNITY PARTNERS TO IDENTIFY THOSE WHO WOULD BENEFIT FROM THE SERVICE.  C) PROVIDING THE SERVICE FREE OF CHARGE.

name: THAMANI YOUTH OF AFRICA
activities: Thamani is currently raising funds to help sponsor educational programmes for low income communities living in rural villages in Nigeria, with particular emphasis on women/widows,children and youths. The charity also raises funds from organisations and individuals in order to fund youth-led organisations running orphanages, schools and educational programmes in Kenya.
objects: TO ADVANCE IN LIFE AND RELIEVE THE NEEDS OF YOUNG PEOPLE THROUGH:  1. THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION  A) TO PROMOTE, PROVIDE, AND ADVANCE EDUCATION IN KENYA BY PROVIDING FUNDS FOR THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES, TEACHERS, TRANSPORT, PAYMENT OF SERVICES ANDSCHOOL SUPPLIES.  B) PROMOTE THE BENEFIT OF EDUCATION TO YOUNG PEOPLE  C) HELP LOCAL COMMUNITIES/ORGANISATIONS THAT ADVANCE EDUCATION FOR YOUNG PEOPLE.  D) HELP CREATE SUSTAINABLE INSTITUTIONS THROUGH PROPER PLANNING AND MANAGEMENT AND PROVIDE MANAGED FUNDING THAT SUSTAINS THESE ORGANISATIONS.  2. THE PREVENTION/RELIEF OF POVERTY AND FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OF YOUNG PEOPLE  A) PROVIDING FUNDS FOR ORPHANAGES THAT PROVIDE HOMES FOR YOUNG PEOPLE AFFECTED BY AIDS AND POVERTY.  B) PROVIDING AID FOR LOCAL ORGANISATIONS THAT RELIEVE POVERTY/FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OF YOUNG PEOPLE.  C) HELP CREATE SUSTAINABLE INSTITUTIONS THROUGH PROPER PLANNING AND MANAGEMENT.

name: PENISTONE LADIES' CHOIR
activities: Penistone Ladies' Choir aims to develop an awareness and appreciation of music, particularly choral music, by means of public concerts and recitals.  The Choir helps to foster community spirit and fellowship in music through joint performance with other individuals and musical groups and to encourage younger musicians to perform as part of our concerts in order to give them valuable experience.
objects: TO ADVANCE, IMPROVE, DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN PUBLIC DEUCATION IN, AND APPRECIATION OF THE ART AND SCIENCE OF MUSIC IN ALL ITS ASPECTS BY ANY MEANS THE MANAGEMENT COMMITTEE SEE FIT, INCLUDING PRESENTATION OF PUBLIC CONCERTS AND RECITALS.

name: THE VIRDEE FOUNDATION
activities: To relieve the needs of women and children who have or who are in danger of suffering mental, physical or sexual abuse. The charity has made various grants during the year.
objects: - THE PURPOSE OF THE CHARITY IS THE PROTECTION OF WOMAN AND CHILDREN FROM ABUSE AND THE RELIEF OF ABUSED WOMEN AND CHILDREN.    - FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT TO PROMOTE THE EDUCATION (INCLUDING SOCIAL AND PHYSICAL TRAINING) OF PEOPLE IN SUCH WAYS AS THE CHARITY TRUSTEES THINK FIT, INCLUDING BY AWARDING SUCH PERSONS SCHOLARSHIPS, MAINTENANCE ALLOWANCE OR GRANTS TENABLE AT UNIVERSITY, COLLEGE OR INSTITUTION OF HIGHER OR FURTHER EDUCATION    - TO ASSIST IN SUCH WAYS AS THE CHARITY TRUSTEES THINK FIT ANYCHARITY IN PLACE WHOSE AIM INCLUDE ADVANCING EDUCATION OF UNDER PRIVILEGED, WOMEN, CHILDREN BY DEVELOPING THEIR MENTAL, PHYSICAL AND MORAL CAPABILITIES THROUGH EITHER FULL TIME EDUCATION OR LEISURE ACTIVITIES INCLUDING THE PROVISION IN THE INTEREST OF SOCIAL WELFARE OF FACILITIES FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE-TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS IN LIFE FOR THE PERSONS FOR WHOM THE FACILITIES ARE PRIMARILY INTENDED.

name: MARCHAM COMMUNITY GROUP
activities: Understanding and representing community views on leisure facilities: As a membership organisation with elected directors, MCG represents its members' views. On important issues, and to report back to members and seek their views, MCG holds open meetings to which non-members are welcome.    MCG has arranged a number of community events and fund-raising activities.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CHARITY ARE THE PROVISION FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF MARCHAM AND THE SURROUNDING AREA OF FACILITIES (INCLUDING A COMMUNITY BUILDING AND PLAYING FIELDS) FOR MEETINGS, LECTURES AND CLASSES, AND FOR OTHER FORMS OF RECREATIONOR OTHER LEISURE-TIME OCCUPATION OF INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, AGE, INFIRMITY OR DISABILITY, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES OR FOR THE PUBLIC AT LARGE IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE AND WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITION OF LIFE OF THE SAID INHABITANTS.

name: MAIDSTONE FAMILY CHURCH
activities: We are a Christian community where people of all ages and backgrounds belong.  There are a variety of opportunities to meet for corporate worship, teaching, discussion and bible study.  We support different charities across the world that relieve hardship and suffering; meet development and educational needs and share the Christian faith.
objects: (1) TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTAIN FAITH IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATEMENT OF BELIEFS ON PAGE 18 IN SUCH PARTS PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES FROM TIME TO TIME MAY THINK FIT.  (2) TO RELIEVE SICKNESS AND FINANCIAL HARDSHIP AND TO PROMOTE AND PRESERVE GOOD HEALTH BY THE PROVISION OF COUNSELLING AND SUPPORT IN SUCH A PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES FROM TIME TO TIME MAY THINK FIT.  (3) TO ADVANCE EDUCATION IN SUCH WAYS AND IN SUCH PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES FROM TIME TO TIME MAY THINK FIT.  THE TRUSTEES MUST USE THE INCOME AND MAY USE THE CAPITAL OF THE CHURCH IN PROMOTING THE OBJECTS.

name: ADVANCING KINGS
activities: To Advance the Education of the pupils at Thorne King Edward Primary School and among people living in Thorne by providing and assisting in the provision of facilities for education at the school. To enhance the development and education of children aged 3-11 years by offering appropiate play, education and care facilities in a safe and secure environment.
objects: 1) TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUPILS AT THORNE KING EDWARD PRIMARY SCHOOL AND AMONG PEOPLE LIVING IN THORNE BY PROVIDING AND ASSISTING IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR EDUCATION AT THE SCHOOL.    2) TO ENHANCE THE DEVELOPMENT AND EDUCATION OF CHILDREN AGED 3-11 BY OFFERING APPROPRIATE PLAY, EDUCATION AND CARE FACILITIES IN A SAFE AND SECURE ENVIRONMENT.

name: THE ANDREW SIMPSON SPORT ENABLING TRUST
activities: Work and research is still continuing in the development of the 'A-Spring'. We are currently researching alternative cost-effective materials before we start pilot tests with groups identified within hospitals and disability sport.  The Andrew Simpson Sport Enabling Award is made each year to an outstanding student at Loughborough University.
objects: TO RELIEVE PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES,WHETHER ACQUIRED OR OTHERWISE,THROUGH THE PROVISION OF DIRECT OR INDIRECT FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE, AND TO SUPPORT RESEARCH INTO AND PRODUCTION OF PRODUCTS AND SERVICES IN THE FIELD OF SPORTS TECHNOLOGY AND MOBILITY THAT WILL PROMOTE THEIR REHABILITATION AND ENABLE THEM TO ENGAGE IN SPORT OR OTHERWISE IMPROVE THEIR DAILY LIVES AND TO DISSEMINATE THE USEFUL RESULTS THEREOF.

name: THE WHITLEY WILDLIFE CONSERVATION TRUST
activities: THE TRUST' IS CURRENTLY DORMANT PENDING A TRANSFER OF ASSETS FROM WHITLEY WILDLIFE CONSERVATION TRUST. IN TIME ITS PRINCIPAL ACTIVITY WILL BE THE ADVANCEMENT OF SCIENTIFIC KNOWLEDGE, EDUCATION AND SCIENCE IN ACCORDANCE WITH ITS CHARITABLE OBJECTIVES
objects: (1) THE ADVANCEMENT OF PUBLIC EDUCATION; (2) THE PROMOTION OF SCIENTIFIC AND EDUCATIONAL STUDY AND RESEARCH AND THE PUBLICATION OF THE USEFUL RESULTS OF ALL SUCH STUDY AND RESEARCH. (3) THE CONSERVATION AND PRESERVATION FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT OF ANIMA0001LS AND PLANTS AND THEIR ENVIRONMENTS; AND (4) THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR RECREATION AND OTHER LEISURE-TIME OCCUPATION OF THE PUBLIC GENERALLY AND THE INHABITANTS OF PAIGNTON IN PARTICULAR IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE AND WITH A VIEW TOIMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR THE PERSONS FOR WHOM THE FACILITIES ARE PROVIDED.

name: STEVENAGE LEISURE
activities: The provision of affordable facilities and activities for everyone in the interest of social welfare, provided to the public at large, to preserve good health, well being and stimulation through community participation in sports, recreation, fitness, health, education, performing arts, galleries, museums, theatres, libraries, community halls, parks and leisure centres
objects: THE COMPANY HAS BEEN ESTABLISHED FOR PUBLIC BENEFIT FOR:  - THE PROVISION OR ASSISTANCE IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES AND SERVICES FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE-TIME OCCUPATION IN THE INTEREST OF SOCIAL WELFARE, SUCH FACILITIES BEING PROVIDED TO THE PUBLIC AT LARGE SAVE THAT SPECIAL FACILITIES MAY BE PROVIDED TO PERSONS WHO BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, AGE, INFIRMITY OR DISABILITY, POVERTY OR SOCIAL OR ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES MAY HAVE NEED OF SPECIAL FACILITIES OR SERVICES; AND/OR  - PRESERVATION OF GOOD HEALTH THROUGH COMMUNITY PARTICIPATION IN HEALTHY RECREATION; AND/OR  - THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE PERFORMING ARTS; AND/OR  - THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION BY THE PROVISION OR ASSISTANCE WITH THE PROVISION OF, MAINTENANCE AND MANAGEMENT THEREOF OF AN ART GALLERY AND/ OR A MUSEUM; AND/OR  - THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION BY THE PROVISION OF OR ASSISTANCE WITH THE PROVISION OF A LIBRARY AND/ OR LIBRARY FACILITIES; AND/OR  - THE PROVISION AND MAINTENANCE OF VILLAGE OR COMMUNITY HALLS FOR USE BY THEINHABITANTS OF THE AREA FOR BENEFIT FOR ALL WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF SEX, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, RACE OR OF POLITICAL, RELIGIOUS OR OPINIONS INCLUDING USE FOR MEETINGS, LECTURES AND CLASSES AND OTHER FORMS OF RECREATION AND LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION WITH THEOBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR THE INHABITANTS; AND/OR  - SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES BENEFICIAL TO THE PUBLIC AND CONSISTENT WITH THE OBJECTS ABOVE, AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION DETERMINE.

name: COMMUNITY EDUCATION ACADEMY OF LEADERSHIP
activities: Leadership opportunities  School support  Partnerships  Mentoring IAG?s Bid writing Family learning  Enterprise Start up support Business workshops Young enterprise training Home school links Preparation for work based experience Parents? employability skills training Healthy life styles Seminars
objects: TO ADVANCE EDUCATION FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT BY PROMOTING INNOVATIVE SERVICES TO YOUNG PEOPLE AND ADULTS IN WEST MIDLANDS AND ITS SURROUNDING AREAS.

name: WIDECOMBE HISTORY GROUP
activities: We hold regular monthly meetings throughout the year, with a guest speaker and also arrange outings for members. We have a series of local history projects on the go at any one time, currently these include: North Hall and Digitising and Cataloguing the History Group and Parish Archive. We have an aim to open a Heritage and Education centre in the village.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN ALL MATTERS HISTORICAL OR ALLIED NATURE, AND IN PARTICULAR THOSE ARISING IN WIDECOMBE PARISH AND THE SURROUNDING AREA AND IN DOING SO TO  PRESERVE AND ARCHIVE MATERIAL OF HISTORICAL INTEREST, IN PARTICULAR BUTNOT EXCLUSIVELY BY:    A)  CREATING AND MAINTAINING A HERITAGE CENTRE FOR THE PURPOSE OF PRESENTING ITEMS FOR LOCAL EXHIBITION  B) PROMOTING, RESEARCHING AND RECORDING LOCAL HISTORY;  C) ACTING AS CUSTODIANS OF HISTORICAL MATERIAL PERTAINING TO WIDECOMBE PARISH LOCAL HISTORY BY COLLECTING TOGETHER, CONSERVING AND ARCHIVING ALL SUCH MATERIAL AND ANY OTHER APPROPRIATE HISTORICAL MATERIAL, FROM WHEREVER IT MAY ORIGINATE;  D) PROVIDING ACCESS TO ARCHIVES TO THE PUBLIC FOR RESEARCH AND EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES THROUGH VARIOUS MEANS, INCLUDING, INTER ALIA, A HERITAGE CENTRE;  E) UNDERTAKING OR PROVIDING HISTORICAL RESEARCH PROJECTS, EXHIBITIONS, BOOKS, THE INTERNET, ARTEFACT RESTORATION, WALKS, OUTINGS, AND A REGULAR PROGRAMME OF SPEAKERS AND DISCUSSION EVENINGS;  F) RECORDING THE LIVING HISTORY OF THE WHG THROUGH PHOTOGRAPHS, WRITING, AUDIO AND OTHER MEDIA;  G) UNDERTAKING SUCH OTHER ACTIVITIES AS MAY BE DEEMED NECESSARY

name: CITY AND GUILDS OF LONDON ART SCHOOL LIMITED
activities: The Art School is a specialist higher education institution teaching at Foundation, undergraduate and postgraduate level, preparing students for careers as contemporary artists, conservators, carvers in wood and stone and related professions. This is underpinned by an emphasis on material understanding, traditional skills, experimentation and research, combined with art historical studies.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CHARITY ARE, FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT:    1. TO ADVANCE EDUCATION, KNOWLEDGE AND LEARNING BY TEACHING FINE ART, CONTEMPORARY AND TRADITIONAL CRAFTS, CONSERVATION AND ART INCLUDING ANY SUCH SKILLS, PRACTICES AND STUDIES AS MAY BE CONCERNED WITH ANY OF THE FOREGOING;    2. TO PRESERVE AND TO PROMOTE THE SKILLS, CRAFTS, TECHNIQUES, PROCESSES AND OTHER KNOWLEDGE ASSOCIATED WITH THE FOREGOING OBJECT;

name: THE MEGAN GWYNNE-JONES CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: The charity provides grants to advance the education of the public, especially those living in North Wales and the North West of England, through the promotion of the arts. The charity focuses in particular on facilitating the purchase of works of art for public display and promoting the renovation, conservation and maintenance of works of art for the public benefit.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC OF THOSE ESPECIALLY, BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY, LIVING IN THE NORTH WEST OF ENGLAND AND NORTH WALES THROUGH THE PROMOTION OF THE ARTS, IN SUCH WAYS AS THE CHARITY TRUSTEES THINK FIT, INCLUDING BY: (A)	FACILITATING THE PURCHASE OF WORKS OF ART FOR PUBLIC DISPLAY (B)	PROMOTING THE RENOVATION, CONSERVATION AND MAINTENANCE OF WORKS OF ART FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT.

name: THE OPEN SPACES SOCIETY
activities: The Open Spaces Society (formally The Commons, Open Spaces and Footpaths Preservation Society) works to create, conserve and enhance common land, village greens, open spaces and rights of public access, in town and country, in England and Wales.
objects: 1) TO PROTECT COMMON LAND, OPEN SPACES AND TOWN AND VILLAGE GREENS FROM ENCROACHMENT AND, SUBJECT TO THE RIGHTS OF COMMONERS, TO SECURE THEIR USE BY THE GENERAL PUBLIC.  2) TO PROTECT PRESERVE AND ENHANCE EXISTING PUBLIC PATHS AND CARRIAGEWAYS USED MAINLY AS PUBLIC PATHS AND TO SECURE THEIR PROPER RECORDING, MAINTENANCE AND SIGNPOSTING FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC.  3) TO SECURE THE CREATION AND PRESERVATION OF NEW PUBLIC PATHS, OPEN SPACES AND ACCESS TO AND OVER OPEN COUNTRY FOR THE BENEFIT OFTHE PUBLIC.  4) TO PROTECT THE BEAUTY OF THE COUNTRYSIDE AND TO PROMOTE ITS FULLEST ENJOYMENT BY THE PUBLIC.

name: SPARK EDUCARE TUTORING CENTRE
activities: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE LIVING IN THE UK, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY, PUPILS WHO REQUIRE ADDITIONAL OR SPECIALIST TUITION TO REALISE THEIR POTENTIAL AND TO COMPLETE THEIR STUDIES.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE LIVING IN THE UK, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY, PUPILS WHO REQUIRE ADDITIONAL OR SPECIALIST TUITION TO REALISE THEIR POTENTIAL AND TO COMPLETE THEIR STUDIES.  TO FACILITATE A SPECIALIST TEACHING SERVICE AND ENVIRONMENT TO SUPPORT CHILDREN WHO HAVE BEEN EXCLUDED FROM SCHOOL OR COLLEGE OR WHO HAVE SPECIAL NEEDS OR WHO ARE NOT IN EDUCATION, EMPLOYMENT OR TRAINING.  TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE TEACHING PROFESSION ON EFFECTIVE METHODS FOR TEACHING PUPILS WHO HAVE SPECIAL NEEDS.  TO PROVIDE A RANGE OF ADDITIONAL ACTIVITIES FOR CHILDREN OUTSIDE SCHOOL HOURS TO SUPPORT THE DEVELOPMENT OF THEIR INTERESTS AND SKILLS OUTSIDE THE CORE ACADEMIC SUBJECTS.  TO RELIEVE UNEMPLOYMENT BY PREPARING PEOPLE FOR THE WORLD OF WORK THROUGH THE PROVISION OF NUMERACY AND LITERACY TRAINING, CITIZEN SKILLS TRAINING AND ADVICE ON THE START UP OF BUSINESS ENTERPRISE.

name: KENSINGTON DRAGONS FOOTBALL CLUB LIMITED
activities: Promoting community participation for primarily young people in football training sessions and entering teams in competitve football leagues.
objects: THE CHARITY'S OBJECTS ARE TO PROMOTE ALL PURPOSES RECOGNISED AS CHARITABLE UNDER THE LAWS OF ENGLAND AND WALES AND IN PARTICULAR (WITHOUT LIMITATION):  1. TO PROMOTE COMMUNITY PARTICIPATION OF, PRIMARILY, CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE REGARDLESS OF RACE,SEX, CREED, FINANCIAL MEANS OR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES IN HEALTHY RECREATION IN PARTICULAR BY THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR THE PLAYING OF ASSOCIATION FOOTBALL ("FOOTBALL") AND OTHER SPORTS CAPABLE OF IMPROVING HEALTH ("FACILITIES" MEANSANY OF LAND, BUILDINGS, EQUIPMENT AND ORGANISING SPORTING ACTITIES); AND  2. TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE SO THAT THEY MIGHT GROW TO MATURITY AS INDIVIDUALS, BECOME RESPONSIBLE MEMBERS OF SOCIETY AND THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE MAY BE IMPROVED.

name: SAHAL COMMUNITY ORGANISATION
activities: For the public benefit, the relief of people in need, by reason of youth, age, ill-health, disability, financial hardship or other disadvantage in the United Kingdom and in Somalia by: The prevention or relief of poverty The advancement of education; and The promotion and preservation of good health
objects: FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT, THE RELIEF OF PEOPLE IN NEED, BY REASON OF YOUTH, AGE, ILL-HEALTH, DISABILITY, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR OTHER DISADVANTAGE IN THE UNITED KINGDOM AND SOMALIA, BY:  A) THE PREVENTION OR RELIEF OF POVERTY;  B) THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION; AND  C) THE PROMOTION AND PRESERVATION OF GOOD HEALTH.

name: CUTHBERT CARTER FOUNDATION
activities: We provide a Saturday school for 6-16 year olds of all backgrounds from 2-4pm at the Friary Community Centre and at the Oaktree Community Centre in west London and we also provide Marimba, African dance and drumming classes.   Please see our website for more information!
objects: THE CUTHBERT CARTER FOUNDATION'S OBJECTS ARE:  TO PROVIDE A RESOURCE WHICH AIMS TO DEVELOP CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE UP TO THE AGE OF 20  AND LIVING IN GREATER LONDON, INTO CONFIDENT, WELL-ROUNDED AND SUCCESSFUL MEMBERS OF ANY  SOCIETY BY:  (A) ADVANCING CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE'S EDUCATION BY PROVIDING SUPPLEMENTARY CLASSES AND  SUPPORTING THEIR PREPARATION FOR STATUTORY ASSESSMENTS (SATS, GCSES AND AS) AND GENERAL  PROGRESSION IN THEIR STUDIES.  (B) SUPPORTING AND EMPOWERING CHILDREN AND YOUNGPEOPLE, ESPECIALLY BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY  THROUGH LEISURE ACTIVITIES (MUSIC AND DANCE) SO AS TO EXPLORE, APPRECIATE AND DEVELOP THEIR  CULTURAL, LINGUISTIC, ARTISTIC AND SOCIAL AWARENESS THEREBY ENABLING THEM TO REALISE THEIR FULL  POTENTIAL AS MEMBERSOF SOCIETY.  (C) EMPOWERING PARENTS / CARERS TO SUPPORT THEIR CHILDRENâS EDUCATIONAL, CULTURAL, AND SOCIAL  DEVELOPMENT.

name: WEST OLDHAM TRUST
activities: Rental of sports hall and pitches.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE TRUST ARE TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUPILS AT THE SCHOOLS, TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF OTHER MEMBERS OF THE COMMUNITY, AND OTHERWISE TO FURTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE COMMUNITY, IT BEING ACKNOWLEDGED THAT IN CARRYING OUT THE OBJECTS THE TRUST:  1.1 MUST (WHERE APPLICABLE) HAVE REGARD TO ITS OBLIGATION TO PROMOTE COMMUNITY COHESION UNDER THE EDUCATION ACTS;  1.2 SHALL PROMOTE EDUCATION IN A MANNER CONSISTENT WITH THE VALUES AND PRINCIPLES ESTABLISHED BYTHE INTERNATIONAL COOPERATIVE ALLIANCE;  1.3 SHALL CONDUCT ITS AFFAIRS IN A MANNER CONSISTENT WITH THE VALUES AND PRINCIPLES ESTABLISHED BY THE INTERNATIONAL COOPERATIVE ALLIANCE.

name: APPLECARTLIVE LTD
activities: (A) To advance the education, public understanding and appreciation of the dramatic arts by providing and presenting for the public benefit high quality performances of storytelling, theatre, film, music, poetry and other performances which are of educational, cultural and spiritual value to the community.
objects: (A) TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION, PUBLIC UNDERSTANDING AND APPRECIATION OF THE DRAMATIC ARTS BY PROVIDING AND PRESENTING FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT HIGH QUALITY PERFORMANCES OF STORYTELLING, THEATRE, FILM, MUSIC, POETRY AND OTHER PERFORMANCES WHICH ARE OF EDUCATIONAL, CULTURAL AND SPIRITUAL VALUE TO THE COMMUNITY. (B) TO TEACH, TRAIN AND ENCOURAGE YOUNG ARTISTS AND OTHER MEMBERS OF THE PUBLIC IN THE ARTS OF STORYTELLING AND DRAMATIC PRESENTATION.

name: THE LUOL DENG FOUNDATION UK
activities: The charity's activity is the development of young people in the United Kingdom through education and sport, as well as provision of facilities for the playing of basketball.
objects: 1.TO ENCOURAGE AND SUPPORT THE DEVELOPMENT OF YOUNG PEOPLE IN THE UNITED KINGDOM THROUGH EDUCATION AND SPORT, IN PARTICULAR BASKETBALL.  2.THE PROMOTION OF COMMUNITY PARTICIPATION IN HEALTHY RECREATION IN PARTICULAR BY THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR THE PLAYING OF BASKETBALL.  3.TO PROVIDE OR ASSIST IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR THE PLAYING OF BASKETBALL IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE OF INDIVIDUALS IN THE UNITED KINGDOM WHO HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, INFIRMITY, DISABILITY OR FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR SOCIAL CIRCUMSTANCES WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE.

name: SHRI SITHI VINAYAGAR THEVASTHANAM
activities: providing a place of worship for the community, holding religious festivities and providing religious and cultural education to youths in the community.
objects: 5.1.	TO PROMOTE THE ADVANCEMENT OF HINDU RELIGION BY:- 5.1.1.	THE ESTABLISHMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF A TEMPLE IN HARROW, MIDDLESEX AND /OR AT SUCH OTHER PLACES THE TRUSTEES MAY DECIDE FOR THE PURPOSE OF PUBLIC RELIGIOUS WORSHIP OF SITHI VINAYAGAR AND OTHER HINDU DEITIES AND FOR OTHER RELIGIOUS CHARITABLE PURPOSES; 5.1.2.	PROVIDING RELIGIOUS DISCOURSES AND THE CELEBRATION OF HINDU RITES, CEREMONIES AND FESTIVALS. 5.2.	PROMOTING AND CARRYING OUT CHARITABLE WORK IN THE UNITED KINGDOM AND ABROAD 5.3.	TOPROMOTE THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION IN: 5.3.1.	THE HINDU RELIGION AND COMPARATIVE RELIGIOUS PHILOSOPHY 5.3.2.	THE HINDU TRADITIONS, HISTORY, LANGUAGE, LITERATURE, CULTURE AND MUSIC 5.4.	TO PROVIDE AND ASSIST IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES TO ENCOURAGE YOUTH ACTIVITIES BY THE ORGANISATION OF YOUTH CAMPS, SPORTS EVENTS, YOUTH SEMINARS AND ASSOCIATED TRAINING AND COMMUNITY ACTIVITIES WITH A VIEW TO PROMOTING THE ADVANCEMENT OF HINDU RELIGION BY ENCOURAGING YOUNGER MEMBERS OF THE HINDU RELIGION, ANDTHE CHILDREN OF MEMBERS OF THE CHARITY TO PARTICIPATE IN SUCH ACTIVITIES AND ALSO ENCOURAGE AN UNDERSTANDING OF THE HINDU RELIGION AND HINDU CULTURAL ACTIVITIES BY INVITING MEMBERS OF THE PUBLIC WHO ARE NOT MEMBERS OF THE CHARITY TO BECOME INVOLVED IN SUCH ACTIVITIES. 5.5.	TO PROMOTE INTERFAITH ACTIVITIES, RELIGIOUS TOLERANCE, UNDERSTANDING AND HARMONY BETWEEN DIFFERENT COMMUNITIES AND RELIGIONS.

name: SAWIRIS FOUNDATION
activities: The Trustees are looking to build up further resources to ensure that sustainable long term grants may be made for projects to be selected in the future.  During the year a grant was made to contribute to scholarship funding for students studying on a Master of Development Practice Graduate program
objects: THE TRUSTEES SHALL HOLD THE CAPITAL AND INCOME OF THE TRUST FUND UPON TRUST TO APPLY THE INCOME, AND ALL OR SUCH PART OR PARTS OF THE CAPITAL, AT SUCH TIME OR TIMES AND IN SUCH MANNER TO, OR FOR THE BENEFIT OF, SUCH EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE OBJECTS AND PURPOSES IN ANY PART OF THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES MAY IN THEIR DISCRETION THINK FIT.

name: HOPE UK AND BANGLADESH
activities: Conduct eye camps in Asia, consult patients in remote area, distribute medicines, spectacles among patients. Organise symposium regarding preventable diseases. Carry out cataract and other operations free for blind and poor people.
objects: THE PRESERVATION AND PROTECTION OF GOOD HEALTH BY THE PROVISION OF FREE TREATMENT AND SUPPLY OF MEDICINES TO PREVENT BLINDNESS OF UNDERPRIVILEDGED PEOPLE IN BANGLADESH

name: GOOD MOVE! MUSIC
activities: Good Move! Music delivers a range of music education projects to primary and secondary schools throughout London. These short and long term projects have a particular focus on providing young people form challenging backgrounds the opportunity to take part in high quality music making activities.
objects: 1. TO ADVANCE EDUCATION IN MUSIC AND THE APPRECIATION AND UNDERSTANDING OF MUSIC FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT BUT WITH A PARTICULAR FOCUS ON YOUNG PEOPLE AND THOSE WHO ARE SOCIALLY OR ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED  2. TO PROMOTE CREATIVE AND PERFORMING ARTS FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT

activities: No current activities.
objects: THE CHARITY'S OBJECTS ("OBJECTS") ARE SPECIFICALLY RESTRICTED TO THE FOLLOWING:  (1) TO RELIEVE THE NEED AMONG (BUT NOT NECESSARILY LIMITED TO) DISABLED, DEAF AND BLIND CHILDREN AND YOUNG ADULTS IN BUCKINGHAMSHIRE AND DEVON, PARTICULARLY BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY:-  A) HELPING THEM ACCESS MAINSTREAM AND PUBLIC SERVICES  B) HELPING THEM PARTICIPATE MORE FULLY IN SOCIETY  C) BY THE PROVISION OF SERVICES, SUPPORT AND SUITABLE FACILITIES  (2) THE RELIEF OF FINANCIAL NEED AND SUFFERING AMONG VICTIMS OF NATURAL OR OTHER KINDS OF DISASTER OR THOSE THAT ARE IMPOVERISHED IN KENYA AND SOMALIA IN THE FORM OF MONEY (OR OTHER MEANS DEEMED SUITABLE) FOR PERSONS, BODIES, ORGANISATIONS AFFECTED INCLUDING THE PROVISION OF  MEDICAL AID.

activities: No current activities.

name: THE FRANKHAM FAMILY CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: Funds available for charitable purposes. Trustee's Do Not Accept Unsolicited Appeals.
objects: THE OBJECTS (THE "OBJECTS") OF THE TRUST ARE TO FURTHER SUCH OBJECTS OR PURPOSES WHICH ARE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE ACCORDING TO THE LAW OF ENGLAND AND WALES IN ANY PART OF THE WORLD AND IN SUCH MANNER AS THE TRUSTEES MAY IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION THINK FIT.

name: THE OSTACCHINI FAMILY CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: i) To promote humane behaviour towards animals by providing appropriate care, protection, treatment and security for animals which are in need of care and attention by reason of sickness, maltreatment, poor circumstances or ill usage and to educate the public in matters pertaining to animal welfare in general; ii) The relief of those in need, by reason of age, ill-health or disability.
objects: 1. TO PROMOTE HUMANE BEHAVIOUR TOWARDS ANIMALS BY PROVIDING APPROPRIATE CARE, PROTECTION, TREATMENT AND SECURITY FOR ANIMALS WHICH ARE IN NEED OF CARE AND ATTENTION BY REASON OF SICKNESS, MALTREATMENT, POOR CIRCUMSTANCES OR ILL USAGE AND TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC IN MATTERS PERTAINING TO ANIMAL WELFARE IN GENERAL AND THE PREVENTION OF CRUELTY AND SUFFERING AMONG ANIMALS. 2. THE RELIEF OF THOSE IN NEED, BY REASON OF AGE, ILL-HEALTH OR DISABILITY.

name: INSPIRED
activities: Organising educational public conferences, seminars for Youth to stay away from extremism as well as providing sports club for them, befriending and providing advice and support for disadvantaged women, work with the elderly and disabled in isolation, advice and advocacy for refugees, cooperation with women's groups and human rights bodies, highlighting situations and cases of human rights abuses.
objects: 1 TO PROMOTE SOCIAL INCLUSION FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT BY WORKING WITH MEMBERS OF THE COMMUNITY WHO ARE SOCIALLY EXCLUDED ON THE GROUNDS OF AGE, GENDER, DISABILITY, LANGUAGE AND ETHNIC ORIGIN AND TO RELIEVE THE NEEDS OF SUCH PEOPLE AND ASSIST THEM TO INTEGRATE INTO SOCIETY BY:   1.1. PROVIDING SUPPORT TO DISADVANTAGED MEMBERS OF THE COMMUNITY AND ASSISTING NEW ARRIVALS TO THE UK WITH INTEGRATION INTO THE COMMUNITY INCLUDING THROUGH THE FACILITATION OF COMMUNITY ACTIVITIES AND EVENTS.   1.2. PROVIDING ADVICE, EDUCATION, COUNSELLING, BEFRIENDING, ADVOCACY AND REPRESENTATION.   2. TO PROMOTE HUMAN RIGHTS (AS SET OUT IN THE UNIVERSAL DECLARATION OF HUMAN RIGHTS AND SUBSEQUENT UNITED NATIONS CONVENTIONS AND DECLARATIONS) THOUGHOUT THE WORLD BY ANY OR ALL THE FOLLOWING MEANS:   2.1 MONITORING ABUSES OF HUMAN RIGHTS;   2.2 OBTAINING REDRESS FOR THE VICTIMS OF HUMAN RIGHTS ABUSE;   2.3 RELIEVING NEED AMONG THE VICTIMS OF HUMAN RIGHTS ABUSE;   2.4 RESEARCH INTO HUMAN RIGHTS ISSUES;   2.5 EDUCATING THE PUBLIC ABOUT HUMAN RIGHTS;   2.6 PROVIDING TECHNICAL ADVICE TO GOVERNMENT AND OTHERS ON HUMAN RIGHTS MATTERS;   2.7 CONTRIBUTING TO THE SOUND ADMINISTRATION OF HUMAN RIGHTS LAW;   2.8 RAISING AWARENESS OF HUMAN RIGHTS ISSUES;   2.9 PROMOTING PUBLIC SUPPORT FOR HUMAN RIGHTS;   2.10 PROMOTING RESPECT FOR HUMAN RIGHTS AMONGST INDIVIDUALS AND CORPORATIONS;   2.11 INTERNATIONAL ADVOCACY OF HUMAN RIGHTS   2.12 ELIMINATING INFRINGEMENTS OF HUMAN RIGHTS   IN FURTHERANCE OF THAT OBJECT BUT NOT OTHERWISE, THE TRUSTEES SHALL HAVE POWER   1) TO WORK TOWARDS THE PREVENTION OF VIOLENT RELIGIOUS EXTREMISM THROUGH THE PROVISION OF AWARENESS RAISING WORKSHOPS, TRAINING AND SEMINARS.   2) TO ENGAGE IN POLITICAL ACTIVITY PROVIDED THAT THE TRUSTEES ARE SATISFIED THAT THE PROPOSED ACTIVITIES WILL FURTHER THE PURPOSES OF THE CHARITY TO AN EXTENT JUSTIFIED BY THE RESOURCES COMMITTED AND THE ACTIVITY IS NOT THE DOMINANT MEANS BY WHICH THE CHARITY CARRIED OUT ITS OBJECTS.

name: STEYN CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: To advance the Christian religion in the United Kingdom and in any other country by such means as the Trustees may determine, including but not limited to the provision of grants and practical support to charities and other organisation working to advance the Christian religion. Such charitable purposes for the public benefit as are exclusively charitable according to the laws of England.
objects: 1) TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN RELIGION IN THE UNITED KINGDOM AND IN ANY OTHER COUNTRY BY SUCH MEANS AS THE TRUSTEES MAY DETERMINE, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE PROVISION OF GRANTS AND PRACTICAL SUPPORT TO CHARITIES AND OTHER ORGANISATIONS WORKING TOADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN RELIGION.    2) SUCH CHARITABLE PURPOSES FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT AS ARE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE ACCORDING TO THE LAWS OF ENGLAND AND WALES AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME DETERMINE.

name: GARGAAR TRUST
activities: No Activities
objects: TO PROMOTE THE BENEFIT OF THOSE LIVING IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT BY:  1)THE RELIEF OF POVERTY AND SICKNESS AND TO PROMOTE AND PROTECT GOOD HEALTH;  2)TO ADVANCE EDUCATION;  3)THE PROVISION OF RECREATIONAL FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE WITH THE  OBJECT OF IMPROVING THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE;  IN PARTICULAR, BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY AMONGST THOSE WHO ARE REFUGEES OR WHO ARE  HAVE BEEN AFFECTED BY CIVIL OR MILITARY ACTION OR NATURAL DISASTER AS THE TRUSTEES  SHALL DETERMINE.

name: TRAFFORD CENTRE FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING LTD
activities: To advance the education and the health and wellbeing ,and the human rights and equality of disabled and deaf people, primarily but not exclusively within the Borough of Trafford, through the provision of services which enable them to live as independently as possible; and through activities which contribute to the removal of barriers to their full and active participation as citizens.
objects: TO RELIEVE THE NEEDS, ADVANCE THE EDUCATION AND PROMOTE AND PROTECT THE PHYSICAL AND MENTAL HEALTH OF DISABLED AND DEAF PEOPLE, PRIMARILY BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY WITHIN THE BOROUGH OF TRAFFORD, THROUGH THE PROVISION OF SERVICES WHICH ENABLE THEM TO LIVE AS INDEPENDENTLY AS POSSIBLE AND AS FULL AND ACTIVE CITIZENS.    [WHEN USING THE WORD DISABLED WE INTERPRET THIS TO MEAN DISABLED PEOPLE OR PEOPLE LIVING WITH LONG-TERM HEALTH CONDITIONS]

name: ESTHER MINISTRIES OUTREACH
activities: HOLISTIC ADVOCACY, EDUCATIIONAL, RECREATIONAL, PASTORAL & THERAPEUTIC FAMILY SUPPORT SERVICES.
objects: (1) TO PROVIDE FOR BENEFIT OF CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE FACILITIES WHICH MAY INCLUDED EDUCATION, RECREATION AND LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION INCLUDING BUT NOT BY LIMITATION THROUGH PROVISION OF A DAY NURSERY/BREAKFAST AND AFTER SCHOOL/HOLIDAY SCHEME. name: THE PANJWANI TRUST

objects: THE CHARITY'S OBJECTS ("OBJECTS") ARE SPECIFICALLY RESTRICTED TO THE FOLLOWING:  TO ADVANCE ANY PURPOSES WHICH ARE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE UNDER THE LAW OF ENGLAND AND WALES FROM TIME TO TIME BY PROVIDING GRANTS TO CHARITIES OR OTHER ORGANISATIONS OR INDIVIDUALS IDENTIFIED BY THE TRUSTEES AT THEIR DISCRETION.

name: TORAH ACTION LIFE
activities: To advance the orthodox Jewish religion for the benefit of the public through the holding of prayer meetings, study sessions, lectures, public celebration of religious festivals in accordance with the tenets of the orthodox Jewish religion and to advance education in the orthodox Jewish religion by providing and assisting in the provision of appropriate facilities needed for such purposes.
objects: 1. TO ADVANCE THE ORTHODOX JEWISH RELIGION FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC THROUGH THE HOLDING OF PRAYER MEETINGS, STUDY SESSIONS, LECTURES, PUBLIC CELEBRATION OF RELIGIOUS FESTIVALS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE TENETS OF THE ORTHODOX JEWISH RELIGION.  2. name: JUBILEE COMMUNITY EDUCATION
activities: The Charity is parent run and provides Bengali language classes to GCSE level for 65 pupils aged 7 to 17 on Saturday mornings in term time. It facilitates a students' forum which promotes student voice and volunteering in the wider community, and student initiated youth activities. It provides educational advice to students and families. The Charity organises family outings and events.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE LIVING IN LONDON, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY:    (1) PROMOTING LINKS BETWEEN EDUCATIONAL ESTABLISHMENTS AND THE COMMUNITY.    (2) ENCOURAGING THE CREATION OF SUPPORT NETWORKS AND SELF-HELP GROUPS FOR CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES.    (3) SUPPORTING AND INITIATING MOTHER-TONGUE CLASSES, CULTURAL STUDY GROUPS AND BILINGUAL SUPPLEMENTARY CLASSES WHERE IT IS FELT THEY ARE NEEDED TO FURTHER THE EDUCATIONAL DEVELOPMENT OF CHILDREN.    (4) ENCOURAGING PARENTS TO BECOME MORE INVOLVED IN THEIR CHILDREN'S EDUCATION AND THE AFFAIRS OF MAINSTREAM SCHOOLS.

activities: Running prayer facility by collecting money from worshipper

objects: THE PREVENTION OR RELIEF OF POVERTY IN SOUTH AFRICA, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY SUPPORTING THE CONSTRUCTION AND OPERATION OF THE DENIS HURLEY CENTRE IN DURBAN, SOUTH AFRICA, AS A COMMUNITY CENTRE FOR THE BENEFIT OF POOR AND NEEDY PERSONS.

name: FRIENDS OF MAPPLEWELLS

name: THE YORK BRIDGE CLUB
activities: The charity's activities are focused on the  (a) the advancement of amateur sport by promoting the game of bridge for the benefit of the residents of York and the surrounding area. (b) the provision of facilities for the learning, teaching and playing of bridge for the benefit of the residents of York and the surrounding area.
objects: THE CHARITY'S OBJECTS ("OBJECTS") ARE SPECIFICALLY RESTRICTED TO THE FOLLOWING:  FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT:  (A) THE ADVANCEMENT OF AMATEUR SPORT BY PROMOTING THE GAME OF BRIDGE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE RESIDENTS OF YORK AND THE SURROUNDING AREA.  (B) THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR THE LEARNING, TEACHING AND PLAYING OF BRIDGE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE RESIDENTS OF YORK AND THE SURROUNDING AREA WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING CONDITIONS OF LIFE.

name: HOOT CREATIVE ARTS
activities: Hoot main activity is providing quality creative arts activities with proven benefits in improving mental health and well being. We work with adults with mental health needs, older people including people living with dementia conditions and their carers. For more information, please visit our website www.hootcreativearts.co.uk
objects: 1) THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE ARTS THROUGH, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES, EQUIPMENT AND PERSONNEL TO ENABLE THE PUBLIC TO PARTICIPATE IN AND OBSERVE MUSIC MAKING, DANCE AND OTHER ARTS ACTIVITIES.  2) THE ADVANCEMENT OF HEALTH THROUGH, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES, EQUIPMENT AND PERSONNEL TO ENABLE THE PUBLIC TO PARTICIPATE IN AND OBSERVE MUSIC MAKING, DANCE AND OTHER ARTS ACTIVITIES.

name: MEDWAY WATERSPORTS TRUST LIMITED
activities: Provision of water sports, including sailing, canoeing and kayaking and other outdoor activities for the local community, and especially schools and youth organisations, through access to the River Medway and lake facilites at Alpha Lake, Cliffe. The Trust has a five year plan to build a new water sports centre at the Strand, Gillingham., Kent, on the river frontage.
objects: 1. TO PROVIDE OR ASSIST IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION OF INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE NEED FOR SUCH FACILITIES BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, AGE, INFIRMITY OR DISABILITY, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR SOCIAL CIRCUMSTANCES, WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE.  2. TO HELP YOUNG PEOPLE, ESPECIALLY BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY THROUGH THEIR LEISURE TIME ACTIVITIES, SO AS TO DEVELOP THEIR CAPABILITIES THAT THEY MAY GROW TO FULL MATURITY AS INDIVIDUALS AND MEMBERS OF SOCIETY.

objects: THE CHARITY'S OBJECTS ("THE OBJECTS") ARE FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATEMENT OF BELIEFS APPEARING IN THE SCHEDULE HERETO IN ABERGAVENNY AND IN SUCH OTHER PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT AND TO FULFIL SUCH OTHER PURPOSES WHICH ARE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE ACCORDING TO THE LAW OF ENGLAND AND WALES AND ARE CONNECTED WITH THE CHARITABLE WORK OF THE CHARITY.

activities: HOLDING REGULAR WORSHIP SERVICES TO PROMOTE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH IN THE COMMUNITY
