DISSEMINATE THE FINDINGS OF THE RESEARCH TO IMPROVE THEIR HEALTH  1.3. RAISE AWARENESS OF THESE HEALTH AND SOCIAL CARE ISSUES AND PROVIDE THEM WITH SUPPORT  1.4. COMMUNICATE, NETWORK AND PROVIDE LINKS AND BUILD CAPACITY WITH COMMUNITY GROUPS, RESEARCH/ACADEMIC INSTITUTIONS AND FUNDING AGENCIES TO INFLUENCE POLICY AND DECISIONS AFFECTING THEM.  2. INFORMING POLICY, LOCALLY AND NATIONALLY, AND ASSISTING IN THE PROMULGATION OF EFFECTIVE POLICIES AND GOOD PRACTICES,  2.1. SO AS TO CONTRIBUTE TO IMPROVED HEALTH OUTCOMES FOR THE PEOPLE FROM THE BLACK AND MINORITY ETHNIC COMMUNITIES  2.2. SO THAT HEALTH SERVICES ARE ABLE TO MEET THEIR SPECIFIC NEEDS.

name: FRIENDS OF TYNEMOUTH OUTDOOR POOL
activities: The principal activity is that of raising finance and developing plans for the redevelopment management of Tynemouth  Outdoor Pool.
objects: 4 THE CHARITY'S OBJECTS ('OBJECTS') ARE SPECIFICALLY RESTRICTED TO THE FOLLOWING:  THE CHARITY'S OBJECTS (OBJECTS) ARE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC GENERALLY AND IN PARTICULAR THE INHABITANTS OF TYNEMOUTH AND ITS SURROUNDING AREAS:  (1) TO PROMOTE COMMUNITY PARTICIPATION IN HEALTHY RECREATION BY PROVIDING FACILITIES AT TYNEMOUTH OUTDOOR POOL AND ELSEWHERE FOR SWIMMING AND OTHER SPORTS CAPABLE OF IMPROVING HEALTH (FACILITIES IN THIS ARTICLE MEANS LAND, BUILDINGS, EQUIPMENT AND ORGANISING SPORTINGACTIVITIES);  (2) TO PROVIDE AND ASSIST IN PROVIDING FACILITIES AT TYNEMOUTH OUTDOOR POOL AND ELSEWHERE FOR SPORTS, RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION OF SUCH PERSONS WHO HAVE NEED FOR SUCH FACILITIES BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, AGE, INFIRMITYOR DISABLEMENT, POVERTY OR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES OR FOR THE PUBLIC AT LARGE IN THE INTEREST OF SOCIAL WELFARE AND WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE;  (3) TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN THE HISTORY AND HERITAGE OF TYNEMOUTH, IN PARTICULAR BY THE PRESERVATION AND MAKING AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC OF THE HISTORIC TYNEMOUTH OUTDOOR POOL, MAINTAINING AN ARCHIVE OF AUDIO-VISUAL MATERIAL RELATING TO TYNEMOUTH OUTDOOR POOL AND  (4) FOR SUCH OTHER EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS THE DIRECTORS MAY FROM TIME TO TIME DECIDE.

name: LEADERS OF TOMORROW (LOT)
activities: LOT is a leadership, enrichment and mentoring programme designed to raise the academic achievements of children and young people; particularly those of African and Caribbean Heritage by empowering them with unbridled opportunities. Through a combination of discipline and tough love we help young people grow in confidence, learn invaluable life skills and compete in the market place.
objects: TO ACT AS A RESOURCE FOR YOUNG PEOPLE UP TO THE AGE OF 25 LIVING IN GREATER LONDON BY PROVIDING ADVICE AND ASSISTANCE AND ORGANISING PROGRAMMES OF PHYSICAL, EDUCATIONAL AND OTHER ACTIVITIES AS A MEANS OF:(A)ADVANCING IN LIFE AND HELPING YOUNG PEOPLE BY DEVELOPING THEIR SKILLS,CAPACITIES AND CAPABILITIES TO ENABLE THEM TO PARTICIPATE IN SOCIETY AS INDEPENDENT,MATURE AND RESPONSIBLE INDIVIDUALS;(B)ADVANCING EDUCATION;(C)RELIEVING UNEMPLOYMENT;(D)PROVIDING RECREATIONAL AND LEISURE TIME ACTIVITY IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR PEOPLE LIVING IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT WHO HAVE NEED BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH,AGE,INFIRMITY OR DISABILITY, POVERTY OR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES WITH A VIEW TO IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE OF SUCH PERSONS

name: HORSE SENSE WIRRAL
activities: We are an Equine Welfare Organisation based in Wirral (Thornton Hough) we supply a life long home to several rescued/retired equines. We believe that ponies who have been neglected or abused deserve to have nothing more asked of them other than to be happy, contented ponies, therefore we don't follow common practise of pony rides. We offer advice & assistance to horse owners & police.
objects: THE CHARITY'S OBJECT ("THE OBJECT") IS TO PROMOTE HUMANE BEHAVIOUR TOWARDS HORSES BY PROVIDING APPROPRIATE CARE, PROTECTION, TREATMENT AND SECURITY FOR ANIMALS WHICH ARE IN NEED OF CARE AND ATTENTION BY REASON OF SICKNESS, MALTREATMENT, POOR CIRCUMSTANCES OR ILL USAGE AND TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC IN MATTERS PERTAINING TO ANIMAL WELFARE IN GENERAL AND THE PREVENTION OF CRUELTY AND SUFFERING AMONG ANIMALS.

name: FORMA ARTS AND MEDIA LIMITED
activities: To promote, maintain, improve, support and encourage the arts; To advance education in the arts including the production, exhibition, presentation, organisation, provision, publication, management, distribution, broadcasting or webcasting of all or any such arts in any forum.
objects: THE CHARITY'S OBJECTS (OBJECTS) ARE FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT:  3.1.1 TO PROMOTE, MAINTAIN, IMPROVE, SUPPORT AND ENCOURAGE THE ARTS;    3.1.2 TO ADVANCE EDUCATION IN THE ARTS INCLUDING (BUT NOT LIMITED TO) BY;  3.1.2.1 THE PROVISION OF TRAINING TO THE PUBLIC INCLUDING, IN PARTICULAR, ARTS PROFESSIONALS;  3.1.2.2 THE PRODUCTION, EXHIBITION, PRESENTATION, ORGANISATION, PROVISION,PUBLICATION, MANAGEMENT, DISTRIBUTION, BROADCASTING OR WEBCASTING OF ALL OR ANY SUCH ARTS IN ANY FORUM;    3.1.3 THE RELIEF OF POVERTY BY THE PROVISION OF SUPPORT AND ASSISTANCE (WHETHER FINANCIAL OR OTHERWISE) TO ARTISTS IN NEED INCLUDING THE RAISING AND GRANTING OF FUNDS FOR ANY ASPECT OF THE ARTS; AND    3.1.4 FOR THE GENERAL PURPOSES OF SUCH CHARITABLE BODIES OR FOR SUCH OTHER EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE PURPOSES IN EACH CASE AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME DECIDE.

name: JALALIA JAAME MOSQUE
activities: Jalalia Jaame Mosque was established in 1971 and continues to be used by the ever growing community as a place for solace and spiritual development. The Mosque can accommodate up to 1500 worshippers and offers a range of services from daily prayers to education and funeral services for the community.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE ISLAMIC RELIGION FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC WITHIN THE METROPOLITAN BOROUGH OF ROCHDALE BY:- A) PROVIDING A PLACE (MOSQUE) FOR MUSLIM CONGREGATIONAL PRAYERS, FIVE TIMES  DAILY LED BY AN IMAM (PRIEST); B)TO PROVIDE A PLACE (MOSQUE)FORTHE WEEKLY FRIDAY PRAYER (JUMMA), A SPECIAL CONGREGATION LED BY AN IMAM WHO WILL ALSO READ THE FRIDAY SERMONS; C)TO PROVIDE A PLACE (MOSQUE) FOR THE TWO EID PRAYERS, SPECIAL ANNUAL CONGREGATIONS LED BY AN IMAM~WHO WILL ALSO READ THE EID SERMONS; D)TOPROVIDE ISLAMIC EDUCATION TO CHILDREN (FROM THE AGE OF 5 TO 15);  E) TO PROVIDE CONTINUING ISLAMIC EDUCATION TO ADULTS THROUGH SEMINARS AND CONFERENCES; F)TO PROVIDE AN IMAM FOR SOLEMNIZING THE MUSLIM MARRIAGE AND ISSUING OF A MARRIAGE CERTIFICATE; AND G)TO PROVIDE A MORTUARY SERVICE.

name: IMPETUS - THE PRIVATE EQUITY FOUNDATION
activities: Impetus transforms the lives of young people from disadvantaged backgrounds by ensuring they get the right support to succeed in school, in work and in life. We find, fund and build the most promising charities working with these young people, providing core funding and working shoulder-to-shoulder with their leaders to help them become stronger organisations.
objects: THE CHARITY'S OBJECTS ARE TO ADVANCE ALL PURPOSES RECOGNISED AS CHARITABLE UNDER THE LAWS OF ENGLAND AND WALES AND TO PROMOTE THE EFFICIENCY AND EFFECTIVENESS OF CHARITIES AND THE PROMOTION OF THE EFFECTIVE USE OF RESOURCES FOR CHARITABLE PURPOSES.

name: HAMPERS OF HOPE
activities: We are a Christian charity with the purpose of relieving poverty, presently focused in North-East Cheshire.  Our activities include providing Christmas food hampers for those in need.
objects: 1. THE PREVENTION OR RELIEF OF POVERTY 2. THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE CHRISTIAN FAITH 3. THE ADVANCEMENT OF HEALTH OR THE SAVING OF LIVES 4. THE RELIEF OF THOSE IN NEED BY REASON OF YOUTH, ILL HEALTH, DISABILITY, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP, OR OTHER DISADVANTAGE, AND 5. THE PROMOTION OF ANY OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC

name: AL HAYAT LANGUAGES LIMITED
activities: english language centre
objects: THE CHARITY'S OBJECTS ("THE OBJECTS") ARE:  (A) TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF AGE, DISABILITY,HEALTH STATUS, RELIGIOUS OR POLITICAL AFFILIATION, RACE, SEX OR SEXUAL ORIENTATION THROUGH THE PROMOTION OF THE TEACHING AND LIFELONG LEARNING, PRIMARILY BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY IN THE SUBJECTS OF GOOD CITIZENSHIP AND THE ENGLISH LANGUAGE, INCLUDING THE PROVISION OF ASSISTANCE TO ATTEND COURSES AND ADVICE ON THE LIFE IN THE UK TEST AS DEFINED IN ARTICLE 1; AND  (B)  (I) TO PROVIDE RELIEF FOR ASYLUM SEEKERS AND REFUGEES AND THEIR DEPENDENTS WHO ARE IN CONDITIONS OF HARDSHIP OR DISTRESS;  (II) TO PRESERVE AND PROTECT THE PHYSICAL AND MENTAL HEALTH OF SUCH PEOPLE;  (III) TO PROVIDE FACILITIES FOR SUCH PEOPLE FOR EDUCATION, RECREATION AND OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE AND ASSISTING THEIR INCLUSION INTO THE WIDER COMMUNITY PARTICULARLY BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY THE PROVISION OF A DROP IN CENTRE.

name: THE JOYCE TRUST
activities: The charity is for the benefit of young men and women 16-25 experiencing social exclusion for economic, educational or social disadvantage. The area covered exclusively is Newcastle upon Tyne and North Tyneside and Hartlepool and Teesside. We invite relevant projects to apply for funding.
objects: 2.2.1 TO PROMOTE SOCIAL INCLUSION FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT BY PREVENTING PEOPLE PARTICULARLY, BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY, YOUNG PEOPLE FROM BECOMING SOCIALLY EXCLUDED*, RELIEVING THE NEEDS OF THOSE PEOPLE WHO ARE SOCIALLY EXCLUDED AND ASSISTING THEM TO INTEGRATE INTO SOCIETY. 2.2.2 SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE AIMS AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL FROM TIME TO TIME DETERMINE. *FOR THE PURPOSE OF THIS CLAUSE 'SOCIALLY EXCLUDED' MEANS BEING EXCLUDED FROM SOCIETY OR PARTS OF SOCIETY AS A RESULT OF ONE OR MORE OF THE FOLLOWINGFACTORS: UNEMPLOYMENT FINANCIAL HARDSHIP YOUTH OR OLD AGE ILL HEALTH (PHYSICAL OR MENTAL) SUBSTANCE ABUSE OR DEPENDENCY INCLUDING ALCOHOL AND DRUGS DISCRIMINATION ON THE GROUNDS OF SEX, RACE, DISABILITY, ETHNIC ORIGIN, RELIGION, BELIEF, CREED, SEXUALORIENTATION OR GENDER REASSIGNMENT: POOR EDUCATIONAL OR SKILLS ATTAINMENT; RELATIONSHIP AND FAMILY BREAKDOWN; POOR HOUSING (THAT IS HOUSING THAT DOES NOT MEET BASIC HABITABLE STANDARDS; CRIME (EITHER AS A VICTIM OF CRIME OR AS AN OFFENDER REHABILITATING INTO SOCIETY)

name: THE ARTS SOCIETY WEALDEN
activities: The promotion and advancement of aesthetic education,the cultivation and study of the decorative and fine arts.
objects: THE PROMOTION AND ADVANCEMENT OF AESTHETIC EDUCATION,THE CULTIVATION AND STUDY OF THE DECORATIVE AND FINE ARTS AND THE GIVING OF ASSISTANCE IN THE PRESERVATION OF OUR NATIONAL ARTISTIC HERITAGE.

name: COMMONWORD ENTERPRISES LTD
activities: We are a writing development agency running workshops, literature events, seminars, running competitions and occasional events. As part of our activities, from time to time we publish physical books averaging 2 per year and e-books averaging 2 per year.
objects: TO ADVANCE EDUCATION FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC IN THE SUBJECT OF CREATIVE WRITING, LITERATURE AND THE ARTS; TO FORMULATE, PREPARE AND ESTABLISH SCHEMES THEREFORE; AND TO CO-OPERATE WITH OTHER CHARITABLE ORGANISATIONS HAVING SIMILAR OBJECTS AND TO ESTABLISH, PROMOTE OR ASSIST SUCH CHARITABLE ORGANISATIONS.

name: DANCESYNDROME
activities: DS enables People With Learning Disabilities to be active and visible citizens and provides opportunities that increase health and well-being. DS's dance leaders' with learning disabilities deliver inclusive dance workshops in local communities in the North West. DS creates meaningful activities that increase the life chances of PWLD and stimulate community cohesion through inclusive approaches.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT IN THE ART OF DANCE AND IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY FOR THE LEARNING DISABLED.

name: JESUS MISSION TO NATIONS MINISTRIES
activities: The charity's principal activities during the year continued to be that of Christian gospel ministries, and weekly meetings & fellowships.
objects: 3.2	THE OBJECTS OF THE CHURCH ARE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC:  3.2.1	TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH [IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATEMENT OF BELIEFS] IN SUCH WAYS AND IN SUCH PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES FROM TIME TO TIME MAY THINK FIT;  3.2.2	TO RELIEVE SICKNESS AND FINANCIAL HARDSHIP AND TO PROMOTE AND PRESERVE GOOD HEALTH BY THE PROVISION OF FUNDS, GOODS OR SERVICES OF ANY KIND, INCLUDING THROUGH THE PROVISION OF COUNSELLING AND SUPPORT IN SUCH PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES FROM TIME TO TIME MAY THINK FIT; AND  3.2.3	TO ADVANCE EDUCATION IN SUCH WAYS AND IN SUCH PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES FROM TIME TO TIME MAY THINK FIT.

name: GHAUSIA GIRLS HIGH SCHOOL LTD
activities: INDEPENDENT ISLAMIC HIGH SCHOOL FOR GIRLS AGED 11 TO 16 YEARS
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUPILS AT GHAUSIA GIRLS HIGH SCHOOL BY PROVIDING AND ASSISTING IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR EDUCATION AT THE SCHOOL.

name: BD4 COMMUNITY TRUST LIMITED
activities: BD4 Community Trust runs two projects with the aim of Supporting and Restoring Community across the Generations. BD4 Family provides services for  pre-school children and their families including Parent & Toddler Groups, Healthy Lifestyle Activities, Nursery Preparation and Infant Massage classes and Gems provide a Day Centre, Supermarket Bus Run and Outings for the older people in the community.
objects: UNDER A CHRISTIAN ETHOS:  1. TO FURTHER OR BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS OF EAST BOWLING, BRADFORD, WEST YORKSHIRE AND THE SURROUNDING SOUTH BRADFORD AREA, WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF SEX, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, RACE OR OF POLITICAL, RELIGIOUS OR OTHER OPINIONS BY ASSOCIATING TOGETHER THE SAID RESIDENTS AND THE LOCAL AUTHORITIES, VOLUNTARY AND OTHER ORGANISATIONS IN A COMMON EFFORT TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND TO PROVIDE FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE OBJECTIVE OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR THE RESIDENTS.  IN FURTHERANCE OF THESE OBJECTS BUT NOT OTHERWISE, THE TRUSTEES SHALL HAVE POWER:  TO ESTABLISH OR SECURE THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A COMMUNITY CENTRE AND TO MAINTAIN OR MANAGE OR CO-OPERATEWITH ANY STATUTORY AUTHORITY IN THE MAINTENANCE AND MANAGEMENT OF SUCH A CENTRE FOR ACTIVITIES PROMOTED BY THE CHARITY IN FURTHERANCE OF THE ABOVE OBJECTS.  2. TO RELIEVE THE NEEDS OF ELDERLY PEOPLE, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY THE PROVISIONOF DAY CARE FACILITIES AND A LUNCH CLUB;  3. TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF BABIES AND YOUNG CHILDREN, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY OFFERING APPROPRIATE PLAY FACILITIES AND COURSES FOR THE CHILDREN AND THEIR FAMILIES.

name: CHANDON SYEDUN FOUNDATION
activities: Made financial contribution poor family to buy cloths and bedding's for 15 families Made financial contribution for orphans to by food,cloths and medicine for 20 orphans Made financial contribution to establish 5 Water well
objects: 3.1 TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC THROUGH THE PROVISION OF GRANTS TO SCHOOLS IN BANGLADESH.  3.2 THE RELIEF OF FINANCIAL HARDSHIP AMONG THE PEOPLE IN BANGLADESH SPECIALLY ORPHANS, POOR AND DESTITUTE AS AND WHEN POSSIBLE BY PROVIDING SUCH PERSONS WITH GOODS/SERVICES WHICH THEY COULD NOT OTHERWISE AFFORD THROUGH LACK OF MEANS.  3.3 THE RELIEF OF FINANCIAL HARDSHIP AMONG PEOPLE LIVING IN BANGLADESH IN THE EVENTS OF UNFORTUNATE NATURAL DISASTER, SUCH AS, FLOOD, HURRICANE, EPIDEMIC ETC.

name: SIR DENIS MAHON'S CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: It is anticipated that the charity will become a grant making charity but currently has no assets. It is further anticipated that funding may be received in the future.
objects: TO PROMOTE AND FURTHER THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION IN THE FINE ARTS IN THE UNITED KINGDOM OF GREAT BRITAIN AND NORTHERN IRELAND, THE REPUBLIC OF IRELAND, THE REPUBLIC OF ITALY AND THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA

name: HEADSTART2WORK
activities: Education and training of young people
objects: THE CHARITYS OBJECTS ARE SPECIFICALLY RESTRICTED TO THE FOLLOWING:  TO ADVANCE EDUCATION IN PARTICULAR (BUT WITHOUT LIMITATION) TO PROVIDE WORK RELATED LEARNING, VOCATIONAL COURSES AND THE OPPORTUNITY TO GAIN QUALIFICATIONS FOR ANY ONE AGED FROM 10 YEARS AND OVER, ESPECIALLY CHILDREN WHO HAVE BEEN OR ARE AT RISK OF BEING EXCLUDED FROM SCHOOL AND PEOPLE FROM THE LARGE TRAVELING COMMUNITY IN LOCAL AREAS OF DEPRIVATION.

name: BALTIC CHARITABLE FOUNDATION
activities: The objects of the Foundation are to promote general charitable activities for the public benefit,  in particular in the fields of the arts and culture, the advancement of education and training, science, ecology and healthcare.
objects: THE OBJECT OF THE CIO IS RESTRICTED SPECIFICALLY TO THE APPLICATION OF CIO FUNDS, AT SUCH TIME OR TIMES AND IN SUCH MANNER, FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT, AS THE CHARITY TRUSTEES MAY IN THEIR DISCRETION THINK FIT FOR ANY EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE OBJECTS AND PURPOSES IN ANY PART OF THE WORLD.

name: THE GOLDEN HELIX FOUNDATION
activities: The objectives of the charity are to advance education in the area of genome and personalised medicine by promoting the development of research and the transfer and communication of knowledge from researchers and scientists in the wider scientific community through collaborative projects and conferences in the field of pharmacogenomics and personalised medicine.
objects: TO ADVANCE EDUCATION IN THE AREA OF GENOME AND PERSONALISED MEDICINE BY PROMOTING THE DEVELOPMENT OF RESEARCH AND THE TRANSFER AND COMMUNICATION OF KNOWLEDGE FROM RESEARCHERS AND SCIENTISTS IN THE WIDER SCIENTIFIC COMMUNITY THROUGH COLLABORATIVE PROJECTS AND CONFERENCES IN THE FIELD OF PHARMACOGENOMICS AND PERSONALISED MEDICINE.

name: THE ARK CHURCH (HUDDERSFIELD)
activities: The Ark Church meets for worship and Christian teaching. We run Life Groups, where people meet to share life experiences and the "HOWs" and "WHYs" of applying God's teachings to everyday issues. We reach out to the local community to share the good news of Jesus Christ and provide Parent and Toddler groups and other practical needs. We are currently planting a new church in Halifax.
objects: A) THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE CHRISTIAN RELIGION TO PROCLAIM AND FURTHER THE GOSPEL OF GOD AND HIS SON JESUS CHRIST AND TO PREACH AND TEACH THE CHRISTIAN FAITH IN THE UNITED KINGDOM & OVERSEAS  B) THE ADVANCEMENT FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT OF RELIGIOUS AND OTHER EDUCATION  C) THE RELIEF OF THE AGED POOR SICK DISADVANTAGED AND DISABLED  D) SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS THE TRUSTEES IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION THINK FIT

name: THE GORDON-SMITH: CUSWORTH HALL GARDENS TRUST
activities: The preservation, repair and maintenance of the land and buildings comprising the Grade 2 listed bowling green and pavilion, terrace, rose garden and 18th century walls situated at Cusworth Hall for the benefit of the public.
objects: A) THE PROVISION, MAINTENANCE AND UPKEEP OF FACILITIES FOR RECREATION OF OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION OF INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, AGE, INFIRMITY, OR DISABLEMENT, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES OR FOR THE PUBLIC AT LARGE IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE AND WITH THE OBJECTS OF IMPROVING THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE; AND  B)THE PRESERVATION, REPAIR AND MAINTENANCE OF THE LAND AND BUILDINGS COMPRISING THE GRADE II LISTED BOWLING GREEN AND PAVILION, TERRACE, ROSE GARDEN AND 18TH CENTURY WALLS SITUATED AT CUSWORTH HALL FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC.

name: VISIONZAMBIA
activities: VisionZambia is a UK based charity established to support low-income communities in Zambia. This involves access to education, water and sanitation delivery, access to building materials and knowhow, distribution of cloths, food and life saving drugs and income generating projects.
objects: 1. THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION AND TRAINING  2. THE RELIEF OF POVERTY  3. THE PRESERVATION AND PROTECTION OF HEALTH  IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY PROVIDING COMMUNITIES IN NEED IN ZAMBIA WITH GOODS, ITEMS SERVICES AND SUPPORTING DEVELOPMENT WITHIN THE COMMUNITY TO HELP PEOPLE MEET THEIR OWN NEEDS

name: 901 TROOP MARINE CADETS
activities: 901Troop Marine Cadets provides opportunities for young people in East Anglia to develop into responsible, dependable and useful members of society. The Troop promote self-discipline and comradeship. The Troop teach the basic principles of leadership in preparation for adult life, through a system of military discipline, Royal Marine ethos, adventorous training and the discipline of music.
objects: TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUNG PEOPLE TO DEVELOP INTO RESPONSIBLE, DEPENDABLE AND USEFUL MEMBERS OF SOCIETY.  TO PROMOTE SELF-DISCIPLINE AND COMRADESHIP  TO TEACH THE BASIC PRINCIPLES OF LEADERSHIP IN PREPARATION FOR ADULT LIFE  TO HELP YOUNG PEOPLE ACHIEVE THEIR FULL PHYSICAL, INTELLECTUAL AND SOCIAL POTENTIAL  ALL THROUGH A SYSTEM OF MILITARY DISCIPLINE, ROYAL MARINE ETHOS AND ADVENTURE TRAINING.

name: SUJA ORPHAN CARE
activities: We provide clothing, educational sponsorship and assistance to access medical care for children and youth from low income families.  We also organise workshops and events aimed at empowering women and enhancing social cohesion.  Through our volunteer programme we provide opportunities that create global citizens who actively take up social projects.
objects: THE PREVENTION OR RELIEF OF POVERTY OR FINANCIAL HARDSHIP IN THE UNITED KINGDOM AND AFRICA, PARTICULARLY SOMALIA AND ETHIOPIA, BY PROVIDING OR ASSISTING IN THE PROVISION OF EDUCATION, TRAINING, HEALTHCARE PROJECTS AND ALL THE NECESSARY SUPPORT DESIGNED TO ENABLE INDIVIDUALS TO GENERATE A SUSTAINABLE INCOME AND BE SELF-SUFFICIENT.

name: FRIENDS OF NORDEN
activities: No current activities.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF PUPILS IN THE SCHOOL IN PARTICULAR BY:DEVELOPING EFFECTIVE RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN THE STAFF PARENTS AND OTHERS ASSOCIATED WITH THE SCHOOL;ENGAGING IN ACTIVITIES OR PROVIDING FACILITIES OR EQUIPMENT WHICH SUPPORT THE SCHOOL AND ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUPILS.

name: THE AFRICAN MORINGA AND PERMACULTURE PROJECT (AMPP)
activities: Working to establish kitchen gardens, food forests and community businesses to transition towards a resilient and prosperous Malawi. Diverse food forests will provide a variety of food, fuel wood and  timber.The project has several thousand trees waiting to be planted in the food forests and the village and aims to set up community businesses derived from its produce.
objects: TO PROMOTE SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC BY:(A)THE PRESERVATION,CONSERVATION AND THE PROTECTION OF THE ENVIRONMENT AND THE PRUDENT USE OF RESOURCES;(B)THE RELIEF OF POVERTY AND THE IMPROVEMENT OF THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE IN SOCIALLY AND ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES;C)THE PROMOTION OF SUSTAINABLE MEANS OF ACHIEVING ECONOMIC GROWTH AND REGENERATION.TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN SUBJECTS RELATING TO SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT AND THE PROTECTION,ENHANCEMENT ANDREHABILITATION OF THE ENVIRONMENT AND TO PROMOTE STUDY AND RESEARCH IN SUCH SUBJECTS PROVIDED THAT THE USEFUL RESULTS OF SUCH STUDY ARE DISSEMINATED TO THE PUBLIC AT LARGE.SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT MEANS DEVELOPMENT WHICH MEETS THE NEEDS OF THE PRESENTWITHOUT COMPROMISING THE ABILITY OF FUTURE GENERATIONS TO MEET THEIR OWN NEEDS.

name: LONDON METROPOLITAN UNIVERSITY STUDENTS' UNION
activities: Promoting the interests and welfare of Students at London Met Uni (LMU) during their course of study and representing, supporting and advising Students;  Being the recognised representative channel between Students and  LMU and any other external bodies; and  Providing social, cultural, and recreational activities and forums for discussions for the personal development of its Students.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE UNION ARE THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION OF STUDENTS AT LONDON METROPOLITAN UNIVERSITY FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT BY:  - PROMOTING THE INTERESTS AND WELFARE OF STUDENTS AT LONDON METROPOLITAN UNIVERSITY DURING THEIR COURSE OF STUDY AND REPRESENTING, SUPPORTING AND ADVISING STUDENTS;  - BEING THE RECOGNISED REPRESENTATIVE CHANNEL BETWEEN STUDENTS AND LONDON METROPOLITAN UNIVERSITY AND ANY OTHER EXTERNAL BODIES; AND  - PROVIDING SOCIAL, CULTURAL, SPORTING AND RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES ANDFORUMS FOR DISCUSSIONS AND DEBATE FOR THE PERSONAL DEVELOPMENT OF ITS STUDENTS.

name: CHESHIRE CONNECT
activities: Our objectives are delivered by matching relevant skills and expertise offered pro bono from the business community to resource needs in the voluntary sector.We do this in three ways: Short-term projects, or Quick Fixes; longer-term projects involving a range of professional skills; and, sourcing Trustees, Mentors, or Critical Friends to deliver longer-term ongoing support.
objects: THE CHARITY'S OBJECTS ("OBJECTS") ARE, FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC:  (A)	TO PROMOTE THE EFFICIENCY AND EFFECTIVENESS OF CHARITIES; AND  (B)	TO PROMOTE CIVIC RESPONSIBILITY AND GOOD CITIZENSHIP.

name: OPERA LYRICA
activities: Performances of opera and opera-related concerts, as well as workshops and other opera-related events.
objects: TO PROMOTE THE PUBLIC APPRECIATION OF, AND TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC IN THE ART OF CLASSICAL MUSIC,IN PARTICULAR OPERA, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO DELIVERING PERFORMANCES AND PROVIDING WORKSHOPS THROUGHOUT THE COUNTRY.

name: CROSSOVER BRIGHTON
activities: The objects are the relief of poverty, hardship and distress among the homeless, the street community and the poor within or around the city of Brighton and Hove by the provision of shelter, food, clothing, support and advice, or by such other charitable means as the trustees shall from time to time determine.
objects: THE RELIEF OF POVERTY,HARDSHIP AND DISTRESS AMONG THE HOMELESS,THE STREET COMMUNITY AND THE POOR WITHIN OR AROUND THE CITY OF BRIGHTON AND HOVE BY THE PROVISION OF SHELTER,FOOD,CLOTHING,SUPPORT AND ADVICE OR BY SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE MEANS AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL FROM TIME TO TIME DETERMINE

name: HEREAFTER FOUNDATION
activities: In accordance with the charity's aims and in line with its acts of sadaqah (charity), the organisation provides financial and moral support for families who may have difficulties in bearing the costs of janazah (burial) of their dead family members according to Islamic teachings.Alleviate the extra financial burdens and distress that such families may experience at such difficult times.
objects: TO RELIEVE FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OF THOSE IN NEED FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT BY ASSISTING WITH COSTS OF BURIAL ASSOCIATED TO THE TRADITIONS OF THE ISLAMIC FAITH.

name: BUXTON MOUNTAIN RESCUE TEAM
activities: Provision of a volunteer based search and rescue service in the UK, working alongside the police and other emergency services.
objects: TO PROVIDE A VOLUNTEER-BASED SEARCH AND RECUE SERVICE IN THE UK, WORKING WITH THE POLICE AND OTHER EMERGENCY SERVICES.

name: KEREN CHOCHMAS SHLOMA TRUST
activities: Grantmaking in accordance with the charity's objects.
objects: THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE ORTHODOX JEWISH FAITH

name: BOLTON STUDENTS' UNION
activities: Our primary objective is to make positive change for students. We do this by representing their views, needs and concerns to the University of Bolton, the National Union of Students, and Government. We offer advice on a variety of matters as well as giving students the opportunity for development through our sports clubs, societies, and volunteer positions.
objects: THE UNIONS OBJECTS ARE THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION OF STUDENTS AT THE UNIVERSITY OF BOLTON FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT BY:  4.1 PROMOTING THE INTERESTS AND WELFARE OF STUDENTS AT THE UNIVERSITY OF BOLTON DURING THEIR COURSE OF STUDY AND REPRESENTING, SUPPORTING AND ADVISING STUDENTS;  4.2 BEING THE RECOGNISED REPRESENTATIVE CHANNEL BETWEEN STUDENTS AND THE UNIVERSITY OF BOLTON AND ANY OTHER EXTERNAL BODIES; AND  4.3 PROVIDING SOCIAL, CULTURAL, SPORTING AND RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES AND FORUMS FOR DISCUSSIONS AND DEBATE FOR THE PERSONAL DEVELOPMENT OF ITS STUDENTS.

name: ARADIN CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: Advance education in rare, minority and little used languages particularly but not exclusively:  by the provision of: grants and bursaries to students who want to study the language  promotion of exchange between students from different countries   support and establish relevant educational establishments and museums   encourage inclusive education to help women and disabled people
objects: TO ADVANCE EDUCATION IN RARE, MINORITY AND LITTLE USED LANGUAGES, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY,  ú BY THE PROVISION OF: GRANTS AND BURSARIES TO STUDENTS WHO WANT TO STUDY THE LANGUAGE;  ú THE PROMOTION OF EXCHANGES BETWEEN STUDENTS BETWEEN STUDENTS FROM DIFFERENT COUNTRIES AND  ú TO SUPPORT AND ESTABLISH RELEVANT EDUCATIONAL ESTABLISHMENTS AND MUSEUMS

name: STAY SAFE EAST
activities: Stay Safe East is a user-led organisation providing advocacy and support to Deaf and disabled victims or survivors of hate crime and harassmemt, domestic and sexual violence, carer abuse and other human rights abuses mainly in East London. We work for change across London and nationally to ensure that disabled people get equal access to justice. We provide training and consultancy.
objects: (1)	TO RELIEVE THE DISTRESS AND SUFFERING CAUSED TO DEAF AND DISABLED PEOPLE BY HATE CRIME, HARASSMENT, DOMESTIC OR SEXUAL VIOLENCE OR OTHER FORMS OF ABUSE    (2)	TO PROMOTE THE HUMAN RIGHTS OF DEAF AND DISABLED PEOPLE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE UNITED NATIONS CONVENTION ON THE RIGHTS OF PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES    (3)	SUCH PURPOSES AS ARE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE LAW OF ENGLAND AND WALES AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME DECIDE

name: Cromer Youth & Skate Park Charity
activities: Cromer has a skate board park and it is well used. The role of the charity is to manage this skate board park and provide other facilitues for the youth and children of Cromer and its guests
objects: TO PROMOTE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF CROMER AND THE SURROUNDING AREA THE PROVISION OF A MULTI-PURPOSE, SAFE, SKATE PARK ALLOWING FOR BMX, SKATEBOARDING, CYCLING. ROLLER-SKATING / BLADING AND SCOOTERING FACILITIES FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION OF INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, AGE, INFIRMITY OR DISABLEMENT, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES OR FOR THE PUBLIC AT LARGE IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE AND WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITION OF LIFE OF THE SAID INHABITANTS.

name: JESUS GENERATION MINISTRIES UK
activities: TO ADVANCE AND PROMOTE CHRISTIAN FAITH PROVIDING CARE AND SUPPORT TO COMMUNITIES OFFERING FREE TRAINING  PROVIDING AS PART OF OUR CORE WORK FREE MEALS TO LOCAL COMMUNITIES AND VARIOUS GROUPS PROVIDING MENTORSHIP AND TRAINING ADVOCATING THE MESSAGE OF LOVE FOR ALL
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE ORGANISATION'S ARE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC:  TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH [IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATEMENT OF BELIEFS] IN SUCH WAYS AND IN SUCH PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES FROM TIME TO TIME MAY THINK FIT;

name: WIRRAL MENCAP
activities: -Information, support and signposting for individuals and families -Weekly social club and annual holiday for adults with a learning disability - The Gateway Award (an accessible partner of the Duke of Edinburgh Award)  - Supported volunteering project - Befriending - Minibus scheme - Information and social events
objects: 1. THE RELIEF OF PEOPLE WITH A LEARNING DISABILITY IN PARTICULAR BY THE PROVISION OF HELP AND SUPPORT FOR THEM AND FOR THEIR FAMILIES, DEPENDENTS AND CARERS,  2. TO PROVIDE OR ASSIST IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION FOR PEOPLE WHO HAVE NEED THEREOF BY REASON OF LEARNING DISABILITY WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE.  "LEARNING DISABILITY" MEANS ANY DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITY OF THE MIND AND ANY ASSOCIATED CONDITION HOWSOEVER CAUSED ANDWHETHER MILD, MODERATE OR SEVERE

name: HELP IN NEED TODAY
activities: relief of poverty worldwide and educational support
objects: THE PREVENTION OR RELIEF OF POVERTY OR FINANCIAL HARDSHIP ANYWHERE IN THE WORLD BY PROVIDING OR ASSISTING IN THE PROVISION OF EDUCATION,TRAINING,HEALTHCARE PROJECTS AND ALL THE NECESSARY SUPPORT DESIGNED TO ENABLE INDIVIDUALS TO GENERATE A SUSTAINABLEINCOME AND BE SELF-SUFFICIENT AS WELL AS HELPING NEEDY PEOPLE SURVIVE IN EXTREME POVERTY.

name: SUSTAINABLE TRAVEL COLLECTIVE LTD
activities: Sustainable Travel Collective delivers sustainable travel related partnership, marketing, promotional and cycle related services. It influences change and deliver travel related products and services to a wide range of local communities. Communities benefit economically and socially from reduced cost, reduced congestion, increased accessibly and health and well being
objects: TO PROMOTE CONSERVATION AND PROTECTION OF THE ENVIRONMENT IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY PROMOTING THE USE OF METHODS OF TRANSPORT WHICH WILL HAVE THE LEAST IMPACT ON THE ENVIRONMENT

name: SLOUGH MITRA MANDAL
activities: Organizing festivals (Ganeshostav, Diwali, New Year etc), sports events (Badminton, Carrom etc) and other cultural and non-cultural activities
objects: 1) TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC, PARTICULARLY YOUNG PEOPLE IN ALL ASPECTS OF THE HISTORY, TRADITION, CULTURE AND LANGUAGE OF MAHARASHTRA (A WESTERN STATE OF INDIA) AND INDIA IN GENERAL  2) TO PROMOTE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF SLOUGH AND THE SURROUNDING AREA THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION OF INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, AGE, INFIRMITY OR DISABLEMENT, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR SOCIAL AND ECONOMICCIRCUMSTANCES OR FOR THE PUBLIC AT LARGE IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE AND WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE

name: AFM INTERNATIONAL MIN NOTTINGHAM
activities: Advancing the Christian religion in accordance with the Holy scriptures as contained in the confession of faith. Provide marriage counselling, family support and youth training in human and social development. Relief of poverty and contribution in times of national and international disasters in accordance with our doctrine
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE TRUST ARE THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE CHRISTIAN RELIGION

name: BARNSLEY FOOD BANK PARTNERSHIP
activities: The food bank partnership operates across Barnsley . In year one 7 spokes were established opening 8 sessions a week . We have recruited and trained 56 referral agencies . We have collected 35,437kg of food and distributed 31,205kg of food . this is equivalent to approximately ?52,424 . We received 2,364 referrals and fed 4,344 people.
objects: TO RELIEVE PERSONS IN BARNSLEY, UNITED KINGDOM AND ELSEWHERE IN THE WORLD WHO ARE IN CONDITIONS OF NEED, HARDSHIP OR DISTRESS (BENEFICIARIES) IN SUCH A WAY AS THE TRUSTEES FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT.

name: THE UK MASTOCYTOSIS SUPPORT GROUP
activities: Online support for sufferers of Systemic Mastocytosis and Mast Cell Disease and the development of research opportunities for possible treatments and cures.
objects: 'THE RELIEF OF SICKNESS AND PRESERVATION OF HEALTH AMONG PEOPLE SUFFERING FROM SYSTEMIC MASTOCYTOSIS AND OTHER MAST CELL RELATED DISEASES OR CONDITIONS AND THEIR CARERS, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY:  - PROVIDING EMOTIONAL SUPPORT, IN PARTICULAR, BY MAINTAINING AN INTERNET BASED MAILING LIST.  - INCREASING AWARENESS OF MAST CELL RELATED DISEASES AND CONDITIONS AMONG HEALTH CARE PROFESSIONALS.  - DISSEMINATING INFORMATION ON CURRENT TREATMENT OPTIONS, THE SAFE USE OF MEDICATIONS AND THE DANGERS OF INAPPROPRIATE MEDICATIONS.  - ORGANISING REGULAR GROUP MEETINGS AT WHICH HEALTH CARE PROFESSIONALS AND ACADEMICIANS ARE INVITED TO ADDRESS THE GROUP.

name: RINGLESTONE COMMUNITY CENTRE DEVELOPMENT GROUP
activities: Our charity has been formed to build and develop a Community Centre both for worship and to serve the people of Ringlestone, Maidstone through various outlets such as health and recreation services.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CIO ARE:  (1) TO BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS OF RINGLESTONE, SPRINGFIELD AND THE SURROUNDING NEIGHBOURHOOD, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY, CHILDREN, YOUNG PEOPLE, FAMILIES, VULNERABLE ADULTS AND THE ELDERLY BY ASSOCIATING TOGETHER THESAID RESIDENTS AND THE LOCAL AUTHORITIES, ST. FAITH'S CHURCH, VOLUNTARY AND OTHER ORGANISATIONS IN A COMMON EFFORT TO ADVANCE EDUCATION, AND TO PROVIDE FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE AND FOR RECREATION AND LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION WITHTHE OBJECTIVE OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR THE RESIDENTS, FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC.  (2) TO ESTABLISH OR SECURE THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A COMMUNITY CENTRE AND TO MAINTAIN OR CO-OPERATE WITH ANY STATUTUTORY AUTHORITY IN THE MAINTENANCE ANDMANAGEMENT OF SUCH A CENTRE FOR ACTIVITIES PROMOTED BY THE CHARITY IN FURTHERANCE OF THE ABOVE OBJECTS.  (3)TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN RELIGION FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC.  (4)ANY OTHER OBJECT THAT IS EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE UNDER THE LAWS OF ENGLANDAND WALES.

name: FREE LEGAL ADVICE GROUP FOR DOMESTIC VIOLENCE (FLAG DV)
activities: TO RELIEVE THE NEEDS OF PEOPLE WHO ARE VICTIMS OF DOMESTIC VIOLENCE OR DOMESTIC ABUSE WHO ARE UNABLE TO AFFORD LEGAL ADVICE OR REPRESENTATION OR WHERE PUBLIC FUNDING IS NOT AVAILABLE BY THE PROVISION OF FREE LEGAL ADVICE OR REPRESENTATION SERVICES
objects: TO RELIEVE THE NEEDS OF PEOPLE WHO ARE VICTIMS OF DOMESTIC VIOLENCE OR DOMESTIC ABUSE WHO ARE UNABLE TO AFFORD LEGAL ADVICE OR REPRESENTATION OR WHERE PUBLIC FUNDING IS NOT AVAILABLE BY THE PROVISION OF FREE LEGAL ADVICE OR REPRESENTATION SERVICES.

name: TENDER NURSING CARE
activities: Within our area of benefit which is the Boroughs of Chorley and South Ribble and the City of Preston and surrounding areas to provide night nursing, at home, for those who are seriously ill, who without help, may have to be admitted to hospital or hospice. To give relief at night for those caring for the sick To provide the service free.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CHARITY ARE SPECIFICALLY RESTRICTED TO THE RELIEF OF SICKNESS AND POOR HEALTH AMONGST PEOPLE LIVING IN THE BOROUGHS OF CHORLEY AND SOUTH RIBBLE AND THE CITY OF PRESTON AND SURROUNDING AREAS WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF SEX, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, RACE OR OF POLITICAL, RELIGIOUS OR OTHER OPINIONS BY (BUT WITHOUT PREJUDICE TO THE GENERALITY OF THE FOREGOING) THE PROVISION OF NURSING CARE DURING THE NIGHT TO PERSONS WHO ARE SEVERELY SICK AND THE PROVISION OF SERVICES TO RELIEVE THOSE WHO ARE CARING FOR OR NURSING FOR SUCH PERSONS.

name: WINDSOR CHRISTIAN ACTION
activities: 1.	 the provision of practical and emotional support to homeless adults and those at risk of homelessness in Windsor; 2.	 the provision of counselling and support in Windsor, particularly but not exclusively by means of caring, listening and helping people on the streets and at various venues day and night.
objects: 1 . THE RELIEF OF ILL HEALTH, DISABILITY AND FINANCIAL HARDSHIP BY THE PROVISION OF PRACTICAL AND EMOTIONAL  SUPPORT TO HOMELESS ADULTS AND THOSE AT RISK OF HOMELESSNESS IN WINDSOR;  2. THE RELIEF OF SICKNESS AND FINANCIAL HARDSHIP AND THE PROMOTION AND PRESERVATION OF GOOD HEALTH BY THE  PROVISION OF FUNDS GOODS OR SERVICES OF ANY KIND INCLUDING THROUGH THE PROVISION OF COUNSELLING AND  SUPPORT IN WINDSOR, PARTICULARLY BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY MEANS OF CARING, LISTENING AND HELPING PEOPLE ON  THE STREETS AND AT VARIOUS VENUES DAY AND NIGHT.

name: WINDSOR CHRISTIAN ACTION
activities: 1.	 the provision of practical and emotional support to homeless adults and those at risk of homelessness in Windsor; 2.	 the provision of counselling and support in Windsor, particularly but not exclusively by means of caring, listening and helping people on the streets and at various venues day and night.
objects: 1 . THE RELIEF OF ILL HEALTH, DISABILITY AND FINANCIAL HARDSHIP BY THE PROVISION OF PRACTICAL AND EMOTIONAL  SUPPORT TO HOMELESS ADULTS AND THOSE AT RISK OF HOMELESSNESS IN WINDSOR;  2. THE RELIEF OF SICKNESS AND FINANCIAL HARDSHIP AND THE PROMOTION AND PRESERVATION OF GOOD HEALTH BY THE  PROVISION OF FUNDS GOODS OR SERVICES OF ANY KIND INCLUDING THROUGH THE PROVISION OF COUNSELLING AND  SUPPORT IN WINDSOR, PARTICULARLY BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY MEANS OF CARING, LISTENING AND HELPING PEOPLE ON  THE STREETS AND AT VARIOUS VENUES DAY AND NIGHT.

name: GREENWICH PARKS FORUM
activities: We act as an umbrella group co-ordinating the activities of the various Friends of Parks groups in the Royal Borough of Greenwich. Since 2009 we have provided an annual programme of events under the title PARKSfest. We also provide grants to our members to improve the facilities in their parks.
objects: TO PROVIDE OR ASSIST IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR RECREATION AND OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE OF THE PUBLIC BY THE IMPROVEMENT OF PARKS AND GREEN OPEN SPACESIN THE ROYAL BOROUGH OF GREENWICH.  IN FURTHERANCE OF THIS THE CHARITY WILL PROVIDE AN UMBRELLA GROUP FOR OTHER INTERESTED ORGANISATIONS WHO ARE FURTHERING THE ABOVE OBJECTS.

name: IRSHAD WELFARE TRUST
activities: Place of worship
objects: THE CHARITY'S OBJECTS ("OBJECTS") ARE SPECIFICALLY RESTRICTED TO THE FOLLOWING FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT:-  1. TO RELIEVE FINANCIAL HARDSHIP;  2. TO ADVANCE EDUCATION;  3. TO RELIEVE SICKNESS AND TO PROMOTE AND PROTECT GOOD HEALTH; AND  4. THE RELIEF OF FINANCIAL NEED AND SUFFERING AMONG VICTIMS OF NATURAL OR OTHER KINDS OF DISASTER FOR PERSONS, BODIES, ORGANISATIONS AND / OR COUNTRIES AFFECTED BY SUCH MEANS AS THE TRUSTEES DEEM APPROPRIATE.

name: WHITLEY AMATEUR BOXING & FITNESS CLUB
activities: We run boxing training/fitness sessions for young people in the area.
objects: THE PROMOTION OF COMMUNITY PARTICIPATION IN HEALTHY RECREATION FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF WHITLEY, READING AND THE SURROUNDING AREA, IN PARTICULAR BY THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR AMATEUR BOXING.

name: THE COVERDALE FOUNDATION
activities: We support a limited number of beneficiaries through long-term relationships.  We regret that we are unable to consider or acknowledge new requests for funding.
objects: TO RELIEVE POVERTY AND TO PRESERVE AND PROTECT GOOD HEALTH ANYWHERE IN THE WORLD FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY OF THOSE WHO ARE HOMELESS OR AT RISK OF BEING MADE HOMELESS THROUGH THE PROVISION OF ACCOMMODATION AND SUPPORT TO THEM.

name: LAUGHTER AFRICA
activities: 1.Dealing with the immediate needs of the street children.Whatever they need,we are willing to provide.  2.The Interim Care Centre is where the street children live while we find their families. At the centre, food, clothing, health care, and other essentials are provided. 3.Reuniting street children with their families.Once they return home,we pay for school fees or vocational training.
objects: THE OBJECT OF THE CIO IS THE RELIEF OF POVERTY, PARTICULARLY BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY THE PROVISION OF HOUSING, AND THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION FOR STREET CHILDREN AND OTHER CHILDREN OR YOUNG PEOPLE AT RISK IN AFRICA.  WE AIM TO DO THIS IN 3 MAIN WAYS:1) BY ESTABLISHING A HOME/DROP IN CENTRE WHICH IS A SAFE SPACE FOR CHILDREN OR YOUNG PEOPLE LIVING ON THE STREETS WHO ARE NOT ABLE TO BE PLACED BACK WITH THEIR FAMILIES FULL TIME BUT DO NOT WANT TO LIVE ON THE STREETS ANY LONGER. AT THE HOME, FOOD,CLOTHING, HEALTH CARE, EDUCATION, TRAINING, COUNSELLING, SUPPORT AND OTHER ESSENTIALS WILL BE PROVIDED.  2) BY STARTING THE REUNIFICATION PROCESS OF STREET CHILDREN WHO WANT TO BE REUNITED WITH THEIR FAMILIES (THIS IS DEPENDENT ON IF THE FAMILY SITUATION IS SAFE AND SECURE).  3) BY ESTABLISHING STREET CLINICS FOR THOSE STREET CHILDREN WHO CHOOSE TO STAY ON THE STREET. STREET CLINICS WILL INVOLVE THE PROVISION OF FOOD, EDUCATION, ASSISTANCE, COUNSELLING AND OTHER SUPPORT.

name: LA SERENISSIMA LIMITED
activities: LA SERENISSIMA AIMS TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN THE ART AND SCIENCE OF MUSIC, AND IN PARTICULAR OF HISTORICALLY AWARE MUSICAL PERFORMANCE, BY THE PRESENTATION OF CONCERTS, RECITALS AND LECTURES, PUBLICATION OF MATERIALS AND OTHER ACTIVITIES. IN PARTICULAR THE REPERTOIRE PROMOTED BY THE ENSEMBLE WILL FOCUS ON THE MUSIC OF ANTONIO VIVALDI AND HIS ITALIAN CONTEMPORARIES.
objects: THE CHARITY'S OBJECTS ARE SPECIFICALLY RESTRICTED TO THE FOLLOWING: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN THE ART AND SCIENCE OF MUSIC, AND IN PARTICULAR OF HISTORICALLY AWARE MUSICAL PERFORMANCE, BY THE PRESENTATION OF CONCERTS, RECITALS AND LECTURES, PUBLICATION OF MATERIALS AND OTHER ACTIVITIES. IN PARTICULAR THE REPERTOIRE PROMOTED BY THE ENSEMBLE WILL FOCUS ON THE MUSIC OF ANTONIO VIVALDI AND HIS ITALIAN CONTEMPORARIES WHICH HAD SUCH A PROFOUND EFFECT ON THE GENRES OF CONCERTO AND OPERA.

name: THE MISSIONARY SISTERS FOR POLISH MIGRANTS
activities: Care for the elderly in care homes, work in schools, help in English and Polish parishes giving support to the parish priests and the communities. We work with children, teenagers and anyone who requires our help and support. We also give spiritual and practical support to the migrant families who have just arrived in the United Kingdom and require help adapting to life in Great Britain.
objects: 1.THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE ROMAN CATHOLIC RELIGION FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC THROUGH THE HOLDING OF PRAYER MEETINGS,PUBLIC CELEBRATION OF RELIGIOUS FESTIVALS,PRODUCING AND/OR DISTRIBUTING LITERATURE TO ENLIGHTEN OTHERS ABOUT THE ROMAN CATHOLIC RELIGION.2.THE RELIEF OF POVERTY AND SICKNESS BY SUCH MEANS AS THE TRUSTEES MAY DETERMINE.3.THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION IN POLISH CULTURE AND TRADITIONS

name: SOUTH HANWELL BAPTIST CHURCH
activities: SHBC continues to provide a place of public worship for the service of Almighty God. Throughout  the year SHBC has sought to discern the needs of the community. The children's & youth clubs are for new born to young adults.There are men's & ladies events, all these are open to the whole community. With other churches we opened our doors to the homeless & provided food, bed & warmth after December.
objects: THE PRINCIPAL PURPOSE OF THE CHURCH IS THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE CHRISTIAN FAITH ACCORDING TO THE PRINCIPLES OF THE BAPTIST DENOMINATION. THE CHURCH MAY ALSO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND CARRY OUT OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES IN THE UNITED KINGDOM AND/OR OTHER PARTS OF THE WORLD.

name: BLYTH DEVELOPMENT TRUST
activities: The promotion for the benefit of the public or urban or rural regeneration in areas of social and economic deprivation (and in particular in Blyth, Northumberland)
objects: THE PROMOTION FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC OF URBAN OR RURAL REGENERATION IN AREAS OF SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC DEPRIVATION (AND IN PARTICULAR IN BLYTHE, NORTHUMBERLAND, IN PARTICULAR, BY ALL OR ANY OF THE FOLLOWING MEANS:  (A) THE RELIEF OF FINANCIAL HARDSHIP:  (B) THE RELIEF OF UNEMPLOYMENT:  (C) THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION, TRAINING OR RETRAINING, PARTICULARLY AMONG UNEMPLOYED PEOPLE, AND PROVIDING UNEMPLOYED PEOPLE WITH WORK EXPERIENCE:  (D) THE CREATION OF TRAINING AND EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES BYTHE PROVISION OF WORKSPACE, BUILDINGS, AND/OR LAND FOR USE ON FAVOURABLE TERMS:   (E) THE MAINTENANCE, IMPROVEMENT OR PROVISION OF PUBLIC AMENITIES:  (F) THE PRESERVATION OF BUILDINGS OR SITES OF HISTORIC OR ARCHITECTURAL IMPORTANCE:  (G) THE PROVISION OF RECREATIONAL FACILITIES FOR THE PUBLIC AT LARGE OR THOSE WHO BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, AGE, INFIRMITY OR DISABLEMENT, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES, HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES:  (H) THE PROTECTION OR CONSERVATION OF THE ENVIRONMENT:   (I) THE PROMOTION OF PUBLIC SAFETY AND PREVENTION OF CRIME:  (J) SUCH OTHER MEANS AS MAY FROM TIME TO TIME BE DETERMINED SUBJECT TO THE PRIOR WRITTEN CONSENT OF THE CHARITY COMMISSION FOR ENGLAND AND WALES.

name: DEPAUL HOUSING SERVICES
activities: The company was formed in 2013 and became a registered social landlord in 2014. The company owns and manages accommodation services for the benefit of homeless young people within the Tyneside area. In 2014, a Social Housing Grant was awarded from the Homes and Communities Agency under the Homelessness change programme to refurbish DePaul House. Bed spaces increased to 14.
objects: THE CHARITABLE OBJECTS ARE SPECIFICALLY RESTRICTED TO THE FOLLOWING FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT  1. TO PROMOTE AND ADVANCE THE RELIEF OF POVERTY BY SUCH MEANS AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION DETERMINE, AND IN PARTICULAR (WITHOUT LIMITATION) BY THE PROVISION OF SOCIAL HOUSING IN ENGLAND, ANY OTHER PURPOSES CONNECTED WITH OR INCIDENTAL TO THE PROVISION AND MANAGEMENT OF SOCIAL HOUSING, SHELTER, ACCOMMODATION, TRAINING AND OTHER SERVICES TO PERSONS WHOM THE TRUSTEES SHALL DEEM TO BE INNEED OF SUCH PROVISION BY REASON OF HOMELESSNESS, DEPRIVATION OR SOCIAL OR ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES (?ELIGIBLE PERSONS?),  2. THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION INCLUDING (WITHOUT LIMITATION) THE PROVISION OF EDUCATION AND TRAINING TO ELIGIBLE PERSONS,  3. TOPROVIDE FACILITIES FOR LEISURE-TIME ACTIVITIES FOR ELIGIBLE PERSONS IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE SO THAT THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE MAY BE IMPROVED, AND  4. TO PROMOTE THE EFFICIENCY AND FURTHER THE CHARITABLE OBJECTS OF DEPAUL UK.  'DEPAUL UK'MEANS DEPAUL UK, A COMPANY LIMITED BY GUARANTEE REGISTERED IN ENGLAND AND WALES UNDER COMPANY NUMBER 2440093 AND REGISTERED CHARITY NUMBER 802384.

name: EUNETHYDIS INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCES
activities: 1.TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONALS AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC IN ALL MATTERS RELATING TO ATTENTION DEFICIT HYPERACTIVITY DISORDER AND ASSOCIATED DISORDERS  2. TO IMPROVE THE TREATMENT AND CARE OF PERSONS SUFFERING FROM ATTENTION DEFICIT HYPERACTIVITY DISORDER AND ASSOCIATED DISORDERS  3. TO PROMOTE FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT RESEARCH INTO ATTENTION DEFICIT HYPERACTIVITY DISORDER AND ASSOCIATED DISORDERS AND TREATMENTS FOR SUCH DISORDERS AND TO DISSEMINATE THE USEFUL RESULTS OF THAT RESEARCH.
objects: 1.TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONALS AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC IN ALL MATTERS RELATING TO ATTENTION DEFICIT HYPERACTIVITY DISORDER AND ASSOCIATED DISORDERS  2. TO IMPROVE THE TREATMENT AND CARE OF PERSONS SUFFERING FROM ATTENTION DEFICIT HYPERACTIVITY DISORDER AND ASSOCIATED DISORDERS  3. TO PROMOTE FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT RESEARCH INTO ATTENTION DEFICIT HYPERACTIVITY DISORDER AND ASSOCIATED DISORDERS AND TREATMENTS FOR SUCH DISORDERS AND TO DISSEMINATE THE USEFUL RESULTS OF THAT RESEARCH.

name: GARDENERS' ROYAL BENEVOLENT SOCIETY
activities: Provision of  casework and debt advice services and financial support  to people employed in or retired from the horticultural industry who find themselves in difficulties arising from financial difficulties, ill health, disability, and /or old age.  Support for education and training in horticulture. Preservation and maintenance of small gardens open to the general public.
objects: 1.1	THE OBJECTS OF THE CHARITY (THE "OBJECTS") SHALL BE:-  1.1.1	THE RELIEF AND ASSISTANCE BY SUCH MEANS AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL DETERMINE TO BE APPROPRIATE IN EACH CASE OF GARDENERS OR PERSONS WHO ARE OR WHO HAVE BEEN IN LIKE EMPLOYMENT OR OCCUPATION OF THOSE CLOSELY INVOLVED IN GARDENING OR RELATED ACTIVITIES OR THOSE TRAINING TO BE GARDENERS OR PERSONS OF LIKE OCCUPATION AND THEIR SPOUSES OR WIDOWS/WIDOWERS OR UNMARRIED PARTNERS AND/OR IMMEDIATE DEPENDANTS (THE "BENEFICIARIES") IN NECESSITOUS CIRCUMSTANCES OR IN CIRCUMSTANCES OF POVERTY, ILLNESS, DISABILITY (WHETHER MENTAL OR PHYSICAL) OR OLD AGE; AND /OR  1.1.2	THE ADVANCEMENT FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT OF EDUCATION AND TRAINING IN OR RELATING TO HORTICULTURE OR GARDENING; AND/OR  1.1.3	THE PROVISION, MAINTENANCE OR ASSISTANCE IN THE PROVISION AND MAINTENANCE OF GARDENS AND OPEN SPACE FOR TRAINING, REHABILITATION AND OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES FOR PUBLIC BENEFIT AND IN PARTICULAR THE PRESERVATION AND MAINTENANCE OF GARDENS OF HISTORIC AND/ORAESTHETIC IMPORTANCE TO BE ENJOYED BY AND MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC AT LARGE; AND/OR  1.1.4	TO FURTHER SUCH OTHER EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE PURPOSES ACCORDING TO THE LAW OF ENGLAND AND WALES AS THE TRUSTEES IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION FROM TIME TO TIME DETERMINE.

name: BURNTWOOD & DISTRICT COMMUNITY FIRST RESPONDERS
activities: Burntwood and District Community First Responders is a voluntary organisation that responds to 999 calls on behalf of West Midlands Ambulance Service. We currently respond in two vehicles, one covering the Burntwood area and the other Cannock Chase.  We are a team of 9 operational responders who also assist with fundraising for the group and 5 fundraisers.
objects: TO RELIEVE PERSONS SUFFERING INJURY OR ILLNESS IN THE AREAS OF NORTON CANES, BURNTWOOD AND BROWNHILLS OR SURROUNDING AREAS IN STAFFORDSHIRE BY THE PROVISION OF EMERGENCY MEDICAL CARE.

name: AGAPE LINK (SOLOMON ISLANDS-UK)
activities: The charity is involved in raising money to improve the health and social welfare of people accessing the Helena Goldie Hospital in the Solomon Islands. This is achieved through sale of cards and monthly donations
objects: SUPPORTING CHRISTIAN HEALTH CARE PROJECTS IN THE SOLOMON ISLANDS BY RELIEVING SICKNESS AND PRESERVING HEALTH (PHYSICAL MENTAL AND SPIRITUAL) OF THE PEOPLE OF THE SOLOMON ISLANDS BY ASSISTING WITH THE PROVISION OF EQUIPMENT, FACILITIES AND SERVICES TO FURTHER THE ABOVE SUPPORT AND RELIEF.

name: THE VTCT FOUNDATION
activities: Grant making in fields of vocational education, especially Hair and Beauty sectors, and research into and relief of disfigurement.
objects: THE CHARITY'S OBJECTS ('OBJECTS') ARE SPECIFICALLY RESTRICTED TO THE FOLLOWING:  THE COMPANY'S OBJECTS ARE FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT  (1) THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION, RESEARCH AND THE PUBLIC DISSEMINATION OF KNOWLEDGE IN:  A) THE ART AND TECHNOLOGY OF HEALTH AND BEAUTY THERAPY;  B) THE SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE REQUIRED FOR OTHER VOCATIONAL EMPLOYMENTS INCLUDING THOSE IN THE WELL-BEING, PUBLIC AND SERVICE INDUSTRIES;  C) THE IMPACT AND TREATMENT OF PHYSICAL DISFIGUREMENT AND ALL KINDRED ARTS AND SCIENCES,  (2) THE RELIEF OF SICKNESS OR POOR HEALTH CAUSED BY PHYSICAL DISFIGUREMENT AND THE ASSISTANCE OF THOSE WITH PHYSICAL DISFIGUREMENTS, AND THEIR FAMILIES AND CARERS, TO OVERCOME ANY SOCIAL, PHYSICAL, PSYCHOLOGICAL, EMOTIONAL OR OTHER DISADVANTAGE.

name: WENTWORTH WOODHOUSE PRESERVATION TRUST
activities: THE WENTWORTH WOODHOUSE PRESERVATION TRUST IS A CHARITABLE COMPANY LIMITED BY GUARANTEE AND HAS BEEN ESTABLISHED TO SECURE A LONG TERM FUTURE FOR WENTWORTH WOODHOUSE.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CHARITY ARE SPECIFICALLY RESTRICTED TO THE FOLLOWING:  TO ACQUIRE AND PRESERVE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE NATION, THE WHOLE OR ANY PART OR PARTS OF THE BUILDINGS, GROUNDS AND SURROUNDING LAND KNOWN AS WENTWORTH WOODHOUSE IN THE METROPOLITAN BOROUGH OF ROTHERHAM AND WHICH ARE OF SPECIAL HISTORICAL, ARCHITECTURAL AND CONSTRUCTIONAL HERITAGE AND INTEREST ("THE BUILDING") TOGETHER WITH SUCH FIXTURES, FITTINGS, FURNITURE, PICTURES AND OTHER CHATTELS ("THE CONTENTS") AS ARE CONTAINED WITHIN OR FORM PART OF THE BUILDING AND WHICH ARE IN THEIR OWN RIGHT OR BY ASSOCIATION WITH THE BUILDING OBJECTS OF PARTICULAR HISTORICAL, ARCHITECTURAL OR ARTISTIC INTEREST.

name: THE FELIX DEXTER FOUNDATION
activities: No activities have been undertaken as yet.
objects: (1) TO ADVANCE EDUCATION FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT OF PEOPLE UNDER THE AGE OF 18 LIVING IN ST KITTS AND THE WEST INDIES IN SUCH WAYS AS THE CHARITY TRUSTEES THINK FIT, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY AWARDING TO SUCH PERSONS SCHOLARSHIPS, MAINTENANCE ALLOWANCES OR GRANTS TENABLE AT ANY UNIVERSITY COLLEGE OR INSTITUTION OF HIGHER OR FURTHER EDUCATION.  (2) TO PROMOTE AND PROTECT THE PHYSICAL AND MENTAL HEALTH OF SUFFERERS OF CANCER AND SICKLE CELL DISEASE THROUGH THE PROVISION OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE, SUPPORT AND EDUCATION IN SUCH WAYS AS THE CHARITY TRUSTEES THINK FIT.  (3) SUCH CHARITABLE PURPOSES FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT AS ARE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE ACCORDING TO THE LAWS OF ENGLAND AND WALES AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME DETERMINE.

name: MOVEMENT FOR ALL
activities: Our group provides weekly fun dance and exercise sessions for people 60+ in and around the Brinsley and Eastwood areas of Nottinghamshire. A mini bus is available for those with mobility or transport issues. Refreshments are provided at the end of the session and are an opportunity for social interaction. The group works within an area targeted for health improvement.
objects: TO PROMOTE AND PRESERVE GOOD PHYSICAL AND MENTAL HEALTH BY THE PROVISION OF, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY A WEEKLY DANCE AND EXERCISE CLASS FOR PEOPLE AGED 60+ IN AND AROUND THE BRINSLEY AREA OF NOTTINGHAM.

name: AFRICAN FOUNDATION FOR EDUCATION & DEVELOPMENT
activities: - Capacity building through teacher support, training and retention - Information exchange and support between the UK and African schools - Provision of material to support learning in African schools - Provision of school support to children from poor families - Contributing to the maintenance of school buildings
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN AFRICA IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY:    PROVIDING AND ASSISTING IN THE PROVISION OF RESOURCES AND FACILITIES FOR EDUCATION;    SUPPORTING THOSE IN FINANCIAL NEED TO ACCESS EDUCATION.

name: MUSIC THERAPY LAMBETH
activities: Delivering music therapy to the most needy children and families in nurseries, primary schools and special schools across Lambeth. This work addresses a range of emotional, behavioural, learning and communication needs experienced by Lambeth children, often with a focus on children from Black and Minority Ethnic and newly migrant communities.
objects: TO PROMOTE FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT MUSIC THERAPY FOR THE RELIEF OF PHYSICAL AND MENTAL ILLNESS AND DISABILITY, THE ALLEVIATION OF DEVELOPMENTAL, EMOTIONAL, SOCIAL AND BEHAVIOURAL DIFFICULTIES AND THE PROTECTION AND PROMOTION OF GOOD HEALTH OF CHILDREN AND ADULTS IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY IN THE LONDON BOROUGH OF LAMBETH.

name: CHARLES AND JULIA HENRY FUND
activities: The Henry Fund provides scholarships to students in the British Isles (UK and Eire) and America to study for one academic year at the Universities of Harvard, Yale, Cambridge and Oxford. The Fellowships provide for tuition fees, living costs and travel. They enable 4 British and American graduates to take advantage of particular educational opportunities and are awarded annually, in competition.
objects: A. SCHOLARSHIPS TENABLE AT THE UNIVERSITIES OF HARVARD AND YALE FOR STUDENTS CURRENTLY ENROLLED AT UNIVERSITIES IN THE BRITISH ISLES; AND    B. SCHOLARSHIPS TENABLE AT THE UNIVERSITIES OF OXFORD AND CAMBRIDGE FOR STUDENTS CURRENTLY ENROLLED AT UNIVERSITIES IN THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA    FOR THE PURPOSES OF PARAGRAPH (A), "UNIVERSITIES IN THE BRITISH ISLES" SHALL INCLUDE ALL UNIVERSITIES AND EQUIVALENT HIGHER EDUCATION INSTITUTIONS WITH DEGREE-AWARDING POWERS IN THE UNITED KINGDOM OF GREAT BRITAIN AND NORTHERN IRELAND AND THE REPUBLIC OF IRELAND.

name: BOREHAMWOOD FOODBANK
activities: to give out food to those in need
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CIO ARE:  TO RELIEVE THOSE IN NEED IN BOREHAMWOOD AND THROUGHOUT THE BOROUGH OF HERTSMERE BY:  1) PROVIDING EMERGENCY FOOD PACKS OF DRIED AND TINNED FOODS SUFFICIENT FOR 3 DAYS TO ENSURE A HEALTHY AND BALANCED DIET AND SERVICES AS MY BE OF HELP.  2) TO PROVIDE OTHER SUCH ITEMS AS MAY BE OF HELP SUCH AS TOILETRIES, CHILDREN'S TOYS, AND HOUSEHOLD ITEMS AS THEY ARE AVAILABLE.  3) TO PROVIDE A LISTENING EAR FOR THOSE WHO WOULD LIKE ONE.  4) TO SIGNPOST CLIENTS TO OTHER AGENCIES THATMAY BE ABLE TO HELP THEM FURTHER.

name: COUNTESS MOUNTBATTEN OF BURMA ROMSEY MEMORIAL TRUST
activities: Residential home for the elderly incorporating self-contained flats for independent living.
objects: THE OBJECT OF THE CIO IS, FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT TO RELIEVE ELDERLY PEOPLE WHO ARE IN NEED, IN PARTICULAR BUT WITHOUT LIMITATION BY PROVIDING HOUSING, SERVICES OR FACILITIES CALCULATED TO RELIEVE THE NEEDS OF SUCH PERSONS AT PROPERTIES MAINTAINED BY THE CIO.

name: ARTS DREAM SELSEY
activities: Support for the arts in Selsey.
objects: TO PROMOTE,MAINTAIN,IMPROVE AND ADVANCE EDUCATION AND APPRECIATION OF THE ARTS IN ALL FORMS AMONG THE PEOPLE OF SELSEY AND DISTRICT COMMUNITY

name: WALSWORTH ROAD BAPTIST CHURCH
activities: We are a friendly and all-age Baptist church family in Hitchin, Hertfordshire. We meet twice on Sundays for worship including a children's work called JAM Club. We have numerous other activities including house groups, prayer meetings, a monthly Friday lunch for the elderly, a Friday evening children's group, a toddler group, a breakfast bar for local schoolchildren, etc.
objects: THE PRINCIPAL PURPOSE OF THE CHURCH IS THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE CHRISTIAN FAITH ACCORDING TO THE PRINCIPLES OF THE BAPTIST DENOMINATION.THE CHURCH MAY ALSO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND CARRY OUT OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES IN THE UNITED KINGDOM AND/OR OTHER PARTS OF THE WORLD.

name: SHABATON L'MENUCHA TRUST
activities: We ar geared towards families of children and adults with special needs . We are widely known for our weekend breaks that grant those special individuals, who happen to have special needs a fantastic time whist also giving their families a much needed break. We provide them with  recreational, educational and social opportunities and respite care with a view to improving  their condition of life
objects: THE RELIEF OF PEOPLE WITH DISABILITY BY THE PROVISION OF RECREATIONAL, EDUCATIONAL AND SOCIAL OPPORTUNITIES AND RESPITE CARE WITH A VIEW TO IMPROVING THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE

name: LENNOX YOUTH CLUB
activities: To provide activities and information services for young people of the local commumity
objects: TO FURTHER THE DEVELOPMENT AND EDUCATION OF YOUNG PEOPLE UNDER THE AGE OF 19 YEARS AND AGED 25 IF THE YOUNG PERSON HAS A DISABILITY AND WHO LIVE ON THE LENNOX ESTATE AND SURROUNDING AREA WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF RACE,SEX,RELIGION OR POLITICAL OR OTHER OPINION THROUGH THEIR LEISURE-TIME ACTIVITIES SO AS TO HELP THEM ACHIEVE THEIR PHYSICAL,MENTAL AND SPIRITUAL POTENTIAL SO THAT THEY MAY GROW TO FULL MATURITY AS INDIVIDUALS AND MEMBERS OF SOCIETY AND THAT THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE MAY BE IMPROVED

name: THE SWEDISH CHURCH IN LONDON LTD
activities: Religious, social and cultural work in the British Isles within the motto: "A living diaconal Church - an oasis in London"
objects: TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE DOCTRINE AS SET DOWN IN CHAPTER 1 OF THE CONSTITUTION OF THE CHURCH OF SWEDEN, AND  TO PROMOTE ANY PURPOSE WHICH IS EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE UNDER ENGLISH LAW, PRIMARILYBUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY FOR THE BENEFIT OF MEMBERS OF THE BENEFIT OF THE SWEDES LIVING IN THE BRITISH ISLES AND THOSE CLOSELY ASSOCIATED WITH THEM AND THEIR RELATED INSTITUTIONS

name: MARSHLAND ST JAMES & DISTRICT COMMUNITY & SPORTS CENTRE
activities: Charity was formed to provide a new community and sports centre for Marshland St James and district. Applications have been successful to the Big Lottery reaching communities . The new building was opened for public use by hiring the facilities, attending fund raising events and attending free community events in February 2018
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CIO ARE:  TO PROMOTE THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF THE AREA OF BENEFIT WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF SEX, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, AGE, DISABILITY, NATIONALITY, RACE OR OF POLITICAL, RELIGIOUS OR OTHER OPINIONS BY THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR SPORTS, RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION OF INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, AGE, INFIRMITY OR DISABLEMENT, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES OR FOR THE PUBLIC AT LARGE IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE AND WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE OF THE SAID INHABITANTS, AND  TO ESTABLISH, OR SECURE THE ESTABLISHMENT OF, A COMMUNITY AND SPORTS CENTRE AND TO MAINTAIN AND MANAGE THE SAME (WHETHER ALONE OR IN CO-OPERATION WITH ANY STATUTORY AUTHORITY OR OTHER PERSON OR BODY) IN FURTHERANCE OF THE OBJECTS.  THE CIO SHALL BE NON-PARTY IN POLITICS AND NON-SECTARIAN IN RELIGION. THE AREA OF BENEFIT ("AREA OF BENEFIT") SHALL BE PARISH OF MARSHLAND ST JAMES AND THE SURROUNDING AREA.

name: SPIRITUAL COMPANIONS TRUST
activities: We are an educational charity delivering trainings in Spiritual Companionship. This is a holistic and multifaith approach to pastoral care. We deliver an accredited course badged by the College of Teachers. We also provide trainings in good practice in spirituality for service providers such as hospices and other charities.
objects: TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND TRAINING IN THE PRACTICE OF SPIRITUAL COMPANIONSHIP; IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY, FOR PROFESSIONAL AND VOLUNTARY CARERS WITH THE PURPOSE OF THE RELIEF OF THE SICK AND VULNERABLE.

name: PORRIDGE AND RICE (UJI NA MCHELE)
activities: PaR supports community schools in the slums of Nairobi in Kenya. We support feeding programs in 4 schools currently, and are constantly looking at other schools we might take on when funds permit. In addition, we assist with teacher development, facilities maintenance, and health education in community schools where we have established feeding programs already.
objects: THE OBJECTS (THE 'OBJECTS') FOR WHICH THE CHARITY IS ESTABLISHED ARE:  (A) THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION OF CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE LIVING IN KENYA, AFRICA IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY ESTABLISHING AND ASSISTING WITH THE BUILDING, MANAGEMENTAND RUNNING OF COMMUNITY AND OTHER SIMILAR SCHOOLS.  (B) THE RELIEF OF SICKNESS AND THE PROMOTION OF THE HEALTH OF CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE LIVING IN KENYA, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY ASSISTING IN THE PROVISION OF MEDICAL SERVICES AND TREATMENT, NUTRITION AND NUTRITION SERVICES AND ACCESS TO ADVICE AND ASSISTANCE IN ACCESSING SUCH MEDICAL AND NUTRITIONAL SERVICES.  (C) THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION, RELIEF OF FINANCIAL HARDSHIP, SICKNESS, POVERTY AND DISTRESS AMONG CHILDREN, YOUNG PEOPLE AND ADULTS, IN PARTICULAR KENYA, AFRICA.  (D) THE RELIEF OF FINANCIAL HARDSHIP AMONGST THE PEOPLE AND COMMUNITIES LIVING IN KENYA, AFRICA AND SUCH OTHER LOCATIONS IN KENYA BY THE PROVISION OF TRAINING, ADVICE AND MICRO FINANCE ENABLING THEM TO ESTABLISH AND GROW THEIR OWN BUSINESSES.MICRO FINANCE INCLUDES LOANS AND/OR EQUITY FUNDING FOR SMALL ENTERPRISES AND/OR THEIR PROPRIETORS, AS APPROPRIATE FOR THE INDIVIDUALS AND FIRMS SEEKING ASSISTANCE.

name: Pathfinders Neuromuscular Alliance
activities: Our main activity is to provide advice and information to adults living with Muscular Dystrophy and related neuromuscular conditions via information events, guides and resources, and peer support activity.  We also raise awareness of issues facing adults with neuromuscular conditions and provide advice on health research committees and steering groups
objects: 1.The promotion of social inclusion of people with neuromuscular conditions who are socially excluded from society, or parts of society as a result of having Muscular Dystrophy and related neuromuscular conditions by  1.    Providing a network of groups that encourage and enables them to participate more effectively with the wider community, 2.    Increasing or co-ordinating opportunities for them to engage with organisations and service providers to enable those providers to adapt services to better meet their needs, 3.    Raising public awareness of the issues affecting them in all areas relating to having a neuromuscular condition, 4.    Providing support to those between the age of 18 and 30 who are socially excluded to establish and growa business or enterprise to relieve their needs and assist them to integrate into society.  2. To promote and protect the physical and mental health of people with Muscular Dystrophy and related neuromuscular conditions in the United Kingdom as thetrustees shall determine.

name: CARDIFF YOUNG MEN'S CHRISTIAN ASSOCIATION
activities: To tackle the issues of social young people in the most needed areas of Cardiff.  To continue to evolve and adapt our services to meet the needs of the local community and aim to provide high quality services in specialist areas: Personal & Social Development; Health & Fitness; Drug/Alcohol Awareness & Avoidance and Education & Training.
objects: 3. THE OBJECTS OF THE ASSOCIATION ARISE FROM ITS ACCEPTANCE OF THE PARIS BASIS OF 1855 INCORPORATED INTO THE NATIONAL STATEMENT OF THE AIMS AND PURPOSES OF THE YMCA IN WALES, ADOPTED AS PART OF THESE ARTICLES NAMELY:  "THE YMCA IS A WORLDWIDE CHRISTIAN, ECUMENICAL, VOLUNTARY MOVEMENT FOR PEOPLE WITH SPECIAL EMPHASIS ON THE GENUINE INVOLVEMENT OF YOUNG PEOPLE AND THAT IT SEEKS TO SHARE THE IDEAL OF BUILDING A HUMAN COMMUNITY OF JUSTICE WITH LOVE, PEACE AND RECONCILIATION FOR THE FULLNESS OF LIFE FOR ALL CREATION.    IT WELCOMES INTO ITS FELLOWSHIP PERSONS OF ALL RELIGIOUS FAITHS AND OF NONE.  IN ACCORDANCE WITH ITS CHRISTIAN VALUES THE YMCA STANDS FOR:  A WORLDWIDE FELLOWSHIP BASED ON THE EQUAL VALUE OF ALL PERSONS;  RESPECT AND FREEDOM FOR ALL, TOLERANCE AND UNDERSTANDING BETWEEN PEOPLE OF DIFFERENT OPINIONS;  ACTIVE CONCERN FOR THE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY;  AS THE EXPRESSION OF ITS CHRISTIAN PURPOSES THE YMCA AIMS TO:  PROVIDE A WELCOME TO ITS MEMBERS FOR THEMSELVES IN A MEETING PLACE WHICH IS THEIRS TO SHARE, WHERE FRIENDSHIPS CAN BE MADE AND COUNSEL SOUGHT;  DEVELOP ACTIVITIES WHICH STIMULATE AND CHALLENGE MEMBERS IN AN ENVIRONMENT THAT ENABLES THEM TO TAKE RESPONSIBILITY TO FIND A SENSE OF ACHIEVEMENT;  INVOLVE ALL MEMBERS IN THE CARE AND WORK FOR OTHERS; AND  CREATE OPPORTUNITIES FOR EXCHANGING VIEWS SO THAT MEMBERS CAN IMPROVE THEIR UNDERSTANDING OF THE WORLD, OF THEMSELVES AND OF ONE ANOTHER.  3.2 ACCORDINGLY, THE OBJECTS OF THE ASSOCIATION ARE:  3.2.1 TO PROVIDE OR ASSIST INTHE PROVISION IN THE INTEREST OF SOCIAL WELFARE OF FACILITIES FOR RESIDENTIAL OR RECREATIONAL USE AND OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION FOR MEN AND WOMEN WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THEIR CONDITION OF LIFE.  3.2.2 TO PROVIDE OR ASSIST IN THE PROVISION OF EDUCATION FOR PERSONS OF ALL AGES WITH THE OBJECT OF DEVELOPING THEIR PHYSICAL, MENTAL AND SPIRITUAL CAPACITY.  3.2.3 TO RELIEVE OR ASSIST IN THE RELIEF OF PERSONS OF ALL AGES WHO ARE IN CONDITIONS OF NEED, HARDSHIP OR DISTRESS BY REASON OF THEIR SOCIAL, PHYSICAL OR ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES.

name: ENGAGE WOKING SCHOOLS
activities: Engage Woking Schools promotes the advancement of Christianity in the Woking area, in particular amongst children and young people.
objects: THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE CHRISTIAN RELIGION IN THE BOROUGH OF WOKING AND ITS LOCALITY FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC IN SCHOOLS AND OTHER EDUCATIONAL ESTABLISHMENTS IN THE SAID AREA MAINLY BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY THROUGH CHRISTIAN ASSEMBLIES,SCHOOL CLUBS,RE AND CHRISTIAN UNION SUPPORT AND DETACHED YOUTH WORK

name: COMMUNITY CHURCH KILLINGWORTH
activities: We are a Christian church based in Killingworth, Newcastle Upon Tyne and hold services each Sunday morning in a local school and midweek house groups. Each Wednesday we run a Mother and Toddler group (Footsteps) and we also work to help people out of debt through our partnership with Christians Against Poverty.
objects: 4. THE OBJECTS OF THE CIO ARE, FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT:- 4.1.	TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATEMENT OF BELIEFS IN SUCH WAYS AND IN SUCH PARTS OF KILLINGWORTH, NEWCASTLE, THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE CHARITY TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT AND OTHER SUCH PURPOSES WHICH ARE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE ACCORDING TO THE LAW OF ENGLAND AND WALES AND ARE CONNECTED WITH THE CHARITABLE WORK OF THE CHURCH FELLOWSHIP; 4.2.	TO RELIEVE SICKNESS AND FINANCIAL HARDSHIP ANDPOVERTY AND TO PROMOTE AND PRESERVE GOOD HEALTH BY THE PROVISION OF FUNDS, GOODS OR SERVICES OF ANY KIND, INCLUDING THROUGH THE PROVISION OF COUNSELLING AND SUPPORT IN SUCH PARTS OF THE KILLINGWORTH, NEWCASTLE, THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THECHARITY TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME MAY THINK FIT; AND 4.3.	THE FURTHERANCE OF RELIGIOUS OR SECULAR PUBLIC EDUCATION INCLUDING BUT WITHOUT LIMITATION THE PROVISION OF LIFE SKILLS TO THOSE IN NEED IN KILLINGWORTH, NEWCASTLE AND SUCH OTHER PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE CHARITY TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT.

name: EYEWITNESS
activities: A mobile camera app, designed to document and report information on human rights abuses, was finalised and launched.   Field testing of the beta version of the app was completed.  The feedback was compiled and incorporated into the final production version of the app.  The app was released to the public in June 2015.  eyeWitness has now been developing support among target users of the app.
objects: FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT TO PROMOTE  1) HUMAN RIGHTS IN RELATION TO TORTURE AND INHUMAN OR DEGRADING TREATMENT OR PUNISHMENT (AS DEFINED IN ARTICLE 3 OF THE EUROPEAN CONVENTION ON HUMAN RIGHTS) OR  2) RIGHTS WHICH ARE PROTECTED BY CRIMINAL SANCTION UNDER THE ROME STATUTE OF THE INTERNATIONAL CRIMINAL COURT AND SUBSEQUENT REVISIONS THERETO  BY ALL OR ANY OF THE FOLLOWING MEANS:  A) MONITORING AND REPORTING OF ABUSES OF SUCH RIGHTS TO LAWFUL PROSECUTING AUTHORITIES;  B) CONTRIBUTING TO THE SOUND ADMINISTRATION OF THE LAW AS IT RELATES TO SUCH RIGHTS;  C) RAISING AWARENESS OF, ADVANCING EDUCATION IN AND PROMOTING PUBLIC SUPPORT FOR SUCH RIGHTS."

name: WOODLANDS SCHOOL CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: To advance the education of the pupils at Woodlands School by providing and assisting the provision of facilities (not required to be provided by the Local Authority) for education at the school.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUPILS AT WOODLANDS SCHOOL BY PROVIDING AND ASSISTING IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES (NOT REQUIRED TO BE PROVIDED BY THE LOCAL AUTHORITY) FOR EDUCATION AT THE SCHOOL.

name: SOCIAL SQUARE (UK)
activities: Helping disadvantaged families and the provision of facilities for recreation and leisure for those in need of such.
objects: I. THE RELIEF OF POVERTY.  II. THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION.  III. THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR RECREATION AND OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION FOR CHILDREN AND ADULTS WHO ARE IN NEED OF SUCH PROVISION BECAUSE OF THEIR YOUTH, AGE, INFIRMITY, POVERTY OR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES AND WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE.  IV. THE PROMOTION OF ANY OTHER EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE OBJECTS AND PURPOSES IN THE UNITED KINGDOM OR IN ANY OTHER PART OF THE WORLD SUCH AS THE TRUSTEES SEEFIT PROVIDED ALWAYS THAT THEY ARE REGARDED AS CHARITABLE BY THE LAW OF ENGLAND AND WALES.

name: HENRY OLDFIELD TRUST
activities: The Trust's main aim is to support programmes which reduce offending and reoffending, promote entrepreneurship amongst the young and disadvantaged, and tackle other challenges such as homelessness and addiction.

objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CHARITY ("THE OBJECTS") ARE SUCH EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS THE TRUSTEES IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION THINK FIT

name: THE DEBS PRICE FOUNDATION
activities: The Debs Price Foundation supports programmes for relieving poverty and improving primary school literacy through grant-making. The Foundation was established in 2013 in memory of Debs Price, an inspirational lady who fought cancer for many years whilst helping people to help themselves.  Until further notice, The Foundation is not accepting unsolicited applications for funding.
objects: 1. THE RELIEF OF FINANCIAL HARDSHIP, EITHER GENERALLY OR INDIVIDUALLY, THROUGH THE PROVISION OF GRANTS, GOODS, OR SERVICES, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE DISTRIBUTION OF, AND THE TRANSFER OF FUNDS TO, AN ELECTRONIC PRE-PAYMENT CARD OR CARDS FOR THE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE BENEFIT OF AND USAGE BY PERSONS WHO HAVE NO FIXED ABODE OR WHO ARE OTHERWISE IN HARDSHIP THROUGH POVERTY;  2. THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE PROMOTION OF INITIATIVES WHICH WILL IMPROVE THE LITERACY OF CHILDREN BETWEEN THE AGES OF FIVE AND ELEVEN YEARS;  3. ANY OTHER EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS THE TRUSTEES MAY AT THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION DECIDE.

name: HUDDERSFIELD MISSION
activities: Providing services for people in need, such as food, shelter, advice, support and developmental activities. Offering a town centre community facility, with space for meetings, classes and rooms for rent. Facilitating dialogue between different groups in Kirklees and enabling vulnerable and marginalised people to be heard. Hosting faith-based groups for worship and sharing.
objects: (A) THE PREVENTION OR RELIEF OF POVERTY;  (B) THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION;  (C) THE ADVANCEMENT OF RELIGION IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE DOCTRINES OF THE METHODIST CHURCH; AND  (E) THE RELIEF OF THOSE IN NEED, BY REASON OF YOUTH, AGE, ILL-HEALTH, DISABILITY, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR OTHER DISADVANTAGE.

name: THE FIELDROSE CHARITABLE TRUST
