activities: TO PROMOTE THE ORTHODOX JEWISH RELIGION AND IN PARTICULAR TO MAINTAIN A SYNAGOGUE PROVIDING FACILITIES FOR PRAYER, RELIGIOUS WORSHIP AND RELIGIOUS STUDIES AND THE RELIEF OF POVERTY.
objects: TO PROMOTE THE ORTHODOX JEWISH RELIGION AND IN PARTICULAR TO MAINTAIN A SYNAGOGUE PROVIDING FACILITIES FOR PRAYER, RELIGIOUS WORSHIP AND RELIGIOUS STUDIES AND THE RELIEF OF POVERTY.

name: LIVE WELL WITH COPD
activities: Provision of Pulmonary Wellbeing Exercise groups and monthly support group to update members on advances in COPD management.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CIO ARE:  TO RELIEVE SICKNESS AND TO PROMOTE AND PROTECT GOOD HEALTH FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT OF THOSE SUFFERING WITH CHRONIC OBSTRUCTIVE PULMONARY DISEASE (COPD), THEIR FAMILIES AND CARERS IN THE GOSPORT AND FAREHAM AREAS BY:  ú RAISING AWARENESS OF COPD THOUGH EFFECTIVE COMMUNICATION;  ú LIAISING WITH OTHER COMMUNITY GROUPS, HEALTH CHARITIES AND PUBLIC BODIES;  ú PROVIDING ADVICE, SUPPORT AND ACTIVE COMMUNICATION WITHIN THE GROUP;  ú ENCOURAGING SELF-MANAGEMENT OF THE CONDITION;ú UPDATING MEMBERS ON, AND PARTICIPATING IN, RESEARCH OPPORTUNITIES;  ú LIAISING WITH AND WORKING TOGETHER WITH COMMUNITY RESPIRATORY TEAMS; AND  ú THROUGH THE PROVISION OF GRANTS TO THOSE SUFFERING WITH COPD OR THEIR CARERS"  NOTHING IN THIS CONSTITUTION SHALL AUTHORISE AN APPLICATION OF THE PROPERTY OF THE CIO FOR THE PURPOSES WHICH ARE NOT CHARITABLE IN ACCORDANCE WITH [SECTION 7 OF THE CHARITIES AND TRUSTEE INVESTMENT (SCOTLAND) ACT 2005] AND [SECTION 2 OF THE CHARITIES ACT (NORTHERN IRELAND) 2008]

name: COLLECTIONS FOR AFRICA
activities: THE OBJECTS OF THE CHARITY, WHICH ARE FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT, ARE SPECIFICALLY RESTRICTED TO THE FOLLOWING:  1. THE RELIEF OF POVERTY, WITHOUT PREJUDICE TO THE GENERALITY OF THE FOREGOING, AMONGST PERSONS RESIDENT IN KENYA OR SUCH OTHER PARTS OF AFRICA AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL DETERMINE;  2. TO PROVIDE EDUCATION AND TRAINING AND, WITHOUT PREJUDICE TO THE GENERALITY OF THE FOREGOING, WITH EMPHASIS ON THOSE LIVING IN AFRICA AND IN PARTICULAR THOSE RESIDENT IN KENYA. FOR THE AVOIDANCE OF DOUBT THIS SHALL INCLUDE EDUCATION AND TRAINING IN LIFE SKILLS FOR THOSE WHO HAVE PARTICULAR NEEDS FOR SUCH SKILLS SO THAT THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE MAY BE IMPROVED; AND  3. ANY OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSE ACCORDING TO THE LAW IN ENGLAND AND WALES WHICH SHALL BE SELECTED BY THE TRUSTEES IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION FROM TIME TO TIME.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CHARITY, WHICH ARE FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT, ARE SPECIFICALLY RESTRICTED TO THE FOLLOWING:  1. THE RELIEF OF POVERTY, WITHOUT PREJUDICE TO THE GENERALITY OF THE FOREGOING, AMONGST PERSONS RESIDENT IN KENYA OR SUCH OTHER PARTS OF AFRICA AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL DETERMINE;  2. TO PROVIDE EDUCATION AND TRAINING AND, WITHOUT PREJUDICE TO THE GENERALITY OF THE FOREGOING, WITH EMPHASIS ON THOSE LIVING IN AFRICA AND IN PARTICULAR THOSE RESIDENT IN KENYA. FOR THE AVOIDANCE OF DOUBT THIS SHALL INCLUDE EDUCATION AND TRAINING IN LIFE SKILLS FOR THOSE WHO HAVE PARTICULAR NEEDS FOR SUCH SKILLS SO THAT THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE MAY BE IMPROVED; AND  3. ANY OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSE ACCORDING TO THE LAW IN ENGLAND AND WALES WHICH SHALL BE SELECTED BY THE TRUSTEES IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION FROM TIME TO TIME.

name: BRITAIN ALXAS COMMUNITY CENTRE
activities: 1) TO PROMOTE SOCIAL INCLUSION FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT AMONGST REFUGEES, ASYLUM SEEKERS AND MIGRANTS OF TURKISH AND KURDISH DESCENT BY PREVENTING SUCH PEOPLE FROM BECOMING SOCIALLY EXCLUDED, RELIEVING THE NEEDS OF THOSE PEOPLE WHO ARE SOCIALLY EXCLUDED AND ASSISTING THEM TO INTEGRATE INTO SOCIETY, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY:  A) PROVIDING A LOCAL NETWORK GROUP THAT ENCOURAGES AND ENABLE
objects: 1) TO PROMOTE SOCIAL INCLUSION FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT AMONGST REFUGEES, ASYLUM SEEKERS AND MIGRANTS OF TURKISH AND KURDISH DESCENT BY PREVENTING SUCH PEOPLE FROM BECOMING SOCIALLY EXCLUDED, RELIEVING THE NEEDS OF THOSE PEOPLE WHO ARE SOCIALLY EXCLUDEDAND ASSISTING THEM TO INTEGRATE INTO SOCIETY, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY:    A) PROVIDING A LOCAL NETWORK GROUP THAT ENCOURAGES AND ENABLES SUCH PEOPLE TO PARTICIPATE MORE EFFECTIVELY WITH THE WIDER COMMUNITY;    B) INCREASING, OR CO-ORDINATING, OPPORTUNITIES FOR SUCH PEOPLE TO ENGAGE WITH SERVICE PROVIDERS, TO ENABLE THOSE PROVIDERS TO ADAPT SERVICES TO BETTER MEET THE NEEDS OF SUCH PEOPLE; AND    C) THE PROVISION OF EDUCATION AND TRAINING, INCLUDING ENGLISH LANGUAGE SKILLS, AND ADVICE AND SUPPORT ON MATTERS SUCH AS HEALTH, HOUSING AND EMPLOYMENT AND SUCH OTHER SUPPORT DESIGNED TO ENABLE THEM TO INTEGRATE AND ADAPT TO THE LOCAL COMMUNITY.    2) TO FURTHER OR BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS OF LONDON AND THE NEIGHBOURHOOD WHO ARE OF TURKISH AND KURDISH DESCENT, BY ADVANCING EDUCATION AND PROVIDING FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION AND LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE OBJECTIVE OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR THE RESIDENTS.    IN FURTHERANCE OF THESEOBJECTS BUT NOT OTHERWISE, THE TRUSTEES SHALL HAVE POWER:    TO ESTABLISH OR SECURE THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A COMMUNITY CENTRE AND TO MAINTAIN AND MANAGE SUCH A CENTRE FOR ACTIVITIES PROMOTED BY THE CHARITY IN FURTHERANCE OF THE ABOVE OBJECTS.

name: THE CAVALIERO FAMILY CHARITABLE TRUST CIO
activities: Making grants to registered charities on a one-off or recurring basis to help those in need of water, sanitation, healthcare, food, housing or education, particularly the poor, the homeless, children and the elderly.
objects: (A)THE OBJECTS OF THE CIO ARE TO ADVANCE SUCH CHARITABLE PURPOSES (ACCORDING TO THE LAW OF ENGLAND AND WALES) FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT, IN ANY PART OF THE WORLD AS THE CHARITY TRUSTEES MAY IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION THINK FIT FROM TIME TO TIME.

name: HYTHE BAY CHILDREN'S CENTRE
activities: Hythe Bay Children's Centre incorporates Hythe Bay Nursery and After School Club and is at the heart of the Government's strategy to deliver better outcomes for children and their families in the Hythe area. We provide seamless, holistic, integrated child-care services for the local community
objects: FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT, THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION IN CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE BY THE PROVISION OF THE NECESSARY FACILITIES FOR THE DAILY CARE, RECREATION AND EDUCATION OF CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE DURING OUT OF SCHOOL HOURS AND SCHOOL HOLIDAYS. THE PROMOTION OF CARE, SAFETY, EDUCATION, HEALTH AND WELLBEING OF CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE AND THE PROVISION OF SERVICES AND SUPPORT TO THEIR FAMILIES AND CARERS. TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION AND TRAINING OF PERSONS PROVIDING SUCH CARE, EDUCATION AND RECREATIONAL FACILITIES AND TO APPOINT SUITABLY QUALIFIED OR EXPERIENCED PEOPLE TO DELIVER CHILD CARE, EDUCATION AND TRAINING. TO ALSO ADOPT AND ADHERE TO A SUITABLE SAFEGUARDING POLICY.

name: ENGLISH4ALL IN LEEDS
activities: Providing free English classes and related activities to adult speakers of other languages.
objects: (1)FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT IN THE LEEDS AREA, TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC, BY PROVIDING FREE ACCESS TO ENGLISH LESSONS FOR ADULT SPEAKERS OF OTHER LANGUAGES

name: ST AUSTELL ARTS CENTRE
activities: To promote, maintain, improve and advance education particularly by the encouragement of the arts, as either a participant or observer. To restore and preserve for the benefit of the public the St Austell Arts Centre, being a building of historic and architectural  interest. To provide facilities for the use of inhabitants of St Austell and its surrounding area, for arts & leisure activities.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CIO ARE  A) TO PROMOTE, MAINTAIN AND ADVANCE EDUCATION PARTICULARLY BY THE PRODUCTION OF PLAYS AND THE ENCOURAGEMENT OF THE ARTS INCLUDING THE ARTS OF DRAMA, DANCE, MUSIC, SINGING, LITERATURE, SCULPTURE AND PAINTING.  B) TO RESTORE AND PRESERVE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC THE ST AUSTELL ART CENTRE BEING A BUILDING OF HISTORIC ARCHITECTURAL AND CONSTRUCTIONAL INTEREST.  C) TO PROMOTE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF ST AUSTELL WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF SEX, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, RACE OR OF POLITICAL, RELIGIOUS OR OTHER OPINIONS, BY ASSOCIATING TOGETHER THE SAID INHABITANTS AND THE LOCAL AUTHORITIES, VOLUNTARY AND OTHER ORGANISATIONS IN A COMMON EFFORT TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND TO PROVIDE FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIALWELFARE FOR RECREATION AND OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATIONS WITH THE OBJECTS OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE OF THE SAID INHABITANTS.  NOTHING IN THIS CONSTITUTION SHALL AUTHORISE AN APPLICATION OF THE PROPERTY OF THE CIO FOR THE PURPOSES WHICH ARENOT CHARITABLE IN ACCORDANCE WITH [SECTION 7 OF THE CHARITIES AND TRUSTEE INVESTMENT (SCOTLAND) ACT 2005] AND [SECTION 2 OF THE CHARITIES ACT (NORTHERN IRELAND) 2008]

name: VISIONS OF HOPE
activities: Transforming communities by educating teachers to equip learners to solve the problems their communities face
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF PUPILS AT SCHOOLS IN AFRICA BY PROVIDING AND ASSISTING IN THE PROVISION OF TRAINING FOR TEACHERS AND FACILITIES FOR EDUCATION AT THOSE SCHOOLS.

name: FURBABIES CAT RESCUE
activities: Furbabies Cat Rescue operates from the Birmingham area and rescues, rehabilitates and rehomes cats. Furbabies uses a network of foster homes to assess the cats and accurately match their personalities and needs to potential adopters. Rehoming criteria applies and home checks are completed for every cat in our care to ensure we secure quality homes.
objects: FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC TO RELIEVE THE SUFFERING OF ANIMALS IN NEED OF CARE AND ATTENTION AND, IN PARTICULAR, TO PROVIDE AND MAINTAIN RESCUE HOMES OR OTHER FACILITIES FOR THE RECEPTION, CARE AND TREATMENT OF SUCH ANIMALS.  TO PROMOTE HUMANE BEHAVIOUR TOWARDS ANIMALS BY PROVIDING APPROPRIATE CARE, PROTECTION, TREATMENT AND SECURITY FOR ANIMALS WHICH ARE IN NEED OF CARE AND ATTENTION BY REASON OF SICKNESS, MALTREATMENT, POOR CIRCUMSTANCES OR ILL USAGE AND TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC IN MATTERS PERTAINING TO ANIMAL WELFARE IN GENERAL AND THE PREVENTION OF CRUELTY AND SUFFERING AMONG ANIMALS.

name: DAY AND NIGHT WORSHIP
activities: The CIO serves Christianity within the UK, in particular by organising public, non-denominational, religious music events from all churches and denominations that bring together volunteers and musicians from across churches.
objects: THE OBJECT OF THE CIO IS TO ADVANCE CHRISTIANITY WITHIN THE UK, IN PARTICULAR BY ORGANISING PUBLIC, NON-DENOMINATIONAL, RELIGIOUS MUSIC EVENTS FROM ALL CHURCHES AND DENOMINATIONS THAT BRING TOGETHER VOLUNTEERS AND MUSICIANS FROM ACROSS CHURCHES.

name: SPACE
activities: We provide support to children with additional needs and their families through the provision of accessible play and recreation activities, and sharing advice and information
objects: TO PROVIDE FACILITIES FOR RECREATION AND/OR OTHER LEISURE TIME FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE IN PARTICULAR, BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY, FOR CHILDREN WITH ADDITIONAL NEEDS. THIS INCLUDES THE PROVISION OF A MULTI-SENSORY AND SAFE PLAY ENVIRONMENT WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CHILDRENS CONDITIONS OF LIFE.  TO PROVIDE INFORMATION, GUIDANCE AND THE OPPORTUNITY FOR PEER SUPPORT TO PARENTS AND CARERS AS WE RECOGNISE THEIR ROLE IS INTEGERAL IN THE HEALTH AND WELL BEING OF CHILDREN WITH ADDITIONAL NEEDS.

name: LLANGOLLEN SPORTS CLUB LTD
activities: 1. THE PROMOTION OF COMMUNITY PARTICIPATION IN HEALTHY RECREATION FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF LLANGOLLEN AND SURROUNDING AREA BY THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR PLAYING OUTDOOR SPORTS IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY FOOTBALL, CRICKET AND RUGBY    2. TO PROMOTE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF LLANGOLLEN AND THE SURROUNDING AREA THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION OF INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, AGE,INFIRMITY OR DISABLEMENT, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES OR FOR THE PUBLIC AT LARGE IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE AND WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITION OF LIFE OF THE SAID INHABITANTS.
objects: 1. THE PROMOTION OF COMMUNITY PARTICIPATION IN HEALTHY RECREATION FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF LLANGOLLEN AND SURROUNDING AREA BY THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR PLAYING OUTDOOR SPORTS IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY FOOTBALL, CRICKET AND RUGBY    2. TO PROMOTE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF LLANGOLLEN AND THE SURROUNDING AREA THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION OF INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, AGE,INFIRMITY OR DISABLEMENT, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES OR FOR THE PUBLIC AT LARGE IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE AND WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITION OF LIFE OF THE SAID INHABITANTS.

name: THE SCHOOLS TRUST
activities: School Governance Body. Assisting schools implement high academic and administrative standards. Development of School Management Systems.
objects: THE OBJECT FOR WHICH THE COMPANY IS ESTABLISHED IS THE PROMOTION OR REGULATION OF EDUCATION AND ANYTHING INCIDENTAL OR CONDUCIVE TO ANY OF THAT OBJECT.

name: GILLINGHAM, MERE & SHAFTESBURY LIONS CLUB
activities: Part of the world's largest service organisation, Lions Clubs International, we raise funds locally through various events and make grants to those in need in the areas of Gillingham & Shaftesbury in Dorset and Mere in Witshire, together with grants to Lions Clubs International appeals. See www.lions.org.uk
objects: 1.1 THE OBJECTS OF THE CLUB ARE SUCH PURPOSES AS ARE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE IN ENGLAND & WALES, INCLUDING IN PARTICULAR:    1.1.1 THE ADVANCEMENT OF CITIZENSHIP BY:    1.1.1.1 PROMOTING THE PRINCIPLES OF GOOD CITIZENSHIP;    1.1.1.2 ENCOURAGING MEMBERS TO TAKE AN ACTIVE INTEREST IN THE CIVIC, CULTURAL, SOCIAL AND MORAL WELFARE OF THE COMMUNITY;    1.1.1.3 PROVIDING A FORUM FOR THE OPEN DISCUSSION OF ALL MATTERS OF PUBLIC INTEREST; PROVIDED THAT PARTISAN POLITICS AND SECTARIAN RELIGION SHALL NOT BEDEBATED BY MEMBERS;    1.1.1.4 ENCOURAGING SERVICE-MINDED PEOPLE TO SERVE THEIR COMMUNITY WITHOUT PERSONAL REWARD AND ENCOURAGING THE PROMOTION OF HIGH ETHICAL STANDARDS IN COMMERCE, INDUSTRY, PROFESSIONS, PUBLIC WORKS AND PRIVATE ENDEAVOURS;    1.1.1.5 SUPPORTING YOUTH TO DEVELOP THEIR SKILLS, CAPACITIES AND CAPABILITIES TO ENABLE THEM TO PARTICIPATE IN SOCIETY AS MATURE AND RESPONSIBLE INDIVIDUALS;    1.1.2 PROMOTING THE VOLUNTARY SECTOR FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT BY ASSOCIATING WITH LOCAL AUTHORITIES IN A COMMON EFFORT TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND PROVIDE FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION TO IMPROVE THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE OF PEOPLE IN LOCAL, NATIONAL AND INTERNATIONAL COMMUNITIES;    1.1.3 PROMOTING VOLUNTEERING;    1.1.4 THE RELIEF OF POVERTY AND THE RELIEF OF THOSE IN NEED IN PARTICULAR BY PROVIDING HUMANITARIAN AID AND DISASTER RELIEF;    1.1.5 THE ADVANCEMENT OF HEALTH OR THE SAVING OF LIVES BY PREVENTING AVOIDABLE BLINDNESS, ASSISTING DISABLED PEOPLE TO LEAD INDEPENDENT LIVES OR HELPING TO PREVENT OR MANAGE HEALTH ISSUES;    1.1.6 PROMOTING FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC THE CONSERVATION PROTECTION AND IMPROVEMENT OF THE PHYSICAL AND NATURAL ENVIRONMENT; AND/OR    1.1.7 PROMOTING COMMUNITY PARTICIPATION IN HEALTHY RECREATION.

name: FRIENDS OF COPE UK
activities: Friends of COPE UK was set up to support the COPE Project in Lao PDR supporting people with disabilities to access prosthetics. Currently seeking registration in Lao PDR. No UK activities to report to date.
objects: 	FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT, THE RELIEF AND ASSISTANCE OF LAO PEOPLE IN NEED DUE TO MOBILITY-RELATED DISABILITIES WHO ARE THE VICTIMS OF THE INDOCHINA WARS, UNEXPLODED ORDNANCE (UXO) INCIDENTS POST-WAR, ACCIDENT OR MISADVENTURE, BY SUPPLYING THEM WITH MEDICAL AID AND BY SUPPORTING ACCESS TO PHYSICAL REHABILITATION SERVICES.    	FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT, THE PROMOTION OF HEALTH AND EDUCATION TO THE PUBLIC IN LAOS ON PROSTHETIC AND ORTHOTIC HEALTH SERVICES, PARTICULARLY TO COMMUNITIES IN RURAL AND REMOTE AREAS THROUGH OUR MOBILE CLINIC PROGRAMME.    	FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT, THE ADVANCEMENT OF HEALTH AND SAVING OF LAO LIVES THROUGH THE CONTINUAL IMPROVEMENT OF SERVICE DELIVERY BY GOVERNMENT OF LAO REHABILITATION CENTRES BY UPGRADING SKILLS FOR REHABILITATION CENTRE STAFF, MAINTAINING EQUIPMENT AND FACILITIES, AND MANAGING INTERNATIONAL AND LOCAL LOGISTICS AND PROCUREMENT.

name: IT'S FOR THE KIDS
activities: Support the provision of education at Kings Sutton Primary Academy by: - Engaging in activities, raising funds or providing facilities, training or equipment for the school; - Contributing to effective relationships between the staff, parents and others associated with the school
objects: THE CHARITY'S OBJECTS ("THE OBJECTS") ARE TO SUPPORT THE PROVISION OF EDUCATION AT KINGS SUTTON PRIMARY ACADEMY, SUCH AS (BUT NOT LIMITED TO) ITS IT PROVISION, BY  1) ENGAGING IN ACTIVITIES, RAISING FUNDS OR PROVIDING FACILITIES, TRAINING OR EQUIPMENTFOR THE SCHOOL;  2) CONTRIBUTING TO EFFECTIVE RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN THE STAFF, PARENTS AND OTHERS ASSOCIATED WITH THE SCHOOL.

name: FAITH LIFE CHURCH - GRANTHAM
activities: We hold weekly services and hold Lifegroup meeting during the week. We support numerous community events. Chaplaincy to the Police and schools work.
objects: THE OBJECT OF THE CIO IS, FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT, THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE CHRISTIAN FAITH IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATEMENT OF FAITH, IN SUCH WAYS AS THE CHARITY TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME DECIDE.

name: NORTHUMBERLAND PRIDE
activities: Northumberland Pride is a county wide organisation that to raises awareness of Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual & Transgender (LGBT) culture and heritage. We do this by promoting equality and diversity for the elimination of discrimination on the grounds of sexual orientation and gender identity.
objects: THE CHARITY'S OBJECTS ("THE OBJECTS") ARE:  TO PROMOTE EQUALITY AND DIVERSITY FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT AND IN PARTICULAR THE ELIMINATION OF DISCRIMINATION ON THE GROUNDS OF SEXUAL ORIENTATION OR GENDER IDENTITY, INCLUDING IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY:  (I) RAISING THE AWARENESS OF THE PUBLIC WITH REGARD TO ALL ASPECTS OF DISCRIMINATION IN SOCIETY AND ISSUES AND DIFFICULTIES AFFECTING THE LIVES OF LESBIAN, GAY, BISEXUAL AND TRANSGENDER (LGBT) PEOPLE;  (II) CULTIVATING A SENTIMENT IN FAVOUR OFEQUALITY AND DIVERSITY IN PARTICULAR THROUGH CELEBRATING THE ACHIEVEMENTS OF LGBT PEOPLE AND THE DIVERSITY OF THE LGBT COMMUNITY;  (III) ADVANCING EDUCATION AND RAISING AWARENESS IN EQUALITY AND DIVERSITY WHETHER BY TEACHING, INTERACTION, PERFORMANCEOR PRODUCING AND/OR DISPLAYING ARTISTIC AND OTHER MATERIALS;  (IV) PRODUCING PUBLICATIONS, LECTURES, MEDIA, PROMOTING PUBLIC EVENTS AND EXHIBITIONS, PUBLIC ADVOCACY AND OTHER MEANS OF COMMUNICATION;  (V) ASSOCIATING WITH VOLUNTARY ORGANISATIONS, AND/OR GOVERNMENTAL, PUBLIC AND PRIVATE BODIES TO DEVELOP AND MAXIMISE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF VOLUNTARY ORGANISATIONS RUN BY AND FOR LGBT PEOPLE;  (VI) STAGING AND PROMOTING LGBT EVENTS AND IN PARTICULAR AN ANNUAL LGBT FESTIVAL;  (VII) CREATING SAFE SPACESWHERE LGBT PEOPLE CAN EXPLORE THEIR CULTURE AND HERITAGE THAT BREAKS DOWN BARRIERS, CELEBRATES INCLUSIVELY AND REMOVES SOCIAL EXCLUSION;  (VIII) PROMOTING ACTIVITIES TO FOSTER UNDERSTANDING BETWEEN PEOPLE FROM DIVERSE BACKGROUNDS.

name: THE SHERWOOD FOUNDATION CIO
activities: To advance education primarily but not exclusively to Judaism and the Jewish faith by way of grants, bursaries and endowments. To advance education by assisting in the funding and establishment of apprenticeships to teach the skills (such as polishing and cutting gems) necessary to prepare apprentices for work in the jewellery industry.
objects: 1. TO ADVANCE EDUCATION PRIMARILY BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY TO TO JUDAISM AND THE JEWISH FAITH BY WAY OF GRANTS, BURSARIES AND ENDOWMENTS.    2. TO ADVANCE EDUCATION BY ASSISTING IN THE FUNDING AND ESTABLISHMENT OF APPRENTICESHIPS TO TEACH THE SKILLS (SUCH AS POLISHING AND CUTTING GEMS) NECESSARY TO PREPARE APPRENTICES FOR WORK IN THE JEWELLERY INDUSTRY.

name: MARKET HARBOROUGH UNIT (NO 640) OF THE SEA CADET CORPS (TS FERNIE)
activities: Based in Market Harborough, TS Fernie is a local unit of The Sea Cadets, a national youth charity based on the standards and traditions of the Royal Navy and Royal Marines, delivering life skills through land and water-based fun & adventure for young people aged 9-18 and volunteering and leadership opportunities for those aged over 18.
objects: TO PROMOTE THE DEVELOPMENT OF YOUNG PEOPLE IN ACHIEVING THEIR PHYSICAL, INTELLECTUAL AND SOCIAL POTENTIAL AS INDIVIDUALS AND AS RESPONSIBLE CITIZENS BY THE PROVISION OF EDUCATION AND LEISURE TIME ACTIVITIES USING A NAUTICAL THEME AND IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PRINCIPLES, ETHOS AND PRACTICES OF THE MARINE SOCIETY & SEA CADETS (MSSC).    IN FURTHERANCE OF THE PURPOSE, THE UNIT MAY:    A.	OFFER YOUNG PEOPLE A STRUCTURED ENVIRONMENT IN WHICH TO DEVELOP;    B.	PROVIDE ACCESS TO EDUCATION AND TRAINING INCLUDING (BUT NOT RESTRICTED TO): SAILING (INSHORE AND OFFSHORE), PADDLE SPORTS, POWER BOATING, SEAMANSHIP, NAVIGATION, MARINE ENGINEERING, COOKING, MUSIC, FIRST AID, DRILL, PIPING, AND PUBLIC SERVICE;    C.	PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUNG PEOPLE TO OBTAIN A RANGE OF QUALIFICATIONS; AND    D.	PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT.

name: THE ROB MOORE FOUNDATION
activities: The objective of the Rob Moore Foundation is to help especially, young and underprivileged people, merge their passion with their profession and to have equal opportunity to be self-sufficient and successful through scholarships, education, support and inspiration.  The Rob Moore Foundation will support the successful candidate on their journey to reach their goal or to start their own business
objects: TO FURTHER SUCH CHARITABLE PURPOSE OR PURPOSES AS THE TRUSTEES IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION SHALL THINK FIT AND IN PARTICULAR, BUT WITHOUT LIMITATION, THROUGH THE MAKING OF GRANTS AND DONATIONS.

name: GUARDIAN ANGELS UK
activities: Providing leisure and enrichment activities for children under 18years who have lost a parent or guardian
objects: THE OBJECT OF THIS CIO IS TO PRESERVE AND PROTECT THE PHYSICAL AND MENTAL HEALTH OF CHILDREN UNDER THE AGE OF 18 LIVING IN THE UK WHO HAVE EXPERIENCED BEREAVEMENT OR LOSS OF A PARENT / GUARDIAN, BY THE PROVISION OF SUPPORT AND RECREATION AND LEISURE TIME ACTIVITIES PROVIDED IN THE INTEREST OF SOCIAL WELFARE, DESIGNED TO IMPROVE THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE.  NOTHING IN THIS CONSTITUTION SHALL AUTHORISE AN APPLICATION OF THE PROPERTY OF THE CIO FOR THE PURPOSES WHICH ARE NOT CHARITABLE IN ACCORDANCE WITH [SECTION 7 OF THE CHARITIES AND TRUSTEE INVESTMENT (SCOTLAND) ACT 2005] AND [SECTION 2 OF THE CHARITIES ACT (NORTHERN IRELAND) 2008]

name: FAIR (FUNDING AUTO IMMUNE RESEARCH)
activities: We raise money through a variety of methods in order to give funds to individuals and entities who are carrying out research into auto-immune conditions, in order to assist them with that research
objects: TO PRESERVE AND PROTECT THE HEALTH OF SUFFERERS OF AUTOIMMUNE CONDITIONS AND DISEASES BY: I.	PROMOTING RESEARCH FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT INTO DEVELOPING TREATMENTS AND FUNDING A CURE FOR AUTOIMMUNE CONDITIONS AND DISEASES, INCLUDING THEIR PREVENTION, AND TO DISSEMINATE THE USEFUL RESULTS OF SUCH RESEARCH; II.	 RELIEVING SICKNESS AMONGST PERSONS WHO ARE SUFFERING FROM AN AUTOIMMUNE CONDITION OR DISEASE; AND III.	ADVANCING THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN GENERAL ON THE SUBJECT OF AUTOIMMUNE CONDITIONSAND DISEASES.

name: MARYAM WELFARE SOCIETY
activities: Children are entitled to any medically necessary medical supplies, equipment and appliances needed to correct, improve or assist in dealing with physical or mental conditions. to help the family deal with a child's circumstances, and also some medically necessary dietary nutritional assistance.we also provide financial help to these deserving families in gujrat pakistan.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CIO ARE:  (1) TO RELIEF FINANCIAL HARDSHIP AMONG ORPHAN CHILDREN LIVING IN PAKISTAN BY MAKING GRANTS OF MONEY FOR PROVIDING OR PAYING FOR ITEMS SERVICES OR FACILITIES WHICH THEY COULD NOT OTHERWISE AFFORD THROUGH LACK OF MEANS.  (2)TO RELIEVE PEOPLE WHO ARE SUFFERING FROM PHYSICAL OR MENTAL DISABILITY IN PAKISTAN BY THE PROVISION OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AND SUPPORT.

name: FRIENDS OF THE DROP-IN FOR ASYLUM SEEKERS AND REFUGEES
activities: We seek to improve the mental health and well-being of all asylum seekers and refugees in Sunderland, whilst promoting their integration into the wider community. Our weekly Drop-in now extends to a Women?s group and added activities for all ages. Our intention is to develop these undertakings. FODI continues the work of the charity of the same name (registered charity 1153057). ?2011-2018.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CHARITY ARE:  1. TO PRESERVE AND PROTECT THE PHYSICAL AND MENTAL HEALTH OF THOSE SEEKING ASYLUM/ GRANTED REFUGEE STATUS AND THEIR DEPENDANTS, THROUGH PROVIDING A DROP-IN AND ASSOCIATED ACTIVITIES.  2. THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FORRECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE OF THOSE ASYLUM SEEKERS AND REFUGEES WHO HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, AGE, INFIRMITY OR DISABLEMENT, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES.  3. THE PROMOTION OF SOCIAL INCLUSION FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT AMONG PEOPLE WHO ARE REFUGEES AND ASYLUM SEEKERS WHO ARE SOCIALLY EXCLUDED ON THE GROUNDS OF THEIR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC POSITION, BY PROVIDING SOCIAL AND RECREATIONAL FACILITIES AND EVENTS INVOLVING THE LOCAL COMMUNITY.

name: New Model Institute for Technology and Engineering
activities: Establishing and operating an institution of Higher Education focussed on teaching inter-disciplinary engineering
objects: TO ADVANCE EDUCATION BY ESTABLISHING, MAINTAINING, DEVELOPING AND RUNNING IN OR NEAR THE CITY OF HEREFORD AND ELSEWHERE IN THE COUNTY OF HEREFORDSHIRE A TERTIARY EDUCATION CENTRE WITH A VIEW TO OBTAINING UNIVERSITY STATUS, AND TO ADVANCE SUCH OTHER EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE PURPOSES COMPATIBLE WITH THE ADVANCEMENT OF A TERTIARY EDUCATION CENTRE SEEKING TO OBTAIN UNIVERSITY STATUS AS THE TRUSTEES IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION DETERMINE

name: AMESBURY HISTORY CENTRE
activities: To advance the education of the public by the establishment and maintenance of a museum and associated artefacts relating to the history of Amesbury and the surrounding area
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC BY THE ESTABLISHMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF A MUSEUM AND ASSOCIATED ARTEFACTS RELATING TO THE HISTORY OF AMESBURY AND THE SURROUNDING AREA.

name: AGORA TRUST
activities: advancing the education of the public in general (and particularly among academics and students) on the subjects of philosophy, politics, and religion in their interrelations; organizing conferences to this end and promoting research for the public benefit in all aspects of these subjects
objects: (I)	TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN GENERAL (AND PARTICULARLY AMONG ACADEMICS AND STUDENTS) ON THE SUBJECTS OF PHILOSOPHY, POLITICS, AND RELIGION IN THEIR INTERRELATIONS;  (II)	TO ORGANIZE CONFERENCES TO THIS END AND TO PROMOTE RESEARCH FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT IN ALL ASPECTS OF THESE SUBJECTS, PUBLISHING THE USEFUL RESULTS.

name: SPRINGFIELD SANCTUARY
activities: Springfield Sanctuary take in pets in need of rehoming. We vet potential adopters to ensure they get the best possible homes.   We also take in wildlife if a vet has determined the animal can be successfully rehabilitated. We pay for treatment and provide care under veterinary guidance.  We also offer advice on animal care and do talks for groups with our ambassador animals.
objects: FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC TO RELIEVE THE SUFFERING OF ANIMALS IN NEED OF CARE AND ATTENTION IN BANBURY AND SURROUNDING AREAS BY, IN PARTICULAR, PROVIDING AND MAINTAINING RESCUE HOMES OR OTHER FACILITIES FOR THE RECEPTION, CARE AND TREATMENT OF SUCH ANIMALS

name: DAGBON UNION UK
activities: TO RELIEVE POVERTY, PROMOTE AND PROTECT GOOD HEALTH AND TO PROMOTE SOCIAL INCLUSION FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT BY PREVENTING PEOPLE FROM BECOMING SOCIALLY EXCLUDED, RELIEVING THE NEEDS OF THOSE PEOPLE WHO ARE SOCIALLY EXCLUDED AND ASSISTING THEM TO INTEGRATE INTO SOCIETY.  FOR THE PURPOSE OF THIS CLAUSE 'SOCIALLY EXCLUDED' MEANS BEING EXCLUDED FROM SOCIETY, OR PARTS OF SOCIETY, AS A RESULT OF ONE OF MORE OF THE FOLLOWING FACTORS: UNEMPLOYMENT; FINANCIAL HARDSHIP; YOUTH OR OLD AGE; ILL HEALTH (PHYSICALOR MENTAL); SUBSTANCE ABUSE OR DEPENDENCY INCLUDING ALCOHOL AND DRUGS; DISCRIMINATION ON THE GROUNDS OF SEX, RACE, DISABILITY, ETHNIC ORIGIN, RELIGION, BELIEF, CREED, SEXUAL ORIENTATION OR GENDER RE-ASSIGNMENT; POOR EDUCATIONAL OR SKILLS ATTAINMENT;RELATIONSHIP AND FAMILY BREAKDOWN; POOR HOUSING (THAT IS HOUSING THAT DOES NOT MEET BASIC HABITABLE STANDARDS; CRIME (EITHER AS A VICTIM OF CRIME OR AS AN OFFENDER REHABILITATING INTO SOCIETY).
objects: TO RELIEVE POVERTY, PROMOTE AND PROTECT GOOD HEALTH AND TO PROMOTE SOCIAL INCLUSION FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT BY PREVENTING PEOPLE FROM BECOMING SOCIALLY EXCLUDED, RELIEVING THE NEEDS OF THOSE PEOPLE WHO ARE SOCIALLY EXCLUDED AND ASSISTING THEM TO INTEGRATE INTO SOCIETY.  FOR THE PURPOSE OF THIS CLAUSE 'SOCIALLY EXCLUDED' MEANS BEING EXCLUDED FROM SOCIETY, OR PARTS OF SOCIETY, AS A RESULT OF ONE OF MORE OF THE FOLLOWING FACTORS: UNEMPLOYMENT; FINANCIAL HARDSHIP; YOUTH OR OLD AGE; ILL HEALTH (PHYSICALOR MENTAL); SUBSTANCE ABUSE OR DEPENDENCY INCLUDING ALCOHOL AND DRUGS; DISCRIMINATION ON THE GROUNDS OF SEX, RACE, DISABILITY, ETHNIC ORIGIN, RELIGION, BELIEF, CREED, SEXUAL ORIENTATION OR GENDER RE-ASSIGNMENT; POOR EDUCATIONAL OR SKILLS ATTAINMENT;RELATIONSHIP AND FAMILY BREAKDOWN; POOR HOUSING (THAT IS HOUSING THAT DOES NOT MEET BASIC HABITABLE STANDARDS; CRIME (EITHER AS A VICTIM OF CRIME OR AS AN OFFENDER REHABILITATING INTO SOCIETY).

name: THE ANTHONY GOLD SOLICITORS CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: The Trust was established for general charitable purposes (charitable under English law).
objects: TO FURTHER SUCH CHARITABLE PURPOSES (CHARITABLE UNDER ENGLISH LAW) AS THE TRUSTEES SEE FIT FROM TIME TO TIME.

name: ABBEY BAPTIST CHURCH
activities: Bible proclamation and teaching, supporting corporate and private worship, prayer, discussion and friendship. Regular activities for specific groups including elderly people, children, people from other countries/cultures. Special events with more concerted publicity to raise awareness of what we offer as public benefits. Support of local community events in line with our aims.
objects: THE PURPOSES OF THE CHURCH ARE:  1. THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE CHRISTIAN FAITH IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE BASIS OF FAITH PRIMARILY BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY WITHIN ABINGDON AND THE SURROUNDING NEIGHBOURHOOD; AND  2. SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS SHALL, IN THE OPINION OF THE MEMBERS OF THE CHURCH IN GENERAL MEETING, PUT INTO PRACTICE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE BASIS OF FAITH, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO: THE PREVENTION AND RELIEF OF NEED, HARDSHIP AND SICKNESS; THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION;AND THE PROVISION OF COMMUNITY FACILITIES; AND THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION OF INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, AGE INFIRMITY OR DISABILITY, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR SOCIAL CIRCUMSTANCES WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE  PROVIDED THAT THE ADVANCEMENT OF SUCH PURPOSES MUST BE UNDERTAKEN IN A MANNER THAT IS CONSISTENT WITH THE ETHICAL STATEMENTS AS MAY BE ADOPTEDAND AMENDED BY THE CHURCH FROM TIME TO TIME IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS OF THE CHURCH HANDBOOK.

name: CHURCH HOUSE, NANTWICH
activities: This Charity is charged with the care of the building known both as Church House, Nantwich and the Parish Hall. The trustees manage the building and associated assets for the benefit of St Mary's Church, Nantwich and the wider community.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CIO ARE, FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT TO PROMOTE, AID AND FURTHER THE OBJECTS AND WORK OF THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND AND IN PARTICULAR ST MARY'S CHURCH NANTWICH, PARTICULARLY BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY IN PROVIDING FACILITIES TO PROMOTE THE RELIGIOUS, CULTURAL AND EDUCATIONAL NEEDS OF THE LOCAL COMMUNITY AND IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR THE RECREATION AND LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION OF THE LOCAL COMMUNITY WITH THE OBJECTIVE OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR THE RESIDENTS OF THE PARISHOF NANTWICH.

name: WINDSOR & MAIDENHEAD YOUTH AND COMMUNITY COUNSELLING SERVICE
activities: The objects of Windsor and Maidenhead Youth and Community Counselling are: the advancement of education, the furtherance of health and relief of distress and sickness of young people families and their carers, by maintaining and developing a counselling service for the giving of free individual or group counselling and support.
objects: THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION, THE FURTHERANCE OF HEALTH AND THE RELIEF OF POVERTY, DISTRESS AND SICKNESS OF YOUNG PEOPLE, FAMILIES AND CARERS,IN THE COMMUNITIES OF WINDSOR, MAIDENHEAD AND THE SURROUNDING AREAS, ON AT LEAST TWO SITES, BY MAINTAINING AND DEVELOPING A YOUTH AND COMMUNITY COUNSELLING SERVICE FOR THE GIVING OF INDIVIDUAL OR GROUP COUNSELLING AND SUPPORT.

name: THE ARLINGHAM COMMUNITY TRUST
activities: the provision of a playing field for the use and enjoyment by residents of Arlingham for social and recreational purposes
objects: TO PROMOTE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF THE PARISH OF ARLINGHAM AND THE SURROUNDING AREA THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION OF INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, AGE, INFIRMITY OR DISABLEMENT, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES OR FOR THE PUBLIC AT LARGE IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE AND WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITION OF LIFE OF THE SAID INHABITANTS BY THE PROVISION OF A PLAYING FIELD.

name: CHOOSE LIFE THE PRISONERS INITIATIVE
activities: We train up people in recovery from drugs/alcohol (and commonly ex offenders) to go into Schools ,Colleges ,Youth Offending Teams and Police Recruit to  educate Young People and professionals around the issues of addiction, drug dealing , criminal exploitation and county lines.  We also run two supported houses in the Anfield area of Liverpool for people often coming straight from prison.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN ALL ASPECTS OF THE DANGERS AND CONSEQUENCES OF DRUGS, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY ENGAGING WITH AND TRAINING RECOVERING DRUG ADDICTS TO DELIVER THE EDUCATION

name: THE OAK AND FURROWS WILDLIFE RESCUE CENTRE
activities: To care for all injured and orphaned wildlife in Gloucestershire band North Wiltshire. Education of the public to the needs of wildlife and visits with talks to schools and clubs in our area
objects: TO RELIEVE THE SUFFERING OF WILD ANIMALS IN WILTSHIRE, GLOUCESTERSHIRE, OXFORDSHIRE AND SURROUNDING AREAS WHICH HAVE BEEN INJURED OR ORPHANED, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY THE PROVISION OF A WILDLIFE RESCUE CENTRE.  TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OFTHE PUBLIC IN WILTSHIRE, GLOUCESTERSHIRE, OXFORDSHIRE AND SURROUNDING AREAS IN THE NEEDS OF WILDLIFE AND IN PROVIDING INITIAL CARE TO INJURED WILDLIFE, IN PARTICULAR THROUGH THE PROVISION OF AN ADVICE SERVICE AND BY ORGANISING VISITS TO SCHOOLS AND OTHER ORGANISATIONS IN THIS AREA.

name: CHEESY WAFFLES PROJECT
activities: Providing activities in order to have fun, meet friends, learn new skills, visit new places including sports, art and crafts, cookery, photography, performing arts, singing, dancing, gardening, games, quizzes, history, heritage, day trips, residentials and community.   Activities for adults age 16 plus include learning activities and programmes to promote independence and life skills.
objects: TO ADVANCE IN LIFE AND EDUCATION, FOR CHILDREN, YOUNG PEOPLE AND ADULTS, PARTICULARLY BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY WHO HAVE DISABILITIES THROUGH:  (A) THE PROVISION OF RECREATIONAL AND LEISURE TIME ACTIVITIES PROVIDED IN THE INTEREST OF SOCIAL WELFARE, DESIGNED TO IMPROVE THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE;  (B) PROVIDING SUPPORT AND ACTIVITIES WHICH DEVELOP THEIR SKILLS, CAPACITIES AND CAPABILITIES TO ENABLE THEM TO PARTICIPATE IN SOCIETY AS MATURE AND RESPONSIBLE INDIVIDUALS

name: THE UK MINDS FOUNDATION
activities: The UK Minds Foundation is comprised of 12 members.  These member's are organisations and projects each relating to a different neuro developmental, neurological or psychological condition, disorder or disease. The 12 members will completely fund the Foundation and it's grants; We do not intend to accept donations from the public nor apply for funding of any kind.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CIO ARE  1) THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC BY RAISING AWARENESS OF NEURODEVELOPMENTAL, NEUROLOGICAL AND  PSYCHOLOGICAL CONDITIONS AND DISORDERS.  2) TO RELIEVE THE NEEDS OF THOSE DISADVANTAGED BY MEANS OFDISABILITY AND/OR ILL HEALTH, IN PARTICULAR THOSE AFFECTED BY NEURODEVELOPMENTAL, NEUROLOGICAL AND PSYCHOLOGICAL CONDITIONS AND DISORDERS AS WELL AS THEIR FAMILIES AND CARERS.

name: SILVERTON EVANGELICAL CHURCH
activities: Independent Evangelical Church being a member of the South West Baptist Association serving Silverton and the surrounding area
objects: TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH

name: RUN WITH IT
activities: We deliver innovative and challenging learning programmes for children and adult learners. Although the Centre has a broad range of programmes and initiatives, the main focus is on raising levels of both literacy and numeracy using the stadium as the classroom.  We work with schools and education providers to design packages to support the needs of identified groups of all ages and abilities.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF CHILDREN, YOUNG PEOPLE AND ADULTS BY:  - OFFERING LEARNING SUPPORT FOR PRIMARY, SECONDARY AND SPECIAL SCHOOLS AND ADULT LEARNING CENTRES IN HULL, EAST RIDING OF YORKSHIRE AND LINCOLNSHIRE;  - DELIVERING A DIFFERENT WAY OF LEARNING, UTILISING THE UNIQUE AND STIMULATING ENVIRONMENT OF THE KCOM STADIUM IN HULL AND OTHER VENUES OFFERING A SIMILAR STIMULATING ENVIRONMENT;  - ENCOURAGING AND IMPROVING THE ATTITUDE, WELLBEING AND MOTIVATION OF PARTICIPANTS TO DEVELOP THEIR LITERACY AND NUMERACY SKILLS WHILE BROADENING THEIR UNDERSTANDING, CONFIDENCE AND EXPERIENCE OF EMPLOYABLE SKILLS;  - OTHER SUCH MEANS AS THE TRUSTEES THINK FIT IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE AIMS OF THE CHARITY.

name: LONDON INTERNATIONAL CHORAL CONDUCTING COMPETITION
activities: The advancement of the arts and the education of the public for the public benefit, by promoting and advancing the appreciation and enjoyment of music; centring on choral music and its performance. This will be achieved by means of (but not limited to) the running of an event which encompasses both a choral conducting competition and also public performances.
objects: THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE ARTS AND THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT, BY PROMOTING AND ADVANCING THE APPRECIATION AND ENJOYMENT OF MUSIC; CENTRING ON CHORAL MUSIC AND ITS PERFORMANCE. THIS WILL BE ACHIEVED BY MEANS OF(BUT NOT LIMITED TO)THE RUNNING OF AN EVENT WHICH ENCOMPASSES BOTH A CHORAL CONDUCTING COMPETITION AND ALSO PUBLIC PERFORMANCES.

name: LONDON INTERNATIONAL CHORAL CONDUCTING COMPETITION
activities: The advancement of the arts and the education of the public for the public benefit, by promoting and advancing the appreciation and enjoyment of music; centring on choral music and its performance. This will be achieved by means of (but not limited to) the running of an event which encompasses both a choral conducting competition and also public performances.
objects: THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE ARTS AND THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT, BY PROMOTING AND ADVANCING THE APPRECIATION AND ENJOYMENT OF MUSIC; CENTRING ON CHORAL MUSIC AND ITS PERFORMANCE. THIS WILL BE ACHIEVED BY MEANS OF(BUT NOT LIMITED TO)THE RUNNING OF AN EVENT WHICH ENCOMPASSES BOTH A CHORAL CONDUCTING COMPETITION AND ALSO PUBLIC PERFORMANCES.

name: K.U.K ALLIANCE
activities: K.U.K Alliance actively searches for avenues to make a difference, igniting challenging conversations with peers so we can empower and give back to the youth of Zimbabwe.   We specifically help orphaned and disadvantaged children in Zimbabwe obtain access to education, mentorship as well as address any issues that may act as a barrier to their successful future.
objects: K.U.K ALLIANCE IS ESTABLISHED TO FURTHER THE FOLLOWING CHARITABLE PURPOSES FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT IN AFRICA, ACCORDING TO THE LAW OF ENGLAND AND WALES WITH A SPECIAL FOCUS ON ZIMBABWE:-  1)TO ADVANCE EDUCATION;  2)TO RELIEVE SICKNESS AND TO PRESERVE AND PROTECT GOOD HEALTH;  3)TO RELIEVE POVERTY;  4)THE RELIEF OF FINANCIAL NEED AND SUFFERING AMONG VICTIMS OF NATURAL OR OTHER KINDS OF DISASTER IN THE FORM OF MONEY (OR OTHER MEANS DEEMED SUITABLE) FOR PERSONS, BODIES, ORGANISATIONS AND / OR COUNTRIES AFFECTED; AND  5)TO HELP YOUNG PEOPLE, ESPECIALLY BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY THROUGH LEISURE TIME ACTIVITIES, SO AS TO DEVELOP THEIR CAPABILITIES THAT THEY MAY GROW TO FULL MATURITY AS INDIVIDUALS AND MEMBERS OF SOCIETY.

name: SQUARE PEGS ARTS
activities: We run drama groups, singing and music projects, a professional Theatre Company, accessible film club and other creative activities for children, young people and adults with learning disabilities and autism in Kent & Medway. We celebrate difference, challenge perceptions and support people to shine in their own way. We nurture friendships, develop confidence, advance skills and improve wellbeing.
objects: TO RELIEVE THE NEEDS OF CHILDREN, YOUNG PEOPLE AND ADULTS WITH LEARNING DISABILITIES, AUTISM AND SOCIAL COMMUNICATION DIFFICULTIES BY PROVIDING DRAMA AND ARTS ACTIVITIES TO HELP DEVELOP THEIR CONFIDENCE, SELF-ESTEEM, COMMUNICATION SKILLS AND GENERAL WELLBEING WITH THE VIEW TO HELPING THEM TO INTEGRATE MORE INTO SOCIETY.

name: TIERRA NUEVA EUROPE
activities: Tierra Nueva Europe gathers, encourages and further equips those serving in marginalised communities around the UK and Europe. Our main way of doing this is through the Certificate in Transformational Ministry at the Margins, which is a 6 - 9 month training for those ministering at the 'margins', or desiring to do so.
objects: THE PREVENTION OR RELIEF OF POVERTY ANYWHERE IN THE WORLD BY PROVIDING OR ASSISTING IN THE PROVISION OF EDUCATION, TRAINING, HEALTHCARE PROJECTS AND ALL THE NECESSARY SUPPORT DESIGNED TO ENABLE INDIVIDUALS TO GENERATE A SUSTAINABLE INCOME AND BE SELF-SUFFICIENT.  THE ABOVE OBJECT IS CARRIED OUT IN ACCORDANCE WITH A CHRISTIAN ETHOS.

name: ST GILES BUILDING PRESERVATION TRUST LIMITED
activities: The St Giles Building Preservation Trust raises funds and donations through personal giving and events held at the St. Giles Centre. Events are recreational in nature, e.g. Quiz Nights, Dinner Nights and heritage events allowing public access to see an ordinarily private building. Funds raises are used for the preservation of the historic Grade II listed building for future generations.
objects: THE CHARITY'S OBJECTS ("OBJECTS") ARE SPECIFICALLY RESTRICTED TO THE FOLLOWING:  (A) FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT, THE PRESERVATION, RESTORATION, REPAIR, MAINTENANCE, IMPROVEMENT AND BEAUTIFICATION OF THE HISTORIC GRADE 2 LISTED BUILDING KNOWN AS ST GILES CHURCH, ST JOHNS GREEN, COLCHESTER IN THE COUNTY OF ESSEX, AND ALSO ITS CHURCHYARD AND ITS ASSOCIATED STRUCTURES, AND PROPERTIES WHICH ARE THE RESPONSIBILITY OF THE TRUSTEES, (INCLUDING BUT NOT BY WAY OF LIMITATION ANY BOUNDARIES, PATHS, ACCESSES, FENCES, AND WALLS); AND THE MONUMENTS, FITTINGS, FIXTURES, ORNAMENTS, ARTEFACTS AND CHATTELS OF THE CHURCH PROPERTIES, WHEREBY IN THIS DOCUMENT THE CHURCH, CHURCHYARD, AND OTHER SUCH STRUCTURES, BUILDINGS AND PROPERTIES ARE TOGETHER CALLED "THE CHURCH PROPERTIES"  (B) TO ADVANCE PUBLIC EDUCATION IN THE SUBJECTS OF THE CHURCH, ITS PROPERTIES AND HISTORY AND THE HISTORY, HERITAGE AND CULTURE OF THE LOCAL AREA  (C) TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND PROMOTE ARTS, CULTURE AND HERITAGE BY THE ESTABLISHMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF A MUSEUM AND/OR ART GALLERY FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC.  (D) TO ESTABLISH AND MAINTAIN A MUSEUM AND/OR ART GALLERY FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC.  (E) TO FURTHER SUCH OTHER PURPOSES AS ARE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE UNDER THE LAWS OF ENGLANDAND WALES AS THE TRUSTEES DETERMINE IN PARTICULAR BY LETTING SPACE TO CHARITIES OR COMMUNITY GROUPS TO SUPPORT THEIR CHARITABLE PURPOSES"

name: ST GILES BUILDING PRESERVATION TRUST LIMITED
activities: The St Giles Building Preservation Trust raises funds and donations through personal giving and events held at the St. Giles Centre. Events are recreational in nature, e.g. Quiz Nights, Dinner Nights and heritage events allowing public access to see an ordinarily private building. Funds raises are used for the preservation of the historic Grade II listed building for future generations.
objects: THE CHARITY'S OBJECTS ("OBJECTS") ARE SPECIFICALLY RESTRICTED TO THE FOLLOWING:  (A) FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT, THE PRESERVATION, RESTORATION, REPAIR, MAINTENANCE, IMPROVEMENT AND BEAUTIFICATION OF THE HISTORIC GRADE 2 LISTED BUILDING KNOWN AS ST GILES CHURCH, ST JOHNS GREEN, COLCHESTER IN THE COUNTY OF ESSEX, AND ALSO ITS CHURCHYARD AND ITS ASSOCIATED STRUCTURES, AND PROPERTIES WHICH ARE THE RESPONSIBILITY OF THE TRUSTEES, (INCLUDING BUT NOT BY WAY OF LIMITATION ANY BOUNDARIES, PATHS, ACCESSES, FENCES, AND WALLS); AND THE MONUMENTS, FITTINGS, FIXTURES, ORNAMENTS, ARTEFACTS AND CHATTELS OF THE CHURCH PROPERTIES, WHEREBY IN THIS DOCUMENT THE CHURCH, CHURCHYARD, AND OTHER SUCH STRUCTURES, BUILDINGS AND PROPERTIES ARE TOGETHER CALLED "THE CHURCH PROPERTIES"  (B) TO ADVANCE PUBLIC EDUCATION IN THE SUBJECTS OF THE CHURCH, ITS PROPERTIES AND HISTORY AND THE HISTORY, HERITAGE AND CULTURE OF THE LOCAL AREA  (C) TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND PROMOTE ARTS, CULTURE AND HERITAGE BY THE ESTABLISHMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF A MUSEUM AND/OR ART GALLERY FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC.  (D) TO ESTABLISH AND MAINTAIN A MUSEUM AND/OR ART GALLERY FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC.  (E) TO FURTHER SUCH OTHER PURPOSES AS ARE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE UNDER THE LAWS OF ENGLANDAND WALES AS THE TRUSTEES DETERMINE IN PARTICULAR BY LETTING SPACE TO CHARITIES OR COMMUNITY GROUPS TO SUPPORT THEIR CHARITABLE PURPOSES"

name: WAREHAM LIONS CLUB (CIO)
activities: The charity raises funds to enable it to make grants to organisations and individuals in need within its local area. We operate a tail lift enables minibus using volunteer drivers from within the club to provide transport to mainly elderly local residents. We support international appeals raised by our parent body, Lions Clubs International.
objects: 1.1	THE OBJECTS OF THE CLUB ARE SUCH PURPOSES AS ARE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE IN ENGLAND & WALES, INCLUDING IN PARTICULAR:  1.1.1	THE ADVANCEMENT OF CITIZENSHIP BY:  1.1.1.1	PROMOTING THE PRINCIPLES OF GOOD CITIZENSHIP;  1.1.1.2	ENCOURAGING MEMBERS TO TAKE AN ACTIVE INTEREST IN THE CIVIC, CULTURAL, SOCIAL AND MORAL WELFARE OF THE COMMUNITY;  1.1.1.3	PROVIDING A FORUM FOR THE OPEN DISCUSSION OF ALL MATTERS OF PUBLIC INTEREST; PROVIDED THAT PARTISAN POLITICS AND SECTARIAN RELIGION SHALL NOT BE DEBATEDBY MEMBERS;  1.1.1.4	ENCOURAGING SERVICE-MINDED PEOPLE TO SERVE THEIR COMMUNITY WITHOUT PERSONAL REWARD AND ENCOURAGING THE PROMOTION OF HIGH ETHICAL STANDARDS IN COMMERCE, INDUSTRY, PROFESSIONS, PUBLIC WORKS AND PRIVATE ENDEAVOURS;  1.1.1.5	SUPPORTING YOUTH TO DEVELOP THEIR SKILLS, CAPACITIES AND CAPABILITIES TO ENABLE THEM TO PARTICIPATE IN SOCIETY AS MATURE AND RESPONSIBLE INDIVIDUALS;  1.1.2	PROMOTING THE VOLUNTARY SECTOR FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT BY ASSOCIATING WITH LOCAL AUTHORITIES IN A COMMON EFFORT TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND PROVIDE FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION TO IMPROVE THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE OF PEOPLE IN LOCAL, NATIONAL AND INTERNATIONAL COMMUNITIES;  1.1.3	PROMOTING VOLUNTEERING;  1.1.4	THE RELIEF OF POVERTY AND THE RELIEF OF THOSE IN NEED IN PARTICULAR BY PROVIDING HUMANITARIAN AID AND DISASTER RELIEF;  1.1.5	THE ADVANCEMENT OF HEALTH OR THE SAVING OF LIVES BY PREVENTING AVOIDABLE BLINDNESS, ASSISTING DISABLED PEOPLE TO LEAD INDEPENDENT LIVES OR HELPING TO PREVENT OR MANAGE HEALTH ISSUES;  1.1.6	PROMOTING FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC THE CONSERVATION PROTECTION AND IMPROVEMENT OF THE PHYSICAL AND NATURAL ENVIRONMENT; AND/OR  1.1.7	PROMOTING COMMUNITY PARTICIPATION IN HEALTHY RECREATION.

name: GORGIAS CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: GENERAL CHARITABLE PURPOSES   THE ADVANCEMENT OF HEALTH OR SAVING OF LIVES   RELIGIOUS ACTIVITIES
objects: THE TRUSTEES SHALL HOLD THE CAPITAL AND INCOME OF THE TRUST FUND UPON TRUST TO APPLY THE INCOME, AND ALL OR SUCH PART OR PARTS OF THE CAPITAL, AT SUCH TIME OR TIMES AND IN SUCH MANNER TO OR FOR THE BENEFIT OF SUCH EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE OBJECTS AND PURPOSES IN ANY PART OF THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES MAY IN THEIR DISCRETION THINK FIT, INCLUDING (WITHOUT IMPOSING ANY LIMITATION OR REQUIREMENT):  (A)	THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE CHRISTIAN RELIGION; AND  (B)	THE PROMOTION OF HEALTH AND THE SAVING OF LIVES; AND  (C)	THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION, WHETHER IN THE MEDICAL SCIENCES OR OTHERWISE.  'CHARITABLE' SHALL MEAN CHARITABLE ACCORDING TO THE LAW OF ENGLAND AND WALES PROVIDED IT WILL NOT INCLUDE ANY PURPOSE WHICH IS NOT ALSO CHARITABLE IN ACCORDANCE WITHSECTION 7 OF THE CHARITIES AND TRUSTEE INVESTMENT (SCOTLAND) ACT 2005. FOR THE AVOIDANCE OF DOUBT, THE SYSTEM OF LAW GOVERNING THE CHARITY IS THE LAW OF ENGLAND AND WALES.

name: CF WARRIORS
activities: The charity's main activities are: a) We provide Warrior Packs that contain goods and/or equipment that can be used to aid the fitness and health of people with cystic fibrosis;  b) We fund research into cystic fibrosis, in particular the effects of exercise on people with cystic fibrosis and any treatments that can potentially aid recovery before, during and after exercise.
objects: FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT, THE RELIEF OF SICKNESS AND THE PRESERVATION OF HEALTH AMONG PEOPLE WITH CYSTIC FIBROSIS BY:    A) PROVIDING GOODS AND/OR EQUIPMENT THAT CAN BE USED TO AID THE FITNESS AND HEALTH OF PEOPLE WITH CYSTIC FIBROSIS AND SUPPORT AND PRACTICAL ADVICE FOR CARRYING OUT APPROPRIATE FORMS OF EXERCISE;    B) PROVIDING FUNDING FOR RESEARCH INTO CYSTIC FIBROSIS, IN PARTICULAR THE TREATMENT OF CYSTIC FIBROSIS AND THE EFFECTS OF EXERCISE ON PEOPLE WITH CYSTIC FIBROSIS.

name: THE JEET AND MOHINDRA WADHWA MEMORIAL FOUNDATION
activities: This charity makes grants to other charity or voluntary  organisations. Children,young people etc. For the benefit of general mankind. Charity make grants throughout England and wales. The trustees have decided to support other charities to help in the fields of education,medical needs and food banks.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CIO ARE TO ADVANCE SUCH CHARITABLE PURPOSES (ACCORDING TO THE LAW OF ENGLAND AND WALES) AS THE TRUSTEES SEE FIT FROM TIME TO TIME IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY MAKING GRANTS TO CHARITIES IN ENGLAND AND WALES.

name: ILARO DESCENDANTS UNION
activities: general charitable activities
objects: FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT TO RELIEVE POVERTY, TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND TO PROMOTE AND PROTECT GOOD HEALTH FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT IN THE UNITED KINGDOM AND NIGERIA.

name: BURY EDUCATION SUPPORT & TRAINING TRUST (BEST TRUST)
activities: 1.	To advance the education of the governors and members of the public in the primary and secondary curriculum subjects and running of educational establishments. 2.	To advance the education of the pupils at Greater Manchester schools by providing and assisting in the provision of facilities for education at such schools. 3.	To provide continuous professional development
objects: 1.	TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE GOVERNORS AND MEMBERS OF THE PUBLIC IN THE PRIMARY AND SECONDARY CURRICULUM SUBJECTS AND RUNNING OF EDUCATIONAL ESTABLISHMENTS.  2.	TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUPILS AT GREATER MANCHESTER SCHOOLS BY PROVIDING AND ASSISTING IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR EDUCATION AT SUCH SCHOOLS.  3.	TO PROVIDE CONTINUOUS PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT FOR EDUCATORS.

name: PAKEFIELD COASTWATCH
activities: A Coastal Surveillance Station that provides assistance in the protection and preservation of the lives and property of people at sea or along the coastline, within the visible range of the Coastwatch Station, by keeping a watch and providing support to Search and Rescue services and by assisting and reporting directly to HM Coastguard.
objects: TO ASSIST IN THE PROTECTION AND PRESERVATION OF LIFE AT SEA ALONG THE UNITED KINGDOM COASTLINE.

name: NIKKI'S WISHES
activities: The preservation and protection of the mental health of children who have suffered from the bereavement of a parent or sibling by providing and assisting in the provision of days out and activities for recreation in the interests of social welfare and such other support designed to protect mental health and wellbeing as the trustees may determine.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CIO ARE:    PRIMARILY, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE BOROUGH OF DACORUM IN HERTFORDSHIRE, ENGLAND THAT INCLUDES THE TOWNS OF HEMEL HEMPSTEAD, BERKHAMSTED, TRING AND THE WESTERN PART OF KINGS LANGLEY:    THE PRESERVATION AND PROTECTION OF THE MENTAL HEALTH OF CHILDREN WHO HAVE SUFFERED FROM THE BEREAVEMENT OF A PARENT OR SIBLING BY PROVIDING AND ASSISTING IN THE PROVISION OF DAYS OUT AND ACTIVITIES FOR RECREATION IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE AND SUCH OTHER SUPPORT DESIGNED TO PROTECT MENTAL HEALTH AND WELLBEING AS THE TRUSTEES MAY DETERMINE.

name: GLOBAL VILLAGE ACTION
activities: 1. Prevention and relief of poverty by the provision of food, clothing, shelter,  education, skills training, pastoral counselling, internships and exchange programmes in partnership with other organisations working to prevent or relieve poverty. 2.	The advancement of Christian Evangelical religion for the benefit of the public.
objects: 1. THE PREVENTION AND RELIEF OF POVERTY IN LONDON AND OVERSEAS FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC BY PROVIDING ACCESS TO FOOD, CLOTHING, SHELTER, SKILLS TRAINING, PASTORAL COUNSELLING, INTERNSHIPS AND EXCHANGE PROGRAMMES IN PARTNERSHIP WITH OTHER ORGANISATIONS WORKING TO PREVENT OR RELIEVE POVERTY. 2. THE ADVANCEMENT OF CHRISTIAN EVANGELICAL RELIGION FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATEMENTS OF BELIEF CONTAINED IN THE APPLICATION AND IN THE EVANGELICAL ALLIANCE BASIS OF FAITH DOCUMENT.

name: REVIVE CONGO
activities: Revive Congo ensures the advancement of education for young people in the UK through delivering a summer programme to provide informal education on the history of the Democratic Republic of Congo.   We also produce e-learning material to provide informal education on leadership and entrepreneurship skills for young people in the DRC to develop their capabilities and increase employability.
objects: (1) TO ADVANCE IN LIFE AND HELP YOUNG PEOPLE BETWEEN THE AGES OF 8 - 21 THROUGH:    (A) THE PROVISION OF RECREATIONAL AND LEISURE TIME ACTIVITIES PROVIDED IN THE INTEREST OF SOCIAL WELFARE, DESIGNED TO IMPROVE THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE;  (B) PROVIDING SUPPORT AND ACTIVITIES WHICH DEVELOP THEIR SKILLS, CAPACITIES AND CAPABILITIES TO ENABLE THEM TO PARTICIPATE IN SOCIETY AS MATURE AND RESPONSIBLE INDIVIDUALS.    2) TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN THE SUBJECT OF THE CULTURE AND HERITAGE OF THE DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF CONGO.

name: DAWLISH CHRISTIAN FELLOWSHIP
activities: We seek to demonstrate our Christian Faith by helping and providing services to the people of Dawlish and surrounding areas. We welcome people of all ages and faith or no faith. We hold a service each Sunday as well as other activities through the week.
objects: A) TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATEMENT OF BELIEFS APPEARING IN THE SCHEDULE HERETO IN DAWLISH AND IN SUCH OTHER PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT AND TO FULFIL SUCH OTHER PURPOSES WHICH ARE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE ACCORDING TO THE LAW OF ENGLAND AND WALES AND ARE CONNECTED WITH THE CHARITABLE WORK OF THE TRUST  B) TO RELIEVE SICKNESS AND FINANCIAL HARDSHIP AND TO PROMOTE AND PRESERVE GOOD HEALTH BY THE PROVISION OF FUNDS, GOODS OR SERVICES OF ANY KIND, INCLUDING THROUGH THE PROVISION OF COUNSELLING AND SUPPORT IN SUCH PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM OR THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES FROM TIME TO TIME MAY THINK FIT

name: FIRST UK
activities: FIRST UK is a disruptive STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Maths) educational charity - we use robots and inspirational role models from industry to equip the next generation with the technical knowledge and core life skills needed to tackle tomorrow's challenges
objects: FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF SCHOOL AGED CHILDREN IN STEM (SCIENCE TECHNOLOGY ENGINEERING MATHEMATICS) SUBJECTS AMONGST SCHOOLS THROUGH THE PROVISION OF STRUCTURED PREPARATION AND LEARNING FOR ROBOTICS COMPETITIONS.

name: ANWARUL QURAN TRUST
activities: Provide and facilitate the holding of prayer meetings,religious education classes, public lectures and celebration of religious festivals as well as improving the social welfare for the residents.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE RELIGION OF ISLAM IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE  TEACHINGS OF THE SUNNI HANAFI BRELVI SCHOOL FOR THE  INHABITANTS OF LYE AND THE SURROUNDING AREA, PARITCULARLY  BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY, THROUGH THE HOLDING OF PRAYER  MEETINGS, RELIGIOUS EDUCATION CLASSES, PUBLIC LECTURES,  PUBLIC CELEBRATION OF RELIGIOUS FESTIVALS.  TO FURTHER OR BENEFIT THE RESIDENTS OF LYE AND THE  NEIGHBOURHOOD, WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF SEX, SEXUAL  ORIENTATION, RACE OR OF POLITICAL, RELIGIOUS OR OTHER  OPINIONS BY ASSOCIATING TOGETHER THE SAID RESIDENTS AND THE  LOCAL AUTHORITIES, VOLUNTARY AND OTHER ORGANISATIONS IN A  COMMON EFFORT TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND TO PROVIDE  FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION  AND LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE OBJECTIVE OF IMPROVING  THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR THE RESIDENTS.

name: CONTACT
activities: To relieve the needs of homeless teenage girls and young women by providing safe accommodation.Supporting them to  return to education or find employment or training to enable them to participate in society as mature and responsible adults.
objects: TO RELIEVE THE NEEDS OF HOMELESS TEENAGE GIRLS AND YOUNG WOMEN IN THE MANCHESTER AREA BY  A)PROVIDING SAFE ACCOMMODATION;  B)SUPPORTING THE RESIDENTS TO ENABLE THEM TO RETURN TO EDUCATION OR FIND EMPLOYMENT OR TRAINING TO ENABLE THEM TO PARTICIPATE IN SOCIETY AS MATURE AND RESPONSIBLE INDIVIDUALS.

name: BUS USERS UK CHARITABLE TRUST LIMITED
activities: Courses for transport providers on meeting the needs of socially excluded people Structured events for people to meet their transport providers and policymakers and give a user perspective Run a registered Alternative Dispute Resolution service Monitor service performance  Raise awareness of transport needs of socially excluded communities Advise on government policy  Promote high standards
objects: 1.TO PROMOTE SOCIAL INCLUSION FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT BY PREVENTING PEOPLE FROM BECOMING SOCIALLY EXCLUDED, RELIEVING THE NEEDS OF THOSE PEOPLE WHO ARE SOCIALLY EXCLUDED AND ASSISTING THEM TO INTEGRATE INTO SOCIETY BY:  - ENCOURAGING TRANSPORT PROVIDERS TO ADAPT TRANSPORT SERVICES TO MEET THE NEEDS OF THOSE WHO ARE SOCIALLY EXCLUDED AND TO PROVIDE SAFE AND CONVENIENT TRANSPORT FACILITIES TO MEET THOSE NEEDS;  - RAISING AWARENESS OF THE TRANSPORT NEEDS OF PEOPLE WHO ARE SOCIALLY EXCLUDED;  FOR THE PURPOSE OF THIS CLAUSE SOCIALLY EXCLUDED MEANS BEING EXCLUDED FROM SOCIETY, OR PARTS OF SOCIETY AS A RESULT OF ONE OR MORE OF THE FOLLOWING FACTORS: FINANCIAL HARDSHIP, YOUTH OR OLD AGE, ILL HEALTH (PHYSICAL OR MENTAL) OR DISABILITY, LIVING IN AREAS WHERE THERE IS NO ADEQUATE TRANSPORT PROVISION, BEING UNABLE TO PROVIDE FOR TRANSPORT FROM PERSONAL RESOURCES.    2.TO PROMOTE FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT HIGH STANDARDS OF URBAN AND RURAL TRANSPORT PLANNING AND SERVICE DELIVERY IN ACCORDANCE WITH RELEVANT LEGISLATION, STANDARDS AND CONDITIONS AND TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC IN A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF THE SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CHANGES AFFECTING PUBLIC TRANSPORT PROVISION.

name: THE MERCURY FOUNDATION
activities: To advance the education of the public, in particular but not exclusively, in the history of the second world war and the Battle of Britain and the Royal Air Force, by the establishment and maintenance of a museum and associated collections, and such other means as the Trustees shall in their discretion determine.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CHARITY ARE, FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT:  TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY IN THE HISTORY OF THE SECOND WORLD WAR AND THE BATTLE OF BRITAIN AND THE ROYAL AIR FORCE, BY THE ESTABLISHMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF A MUSEUM AND ASSOCIATED COLLECTIONS AND SUCH OTHER MEANS AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL IN THEIR DISCRETION DETERMINE; AND  TO FURTHER ANY OTHER PURPOSE THAT IS CHARITABLE UNDER THE LAW OF ENGLAND AND WALES AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION DETERMINE.

name: THE FORT SLOUGH COMMUNITY CHURCH
activities: The Fort Slough Community Church is a community church based in the town of Slough in England. We believe in God and we use the christian Bible for preaching We depend on contributions from our members for our expenses we do not employ anybody  the church has a board made up of men and women to run the church
objects: 'TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT THROUGHOUT ENGLAND AND WALES IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR PUBLIC WORSHIP AND PRAYER.'

name: FENLAND BLACK OAK CIO
activities: The objects of the Charity are to preserve and promote the heritage and historical importance of the Jubilee Oak and Fenland Black Oak more generally by crafting a Jubilee Oak table and ensuring that the resulting work of craftmanship is displayed to the public.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CIO ARE:  3.1.1 TO PRESERVE AND PROMOTE THE HERITAGE AND HISTORICAL IMPORTANCE OF THE JUBILEE OAK AND FENLAND BLACK OAK MORE GENERALLY BY CRAFTING A JUBILEE OAK TABLE AND ENSURING THAT THE RESULTING WORK OF CRAFTSMANSHIP IS DISPLAYED TO THE PUBLIC AND BY PROMOTING AND RAISING AWARENESS, RESEARCH AND KNOWLEDGE RELATING TO THE JUBILEE OAK AND ALL MATTERS RELATING TO OR ASSOCIATED WITH THE FORMATION, HISTORY AND CONSERVATION OF FENLAND BLACK OAK IN SUCH WAYS AS THE TRUSTEES DEEM APPROPRIATE; AND  3.1.2 TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION AND TRAINING IN THE CRAFTS OF CARPENTRY AND JOINERY ASSOCIATED WITH PRESERVING AND WORKING WITH FENLAND BLACK OAK.

name: STAND AGAINST SEXUAL EXPLOITATION
activities: Activities that help to relieve need, particularly through service provision    Activities that promote the elimination of harm and human rights abuses, particular through exiting services   Developing a network of services and other stakeholders and facilitating collaboration   Research and development of solutions   Providing information and advice to services and other interested partie
objects: 3.1 THE OBJECTS FOR WHICH THE COMPANY IS ESTABLISHED (OBJECTS) ARE:  3.1.1 TO PROMOTE HUMAN RIGHTS (AS SET OUT IN THE UNIVERSAL DECLARATION OF HUMAN RIGHTS AND SUBSEQUENT UNITED NATIONS CONVENTIONS AND DECLARATIONS) IN RELATION TO HUMAN RIGHTS ABUSES OF PEOPLE INVOLVED IN COMMERCIAL SEXUAL EXPLOITATION ("CSE"), PARTICULARLY ABUSES THAT CREATE BARRIERS TO EXIT FROM CSE, THROUGHOUT GREAT BRITAIN BY ALL OR ANY OF THE FOLLOWING MEANS:  I. RELIEVING NEED AMONG THE VICTIMS OF HUMAN RIGHTS ABUSE;  II. RESEARCH INTO HUMAN RIGHTS ISSUES;  III. PROVIDING TECHNICAL ADVICE TO GOVERNMENT AND OTHERS ON HUMAN RIGHTS MATTERS;  IV. RAISING AWARENESS OF HUMAN RIGHTS ISSUES;  V. COMMENTING ON PROPOSED HUMAN RIGHTS LEGISLATION; AND  VI. ELIMINATING INFRINGEMENTSOF HUMAN RIGHTS  (THE "HUMAN RIGHTS OBJECT")  3.1.2 TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN GENERAL (AND PARTICULARLY AMONGST POLICY MAKERS AND SERVICE PROVIDERS TO VICTIMS OF HUMAN RIGHTS ABUSE IN RELATION TO HUMAN RIGHTS ABUSES OF PEOPLE INVOLVEDIN COMMERCIAL SEXUAL EXPLOITATION ("CSE"), PARTICULARLY FOCUSING ON RELIEVING NEED AND ELIMINATING THE ABUSES) (THE "EDUCATION OBJECT")  3.1.3 THE PREVENTION OR RELIEF OF POVERTY OR FINANCIAL HARDSHIP AMONG VICTIMS OF HUMAN RIGHTS ABUSE BY VIRTUE OFINVOLVEMENT IN CSE IN GREAT BRITAIN, BY PROVIDING OR ASSISTING IN THE PROVISION OF EDUCATION, TRAINING AND ALL THE NECESSARY NON-FINANCIAL SUPPORT DESIGNED TO ENABLE INDIVIDUALS TO GENERATE A SUSTAINABLE INCOME AND BE SELF-SUFFICIENT (THE "PREVENTIONAND RELIEF OF POVERTY OBJECT")

name: QQS GLOBAL
activities: To support such general charitable purposes as the trustees may in their absolute discretion determine, in particular but not limited to the relief of poverty, the relief of sickness and preservation and protection of good health and the advancement of education for the benefit of the public in England and around the world and its environs (hereinafter called the "area of benefit").
objects: TO SUPPORT SUCH GENERAL CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS THE TRUSTEES MAY IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION DETERMINE, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE RELIEF OF POVERTY, THE RELIEF OF SICKNESS AND PRESERVATION AND PROTECTION OF GOOD HEALTH AND THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC IN ENGLAND AND AROUND THE WORLD AND ITS ENVIRONS (HEREINAFTER CALLED THE "AREA OF BENEFIT").

name: St Richard's CE Preschool
activities: We offer early years pre-school provision for up to 30 children per session, morning and afternoon, five days a week during school term time.
objects: THE CHARITY WORKS FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT HAVING AS ITS OBJECTS THE DEVELOPMENT AND EDUCATION OF CHILDREN BY:  1)	PROMOTING THEIR CARE AND SAFETY;  2)	PROMOTING THEIR EDUCATION AND PROMOTING PARENTAL INVOLVEMENT;  3)	PROMOTING THEIR HEALTH AND WELLBEING;  4)	PROVIDING SERVICES TO SUPPORT THEM AND THEIR FAMILIES AND CARERS;  5)	PROVIDING SERVICES TO INDIVIDUALS HOLDING MEMBERSHIP OF THE CIO.

name: IVYBRIDGE U3A
activities: The advancement of education for older people and those who are retired from full-time work by all means, including associated activities conducive to learning and personal development, in Ivybridge and its surrounding area.
objects: THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION AND, IN PARTICULAR, THE EDUCATION OF OLDER PEOPLE AND THOSE WHO ARE RETIRED FROM FULL TIME WORK IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT BY ALL MEANS, INCLUDING ASSOCIATED ACTIVITIES CONDUCIVE TO LEARNING AND PERSONAL DEVELOPMENT IN IVYBRIDGE AND ITS SURROUNDING AREA.

name: POOLE METHODISTS
activities: Religious, social community and pastoral activities.
objects: THE PURPOSES OF THE METHODIST CHURCH ARE AND SHALL BE DEEMED TO HAVE BEEN SINCE THE DATE OF UNION THE ADVANCEMENT OF -  (A) THE CHRISTIAN FAITH IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE DOCTRINAL STANDARDS AND THE DISCIPLINE OF THE METHODIST CHURCH;  (B) ANY CHARITABLE PURPOSE FOR THE TIME BEING OF ANY CONNEXIONAL, DISTRICT, CIRCUIT, LOCAL OR OTHER ORGANISATION OF THE METHODIST CHURCH;  (C) ANY CHARITABLE PURPOSE FOR THE TIME BEING OF ANY SOCIETY OR INSTITUTION SUBSIDUARY OR ANCILLARY TO THE METHODIST CHURCH;  (D) ANY PURPOSE FOR THE TIME BEING OF ANY CHARITY BEING A CHARITY SUBSIDIARY OR ANCILLARY TO THE METHODIST CHURCH.

name: RATTERY ENVIRONMENT GROUP
activities: To promote the improvement of the community for the benefit of the inhabitants of the parish of  Rattery , in particular but not exclusively by conserving, protecting and improving the natural and physical environment.
objects: 1 TO PROMOTE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC THE CONSERVATION PROTECTION AND IMPROVEMENT OF THE PHYSICAL AND NATURAL ENVIRONMENT OF THE PARISH OF RATTERY BY PROMOTING ITS BIOLOGICAL DIVERSITY AND IN PARTICULAR BY PROVIDING ACCESS TO WOODLANDS AND WETLANDS ALONG THE VALLEY OF THE BIDWELL BROOK WITHIN THE PARISH; AND  2 TO PROMOTE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF RATTERY PARISH AND THE SURROUNDING AREA THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION OF INDIVIDUALS WHOHAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, AGE, INFIRMITY OR DISABLEMENT, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES OR FOR THE PUBLIC AT LARGE IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE AND WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONOF LIFE OF THE SAID INHABITANTS

name: TEIGN VALLEY MUSEUM AND ARCHIVE TRUST
activities: To establish and maintain for the benefit of the public a History Centre  relating to the Teign Valley
objects: 1) TO ESTABLISH AND MAINTAIN A MUSEUM FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC SO AS TO ENABLE THEM TO VIEW HISTORICAL DOCUMENTS AND OBJECTS RELATING TO THE TEIGN VALLEY  2)TO ENCOURAGE HISTORICAL RESEARCH AND PRESENTATION  3)TO ADVANCE EDUCATION BY ORGANIZING EXHIBITIONS AND OTHER EDUCATIONAL EVENTS AND DISPLAYS TO EXAMINE ASPECTS OF LOCAL HISTORY  4)TO ESTABLISH COLLECT AND MAINTAIN AN ARCHIVE OF DOCUMENTS AND ARTEFACTS CONCERNING THE HISTORY OF THE TEIGN VALLEY IN ORDER TO PROVIDE THE GENERAL PUBLIC WITHOPPORTUNITIES FOR RESEARCH AND TO ENCOURAGE EDUCATION INTO LOCAL HISTORY  5)TO PROMOTE INTEREST AND ACTIVE RESEARCH INTO LOCAL HISTORY GENERALLY AND PARTICULARLY ENCOURAGING PARTICIPATION IN SUCH ACTIVITY BY THE SCHOOLS IN THE TEIGN VALLEY

name: TEIGN VALLEY MUSEUM AND ARCHIVE TRUST
activities: To establish and maintain for the benefit of the public a History Centre  relating to the Teign Valley
objects: 1) TO ESTABLISH AND MAINTAIN A MUSEUM FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC SO AS TO ENABLE THEM TO VIEW HISTORICAL DOCUMENTS AND OBJECTS RELATING TO THE TEIGN VALLEY  2)TO ENCOURAGE HISTORICAL RESEARCH AND PRESENTATION  3)TO ADVANCE EDUCATION BY ORGANIZING EXHIBITIONS AND OTHER EDUCATIONAL EVENTS AND DISPLAYS TO EXAMINE ASPECTS OF LOCAL HISTORY  4)TO ESTABLISH COLLECT AND MAINTAIN AN ARCHIVE OF DOCUMENTS AND ARTEFACTS CONCERNING THE HISTORY OF THE TEIGN VALLEY IN ORDER TO PROVIDE THE GENERAL PUBLIC WITHOPPORTUNITIES FOR RESEARCH AND TO ENCOURAGE EDUCATION INTO LOCAL HISTORY  5)TO PROMOTE INTEREST AND ACTIVE RESEARCH INTO LOCAL HISTORY GENERALLY AND PARTICULARLY ENCOURAGING PARTICIPATION IN SUCH ACTIVITY BY THE SCHOOLS IN THE TEIGN VALLEY
