name: EQUAL AQUA
activities: TO RELIEVE POVERTY AND TO PRESERVE AND PROTECT GOOD HEALTH FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT OF COMMUNITIES IN AFRICA BY:-  1. IMPROVING ACCESS TO SAFE AND SUSTAINABLE DRINKING WATER;  2. EXPANDING ACCESS TO ADEQUATE AND EQUITABLE SANITATION AND HYGIENE, PAYING SPECIAL ATTENTION TO THE NEEDS OF WOMEN AND GIRLS AND THOSE IN VULNERABLE SITUATIONS;  3. TAKING ACTION TO PROMOTE CONSERVATION OF THE NATURAL ENVIRONMENT; IMPROVE WATER QUALITY BY REDUCING POLLUTION; PROTECT AND RESTORE WATER-RELATED ECOSYSTEMS.  4.INCREASING WATER-USE EFFICIENCY TO ADDRESS WATER SCARCITY AND SUBSTANTIALLY REDUCE THE NUMBER OF PEOPLE SUFFERING FROM WATER SCARCITY;  5. SUPPORTING AND STRENGTHENING THE PARTICIPATION OF LOCAL COMMUNITIES IN IMPROVING WATER AND SANITATION MANAGEMENT;  6. IMPROVING EDUCATION AROUND WATER AND SANITATION ISSUES IN SCHOOLS, YOUTH GROUPS AND COMMUNITY CENTRES;  7. COLLABORATING WITH OTHER ORGANISATIONS WITH SIMILAR OBJECTIVES BOTH WITHIN AND OUTSIDE UGANDA TO ACHIEVE THESE OBJECTIVES;  8. RAISING AWARENESS AROUND WATER INEQUALITY IN AFRICA, TO BUILD SUPPORT IN THE UK AND WORLDWIDE TO TACKLE THESE INEQUALITIES;  9. RAISING FUNDS TO SUPPORT THESE ACTIVITIES THROUGH GRANT APPLICATIONS, PERSONAL AND PRIVATE FUND RAISING, AND CORPORATE AND COMMUNITYDONATIONS; AND  10. PROVIDING MENTORSHIP, TRAINING AND OTHER PEDAGOGICAL SUPPORT FOR MEMBERS OF EQUAL AQUA AND OUR AFFILIATES.  NOTHING IN THIS CONSTITUTION SHALL AUTHORISE AN APPLICATION OF THE PROPERTY OF THE CIO FOR PURPOSES WHICH ARE NOT CHARITABLE IN ACCORDANCE WITH (SECTION 7 OF THE CHARITIES AND TRUSTEES INVESTMENT (SCOTLAND) ACT 2005) AND (SECTION 2 OF THE CHARITIES ACT (NORTHERN IRELAND) 2008).
objects: TO RELIEVE POVERTY AND TO PRESERVE AND PROTECT GOOD HEALTH FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT OF COMMUNITIES IN AFRICA BY:-  1. IMPROVING ACCESS TO SAFE AND SUSTAINABLE DRINKING WATER;  2. EXPANDING ACCESS TO ADEQUATE AND EQUITABLE SANITATION AND HYGIENE, PAYING SPECIAL ATTENTION TO THE NEEDS OF WOMEN AND GIRLS AND THOSE IN VULNERABLE SITUATIONS;  3. TAKING ACTION TO PROMOTE CONSERVATION OF THE NATURAL ENVIRONMENT; IMPROVE WATER QUALITY BY REDUCING POLLUTION; PROTECT AND RESTORE WATER-RELATED ECOSYSTEMS.  4.INCREASING WATER-USE EFFICIENCY TO ADDRESS WATER SCARCITY AND SUBSTANTIALLY REDUCE THE NUMBER OF PEOPLE SUFFERING FROM WATER SCARCITY;  5. SUPPORTING AND STRENGTHENING THE PARTICIPATION OF LOCAL COMMUNITIES IN IMPROVING WATER AND SANITATION MANAGEMENT;  6. IMPROVING EDUCATION AROUND WATER AND SANITATION ISSUES IN SCHOOLS, YOUTH GROUPS AND COMMUNITY CENTRES;  7. COLLABORATING WITH OTHER ORGANISATIONS WITH SIMILAR OBJECTIVES BOTH WITHIN AND OUTSIDE UGANDA TO ACHIEVE THESE OBJECTIVES;  8. RAISING AWARENESS AROUND WATER INEQUALITY IN AFRICA, TO BUILD SUPPORT IN THE UK AND WORLDWIDE TO TACKLE THESE INEQUALITIES;  9. RAISING FUNDS TO SUPPORT THESE ACTIVITIES THROUGH GRANT APPLICATIONS, PERSONAL AND PRIVATE FUND RAISING, AND CORPORATE AND COMMUNITYDONATIONS; AND  10. PROVIDING MENTORSHIP, TRAINING AND OTHER PEDAGOGICAL SUPPORT FOR MEMBERS OF EQUAL AQUA AND OUR AFFILIATES.  NOTHING IN THIS CONSTITUTION SHALL AUTHORISE AN APPLICATION OF THE PROPERTY OF THE CIO FOR PURPOSES WHICH ARE NOT CHARITABLE IN ACCORDANCE WITH (SECTION 7 OF THE CHARITIES AND TRUSTEES INVESTMENT (SCOTLAND) ACT 2005) AND (SECTION 2 OF THE CHARITIES ACT (NORTHERN IRELAND) 2008).

name: THE THRONEROOM
activities: THE OBJECT OF THE CIO IS TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH IN THE UNITED KINGDOM AND THE WORLD FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC, MAINLY, BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY, BY HOLDING PRAYER MEETINGS, PUBLIC WORSHIP AND FELLOWSHIP MEETINGS, TEACHING ADULTS AND CHILDREN INCLUDING AT SUNDAY SCHOOL, VISITING THE SICK AND ELDERLY, SUPPORTING FOOD BANKS AND PRODUCING AND/OR DISTRIBUTING LITERATURE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATEMENT OF FAITH TO ENLIGHTEN OTHERS ABOUT THE CHRISTIAN FAITH.
objects: THE OBJECT OF THE CIO IS TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH IN THE UNITED KINGDOM AND THE WORLD FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC, MAINLY, BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY, BY HOLDING PRAYER MEETINGS, PUBLIC WORSHIP AND FELLOWSHIP MEETINGS, TEACHING ADULTS AND CHILDREN INCLUDING AT SUNDAY SCHOOL, VISITING THE SICK AND ELDERLY, SUPPORTING FOOD BANKS AND PRODUCING AND/OR DISTRIBUTING LITERATURE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE STATEMENT OF FAITH TO ENLIGHTEN OTHERS ABOUT THE CHRISTIAN FAITH.

name: OLDHAM INSPIRING YOUTH
activities: THE OBJECT OF THE CHARITY IS:  TO ADVANCE IN LIFE AND HELP YOUNG PEOPLE IN OLDHAM AND THE SURROUNDING AREAS THROUGH:  A)	THE PROVISION OF RECREATIONAL AND LEISURE TIME ACTIVITIES PROVIDED IN THE INTEREST OF SOCIAL WELFARE, DESIGNED TO IMPROVE THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE;  B)	PROVIDING SUPPORT AND ACTIVITIES WHICH DEVELOP THEIR SKILLS, CAPACITIES AND CAPABILITIES TO ENABLE THEM TO PARTICIPATE IN SOCIETY AS MATURE AND RESPONSIBLE INDIVIDUALS.
objects: THE OBJECT OF THE CHARITY IS:  TO ADVANCE IN LIFE AND HELP YOUNG PEOPLE IN OLDHAM AND THE SURROUNDING AREAS THROUGH:  A)	THE PROVISION OF RECREATIONAL AND LEISURE TIME ACTIVITIES PROVIDED IN THE INTEREST OF SOCIAL WELFARE, DESIGNED TO IMPROVE THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE;  B)	PROVIDING SUPPORT AND ACTIVITIES WHICH DEVELOP THEIR SKILLS, CAPACITIES AND CAPABILITIES TO ENABLE THEM TO PARTICIPATE IN SOCIETY AS MATURE AND RESPONSIBLE INDIVIDUALS.

name: MASJID ABU BAKR WALTHAMSTOW
activities: MASJID ABU BAKR IS PLACE OF WORSHIP, IT OFFERS FAMILY EDUCATIONAL CLASSES, MARRIAGE SERVICES AND BEREAVEMENT COUNSELLING AND LEGAL ADVICE. THE MASJID STANDS AS A PILLAR WITHIN THE COMMUNITY AND HELPS CONNECT DIVERSE GROUPS OF PEOPLE AND IS AN ACTIVE PARTICIPANT WITHIN ALL FAITH COMMUNITIES.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE ISLAMIC RELIGION IN WALTHAMSTOW FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC, IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE BELIEFS AND PRACTICES OF THE SUNNI HANAFI DEOBANDI SCHOOL OF THOUGHT, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY BY THE PROVISION OF A MASJID AND THE HOLDING OF PRAYER MEETINGS, LECTURES, PUBLIC CELEBRATIONS OF RELIGIOUS FESTIVALS AND THE PUBLICATION AND DISTRIBUTION OF LITERATURE TO ENLIGHTEN OTHERS ABOUT THE ISLAMIC RELIGION.

name: ABNEY DISTRICT COMMUNITY ASSOCIATION
activities: THE OBJECTS OF THE CIO ARE:    (A) TO PROMOTE THE BENEFIT OF THE RESIDENTS OF ABNEY AND THE NEIGHBOURHOOD AS DELINEATED IN THE ANNEXED PLAN (HEREINAFTER CALLED 'THE AREA OF BENEFIT') WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF SEX, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, AGE, DISABILITY, NATIONALITY, RACE OR OF POLITICAL, RELIGIOUS OR OTHER OPINIONS BY ASSOCIATING TOGETHER THE SAID RESIDENTS AND THE LOCAL AUTHORITIES, VOLUNTARY ORGANISATIONS AND INHABITANTS IN A COMMON EFFORT TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND TO PROVIDE FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION AND LEISURE-TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITION OF LIFE FOR THE SAID INHABITANTS.    IN FURTHERANCE OF THESE OBJECTS BUT NOT OTHERWISE, THE TRUSTEES SHALL HAVE POWER:    TO ESTABLISH OR SECURETHE ESTABLISHMENT OF A COMMUNITY CENTRE AND TO MAINTAIN OR MANAGE OR CO-OPERATE WITH ANY STATUTORY AUTHORITY IN THE MAINTENANCE AND MANAGEMENT OF SUCH A CENTRE FOR ACTIVITIES PROMOTED BY THE CHARITY IN FURTHERANCE OF THE ABOVE OBJECTS.    (B) TO PROMOTE SUCH OTHER EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE PURPOSES WITHIN THE LAWS OF ENGLAND AND WALES AS MAY FROM TIME TO TIME BE DETERMINED, INCLUDING THE PROVISION OF PUBLIC AMENITIES.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CIO ARE:    (A) TO PROMOTE THE BENEFIT OF THE RESIDENTS OF ABNEY AND THE NEIGHBOURHOOD AS DELINEATED IN THE ANNEXED PLAN (HEREINAFTER CALLED 'THE AREA OF BENEFIT') WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF SEX, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, AGE, DISABILITY, NATIONALITY, RACE OR OF POLITICAL, RELIGIOUS OR OTHER OPINIONS BY ASSOCIATING TOGETHER THE SAID RESIDENTS AND THE LOCAL AUTHORITIES, VOLUNTARY ORGANISATIONS AND INHABITANTS IN A COMMON EFFORT TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND TO PROVIDE FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION AND LEISURE-TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITION OF LIFE FOR THE SAID INHABITANTS.    IN FURTHERANCE OF THESE OBJECTS BUT NOT OTHERWISE, THE TRUSTEES SHALL HAVE POWER:    TO ESTABLISH OR SECURETHE ESTABLISHMENT OF A COMMUNITY CENTRE AND TO MAINTAIN OR MANAGE OR CO-OPERATE WITH ANY STATUTORY AUTHORITY IN THE MAINTENANCE AND MANAGEMENT OF SUCH A CENTRE FOR ACTIVITIES PROMOTED BY THE CHARITY IN FURTHERANCE OF THE ABOVE OBJECTS.    (B) TO PROMOTE SUCH OTHER EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE PURPOSES WITHIN THE LAWS OF ENGLAND AND WALES AS MAY FROM TIME TO TIME BE DETERMINED, INCLUDING THE PROVISION OF PUBLIC AMENITIES.

name: EMMIES KITCHEN
activities: THE RELIEF OF SICKNESS AMONG HOSPITALISED CHILDREN IN THE NORTH WEST OF ENGLAND BY THE PROVISION OF SUPPORT AND FACILITIES TO THEIR PARENTS AND CARERS, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY THE PROVISION OF HOT MEALS AND RESPITE, TO ENABLE FAMILIES AND CARERS TO HAVE EXTENDED VISITS.
objects: THE RELIEF OF SICKNESS AMONG HOSPITALISED CHILDREN IN THE NORTH WEST OF ENGLAND BY THE PROVISION OF SUPPORT AND FACILITIES TO THEIR PARENTS AND CARERS, IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY THE PROVISION OF HOT MEALS AND RESPITE, TO ENABLE FAMILIES AND CARERS TO HAVE EXTENDED VISITS.

name: DARWIN DOGS
activities: FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT, TO RELIEVE THE NEEDS OF ADULTS WHO HAVE A DIAGNOSIS OF, AND ARE DISABLED BY, A LONG TERM MENTAL HEALTH CONDITION, OR ARE ON THE AUTISM SPECTRUM, ACROSS GREAT BRITAIN, BY PROVIDING ACCESS TO SPECIALISED DOG TRAINING SERVICES TO ALLOW THEIR PETS TO BE TRAINED AS SPECIALIST ASSISTANCE DOGS, PROVIDING FREE AND LOW-COST TRAINING WHERE BENEFICIARIES CANNOT AFFORD IT, AND EDUCATING THOSE PEOPLE AND THEIR GUARDIANS/CARERS AND FAMILIES IN THE USE AND CARE OF SUCH ASSISTANCE DOGS, AND BY RAISING AWARENESS OF THE ISSUES FACED BY SUCH PEOPLE.
objects: FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT, TO RELIEVE THE NEEDS OF ADULTS WHO HAVE A DIAGNOSIS OF, AND ARE DISABLED BY, A LONG TERM MENTAL HEALTH CONDITION, OR ARE ON THE AUTISM SPECTRUM, ACROSS GREAT BRITAIN, BY PROVIDING ACCESS TO SPECIALISED DOG TRAINING SERVICES TO ALLOW THEIR PETS TO BE TRAINED AS SPECIALIST ASSISTANCE DOGS, PROVIDING FREE AND LOW-COST TRAINING WHERE BENEFICIARIES CANNOT AFFORD IT, AND EDUCATING THOSE PEOPLE AND THEIR GUARDIANS/CARERS AND FAMILIES IN THE USE AND CARE OF SUCH ASSISTANCE DOGS, AND BY RAISING AWARENESS OF THE ISSUES FACED BY SUCH PEOPLE.

name: EPSOM REPAIR CAFE
activities: TO PROTECT AND SAFEGUARD THE ENVIRONMENT FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT THROUGH THE PROMOTION OF REPAIR AND RE-USE OF PRODUCTS AS A MEANS OF PREVENTING AND MINIMISING WASTE DISPOSAL.
objects: TO PROTECT AND SAFEGUARD THE ENVIRONMENT FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT THROUGH THE PROMOTION OF REPAIR AND RE-USE OF PRODUCTS AS A MEANS OF PREVENTING AND MINIMISING WASTE DISPOSAL.

name: LIVING GOD GOSPEL CHURCH
activities: TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN RELIGION FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY THROUGH THE HOLDING OF PRAYER MEETINGS, LECTURES, PUBLIC CELEBRATION OF RELIGIOUS FESTIVALS, PRODUCING AND/OR DISTRIBUTING LITERATURE ON THE CHRISTIAN FAITH TO ENLIGHTEN OTHERS ABOUT THE CHRISTIAN RELIGION, PROVIDING PASTORAL CARE AND CARRYING OUT OUTREACH WORK IN THE COMMUNITY
objects: TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN RELIGION FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC IN PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY THROUGH THE HOLDING OF PRAYER MEETINGS, LECTURES, PUBLIC CELEBRATION OF RELIGIOUS FESTIVALS, PRODUCING AND/OR DISTRIBUTING LITERATURE ON THE CHRISTIAN FAITH TO ENLIGHTEN OTHERS ABOUT THE CHRISTIAN RELIGION, PROVIDING PASTORAL CARE AND CARRYING OUT OUTREACH WORK IN THE COMMUNITY

name: THE HURST WATER MEADOW TRUST
activities: 1. TO PROMOTE, FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT, THE CONSERVATION, PROTECTION AND IMPROVEMENT OF THE PHYSICAL AND NATURAL ENVIRONMENT OF HURST WATER MEADOW AND ANY OTHER LAND ACQUIRED BY THE TRUST, ITS TERRESTRIAL AND AQUATIC LIFE AND THEIR HABITATS  2. TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN THE STUDY AND RESEARCH OF LAND OWNED OR MANAGED BY THE TRUST AND ITS CONSERVATION AND THE DISSEMINATION OF THE USEFUL RESULTS OF SUCH RESEARCH;  3. TO PROVIDE OR ASSIST IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION OF THE PUBLIC AT LARGE WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE.
objects: 1. TO PROMOTE, FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT, THE CONSERVATION, PROTECTION AND IMPROVEMENT OF THE PHYSICAL AND NATURAL ENVIRONMENT OF HURST WATER MEADOW AND ANY OTHER LAND ACQUIRED BY THE TRUST, ITS TERRESTRIAL AND AQUATIC LIFE AND THEIR HABITATS  2. TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN THE STUDY AND RESEARCH OF LAND OWNED OR MANAGED BY THE TRUST AND ITS CONSERVATION AND THE DISSEMINATION OF THE USEFUL RESULTS OF SUCH RESEARCH;  3. TO PROVIDE OR ASSIST IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION OF THE PUBLIC AT LARGE WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE.

name: PROUD 'N' DIVERSE
activities: TO PROMOTE EQUALITY AND DIVERSITY FOR THE LGBTQI+ COMMUNITY BY GIVING ADVICE AND COUNSELLING AND HELP WITH ANY SOCIAL INCLUSION PROBLEMS THEY MAY BE FACING WHILST COMING TO TERMS WITH THEIR SEXUAL ORIENTATION OR GENDER IDENTITY. THIS IS PRIMARILY LOCATED IN LEEDS AND OTHER SURROUNDING AREAS OF WEST YORKSHIRE WITH OUR OUTREACH PROGRAMME.
objects: TO PROMOTE EQUALITY AND DIVERSITY FOR THE LGBTQI+ COMMUNITY BY GIVING ADVICE AND COUNSELLING AND HELP WITH ANY SOCIAL INCLUSION PROBLEMS THEY MAY BE FACING WHILST COMING TO TERMS WITH THEIR SEXUAL ORIENTATION OR GENDER IDENTITY. THIS IS PRIMARILY LOCATED IN LEEDS AND OTHER SURROUNDING AREAS OF WEST YORKSHIRE WITH OUR OUTREACH PROGRAMME.

name: MRS JANE CART'S TRUST
activities: Supporting clergy, clergy widows and the maiden daughters of clergy under the age of 45
objects: 1. FOR THE RELIEF OF POOR CLERGYMEN. 2. RELIEF OF WIDOWS AND MAIDEN DAUGHTERS OF CLERGYMEN AGED 45 YEARS OR UPWARDS. 3. UPKEEP OF A MONUMENT AND CLOCK IN DUNSTABLE PARISH CHURCH. 4. A SERMON TO BE PREACHED IN DUNSTABLE PARISH CHURCH. 5. FOR THE RELIEFOF POOR MEMBERS OF THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND RESIDENT IN DUNSTABLE EITHER IN GIFTS IN KIND OR GRANTS OF MONEY.

name: THE FREDERICK RAY TRUST
activities: Almshousing.
objects: PROVISION OF COTTAGES FOR OCCUPATION BY AGED, POOR OR INFIRM PERSONS WHO MAY BE EITHER SINGLE PERSONS OF EITHER SEX OR MARRIED COUPLES. PREFERENCE TO BE GIVEN FIRST TO PERSONS WHO (OR IN THE CASE OF A MARRIED COUPLE AT LEAST ONE OF WHOM) SHALL HAVE BEEN IN THE SERVICE OR EMPLOYMENT OF THE LATE FREDERICK RAY AND NEXT TO INHABITANTS OF RURAL KEMPSTON, STAGSDEN OR BEDFORD. ANY SURPLUS INCOME SHALL BE APPLIED IN MAKING WEEKLY OR OTHER ALLOWANCES TO OCCUPANTS AND, IF TRUSTEES THINK FIT IN PURCHASING NECESSITIES OR COMFORTS FOR THEM OR OTHERWISE PROVIDING FOR THEIR MAINTENANCE AND SUPPORT.

name: WILLIAM CRAWLEY
activities: The charity operates in the Luton Deanery and its objective is to give grants for the relief of poverty through the Churches in that area.
objects: RELIEF ON MONEY, BREAD OR COALS TO SUCH POOR PERSONS OF THE FORMER ANCIENT PARISH OF LUTON.

name: ROSEBERY PARK
activities: Public pleasure ground
objects: PUBLIC PLEASURE GROUND FOR THE RESORT AND RECREATION OF THE INHABITANTS.

name: JESSIE ANN ALFORD CHARITY
activities: Makes small Christmas grants to deserving spinsters and widows over the age of 60 in Tavistock parish
objects: THE INTEREST FROM THE TRUST FUND IS TO BE DISTRIBUTED IN SEPTEMBER OF EACH YEAR EQUALLY BETWEEN EIGHT WIDOWS OR SPINSTERS OVER THE AGE OF SIXTY YEARS.

name: BADSEY REMEMBRANCE HALL
activities: To provide a place for the local residents to hire for funtions and a meeting place for the villagers
objects: TO MAINTAIN A HALL SUITABLE FOR THE USE OF ALL VILLAGE ORGNAISATIONS AS SET OUT IN THE CONVEYANCE.

name: THE LAWSON TAIT MEDICAL AND SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH TRUST
activities: The Trust was established to award memorial prizes and memorial grants to recognise medical or scientific research beneficial to mankind but does not involve the use of animals in testing.
objects: THE PROMOTION AND ENCOURAGEMENT OF MEDICAL AND SCIENTIFC RESEARCH AND LEARNING BY AWARDING PRIZES AND MAKING GRANTS TO PERSONS WHO HAVE COMPLETED OR SHALL BE ENGAGED IN SOME WORK OR MEDICAL OR SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH BENEFICIAL TO MANKIND WHICH DOES NOT IN ANY WAY INVOLVE VIVISECTON. (FOR FURTHER DETAILS SEE CLAUSE 4 OF DECLARATION OF TRUST).

name: THE REVEREND W J GOODDEN'S CHARITY
activities: To provide support and financial help, if required, to needy residents of Nether Compton, Dorset.
objects: THE PURCHASE OF BLANKETS OR COATS OR OTHERWISE FOR THE BENEFITS OF THE POOR.

name: SHINFIELD UNITED CHARITIES
activities: Issue small grants to individuals and to community groups
objects: SEE INDIVIDUAL CONSTITUENTS

name: BRUNELCARE
activities: Brunelcare is a registered charity and social landlord providing choice and care for older people in Somerset, North Somerset, Gloucestershire, South Gloucestershire and Bristol. Brunelcare provides sheltered and extra care housing, care homes and domiciliary care and support.
objects: THE OBJECTS FOR WHICH THE ASSOCIATION IS ESTABLISHED ARE:    (A) THE RELIEF OF THOSE WITHIN THE UNITED KINGDOM WHO ARE IN NEED BY REASON OF AGE (WHETHER OR NOT THAT NEED IS EXACERBATED BY ILL-HEALTH, DISABILITY AND/OR FINANCIAL HARDSHIP); AND   (B) THE RELIEF OF THOSE WITHIN THE UNITED KINGDOM WHO ARE IN NEED BY REASON OF ILL-HEALTH, DISABILITY AND/OR FINANCIAL HARDSHIP.

name: THE REVD DR JEFFEREY'S CHARITY
activities: General Needs Charity
objects: FOR POOR INHABITANTS OF THE PARISH

name: CHARITY OF SAMUEL LEE
activities: Assistance by grants and loans to persons in need.
objects: THE TRUSTEES SHALL APPLY THE INCOME OF THE CHARITY IN RELIEVING EITHER GENERALLY OR INDIVIDUALLY PERSONS RESIDENT IN THE PARISHES OF GEDDINGTON AND NEWTON WHO ARE IN CONDITIONS OF NEED BECAUSE OF THEIR YOUTH, AGE, ILL HEALTH, DISABILITY, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR OTHER DISADVANTAGE.  THE CHARITY SHALL APPLY THE INCOME FOR THE ADVANCEMENT OF CITIZENSHIP ON COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT.  THE TRUSTEES MAY PAY FOR SUCH ITEMS, SERVICES OR FACILITIES BY WAY OF DONATIONS OR SUBSCRIPTIONS TO INSTITUTIONS OR ORGANISATIONS WHICH PROVIDE OR WHICH UNDERTAKE IN RETURN TO PROVIDE SUCH ITEMS, SERVICES OR FACILTIIES FOR SUCH PERSONS.  IN EXCEPTIONAL CIRCUMSTANCES THE TRUSTEES MAY GRANT RELIEF TO PERSONS OTHERWISE ELIGIBLE WHO ARE RESIDENT IMMEDIATELY OUTSIDE THE SAID PARISH BUT IN THE OPINION OF THE TRUSTEES OUGHT NEVERTHELESS FOR SUFFICIENT REASON TO BE TREATED AS IF RESIDENT THEREIN OR WHO ARE LOCATED FOR THE TIME BEING WITHIN THE PARISH.

name: ROYAL SOCIETY FOR THE PREVENTION OF CRUELTY TO ANIMALS SURREY WOKING AND DISTRICT BRANCH
activities: to promote kindness and prevent or suppess cruelty to animals
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE BRANCH ARE TO PROMOTE THE WORK AND OBJECTS OF THE SOCIETY [ROYAL SOCIETY FOR THE PREVENTION OF CRUELTY TO ANIMALS (219099)], WITH PARTICULAR REFERENCE TO THE AREA OF THE BRANCH, IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE POLICIES OF THE SOCIETY.

name: SUSAN COUNTESS OF HARDWICKE CHARITY
activities: Provides four almshouses for local people
objects: ALMSHOUSES FOR POOR PERSONS OF GOOD CHARACTER WHO HAVE RESIDED IN THE PARISHES OF WIMPOLE OR ARRINGTON OR THE SURROUNDING AREAS. PREFERENCE SHALL BE GIVEN TO WIDOWS AND TO THOSE WHO RESIDED IN THE PARISHES OF WIMPOLE OR ARRINGTON.

name: POORS HILLOCK
activities: The provision of allotment gardens for the residents of Kingston Blount.
objects: TO PROVIDE ALLOTMENTS FOR THE POOR INHABITANTS OF KINGSTON BLOUT.

name: ELIZABETH PYNDAR'S CHARITY
activities: Within the Parish of Kempley The instruction of poor children of the Parish to read  and such other charitable purposes as the Minister shall think fit; For the relief of poor inhabitants of Kempley [ex205124] The Trustees are: The Rector and 3 appointed by the Kempley Parish Council
objects: THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION,  THE ADVANCEMENT OF COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT, AND  THE RELIEF OF THOSE IN NEED BY REASON OF YOUTH, AGE, ILL HEALTH, DISABILITY, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR OTHER DISABILITY.

name: THE POOR'S LAND, WELLAND
activities: Gives grants to persons and organisations in the parish of Welland in Worcestershire
objects: GENERAL BENEFIT OF THE POOR

name: DOLPHIN SOCIETY
activities: We provide pendant alarms(telecare) for disadvantaged elderly or disabled people living alone and at risk of falls.  We also give grants for essential small works to aid independence and ensure security.
objects: THE RELIEF OF ELDERLY OR DISABLED PERSONS WHO ARE OR HAVE BEEN RESIDENT IN BRISTOL AND ITS ADJOINING LOCAL AUTHORITY AREAS AND WHO ARE IN NEED HARDSHIP OR DISTRESS TO MAINTAIN A HIGH QUALITY OF LIFE AND INDEPENDENCE BY SUCH MEANS AS ARE APPROPRIATE, INCLUDING ASSISTING AND SUPPORTING THEM TO LIVE IN THEIR OWN HOMES. TO PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR THE ELDERLY AND DISABLED IN NEED HARDSHIP OR DISTRESS IN SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE WAYS AS SHALL BE PROPOSED BY THE PRESIDENT FOR THE TIME BEING IN ANY APPEAL MADE ON BEHALF OF THE SOCIETY

name: AGE CONCERN-CHANDLER'S FORD
activities: To improve the quality of life for the elderly community in Chandlers Ford, in particular by providing a Centre where they may meet & carry out their activities in a healthy & safe environment.
objects: TO PROMOTE THE RELIEF OF ELDERLY PEOPLE IN ANY MANNER WHICH NOW IS OR HEREAFTER MAY BE DEEMED BY LAW TO BE CHARITABLE IN AND AROUND CHANDLER'S FORD

name: STEVENTON ALLOTMENTS AND RELIEF IN NEED CHARITY
activities: Maintenance of the allotments & surroundings. Identification of cases of individual need among parishioners. Identification of general need within the parish benefiting both individuals and the parish as a whole. This objective is usually accomplished by subsidies to existing organisations within the village.
objects: RELIEVING EITHER GENERALLY OR INDIVIDUALLY PERSONS RESIDENT IN THE PARISH OF STEVENTON WHO ARE IN CONDITIONS OF NEED, HARDSHIP, OR DISTRESS BY MAKING GRANTS OF MONEY OR PROVIDING OR PAYING FOR ITEMS, SERVICES OR FACILITIES CALCULATED TO REDUCE THE NEED, HARDSHIP OR DISTRESS OF SUCH PERSONS. (FOR FULL DETAILS, SEE SCHEME).

name: COUNSEL AND CARE FOR THE ELDERLY
activities: COUNSEL AND CARE IS A NATIONAL CHARITY WORKING WITH OLDER PEOPLE, THEIR FAMILIES AND CARERS TO GET THE BEST CARE AND SUPPORT. AS PART OF INDEPENDENT AGE WE PROVIDE PERSONALISED, IN-DEPTH ADVICE AND INFORMATION, WHICH INFORMS OUR RESEARCH AND CAMPAIGNING
objects: TO ASSIST BY MEANS DEEMED BY LAW TO BE CHARITABLE TO ELDERLY INVALIDS WHO ARE IN NEED OF FINANCIAL OR OTHER HELP. TO ALLEVIATE DISTRESS AND SUFFERING AMONGST ELDERLY INVALIDS BY ANY MEANS CONSIDERED NECESSARY FROM TIME TO TIME AND DEEMED BY LAW TO BE CHARITABLE.

name: BURNHAM CONSOLIDATED CHARITIES
activities: Grants issued for needy people
objects: SEE INDIVIDUAL CONSTITUENTS

name: THE ALDERSHOT CHURCH OF ENGLAND SERVICES TRUST
activities: For the purpose of furthering the religious and other charitable work of the Church of England amongst members and former members of the Armed Forces of the Crown.
objects: FURTHERING THE RELIGIOUS AND OTHER CHARITABLE WORK OF THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND AMONGST MEMBERS AND FORMER MEMBERS OF THE ARMED FORCES OF THE CROWN RESIDENT OR SERVING IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT, AND THE DEPENDANTS OF SUCH MEMBERS, AND THE PROMOTION OF THE EFFICIENCY OF THE ARMED FORCES OF THE CROWN BY THE PROVISION OF BENEFITS NOT NORMALLY PROVIDED OUT OF FUNDS OF THE EXCHEQUER.

name: WARMINGTON ALMSHOUSES CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: The Warmington Almshouses Charitable Trust manages 3 almshouses originally endowed in 1862 in the village of Warmington Northamptonshire
objects: FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE RESIDENTS IN THE ALMSHOUSES OF THE CHARITY OR ANY OF THEM IN SUCH MANNER AS THE TRUSTEES THINK FIT FROM TIME TO TIME.

name: GREAT MISSENDEN MEMORIAL CENTRE
activities: The Great Missenden Memorial Centre (GMMC) is a memorial to the men and women of the parish who have died in war.  We run the day to day operation of GMMC as a recreational facility for the inhabitants of Great Missenden and the surrounding area.  In addition we are responsible for the internal upgrading and refurbishment of the centre.
objects: TO FURTHER THE SPIRITUAL MENTAL SOCIAL AND PHYSICAL ACTIVITIES OF ALL MEMBERS OF THE COMMUNITY IN THE PARISH

name: SOMERTON RELIEF IN NEED CHARITY
activities: We meet twice a year.  We have an income from various legacies including two small pieces of land.  We give out small payments where there is need in the parish of Somerton.
objects: TO RELIEVE, EITHER GENERALLY OR INDIVIDUALLY PERSONS RESIDENT IN THE AREA OF THE ANCIENT PARISH OF SOMERTON WHO ARE IN CONDITIONS OF NEED, HARDSHIP OR DISTRESS.

name: THE SEAMEN'S FRIENDLY SOCIETY OF ST PAUL
activities: To provide for the well being and maintenance of Destitute Seamen.
objects: THE CARE AND MAINTENANCE OF DESTITUTE MERCHANT SEAMEN; RELIGIOUS EDUCATIONAL AND CHARITABLE WORK AMONGST MERCHANT SEAMEN OF EVERY NATIONALITY; PROVISION OF ACCOMMODATION FOR DISTRESSED SEAMEN; MAINTENANCE OF DESTITUTE, AGED OR INFIRM SEAMEN; MAINTENANCE AND SUPPORT OF MEMBERS OF THE ORDER OF ST BENEDICT AT ALTON ABBEY WHO ARE ENGAGED IN THE ABOVE; PUBLICATION OF "THE MESSENGER"

name: STOKE POGES UNITED CHARITY
activities: Relief of persons resident in the area of benefit, being the ancient parish of Stoke Poges and the surrounding area, who are in need, hardship or distress.
objects: THE RELIEF OF PERSONS RESIDENT IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT WHO ARE IN NEED, HARDSHIP OR DISTRESS.

name: THE ASHTON KEYNES CHARITY
activities: Assistance to young persons of the village taking an apprenticeship Assistance to poor and those in need in the village General benefit for village
objects: 1. TO APPLY A YEARLY SUM OF £15 IN ASSISTING PERSONS UNDER 25 YEARS OF AGE IN NEED OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE WHO ARE PREPARING FOR ENTERING UPON OR WHO ARE ENGAGED IN ANY PROFESSION, TRADE, OCCUPATION OR SERVICE. 2. TO RELIEVE EITHER GENERALLY OR INDIVIDUALLY PERSONS RESIDENT IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT WHO ARE IN CONDITIONS OF NEED, HARDSHIP OR DISTRESS. 3. FOR THE GENERAL BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF THE AREA OF BENEFIT.

name: FLUCK CONVALESCENT FUND
activities: To provide financial grants to women and children (male or female) to the age of 16 considered to be of poor financial means, are sick or convalescing after illness or operative treatment, resident in Gloucester City or neighbourhood previously forming Gloucester Rural District.
objects: THE ASSISTANCE OF POOR WOMEN AND CHILDREN WHO ARE SICK OF CONVALESCENT AFTER ILLNESS, DISEASE OR SURGICAL OPERATION AND ARE RESIDENT IN THE CITY OF GLOUCESTER OR THE NEIGHBOURHOOD THEREOF. (SEE SCHEME OF 16TH MARCH 1956 FOR FULL DETAILS AND METHOD OF ASSISTANCE).

name: CHARITY OF SOPHIA GIFFORD EDMONDS
activities: Upkeep of Churchyard
objects: UPKEEP OFCHURCHYARD

name: THE EMILIE GALLOWAY HOME OF REST
activities: PROVISION OF A RESIDENTIAL HOME FOR LOW DEPENDENCY ELDERLY PEOPLE
objects: HOME OF REST FOR GENTLEFOLK OF EITHER SEX AND WHETHER MARRIED OR SINLE WHO MAY BE IN STRAITENED CIRCUMSTANCES AND UNABLE TO OBTAIN ANY PLACE FOR TEMPORARY REST AND THE ENJOYMENT OF RESIDENCE IN THE COUNTRY FOR A FEW WEEKS

name: ROYAL HOSPITAL FOR NEURO-DISABILITY
activities: The Royal Hospital for Neuro-disability is an independent, national, not-for-profit medical charity.  It is not part of the NHS.  It seeks through the provision of specialist services and research to enable people with profound or complex disabilities resulting from damage to the brain or other areas of the nervous system, to enjoy an optimal quality of life through enhanced independence.
objects: TO GIVE PERMANENT RELIEF TO SUCH PERSONS AS ARE HOPELESSLY DISQUALIFIED FOR THE DUTIES OF LIFE BY DISEASE, ACCIDENT,  OR DEFORMITY; AND THIS SHALL BE CARRIED OUT ON THE BROAD PRINCIPLE OF CHRISTIAN KINDNESS AND LIBERALITY, IN THE HOPE OF UNITING ALL THE GOOD FOR THE GOOD OF ALL WHO REALLY NEED HELP.

name: HOPTON-ON-SEA RELIEF IN NEED CHARITY
activities: Raising funds and making donations to assist local residents and organisations in the Parish of Hopton-on-Sea as the charity considers would benefit such individuals or groups.
objects: RELIVING EITHER GENERALLY OR INDIVIDUALLY PERSONS OR GROUPS IN THE PARISH OF HOPTON-ON-SEA BY MAKING GRANTS OF MONEY OR PAYING FOR ITEMS, SERVICES OR FACILITIES AS THE CHARITY CONSIDERS WOULD BENEFIT SUCH INDIVIDUALS OR GROUPS.

name: EAST WICKHAM AND WELLING WAR MEMORIAL TRUST
activities: Grant giving charity and offering the following categories of grants to individuals or community based organisations within the boundaries of East Wickham and Welling: Capital Grants for Improvements to Premises, Grants Towards the Hire of Premises and Individual Grants for Character Building Courses or Expeditions.  The Trustees also offer an academic bursary.
objects: (1) UPKEEP OF THE PARISH WAR MEMORIAL OF THE PARISH CHURCH OF ST MICHAEL, EAST WICKHAM (2) IN FURTHERING THE WORK OF ANY CHARITY THE OBJECTS OF WHICH INCLUDE (A) THE PROMOTION OF EDUCATION OF PERSONS IN EAST WICKHAM (B) THE IMPROVEMENT OF THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE OF PEOPLE IN EAST WICKHAM OR WELLING (FOR FURHTER DETAILS, SEE CLAUSE 5 OF SCHEME)

name: GODMERSHAM RELIEF IN NEED CHARITY
activities: Grants made for the relief of hardship, towards the cost of extra curricular activities for school children and to help with the purchase of course material by further education students. Grants also made to local organizations such as the Brownie pack. Life-line alarm systems rented for the elderly.
objects: IN RELIEVING EITHER GENERALLY OR INDIVIDUALLY PERSONS RESIDENT IN THE AREA OF THE ANCIENT PARISH OF GODMERSHAM WHO ARE IN THE CONDITIONS OF NEED, HARDSHIP OR DISTRESS BY MAKING GRANTS OF MONEY OR PROVIDING OR PAYING FOR ITEMS, SERVICES OR FACILITIES CALCULATED TO REDUCE THE NEED, HARDSHIP OR DISTRESS OF SUCH PERSONS.IF AND INSOFAR AS INCOME IN ANY YEAR IS NOT REQUIRED FOR APPLICATION IN THE MANNER AFORESAID THE TRUSTEES MAY APPLY THE SAME AS THEY THINK FIT FOR ANY CHARITABLE PURPOSES FOR THE GENERAL BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF THE SAID AREA.

name: THE BASIL SAMUEL CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: The objects of the charity are such charitable purposes as the trustees think fit whether in England and Wales or elsewhere.  The capital and income of the Trust is held for general charitable purposes. The trustees make a number of grants to medical, socially supportive, educational and cultural charities plus a number of donations to other charities.
objects: TO PAY THE INCOME WITH POWER TO PAY THE WHOLE OR ANY PART OF THE CAPITAL FOR SUCH CHARITABLE PURPOSES IN THE U.K. OR ELSEWHERE AT SUCH TIMES AND IN SUCH MANNER AS THE TRUSTEES IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION THINK FIT.

name: NORTHCHURCH UNITED CHARITIES
activities: Financial assistance to individuals or organisations providing services for the needy or disabled in the old parish of Northchurch.
objects: THE GENERAL BENEFIT OF DESERVING POOR PERSONS. (REMARKS: THE INCOME IS APPORTIONED FOR APPLICATION IN THE AREA OF NORTHCHURCH AND BROADING AND THE AREA OF SUNNYSIDE AND GOSSENS END.)

name: THE ASTHAL SWINBROOK AND WIDFORD RELIEF IN NEED CHARITY
activities: Income from investments used for any worthy cause considerd to be appropriate by the trustees from primary education to assistance with the needs of the elderly
objects: SEE INDIVIDUAL CONSTITUENTS

name: THE QUESTORS LIMITED
activities: To encourage the study and practice of the dramatic arts and to promote and conduct theatrical and musical performances, lectures, concerts and educational activities to this end
objects: TO ENCOURAGE THE STUDY AND PRACTICE OF DRAMATIC ART AND TO PROMOTE AND CONDUCT SUCH THEATRICAL AND MUSICAL PERFORMANCES, LECTURES, CONCERTS AND OTHER EDUCATIONAL ENTERPRISES AS MAY TEND TO THE ATTAINMENT OF THIS OBJECT.

name: ROYAL SOCIETY FOR THE PREVENTION OF CRUELTY TO ANIMALS KENT, ASHFORD, TENTERDEN AND DISTRICT BRANCH
activities: Animal rescue, care and rehoming.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE BRANCH ARE TO PROMOTE THE WORK AND OBJECTS OF THE SOCIETY [ROYAL SOCIETY FOR THE PREVENTION OF CRUELTY TO ANIMALS (219099)], WITH PARTICULAR REFERENCE TO THE AREA OF THE BRANCH, IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE POLICIES OF THE SOCIETY.

name: POOR'S ALLOTMENT
activities: The charity's principal activity is that of providing a fuel allowance for the pensioners, widows and poor of East Ruston. If a surplus is available special help can be given to children in the village
objects: PROVIDING FUEL FOR POOR PERSONS RESIDENT IN THE PARISH OF EAST RUSTON. IF THE INCOME IS NOT REQUIRED FOR THE ABOVE IT IS APPLIED IN RELIEVING EITHER GENERALLY OR INDIVIDUALLY PERSONS RESIDENT IN THE PARISH OF EAST RUSTON WHO ARE IN CONDITIONS OF NEED,HARDSHIP OR DISTRESS.

name: FELTHAM UNITED CHARITIES
activities: Management of eight almshouses. Accommodating elderly people who wish to downsize or need a home.
objects: SEE INDIVIDUAL CONSTITUENTS

name: FRIENDS OF FARNHAM HOSPITAL & CENTRE FOR HEALTH
activities: Provide funding for the provision of comforts and equipment, not available from the NHS, to patients and staff of Farnham Hospital. Some fundraising activities in support of these purposes and personal contacts from time to time with patients and staff.
objects: TO RELIEVE PATIENTS AND FORMER PATIENTS OF THE HOSPITAL AND OTHER INVALIDS IN THE COMMUNITY WHO ARE SICK, CONVALESCENT, DIABLED, HANDICAPPED, INFIRM OR IN NEED OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AND, GENERALLY, TO SUPPORT THE CHARITABLE WORK OF THE SAID HOSPITAL.

name: THE CHARITY OF SIR JOHN PICTO AND OTHERS
activities: TO MAINTAIN, ADMINISTER PROPERTY AND LAND IN THE OWNERSHIP OF THE CHARITY. TO MAKE AWARDS TO THOSE IN NEED WITHIN THE PARISH OF BUXTON LAMAS, LITTLE HAUTBOIS,  BRAMPTON AND OXMEAD
objects: TO RELIEVE EITHER GENERALLY OR INDIVIDUALLY PERSONS RESIDENT IN THE PARISH OF BUXTON WITH LAMMAS WHO ARE IN CONDITIONS OF ENN, HARDSHIP OR DISTRESS.

name: THE BEACON LIGHT LODGE BENEVOLENT FUND
activities: Collections and gifts from members
objects: BENEFIT OF DISTRESSED BROTHER MASONS OR THEIR WIDOWS AND CHILDREN OR TO OR FOR THE BENEFIT OF MASONIC OR OTHER CHARITABLE INSTITUTIONS AS THE LODGE SHALL FROM TIME TO TIME DIRECT.

name: THE DRURY LANE THEATRICAL FUND
activities: The DLTF was established to help members who have worked at the Theatre Royal, Drury Lane, either as performers or stage management. Payments are made on their age, retirement or on ceasing work through ill-health or accident. Other grants may be made at the directors discretion.
objects: THE RELIEF OF INDIGENT PERSONS BELONGING TO HIS MAJESTY'S COMPANY OF COMEDIANS IN THEATRE ROYAL, DRURY LANE.

name: MISS NORA JANE ALLEN BEQUEST
activities: To benefit All Saints Church.
objects: IN COME FOR UPKEEP AND MAINTENANCE OF CHURCH.

name: KINGS HALL COMMUNITY ASSOCIATION
activities: Community hall used by various groups including toddler group, Beaver, Cubs & Scouts, After School Club, Senior Citizens Club, Bingo, Rainbows, Brownies and Guides, Church Group, Drama Group, Over 50's Fitness & Irish Dancing
objects: TO PROMOTE THE WELL BEING OF THE COMMUNITY BY CO-ORDINATING ACTIVITIES IN AN EFFORT TO FURTHER HEALTH, TO ADVANCE ALL FORMS OF EDUCATION AND TO FOSTER A COMMUNITY SPIRIT FOR THE ACHIEVEMENT OF THESE AND OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES.

name: RAINY DAY TRUST
activities: The Trust helps those who have worked in the DIY, Hardware, Housewares, Ironmongery, Builders Merchants and Brushware industries -  normally for at least five years. Very often it depends more on which products were manufactured/ supplied and excludes foundries and steelworkers.
objects: THE RELIEF OF PERSONS WHO HAVE BEEN ENGAGED IN THE TRADES DETAILED IN ARTICLE 1 AND THE WIVES, WIDOWS, WIDOWERS, CHILDREN AND OTHER DEPENDANTS OF SUCH PERSONS BEING IN NEED OF ASSISTANCE.  IN PARTICULAR (BUT WITHOUT IN ANY WAY LIMITING THE GENERALITY OF THE FOREGOING) THE TRUST MAY ASSIST SUCH PERSONS IN ANY OF THE FOLLOWING WAY:  SEE GOVERNING DOC

name: INTERNATIONAL BEE RESEARCH ASSOCIATION
activities: IBRA promotes the value of bees by providing information on bee science and beekeeping worldwide.
objects: THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE SCIENCE OF APIOLOGY AND, WITH A VIEW TO ACHIEVING THAT PRIMARY OBJECTS, THE PROMOTING, FINANCING, ORGANISING, CARRYING ON AND ENCOURAGING BEE RESEARCH.

name: LANCING PAROCHIAL CHARITIES
activities: Grants are made for the benefit of the poor of the area of the ancient parish of Lancing to relieve sickness, infirmity or distress.
objects: SEE INDIVIDUAL CONSTITUENTS

name: LEO BAECK COLLEGE
activities: Training rabbis and teachers for Jewish congregations, communities and schools
objects: THE PROMOTION AND FURTHERANCE OF JEWISH RELIGIOUS AND EDUCATIONAL INSTRUCTION AND FOSTERING AND ADVANCING THE STUDY OF JUDAISM AND OF JEWISH EDUCATION, HISTORY, ART, LITERATURE, MUSIC AND WAY OF LIFE IN ALL ITS ASPECTS, BOTH RELIGIOUS AND SECULAR AND PROMOTING SUCH OTHER LEGALLY CHARITABLE PURPOSES OF A LIKE NATURE TO THE FOREGOING, AS THE COLLEGE MAY SEE FIT.

name: THE DRAPERS' ALMSHOUSE CHARITY
activities: To give assistance to elderly poor people through the provision of sheltered almshouse accommodation, the upkeep of almshouse properties and estate, and the provision of social activities and other communal facilities and services for the benefit of the almshouse community.
objects: (1) THE OBJECTS OF THE CHARITY ARE:  (A) THE PROVISION OF HOUSING ACCOMMODATION FOR PERSONS WHO ARE IN NEED  AND RESIDENT IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT; AND  (B) SUCH CHARITABLE PURPOSES FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE RESIDENTS AT THE  ACCOMMODATION PROVIDED BY THE CHARITY AS THE TRUSTEE SHALL DECIDE.  (2) THE TRUSTEE MAY UTILISE SURPLUS INCOME TO PROVIDE:  (A) DAY SERVICES FOR BOTH RESIDENTS AND NON-RESIDENTS WHO ARE IN NEED AND  WHO LIVE IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT; AND/OR  (B) HOME ADAPTATIONS FOR ELDERLY PEOPLE WHO LIVE IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT.

name: THE ROYAL BRITISH NURSES' SETTLEMENT FUND
activities: For the benefit of such aged nurses who are in need of assistance as the Trustees think fit.
objects: FOR THE BENEFIT OF SUCH AGED NURSES WHO ARE IN NEED OF ASSISTANCE AS THE TRUSTEES THINK FIT.

name: ROYAL BRITISH LEGION INDUSTRIES LTD.
activities: To provide quality care and support to members of the ex-Service community and to help disadvantaged men and women find meaningful and sustained employment
objects: (A) THE RELIEF OF THOSE IN NEED BY REASON OF AGE, ILL HEALTH, DISABILITY OR INCAPACITY.  (B) THE RELIEF OF THE CHARITABLE NEEDS OF MEMBERS AND FORMER MEMBERS OF HM FORCES, THEIR RELATIVES AND DEPENDANTS.  (C) THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION AND TRAINING.(D) THE RELIEF OF UNEMPLOYMENT FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC IN SUCH WAYS AS MAY BE THOUGHT FIT INCLUDING ASSISTANCE TO FIND EMPLOYMENT.  (E) TO PROMOTE EQUALITY OF OPPORTUNITIES FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES IN PARTICULAR IN RELATION TO THEIR ACCESSTO EMPLOYMENT.  (F) FOR THE PURPOSES OF THESE OBJECTS THE WORD "DISABILITY" INCLUDES ANY PHYSICAL, MENTAL OR SENSORY DISABILITY OR DISADVANTAGE OR RESTRICTION OF ACTIVITY HOWEVER CAUSED AND WHETHER PERMANENT OR TEMPORARY IRRESPECTIVE OF THE PERSON'SRACE, NATIONALITY, RELIGIOUS BELIEF, SEX, SEXUAL ORIENTATION OR AGE.

name: UNITED GRAND LODGE OF ENGLAND LETCHWORTH MEMORIAL FUND
activities: The Letchworth Memorial Fund provides assistance to Freemasons, and dependants of Freemasons, who cannot be helped by the various existing Masonic benevolent funds, but who stand in need of prompt aid.
objects: INCOME TO BE USED FOR THE ASSISTANCE OF FREEMASONS, AND DEPENDANTS OF FREEMASONS WHO CANNOT BE HELPED BY THE VARIOUS EXISTING MASONIC BENEVOLENT FUNDS, BUT WHO STAND IN NEED OF PROMPT AID.

name: THE HENRY PINNOCK AND VICTORIA AND ALBERT MEMORIAL CHARITY
activities: Provision of Almshouse accomodation
objects: PROVISION AND MAINTENANCE OF ALMSHOUSES FOR THE BENEFIT OF NEEDY PERSONS WHO ARE INHABITANTS OR THE AREA OF THE FORMER BOROUGH OF GRAVESEND AS CONSTITUTED IMMEDIATELY BEFORE THE 1ST APRIL 1974 AND THE ECCLESIASTICAL PARISHES OF ST. MARK, ROSHERVILLE AND ALL SAINTS PERRY ST, NORTHFLEET, WITH PREFERENCE TO SUCH PERSONS WHO HAVE RESIDED FOR NOT LESS THAN 10 YEARS IN THE AREA OF THE ANCIENT PARISHES OF GRAVESEND OR MILTON-NEXT-GRAVESEND.

name: MAYNARD AND COTTON'S HOSPITAL
activities: To provide accommodation for elderly residents in twelve almshouse units, most of which can house couples, together with providing utility services for these dwellings. The criteria for residency is that the applicants must be of modest means and to have lived within the Canterbury City boundary for seven years.
objects: TO PROVIDE ALMSHOUSES FOR THOSE WHO ARE DESCRIBED IN CLAUSE 19 OF THE SCHEME.

name: BLACKFRIARS SETTLEMENT
activities: Empowering local people by adding expertise, encouragement and support to their efforts and achievements;creating opportunities for them to reach their educational, social and economic potential Uniting the contributions of local volunteers and community partners to achieve shared objectives Encouraging funds in to deliver and support quality services for people of all ages
objects: TO PROMOTE THE WELFARE OF INDIVIDUAL PERSONS, FAMILIES AND COMMUNITIES IN LONDON AND ELSEWHERE BY ALL PRACTICABLE MEANS AND IN PARTICULAR (BUT WITHOUT PREJUDICE TO THE GENERALITY OF THE FOREGOING) BY THE PROVISION AND MAINTENANCE OF A RESIDENTIAL OR OTHER CENTRE OF CENTRES IN SOUTHWARK OR ELSEWHERE AND THE FOSTERING OF COMMUNITY ACTIVITIES.

name: THE ROYAL UNITED SERVICES INSTITUTE FOR DEFENCE AND SECURITY STUDIES
activities: RUSI is the UK's leading independent think tank on international defence and security. Its mission is to be an analytical research-led global forum for informing, influencing and enhancing public debate on a safer and more stable world.
objects: THE PROMOTION AND ADVANCEMENT OF THE SCIENCE AND LITERATURE OF THE THREE SERVICES

name: TODMORDEN SOCIETY FOR THE BLIND
activities: The society provides practical and moral support for registered and partially sighted persons living in Todmorden. This includes the making of financial grants, visits by committee members, a monthly drop in, lunch (at present twice a year) at local hostelries and evening social gatherings (at present twice a year)
objects: TO HELP IN ANY WAY POSSIBLE THE BLIND PERSONS IN THE BOROUGH OF TODMORDEN.

name: RUTLAND HISTORIC CHURCHES PRESERVATION TRUST
activities: Give grants and loans for the maintenance and improvement of churches in the county of Rutland.
objects: MAINTENANCE AND IMPROVEMENT OF CHURCHES IN THE COUNTY OF RUTLAND AND OFCHATTELS THEREIN AND IN THE CHURCHYARDS, WITH POWER TO MAKE GRANTS FOR SUCH PURPOSES IN OTHER PARTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM.

name: ACTON (MIDDLESEX) RELIEF IN NEED CHARITY
activities: Help can be given to Acton residents where there is a specific need for assistance. Referrals must be made by doctors, district and health visitors and other social services.
objects: £4 FOR THE PREACHING OF A SERMON IN THE ECCLESIASTICAL PARISH OF ST MARY, ACTON. 50P TO THE PERSON WHO CARRIES OUT THE DUTIES OF A READER IN THE SAID PARISH. 25P TO THE PERSON WHO CARRIES OUT THE DUTIES OF THE CLERK IN THE SAID PARISH. 25P TO THE PERSON WHO CARRIES OUT THE DUTIES OF THE SEXTON TO THE SAID ECCLESIASTICAL PARISH. SUBJECT TO THE PAYMENTS AFORESAID THE TRUSTEES SHALL APPLY THE INCOME OF THE RELIEF IN NEED CHARITY IN RELIEVING EITHER GENERALLY OR INDIVIDUALLY PERSONS RESIDENT IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT WHO ARE IN CONDITIONS OF NEED, HARDSHIP OR DISTRESS BY MAKING GRANTS OF MONEY OR PROVIDING OR PAYING FOR ITEMS SERVICES OR FACILITIES CALCULATED TO REDUCE THE NEED OR DISTRESS OF SUCH PERSONS.

name: SCAYNES HILL WOMEN'S INSTITUTE
activities: Monthly meeting with a variety of speakers - involvement in local village life & its activities. Craft classes held on a monthly basis and also a monthly lunch club, involving partners & friends.
objects: The objects of the WI are to further the purposes of the Women's Institute organisation

name: OXFORD MISSION
activities: Founded in 1880. In Behala, India it funds: an orphanage for 135+ boys between the ages of 4 & 15, educated & taught music; old peoples home; ENT/eye clinics. It funds in Bangladesh: Barisal - high & primary schools, boys & girls hostels, girls orphanage & a medical centre; Jobarpar - an indigenous sisterhood (CSS), oversees girls hostel & a play centre & helps in the diocesan primary school.
objects: ADVANCEMENT OF CHRISTIAN RELIGION IN INDIA AND PAKISTAN ACCORDING TO THE TEACHING OF THE ANGLICAN COMMUNION.

name: QUARTERLY JOURNAL OF MECHANICS AND APPLIED MATHEMATICS
activities: Has overall control of a scientific journal -- Quarterly Journal of Mechanics and Applied Mathematics, published for the benefit of the scientific community.
objects: FOR THE PURPOSE OF SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH AND POSTGRADUATE EDUCATION AND TO PROVIDE A MEDIUM FOR PUBLISHING ORIGINAL INVESTIGATIONS INTO THE THEORETICAL BASIS OF APPLIED MECHANICS.

name: RICHARD ABBAY'S NON-EDUCATIONAL CHARITY
activities: SUPPORT FOR NEEDY VILLAGERS
objects: UPKEEP OF CHURCHYARD PAYMENTS TO POOR OR INFIRM MEMBERS OF THE CONGREGATION, THE RECTOR & BELL-RINGERS AT EMPIRE DAY SERVICE.

name: RICHARD ABBAY'S NON-EDUCATIONAL CHARITY
activities: SUPPORT FOR NEEDY VILLAGERS
objects: UPKEEP OF CHURCHYARD PAYMENTS TO POOR OR INFIRM MEMBERS OF THE CONGREGATION, THE RECTOR & BELL-RINGERS AT EMPIRE DAY SERVICE.

name: CHARLOTTE MARSHALL CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: The Trust was formed to distribute funds as to two thirds for educational, religious or other charitable purposes for Roman Catholics in the United Kingdom as the Trustess think just with the balance of the income distributed for charitable purposes in the United Kingdom all according to the Trustees discretion
objects: TWO THIRDS OF TRUST FUND FOR EDUCATIONAL RELIGIOUS OR OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES FOR ROMAN CATHOLICS IN THE UNITED KINGDOM AS TRUSTEES THINK FIT. ONE THIRD OF TRUST FUND FOR SUCH CARITABLE PURPOSES IN UNITED KINGDOM AS TRUSTEES THINK FIT.

name: HENRY TYLSTON HODGSON FOR PLAYGROUNDS OR OTHER PURPOSES
activities: Owner of part of St Nicholas School playground
objects: THE PROVISION OF A CHILDREN'S PLAYGROUND OR GARDENS IN CONNECTION WITH HARPENDEN CHURCH OF ENGLAND J.M.I. SCHOOL OR SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS THE TRUSTEES FROM TIME TO TIME WITH THE CONSENT OF THE RECTOR SHALL DIRECT.

name: THE KNIGHTS OF THE ROUND TABLE BENEVOLENT FUND
activities: The charity funds awards, exhibitions, special prizes bursaries and scholarships for the purpose of education and training.
objects: CAPITAL AND INCOME TO BE APPLIED FOR ANY CHARITABLE PURPOSE OR CHARITABLE PURPOSES CONNECTED WITH THE AWARDS SET FORTH IN THE SECOND SCHEDULE OF THE TRUST OR SUBSEQUENT AWARDS AGREED BY THE TRUSTEES.

name: RUISLIP COMBINED CHARITY
activities: Makes grants to individuals and organisations
objects: (1) (A) IN RELIEVING EITHER GENERALLY OR INDIVIDUALLY PERSONS RESIDENT IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT WHO ARE IN CONDITIONS OF NEED, HARDSHIP OR DISTRESS BY MAKING GRANTS OF MONEY OR PROVIDING OR PAYING FOR ITEMS, SERVICES OR FACILITIES CALCULATED TO REDUCE THE NEED, HARDSHIP OR DISTRESS OF SUCH PERSONS. (B)  THE TRUSTEES MAY PAY FOR SUCH ITEMS, SERVICES OR FACILITIES BY WAY OF DONATIONS OR SUBSCRIPTIONS TO INSTITUTIONS OR ORGANISATIONS WHICH PROVIDE OR UNDERTAKE IN RETURN TO PROVIDE SUCH ITEMS, SERVICESOR FACILITIES FOR SUCH PERSONS.  (2) (A) FOR THE PURPOSE OF RELIEVING IN CASES OF NEED PERSONS RESIDENT IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT WHO ARE SICK, CONVALESCENT, DISABLED, HANDICAPPED OR INFIRM BY PROVIDING OR PAYING FOR ITEMS, SERVICES OR FACILITIES WHICH ARE CALCULATED TO ALLEVIATE THE SUFFERING OR ASSIST THE RECOVERY OF SUCH PERSONS IN SUCH CASES BUT ARE NOT READILY AVAILABLE TO THEM FROM OTHER SOURCES. (B)  THE TRUSTEES MAY MAKE ARRANGEMENTS FOR SUCH SERVICES OR FACILITIES TO BE PROVIDED FOR THAT PURPOSE BY OTHER INSTITUTIONS OR ORGANISATIONS WHICH PROVIDE OR UNDERTAKE IN RETURN FOR DONATIONS OR SUBSCRIPTIONS OUT OF THE INCOME OF THE CHARITY. (FOR FURTHER DETAILS PLEASE SEE SCHEME).

name: HON MARY HOWARD FUND (BAGOT PAGET AND DRUMMOND PRINCIPAL FUND)
activities: Reparation of churches, parsonage houses and schools in the designated areas.
objects: THE REBUILDING OR ENLARGEMENT OF CHURCHES, PARSONAGE HOUSES AND SCHOOLS IN THE VICINITY OF THE ESTATES OF THE LATE MARY HOWARD IN THE COUNTIES OF WESTMORLAND, NORFOLK AND STAFFORDSHIRE. ERECTION, REBUILDING, REPARATION, ENLARGEMENT, FOUNDATION OR ENDOWMENT OF HOSPITALS, SCHOOLS OR ORPHAN HOMES IN THE SAME THREE COUNTRIES. AID OR ASSISTANCE OF HOME OR FOREIGN MISSIONS FOR PROPOGATION OF CHRISTIAN RELIGION ON PRINCIPLES OF CHURCH OF ENGLAND. BUILDING OR ENDOWING OF CHURCHES OF CHAPELS IN POPULOUS PARISHES OR PLACES IN ENGLAND.

name: THE COLLEGE OF PSYCHIC STUDIES
activities: The College explores consciousness beyond matter.
objects: TO SEEK, COLLECT AND OBTAIN INFORMATION RESPECTING, AND GENERALLY TO INVESTIGATE, THE PHENOMENA COMMONLY KNOWN AS PSYCHIC, INCLUDING ALL MATTERS OF A KINDRED NATURE, AND IN PARTICULAR TO STUDY THE APPLICATION TO THE SUBJECT OF SURVIVAL AND COMMUNICATION WITH THE DISCARNATE AND TO DISSEMINATE THE KNOWLEDGE GAINED THEREBY.(FOR FURTHER DETAILS SEE THE MEMORANDUM AND ARTICLES OF ASSOCIATION)

name: AMY MARY BIRD WILL TRUST
activities: Funds other charities
objects: 1) TO PAY CHARITABLE ANNUITIES TO THE INSTITUTIONS NAMED IN THE THIRD SCHEDULE OF THE WILL.  2) TO DIVIDE THE INCOME REMAINING AFTER PAYMENT OF THE AFORESAID CHARITABLE ANNUITIES BETWEEN THE SALVATION ARMY, THE ROYAL NATIONAL MISSION TO DEEP SEA FISHERMEN AND THE LONDON ASSOCIATION IN AID OF MORAVIAN MISSIONS IN SUCH SHARES AS THE SURVIVING TRUSTEE SHALL IN HIS UNCONTROLLED DISCRETION THINK FIT AND AFTER HIS DEATH EQUALLY BETWEEN SUCH THREE INSTITUTIONS.

name: CHARITY OF KATHARINE SHORE
activities: Provides a small grant at Christmas time to ladies of the village of Freckenham that are over 60 years old and who are widowed or whose husband has retired.
objects: BENEFIT EITHER OF THE POOR WOMEN OF THE PARISH OF FRECKENHAM GENERALLY OR OF POOR WOMEN RESIDENT THEREIN.

name: RUABON AND DISTRICT RELIEF IN NEED CHARITY
activities: To relieve poverty by helping individuals or organisations who live/operate within the Community Council areas of Cefn Mawr, Penycae, Rhosllannerchrugog and Ruabon.
objects: TO RELIEVE EITHER GENERALLY OR INDIVIDUALLY PERSONS RESIDENT IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT WHO ARE IN CONDITIONS OF NEED, HARDSHIP OR DISTRESS.

name: JOHN LYNN AND THE CHARITY KNOWN AS THE POOR'S LANDS
activities: We receive income from  the John Lynn & Poor Lands Charities. We share this income amongst  recipients  domiciled with in the Parish of Southwick.
objects: FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE POOR OF THE PARISH OF SOUTHWICK AND ALSO FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE VICAR

name: MAIDA VALE LODGE BENEVOLENT FUND (FREEMASONS)
activities: Masonic Lodge collecting for distribution to Masonic and non-masonic charities
objects: FOR THE RELIEF OF DISTRESSED BROTHER MASONS, WIDOWS AND CHILDREN. FOR VARIOUS MASONIC CHARITIES OR OTHER CHARITABLE INSTITUTIONS.

name: FRANK HODSON FOUNDATION LIMITED
activities: Provision of accommodation for elderly.
objects: THE RELIEF OF POVERTY AND SICKNESS AND THE PURSUIT OF ANY OBJECTS WHICH MAY FOR THE TIME BEING BE DEEMED BY LAW TO BE CHARITABLE.

name: THE FELLOWSHIP OF MEDITATION
activities: The Fellowship promotes contemplative meditation as a way of approaching The Divine Presence. This is communicated through Notes to members, newsletters and gatherings
objects: TO SPREAD PURE CHRISTIANITY BY TEACHING THE THEORY AND PRACTICE OF CONTEMPLATIVE MEDITATION ON GOD AND MAN IN HIS RELATIONSHIP TO GOD.

name: BUDE WOMEN'S INSTITUTE
activities: This charity activity is the Women's Institute whose purposes are renowned.  Bude WI is an active organisation giving interests and fellowship to all those who belong.
objects: TO IMPROVE AND DEVLOP CONDITIONS OF RURAL LIFE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE CONSTITUTION AND RULES OF THE WOMEN'S INSTITUTE.

name: WARWICKSHIRE MARK BENEVOLENT FUND
activities: To provide relief of distressed Mark Master Masons or their dependants. To meet present day needs of freemasons and all connected therewith as well as supporting the masonic principle of helping others and providing assistance and aid of an emergency or charitable nature.
objects: TO PROVIDE A RELIEF FUND FOR AND SUPPORT TO OTHER MASONIC AVENUES OF FINANCIAL RELIEF FOR THE BENEFICIARIES; AND TO MAKE DONATIONS FROM THE FUND TO MASONIC AND NON-MASONIC CHARITIES

name: GORDON GRAY TRUST
activities: Individuals are requested NOT to approach the Gordon Gray Trust as it is not our policy to support individuals, only registered charitable organisations. If you do not receive a reply to a request for funding, your application has been unsuccessful. Preference is given to Gloucestershire or Worcestershire causes.
objects: PAYMENT OF DONATIONS TO ANY CHARITABLE INSTITUTIONS OR FOR ANY CHARITABLE OBJECTS OR PURPOSES AT THE TRUSTEES' DISCRETION (THE CAPITAL ENDOWMENTS OF THE TRUST REMAINING AFTER A PERIOD OF 75 YEARS FROM THE DATE OF THE TRUST DEED ARE TO BE DISTRIBUTED IN THE WAY SET OUT ABOVE).

name: THE ROYAL SOCIETY OF LITERATURE OF THE UNITED KINGDOM
activities: The Royal Society of Literature celebrates and nurtures all that is best in British literature, past and present. We are the UK's charity for the advancement of literature. We act as a voice for the value of literature, engage people in literature, and honour and encourage writers. Activities include public events, awards and prizes, campaigns and young people's outreach.
objects: FOR THE ADVANCEMENT OF LITERATURE GENERALLY.

name: OBSERVER CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: Making donations to charities to further their objectives
objects: TO APPLY THE INCOME FOR SUCH CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS THE TRUSTEES IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION DETERMINE.

name: SAINT PANCRAS THANET STREET TRUST

name: THE CORNWALL TRUST FOR NATURE CONSERVATION LIMITED
activities: RECORD, STUDY AND PROTECT PLACES AND OBJECTS OF ORNITHOLOGICAL, ENTOMOLOGICAL, BOTANICAL, ZOOLOGICAL, GEOLOGICAL, ARCHAEOLOGICAL OR SCIENTIFIC INTEREST, OR OF NATURAL BEAUTY; OWN AND MANAGE NATURE RESERVES FOR THE CONSERVATION AND CONTROL OF PLANTS AND WILD CREATURES LIVING THEREIN; PROMOTE, ORGANISE AND ENCOURAGE STUDY AND RESEARCH FOR THE ADVANCEMENT OF KNOWLEDGE IN THE NATURAL SCIENCES.
objects: FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT:  (I)	TO RECORD AND STUDY PLACES AND OBJECTS OF ORNITHOLOGICAL, ENTOMOLOGICAL, BOTANICAL, ZOOLOGICAL, GEOLOGICAL, ARCHAEOLOGICAL OR SCIENTIFIC INTEREST, OR OF NATURAL BEAUTY, AND TO PROTECT THESE FROM INJURY, ILL TREATMENT OR DESTRUCTION.  (II)	TO ESTABLISH, FORM, OWN, MAINTAIN AND MANAGE BIRD SANCTUARIES OR NATURE RESERVES FOR THE CONSERVATION AND CONTROL OF WILD PLANTS AND OTHER VEGETATION AND OF THE WILD CREATURES OF ANY DESCRIPTION LIVING NATURALLY THEREIN.  (III)	TO ENCOURAGE THE BREEDING OF WILD ANIMALS AND PLANTS WHICH ARE HARMLESS, BEAUTIFUL OR RARE.  (IV)	TO PROMOTE, ORGANIZE, CARRY ON AND ENCOURAGE STUDY AND RESEARCH FOR THE ADVANCEMENT OF KNOWLEDGE IN THE NATURAL SCIENCES, AND TO MAKE GRANTS OR DONATIONS FORSUCH PURPOSES.

objects: TO HOUSE POOR PERSONS WHO THROUGH AGE INFIRMITY OR ILL HEALTH AND LACK OF MEANS IS OR INCAPABLE OR UNABLE PROPERLY TO HOUSE THEMSELVES.

The Institute's purpose is to serve people, through education and health care.

name: BIBLE READING FELLOWSHIP
activities: BRF is a Christian charity that enables all ages to grow in faith. BRF resources the spiritual journey of individuals and the mission and ministry of local churches (Messy Church, Anna Chaplaincy, Holy Habits, Parenting for Faith, Living Faith). BRF also provides a professional education service (Barnabas in Schools) equipping primary schools to explore Christianity creatively and confidently.
objects: TO ADVANCE CHRISTIAN RELIGION BY  A) ENCOURAGING UNDERSTANDING OF THE BIBLE BY PEOPLE OF ALL AGES  B) ENCOURAGING AND RESOURCING THE DEVELOPMENT OF CHRISTIAN LIFE AND/OR MINISTRY AMONGST PEOPLE OF ALL AGES

name: CONGREGATION OF THE MISSION (THE VINCENTIAN FATHERS)

Some members are engaged in various chaplaincies. Giving retreats and spiritual direction and involvement in school governance are also other areas of activity. The Charity continues to support those who seek spiritual and material help.
objects: FOR SUCH LAWFUL CHARITABLE PURPOSES CONNECTED WITH THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE ROMAN CATHOLIC RELIGION AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL DETERMINE.

BARCLAY HALL IS THUS A HOLDING CHARITY FOR THE PREMISES TITLED BARCLAY HALL.
objects: PREMISES TO BE USED AS A READING ROOM FOR WORKING MEN FOR BIBLES READINGS, RELIGIOUS LECTURES AND WRITING AND FOR SUCH OTHER USEFUL OR BENEVOLENT PURPOSES AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL DECIDE, FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS.

name: THE EMBROIDERERS' GUILD
activities: The Embroiderers Guild is a  national educational charity with a network of about 7500 members, many of whom belong to one or more of 185 branches.   It has a museum with a unique global collection and offers a programme of exhibitions, events, workshops, lectures and tours. It also has a specialist library and publishes two successful magazines, Embroidery and Stitch with the Embroiderers Guild.
objects: A) TO PROMOTE AND ENCOURAGE THE ART OF EMBROIDERY AND RELATED AND ENCOURAGE THE CREATION OF FINE ARTICLES INCORPORATING THE USE OF OR ASSOCIATED WITH EMBROIDERY;  B) TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC IN THE HISTORY  AND ART OF EMBROIDERY AND TO UNDERTAKE OR SUPPORT RESEARCH IN THAT SUBJECT AND TO PUBLISH THE USEFUL RESULTS OF THAT RESEARCH; AND  C) TO COLLECT, DOCUMENT, PRESERVE, EXHIBIT AND INTERPRET EXAMPLES OF FINE EMBROIDERY WHICH ARE OF HISTORICAL OR EDUCATIONAL MERIT AND TO MAKE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLICSUCH ARTICLES.

name: THORPE TRUSSELLS CHARITY

name: SECULAR CLERGY COMMON FUND

The fund aims to relieve the hardship that might otherwise be experienced.
objects: TO PROVIDE FOR THE SUPPORT OF MEMBERS INCAPACITATED BY OLD AGE, INFIRMITY OR ILLNESS FROM PERFORMANCE OF THEIR CLERICAL DUTY.

name: DONCASTER UNITARIAN AND FREE CHRISTIAN CHURCH TRUST FUND AND PROPERTIES HELD IN CONNEXION THEREWITH

We hold coffee mornings, open days, meditation sessions, and social events to raise awareness of Unitarianism and to raise funds.  The church also fundraises through its charity shop on Hall Gate. We support a number of local organisations to help vulnerable communities.

MARY, TEMPLE BALSALL,AS CONSTITUTED ON THE 4TH OF JUNE 1935 TOWARDS THE COST OF ERECTING AND MAINTAINING ANY NEW CHURCH OR PARSONAGE OR OF MAINTAINING ANY EXISTING CHURCH OR PARSONAGE OF THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT OR OF EXTENSIONS OF ANY CHURCH OF ENGLAND CHURCH OR TOWARDS THE COST OF ERECTING AND MAINTAINING ANYNEW CHURCH HALL OR OF MAINTAINING ANY EXISTING CHURCH HALL OF THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT. (2) PROVISION AND MAINTENANCE OF ANY RECREATION GROUND,OPEN SPACE, READING ROOM,LIBRARY AND VILLAGE HALL FOR THE USE OF THE INHABITNANTS. name: REHEARSAL ORCHESTRA
activities: Since its foundation in 1957, the Rehearsal Orchestra has promoted an annual residential orchestral course during the Edinburgh Festival, and arranged weekend courses in London and other parts of the UK aimed at providing an orchestral training resource for talented players and soloists of all ages and from all parts of the UK and abroad.
objects: TO FURTHER THE EDUCATION OF MANKIND IN THE ART OF MUSIC AND AS ANCILLARY THERETO TO PROMOTE AMONG PEOPLE THE STUDY, PLAYING AND COMPOSING OF ORCHESTRAL MUSIC.

name: THE PHILIP ALLISON FOUNDATION
activities: The charity provides facilities for research (1) to investigate the problems that arise in the day to day treatment of diseases (2) to carry out research to develop new surgical methods of alleviation or cure of disease and (3) to teach new concepts for the treatment of diseases.  It is currently doing this by way of supporting the Islet Isolation facility at the Nuffield Dept of Surgery.
objects: TO PROVIDE FACILITIES FOR RESEARCH, TO INVESTIGATE THE PROBLEMS THAT ARISE IN THE DAY TO DAY TREATMENT OF DISEASES, TO CARRY OUT RESEARCH TO DEVELOP NEW SURGICAL METHODS OF ALLEVIATION OR CUREOF DISEASE AND TO TEACH NEW CONCEPTS FOR THE TREATMENT OF DISEASES.

name: THE FARMINGTON TRUST LIMITED

To support Head Teachers to undertake research on values and standards, to disseminate recent and interesting work in RE and provide a network of support for those involved in RE teaching.
objects: TO PROMOTE CARRY OUT OR ADVANCE ANY CHARITABLE OBJECTS, AND IN PARTICULAR ANY BRANCHES OR ASPECTS OF EDUCATION ESPECIALLY BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY CHRISTIAN EDUCATION, LIKELY TO PROMOTE MORALITY AND THE ACCEPTANCE OF MORAL STANDARDS IN HUMAN CONDUCT. The rents from the commercial property help in the upkeep of the flats and enables the trust to make contributions in many ways to those in need in the parish. The allotments are self financing.
objects: 1.  THE PROVISION OF ALMSHOUSES FOR POOR AGED WIDOWERS, WIDOWS OR OTHER SINGLE PERSONS OF GOOD CHARACTER WHO (EXCEPT IN SPECIAL CASES TO BE APPROVED BY THE COMMISSIONERS) ARE INHABITANTS OF THE PARISH OF THORNBURY AND THE PROVISION OF BENEFITS FOR SUCH RESIDENTS.  2.  RELIEVING EITHER GENERALLY OR INDIVIDUALLY PERSONS RESIDENT IN THE PARISH OF THORNBURY WHO ARE IN CONDITIONS OF NEED, HARDSHIP OR DISTRESS BY MAKING GRANTS OF MONEY OR PROVIDING OR PAYING FOR ITEMS, SERVICES OR FACILITIES CALCULATEDTO REDUCE THE NEED, HARDSHIP AND DISTRESS OF SUCH PERSONS.

objects: THE INCOME IS TO BE DISTRIBUTED ANNUALLY AT CHRISTMAS IN SEVEN EQUAL PARTS TO EACH OF THE FOLLOWING SEVEN PLACES RESPECTIVELY, SWALCLIFFE, SIBFORD FERRIS, SIBFORD GOWER AND BURDRUP, IN THE COUNTY OF OXFORD, AND CLIFFORD CHAMBER, QUINTON, AND LONG MARSTON, IN THE COUNTY OF WARWICK.

name: CONSOLIDATED CHARITY OF BURTON UPON TRENT
activities: Charity for the benefit of residents of Burton upon Trent (including the neighbouring parishes of Branston, Stretton, Barton-under-Needwood, Tutbury, Rolleston-on-Dove, Tatenhill and Rangemore and the existing civil Parish of Outwoods including South Outwoods.)
objects: (1) THE PROVISION OF ALMSHOUSE ACCOMMODATION FOR POOR PERSONS RESIDENT IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT; AND SUCH CHARITABLE PURPOSES FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE RESIDENTS AS THE TRUSTEES DECIDE; AND (2) THE PROMOTION OF ANY CHARITABLE PURPOSE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THEINHABITANTS OF THE AREA OF BENEFIT AS THE TRUSTEES THINK FIT. (3) IN EXCEPTIONAL CIRCUMSTANCES THE TRUSTEES MAY TREAT AS WITHIN THESE OBJECTS PERSONS OTHERWISE ELIGIBLE WHO ARE RESIDENT IMMEDIATELY OUTSIDE THE AREA OF BENEFIT BUT IN THE OPINION OF THE TRUSTEES OUGHT NEVERTHELESS FOR SUFFICIENT REASON BE TREATED AS RESIDENT THEREIN OR WHO ARE LOCATED FOR THE TIME BEING WITHIN THAT AREA.

name: SWANSEA AND BRECON DIOCESAN COUNCIL FOR SOCIAL RESPONSIBILITY
activities: A faith based organisation giving community members the tools and confidence to make positive changes in their lives that impacts on their families and their community. Working with children, families, older people and the elderly facing isolation or disadvantage, promoting well-being and healthy living opportunities

There is also provision for one off payments at any time for special cases.

THISINCLUDES COMMENTING ON PLANNING APPLICATIONS AND WHERE APPROPRIATE SEEKING TO INFLUENCE DECISIONS.  (2) TO STIMULATE PUBLIC INTEREST IN AND CARE FOR THE BEAUTY, HISTORY AND CHARACTER OF THE TOWN, BY PROMOTING AN AWARENESS OF HERITAGE ISSUES IN ALL AGE GROUPS.  (3)TO PURSUE THESE ENDS BY MEANS OF MEETINGS, EXHIBITIONS, LECTURES, PUBLICATIONS, OTHER FORMS OF PUBLICITY AND  PROMOTION OF SCHEMES OF A CHARITABLE NATURE.

(2)	THE TRUSTEES MAY RELIEVE PERSONS IN NEED BY:  (A)	MAKING GRANTS OF MONEY TO THEM; OR  (B)	PROVIDING OR PAYING FOR GOODS,SERVICES OR FACILITIES FOR THEM; OR  (C)	MAKING GRANTS OF MONEY TO OTHER PERSONS OF BODIES WHO PROVIDE GOODS, SERVICES OR FACILITIES TO THOSE IN NEED.

Barnet Arts magazine listing events, including poetry and drama competitions, is distributed at exhibitions in libraries, shopping centres and summer festivals.   BBAC is an independent charity.

objects: 1.PROVIDE A WELCOME TO MEMBERS FOR THEMSELVES, IN A MEETING PLACE WHICH IS THEIRS TO SHARE, WHERE FRIENDSHIPS CAN BE MADE AND COUNCIL SOUGHT. 2. DEVELOP ACTIVITIES WHICH STIMULATE AND CHALLENGE ITS MEMBERS IN AN ENVIRONMENT THAT ENABLES THEM TO TAKE RESPONSIBILITY AND FIND A SENSE OF ACHIEVEMENT. 3. INVOLVE ALL MEMBERS IN CARE AND WORK FOR OTHERS. 4. CREATE OPPORTUNITIES FOR EXCHANGING VIEWS, SO THAT ITS MEMBERS CAN IMPROVE THEIR UNDERSTANDING OF THE WORLD, OF THEMSELVES AND OF ONE ANOTHER.

objects: FOR SUCH CHARITABLE PURPOSES WHICH ADVANCE THE RELIGIOUS AND OTHER CHARITABLE WORK BEING CARRIED ON BY THE SOCIETY, KNOWN AS THE CONGREGATION OF ST. MARY OF THE ANGELS.

Residents have the privacy of their own flat/bed sitting room but share meals and social time together.
objects: TO RELIEVE AGED, IMPOTENT AND POOR PEOPLE OF ALL CLASSES FOR THE ADVANCEMENT OF RELIGION AND EDUCATION AND FOR OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES BENEFICIAL TO THE COMMUNITY.

name: SUFI ORDER (UK)
activities: Provide a programme of spiritual training to bring about a deep personal transformation, culminating in a balanced, harmonious and creative life. Serve God and humanity by helping to relieve suffering, promoting understanding and acceptance among adherents of various faiths, and encouraging the unfoldment of universal loving kinship.
objects: THE ORDER IS ESTABLISHED FOR THE ADVANCEMENT OF RELIGION THROUGH (I) THE STUDY OF COMPARATIVE RELIGION FROM A STANDPOINT UNBAISED BY ANY PARTICULAR DOGMA OR CREED.(II) THE ORGANISATION AND PUBLICATION OF RESEARCH INTO THE LEARNING OF THE ESOTERIC AND MYSTICAL SCHOOLS ATTACHED TO THE WORLD RELIGIONS INCLUDING THAT OF THE SUFIS,(III) THE ESTABLISHMENT OF MUTUAL TOLERANCE UNDERSTANDING AND CO-OPERATION BETWEEN THE RELIGIONS OF THE WORLD.

name: LINCOLNSHIRE NATURALISTS' UNION

Major activities:- Programme of Spring & Summer Field Meetings; Programme of Winter indoor meetings culminating with annual Recorders Meeting; Publication of Transactions.
objects: TO PROMOTE THE THOROUGH INVESTIGATION OF THE GEOLOGY, FAUNA, FLORA AND PHYSICAL FEATURES OF THE COUNTY AND TO INCREASE THE INTEREST IN, AND STUDY OF EVERY BRANCH OF NATURAL HISTORY.

IF AND IN SO FAR AS INCOME IS NOT REQUIRED IN ANY ONE YEAR FOR APPLICATION  THE MANAGING TRUSTEES SHALL APPLY THE SAME FOR FURTHERING THE RELIGIOUS AND OTHER  CHARITABLE WORK OF THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND IN THE SAID ECCLESIASTICAL PARISH

name: CHURCH LAND CHARITY

objects: SUCH CHARITABLE PURPOSES IN OR CONNECTED WITH HAMPSHIRE AND ITS SURROUNDING AREAS AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT.

name: THE TOPSHAM SOCIETY
activities: To promote high standards of planning and architecture in Topsham area, To educate the public in the geography, history, natural history and architecture of the Topsham area and To secure the preservation, protection, development and improvement of features of historic or public interest in and around Topsham.
objects: (A) TO PROMOTE AND ENCOURAGE HIGH STANDARDS OF ARCHITECTURE AND TOWN PLANNING IN TOPSHAM. (B) TO STIMULATE AND PROMOTE PUBLIC INTEREST IN AN CARE FOR THE BEAUTY, HISTORY AND CHARACTER OF THE AREA OF TIPSHAM AND ITS SURROUNDINGS. (C) TO ENCOURAGE AND SUPPORT THE PRESERVATION, DEVELOPMENT, IMPROVEMENT AND BEAUTIFICATION OF FEATURES OF GENERAL PUBLIC AMENITY OR HISTORIC INTEREST. (D) TO PURSUE THESE ENDS BY MEETINS, EXHIBITIONS, LECTURES, PUBLICATION, OTHER FORMS OF INSTRUCTION ADN PUBLICITY, AND PROMOTION OF SCHEMES OF A CHARITABLE NATURE.

name: THE ST CHRISTOPHERS TRUST
activities: The Trust's income has been applied in supporting various charitable causes.  The principal beneficiaries being the Medical Foundation for the Care of Victims of Torture, Church Mission Society, The Church Army and UNICEF.
objects: FOR SUCH PURPOSE OR PURPOSES WHICH NOW ARE OR HEREAFTER MAY BE TREATED BY LAW TO BE CHARITABLE AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION THINK FIT.

name: CENTRE FOR ALTERNATIVE TECHNOLOGY CHARITY LIMITED
activities: CAT seeks to inspire, inform and enable people to adopt sustainable technologies and practices. The Charity achieves its objectives by: promoting scenarios for a Zero Carbon Britian; providing education through school visits, short courses and postgraduate teaching; publishing a members' magazine; providing a free information service; operating a visitor centre; hosting external events.
objects: 1. TO PROMOTE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC THE CONSERVATION, PROTECTION AND IMPROVEMENT OF THE ENVIRONMENT BY VARIOUS EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE MEANS INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE PROMOTION OF SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT, THE CONSERVATION OF NATURAL RESOURCES, THE REDUCTION OF CARBON EMISSIONS, THE PROMOTION OF RE-CYCLING, ENERGY EFFICIENCY AND THE REDUCTION OF HARMFUL POLLUTION AND ANY OTHER EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE MEANS OF PROTECTING AND CONSERVING THE ENVIRONMENT.    2. TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN SUBJECTS RELATED TO SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT AND THE PROTECTION, ENHANCEMENT AND REHABILITATION OF THE ENVIRONMENT, THE USE OF NATURAL RESOURCES AND SUSTAINABLE ENERGY AND TO PROMOTE STUDY AND RESEARCH IN SUCH SUBJECTS PROVIDED THAT THEUSEFUL RESULTS OF SUCH STUDY ARE DISSEMINATED TO THE PUBLIC AT LARGE.  SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT MEANS 'DEVELOPMENT THAT MEETS THE NEEDS OF THE PRESENT WITHOUT COMPROMISING THE ABILITY OF FUTURE GENERATIONS TO MEET THEIR OWN NEEDS'.  AND FOR THE FURTHERANCE OF THOSE OBJECTS BUT NOT OTHERWISE

name: ASHTEAD CHORAL SOCIETY
activities: The performance of sacred and secular music
objects: THE ADVANCEMENT OF PUBLIC EDUCATION AND THE IMPROVEMENT OF PUBLIC TASTE BY THE PRACTICE AND PERFORMANCE OF SACRED AND SECULAR CHORAL MUSIC.

name: CHURCH ESTATE
activities: St Peter's Church is in a very small hamlet some 5 miles outside Bungay - with a population of some 30 people. The income is spent towards the cleaning of the church - sometimes towards flowers for someone who is ill. The income is very small and probably will pay for one hours cleaning or a bunch of flowers from a supermarket.
objects: FURTHERING THE RELIGIOUS AND OTHER CHARITABLE WORK OF THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND IN THE ECCLESIASTICAL PARISH OF ST PETER, SOUTH ELMHAM

name: THE SIMON HELLER CHARITABLE SETTLEMENT

objects: SUCH CHARITABLE PURPOSES OR OBJECTS AND TO OR FOR SUCH CHARITABLE BODIES ORGANISATIONS INSTITUTIONS OR FUNDS FOR THE CHARITABLE PURPOSES THEREOF IN SUCH PROPORTIONS AND MANNER AS THE TRUSTEES THINK FIT.

name: PORTSMOUTH AND SOUTHSEA VOLUNTARY LIFEGUARDS
activities: The aims and objectives of the Portsmouth & Southsea Voluntary Lifeguard Club are to train competent swimmers in the RLSS method of life-saving/lifeguarding, provide an inshore rescue boat service  and to guard the local beaches to render them safer for bathers and boat users.
objects: 1. TO TRAIN COMPETENT SWIMMERS IN THE RLSS METHOD OF LIFE-SAVING/LIFEGUARDING; AND  2. TO LIFEGUARD THE LOCAL BEACHES TO MAKE THEM SAFE FOR BATHERS AND WATER USERS.

name: THE CAMELLIA TRUST
activities: The financial support of registered charities, especially Christian churches and societies, organisations working for the relief of poverty and deprivation, and community projects.
objects: FOR SUCH ONE OR MORE CHARITABLE INSTITUTIONS OR CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS THE TRUSTEES IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT.

name: PETWORTH AND DISTRICT OVER 60'S DAY CENTRE
activities: The provision of a meeting place for senior citizens in, and around, the Petworth area thus encouraging companionship and conversation. Numerous activities and outings are arranged throughout the year together with regular scrabble, bingo, card and quiz sessions. The centre is generally open Monday to Friday between 10.00am and 12.00pm and in the afternoons between 2.00pm and 4.00pm.
objects: TO PROMOTE THE WELFARE OF THE AGED IN ANY MANNER WHICH NOW IS, OR HEREAFTER MAY BE DEEMED BY LAW TO BE CHARITABLE WITHIN THE TOWN OF PERWORTH AND DISTRICT IN TH COUNTY OF SUSSEX.

name: THE CHURCH LANDS
activities: Support  to  the  Anglican  church  in  the  parish  of  Kilkhampton
objects: FOR THE MAINTENANCE AND REPAIR AND INSURANCE AGAINST FIRE OF THE FABRIC OF THE PARISH CHURCH OF KILKHAMPTON. (FOR FURTHER DETAILS SEE CLAUSE 4 OF THE SCHEME OF THE 1ST DECEMBER 1922).

name: THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION FOR THE RELIEF OF PAGET'S DISEASE
activities: The Paget's Association provides information and support to people whose lives are affected by all aspects of Paget's Disease of Bone and to educate health professionals.  It works to raise the profile of the condition, and to raise awareness, both amongst members of the public and health professionals.  It also supports and funds research into all aspects of Paget's Disease of Bone.
objects: (A) TO ENCOURAGE PROMOTE AND ASSIST RESEARCH INTO THE DIAGNOSIS,TREATMENT AND PREVENTION OF PAGET'S DISEASE AND RELATED DISORDERS. (B) THE RELIEF OF PERSONS SUFFERING FROM PAGET'S DISEASE AND RELATED DISORDERS AND TO ENGAGE IN INDIVIDUAL OR JOINT ACTIVITIES ON THEIR BEHALF.

name: THE HARROW HILL TRUST
activities: The Harrow Hill Trust founded in 1960 and is devoted to the needs of the Hill as a whole, and takes a wide view of the local scene. In its work the Trust is careful to avoid the path of narrow conservationism, seeking to enhance the Hill as an exciting and pleasant place to live.
objects: A. TO STIMULATE PUBLIC INTEREST IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT. B. TO PROMOTE HIGH STANDARDS OF PLANNING AND ARCHITECTURE IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT. C. TO SECURE THE PRESERVATION PROTECTION, DEVELOPMENT AND IMPROVEMENT OF FEATURES OF HISTORIC OR PUBLIC INTEREST IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT.

name: THE BLAVATSKY TRUST

activities: The Trustees shall allow Trust properties to be used for the residence of and use by (with or without payment of rent at the discretion of the Trustees) persons of good character and moral worth who should either have been born in the Parish of Urchfont or should have resided in the said Parish for not less than five years and are unable to maintain themeselves by their own exertions.
objects: TWO COTTAGES FOR THE RESIDENCE AND USE (WITH OR WITHOUT PAYMENT OF RENT AT THE DISCRETION OF THE CHARITY TRUSTEES) OF PERSONS OF GOOD CHARACTER AND MORAL WORTH WHO SHALL EITHER HAVE BEEN BORN IN THE PARISH OF URCHFONT OR SHALL HAVE RESIDED IN THE SAIDPARISH AT ANY TIME FOR NOT LESS THAN FIVE YEARS AND SHALL BE UNABLE TO MAINTAIN THEMSELVES BY THEIR OWN EXERTIONS.

name: THE HINTLESHAM AND CHATTISHAM COMMUNITY COUNCIL
activities: Provides a facility for educational and recreational activities for the local community.
objects: TO PROVIDE ADEQUATE RECREATIONAL FACILITIES, PLAYING FIELDS, PLAYGROUNDS, COMMUNITY CENTRES AND OTHER AMENITIES OF A SIMILAR CHARACTER FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE COMMUNITY RESIDING IN HINTLESHAM, CHATTISHAM AND THE NEIGHBOURHOOD. FOR FURTHER DETAILS SEE CLAUSE 2 OF CONSTITUTION.

name: EDWARD WILDE FOUNDATION
activities: Modest donations to organisations known to trustees. Grants to individuals are rarely made. Program for donations is fully committed for several years ahead. Unsolicited applications cannot be acknowledged.
objects: FOR THE RELIEF OF POVERTY, THE ADVANCEMENT OF RELIGION AND SUCH OTHER LEGALLY CHARITABLE OBJECTS AS THE TRUSTEES IN THEIR DISCRETION MAY SELECT.

name: THE LIVING WATERS TRUST
activities: MAKING CASH GIFTS TO CHRISTIAN MISSIONS.
objects: FOR THE BENEFIT OF SUCH ONE OR MORE CHARITABLE ASSOCIATIONS, SOCIETIES, INSTITUTIONS, PURPOSES, CAUSES OF OBJECTS AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL DETERMINE.

name: THE SCHREIB TRUST
activities: The Schreib Trust is constituted by Trust Deed, and its objects are to provide general charitable donations and in particular for the relief of poverty and the advancement of religion and religious education.
objects: FOR THE BENEFIT OF SUCH ONE OR MORE CHARITIES, CHARITABLE INSTITUTIONS OR CHARITABLE PURPOSES IN ANY PART OF THE WORLD IN SUCH SHARES AND IN SUCH MANNER AS THE TRUSTEES IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION MAY FROM TIME TO TIME DETERMINE.

name: THE ROYAL PAVILION AND MUSEUMS FOUNDATION
activities: The advancement of, including the advancement of public appreciation in, the arts, culture, heritage, or science, in particular (without limitation) by acquiring and maintaining suitable objects and works of art for inclusion in the permanent collections at the Royal Pavilion Art Gallery and Museums of Brighton and Hove. Please contact us for the full version.
objects: ADVANCEMENT OF, INCLUDING THE ADVANCEMENT OF PUBLIC APPRECIATION IN THE ARTS, CULTURE, HERITAGE OR SCIENCE BY ACQUIRING SUITABLE OBJECTS AND WORKS OF ART FOR INCLUSION IN THE PERMANENT COLLECTIONS AT THE ROYAL PAVILION ART GALLERY AND MUSEUMS OF BRIGHTON AND HOVE; PROVIDING FOR OR SUPPORTING THE  ESTABLISHMENT, MAINTENANCE, REFURBISHMENT AND ENHANCEMENT OF EXHIBITIONS AND DISPLAYS OF THE SAID PERMANENT COLLECTIONS AND THE BUILDINGS IN WHICH THEY ARE HOUSED; AND PROVIDING FOR, OR SUPPORTING, THE ESTABLISHMENT, MAINTENANCE, REFURBISHMENT AND ENHANCEMENT OF OTHER EXHIBITIONS AND DISPLAYS OF SUCH PERMANENT COLLECTIONS.

name: CARLTON COLVILLE COMMUNITY CENTRE
activities: The Community Centre is the hub of the village, inasmuch as it provides for use of the community, a full size soccer pitch used by two local clubs, A children's play area comprising swings, slides and roundabouts, an area given over to youth sports.  The Community Centre holds regular indoor activities which include toddlers and children's playgroups, dance classes, badminton, and bowls etc.
objects: A COMMUNUTY CENTRE FOR THE USE OF THE INHABITANTS OF THE PARISH OF CARLTON COLVILLE IN THE COUNTY OF SUFFOLK, WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF POLITICAL RELIGIOUS OR OTHER OPINIONS INCLUDING USE FOR MEETINGS LECTURES AND CLASES AND FOR OTHER FORMS OF RECREATIONAND LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR THE SAID INHABITANTS.

name: THE CECCHETTI SOCIETY TRUST
activities: The main objective is the advancement of the education of the public in the art of classical ballet and in particular that art as perpetrated by the Cecchetti Method to include, the furtherance of the Cecchetti Method of training, the holding of classes or courses in classical ballet, organising conferences and seminars on teaching methods and the publication of educational literature on ballet.
objects: THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN THE ART OF CLASSICAL BALLET AND IN PARTICULAR THAT ART AS PERPETRATED BY THE CECCHETTI METHOD OF TRAINING.

name: SOUTH EAST HINDU ASSOCIATION
activities: 1. Religious activities, religious festivals. 2. Hold music sessions (religious only). 3. Hold permission for registered weddings. 4. Advocate community harmony and good relations. 5. Promote peace and harmony with community.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE HINDU RELIGION AND THE DOCTRINES AND OBSERVATIONS WHICH SERVE TO PROMOTE AND MANIFEST THE SAID RELIGION.

name: THE SOUTHWOLD AND REYDON RECREATIONAL DEVELOPMENT COUNCIL

objects: TO PROVIDE ADEQUATE RECREATIONAL FACILITIES, PLAYING FIELDS AND PLAYGOUNDS WITHIN SOUTHWOLD AND THE NEIGHBOURHOOD, IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE; TO ENCOURAGE AND DEVELOP ALL RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES IN THE INTEREST OF SOCIAL WELFARE; TO RAISE BY SUBSCRIPTION OR OTHERWISE FUNDS FOR FURTHERANCE OF THE OBJECTS OF THE COUNCIL.

name: ENFIELD AND DISTRICT VETERAN VEHICLE TRUST
activities: To promote the permanent preservation of vehicles of any type being old and of historic interest or scientific importance and to educate the public in the history of transport and the technical details, engineering and performance of such vehicles.

name: THE C H A INVITED GUEST TRUST

objects: TO APPLY THE INCOME IN PROVIDING HOLIDAYS AND OTHER RECREATION FOR THE BENEFIT OF PERSONS WHO HAVE NEED OF THE FACILITIES PROVIDED BY THE CHARITY BY REASON OF THEIR AGE, YOUTH, INFIRMITY, DISABLEMENTS, POVERTY OR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES IN THE INTRESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE AND WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE.
