activities: The foundation gives grants to further education and to promote the health and wellbeing of young people, mainly in the UK, India and the USA. It also gives humanitarian relief where appropriate, from time to time.
objects: TO PAY OR APPLY THE INCOME TO OR FOR THE BENEFIT OF SUCH CHARITABLE ORGANISATION OR ORGANISATIONS PURPOSE OR PURPOSES AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL FROM TIME TO TIME IN THEIR DISCRETION THINK FIT.

activities: To help people and charitable institutions in need and to provide educational facilities for the community
objects: TO APPLY THE INCOME FOR THE BENEFIT OR FURTHERANCE OF SUCH CHARITABLE PURPOSES CHARITABLE INSTITUTIONS OR CHARITABLE FOUNDATIONS AS THE SETTLOR FROM TIME TO TIME DETERMINES.

objects: RELIEVING EITHER GENERALLY OR INDIVIDUALLY PERSONS RESIDENT IN THE PARISH OF DEPDEN WHO ARE IN CONDITIONS OF NEED HARDSHIP OR DISTRESS.

Create Sikhism awareness by arranging worship and lectures.
objects: THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE SIKH RELIGION, THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION AND THE RELIEF OF POVERTY.

name: LEIGH ON MENDIP RECREATON FIELD MANAGEMENT COMMITTEE
activities: The main activity of this charity has for many years been to provide a recreation ground, used by the public, the local primary school and local football and cricket clubs, and for village events.  We also host recycling facilities.
objects: (1) THE PROVISION AND MAINTENANCE OF A COMMUNITY CENTRE FOR THE USE OF THE INHABITANTS OF LEIGH-ON-MENDIP AND THE SURROUNDING AREA;  (2) TO PROVIDE OR ASSIST IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION, TRAINING OROTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION OF INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES BY REASON OF THEIR YOUTH, OLD AGE, INFIRMITY OR DISABILITY, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR SOCIAL CIRCUMSTANCES WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE;  (3) TO PROVIDE A RECREATION GROUND FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF THE PARISH OF LEIGH-ON-MENDIP AND THE SURROUNDING AREA; AND  (4) TO UNDERTAKE THE PROTECTION AND PRESERVATION OF THE ENVIRONMENT AND TO PROMOTE SUSTAINABLE DEVELOPMENT FOR THE BENEFIT OF THEPUBLIC.    SUBJECT TO CLAUSE 25, THE LAND IDENTIFIED IN PART 2 OF THE SCHEDULE TO THIS SCHEME MUST BE RETAINED BY THE COMMITTEE FOR USE FOR THE OBJECTS OF THE CHARITY.

name: THE FOCOLARE TRUST
activities: The Focolare Movement works towards establishing unity at all levels and all its activities are directed towards this end - the fulfilment of the words of the gospel:" May they all be one". It is also commited to fostering an ever greater equality among peoples and nations. To this end each year it gives a considerable contribution to its members in the developing world and to other projects.
objects: SUCH CHARITABLE PURPOSES CONNECTED WITH THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE CHRISTIAN RELIGION AS MAY FROM TIME TO TIME BE CARRIED OUT BY OR UNDER THE DIRECTION OF MEMBERS OF THE WOMEN'S SECTION OF THE FOCOLARE MOVEMENT. (FOR DETAILS SEE CLAUSE 3 OF THE TRUST DEED).

name: THE CHURCH IN ABINGDON DEVELOPMENT TRUST LIMITED

objects: The Object and purpose of the Trust is to benefit the public by advancing the Christian faith in the Area of Benefit in accordance with the principles and practices of the Participating Denominations and in achieving this purpose the Trust may engage in a range of activities either on its own or with others, including (but not restricted to): (1)	        the celebration of public worship; (2)	the teaching of the Christian faith; (3)	mission and evangelism; (4)	pastoral work, including visitingthe sick and the bereaved; (5)	the provision of facilities with a Christian ethos for the local community, including (but not restricted to) the elderly, the young and other groups with special needs; and (6)	the support of other charities in the UKand overseas.

name: THE FOSTERING NETWORK

(B) TO PROMOTE AND ORGANISE CO-OPERATION IN ACHIEVING THE IMPROVEMENT OF THE QUALITY OF SERVICE GIVEN TO CHILDREN AND OTHERS IN CARE AND TO THAT END BRING TOGETHER IN THE ASSOCIATION FOSTER-CARERS REPRESENTATIVES OF THE AUTHORITIES AND ORGANISATIONS ENGAGED IN ADVANCING FOSTER CARE AND RELIEVING DISTRESS OF CHILDREN AND OTHERS IN CARE AND TO ASSIST THEIR WORK.

name: EMPLOYMENT SUPPORT AND RETRAINING AGENCY LTD
activities: ESRA is a leader in the field of providing local specialist employment related services to our clients (people with mental health problems) and employers.  Our services are available to clients who are looking to return to or retain work and also employers who need advice and support in recruiting or retaining valuable staff (who have mental health problems).
objects: TO ENCOURAGE AND SUPPORT THOSE PREFERABLY IN THE EAST SURREY HEALTH DISTRICT WHO ARE SO MENTALLY OR PHYSICALLY HANDICAPPED AS TO REQUIRE SPECIAL HELP, AND IN PARTICULAR TO RAISE FUNDS AND PROVIDE FACILITIES ON ITS OWN, OR IN ASSOCIATION WITH OTHER STATUTORY OR VOLUNTARY BODIES WITH A VIEW TO PROMOTING EFFECTIVE REHABILITATION AND ULTIMATE RESETTLEMENT OF THOSE WHO ARE OR HAVE BEEN MENTALLY OR PHYSICALLY HANDICAPPED IN THE COMMUNITY.

name: PRIOR PARK EDUCATIONAL TRUST
activities: Operates three schools
objects: TO PROVIDE FOR THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION AND IN CONNECTION THEREWITH TO CONDUCT,CARRY ON,ACQUIRE AND DEVELOP ANY BOARDING OR DAY SCHOOL OR SCHOOLS FOR THE EDUCATION OF CHILDREN OF EITHER OR BOTH SEXES OF THE ROMAN CATHOLIC RELIGION  WITH OTHER CHRISTIAN CHILDREN, WITH OR WITHOUT NON-CHRISTIAN CHILDREN.    TO PROVIDE FOR SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE WORKS WHERESOEVER AND WHATSOEVER AS ADVANCE THE  ROMAN CATHOLIC RELIGION

name: KINGSLEY HALL COMMUNITY CENTRE LIMITED
activities: Activities for the local community including many with a  youth focus 6 days of the week particularly concentrating on week day evenings. Also large women's groups of Somali and Bangladeshi ethnic origin, Tai Chi, Ball Room Dance, patchwork, Zumba, and heritage events for all associated with this internationally known centre. See website
objects: (A) TO PROMOTE THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF THE LONDON BOROUGH OF TOWER HAMLETS WITHOUT REFERENCE TO SEX OR RACE OR POLITICAL, RELIGIOUS OR OTHER OPINIONS BY CO-OPERATING WITH LOCAL AUTHORITIES, VOLUNTARY ORGANISATIONS AND INHABITANTS IN A COMMONEFFORT TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND TO PROVIDE FACILITIES IN THE INTEREST OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION AND LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR THE SAID INHABITANTS. (B) TO ESTABLISH OR TO SECURE THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A COMMUNITY CENTRE AND TO MAINTAIN AND MANAGE OR TO CO-OPERATE WITH ANY LOCAL OR STATUTORY AUTHORITY IN THE MAINTENANCE OF SUCH A CENTRE FOR ACTIVITIES PROMOTED BY THE CENTRE AND ITS CONSTITUENT BODIES IN THE FURTHERANCE OF THE ABOVE OBJECTS.

name: PATANJALI CENTRE FOR CLASSICAL YOGA TRUST LONDON
activities: Classical Yoga Teaching
objects: (A) TO ADVANCE PUBLIC EDUCATION IN THE CLASSICAL TEACHINGS OF THE SCIENCE OF YOGA, BASED UPON THE PRINCIPLES OF THE HIGHEST STANDARDS OF PERSONAL CONDUCT AND SERVICE TO OTHERS. (B) TO PROMOTE AND ADVANCE FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT THE STUDY AND PRACTICE OF AND RESEARCH INTO THE THERAPEUTIC EFFECTS OF YOGA AS A MEANS OF IMPROVING THE MENTAL, PHYSICAL AND SPIRITUAL HEALTH OF THE COMMUNITY, AND TO PUBLISH THE USEFUL RESULTS OF ANY SUCH RESEARCH.

name: WEALDEN IRON RESEARCH GROUP
activities: To promote investigation and collate information on the Wealden Iron Industry and related activities for the benefit of the public by: publication and historical/archaeological research
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN HISTORICAL AND ARCHAEOLOGICAL STUDY AND, IN PARTICULAR, TO PROMOTE INVESTIGATION AND COLLATE INFORMATION CONCERNING THE WEALDEN IRON INDUSTRY AND RELATED ACTIVITIES FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC.

name: THE AVON RIDING CENTRE FOR THE DISABLED LIMITED
activities: Provision of therapeutic riding lessons to around 300 disabled children and adults in one of the UK's largest equestrian centres purpose built for disabled riders. Set among 100 acres of fields and woodland, the Centre offers individual development, enabling clients to achieve skill and confidence in a safe, friendly and attractive environment.
objects: THE RELIEF OF DISABLED PERSONS (WHETHER PHYSICALLY OR MENTALLY) BY THE PROVISION OR ASSISTANCE IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR RIDING.

name: UNITED KINGDOM TURKISH ISLAMIC ASSOCIATION
activities: To provide a place to worship and facilities for education and religious studies for Muslims. It also endeavours to help those in need.
objects: 1. TO ADVANCE THE RELIGION OF ISLAM. 2. TO RELIEVE SUCH MEMBERS OF THE MUSLIM COMMUNITY WHO ARE IN NECESSITOUS CIRCUMSTANCES. 3. TO ADVANCE PUBLIC EDUCATION IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE TENETS AND DOCTRINES OF ISLAM AND TRADITIONS OF TURKISH CULTURE.

name: THE NHIC EDUCATIONAL TRUST
activities: Promotes awareness through publicity and education on all matters relating to maintaining and improving residential property. Encourages the better use of homes by stimultaing activity by householders, the industry, local authories and Government departments.Complements the activities of The National Home Improvement Council
objects: FOR THE ADVANCEMENT OF PUBLIC EDUCATION AND CHARITABLE PURPOSES FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE COMMUNITY AS A WHOLE (SEE TRUST DEED FOR FURTHER DETAILS).

name: WEST LONDON MISSION HOUSING ASSOCIATION LIMITED
activities: A housing association whose properties are used in connection with housing people with special needs.
objects: TO FURTHER THE CHARITABLE WORK OF THE METHODIST CHURCH FOR THE RELIEF OF AGED IMPOTENT AND POOR PEOPLE AND THOSE IN NEED OF CARE PROTECTION AND HEALING AND THE ADVANCEMENT OF RELIGION IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE DOCTRINES AND DISCIPLINE OF SAID CHURCH.

name: HAMPSTEAD COMMUNITY ACTION LIMITED
activities: PLAYGROUPS, PLAYCENTRE (ASC AND PLAYSCHEMES), OVER 60s, SUPPORT GROUPS, PRODUCE MARKET, EDUCATION, ADVICE
objects: TO PROMOTE THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS IN THE PART OF THE LONDON BOROUGH OF CAMDEN BEING THE AREA ENCOMPASSED BY A CIRCLE OF ONE KILOMETRE RADIUS CENTRED ON HAMPSTEAD TUBE STATION.

name: NENE VALLEY PHAB CLUB
activities: Social club and outings
objects: THE RELIEF OF ILLNESS, SICKNESS AND SUFFERING OF PHYSICALLY HANDICAPPED PERSONS RESIDENT IN THE AREA OF THE NENE VALLEY, BY BRINGING SUCH PERSONS INTO CLOSER ASSOCIATION WITH ABLE BODIED PEOPLE AD THE PROVISION OF, OR ASSISTANCE IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION OF SUCH PERSONS.

name: HORSHAM UNIT 186 OF THE SEA CADET CORPS
activities: Unit of the Sea Cadet National Organisation providing Training to youths between ages of 10 and 18 in acccordance with the methods laid down by the Sea Cadet Organisation.
objects: The charitable purpose of the Unit (the Purpose) is to promote the development of young people in achieving their physical, intellectual and social potential as individuals and as responsible citizens by the provision of education and leisure time activities using a nautical theme and in accordance with the principles, ethos and practices of the Marine Society & Sea Cadets (MSSC).

name: SIDDINGTON TRUST LIMITED
activities: Residential courses and retreats Talks
objects: THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION AND THE TRAINING OF CHARACTER IN ACCORDANCE WITH CHRISTIAN PRINCIPLES AND IDEALS. FOR FULL DETAILS SEE OBJECTS CLAUSE MEMORANDUM OF ASSOCIATION.

name: FRIENDS OF JEWISH YOUTH
activities: The objects of the Association are to provide or assist in the provision of facilities for recreation and other leisure-time occupation in the interests of social welfare for young persons of the Jewish Faith within the United Kingdom with the object of improving the conditions of life for the persons for whom the facilities are primarily intended.
objects: TO PROVIDE OR ASSIST IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR RECREATION AND OTHER LEISURE-TIME OCCUPATION IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR YOUNG PERSONS OF THE JEWISH FAITH WITHIN THE UNITED KINGDOM WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFEFOR THE PERSONS FOR WHOM THE FACILITITIES ARE PRIMARILY INTENDED.

name: NORTH WEST KENT FAMILY HISTORY SOCIETY
activities: TO PROMOTE THE STUDY OF FAMILY HISTORY, GENEALOGY AND HERALDRY IN THE AREAS OF SOUTH EAST LONDON AND NORTH WEST KENT AND TO AID THE RESEARCH OF OTHERS BY PRESERVING, TRANSCRIBING AND PUBLISHING HISTORIC RECORDS OF THESE AREAS.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE SOCIETY SHALL BE TO PROMOTE AND ENCOURAGE EDUCATION IN THE STUDY OF FAMILY HISTORY AND GENEALOGY IN RELATION TO NATIONAL AND LOCAL HISTORY.

name: BRACKNELL CHORAL SOCIETY
activities: Provide Classical choral concerts.
objects: TO ADVANCE, IMPROVE, DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN PUBLIC EDUCATION IN, AND APPRECIATION OF, ART AND SCIENCE OF MUSIC IN ALL ITS ASPECTS BY ANY MEANS THE TRUSTEES SEE FIT, INCLUDING THROUGH THE PRESENTATION OF PUBLIC CONCERTS AND RECITALS.

name: THE DORSET HISTORIC CHURCHES TRUST
activities: The object of the trust is to assist financially with the preservation, repair, maintenance and preservation of Christian churches and chapels in Dorset. The trustees decide as a matter of policy from time to time which of those things shall be aided by grants made by them.
objects: THE PRESERVATION, REPAIR, MAINTENANCE, IMPROVEMENT, UPKEEP, BEAUTIFICATION AND RECONSTRUCTION OF CHURCHES IN DORSET AND OF MONUMENTS, FITTINGS, FIXTURES, STAINED GLASS FURNITURE, ORNAMENTS AND CHATTELS IN SUCH CHURCHES AND OF THE CHURCHYARD BELONGING TO ANY SUCH CHURCHES.

name: THE MORGAN CHARITABLE FOUNDATION
activities: To provide funds for the benefit of worthy Charitable Organisations.
objects: TO OR FOR THE BENEFIT OF SUCH CHARITABLE INSTITUTION OR CHARITABLE INSTITUTIONS OR CHARITABLE PURPOSE OR CHARITABLE PURPOSES OR CHARITABLE OBJECT OR CHARITABLE OBJECTS AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL THINK FIT OR BY DEED APPOINT.

name: NORTHUMBERLAND HUSSARS REGIMENTAL MUSEUM
activities: The purpose of the Museum is to protect the regimental collection, uphold the tradition of the Regiment and perpetuate its deeds for future generations.
objects: UPHOLDING THE TRADITIONS OF THE REGIMENT.

name: EARL OF CHICHESTER'S CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: To support the work of charities, voluntary organisations and individuals.
objects: FOR SUCH CHARITABLE ORGANISATIONS OR SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES AND AT SUCH TIMES AND IN SUCH MANNER AS THE TRUSTEES IN THEIR DISCRETION SHALL THINK FIT.

name: SEEDFIELD TRUST
activities: The charity makes grants in furtherance of its charitable objectives.
objects: TO PROCLAIM AND FURTHER THE GOSPEL OF GOD CONCERNING HIS SON JESUS CHRIST OUR LORD AND THE PREACHING AND TEACHING OF THE CHRISTIAN FAITH THROUGHOUT THE UNITED KINGDOM OF GREAT BRITAIN AND ELSEWHERE. (SEE TRUST DEED FOR FULL DETAILS).

name: SOUTHEND-ON-SEA MUSICAL FESTIVAL ASSOCIATION
activities: 1. To encourage the study, performance and appreciation of good music (and drama) by holding annual public competitions. 2. To afford the competitors the opportunity of having their qualifications tested by eminent adjudicators.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN THE ARTS, AND IN PARTICULAR THE ARTS OF MUSIC, SPEECH AND DRAMA, AND DANCE, IN ALL THEIR BRANCHES.

name: CAMPHILL MILTON KEYNES COMMUNITIES LIMITED
activities: Our mission is to create a living and working community where adults with learning disabilities and those who support them may reach their full potential in the spirit of life-long learning.Over fifty residents live together with volunteer staff in ten separate households, forming an intentional community on several sites within the neighbouring areas of Pennyland and Willen Park in Milton Keynes.
objects: FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT, TO RELIEVE SICKNESS, PROMOTE GOOD HEALTH, PROVIDE CARE TO AND ADVANCE THE EDUCATION AND TRAINING OF PEOPLE WITH DISABILITY (WHETHER MENTAL OF PHYSICAL), THE YOUNG, THE OLD, OR PEOPLE OTHERWISE IN NEED, IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PRINCIPLES OF DR RUDOLF STEINER (AS SUMMARISED IN THE APPENDIX TO THIS MEMORANDUM), PARTICULARLY (WITHOUT LIMITATION) BY THE ESTABLISHMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF COMMUNITIES IN THE FORM OF VILLAGES, RESIDENTIAL HOUSES, DAY CENTRES, KINDERGARTENS, SCHOOLS, COLLEGES OR OTHER TYPES OF SOCIAL AND/ OR EDUCATIONAL COMMUNITY, IN WHICH BENEFICIARIES LIVE AND/ OR WORK AND/ OR TO WHICH THEY OTHERWISE RESORT, IN COMMUNITY WITH PERSONS PROVIDING SUPPORT.

name: BATE AND HULLCOOP FOUNDATION
activities: Donations to Schools for the furthering of the education of children.
objects: PROVIDING FOR THE SHIPLAKE CHURCH OF ENGLAND SCHOOL SUCH SPECIAL BENEFITS OF ANY KIND NOT NORMALLY PROVIDED AT THE SCHOOL BY THE LOCAL EDUCATION AUTHORITY.

name: EBENEZER TRUST
activities: The charity gives support to Christian ministries and organisations carrying on activities which the trustees are able to validate by personal knowledge of some or all of the personnel involved.
objects: (A) TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH. (B) FOR THE RELIEF OF POVERTY AND THE ADVANCEMENT OF CHRISTIAN EDUCATION WHETHER WITHIN THE BRITISH ISLES OF ELSEWHERE. FOR DETAILS, SEE CLAUSE 4 OF TRUST DEED.

name: FRIENDS OF SHENSTONE AND SVF
activities: The Friends fundraise to support the purchasing of specialised equipment for Shenstone School pupils.  They also help fund the purchase and maintenance of school buses, and play equipment for outside areas.  Shenstone is a school for pupils aged 2 to 11 with severe learning difficulties. The school operates across two sites, Shenstone School (Crayford) and Shenstone Early Years Centre (Sidcup).
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUPILS OF THE SCHOOL BY PROVIDING AN ASSISTING IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITES FOR EDUCATION AT THE SCHOOL (NOR NORMALLY PROVIDED BY THE LOCAL EDUCATION AUTHORITY).

name: PARTRIDGE GREEN COLVIN WOMEN'S INSTITUTE
activities: Local Women's Institute providing social and educational activities.
objects: TO IMPROVE AND DEVELOP CONDITIONS OF RURAL LIFE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE CONSTITUTION AND RULES OF THE WOMEN'S INSTITUTE.

name: BRIGADIER GOULBURN'S 1982 CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: General charitable activities
objects: TO APPLY THE INCOME AND MAY APPLY THE CAPITAL THEREOF FOR SUCH CHARITABLE PURPOSES OR PAY THE SAME TO SUCH CHARITABLE BODIES ASSOCIATIONS OR INSTITUTIONS AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION DETERMINE.

name: THE SICK CHILDREN'S TRUST
activities: The Sick Children's Trust provides essential accommodation and amenities (Homes from Home) for the families and carers of sick children undergoing treatment at a number of hospitals around the country.
objects: TO PROMOTE AND FURTHER THE CARE RELIEF AND TREATMENT OF SICK CHILDREN AT OR REGISTERED WITH THE HOSPITAL FOR SICK CHILDREN GREAT ORMOND STREET OR AT OR REGISTERED WITH ANY OTHER HOSPITAL IN GREAT BRITAIN AND NORTHERN IRELAND.

name: ST MARY'S CHURCH (WITNEY) PRESERVATION TRUST
activities: PRESERVATION AND UPKEEP OF BUILDING AND FABRIC OF ST MARY'S PARISH CHURCH WITNEY
objects: THE RESTORATION, REPAIR AND UPKEEP OF THE FABRIC OF THE CHURCH INCLUDING THE PROVISION OF EQUIPMENT TO COMPLY WITH STATUTORY REQUIREMENTS, THE PROVISION, RESTORATION AND REPAIR OF MONUMENTS, ORNAMENTS, FURNISHINGS, ORGAN, WINDOWS AND OTHER EMBELLISHMENTS AND EQUIPMENTS OF THE CHURCH, SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES CONNECTED WITH THE CHURCH AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL DETERMINE, AND FOR SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE FOUNDATIONS AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL FROM TIME TO TIME UNANIMOUSLY DECLARE.

name: ELSIE DOROTHY KNIGHT MEMORIAL TRUST
activities: To provide grants in respect of capital projects undertaken at St. Margaret's Church Rochester.
objects: FOR THE GENERAL PURPOSES OF ST MARGARET'S CHURCH IN THE PARISH OF ROCHESTER IN THE COUNTY OF KENT.

name: THE HAMPSHIRE GENEALOGICAL SOCIETY
activities: Promote the study of family history and provide information and education services to facilitate this study.
objects: THE AIMS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE SOCIETY SHALL BE TO ADVANCE THE STUDY OF FAMILY HISTORY RESEARCH.  IN FURTHERANCE OF THIS THE SOCIETY MAY:  (A) COLLECT, PUBLISH, CO-ORDINATE AND MAKE ACCESSIBLE IN THE INTERESTS OF FAMILY HISTORY ANY DOCUMENTS OR RECORDS PARTICULARLY RELATING TO THE COUNTY OF HAMPSHIRE.  (B) PROMOTE THE PRESERVATION AND PRESENTATION OF SUCH DOCUMENTS AND RECORDS.  (C) HOLD LECTURES, OUTINGS, MEETINGS AND DISCUSSIONS, GIVE ADVICE AND GUIDANCE AND ISSUE PUBLICATIONS.

name: THE NORWICH CHILDREN'S FUND
activities: To provide for the babies and children attending the Neonatal Unit and paediatric Department at the Norfolk & Norwich University Hospital in Norfolk & Suffolk.
objects: TO BENEFIT SUCH EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE OBJECTS OR PURPOSES IN THE UNITED KINGDOM OR ELSEWHERE AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL THINK FIT AND IN PARTICULAR BUT WITHOUT PREJUDICE TO THE GENERALITY OF THE FOREGOING THE TRUSTEES MAY PAY OR APPLY THE WHOLE OR PART OFTHE TRUST FUND AND THE IMCOME THEREOF FOR THE PROMOTION AND FURTHERANCE OF THE MEDICAL TREATMENT OF CHILDREN AND RESEARCH INTO CHILDREN'S DISEASES.

name: CONTACT A FAMILY
activities: To support parents and families who care for a disabled child by: - Providing access to good quality advice and information, broad ranging appropriate support and contact with other families which will lead to positive outcomes; - Influencing changes in policy and practice in order to substantially improve the quality of lives of parents and families and their children.
objects: TO PROMOTE THE EDUCATION, WELFARE AND BENEFIT OF THE DISABLED, MORE SPECIFICALLY, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, CARING FOR CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE WITH ANY KIND OF DISABILITY OR SPECIAL NEED.

name: LEATHERHEAD AND DORKING GYMNASTIC CLUB
activities: Providing the children of Leatherhead and Dorking and surrounding District with gymnastics tuition at affordable prices, with no charge to needy cases.
objects: TO ORGANISE OR PROVIDE OR ASSIST IN THE ORGANISATION AND PROVISION OF A FACILITY WHICH WILL ENABLE AND ENCOURAGE PUPILS OF SCHOOLS AND UNIVERSITIES TO UNDERTAKE GYMNASTICS TO ASSIST IN ENSURING THAT DUE ATTENTION IS GIVEN TO THE PHYSICAL EDUCATION ANDDEVELOPMENT OF SUCH PUPILS AS WELL AS TO THE DEVELOPMENT AND OCCUPATION OF THEIR MINDS.

name: THE JOHN OLDACRE FOUNDATION
activities: To provide financial support for the advancement or promotion, for the public benefit, of research and education in agricultural sciences and the publication of the useful results of such research
objects: SUCH CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS THE TRUSTEES MAY BY DEED APPOINT AND IN DEFAULT OF SUCH APPOINTMENT FOR THE ADVANCEMENT OF PROMOTION FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT OF RESEARCH AND EDUCATION IN AGRICULTURAL SCIENCES AND THE PUBLICATION OF THE USEFUL RESULTS OF SUCH RESEARCH.

name: MISSION CARE
activities: Mission Care is a Christian charity that provides nurisng care and support to the elderly frail, older people with mental health needs and people with physical disabilities in South London and Kent.  We also have a growing work partnering with other organisations to help them fund and manage capital projects, to date principally in East Africa.
objects: THE RELIEF OF SICKNESS AND POVERTY, THE RELIEF OF THE AGED, HANDICAPPED OR INFIRM AND THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE CHRISTIAN RELIGION IN THE LONDON BOROUGHS OF SOUTHWARK, LEWISHAM, GREENWICH, BROMLEY AND ELSEWHERE AS THE TRUSTEES MAY DETERMINE.

name: THE ROYAL ALBERT HALL TRUST
activities: The trust receives and invests funds in support of the maintenance and preservation of the Royal Albert Hall, a Grade 1 listed building of historic and cultural significance, and of the work of the Hall in seeking to advance education for public benefit by the provision of such instructive activities that relate to the Hall as the Trustees shall from time to time determine.
objects: THE MAINTENANCE, PRESERVATION, RESTORATION, IMPROVEMENT, RENEWAL, DECORATION AND GENERAL UPKEEP OF THE ROYAL ALBERT HALL.  TO ADVANCE EDUCATION FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT BY THE PROVISION OF SUCH INSTRUCTIVE ACTIVITIES THAT RELATE TO THE ROYAL ALBERT HALLAS THE TRUSTEES SHALL FROM TIME TO TIME DETERMINE.

name: THE HENBURY SCHOOL TRUST
activities: The objects of the charity are to advance the education of the students of Henbury School, Bristol by providing and assisting in the provision of facilities for education at the school being primarily but not exclusively facilities not normally provided by the academy.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUPILS FROM TIME TO TIME AT HENBURY SCHOOL, MARISSAL ROAD, HENBURY, BRISTOL BY PROVIDING EXTRA FACILITIES AND TO FOSTER MORE CONTACTS BETWEEN THE SCHOOL STAFF AND PARENTS OF PUPILS AND OTHERS ASSOCIATED WITH THE SCHOOL

name: ILCHESTER AND DISTRICT COMMUNITY ASSOCIATION
activities: IDCA currently funds & organises the village street fair, craft & produce show and Christmas fair. We produce the village newsletter on a bi-monthly basis to over 1200 homes. We donate money to help other organisations within the village such as Guides, Scouts, Youth Parish Council, Tots Groups etc.
objects: A. TO PROMOTE THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF ILCHESTER, LIMINGTON, PODIMORE AND YEOVILTON AND THE NEIGHBOURHOOD WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF SEX OR OF POLITICAL, RELIGIOUS OR OTHER OPINIONS BY ASSOCIATING THE LOCAL AUTHORITIES VOLUNTARY ORGANISATIONS ANDINHABITANTS IN A COMMON EFFORT TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND TO PROVIDE FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION AND LEISURE-TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR THE SAID INHABITANTS. B. TO ESTABLISHOR SECURE THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A COMMUNITY CENTRE AND TO MAINTAIN AND MNAGE, OR TO CO-OPERATE WITH ANY LOCAL STATUTORY AUTHORITY IN THE MAINTENANCE AND MANAGEMENT OF SUCH A CENTRE FOR ACTIVITIES PROMOTED BY THE ASSOCIATION AND ITS CONSTITUENT BODIES IN FURTHERANCE OF THE ABOVE OBJECTS.

name: NAS UWT BENEVOLENT FUNDS
activities: Relief of hardship amongst members, former members, dependants of members and former members and dependants of deceased members.
objects: THE RELIEF OF POVERTY AMONGST FULL MEMBERS, NON FULL MEMBERS AND RETIRED MEMBERS OF THE ASSOCIATION AND THEIR DEPENDANTS AND THE DEPENDANTS OF DECEASED MEMBERS, AND TO PROVIDE FOR THE FURTHER EDUCATION OF THE NEEDY CHILDREN OF MEMBERS OR DECEASED MEMBERS OF THE ASSOCIATION.

name: THE CADWALLADER TRUST
activities: The aim of the Charity is to raise funds to support rowing at Jesus College Oxford both with capital expenditure and training costs.
objects: THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION OF THE UNDERGRADUATES OF JESUS COLLEGE OXFORD BY THE PROMOTION OF ROWING AT THE COLLEGE BY ASSISTING THE COLLEGE BOAT CLUB.

name: THE VENTURE TRUST
activities: Venture Trust helps people, who, because of their life experiences, are marginalised, disadvantaged, chaotic or vulnerable, to recognise what they need to change, then gives them the confidence, motivation and lifeskills they need to make those changes. At the heart of its work, Venture Trust gives people time, space, challenge and intensive personal development support in wilderness settings.
objects: (A) THE ADVANCEMENT ORGANISATION AND PROMOTION OF PUBLIC EDUCATION AND RESEARCH AND IN PARTICULAR TO SET UP AND CARRY OUT PROJECTS WHICH WILL ESTABLISH EVIDENCE ADDING TO AND ADVANCING KNOWLEDGE OF ARCHAEOLOGY, CONSERVATION, ADVENTURE TRAINING AND THEDEVELOPMENT OF INTELLECTUAL AND PHYSICAL CAPACITIES; INCLUDING THE PUBLICATION OF THE USEFUL RESULTS OF SUCH EDUCATION INVESTIGATIONS AND RESEARCH. (B) THE DEVELOPMENT OF CHARACTER AND LASTING QUALITIES OF GOOD CITIZENSHIP THROUGH PHYSICAL AND EDUCATION TRAINING SELF-DISCIPLINE AND RELIANCE AND SERVICE TO THE COMMUNITY, THEREBY ADVANCING THE MENTAL PHYSICAL AND SPIRITUAL WELFARE OF YOUNG PERSONS. (C) THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES OR PROJECTS FOR PHYSICAL RECREATION IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC. (D) TO ASSIST AND ENCOURAGE PEOPLE OF ALL AGES AND FROM ALL BACKGROUNDS TO DEVELOP A SPIRIT OF SERVICE AND AN ABILITY TO SERVE THE COMMUNITY FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE COMMUNITY. (E) TO PROMOTE OR BENEFIT SUCH ONE OR MORE PURPOSES OR INSTITUTIONS AS SHALL FROM TIME TO TIME BE CHARITABLE BY ENGLISH LAW

name: BASILDON NATURAL HISTORY SOCIETY
activities: Holds regular lectures in natural history subjects; practical conservation work parties; monitors and records local wildlife; monitors potential effect of local planning applications on wildlife; supports the work of Essex Wildlife Trust.
objects: FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC TO CONSERVE OR ASSIST IN THE CONSERVATION OF ALL FORMS OF WILD LIFE, FLORA AND FAUNA, IN THE BASILDON DISTRICT AND ITS IMMEDIATE SURROUNDINGS, TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC WITHIN THE AREA OF BENEFIT IN ALL FLORAAND FAUNA AND MATTERS RELATING THERETO AND TO PROMOTE THE ESTABLISHMENT OF WILD LIFE AND NATURE RESERVES WITHIN THE AREA OF BENEFIT.(FOR FURTHER DETAILS SEE CLAUSE 2 OF THE CONSTITUTION).

name: THE ASGILL HOUSE TRUST LIMITED
activities: Preservation of listed buildings together with the heritage and other environmental aspects of their setting.
objects: TO PRESERVE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE NATION AT LARGE WHATEVER OF THE HISTORICAL ARCHITECTURAL AND CONSTRUCTIONAL HERITAGE MAY EXIST IN AND AROUND THE UNITED KINGDOM IN THE FORM OF BUILDINGS OF PARTICULAR BEAUTY OR HISTORICAL ARCHITECTURAL OR CONSTRUCTIONAL INTEREST.

name: THE CHARLES LITTLEWOOD HILL TRUST
activities: The sole activity of the trust is the giving of grants
objects: FOR SUCH CHARITABLE PURPOSE OR PURPOSES OR IN FURTHERANCE OF ANY SUCH CHARITABLE OFJECT OR OBJECTS (AND WHETHER SUCH PURPOSES ARE WITHIN OR OUTSIDE ENGLAND) AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION THINK FIT OR DETERMINE.

name: HENLEY TRINITY TRAINER POOL ASSOCIATION
activities: Hire of swimming pool in Henley on Thames for recreational use.
objects: TO ASSIST IN THE PROVISION OF A SWIMMING POOL FIRSTLY FOR THE BENEFIT OF SCHOOL CHILDREN AND SECONDLY FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC IN HENLEY.

name: THE SCLERODERMA SOCIETY
activities: Patient support group with focus on improving awareness of scleroderma, facilitating contact between scleroderma sufferers and funding medical and scientific research into scleroderma.
objects: TO RELIEVE PERSONS SUFFERING FROM SCLERODERMA, TO PROMOTE RESEARCH INTO THE CAUSES AND TREATMENT OF SCLERODERMA AND RELATED DISORDERS AND TO DISSEMINATE THE USEFUL RESULTS OF SUCH RESEARCH AND TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC ABOUT SUCH DISORDERS.

name: INDIA WELFARE SOCIETY
activities: To promote the relief of poverty, relief and distress specially in the Indian Community.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE INHABITANTS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM AND IN PARTICULAR MEMBERS OF THE INDIAN COMMUNITY AND THE RELIEF OF SUCH PERSONS WHO ARE IN CONDITIONS OF NEED HARDSHIP OR DISTRESS.

name: PETT LEVEL INDEPENDENT RESCUE BOAT ASSN.
activities: To provide an inshore rescue service.
objects: THE PRESERVATION OF LIFE FROM SHIPWRECK BY THE PROVISION OF A SEA RESCUE SERVICE IN THE VICINITY OF RYE BAY.

name: CONCORDE WHEELCHAIR DANCERS ASSOCIATION
activities: wheelchair dancing
objects: THE RELIEF OF DISABLED PEOPLE BY THE PROVISION OF RECREATIONAL FACILITIES IN THE FORM OF WHEELCHAIR DANCING.

name: HAROLD MOORHOUSE CHARITY
activities: To allocate the Investment Income received between the Institutions and the residents of Burnham Market that were in need of assistance according to the terms and conditions set out in the Will of the late Harold Moorhouse.
objects: SUCH BEQUESTS GRANTS AND PAYMENTS AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL THINK FIT OUT OF THE INCOME OF THE TRUST FUND FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE POOR AND NEEDY IN THE PARISH OF BURNHAM MARKET TWICE IN EVERY YEAR AND THE TRUSTEES SHALL ON EACH OCCASION MAKE A DONATION IN SUCH SUM AS THEY SHALL IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION DECIDE TO: (A) THE FRIENDS OF WELLS COTTAGE HOSPITAL, WELLS-NEXT-THE-SEA, NORFOLK. (B) THE ROYAL NATIONAL INSTITUTE FOR THE BLIND.

name: TAVERHAM AND DISTRICT DAY CARE CENTRE
activities: The day care centre provides facilities for elderly & disabled people to have social contacts and a hot midday meal. We provide organised entertainment, slide shows, talks, live music, light exercise and bingo. Computer training, hairdressing & chiropody are available. We also arrange coach outings during the year.
objects: TO PROMOTE THE WELFARE OF THE ELDERLY OR HANDICAPPED IN ANY MANNER WHICH NOW IS OR HEREAFTER MAY BE DEEMED BY LAW TO BE CHARITABLE AND IN PARTICULAR: A) PROVIDE AND MAINTAIN A DAY CENTRE FOR THE PURPOSEOF RECREATION AND OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE AND THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THEIR CONDITION OF LIFE AND B) PROVIDE HOT MEALS TO ELDERLY OR HANDICAPPED PERSONS WHO THROUGH THEIR AGE OR INFIRMITY ARE UNABLE TO PREPARE MEALS FOR THEMSELVES.

name: TAVERHAM AND DISTRICT DAY CARE CENTRE
activities: The day care centre provides facilities for elderly & disabled people to have social contacts and a hot midday meal. We provide organised entertainment, slide shows, talks, live music, light exercise and bingo. Computer training, hairdressing & chiropody are available. We also arrange coach outings during the year.
objects: TO PROMOTE THE WELFARE OF THE ELDERLY OR HANDICAPPED IN ANY MANNER WHICH NOW IS OR HEREAFTER MAY BE DEEMED BY LAW TO BE CHARITABLE AND IN PARTICULAR: A) PROVIDE AND MAINTAIN A DAY CENTRE FOR THE PURPOSEOF RECREATION AND OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE AND THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THEIR CONDITION OF LIFE AND B) PROVIDE HOT MEALS TO ELDERLY OR HANDICAPPED PERSONS WHO THROUGH THEIR AGE OR INFIRMITY ARE UNABLE TO PREPARE MEALS FOR THEMSELVES.

name: LIBRARY SERVICES TRUST
activities: Making grants to individuals, groups and organisations who are members of or are associated with the Chartered Institute of Library and Information Professionals (CILIP) to help further their educational and or professional development including attendance at courses, conferences weekend, schools and educational visits at home and overseas and other promotional activities.
objects: TO PROMOTE EDUCATION IN LIBRARIANSHIP, BIBLIOGRAPHY AND RELATED SUBJECTS BOTH WITHIN THE UNITED KINGDOM AND ELSEWHERE THROUGHOUT THE WORLD.

name: HANHAM TODDLERS PRESCHOOL
activities: Pre-school
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF CHILDREN BELOW COMPLUSORY SCHOOL AGE BY (A) PROVIDING SAFE AND SATISFYING GROUP PLAY IN WHICH PRENTS MAY TAKE PART. (B) ENCOURAGE OTHER CHARITABLE ACTIVITIES THROUGH WHICH PARENTS MAY HELP THE CHILDREN. (C) FURTHER THE AIMSOF THE PRE-SCHOOL ASSOICIATION.

name: NAFSIYAT
activities: Nafsiyat provides intercultural psychotherapy and counselling to diverse cultural, ethnic and linguistic communities. Therapeutic help is offered to those experiencing emotional and psychological problems. Clinical supervision and training relating to intercultural therapy are also delivered. Nafsiyat works in partnership with therapeutic and community organisations.
objects: THE RELIEF OF SICKNESS AND THE ADVANCEMENT OF PSYCHOTHERAPEUTIC KNOWLEDGE FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT BY THE PROMOTION OF THE STUDY AND PRACTICE BENEFIT BY THE PROMOTION OF THE STUDY AND PRACTICE OF THE ART AND SCIENCE OF PSYCHOTHERAPY AND IN PARTICULAR AMONGST PERSONS BELONGING TO TO ONE OR MORE RELIGIOUS, RACIAL, NATIONAL OR OTHER SIMILAR GROUPS INENGLAND AND ELSEWHERE.

name: AMERY HILL SCHOOL TRUST
activities: Providing support for the wider education of pupils at Amery Hill School - A Specialist Music School.
objects: ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION OF THE PUPILS OF THE AMERY HILL SCHOOL

name: MAIDSTONE LIONS CLUB CHARITY TRUST FUND
activities: Maidstone Lions Club Charity Trust Fund meet every month to consider any application made for financial assistance, of reasonable and moderate proportion, within our income.
objects: TO RAISE MONEY AND USE AND DISTRIBUTE SUCH MONIES TO CHARITABLE CAUSES FOR SUCH CHARITABLE PURPOSE OR PURPOSES ACCORDING TO THE LAWS OF ENGLAND AND WALES THROUGHOUT THE UK AND EIRE OR ELSEWHERE. (FOR FURTHER DETAILS SEE DECLARATION OF TRUST DATED 31STAUGUST 1983).

name: BEDFORD SCHOOL LUNT-WALDECKER TRUST
activities: Disadvantaged pupils and former staff of Bedford School in need of financila help
objects: (A) THE PROVISION OF SCHOLARSHIPS FOR PUPILS TO ATTEND BEDFORD SCHOOL AND FOR FORMER PUPILS OF THE SCHOOL TO PURSUE HIGHER EDUCATION OR FURTHER EDUCATION OR BOTH. (B) THE PROVISION OF GRANTS FOR PERSONS WHO ARE MEMBERS OF THE TEACHING STAFF OF BEDFORDSCHOOL. (C) THE PROVISION OF ANY OTHER BENEFIT FOR THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION AT BEDFORD SCHOOL.

name: BASINGSTOKE MUSLIM WELFARE ASSOCIATION

MATRIMONIAL PROVIDE COUNSELLING AND SUPPORT FOR MARRIAGE AND DIVORCE ISSUES
objects: TO ADVANCE THE ISLAMIC FIATH AND TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF MUSLIMS IN THE AREA OF BASINGSTOKE.

name: LINGFIELD NOTRE DAME ASSOCIATION
activities: Parents Evenings, Quiz Nights, Childrens Discos, Xmas Fair & Summer Funday and occasionally a School Ball
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUPILS OF THE SCHOOL BY PROVIDING AND ASSISTING IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR EDUCATION AT THE SCHOOL.

name: CHURCH TRUST
activities: Grant making Trust
objects: (1) AS TO ONE-SIXTEENTH THEREOF FOR ANY CHARITABLE PURPOSE FOR THE GENERAL BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF THE AREA OF BENEFIT. (2) AS TO A FURTHER SEVEN-SIXTEENTHS THEREOF IN OR TOWARDS THE MAINTENANCE AND REPAIR OF THE FABRIC OF THE PARISH CHURCH OF THE ECCLESIASTICAL PARISH OF ST. LEONARD, ST. LEONARDS AND THE CHURCHYARD AND OTHER PROPERTY THEREOF AND IN ESTABLISHING AND MAINTAINING AN EXTRAORDINARY REPAIR FUND IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS HEREINAFTER CONTAINED. (3) AS TO THE REMAINING EIGHT-SIXTEENTHS THEREOF THE TRUSTEES MAY APPLY SUCH PART AS THEY FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT IN OR TOWARDS THE PAYMENT OF EXPENSES INCURRED BY THE INCUMBENT OF THE BENEFICE OF HAWRIDGE WITH CHOLESBURY AND ST. LEONARDS IN CARRYING OUT HIS DUTIES WITHIN THEAREA OF BENEFIT AND SUBJECT THERETO IN DEFRAYING THE EXPENSES OF MAINTAINING SERVICES AT THE SAID CHURCH. (4) ANY REMAINING PART OF THE SAID INCOME NOT REQUIRED FOR APPLICATION IN MANNER AFORESAID SHALL BE APPLIED BY THE TRUSTEES IN FURTHERING THE RELIGIOUS AND OTHER CHARITABLE WORK OF THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT.

name: PRINCES RISBOROUGH ROTARY CLUB CHARITY FUND
activities: Makes grants to organisations, elderly/old people, other charities or volunatry bodies, children/young people, provides human resources, peopleof a particular ethnic or racial origin, people with disabilities, makes grants to individuals, general charitable purposes
objects: TO APPLY BOTH CAPITAL AND INCOME OF THE CHARITY FUND TO OR FOR RELIEF OF THEPOOR AND NEED OR TO OR FOR THE BENEFIT OF SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE INSTITUTIONS SOCIETIES AND OBJECTS AS THE CLUB SHALL IN DULY CONSTITUTED MEETIN FROM TIME TO TIME DIRECT.

name: THE CANINE SUPPORTERS CHARITY
activities: Raising funds for canine charities

name: FOXWOOD ASSOCIATION
activities: Fund raising for the benefit of pupils currently at Foxwood.

name: BISHOP'S WALTHAM MINIBUS GROUP
activities: Operating on a section 19 permit we supply transport to all affilliated groups in Bishop's Waltham and surrounding parishes; including two lunch clubs and  dial a ride services for people from outlying areas to shop in Bishop's Waltham, Fareham and Hedge End. Our minibus is equipped with a tailift, wheelchair restraints, seatbelts and is fully insured.
objects: TO PROVIDE TRANSPORT FOR THE USE OF CHARITABLE ORGANISATIONS AND CHARITABLE GROUPS BASED IN THE PARISH OF BISHOPS WALTHAM WHO ARE AFFILIATED TO THE GROUP OR INDIVIDUALS IN SPECIFIC NEED BY REASON OF POVERTY,SICKNESS OR HANDICAP.

name: LACES TRUST
activities: The advancement of education and the relief of sickness by promoting or providing for the benefit of the public study, research and instruction in ethics and other philosophical disciplines as a part of or as related to medicine and any subject ancillary thereto.
objects: THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION AND THE RELIEF OF SICKNESS AND WITHOUT PREJUDICE TO THE GENERALITY OF THE FOREGOING THROUGH PROMOTING OR PROVIDING FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC STUDY RESEARCH AND INSTRUCTION IN ETHICS AND OTHER PHILOSOPHICAL DISCIPLINES AS A PART OF OR AS RELATED TO MEDICINE AND ANY SUBJECT ANCILLARY THERETO.

name: CHARITY OF G V BALL (PEOPLE'S PARK) BANBURY
activities: Management and Maintenance of People's Park
objects: TO PROVIDE LAND IN SOME SUITABLE SITUATION NEAR THE TOWN OF BANBURY AS A PARK FOR THE RECREATION OF ALL CLASSES OF THE PUBLIC DURING EVERY DAY OF THE WEEK FROM SUNRISE TO SUNSET ALL YEAR ROUND TO BE ORNAMENTALLY PLANTED AND LAID OUT AND TO BE CALLED THE PEOPLE'S PARK.

name: HORFIELD COMMUNITY ASSOCIATION
activities: Our vision is to support, enable and empower local residents to identify priorities and develop services, activities and projects that contribute to the development of the area by developing adult education opportunities, providing a weekly youth club, providing an affordable space for the local community and working with residents and partners to improve local cohesion and tackle marginalisation.
objects: (A) TO PROMOTE THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF HORFIELD ANDD THE NEIGHBOURHOOD WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF SEX OR OF POLITICAL, RELIGIOUS OR OTHER OPINIONS BY ASSOCIATIONGTHE LOCAL AUTHORITIES, VOLUNTARY ORGANISATIONS AND INHABITANTS IN A CCOMMON EFFORT TO ADVANCE EDUCCATION AND TO PROVIDE FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION AND LEISURE-TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CCONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR THE SAID INHABITANTS. (B) TO ESTABLISH OR SECURE THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A COMMUNITY CENTRE. (FOR FURTHER DETAILS SEE CLAUSE 2 OF CONSTITUTION.)

name: AVON VALLEY ARCHAEOLOGICAL SOCIETY
activities: Promoting archaeology in the Hampshire Avon Valley and surrounding areas of West Hampshire (particularly the New Forest),East Dorset and South Wiltshire
objects: TO PROMOTE THE INTEREST IN AND STUDY OF ARCHAEOLOGY FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE GENERAL PUBLIC.

name: WARREN ASSOCIATION TRUST
activities: Fundraising/Social Events inc- Sumer Fete, Christmas Party, Christmas Cards, Raffles, fundraising brochure sales. Spending-  Library books, special needs equipment, musical equipment, school trips, purchase of new mini bus etc
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUPILS OF WARREN SCHOOL, CLARKE'S LANE, OULTON BROAD, LOWESTOFT, SUFFOLK BY PROVIDING OR ASSISTING IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES AND SERVICE FOR EDUCATION NOT NORMALLY PROVIDED BY THE LOCAL AUTHORITY.

activities: Promotion of the Orthodox Jewish faith and the relief of poverty
objects: 1. THE ADVANCEMENT OF RELIGION IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE ORTHODOX JEWISH FAITH. 2. THE RELIEF OF POVERTY. 3. FOR SUCH OTHER PURPOSES AS ARE RECOGNISED BY ENGLISH LAW AS CHARITABLE.

name: MAIDENHEAD AND DISTRICT TALKING NEWSPAPER ASSOCIATION
activities: Provision of news and magazine recordings to the visually impaired in the Maidenhead area.
objects: THE OBJECT OF THE ASSOCIATION IS TO RELIEVE THE BLIND, OR THE PARTIALLY SIGHTED, OR THOSE LABOURING UNDER SOME TEMPORARY OR PERMANENT INCAPACITY OR DISABILITY WHICH MAKES READING A STRAIN, BY THE PROVISION OF AUDIO RECORDINGS.

name: THE SALISBURY AND SOUTH WILTSHIRE MUSEUM TRUST
activities: Salisbury museum collects, preserves and presents collections that illustrate Salisbury and South Wiltshires past (including archaeology of national status). It encourages learning, research, publication and enjoyment of those collections through services which include display, educaiton and events.
objects: A) THE PROVISION AND MAINTENANCE OF A MUSEUM IN OR NEAR THE CITY OF SALISBURY FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC PROVIDING EXHIBITS OF HISTORICAL, SCIENTIFIC AND ARTISTIC SIGNIFICANCE AND INTEREST.B) THE PROVISION IN CONNECTION WITH THE MUSEUM OF A LIBRARY, LECTURES AND OTHER FACILITIES FOR EDUCATION RELATING TO ARTS AND SCIENCES.C) THE PROMOTION IN CONNECTION WITH THE MUSEUM OF RESEARCH RELATING TO THE ARTS AND SCIENCES AND THE PUBLICATION OF THE USEFUL RESULTS OF SUCH RESEARCHES.

name: ROYAL SOCIETY OF MARINE ARTISTS
activities: The society was formed in 1946 to promote, maintain, improve and advance the education of the public by the encouragement of the study and practice of the fine and applied arts, with particular reference to the sea and maritime subjects.
objects: TO PROMOTE, MAINTAIN, IMPROVE AND ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC BY THE ENCOURAGEMENT OF THE STUDY AND PRACTICE OF THE FINE AND APPLIED ARTS WITH PARTICULAR BUT NOT EXCLUSIVE REFERENCE TO THE SEA, TO THE SEASHORE AND TO MARINE AND MARITIME SUBJECTS OF WHATSOEVER NATURE AND BY THE RECOGNITION OF SUCH WORKS OF ART AS AN ESSENTIAL FEATURE OF THE ARTISTIC OF A MARITIME NATION. (FOR FURTHER DETAILS SEE CLAUSE 3 OF RULES).

name: THEATRE DANCE COUNCIL INTERNATIONAL
activities: ACTING AS A REGULATORY BODY FOR THEATRE AND STAGE DANCE ESTABLISHING RULES FOR THEATRE DANCE COMPETITIONS AND CHAMPIONSHIPS. GRANTING NATIONAL AND REGIONAL CHAMPIONSHIP TITLES. TO PROMOTE DANCE EDUCATION FOR YOUNG PEOPLE.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF CHILDREN, YOUNG PEOPLE AND STUDENTS IN THE ART OF DANCE AND IN PARTICULAR STAGE DANCING IN BALLET TAP AND MODERN DANCE FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT.

name: AUDREY EARLE CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: The making of grants to charities and voluntary bodies.
objects: FOR THE BENEFIT OF SUCH EXCLUSIVELEY CHARITABLE OBJECTS AND PURPOSES IN THE UNITED KINGDOM OR IN ANY OTHER PART OF THE WORLD AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL IN THEIER DISCRETION THINK FIT.

name: THE MANAVA TRUST
activities: The Manava Trust is a Charity whose object is relief of poverty and religious activities. It also grants educational scholarships.
objects: (I) TO ADVANCE THE HINDU RELIGION (II) TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN THE HINDU AND OTHER RELIGIONS AND LANGUAGES AND CULTURE OF HINDUS. (III) TO RELIVE , EITHER GENERALLY OR INDIVIDUALLY, PERSONS WHO BELONG TO THE HINDU FAITH WHO ARE IN CONDITIONS OF NEED, HARDSHIP AND DISTRESS BY THE GIVING OF ADVICE CALCULATED TO REDUCE THE NEED, HARDSHIP AND DISTRESS OF SUCH PERSONS.

name: THE PRINCE ANDREW CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: The Prince Andrew charitable Trust uses its resources to create initiatives which support the work of The Duke of York's main areas of activity: Education and Skills, Entrepreneurship, Science, Technology and Engineering.
objects: SUCH CHARITABLE BODIES OR FOR SUCH OTHER PURPOSES AS SHALL BE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABE AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME DECIDE.

name: CHURCH MUSIC SOCIETY
activities: To advance the education of the public on the Art and Science of church music primarily by publishing music of the highest quality, both in context and presentation and which is not available through commercial publishers, for the diverse needs of the Christian Church. It also seeks to promote the cause of church music by disseminating information and co-operating with like-minded organisations.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN THE ART AND SCIENCE OF CHURCH MUSIC BY FACILITATING THE SELECTION AND PERFORMANCE OF THE MUSIC WHICH IS MOST SUITABLE FOR DIFFERENT OCCASIONS OF DIVINE WORSHIP AND FOR DIFFERENT TYPES OF CHOIR, WITHOUT PARTISANSHIP FOR ANY PARTICULAR STYLE OF COMPOSITION AND WITHOUT ADOPTING ANY ONE ECCLESIASTICAL STANDPOINT.

name: HELSTON FREE METHODIST CHURCH
activities: The promotion of the Christian faith in the area served by the Helston, Penzance,Truro,Hayle,Pool and Falmouth Churches, and surrounding areas. The charity was established for Christian worship, prayer, Bible teaching and preaching of the Christian Gospel. We seek to serve the local community by providing a place of prayer and worship,meeting needs of the community and helping individuals in need.
objects: THE FURTHERANCE IN HELSTON OF THE RELIGIOUS AND OTHER CHARITABLE WORK OF THE FREE METHODIST CHURCH OF NORTH AMERICA IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE DOCTRINES, DISCIPLINES AND USAGES OF THAT CHURCH FOR THE TIME BEING AS SET FORTH IN THE BOOK OF DISCIPLINE

name: HILLINGDON LAW CENTRE
activities: To provide legal advice,assistance and representation to poor persons resident or working in London Borough of Hillingdon or living in London Boroughs of Harrow,Hounslow,Ealing,Brent and neighbourhood thereof. Undertake education of residents and research into special problems.
objects: (I) TO PROVIDE BY EMPLOYING SOLICITORS AND OTHER STAFF FREE LEGAL ADVICE AND ASSISTANCE TO POOR PERSONS RESIDENT OR WORKING IN THE LONDON BOROUGH OF HILLINGDON AND NEIGHBOURHOOD THEREOF. IN FURTHERANCE OF THIS OBJECT AND AS ANCILLARY THERETO THE CENTRE MAY INSTITUTE CONDUCT AND DEFEND ANY PROCEEDINGS BEFORE ANY COURT, COMMISSION, TRIBUNAL OR INQUIRY. (II) TO UNDERTAKE OR CO-OPERATE IN THE EDUCATION OF RESIDENTS OF THE LONDON BOROUGH OF HILLINGDON IN THE LAW AND ITS OPERATION AND OTHER MATTERS.

activities: Music teaching on most instruments for all ages (4 to 104!) and abilities, mostly individually but also in small groups.  We also run bands, an orchestra, smaller instrumental groups, choirs and workshops for young children which are all free if you have lessons with us.

name: THE J L WINE CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: general charitable giving
objects: FOR SUCH PURPOSES AND OBJECTS OR TO PAY THE SAME TO SUCH BODY OR BODIES AS ARE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE ACCORDING TO THE LAW OF ENGLAND AND WALES FOR THE TIME BEING.

activities: Provision of PreSchool and Out of School education
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF CHILDREN BELOW COMPULSORY SCHOOL AGE BY: A) PROVIDING SAFE AND SATISFYING GROUP PLAY IN WHICH PARENTS MAY HAVE THE RIGHT TO TAKE PART, B) ENCOURAGING OTHER CHARITABLE ACTIVITIES THROUGH WHICH PARENTS MAY HELP THE CHILDREN AND C) FURTHERING THE AIMS OF THE PRE-SCHOOL PLAYGROUPS ASSOCIATION

name: THE TSEHCHENOV INSTITUTIONS TRUST

activities: The object of the Society is to educate the public in the dramatic and operatic arts, to further the development of public appreciation and taste in the said arts by the presentation of dramatic and operatic works of cultural and educative value and to assist and further such charitable institutions and charitable purposes as the Executive Committee from time to time determine.
objects: TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC IN THE DRAMATIC AND OPERATIC ARTS, TO FURTHER THE DEVELOPMENT OF PUBLIC APPRECIATION AND TASTE IN THE SAID ARTS BY THE PRESENTATION OF DRAMATIC AND OPERATIC WORKS OF CULTURAL AND EDUCATIVE VALUE AND TO ASSIST AND FURTHER SUCH CHARITABLE INSTITUTIONS AND CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE FROM TIME TO TIME DETERMINE.

name: GRAND ORDER OF WATER RATS CHARITIES FUND
activities: The GOWR Charities Fund was founded to help members of the theatrical profession, or their dependents, who due to old age or ill health are in need. Other charitable organisations and individuals can also be helped if there are sufficient funds available.
objects: TO RELIEVE OR ASSIST IN THE RELIEF OF POOR OR NECESSITOUS MEMBERS OF THE GRAND ORDER OF WATER RATS AND WIDOWS AND DEPENDANTS OF SUCH MEMBERS OR NECESSITOUS PERSONS ENGAGED OR CONCERNED OR FORMALLY ENGAGED OR CONCERNED AS THEATRICAL ENTERTAINERS MUSIC HALL AND VARIETY ARTISTES OR IN OTHE ASSOCIATIED ENGAGEMENTS AND THE WIDOWS AND DEPENDANTS THEREOF. (FOR DETAILS SEE CLAUSE 1 OF TRUST DEED).

name: ALBERT ROAD RECREATION GROUND
activities: Management and maintenance of Albert Road recreation ground
objects: TO PROVIDE A PUBLIC GROUND FOR THE BOROUGH OF READING FOR THE PURPOSES OF THE RECREATION GROUNDS ACT 1959.

name: THE OXFORD CENTRE FOR  ISLAMIC STUDIES
activities: The principal activites of the charity are dedicated to the encouragement by academic means of a more informed understanding of the culture and civilization of Islam and of contemporary Muslim societies.  For these purposes the Centre is committed to the promotion of scholarship, teaching, research, publication and dialogue and co-operation in the world of learning.
objects: THE OBJECTS FOR THE CENTRE SHALL BE TO MAINTAIN RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE OXFORD CENTRE FOR ISLAMIC STUDIES IN ORDER TO PROMOTE THROUGH THE CENTRE THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION AND CHARITABLE RESEARCH IN THE FIELD OF ISLAMIC STUDIES, WHICH INCLUDE STUDIESOF THOSE ARTS AND SCIENCES DERIVED FROM OR OF RELEVANCE TO THE ISLAMIC TRADITION AND THE NEEDS OF MUSLIM SOCIETIES AND SUBJECTS WHICH ARE IN THE OPINION OF THE COUNCIL ANCILLARY THERETO PARTICULARLY BY AND IN ORDER TO PROMOTE THROUGH THE CENTRE THE ADVANCEMENT OF AN UNDERSTANDING OF ISLAM FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT.

name: MILTON KEYNES CHRISTIAN FOUNDATION LIMITED
activities: In all our activities we seek to express the basic belief that all people and things have an essential value and inherent potential and we try to work in ways that enable some of this potential to be released. Our main activities continue to be focussed around four areas: -?+?-?	Groups on the margins -?+?-?	Regeneration -?+?-?	Sustainability -?+?-?	Economic and social justice
objects: TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN RELIGION.

name: THE WOODFORD WELLS ECUMENICAL CHURCH TRUST
activities: Normal church activities - holding services etc. In addition our trust deed authorises us to make donations to Christian charities (clause 2b).

objects: (A) THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE CHRISTIAN REGLION BY FUTHERING THE WORK OF THE SAID CHURCH; (B) SUCH OTHER CHRISTIAN CHARITIES AS MAY BE APPROVED BY THE CHURCH MEETING.

(B) TO ESTABLISH OR SECURE THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A COMMUNITY CENTRE AND TO MAINTAIN AND MANAGE THE SAME (WHETHER IN CO-OPERATION WITH ANY LOCAL AUTHORITY OR OTHER PERSON OR BODY) IN FURTHERANCE OF THESE OBJECTS. C) TO PROMOTE SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS MAY FROM TIME TO TIME BE DETERMINED.

name: FRIENDS OF MAIDSTONE ORCHESTRAL SOCIETY
activities: To give support to the Maidstone Orchestral Society in furthering the performing arts in the field of music making
objects: (A) TO ADVANCE AND PROMOTE PUBLIC EDUCATION IN AND APPRECIATION OF MUSIC BY THE PRESENTATION OF PUBLIC CONCERTS AND RECITALS IN CONJUNCTION WITH MAIDSTONE ORCHESTRAL SOCIETY AND BY SUCH OTHERWAYS AS THE SOCIETY THROUGH ITS COMMITTEE SHALL DETERMINE FROM TIME TO TIME. (B)TO DO AND PROVIDE ALL SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE ACTS AND THINGS AS WILL FURTHER AND ADVANCE THE PURPOSES OFORESAID OR ANY OF THEM.

name: THE DUFFIELD (TIVERTON) CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: The trustees follow a general policy of distributing the trust's income whilst maintaining the substance of the trust's investments to enlarge its grant-giving potential.
objects: TO SUCH CHARITABLE INSTITUTION OR INSTITUTIONS IF MORE THAN ONE IN SUCH SHARES AND PROPORTIONS (AND EITHER FOR THE GENERAL PURPOSES OF SUCH CHARITABLE INSTITUTION OR INSTITUTIONS OR FOR ANY PARTICULAR CHARITABLE PURPOSES) AND THE TRUSTEES SHALL FROM TIME TO TIME IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION THINK FIT.

name: CHRIST THE SAVIOUR MONASTIC TRUST
activities: Religious Activities Publications under the name of 'CSWG Press'.

(II) SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES IN THE PARISH OR ELSEWHERE AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL FROM TIME TO TIME IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION DETERMINE.

name: FERRING RIFERS YOUTH AND COMMUNITY CENTRE
activities: The Glebelands Community Centre under the control of the The Glebelands Centre Ltd (Reg No 07913364) will work for the good of the community providing assistance to young people to make informed choices and decisions with issues that affect their lives.  To enable them to make a positive contribution through the experience of social education, in their transition from childhood to adulthood.
objects: TO HELP YOUNG PEOPLE, ESPECIALLY BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY THROUGH LEISURE-TIME ACTIVITIES SO TO DEVELOP THEIR PHYSICAL, MENTAL AND SPIRITUAL CAPACITIES THAT THEY MAY GROW TO FULL MATURITY AS INDIVIDUALS AND MEMBERS OF SOCIETY AND THAT THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE MAY BE IMPROVED; AND TO PROMOTE THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF FERRING AND DISTRICT WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF SEX OR OF POLITICAL RELIGIOUS OR OTHER OPINION BY ASSOCIATING THE LOCAL AUTHORITIES, VOLUNTARY ORGANISATIONS AND INHABITANTS IN A COMMONEFFORT TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND TO PROVIDE FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIALWELFARE FOR RECREATION AND LEISURE-TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR THE SAID INHABITANTS.

name: THE BAR CONVENT TRUST
activities: The advancement of education and religion. The education of the public in the history of the Catholic Church in England by the provision of a museum. The maintenance of Grade 1 listed building. Offer opportunities for a broad range of people to visit and share the history of the Bar Convent. Provide facilities for religious, charitable and voluntary organisations.
objects: FOR THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION AND RELIGION AND IN PARTICULAR, WITHOUT PREJUDICE TO THE GENERALITY OF THE FOREGOING, FOR THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN THE HISTORY OF THE ROMAN CATHOLIC CHURCH IN ENGLAND BY THE PROVISION OF A MUSEUM.

name: CITY OF LONDON POLICE - CHARITY FOR CHILDREN
activities: This charity is run for the benefit of children & young persons for the relief of sickness, crisis, disability & any disadvantages, the charity provide funds for individuals & groups. The maximum age limit for beneficiaries of funding is 18 and the charity is principally for those with a link to the City although any appropriate request which falls within the charity guidelines will be considered.
objects: FOR THE BENEFIT OF YOUNG PERSONS AND CHILDREN WHO ARE IN NEED BY REASON OF ILL HEALTH, DISABILITY, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR OTHER DISADVANTAGE.

name: CITY OF LONDON POLICE - CHARITY FOR CHILDREN
activities: This charity is run for the benefit of children & young persons for the relief of sickness, crisis, disability & any disadvantages, the charity provide funds for individuals & groups. The maximum age limit for beneficiaries of funding is 18 and the charity is principally for those with a link to the City although any appropriate request which falls within the charity guidelines will be considered.
objects: FOR THE BENEFIT OF YOUNG PERSONS AND CHILDREN WHO ARE IN NEED BY REASON OF ILL HEALTH, DISABILITY, FINANCIAL HARDSHIP OR OTHER DISADVANTAGE.

name: ULTING OVERSEAS TRUST
activities: Making grants to those training for Christian Ministry, teachers in theological education, theological institutions in the Majority world and those seeking to assist in the Majority world.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE CHRISTIAN FAITH IN DEVELOPING COUNTRIES BY SUCH MEANS BEING CHARITABLE AS THE ASSOCIATION MAY DETERMINE(FOR FURTHER DETAILS SEE CLAUSE 3 OF THE MEMORANDUM OF ASSOCIATION).THE AREA OF BENEFIT SHALL BE LATIN AMERICA, THE CARIBBEAN, AFRICA, ASIA, EASTERN EUROPE, THE ISLANDS OF THE PACIFIC, INDIAN OCEANS AND ELSEWHERE.

name: MORGAN'S JMI PARENT/TEACHER ASSOCIATION
activities: To advance the education of the pupils of Morgans School (Hertford) including its facilities, via fundraising events such as: Summer fete, Christmas fair, disco, sponsered events.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUPILS AT THE SCHOOL (FOR FURTHER DETAILS SEE CLAUSE 2 OF CONSTITUTION)).

name: MRS S K WEST'S CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: The charity is dormant
objects: TO OR FOR THE CHARITABLE PURPOSES OF ALL OR SUCH ONE OR MORE TO THE EXCLUSION OF THE OTHER OR OTHERS OF THE CHARITIES IN SUCH SHARES IF MORE THAN ONE AND IN SUCH MANNER IN ALL RESPECTS AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION THINK FIT.

name: THE TIBETAN REFUGEE CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: The main objects of the charity are (a) to advance education amongst Tibetan refugee children and adults in exile; (b) to preserve and promote the cultural heritage of Tibet through the promotion of research and study and (c) to relieve poverty and hardship amongst Tibetans in exile
objects: (A) TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AMONGST TIBETAN REFUGEE CHILDREN AND ADULTS IN EXILE. (B) TO PRESERVE AND PROMOTE THE CULTURAL HERITAGE OF TIBET THROUGH THE PROMOTION OF RESEARCH AND STUDY INTO SUCH HERITAGE AND THE PUBLICATION AND DISSEMINATION OF THE USEFUL RESULTS OF SUCH RESEARCH, (C) TO RELIEVE POVERTY AND HARDSHIP AMONGST TIBETANS IN EXILE IN SUCH MANNER IN ALL RESPECTS AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL FROM TIME TO TIME AND AT ANY TIME IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION THINK FIT PROVIDED ALWAYS THAT IN EXERCISINGTHEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION AS AFORESAID THE TRUSTEES MAY HAVE REGARD TO BUT SHALL NOT IN ANY WAY BE BOUND BY THE WISHES OF THE TIBETAN COMMUNITY IN BRITAIN AS EXPRESSED TO THEM FROM TIME TO TIME IN WRITING AND PROVIDED ALL SUCH RELIEF IS OF A CHARITABLE NATURE.

name: UNITED KINGDOM - JAPAN 21ST CENTURY GROUP
activities: The Group aims to educate citizens of the UK and Japan in all aspects of each other's public institutions and systems of government, and each other's political and economic institutions, industry, social sciences and culture. The Group holds an annual conference alternately in Britain and Japan, following which the co-Chairmen submit recommendations to the two Prime Ministers.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE CITIZENS OF THE UNITED KINGDOM AND OF THE CITIZENS OF JAPAN IN ALL ASPECTS OF EACH OTHER'S PUBLIC INSTITUTIONS, SYSTEMS OF GOVERNMENT AND ALSO IN ALL BRANCHES OF EACH OTHER'S POLITICAL, ECONOMIC, INDUSTRIAL AND SOCIAL SCIENCES AND CULTURE.

name: WOODHATCH COMMUNITY ASSOCIATION
activities: The Woodhatch Centre is open for the Active Elderly, 50+ group Monday-Friday 9.30am-4pm. There are activities daily which include Healthy Living events, craft, bingo, dominoes, tea dances, bowls, table tennis, outings and holidays.   It is a drop in centre for the whole community to order refreshments or to hire a room for a private function.   Room hire is available 7 days a week 8.30am - 11pm.
objects: TO PROMOTE THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF WOODHATCH, SOUTH PARK, MEADVALE AND THE IMMEDIATE NEIGHBOURHOOD, TOGETHER DEFINED BY THE BOUNDARIES OF THE BOROGH OF REIGATE SOTH OF THE M25 HERINAFTER CALLED THE AREA OF BENEFIT WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF SEX OR OF POLITICAL, RELIGIOUS OR OTHER OPINIONS BY ASSOCIATING THE LOCAL AUTHORITIES, VOLUNTARY ORGANISATIONS AND INHABITANTS IN A COMMON EFFORT TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND TO PROVIDE FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION AND LEISURE-TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR THE SAID INHABITANTS; TO ESTABLISH OR TO SECURE THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A COMMUNITY CENTRE.

name: MISS MARIA SUSAN RICKARD CATS CHARITY
activities: TO PREVENT CRUELTY TO CATS ANYWHERE IN WORLD
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE TRUST ARE THE PREVENTION OF CRUELTY TO AND RELIEF OF SUFFERING AMONG CATS ANYWHERE IN THE WORLD.

name: THE FARINGDON AND DISTRICT EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES TRUST
activities: Provision of financial assistance for educational purposes to individuals and organisations in Faringdon and the surrounding area.
objects: TO PROMOTE THE BENEFITS OF THE INHABITANTS OF FARINGDON AND ITS NEIGHBOURHOOD IN OXFORDSHIRE WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF SEX POLITICAL, RELIGIOUS OR RACE BY PROVIDING FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION AND LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE LIFE OF THE SAID INHABITANTS.

name: NORTHAMPTONSHIRE BEEKEEPERS' ASSOCIATION
activities: The object of the Association is to advance the education of the public in apiculture in the county of Northamptonshire.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN APICULTURE IN THE COUNTY OF NORTHAMPTONSHIRE.

name: SOUTH BENFLEET SCHOOL ASSOCIATION
activities: To organise events and fundraising activities to raise funds to be spent on equipment and activities that will further the children's education.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE ASSOCIATION ARE TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUPILS OF THE SCHOOL BY PROVIDING AND ASSISTING IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR EDUCATION AT THE SCHOOL (NOT NORMALLY PROVIDED BY THE LOCAL EDUCATION AUTHORITY).

name: THE ALBERT EDWARD PROCTER CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: THE TRUSTEES HOLD REGULAR MEETINGS TO CONSIDER APPLICATIONS RECEIVED AND AWARDS GRANTS TO CHARITABLE ORGANISATIONS AND BODIES INVOLVED IN ACTIVITIES WHICH BENEFIT CHILDREN AND ECCLESIASTICAL CAUSES OR RELIEVING PAIN OR SUFFERING.
objects: TO OR AMONGST SUCH CHARITABLE INSTITUTIONS OF WHATSOEVER NATURE AND WHERESOEVER AS THE COMPANY MAY IN ITS ABSOLUTE AND UNCONTROLLED DISCRETION SELECT AND THINK PROPER AND WHETHER AS TO ONE SUCH INSTITUTION TO THE EXCLUSION OF ALL OTHERS OR TO SEVERAL SUCH INSTITUTIONS IN SUCH PROPORTIONS FROM FIME TO TIME AS THE COMPANY SHALL IN ITS ABSOLUTE AND UNCONTROLLED DISCRETION THINK FIT.

name: SWITCHBOARD LGBT+
activities: Switchboard, the LGBT Helpline provides a telephone, instant messaging and email helpline service from 10am to 10pm every day of the year. We are a safe space for anyone to discuss anything, including sexuality, gender identity, sexual health and emotional wellbeing. We support people to explore the right options for themselves.
objects: TO RELIEVE MEMBERS OF THE LGBT+ COMMUNITIES SUFFERING FROM MENTAL OR EMOTIONAL DISABILITY OR DESPAIR AND TO PROMOTE THEIR WELL-BEING BY COUNSEL AND/OR HELP.

name: THE NORTHREPPS BELL MAINTENANCE FUND
activities: To support the upkeep and general maintenance of the bells of St. Mary the Virgin, Northrepps in the Diocese of Norwich. The Fund is vested in the Norwich Diocesan Association of Ringers and its object is achieved through the administration of the Fund by the Association's Standing Committee and Belfry Advisory Committee, as required, in accordance with its Rules.
objects: THE UPKEEP AND GENERAL MAINTENANCE OF THE BELLS OF THE PARISH CHURCH OF NORTHREPPS.

name: ST MARY'S CHURCH RESTORATION FUND
activities: Village Church providing weekly services for residents and visitors, weddings, funerals baptism etc counselling. Fund raising and various social activities on a regular basis throughout the year.
objects: INCOME TO BE APPLIED FOR GENERAL REPAIRS TO THE SAID CHURCH AS TO BOTH THE INTERIOR AND EXTERIOR THEREOF.

name: HAWLEY WOMEN'S INSTITUTE
activities: Monthly meeting with speakers & demonstrations, drama group, walking group, craft group. Monthly outings and local activities.
objects: THE MAIN PURPOSES OF THE WOMEN'S INSTITUTE ORGANISATION ARE TO ENABLE WOMEN WHO ARE INTERESTED IN ISSUES ASSOCIATED WITH RURAL LIFE, INCLUDING ARTS, CRAFTS AND SCIENCES, TO IMPROVE AND DEVELOP CONDITIONS OF RURAL LIFE, TO ADVANCE THEIR EDUCATION IN CITIZENSHIP, IN PUBLIC QUESTIONS BOTH NATIONAL AND INTERNATIONAL, IN MUSIC, DRAMA AND OTHER CULTURAL SUBJECTS AND IN ALL BRANCHES OF AGRICULTURE, HANDICRAFTS, HOME ECONOMICS, HEALTH AND SOCIAL WELFARE.  IT SEEKS TO GIVE WOMEN THE OPPORTUNITY OF WORKINGTOGETHER THROUGH THE WOMEN'S INSTITUTE ORGANISATION AND OF PUTTING INTO PRACTICE THOSE IDEALS FOR WHICH IT STANDS.

name: BEDFORD MARIANETTES
activities: The object of the charity is to cultivate the Dramatic and Operatic Arts and improve and educate the public taste in those arts; to promote the production of Dramatic and Operatic works having educative value in the foregoing and with the further object of raising funds to be devoted solely to charitable purposes.
objects: TO CULTIVATE TE DRAMATIC AND OPERATIC ARTS AND IMPROVE AND EDUCATE THE PUBLIC TASTE IN THOSE ARTS. TO PROMOTE THE PRODUCTION OF DRAMATIC AND OPERATIC WORKS HAVING AN EDUCATIVE VALUE IN FURTHERANCE OF ABOVE AND WITH THE FURTHER OBJECT OF RAISING FUNDS TO BE DEVOTED SOLELY TO CHARITABLE PURPOSES. TO DO ALL SUCH THINGS AS SHALL BE CONDUCIVE TO THE ATTAINMENT OF THE ABOVE OBJECTS.

name: PORTSMOUTH PROVINCIAL GRAND LODGE BENEVOLENT FUND
activities: The Portsmouth Province is one of the Provinces of the Royal Antediluvian Order of Buffaloes, Grand Lodge of England. We support individuals and organisations in the community. Each year we support a local charity nominated by the Provincial Grand Primo (Chief Officer) and support the benevolence activities of the Grand Lodge and the national charity nominated by the Grand Primo.
objects: FOR THE RELIEF OR BENEFIT OF NECESSITOUS BRETHREN OF THE ORDER AND OF NECESSITOUS WIDOWS ORPHANS OR DEPENDANTS OF DECEASED BRETHREN OF THE ORDER.

name: CHESED CHARITY TRUST
activities: Raises funds and distributes to the poor and needy
objects: SUCH CHARITIES CHARITABLE INSTITUTIONS OR CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS THE TRUSTEES IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION MAY FROM TIME TO TIME DETERMINE.

name: THE ELTON CHURCH (FABRIC) APPEAL FUND
