objects: (I) THE MAINTAINANCE REPAIR AND IMRPOVEMENT OF THE FABRIC OF THE CHURCH OF ALL SAINTS ELTON PETERBOROUGH INCLUDING ITS FIXTURES AND FITTINGS. (II) FOR THE BENEFIT OF SUCH ONE OR MORE CHARITABLE ASSOCIATIONS SOCIETIES INSTITUTIONS PURPOSES OR OBJECTS WHEREVER SITUATE AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL THINK FIT (FOR FURTHER DETAILS SEE CLAUSE 3 OF TRUST DEED)

name: THE CLEARY BLACKFRIARS TRUST
activities: TO PROMOTE EDUCATION AT THE KING'S SCHOOL CANTERBURY THE ESTABLISHMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF ONE OR MORE "CLEARY SCHOLARSHIPS" FOR PUPILS OF THE KING'S SCHOOL CANTERBURY THE MAINTENANCE OF THE BLACKFRIARS BUILDING THE PROMOTION OF THE ARTS
objects: THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION AND SUCH OTHER PURPOSES AS SHALL FOR THE TIME BEING BE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE IN ENGLIS LAW; AND IN PARTICULAR BUT WITHOUT PREJUDICE TO THE GENERALITY OF THE FOREGOING ANY ONE OR MORE OF THE FOLLOWING OBJECTS BEING EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE: (1) THE PROMOTION OF EDUCATION AT HE KING'S SCHOOL (2) THE ESTABLISHMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF ONE OR MORE SCHOLARSHIPS TO BE CALLED "CLEARY SCHOLARSHIPS" FOR PUPILS OR FORMER PUPILS AT THE KING'S SCHOOL TO BE AWARDED AT THE NOMINATION IN WRITING OF THE KING'S SCHOOL. (3) THE MAINTENANCE OF ANY HISTORIC BUILDINGS FOR THE TIME BEING VESTED IN THE TRUSTEES (4) THE PROMOTION OF THE ARTS

name: LETCHWORTH SINFONIA
activities: To make live orchestral music available to the local community by presenting 2-3 concerts annually at venues in and around Letchworth Garden City.
objects: THE OBJECT OF THE SOCIETY SHALL BE TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC IN THE ART AND SCIENCE OF MUSIC BY THE TRAINING OF MUCISIANS, THE PRESENTATION OF CONCERTS AND OTHER ACTIVITIES.

name: THE MICHAEL BISHOP FOUNDATION
activities: To assist such charitable institutions or charitable purposes as the trustees shall in their absolute discretion think fit.
objects: TO APPLY INCOME OR CAPITAL FOR THE BENEFIT OF ANY ONE OR MORE QUALIFIED CHARITY DEFINED AS ANY PURPOSE BODY ORGANISATION OR OBJECT IN ANY PART OF THE WORLD WHICH UNDER THE LAW OF ENGLAND SHALL BE RECOGNISED AS EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE PROVIDED THAT NO "EXCLUDED PERSON" SHALL BE CAPABLE OF BECOMING A QUALIFIED CHARITY OTHERWISE THAN AS A TRUSTEE FOR CHARITABLE PURPOSES.

name: CHINESE COMMUNITY CENTRE
activities: The main activities of the Chinese Community Centre are as follows: Information, Advice and Outreach Services, Elderly Health Improvement Project and Healthy Eating Luncheon Club, Community Group Support Services, Arts and Culture Programme; Life Long Learning - English for Speakers of Other Languages Classes and Computer classes and a Youth Club.
objects: (I) TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION AND TO PROVIDE FACILITIES IN THE INTEREST OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION AND LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE OF THE CHINESE COMMUNITY IN LONDON.(II) TO ESTABLISH OR PROCURE THEESTABLISHMENT OF COMMUNITY CENTRE AND MAINTAIN AND MANAGE SUCH A CENTRE.

name: FRIENDS OF IVER SCHOOLS ASSOCIATION
activities: fund raising activities to help raise monies to enable Iver Infant and Iver Junior schools to acquire resources
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUPILS IN THE SCHOOL IN PARTICULAR BY:    DEVELOPING EFFECTIVE RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN THE STAFF, PARENTS AND OTHERS ASSOCIATED WITH THE SCHOOL;    ENGAGING IN ACTIVITIES OR PROVIDING FACILITIES OR EQUIPMENT WHICH SUPPORTTHE SCHOOL AND ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUPILS.

name: NATIONAL AIDS TRUST
activities: To promote public health through effective HIV prevention and early diagnosis of HIV infection; to promote the rights, dignity, health and wellbeing of people affected by HIV, or at risk of HIV infection, in the UK; to advance the education of the public in general in order to increase awareness and understanding of HIV and AIDS and eradicate HIV-related stigma, discrimination and inequality.
objects: TO PROMOTE PUBLIC HEALTH THROUGH EFFECTIVE HIV PREVENTION AND EARLY DIAGNOSIS OF HIV INFECTION.  TO PROMOTE THE RIGHTS, DIGNITY, HEALTH AND WELLBEING OF PEOPLE AFFECTED BY HIV, OR AT RISK OF HIV INFECTION, IN THE UK.  TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN GENERAL (AND IN PARTICULAR POLICY MAKERS, OPINION FORMERS AND DECISION-MAKERS) IN ORDER TO INCREASE AWARENESS AND UNDERSTANDING OF HIV AND AIDS AND ERADICATE HIV-RELATED STIGMA, DISCRIMINATION AND INEQUALITY.

name: THE LORD FORTE FOUNDATION
activities: The object of the charity is to encourage excellence within the fields of hospitality, encompassing the hotel, catering, travel and tourism industries within the UK and overseas.
objects: TO PROMOTE OR ADVANCE SUCH CHARITABLE PURPOSES OR CHARITABLE INSTITUTIONS AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION THINK FIT PROVIDED ALWAYS THAT WITHOUT DEROGATING FROM THE GENERAL DISCRETION AFORESAID THE TRUSTEES SHALL IN THEIR SELECTION OF PARTICULAR CHARITABLE PURPOSES PAY SPECIAL REGARD TO THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION IN ANY CHARITABLE FIELD OF LEARNING BUT ESPECIALLY IN THE FIELDS OF HOTEL MANAGEMENT AND CATERING.

name: THE PAVILION PRESCHOOL
activities: Preschool education
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATON OF CHILDREN BELOW THE COMPULSARY SCHOOL AGE BY: (A) PROVIDING SAFE AND SATISFYING GROUP PLAY IN WHICH PARENTS HAVE THE RIGHT TO TAKE PART; (B) ENCOURAGING OTHER CHARITABLE ACTIVITIES THROUGH WHICH PARENTS MAY HELP THE CHILDREN;(C) FURTHERING THE AIMS OF THE PRE-SCHOOL PLAYGROUPS ASSOCATION.

name: MR AND MRS D J BARRINGTON'S CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: Payments of donations & subscriptions to charitable institutions for any of the charitable purposes as the trustees shall think fit
objects: PAYMENTS OF DONATIONS OR SUBSCRIPTIONS TO SUCH CHARITABLE INSTITUTION OR INSTITUTIONS FOR ALL OR ANY OF THE CHARITABLE OBJECTS OR PURPOSES AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL IN THEIR DISCRETION FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT.

name: HALCON WARD COMMUNITY ASSOCIATION
activities: TO PROMOTE THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF HALCON WARD AND THE NEIGHBOURHOOD WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF SEX OR OF POLITICAL OR OTHER OPINIONS BY ASSOCIATING THE LOCAL AUTHORITIES: VOLUNTARY ORGANISATIONS: AND INHABITANTS IN A COMMON EFFORT TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND TO PROVIDE FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION AND LEISURE-TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR THE SAID INHABITANTS. TO ESTABLISH OR SECURE THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A COMMUNITY CENTRE (HEREINAFTERCALLED THE CENTRE) AND TO MAINTAIN AND MANAGE OR TO CO-OPERATE WITH ANY LOCAL STATUTORY AUTHORITY IN THE MAINTENANCE AND MANAGEMENT OF SUCH A CENTRE FOR ACTIVITIES PROMOTED BY THE ASSOCIATION AND ITS CONSTITUENT BODIES IN FURTHERANCE OFTHE ABOVE OBJECTS.
objects: TO PROMOTE THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF HALCON WARD AND THE NEIGHBOURHOOD WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF SEX OR OF POLITICAL OR OTHER OPINIONS BY ASSOCIATING THE LOCAL AUTHORITIES: VOLUNTARY ORGANISATIONS: AND INHABITANTS IN A COMMON EFFORT TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND TO PROVIDE FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION AND LEISURE-TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR THE SAID INHABITANTS. TO ESTABLISH OR SECURE THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A COMMUNITY CENTRE (HEREINAFTERCALLED THE CENTRE) AND TO MAINTAIN AND MANAGE OR TO CO-OPERATE WITH ANY LOCAL STATUTORY AUTHORITY IN THE MAINTENANCE AND MANAGEMENT OF SUCH A CENTRE FOR ACTIVITIES PROMOTED BY THE ASSOCIATION AND ITS CONSTITUENT BODIES IN FURTHERANCE OFTHE ABOVE OBJECTS.

name: 2 WHEEL APPEAL
activities: The trustees identify projects and organisations they wish to support and also the Trust may  make grants to people or organisations who apply speculatively.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE TRUST ARE TO PROMOTE THE FOLLOWING CHARITABBLE INSTITUTIONS: "ACTIONAID" "THE MULTIPLE SCLEROSIS SOCIETY OF GREAT BRITAIN AND NORTHERN IRELAND" "AMNESTY INTERNATIONAL" "KING'S COLLEGE LONDON, UNIVERSITY OF LONDON.

name: THE WELLINGTON STROKE CLUB
activities: Provide services to members with post strokes. Social activities, meetings. outings,physiotherapy, speach therapy, advice and companionship.
objects: TO RELIEVE PERSONS WHO HAVE SUFFERED FROM A STOKE.

name: THE PLANTERS' BENEVOLENT FUND OF CEYLON
activities: The object of the Fund is to relieve poverty amongst persons of European birth who are or have been members of the planting community of Sri Lanka and their dependant relatives in need, restricted to the wives, widows and dependant children of such persons.
objects: "TO RELIEVE POVERTY AMONGST PERSONS OF EUROPEAN BIRTH WHO ARE OR HAVE BEEN MEMBERS OF THE PLANTING COMMUNITY OF SRI LANKA (CEYLON) AND THEIR DEPENDANT RELATIVES IN NEED RESTRICTED TO THE WIVES, WIDOWS AND CHILDREN OF SUCH PERSONS"

name: AMBULANCE SERVICE INSTITUTE
activities: The objectives of the ASI are to: Promote, advance and encourage the education and development of all those persons engaged in the provision of pre-hospital care. To represent the interests of its members by pro-actively influencing developments in the pre-hospital care sector.
objects: TO PROMOTE, ADVANCE AND ENCOURAGE THE EDUCATION AND TAINING FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC OF PERSONS ENGAGED IN THE AMBULANCE SERVICE AND SUBJECT THERETO TO EXTEND SUCH EDUCATION AND TRAINING TO MEMBERS OF THE PUBLIC GENERALLY.

name: THE SPITFIRE SOCIETY
activities: a) To advance the education of the public and conduct research into all matters relating to the Vickers Supermarine Spitfire and Seafire and the designer thereof, R.J.Mitchell, and to publish the useful results of such research. b) To advance education in the field of aeronautics, astronautics, and associated subjects.
objects: A. TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC AND CONDUCT RESEARCH INTO ALL MATTERS RELATING TO THE VICKERS SUPERMARINE SPITFIRE AND SEAFIRE AND THE DESIGNER THEREOF, R J MITCHELL, AND TO PUBLISH THE USEFUL RESULTS OF SUCH RESEARCH. B. TO ADVANCE EDUCATION IN THE FIELD OF AERONAUTICS, ASTRONAUTICS AND ASSOCIATED SUBJECTS BY THE PRESENTATION OF BURSARIES AND AWARDS IN THE NAME OF THE SOCIETY AT INSTITUTIONS TEACHING SUCH SUBJECTS.

name: ADVICE UK
activities: The charity operates as a co-ordination and support network for organisations that provide social welfare law advice to the public.
objects: TO PROMOTE SUCH CHARITABLE PURPOSES FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC AS MAY FROM TIME TO TIME BE DETERMINED INCLUDING THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION, THE PROTECTION OF HEALTH AND THE RELIEF OF POVERTY, SICKNESS AND DISTRESS IN PARTICULAR BY PROVIDING CO-ORDINATION AND SUPPORT TO INDEPENDENT ADVICE SERVICES AND BY ASSISTING THEM TO MAKE BETTER USE OF THE RESOURCES AVAILABLE TO THEM.

name: BREAD OF LIFE FELLOWSHIP
activities: Distributing Christian literature in this country, in prisons and abroad.   Helping the homeless and persons with Addictions in the UK .
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE SOCIETY SHALL BE THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE CHRISTIAN RELIGION.

name: THE DE VITRE TRUST
activities: Give grants to smaller charities where comparatively small amounts can make bigger difference.
objects: FOR THE BENEFIT OF SUCH EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE OBJECTS AND PURPOSES IN THE UNITED KINGDOM OR ANY OTHER PART OF THE WORLD AS THEIR DISCRETION THINK FIT.

name: THE BRITISH FRIENDS OF NORMANDY
activities: Through the D Day Memorial garden and contribution to the Normandy Battle Museum in Caen (Memorial), the Charity's activities are focused on commemorating the landings by Allied Forces in 1944 and the subsequent campaign to liberate Normandy and to foster and make known through public education the historical importance and sacrifices made.
objects: TO PROVIDE FOR THE ADVANCEMENT OF PUBLIC EDUCATION IN MATTERS RELATING TO THE HISTORY THE ARMED FORCES OF THE CROWN AND IN PARTICULAR THE HISTORICAL IMPORTANCE OF THE LANDINGS BY THE ALLIED FORCES IN NORMANDY IN 1944 BY PROVISION OF DOCUMENTS, ARTIFACTS AND OTHER ITEMS IN CONNECTION WITH THE PART PLAYED BY THOSE ARMED FORCES IN THE LANDING FOR EXHIBITION IN THE NORMANDY BATTLE MUSEUM, AT CAEN, IN THE REPUBLIC OF FRANCE.

name: BETH HAMEDRASH KNESSET YEHEZKEL

objects: 1) THE RELIEF OF PEOPLE WITH LEARNING DISABILITIES (IN PARTICULAR) AND/OR PHYSICAL DISABILITIES (TOGETHER DESCRIBED AS "DISABILITIES"), IN PARTICULAR BY THE PROVISION OF HELP AND SUPPORT FOR THEM AND FOR THEIR FAMILIES, DEPENDANTS AND CARERS, AND  2) TO PROVIDE OR ASSIST IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR PEOPLE WITH LEARNING DIFFICULTIES WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE, TO INCLUDE (BUT NOT LIMITED TO) THE PROVISION OF RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION, EDUCATION, WELFARE, ADVOCACY, TRAINING, EMPLOYMENT AND VOLUNTEERING OPPORTUNITIES.

objects: The charitable purpose of the Unit (the Purpose) is to promote the development of young people in achieving their physical, intellectual and social potential as individuals and as responsible citizens by the provision of education and leisure time activities using a nautical theme and in accordance with the principles, ethos and practices of the Marine Society & Sea Cadets (MSSC).

activities: To help with the education of those under 25, who reside in the benefit area and are in financial need, by assistance with fees, travel, outfits, clothing, books etc. Also providing schools in the area with educational benefits. objects: THE OBJECT OF THE CHARITY SHALL BE THE PROMOTION OF EDUCATION AMONGST PERSONS UNDER 25 YEARS WHO ARE RESIDENT IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT IN SUCH WAYS AS THE TRUSTEE THINKS FIT.

name: THE BEDFORD MODERN SCHOOL GENERAL CHARITABLE TRUST
activities: The Charity's objectives are to raise funds on behalf of Bedford Modern School.  The Charity has been largely inactive over recent years but will be re-activated over the course of the next year.
objects: 1. THE INCOME OF THE TRUST SHALL BE USED FOR SUCH CHARITABLE PURPOSES CONNECTED WITH THE BEDFORD MODERN SCHOOL AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL FROM TIME TO TIME DETERMINE OR; 2. SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES OR SUCH CHARITABLE FOUNDATIONS (WHETHER OR NOT CONNECTED WITH THE SCHOOL) AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL DETERMINE.

objects: THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PRINCIPLES AND DOCTRINES OF THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND.

name: BECKETT'S AND SARGEANT'S EDUCATIONAL FOUNDATION

objects: THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PRINCIPLES AND DOCTRINES OF THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND AND IN PARTICULAR BY THE FOLLOWING:  (1)	PAYMENTS TO THE GOVERNORS OF THE PRIMARY SCHOOL FOR MATTERS FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PRIMARY SCHOOL NOT NORMALLY SUPPORTED FROM PUBLIC FUNDS;  (2)	PAYMENTS TO THE GOVERNORS OF OTHER PUBLICLY FUNDED SCHOOLS LINKED TO THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND FOR MATTERS FOR THE BENEFIT OF THOSE SCHOOLS NOT NORMALLY SUPPORTED FROM PUBLIC FUNDS;  (3)	THE PROVISION OF GRANTS OR BENEFITS FOR YOUNG PEOPLE UNDER THE AGE OF 25 WHO ARE IN NEED OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AND, UNLESS THE TRUSTEES DECIDE IN PARTICULAR CASES OTHERWISE, ARE EITHER:  (A)	ORDINARILY RESIDENT IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT AND ATTENDING A SCHOOL OR EDUCATIONAL ESTABLISHMENT IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT; OR  (B)	ORDINARILY RESIDENT IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT IN THEIR ACADEMIC YEAR HOLIDAYS AND ATTENDING A SCHOOL OR EDUCATIONAL ESTABLISHMENT ELSEWHERE.

name: THE PAROCHIAL ROOM, WOLLASTON

objects: THE OBJECT OF THE CHARITY IS TO FURTHER THE RELIGIOUS AND OTHER CHARITABLE WORK OF THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND IN THE PARISH IN THE FOLLOWING PRIORITY:  (1)	BY THE PROVISION AND MAINTENANCE OF A SCHOOL FOR THE EDUCATION OF CHILDREN IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT INACCORDANCE WITH THE PRINCIPLES OF THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND.  (2)	INSOFAR AS IT IS NOT REQUIRED TO BE USED AS A SCHOOL, THE PROPERTY MAY BE USED FOR THE FOLLOWING PURPOSES:  	(A)	THE PROVISION AND MAINTENANCE OF A SUNDAY SCHOOL;  (B)	THE RELIGIOUS ANDOTHER CHARITABLE WORK OF THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND; AND  (C)	RECREATION OR OTHER LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION, INCLUDING THE EDUCATION OF CHILDREN AND ADULTS IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT.  (3)	BY THE PROVISION OF ITEMS, SERVICES AND FACILITIES TO PROMOTE THE EDUCATION OF CHILDREN OF SCHOOL AGE IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PRINCIPLES OF THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND

THE RESIDUE OF THE SAID INCOME IN PROMOTING THE EDUCATION OF PERSONS UNDER THE AGE OF25 YEARS WHO ARE IN NEED OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE.

THE GOVERNORS SHALL APPLY THE RESIDUE OF SAID INCOME IN ASSISTING SENIOR FOUNDATIONERS TO CONTINUE THEIREDUCATION, AFTER THEY HAVE (IN PURSUANCE OF  ANY STATUTE OR OF ANY BYE-LAW IN FORCE IN THE AREA IN WHICH THEY RESIDE)BECOME EXEMPT WHOLLY OR PARTIALLY FROM OBLIGATION TO ATTEND SCHOOL, BY  LEARNING THE THEORY AND PRACTICE OF SKILLED TRADES, INDUSTRIES, OR EMPLOYMENT, BY MEANS OF APPRENTICESHIP OR OTHER MODES OF TECHNICAL OR INDUSTRIAL  EDUCATION; PROVIDED THAT THE POWERS OF THE GOVERNORS UNDER THIS SUB-CLAUSE SHALL BE EXERCISED IN ACCORDANCE WITH RULES TO BE MADE BY THE GOVERNORS WITH  THE APPROVAL OF THE CHARITIES COMMISSION SIGNIFIED BY WRITING.

objects: INCOME TO BE APPLIED IN SUCH MANNER AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL FROM TIME TO TIME THINK FIT IN OR TOWARDS THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION, PROVIDED ALWAYS THAT SO FAR AS MAY FROM TIME TO TIME IN THE OPINION OF THE TRUSTEES BE PRACTICABLE AND DESIRABLE PREFERENCE SHALL BE GIVEN TO THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE EDUCATION OF THOSE PERSONS IN THE TERRITORY NOW COMPRISED IN THE REPUBLIC OF SOUTH AFRICA WHO ARE NOT OF EUROPEAN DESCENT.

(3) TO PAY ALL OR ANY PART OR PARTS OF ANY COSTS OREXPENSES INCURRED OR TO BE INCURRED BY THE UNIVERSITY IN OPERATING AND MAINTAINING THE UNIVERSITY IN A PROPER AND EFFICIENT MANNER AND IN REPAIRING, RENEWING, EXTENDING OR CREATING OR IMPROVING THE BUILDINGS, EQUIPMENT AND CONVENIENCES IN THE GROUNDSTHEREOF.  (4) THE PROMOTION AND ADVANCEMENT OF RELIGIOUS AND SECULAR EDUCATION AND INSTRUCTION FOR AND AT THE UNIVERSITY AND ELSEWHERE.

name: B E S T BASIC EDUCATION AND SUPPLEMENTARY TEACHING ASSOCIATION

objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF PEOPLE AND CHILDREN PARTICULARLY THOSE OF MULTI-ETHNIC ORIGINS AND THOSE IN SPECIAL NEED THROUGH SOCIAL DEPRIVATION.

name: THE GLASS ASSOCIATION
activities: Educational day & weekend events & meetings on all aspects of glass; glassmaking and collecting from antique to modern studio glass. The interests range worlwide, e.g. British, American, Czech, Scandinavian. Publication of four isues of "The Cone" magazine a year with a scholarly journal once every three to four years. International trips, recently to Sweden and the USA.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE SOCIETY SHALL BE TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC REGARDING (A) THE HISTORY AND APPRECIATION OF GLASS, THROUGH EXHIBITIONS, MEETINGS, SEMINARS, AND ANY OTHER APPROPRIATE MEANS. (B) THE UNDERSTANDING AND APPRECIATION OF HISTORICAL AND CONTEMPORARY GLASS. (C) THE PRACTICE OF THE CRAFT OF GLASSMAKING. (D) THE STUDY AND COLLECTION OF GLASS.

name: THE CHRISTIAN SCIENCE ASSOCIATION OF THE PUPILS OF MICHAEL B THORNELOE C S B
activities: The main purpose of the Association is to promote Christian Science by maintaining links with its members and providing spiritual inspiration. Each year a meeting is held to which members from all over the world come to hear an address given by a guest speaker. Travel assistance is made available if necessary. Other charitable donations are made.
objects: PROMOTING AND EXTENDING THE RELIGION OF CHRISTIAN SCIENCE AS TAUGHT BY MARY BAKER EDDY IN THE CHRISTIAN SCIENCE TEXT BOOK, "SCIENCE AND HEALTH WITH KEY TO THE SCRIPTURES"

name: THE CIMMIE WINTON CHARITABLE TRUST

name: Able Child Africa
activities: AbleChildAfrica's mission is to promote the realisation of equal rights for disabled children and their families in Africa and to facilitate their meaningful inclusion in all aspects of life.  This is achieved by working in partnership with independent African organisations to provide direct services as well as engaging in advocacy and influencing work in the UK and internationally.
objects: TO RELIEVE CHARITABLE NEED, PROMOTE HEALTH, ADVANCE EDUCATION AND PROMOTE THE SOCIAL INTEGRATION OF CHILDREN WITH DISABILITIES FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT, WITH A FOCUS ON (BUT WITHOUT LIMITATION) PROMOTING SUCH DISABLED CHILDREN ACHIEVING THEIR HUMAN, SOCIAL, CULTURAL AND ECONOMIC RIGHTS (AS SET OUT IN THE UNITED NATIONS CONVENTION ON THE RIGHTS OF CHILDREN ("UNCRC"), UNIVERSAL DECLARATION OF HUMAN RIGHTS ("UDHR") AND SUBSEQUENT UNITED NATIONS CONVENTIONS AND DECLARATION AND IN REGIONAL CODES OF HUMANRIGHTS WHICH INCORPORATE THE RIGHTS CONTAINED IN THE UNCRC, THE UDHR AND THOSE SUBSEQUENT CONVENTIONS  AND DECLARATIONS) BY ANY MEANS THE TRUSTEES IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION CHOOSE AND IN PARTICULAR BY RAISING AWARENESS AS TO THE NEEDS OF CHILDRENWITH DISABILITIES AND ADVOCACY AS TO HOW THOSE NEEDS CAN BEST BE MET.

name: RURAL THEOLOGY ASSOCIATION
activities: Aims: To study the gospel and develop theology in a rural setting; to raise awareness of the nature of rural ministry, worship and mission in the world at large; to discover ways of living in the countryside which embody a Christian response to the world.

PUBLISHING OCCASIONAL PAPERS AND ARRANGING PERIODIC CONFERENCES TO ENCOURAGE THE DEVELOPMENT AND PATTERNS OF MINISTRY AND MISSION APPROPRIATE TO THE COUNTRYSIDE. C. name: CHARITY OF FREDERICK PEARSON FISHER
activities: Grants are awarded to organisations that operate for the benefit of the public in the West Midlands and which support and further the religious and other charitable work of the Church of England, or relieve sickness and preserve the health of those people who are either permanently or temporarily resident in the West Midlands, with preferences as listed in the objects.
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE CHARITY ARE TO MAKE GRANTS FOR SUCH CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS THE TRUSTEES SHALL IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION DECIDE, IN PARTICULAR BY:    (1) 	ADVANCING THE RELIGIOUS AND OTHER CHARITABLE WORK OF THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE PUBLIC IN THE WEST MIDLANDS;    (2) 	RELIEVING SICKNESS AND PRESERVING THE HEALTH OF THOSE PEOPLE RESIDING PERMANENTLY OR TEMPORARILY IN THE WEST MIDLANDS;    WITH A PREFERENCE BEING GIVEN TO INHABITANTS OF THE ECCLESIASTICAL PARISHES OF ST. MICHAEL, BRIERLEY HILL AND ST JOHN, BROCKMOOR

We contribute to 18 funds.  For example, as a result of natural disasters where an international appeal has been made. name: THE CHILDREN'S HOSPITAL CHARITY
activities: Enhancing Sheffield Children's NHS Foundation Trust and its reputation as a centre of excellence for the care, prevention & cure of illnesses. objects: 2.1	THE OBJECTS OF THE CHARITY ARE, FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT, THE RELIEF OF SICKNESS AND IN PARTICULAR:  A.	TO ENHANCE THE SERVICES, FACILITIES AND ENVIRONMENT OF THE FOUNDATION TRUST AND ITS REPUTATION AS A CENTRE OF EXCELLENCE FOR THE CARE, PREVENTIONAND CURE OF ILLNESSES AFFECTING CHILDREN;  B.	TO FURTHER ANY CHARITABLE PURPOSE OR PURPOSES RELATING TO THE GENERAL OR ANY SPECIFIC PURPOSES OF THE FOUNDATION TRUST OR THE PURPOSES OF THE HEALTH SERVICE;  C.	TO PROMOTE, PROTECT, PRESERVE AND ADVANCEALL OR ANY ASPECTS OF THE HEALTH OF THE PUBLIC; AND  D.	TO ADVANCE AND PROMOTE KNOWLEDGE AND EDUCATION IN MEDICINE INCLUDING BY ENGAGING IN AND SUPPORTING MEDICAL RESEARCH (AND THE DISSEMINATION OF THE USEFUL RESULTS)."  PROVIDED THAT SUCH SUPPORT ISNOT OF A KIND THAT WOULD ORDINARILY BE GIVEN BY THE STATUTORY AUTHORITIES.

TO PROMOTE AND ADVANCE THE JAIN RELIGION AND TO RELIEVE THE FOLLOWERS  OF THE JAIN RELIGION WHO ARE IN NECESSITOUS CIRCUMSTANCES.  II. TO EDUCATE THE CHILDREN OF MEMBERS IN THE JAIN RELIGION AND ENCOURAGE  LEARNING OF LANGUAGES.III. TO PROVIDE FACILITIES FOR THEIR RELIGIOUS WORSHIP.  IV. TO CELEBRATE RELIGIOUS FESTIVALS FOR THE MEMBERS OF THE SAMAJ AND  ORGANISE MEETINGS AND LECTURES.

name: BLAENAU RECREATION ASSOCIATION
activities: recreation association
objects: TO PROMOTE THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF BLAENAU AND THE NEIGHBOURHOOD BY PROVIDING FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION AND LEISURE-TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR THE SAID INHABITANTS. (FOR FURTHER DETAILS SEE CLAUSE 2 OF CONSTITUTION).

name: MABEL EVANS TRUST
activities: Charitable purposes for the benefit of the people of Wilmslow and its neighbourhood.
objects: SUCH CHARITABLE OBJECT OR OBJECTS OR SUCH CHARITABLE PURPOSE OR PURPOSES AS THE TESTATRIX'S TRUSTEES MIGHT IN THEIR ABSOLUTE DISCRETION SELECT, AND THE TESTATRIX DESIRED (BUT WITHOUT CREATING ANY BINDING TRUST OR IMPOSING ANY LEGAL OBLIGATION) THAT HER TRUSTEES SHOULD APPLY THE RESIDUE OF THER ESTATE IN OR TOWARDS CHARITIES IN OR CONNECTED WITH WILMSLOW.

name: DERBY CITY AND DISTRICT TALKING NEWSPAPER ASSOCIATION
activities: The Association distributes recorded articles from a number of newspapers and magazines to sight impaired and physically impaired persons. A team of 'readers' record the material in digital form, this is transfered onto memory sticks and sent through the Blind Post scheme to the clients,15 publications and subjects are sent out on weekly, monthly and quarterly basis.
objects: TO RELIEVE THE BLIND, OR THE PARTIALLY SIGHTED, OR THOSE LABOURING UNDER SOME TEMPORARY OR PERMANENT INCAPACITY OR DISABILITY WHICH MAKES READING A STRAIN, BY THE PROVISION OF RECORDED TAPES.

name: DERBY CITY AND DISTRICT TALKING NEWSPAPER ASSOCIATION
activities: The Association distributes recorded articles from a number of newspapers and magazines to sight impaired and physically impaired persons. A team of 'readers' record the material in digital form, this is transfered onto memory sticks and sent through the Blind Post scheme to the clients,15 publications and subjects are sent out on weekly, monthly and quarterly basis.
objects: TO RELIEVE THE BLIND, OR THE PARTIALLY SIGHTED, OR THOSE LABOURING UNDER SOME TEMPORARY OR PERMANENT INCAPACITY OR DISABILITY WHICH MAKES READING A STRAIN, BY THE PROVISION OF RECORDED TAPES.

name: Kington Museum and History Centre
activities: Local Museum
objects: To maintain a museum for the people of Kington and District. The advancement of education, with particular reference to the understanding and appreciation of the heritage and history of Kington and its surrounding area, by provision and maintenance within that area of a museum and associated collection and other resources, and the provision of associated educational activities, for the benefit of the inhabitants of that area and any others who use the museum, it's facilities or resources.

name: SOUTH EAST WALES UNITARIAN SOCIETY
activities: To support Congregations within the above district in regard to worship activities, building maintenance and publicity matters.
objects: TO PROMOTE AND EXTEND UNITARIAN CHRISTIANITY IN THE AREA BY RENDERING AID TO EXISTING CHURCHES, BY ESTABLISHING NEW ONES, BY INTERCHANGE OF PULPITS, BY CONFERENCES AND OTHER MEETINGS AMONG THE AFFILIATED CHURCHS, AND BY CO-OPERATION WITH THE GENERAL ASSEMBLY OF UNITARIAN AND FREE CHRISTIAN CHURCHES.

name: SOUTHRIDGE WOMEN'S INSTITUTE
activities: HOLD MEETINGS WITH SPEAKERS ONCE A MONTH.FUND RAISING COFFEE MORNINGS OR THEMED ACTIVITIES TWO OR THREE TIMES A YEAR
objects: THE MAIN PURPOSE OF THE WOMEN'S INSTITUTE ORGANISATION ARE TO ENABLE WOMEN WHO ARE INTERESTED IN ISSUES ASSOCIATED WITH RURAL LIFE, INCLUDING ARTS, CRAFTS AND SCIENCES, TO IMPROVE AND DEVELOP CONDITIONS OF RURAL LIFE, TO ADVANCE THEIR EDUCATION IN CITIZENSHIP, IN PUBLIC QUESTIONS BOTH NATIONAL AND INTERNATIONAL, IN MUSIC, DRAMA AND OTHER CULTURAL SUBJECTS AND IN ALL BRANCHES OF AGRICULTURE, HANDICRAFTS, HOME ECONOMICS, HEALTH AND SOCIAL WELFARE.  IT SEEKS TO GIVE WOMEN THE OPPORTUNITY OF WORKING TOGETHER THROUGH THE WOMEN'S INSTITUTE ORGANISATION AND OF PUTTING INTO PRACTICE THOSE IDEALS FOR WHICH IT STANDS.

name: The Friends of the Beacon Museum
activities: We have had a joiner install 'protectors' surrounding 2 valuable paintings to protect them from any wilful damage whilst on display in the Beacon Museum, Whitehaven, Cumbria.  We are members of BAFM and local History Groups and invite and pay for Lectures at The Beacon Museum.
objects: THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC BY PROMOTION, SUPPORT, ASSISTANCE AND IMPROVEMENT OF THE WHITEHAVEN MUSEUM.

name: WOOD END CHARITY
activities: Receiving requests and ascertaining whether these fall within the rules of the charity Costs involved with the religious education and welfare of children
objects: TO PROVIDE SUCH SPECIAL BENEFITS OF ANY KIND NOT NORMALLY PROVIDED BY THE LOCAL EDUCATION AUTHORITY FOR ST. THOMAS'S SCHOOL, WEDNESFIELD, AS MAY FROM TIME TO TIME BE AGREED BETWEEN THE SCHOOL GOVERNORS AND THE TRUSTEES AFTER CONSULTATION WITH THE LOCAL EDUCATION AUTHORITY (FOR FURTHER DETAILS SEE CLAUSE 20 OF THE SCHEME).

name: THE FRIENDS OF VELINDRE HOSPITAL
activities: The charity provides funds to Velindre Hospital to assist in the purchase of medical equipment. The charity provides support and assistance to patients to improve their comfort and welfare.
objects: TO RELIEVE PATIENTS AND FORMER PATIENTS OF VELINDRE HOSPITAL WHO ARE SICK, CONVALESCENT, DISABLED, HANDICAPPED, INFIRM OR IN NEED OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AND GENERALLY TO SUPPORT THE CHARITABLE WORK OF THE SAID HOSPITAL. (FOR FURTHER DETAILS SEE CLAUSE 3 OF THE RULES)

name: CARLETON COMMUNITY ASSOCIATION
activities: The hall provides a venue for various activities rather than organising events ourselves.
objects: A) TO PROMOTE THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF THE ELECTORAL WARDS OF CARLETON AND TITHEBARN IN THE BOROUGH OF WYRE IN THE COUNTY OF LANCASHIRE (HEREINAFTER CALLED 'THE AREA OF BENEFIT') WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF NATIONALITY, COLOUR, RACE, SEXUAL ORIENTATION OR SEX OR OF POLITICAL, RELIGIOUS OR OTHER OPINIONS BY ASSOCIATING THE LOCAL AUTHORITIES, VOLUNTARY AND OTHER ORGANISATIONS AND INHABITANTS IN A COMMON EFFORT TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND TO PROVIDE FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FORRECREATION AND LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR THE SAID INHABITANTS.    B) TO ESTABLISH OR TO SECURE THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A COMMUNITY CENTRE (HEREINAFTER CALLED 'THE CENTRE') AND TO MAINTAIN AND MANAGE,OR TO CO-OPERATE WITH ANY LOCAL STATUTORY AUTHORITY IN THE MAINTENANCE AND MANAGEMENT OF SUCH A CENTRE FOR ACTIVITIES PROMOTED BY THE ASSOCIATION AND ITS CONSTITUENT BODIES IN FURTHERANCE OF THE ABOVE OBJECTS.    THE ASSOCIATION SHALL BE NON-PARTY IN POLITICS AND NON-SECTARIAN IN RELIGION

name: THE NOTTINGHAM 'ROOSEVELT' MEMORIAL TRAVELLING SCHOLARSHIP FUND
activities: To grant travelling scholarships to men and women aged between 21 and 35 working and/or living in the city or county of Nottingham.  The scholarship consists of a gift of money to enable them to visit the United States of America for a period of generally between one month and three months.
objects: SUBJECT AS AFORESAID THE TRUSTEES SHALL APPLY THE ANNUAL SUMS PAYABLE TO THE TRUSTEES UNDER DEEDS OF COVENANT AS HEREINBEFORE RECITED AND ALSO THE INCOME OF THE INVESTMENTS OF THE SCHOLARSHIP FUND IN PERPETUITY FOR THE PURPOSE AWARDING A SCHOLARSHIP OR SCHOLARSHIPS TO YOUNG MEN AND WOMEN PRIMARILY EMPLOYED IN THE PRIVATE, PUBLIC OF THIRD SECTOR BETWEEN THE AGES OF 20 AND 35 AS AT 1ST SEPTEMBER OF THE YEAR IN WHICH THEY HAVE THEIR FINAL INTERVIEW WHO ARE RESIDENT OR EMPLOYED IN THE CITY OR COUNTY OF NOTTINGHAM TO ENABLE THEM TO VISIT THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA FOR A PERIOD OF NOT LESS THAN SIX WEEKS AND NOT MORE THAN THREE MONTHS OR FOR SUCH OTHER PERIOD AS MAY IN SPECIAL CIRCUMSTANCES BE DECIDED BY THE TRUSTEES FOR THE PURPOSE OF OBTAINING FURTHER EDUCATION IN RESPECT IN PARTICULAR OF THE HISTORY AND WAY OF LIFE OF THE AMERICAN PEOPLE.

name: SEBERGHAM WOMEN'S INSTITUTE
activities: The W.I. is based in the ideals of fellowship,truth, tolerance and justice.  It is non-sectarian & non party political.  Its object is to enable women to take an effective role in the improvement and development of conditions of rural life. To make provision to advance their education in citizenship, music, drama, handicrafts, home economics, agriculture, health and social welfare.
objects: TO IMPROVE AND DEVELOP CONDITIONS OF RURAL LIFE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE CONSTITUTION AND RULES OF THE WOMEN'S INSTITUTE.

name: HINCKLEY AND DISTRICT TOY LIBRARY
activities: Loans good quality toys and equipment.
objects: THE OBJECT OF THE TOY LIBRARY SHALL BE THE RELIEF AND EDUCATION OF LOCAL CHILDRED WITH SPECIAL NEEDS, BY THE PROVISION OF THERAPEUTIC, EDUCATIONAL AND STIMULATING TOYS AND QUIPMENT AND IN FURTHERANCE OF SUCH OBJECT THE TOY LIBRARY SHALL AIM: I TO ASSIST THE DEVELOPMENT FROM THE EARLIEST AGE OF ALL LOCAL CHILDREN WHATEVER THEIR DISABILITY THROUGH ALL FORMS OF PLAY ACTIVITY. II TO LEND TO THEM THE BEST AVAILABLE TOYS. III TO PROVIDE AN OPPORTUNITY FOR PROFESSIONAL INVOLGEMENT IN A VOLUNTARY SERVICEFOR LOCAL CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL NEEDS.

name: MEMORIAL INSTITUTE, SANDIACRE
activities: Community centre providing facilities for groups and organisations such as, Polling station, Pre-school certified by OFSTED, dance classes, Exercise and fitness classes and also casual users for parties and meetings.
objects: (1) TO PROVIDE, IN MOMORY OF THE DEAD OF THE TWO WORLS WARS A VILLAGE HALL FOR THE USE OF THE INHABITANTS OF THE PARISH OF SANDICARE AND ITS IMMEDIATE VICINITY (HEREINAFTER CALLED THE AREA OF BENEFIT) WITHOUT DISTINCTION OFPOLITICAL, RELIGIOUS OR OTHER OPINIONS, UNCLIDING USE FOR MEETINGS, LECTURES AND CLASSES, AND FOR OTHER FORMS OF RECREARION AND LEISURE-TIME OCCUPATION, WITH THE CONDISTION OF LIFE FOR THE SAID INHABITANTS. (2) SAID LAND AND BUILDING SHALL BE HELD ON TRUST FOR THE PURPOSES OF AVILLAGE HALL AND EXISTING MEMORIAL TABLETS TO BE PRESERVED AND DISPLAYED THEREIN.

name: NEWARK AND NOTTINGHAMSHIRE AGRICULTURAL SOCIETY
activities: The promotion of agriculture and related industries via the Nottinghamshire County , Midlands Machinery and Newark Vintage Tractor Shows.  Home to Notts YFC, Long Service medals, the free loan of equipment and sponsorship and local shows' conference.  Grants for Nottinghamshire agricultural machinery apprentices and students.  Venue hire through a Trading Company.
objects: (1) TO PROMOTE AGRICULTURE AND TO SUCH END GENERALLY TO IMPROVE IT IN ALL ITS BRANCHES AND TO ENCOURAGE SKILL AND INDUSTRY IN IT AND IN ALL TRADES, CRAFTS AND PROFESSIONS CONNECTED WITH IT. (2) TO PROMOTE INDUSTRY IN GENERAL. (3) TO HOLD IN PURSUANCE OF ITS MAIN OBJECT AN ANNUAL AGRICULTURAL SHOW PROVIDED THAT THE SOCIETY SHALL NOT BE OBLIGED TO HOLD A SHOW IN ANY YEAR IN RELATION TO WHICH THE COUNCIL OF THE SOCIETYSHALL RESOLVE THAT THE HOLDING OF SUCH SHOW IS IMPRACTICABLE OR NOT IN THE INTERESTS OF THE SOCIETY.

name: THE SOUTH PEMBROKESHIRE PROVINCIAL GRAND LODGE OF THE ROYAL ANTEDILUVIAN ORDER OF BUFFALOES GRAND LODGE OF ENGLAND
activities: fOR THE BEBNIFIT OF MEMBERS OR FAMILY WHO ARE IN NEED OF SUPPORT
objects: TO RELIEVE BY DONATIONS ANNUITIES OR OTHERWISE ASSIST NECESSITOUS BRETHEREN WIDOWS ORPHANS OR DEPENDENTS OF DECEASED BRETHEREN.

name: THE 'WEST MIDLANDS' SURGICAL SOCIETY
activities: The advancement of the science and art of surgery in all its branches and to promote and encourage for the public benefit within the area covered by the West Midlands Regional Authority, the study, general practice and general knowledge of surgery
objects: THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE SCIENCE AND ART OF SURGERY IN ALL ITS BRANCHES AND TO PROMOTE AND ENCOURAGE FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT WITHIN THE AREA COVERED BY THE WEST MIDLANDS REGIONAL HEALTH AUTHORITY, THE STUDY, GENERAL PRACTICE AND GENERAL KNOWLEDGE OF SURGERY.

name: THE 'WEST MIDLANDS' SURGICAL SOCIETY
activities: The advancement of the science and art of surgery in all its branches and to promote and encourage for the public benefit within the area covered by the West Midlands Regional Authority, the study, general practice and general knowledge of surgery
objects: THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE SCIENCE AND ART OF SURGERY IN ALL ITS BRANCHES AND TO PROMOTE AND ENCOURAGE FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT WITHIN THE AREA COVERED BY THE WEST MIDLANDS REGIONAL HEALTH AUTHORITY, THE STUDY, GENERAL PRACTICE AND GENERAL KNOWLEDGE OF SURGERY.

name: THE ROSSITER SCHOLARSHIP FOUNDATION
activities: Assists pupils from Beverley High School with individual grants for art and culture.
objects: PROMOTING THE EDUCATION OF GIRLS ATTENDING THE BEVERLEY HIGH SCHOOL AT BEVERLEY. PROVISION OF EXHIBITIONS TENABLE AT PLACES OF HIGHER EDUCATION. PROVIDED THAT CANDIDATES FOR BENEFITS SHALL BE GIRLS WHO IN THE OPINION OF THE TRUSTEES ARE IN NEED OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE.

name: DENYS EDWARDS PLAYERS
activities: Drama Group performing to the public
objects: TO PROMOTE THE ADVANCEMENT AND IMPROVEMENT OF GENERAL EDUCATION AND PUBLIC APPREICATION OF ALL ASPECTS OF THE ART OF DRAMA.

name: BIRMINGHAM HOSPITAL BROADCASTING NETWORK
activities: Providing entertainment for hospital in patients
objects: TO RELIEVE SICKNESS, INFIRMITY AND OLD AGE AMONG PERSONS IN THE WEST MIDLANDS METROPOLITAN COUNTY BY AND LAWFUL MEANS INCLUDING (BUT WITHOUT LIMITATION) THE FOLLOWING:- (A) PROVIDING A LOCAL BROADCASTING SERVICE FOR HOSPITALS AND CONVALESCENT HOMES. (B) EQUIPPING WHERE NECESSARY HOSPITALS AND CONVALESCENT HOMES TO RECEIVE AND DISTRIBUTE SUCH BROADCASTING SERVICE.

name: THE UPPER GORNAL VOLUNTARY RECREATION ASSOCIATION
activities: we run a local community building rpoviding  lighting heating for volunteer user groups like a kick boxing group a judo club a kids club a church group a dance club and a football group
objects: TO PROMOTE ANY CHARITABLE PURPOSES FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF THE UPPER GORNAL AREA AND ITS NEIGHBOURHOOD ("HEREINAFTER CALLED THE AREA OF BENEFIT") WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF SEX OR OF POLITICAL, RELIGIOUS OR OTHER OPINIONS, AND IN PARTICULAR TO PROVIDE FACILITIES FOR RECREATION AND LEISURE-TIME ACTIVITIES WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE AND OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE SAID INHABITANTS. TO ESTABLISH OR TO SECURE THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A RECREATIONAL CENTRE ("HEREINAFTER CALLEDTHE CENTRE") AND TO MAINTAIN AND MANAGE, OR TO CO-OPERATE WITH ANY LOCAL STATUTORY AUTHORITY IN THE MAINTENANCE AND MANAGEMENT OF SUCH A CENTRE FOR ACTIVITIES PROMOTED BY THE ASSOCIATION AND ITS CONSTITUENT BODIES IN FURTHERANCE OF THE ABOVE OBJECTS.(FOR FURTHER DETAILS SEE CONSTITUTION).

name: LICHFIELD LIONS CLUB CHARITY TRUST FUND
activities: We take an active interest in the civic and social welfare of the community overall by encouraging service minded people to serve within their community without personal financial reward. Money is raised through various fund raising activities which is re-distributed through donations to the needy at local, national and international levels i.e. the old, physically impaired and the young.
objects: FOR SUCH CHARITABLE PURPOSE OR PURPOSES ACCORDING TO THE LAWS OF ENGLAND AND WALES IN AND WITHIN THE AREA FROM TIME TO TIME COMRPISING THE TERRITORIAL AREA OF THE CLUB THROUGHOUT THE UNITED KINGDOM AND THE REPUBLIC OF EIRE OR ELSEWHERE AND/OR TO OR FOR THE BENEFIT OF SUCH ONE OR MORE CHARITABLE BODIES, TRUSTS, ASSOCIATIONS, INSTITUTIONS OR ORGANISATIONS ESTABLISHED OR ABOUT TO BE ESTABLISHED FOR SUCH CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS AFORESAID AND IN SUCH SHARES AND IN SUCH MANNER AS THE CLUB SHALL IN ITS ABSOLUTE DISCRETION DETERMINE AND SELECT.

name: LLANLLWNI YOUNG FARMERS CLUB
activities: Youth Organisation
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF YOUNG MEMBERS OF THE PUBLIC AT LARGE IN AGRICULTURE, HOME CRAFTS, COUNTRY LIFE AND RELATED SUBJECTS. (FOR FURTHER DETAILS SEE CLAUSE 2 OF THE CONSTITUTION)

name: THE MANCHESTER AND LANCASHIRE FAMILY HISTORY SOCIETY
activities: The principal activities of the charity throughout the year have continued to be that of promoting and encouraging the public study of British family history, genealogy, heraldry and local history and also to promote the preservation, security and accessibility of archival material.
objects: THE AIMS OF THE SOCIETY SHALL BE:- 1) TO PROMOTE AND ENCOURAGE THE PUBLIC STUDY OF BRITISH FAMILY HISTORY,GENEALOGY, HERALDRY AND LOCAL HISTORY. 2) TO PROMOTE THE PRESERVATION,SECURITY AND ACCESSIBILITY OF ARCHIVAL MATERIAL.

name: WODENSBOROUGH SENIOR CITIZENS CLUB
activities: LEISURE AND SOCIAL ACTIVITIES FOR OAP'S MONDAY AND TUESDAYS EVERY WEEK .2 HOURLY SESSION EACH TIME. SOCIAL PARTIES AND DAY TRIPS ALSO DANCING,AND GUEST SPEAKERS
objects: TO PROMOTE THE WELFARE OF THE AGED IN ANY MANNER WHICH NOW IS OR HEREAFTER MAY BE DEEMED BY LAW TO BE CHARITABLE WITHIN THE AREA BORDERING WEDNESBURY AND WEST BROMWICH IN THE METROPOLITAN BOROUGH OF SANDWELL.

name: BIRKENHEAD PHOTOGRAPHIC ASSOCIATION
activities: Organising and conducting exhibitions of photography. Making pubicly available information concerning photography by means of lectures, instruction, information and research.
objects: THE OBJECTS FOR WHICH THE ASSOCIATION IS ESTABLISHED ARE TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN THE THEORY AND PRACTICE OF PHOTOGRAPHY AS AN ART.

name: MOSSLANDS SCHOOL ASSOCIATION
activities: Fundraising towards the education of Mosslands school students.
objects: TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUPILS OF THE SCHOOL BY PROVIDING AND ASSISTING IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR EDUCATION AT THE SCHOOL (NOT NORMALLY PROVIDED BY THE LOCAL EDUCATION AUTHORITY). (FOR FURTHER DETAILS SEE CONSTITUTION).

name: PENYGRAIG COMMUNITY PROJECT
activities: Penygraig Community Project develops facilities to support children, young people and families living in Penygraig and neighbourhood creating opportunities for play, youth and community activities.
objects: THE PROPERTY ASSIGNED SHALL BE HELD UPON TRUST FOR THE PURPOSE OF A CENTRE FOR THE USE OF THE PENYGRAIG COMMUNITY PROJECT TO PROMOTE THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF PENYGRAIG AND THE NEIGHBOURHOOD WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF SEX OR OF POLITICAL, RELIGIOUS OR OTHER OPINIONS BY THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION AND PROVISION OF FACILITIES IN THE INTEREST OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION AND LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR THE SAID INHABITANTS.

name: SHAVINGTON YOUTH CLUB
activities: PROVIDE: Management and administration of the building and the facilities  SENIOR YOUTH CLUB based in Old School, 140 Main Rd Shavington JUNIOR YOUTH CLUB based in Old School, 140 Main Rd Shavington
objects: TO HELP YOUNG PEOPLE ESPECIALLY BUT NOT EXCLUSIVELY THROUGH LEISURE TIME ACTIVITIES SO TO DEVELOP THEIR PHYSICAL, MENTAL AND SPIRITUAL CAPACITIES THAT THEY MAY GROW TO FULL MATURITY AS INDIVIDUALS AND MEMBERS OF SOCIETY.

name: GLASSON COMMUNITY ASSOCIATION
activities: The Glasson Community Association was formed to benefit the people living within the village of Glasson.  We are responsible for managing, maintaining and insuring the Children's Playground within the village and organise fundraising activities to support this.  We also work with surrounding Village Community Associations to provide other services for people within the community as requested.
objects: 1. TO PROVIDE FOR THE INHABITANTS OF GLASSON AND THE NEIGHBOURHOOD, BY ASSOCIATION WITH THESE INHABITANTS AND LOCAL AUTHORITIES, VOLUNTARY AND OTHER ORGANISATIONS IN A COMMON EFFORT, FACILITIES FOR RECREATION AND LEISURE-TIME ACTIVITIES WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR THE SAID INHABITANTS 2. TO PROMOTE SUCH OTHER CHARITABLE PURPOSES AS MAY FROM TIME TO TIME BE DETERMINED.

name: LOSTOCK CHRISTIAN FELLOWSHIP
activities: Religious activities, relief of poverty, overseas aid/famine relief, general charitable activities
objects: (A) THE PROCLAMATION AND FURTHERANCE OF THE GOSPEL OF GOD CONCERNING HIS SON JESUS CHRIST OUR LORD AND THE PREACHING AND TEACHING OF THE CHRISTIAN FAITH IN POYNTON, CHESHIRE AND ELSEWHERE.  (B) THE ORGANISATION, SPONSORSHIP AND PROMOTION OF INTER-DENOMINATIONAL CHRISTIAN WORK THROUGHOUT THE UNITED KINGDOM OF GREAT BRITAIN AND ELSEWHERE. (FOR FURTHER DETAILS SEE DECLARATION OF TRUST).

name: SKETTY CLUB BENEVOLENT TRUST
activities: THE FUND WAS ESTABLISHED AS A CHARITABLE TRUST FOR THE BENEFIT OF MEMBERS AND THIER FAMILIES
objects: THE GRANTING OF GRATUITIES PENSIONS OR ALLOWANCES TO PERSONS MENTIONED IN THE TRUST INSTRUMENT WHO ARE IN NEED HARDSHIP OR DISTRESS.

name: METCHLEY PARK MEDICAL SOCIETY
activities: Metchely Park Medical Society promotes and supports postgraduate medical education and the advancement of academic research of, and amongst, medical and senior paramedical staff of NHS hospital trusts and primary care providers in South Birmingham
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE SOCIETY ARE TO PROMOTE POSTGRADUATE MEDICAL EDUCATION AND THE ADVANCEMENT OF ACADEMIC RESEARCH OF AND AMONGST THE MEDICAL AND SENIOR PARAMEDICAL STAFF OF SOUTH BIRMINGHAM HEALTH AUTHORITY.

name: METCHLEY PARK MEDICAL SOCIETY
activities: Metchely Park Medical Society promotes and supports postgraduate medical education and the advancement of academic research of, and amongst, medical and senior paramedical staff of NHS hospital trusts and primary care providers in South Birmingham
objects: THE OBJECTS OF THE SOCIETY ARE TO PROMOTE POSTGRADUATE MEDICAL EDUCATION AND THE ADVANCEMENT OF ACADEMIC RESEARCH OF AND AMONGST THE MEDICAL AND SENIOR PARAMEDICAL STAFF OF SOUTH BIRMINGHAM HEALTH AUTHORITY.

name: SANDWITH SCHOOL
activities: The Trust issues small grants to students within the restricted area of the old Parish Councils of Sandwith and Rottington
objects: (A) TO PROMOTE THE EDUCATION OF PERSONS RESIDENT IN THE AREA OF THE FORMER PARISHES OF ROTTINGTON AND SANDWITH. (B) TO PROMOTE THE RELIGIOUS EDUCATION OF PERSONS RESIDENT IN THE SAID AREA IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PRINCIPLES AND DOCTRINES OF THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND.

name: WILMSLOW HISTORICAL SOCIETY
activities: Organises lectures, undertakes research, organises social events
objects: TO ADVANCE PUBLIC EDUCATION IN LOCAL HISTORY WITH PARTICULAR REFERENCE TO WILMSLOW AND THE SURROUNDING AREA AND TO PROMOTE THE STUDY OF SOURCE MATERIAL RELATING THERETO.

name: PATRONS OF LAKE DISTRICT SUMMER MUSIC
activities: To promote, improve, develop and maintain the education of the public in the study and appreciation of music and the other arts.. by supporting the objects and activities of Lake District Summer Music Limited. The charity makes an annual contribution towards student bursaries at Lake District Summer Music.  Patrons arrange their own concerts and events throughout the year.
objects: TO PROMOTE IMPROVE DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN THE EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC IN THE STUDY PRACTICE AND APPRECIATION OF MUSIC AND THE OTHER ARTS IN SUCH MANNER AS THE SOCIETY (ACTING THROUGH ITS COMMITTEE) SHALL FROM TIME TO TIME DETERMINE AND IN PARTICULAR (BUT WITHOUT PREJUDICE TO THE GENERALITY OF THE FOREGOING) BY SUPPORTING THE OBJECTS AND ACTIVITIES OF LAKE DISTRICT SUMMER MUSIC LIMITED (BEING A COMPANY LIMITED BY GUARANTEE AND REGISTERED AS A CHARITY).

name: ELLESMERE PORT CONCERT BRASS
activities: Ellesmere Port Concert Brass aims to keep the tradition of the culture and performance of Brass Band music alive, particularly but not exclusively in the boroughs of Cheshire West and Chester and Wirral.  To encourage musical education in young people by the provision of musical instruments and funding toward tuition.
objects: TO PROMOTE IMPROVE DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN PUBLIC EDUCATION IN AND APPRECIATION OF THE ART AND SCIENCE OF SILVER BAND MUSIC IN ALL ITS ASPECTS BY THE PRESENTATION OF PUBLIC CONCERTS AND RECITALS AND BY SUCH OTHER WAYS AS THE BAND THROUGH ITS COMMITTEE SHALL DETERMINE FROM TIME TO TIME.

name: ST JAMES'S CHURCH OF ENGLAND PRIMARY SCHOOL PARENTS, TEACHERS AND FRIENDS ASSOCIATION
activities: Fund raising activities for benefit of education and activities for the children and staff of St James' C.of E. Primary School, Wollaston, West Midlands.
objects: THE OBJECT OF THE ASSOCIATIO IS TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION OF THE PUPILS AT THE SCHOOL BY PROVIDING AND ASSISTING IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR EDUCATION AT THE SCHOOL NOT NORMALLY PROVIDED BY THE LOCAL EDUCATION AUTHORITY.

name: DURHAM JOHNSTON COMPREHENSIVE SCHOOL FUND
activities: DURHAM JOHNSTON SCHOOL FUND PROMOTES THE EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES OF THE PUPILS AT THAT SCHOOL WITH THE OBJECTIVE OF "Advancing the education of the pupils of Durham Johnston Comprehensive School by providing and assisting in the provision of the facilities for the education (including extra curricular education) of pupils at the school not normally provided for by the LA".
objects: ADVANCING THE EDUCATION OF THE PUPILS OF DURHAM JOHNSTON COMPREHENSIVE SCHOOL BY PROVIDING AND ASSISTING IN THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES FOR THE EDUCATION OF PUPILS AT THE SCHOOL NOT NORMALLY PROVIDED BY THE LOCAL AUTHORITY.

name: CLEMENTHORPE COMMUNITY ASSOCIATION
activities: We provide an area for local activities to take place:- bingo, and childrens activities, healing group, theatre group
objects: (A) TO PROMOTE THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF THE AREA BOUNDED BY THE RIVER OUSE, SKELDERGATE BRIDGE, BISHOPGATE STREET, BISHOPTHORPE ROAD AS FAR AS AND INCLUDING BUTCHER TERRACE WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF SEX OR OF POLICITAL RELIGIOUS OR OTHER OPINIONS BY ASSOCIATING THE LOCAL AUTHORITIES, VOLUNTARY ORGANISATIONS AND INHABITANTS IN A COMMON EFFORT TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND TO PROVIDE FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION AND LEISURE-TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR THE SAID INHABITANTS.                                                                    (B) TO ESTABLISH OR TO SECURE THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A COMMUNITY CENTRE AND TO MAINTAIN AND MANAGE, OR TO CO-OPERATE WITH ANY LOCAL STATUTORY AUTHORITY IN THE MAINTENANCE AND MANAGEMENT OF SUCH A CENTRE FOR ACTIVITIES PROMOTED BY THE ASSOCIATION AND ITS CONSTITUTENT BODIES IN FURTHERANCE OF THE ABOVE OBJECTS.

name: THE HEREFORDSHIRE CHEST FUND
activities: Supports patient education, essential equipment purchase, research & training for the management and care of people with lung diseases in Herefordshire and surrounding counties
objects: TO PROMOTE THE RELIEF AND REHABILTIATION OF PERSONS SUFFERING FROM ANY FORM OF DISEASE OF THE CHEST WITHIN THE AREA OF BENEFIT AS HEREINAFTER DEFINED AND WHO ARE HAVE BEEN PATIENTS OF THE CONSULTANT PHYSICIANS APPOINTED TO THE HEREFORDSHIRE GROUP OF HOSPITALS.

name: TYBROUGHTON RELIEF IN NEED CHARITY
activities: Tybroughton area only. Anyone in need or has fallen on hard times.
objects: RELIEVING EITHER GENERALLY OR INDIVIDUALLY PERSONS RESIDENT IN THE TYBROUGHTON WARD OF THE COMMUNITY OF BRONINGTON WHO ARE IN CONDITIONS OF NEED, HARDSHIP OR DISTRESS BY MAKING GRANTS OF MONEY OR PROVIDING OR PAYING FOR ITEMS, SERVICES OR FACILITIES CALCULATED TO REDUCE THE NEED, HARDSHIP OR DISTRESS OF SUCH PERSONS.

name: BREWOOD MIDDLE SCHOOL CHARITY
activities: To provide special benefits for Brewood Middle School of any kind not normally provided by the Local Education Authority.Also to promote the education, in such manner as the Trustees think fit, of persons under  the age of 25 who are attending or have attended Brewood Middle School.
objects: 1) TO PROVIDE SPECIAL BENEFITS FOR BREWOOD MIDDLE SCHOOL OF ANY KIND NOT NORMALLY PROVIDED BY THE LOCAL EDUCATION AUTHORITY.2) TO PROMOTE THE EDUCATION IN SUCH MANNER AS THE TRUSTEES THINK FIT OF PERSONS UNDER THE AGE OF 25 YEARS WHO ARE ATTENDING OR HAVE ATTENDED, BREWOOD MIDDLE SCHOOL

name: MARCUS GARVEY DAY CENTRE
activities: To provide day care facilities to African/Caribbean Elders and people of other communities in the city of Nottingham.  To provide support to those elders who have dementia to improve the quality of their life and promote self worth.
objects: TO PROMOTE THE WELFARE OF THE AGED WHO ARE RESIDENT IN THE RADFORD AND LENTON AREAS OF NOTTINGHAM AND ELSEWHERE PARTICULARLY THOSE OF AFRO-CARIBBEAN ORIGIN IN ANY MANNER WHICH NOW IS OR HEREAFTER MAY BE DEEMED BY LAW TO BE CHARITABLE.

name: WIGAN UNIT 366 OF THE SEA CADET CORPS
activities: The principle aim of Wigan Sea Cadets is to engage young people 10-18 through a nautical theme, based on traditions and values of the Royal Navy in extra curricular education and training. Objectively we aim to give young people the best possible headstart in life, laying the foundations to support young people into further education and employment.
objects: The charitable purpose of the Unit (the Purpose) is to promote the development of young people in achieving their physical, intellectual and social potential as individuals and as responsible citizens by the provision of education and leisure time activities using a nautical theme and in accordance with the principles, ethos and practices of the Marine Society & Sea Cadets (MSSC).

name: PHILHARMONIA OF NORTH WALES LIMITED
activities: The advancement of public education in musical arts in North Wales.
objects: THE ADVANCEMENT OF PUBLIC EDUCATION IN THE MUSICAL ARTS IN NORTH WALES (THE COUNTIES OF CLWYD, GWYNEDD AND POWYS) AND TO PROMOTE AND FOSTER PUBLIC APPRECIATION AND UNDERSTANDING OF MUSIC IN ALL ITS ASPECTS.

name: THE SUNDERLAND DEAF SOCIETY
activities: THE SOCIETY PROVIDES THE FOLLOWING FOR PEOPLE WITH HEARING AND SPEECH DISABILITIES ; A BUILDING WITH FACILITIES , HUMAN RESOURCES IN THE FORM OF VOLUNTEERS , CARE AND COUNSELLING , ADVOCACY ADVICE AND INFORMATION , SPORTS AND RECREATION .
objects: 1. TO PROVIDE SOCIAL, RECREATIONAL AND EDUCATIONAL ACTIVATES FOR DEAF AND HARD OF HEARING IMPAIRED PEOPLE LIVING IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT, REGARDLESS OF RACE, RELIGION, CREED, DISABILITY, AGE, GENDER OR SEXUAL ORIENTATION  2. TO PROVIDE ADVICE, SUPPORT AND INFORMATION ON DEAF ISSUES

name: ISRAAC SOMALI COMMUNITY ASSOCIATION
activities: Advocacy Service;Youth Work; Globe Tutoring for primary school age, delivering an extension of the school curriculum;?I Can Read? project mainly focuses on raising children?s reading levels;Secondary Study Support; Women's Resource Centre supporting women to access employment, training and education;Job Club; Lunch Club for senior citizens; Interpretation and translation service;Catering service.
objects: TO PROMOTE FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE SOMALI COMMUNITY IN THE CITY OF SHEFFIELD THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION AND THE PROVISION OF FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION AND LEISURE-TIME OCCUPATION FOR THOSE MEMBERS OF THE SAID COMMUNITY WHO HAVE NEED OF SUCH FACILITIES BY REASON OF THEIR SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR THE SAID COMMUNITY.

name: BREADSALL WOMEN'S INSTITUTE
activities: Develop education in music , drama, home economics,handicrafts,health and social welfare.
objects: THE MAIN PURPOSES OF THE WOMEN'S INSTITUTE ORGANISATION ARE TO ENABLE WOMEN WHO ARE INTERESTED IN ISSUES ASSOCIATED WITH RURAL LIFE, INCLUDING ARTS, CRAFTS AND SCIENCES, TO IMPROVE AND DEVELOP CONDITIONS OF RURAL LIFE, TO ADVANCE THEIR EDUCATION IN CITIZENSHIP, IN PUBLIC QUESTIONS BOTH NATIONAL AND INTERNATIONAL, IN MUSIC, DRAMA AND OTHER CULTURAL SUBJECTS AND IN ALL BRANCHES OF AGRICULTURE, HANDICRAFTS, HOME ECONOMICS, HEALTH AND SOCIAL WELFARE.  IT SEEKS TO GIVE WOMEN THE OPPORTUNITY OF WORKINGTOGETHER THROUGH THE WOMEN'S INSTITUTE ORGANISATION AND OF PUTTING INTO PRACTICE THOSE IDEALS FOR WHICH IT STANDS.

name: CATALYST SCIENCE DISCOVERY CENTRE AND MUSEUM TRUST LIMITED
activities: Science Discovery Centre and Museum
objects: THE CHARITY'S OBJECTS ("OBJECTS") ARE SPECIFICALLY RESTRICTED TO RAISING AWARENESS OF AND INCREASING PUBLIC KNOWLEDGE OF CHEMISTRY AND BIOCHEMISTRY AND OTHER RELATED SCIENCES AND THEIR MATERIALS PROCESSES AND PRODUCTS WITH A PARTICULAR EMPHASIS ON EDUCATION OF YOUNG PEOPLE THROUGH THE DEVELOPMENT AND MAINTENANCE OF A SCIENCE CENTRE/MUSEUM - PLACED WITHIN A HISTORICAL CONTEXT AND WITH PARTICULAR REFERENCE TO THE LOCALITY. THE AIM IS TO PROMOTE, ORGANISE, SPONSOR AND INAUGURATE SUCH ACTIVITIES AND FUNCTIONS AS MAY FROM TIME TO TIME BE CONSIDERED NECESSARY OR DESIRABLE FOR THE ATTAINMENT OF ALL OR ANY ASPECTS OF THE ABOVE OBJECTS.

name: HURST HILL (COSELEY) COMMUNITY ASSOCIATION

objects: TO PROMOTE THE BENEFIT OF THE INHABITANTS OF HUST HILL AND THE NEIGHBOURHOOD WITHOUT DISTINCTION OF SEX, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, RACE OR OF POLITICAL, RELIGIOUS OR OTHER OPINIONS BY ASSOCIATION THE LOCAL AUTHORITIES, VOLUNTARY ORGANISATIONS IN A COMMON EFFORT TO ADVANCE EDUCATION AND TO PROVIDE FACILITIES IN THE INTERESTS OF SOCIAL WELFARE FOR RECREATION AND LEISURE TIME OCCUPATION WITH THE OBJECT OF IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR THE SAID INHABITANTS.

name: VALE OF GLAMORGAN FESTIVAL LIMITED
activities: The Festival comprises an annual series of public concerts of the music of living composers, together with associated public talks and community outreach projects.
objects: THE COMPANY IS ESTABLISHED TO ADVANCE PUBLIC EDUCATION OF THE ARTS GENERALLY IN THE VALE OF GLAMORGAN (THE COUNTIES OF MID GLAMORGAN AND SOUTH GLAMORGAN) PARTICULARLY BY THE PROMOTION OF EDUCATIONAL MUSICL CONCERTS AND THE ENCOURAGEMENT OF THE ARTS INCLUDING THE ARTS OF MUSIC, BALLET, SINGING, DRAMA, MINE DANCING AND THE FORMULATION, PREPARATION AND ESTABLISHMENT OF SCHEMES THEREFORE AND SUCH OTHER ARTISTIC AND CULTRAL ACTIVITIES AND EVENTS AS MAY PROPERLY RELATE THERETO.

name: WEST END WOMEN AND GIRLS CENTRE
activities: We aim to empower women and girls who have been traditionally disenfranchised from access to existing services, to effect positive change in their leisure, work and social environments. We do this by providing group work where women and girls can meet, have fun, learn new skills and look at issues relevant to their lives, building confidence in a safe and supportive environment.
objects: TO PROMOTE THE EQUALITY OF, AND TO HELP AND EDUCATE GIRLS AND WOMEN THROUGH THEIR LEISURE TIME ACTIVITIES SO TO DEVELOP THEIR PHYSICAL, MENTAL CAPACITIES THAT THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE MAY BE IMPROVED WHO LIVE IN THE WEST END AREA OF NEWCASTLE UPON TYNE.

name: TREETOPS HOSPICE TRUST
activities: Treetops Hospice provides Daycare, Complementary Therapy and Hospice at Home care for people suffering from life-limiting illnesses. We also provide Carers Support and Complementary Therapy for people involved in caring for people with life-limiting illnesses and Bereavement Support for people and families who have suffered a bereavement.
objects: PURPOSES OF RELIEVING IN CASES OF NEED PERSONS WHO ARE SICK, CONVALESCENT, DISABLED, HANDICAPPED OR INFIRM BY PROVIDING OR PAYING FOR ITEMS, SERVICES OR FACILITIES WHICH ARE CALCULATED TO ALLEVIATE THE SUFFERING OR ASSIST THE RECOVERY OF SUCH PERSONS IN SUCH CASES BUT ARE NOT READILY AVAILABLE TO THEM FROM OTHER SOURCES. (FOR FURTHER DETAILS PLEASE SEE CLAUSE 3 OF MEMOR. AND ACTS.)

objects: THE OBJECT OF THE CHARITY IS TO RELIEVE CHILDREN AND YOUNG PEOPLE SUFFERING FROM MUSCULAR DYSTROPHY AND OTHER SIMILAR DISEASES AND HANDICAPS GENERALLY AND IN PARTICULAR IN THE PURCHASE AND PROVISION OF OUTDOOR ELECTRIC WHEELCHAIRS AND SUCH OTHER AIDS AS THE TRUSTEES MAY FROM TIME TO TIME DECIDE.

objects: TO RELIEVE THE DISTRESS OF UNWANTED AND STRAY ANIMALS IN THE AREAS OF ALSAGER, BIDDULPH AND STOKE ON TRENT. (FOR FURTHER DETAILS SEE CONSTITUTION).

activities: Unit of the Sea Cadet Corps, with about 50 cadets, boys and girls, aged 10 to 18, who meet twice a week in the evenings for training and who sail on Saturday mornings in the summer. The aims are to encourage young people towards responsible adulthood. The Royal Navy provides uniforms and some training and operates a rigorous inspection system. Each unit is an independent charity.
objects: The charitable purpose of the Unit (the Purpose) is to promote the development of young people in achieving their physical, intellectual and social potential as individuals and as responsible citizens by the provision of education and leisure time activities using a nautical theme and in accordance with the principles, ethos and practices of the Marine Society & Sea Cadets (MSSC).

objects: PROVISION OF A SCHOOL FOR BOYS AND A SCHOOL FOR GIRLS, IN OR NEAR THE BOROUGH OF OLDHAM

objects: A DAY AND BOARDING SCHOOL FOR BOYS. A LIBRARY. MAINTENANCE OF THE PREMISES OF THE LIBRARY AND HOSPITAL PREMISES. AWARD OF SCHOLARSHIPS, MAINTENANCE ALLOWANCES, LEAVING EXHIBITIONS AND OTHER GRANTS.

IF AND INSOFAR AS THE INCOME  OF THE CHARITY  CANNOT BE APPLIED TOWARDS THE ABOVE OBJECT IT MAY BE APPLIED IN PROMOTING THE EDUCATION OF PERSONS WHO ARE IN NEED OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE IN THE FOLLOWING ORDER OF PRIORITY(A) PERSONS WHO ARE ATTENDING THE COLLEGE; AND (B) PERSONS WHO HAVE AT ANY TIME ATTENDED THE COLLEGE; AND (C) PERSONS UNDER THE AGE OF 25 RESIDENT IN THE AREA OF BENEFIT.

name: THE NATURAL HISTORY SOCIETY OF NORTHUMBRIA
activities: The objects of the Society are the encouragement by every means of the study of natural history in all its branches and the conservation of the natural environment in north east England including its geology, flora and fauna.
objects: THE ENCOURAGEMENT BY EVERY MEANS OF THE STUDY OF NATURAL HISTORY IN ALL ITS BRANCHES; THE PROTECTION OF THE LOCAL FLORA AND FAUNA; THE MAINTENANCE AND EXTENSION OF THE SOCIETY'S LIBRARY AND COLLECTIONS; THE PUBLICATION OF 'TRANSACTIONS' AND OTHER SCIENTIFIC PAPERS, THE ORGANISATION OF LECTURES, DISCUSSIONS AND FIELD MEETINGS AND CO-OPERATION WITH OTHER SCIENTIFIC SOCIETIES OR ASSOCIATIONS WITH SIMILAR OBJECTS. THE SOCIETY SHALL ALSO ENCOURAGE THE ESTABLISHMENT OF SECTIONS FOR THE PURPOSE OF STUDYING BOTANY, GEOLOGY AND ZOOLOGY AND SUCH OTHER SUBJECTS AS MAY FROM TIME TO TIME BE APPROVED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE SOCIETY.

name: WINDERMERE EDUCATIONAL TRUST LIMITED
activities: Windermere Educational Trust Limited operates an Independent Boarding Preparatory and Senior School offering education to children aged 3 to 18.
objects: (A) TO ACQUIRE AND TAKE OVER AND CARRY ON ST ANNE'S SCHOOL, BROW HEAD, WINDERMERE, HERETOFORE CARRIED ON BY ST. ANNE'S SCHOOL LIMITED. (B)(I) TO ESTABLISH AND MAINTAIN AT THE SAID PREMISES, AND TO ESTABLISH OR ACQUIRE AND CARRY ON OR MANAGE ELSEWHERE,ANY SUBSIDIARY, AFFILIATED OR OTHER SCHOOLS FOR THE EDUCATION OF GIRLS, AND IF THOUGHT FIT, FOR THE EDUCATION OF BOYS, EITHER IN CONNEXION WITH ST. ANNE'S SCHOOL OR AS INDEPENDENT SCHOOLS, AND TO SUPPLY TO THE PUPILS GENERAL INSTRUCTION OF THE HIGHEST CLASS, TOGETHER WITH PHYSICAL, MORAL AND RELIGIOUS TRAINING, BUT SO THAT EACH SCHOOL SHALL BE CARRIED ON AS AN EDUCATIONAL CHARITY. (B)(II) TO EDUCATE AND ASSIST YOUNG PERSONS THROUGH THEIR LEISURE TIME ACTIVITIES SO AS TO DEVELOP THEIR PHYSICAL MENTAL AND SPIRITUAL CAPACITIES THAT THEY MAY GROW TO FULL MATURITY AS INDIVIDUALS AND MEMBERS OF SOCIETY AND THAT THEIR CONDITIONS OF LIFE MAY BE IMPROVED. (C) TO CARRY ON ANY SCHOOLS ACQUIRED BY ST. ANNE'S SCHOOL EDUCATIONAL TRUST LIMITED AS EDUCATIONAL CHARITIES.

objects: THE PROMOTION OF EDUCATION (INCLUDING RELIGIOUS EDUCATION IN THE DOCTRINES OF THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND AND SOCIAL AND PHYSICAL TRAINING) AND THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE RELIGIOUS AND OTHER CHARITABLE WORK OF THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND.

name: REPTON SCHOOL TRUST
activities: Repton School Trust's principal objective is to further the education of children and young persons. The Trust provides the land and buildings from which Repton School and Repton Preparatory School operate.
objects: A) THE OBJECT OF THE CHARITY SHALL BE THE PROVISION AND CONDUCT IN OR NEAR REPTON OF INDEPENDENT DAY AND BOARDING SCHOOLS FOR BOYS OR BOYS AND GIRLS AND THE PROMOTION OF EDUCATION (INCLUDING SOCIAL AND PHYSICAL TRAINING) OF BOYS AND GIRLS.    B) SUBJECT TO THE PROVISIONS IN THIS SCHEME CONCERNING DISPOSAL AND REPLACEMENT SUCH LAND AS IS PERMANENT ENDOWMENT MUST BE RETAINED BY THE TRUSTEE FOR USE FOR THE OBJECT OF THE CHARITY.

name: ETHEL JAMES TRUST FUND
activities: Aims are advancement of education of the public; granting assistance to present or past members of Normanton School in necessitous circumstances; provision of Scholarships, prize exhibitions or awards; assistance of existing charitable institutions associated with Normanton School
objects: FOR THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC FOR THE GRANTING OF ASSISTANCE TO PRESENT OR PAST MEMBERS OF NORMANTON SCHOOL WHO ARE IN NECESSITOUS CIRCUMSTANCES.

name: JOHN TOWNSHEND
activities: We are a Church school.
objects: SUPPORT OF THE SCHOOL AT CRADLEY.

name: CHARITIES IN CONNECTION WITH STOURBRIDGE HIGH SCHOOL FOR GIRLS
activities: education prize
objects: SEE INDIVIDUAL CONSTITUENTS

name: THE DENNIS PRIZE FOR EMPIRE KNOWLEDGE
activities: Split between 5 Lincolnshire schools for Empire Knowledge prizes
objects: THE ENCOURAGEMENT OF KNOWLEDGE OF THE BRITISH EMPIRE BY ANNUAL AWARDS TO THE STUDENTS MOS PROFICIENT IN THAT SUBJECT IN SECONDARY SCHOOLS AIDED OR MAINTAINED BY THE LOCAL EDUCATION AUTHORITY.

name: GREAT PONTON ARCHERS SCHOOL TRUST
activities: Financial support of Great Ponton Archers School, and award of a grant towards the cost of new uniform for parents/carers of final year pupils at the school who are of the parish of Great Ponton and transferring to secondary school.
objects: 1) TO PROVIDE SPECIAL BENEFITS FOR THE SCHOOL OF ANY KIND NOT NORMALLY PROVIDED BY THE LOCAL EDUCATION AUTHORITY. 2) TO ADVANCE THE EDUCATION, INCLUDING THE PROVISION OF RELIGIOUS INSTRUCTION IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PRINCIPLES OF THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND,OF PERSONS UNDER THE AGE OF 25 YEARS WHO ARE OR WHO HAVE A PARENT OR PARENTS RESIDENT IN THE PARISH OF GREAT PONTON.

name: OLDERSHAW EDUCATIONAL FOUNDATION
activities: To assist disadvantaged children and/or groups of children within Kegworth with financial assistance
objects: NET YEARLY INCOME SHALL BE APPLIED BY THE TRUSTEES FOR THE BENEFIT OF YOUNG PERSONS OF EITHER SEX WHO (OR WHOSE PARENTS OR ONE OR OTHER OF THEM) ARE RESIDENT IN THE AREA OF THE PARISH OF KEGWORTH, LEICESTER WHO HAVE NOT ATTAINED THE AGE OF 25 YEARS AND WHO IN THE OPINION OF THE TRUSTEES ARE IN NEED OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE(SUCH PERSONS BEING HEREWITH REFERED TO AS BENEFICIARIES) IN ONE OR MORE OF THE FOLLOWING WAYS:A)AWARD TO THE BENEFICIARIES OF EXHIBITIONS OR GRANTS TENABLE AT ANY SECONDARY SCHOOL, COLLEGE OF EDUCATION ,UNIVERSITY OR OTHER INSTITUTION OF FURTHER (INCLUDING PROFESSIONS AND TECHNICAL ) EDUCATION APPROVED BY THE TRUSTEES. B)PROVIDING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE, OUTFITS, CLOTHING, TOOLS, INSTRUMENTS OR BOOKS TO HELP BENEFICIARIES ON LEAVING SCHOOL, UNIVERSITY OR ANY OTHER EDUCATIONAL ESTABLISHMENT TO PREPARE FOR OR TO ENTER A PROFESSION, TRADE OR CALLING; C) PROVIDING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO ENABLE BENEFICIARIES TO TRAVEL, WHETHER IN THIS COUNTRY OR ABROAD, TO PURSUE THEIR EDUCATION; D) PROVIDING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO ANY CHARITABLE ORGANISATION IN OR IN THE NEIGHBOURHOOD OF THE PARISH OF KEGWORTH, THE OBJECTS OF WHICH ARE DIRECTED TO ADVANCING THE EDUCATION OF ,OR IMPROVING THE CONDITIONS OF LIFE FOR THE BENEFICIARIES BY DEVELOPING THEIR PHYSICAL ,MENTAL AND MORAL CAPACITIES THROUGH THEIR LEISURE TIME ACTIVITIES E) OTHERWISE PROMOTING THE EDUCATION OF THE BENEFICIARIES.

name: SUNDERLAND JEWISH BOYS' HOSTEL AND TALMUDICAL COLLEGE
activities: The charities objectives are to promote theological and talmudic research, provide such educational facilities as will enable the students to become Rabbis, Ministers, Readers and Hebrew teachers for the Jewish Community. The college also helps necessitous students pursue their studies by means of scholarships and grants.
objects: 1. TO PROMOTE THEOLOGICAL AND TALMUDICAL RESEARCH. 2. TO PROVIDE SUCH EDUCATIONAL FACILITIES AS WILL ENABLE THE STUDENTS TO BECOME RABBIS, MINISTER, READERS AND HEWBREW TEACHERS FOR JEWISH COMMUNITIES. 3. TO PROVIDE SCHOLARSHIPS DURING THEIR STAY AT THE COLLEGE FOR SUCH STUDENTS AS REQUIRE IT. 4. TO ACQUIRE PROPERTY AND ANYTHING NECESSARY FOR THE MAINTENANCE OF THE INSTITUTION. 5. TO COLLECT THE MONEY NEEDED FOR THE ACHIEVEMENT OF THESE AIMS.

name: THE UNIVERSITY OF NEWCASTLE UPON TYNE DEVELOPMENT TRUST
activities: The Trust receives and invest funds from donors for the benefit of Newcastle University. Grants are made twice each year to the University to fund posts, scholarships and projects, in accordance with the specific wishes of the donors.
objects: FOR SUCH PURPOSES AS ARE EXCLUSIVELY CHARITABLE ACCORDING TO THE LAW OF ENGLAND AND WALES AND ARE DEEMED TO FURTHER THE WORK OF THE UNIVERSITY.

name: TAYLOR'S EDUCATIONAL FOUNDATION
activities: GRANTS TO YOUNG PEOPLE RESIDENT IN FORMER NEWBURN UDC AREA OF NEWCASTLE UPON TYNE TO ASSIST EDUCATION AND TRAINING.
objects: BENEFIT OF BOYS OR GIRLS UNDER THE AGE OF 25 IN NEED OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE IN ONE OR MORE OF THE FOLLOWING WAYS:- (A) EXHIBITIONS OR GRANTS TENABLE AT ANY SECONDARY SCHOOL OR INSTITUTION OF FURTHER EDUCATION; (B) FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO BENEFICIARIES PREPARING TO ENTER A PROFESSION,TRADE OR CALLING; (C) OTHERWISE PROMOTING THE EDUCATION (INCLUDING SOCIAL AND PHYSICAL TRAINING) OF BENEFICIARIES.

name: HAWKYARDS AND WHITEHEADS EDUCATIONAL FOUNDATION
activities: Providing grants for educational purposes to individual children living and going to school in Saddleworth.
objects: A) THE PROVISION OF ASSISTANCE FOR HIGHER EDUCATION OR THE AWARD OF MAINTENANCE ALLOWANCES; B) ATTENDING TO THE HEALTH AND PHYSICAL CONDITION OF CHILDREN RESIDENT IN THE BENEFICIAL AREA.

name: THE J B EASTWOOD QUEEN ELIZABETH GRAMMAR SCHOOL FOR BOYS FUND
activities: Advancement of education in the Parish of Mansfield, and in particular, furtherance of the education of pupils of the Queen Elizabeth's (1561) Endowed School, Mansfield

name: HARPER ADAMS UNIVERSITY COLLEGE
activities: The object of the University College shall be the provision, conduct and development of the University College to provide higher education for the industries, professions and communities associated with rural land.  The charity is not currently active.
objects: THE PROVISION, CONDUCT AND DEVELOPMENT OF A COLLEGE FOR THE PROVISION OF EDUCATION AND TRAINING IN PRACTICAL AND THEORETICAL AGRICULTURE.

name: OSWESTRY SCHOOL CHARITY
activities: Independent day and boarding school providing a full educational curriculum for pupils aged 4 to 18
objects: 1. THE PROVISION AND CONDUCT OF A DAY OR DAY AND BOARDING SCHOOL FOR BOYS AND GIRLS IN OR NEAR THE TOWN OF OSWESTRY; AND/OR, 2. TO FURTHER THE OBJECTS OF THE CHARITY CALLED OSWESTRY SCHOOL (1079822) INSOFAR AS THEY RELATE TO THE PROVISION AND CONDUCT OF A DAY OR DAY AND BOARDING SCHOOL AND GIRLS ON OR NEAR THE TOWN OF OSWESTRY.

name: KING EDWARD VI HIGH SCHOOL,LICHFIELD
activities: Land and Buildings to be used by the County Council for secondary education of boys and girls
objects: (A)IN AWARDING TO BOYS AND GIRLS OR YOUNG MEN AND WOMEN NOT OVER 25 YEARS OF AGE WHO ARE OR WHO HAVE BEEN FOR NOT LESS THAN TWO YEARS AT ANY TIME IN ATTENDANCE AT THE SCHOOL,AND WHO ARE,IN THE OPINION OF THE COUNCIL,IN NEED OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE,SCHOLARSHIPS,BURSARIES OR MAINTENANCE ALLOWANCES TENABLE AT ANY SCHOOL,UNIVERSITY,OR OTHER PLACE OF LEARNING, APPROVED BY THE COUNCIL.(B)IN PROVIDINF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE,OUTFITS,CLOTHING,TOOLS,INSTRUMENTS OR BOOKS TO ENABLE BENEFICIARIES ON LEAVING SCHOOL,A UNIVERSITY,OR ANY OTHER EDUCATIONAL ESTABLISHMENT,TO PREPARE FOR,OR TO ASSIST THEIR ENTRY INTO,A PROFESSION TRADE OR CALLING.  FOR FURTHER DETAILS SEE SCHEME.

name: ALLEYNE'S HIGH SCHOOL
activities: Awarding beneficiaries Scholarships,Bursaries or Maintenance Allowances tenable at any school, university, or other place of learning, approved by the Council. In providing financial assistance, outfits,clothing,tools,instruments or books to enable beneficiaries on leaving school,a university, or any other educational establishment to prepare for or to assist their entry into a profession.
objects: PROVISION OF A SCHOOL SITE.  A YEARLY SUM SHALL BE APPLIED IN PROVIDING FOR THE SCHOOL, SPECIAL BENEFITS OF A KIND NOT NORMALLY PROVIDED BY THE STAFFORDSHIRE COUNTY COUNCIL. ANY RESIDUE OF THE INCOME OF THE FOUNDATION TO BE APPLIED IN ONE OR MORE OF THE FOLLOWING WAYS - A)THE PROVISION OF ASSISTANCE FOR HIGHER EDUCATION BY THE AWARD OF SCHOLARSHIPS, BURSARIES OR MAINTENANCE ALLOWANCES. B)AWARDING SCHOLARSHIPS OR MAINTENANCE ALLOWANCES TO ENABLE BENEFICIARIES TO TRAVEL TO PURSUE THEIR EDUCATION, AND PROVIDING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE TO ENABLE BENEFICIARIES TO STUDY MUSIC OR OTHER ARTS.

name: LEEK WAR MEMORIAL SCHOLARSHIP IN CONNEXION WITH LEEK HIGH SCHOOL

B) TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE, OUTFITS, CLOTHING, TOOLS, INSTRUMENTS OR BOOKS TO ENABLE BENEFICIARIES ON LEAVING SCHOOL, UNIVERSITY OR ANY OTHER EDUCATIONAL ESTABLISHMENT, TO PREPARE FOR, OR TO ASSIST THEIR ENTRY INTO A PROFESSION TRADE OR CALLING. (FOR FURTHER DETAILS SEE CLAUSE 3 OF SCHEME)

name: ARLIDGE'S CHARITY
activities: There are no activities
objects: THE TRUSTEES SHALL (1) PAY 1/7 OF THE YEARLY INCOME OF THE CHARITY TO THE MINISTER FOR THE TIME BEING OF THE SAID ABBEY HILL UNITED REFORMED CHURCH EITHER FOR APPLICATION BY HIM IN FUTHERING THE RELIGIOUS AND OTHER CHARITABLE WORK OF THE CONGREGATION MEETING FOR RELIGIOUS WORSHIP AT THE SAID CHURCH OR, IN AUGMENTATION OF HIS STIPEND; (2) APPLY THE RESIDUE OF SUCH INCOME IN ONE OR BOTH THE FOLLOWING WAYS (A)FOR RELIEF IN NEED OF PERSONS RESIDENT IN KENILWORTH WHO ARE MEMBERS OF THE UNITED REFORM CHURCH,WITH A PREFERENCE FOR PERSONS WHO ARE MEMBERS OF THE ABBEY HILL UNITED REFORM CHURCH (B) IN PROMOTING THE EDUCATION (INCULDING SOCIAL AND PHYSICAL TRAINING) OF PERSONS UNDER THE AGE OF 25 YEARS AND IN NEED OF FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE WHO ARE OR WHOSEPARENTS OR ONE OF WHOSE PARENTS ARE MEMBERS OF THE UNITED REFORMED CHURCH AND WHO ARE RESIDENT IN THE COUNTY OF WARWICK AS CONSTITUTED IMMEDIATELY BEFORE 1 APRIL 1974 WITH A PREFERENCE FOR PERSONS RESIDENT IN KENILWORTH.

name: MARY DORMER HARRIS BURSARY
activities: For the promotion, encouragement and assistance of the education of students of history and of such other branches of education as the trustees may from time to time decide.
