name: Finechty Men's Shed
activities: The purpose of the organisation is to provide recreational facilities and advance the social needs, health and wellbeing of any man aged 18 or over who is currently resident in Findochty and surrounding areas.  By: a) Creating, developing and maintaining a facility, namely a Men's Shed.  b) Offering opportunities for men in the Findochty area to meet and undertake creative, physical, purposeful and recreational activities of their choice.  c) Reducing isolation of men in the area thus contributing to their physical and mental wellbeing.  d) Developing the capacity of men in the Findochty area to share their skills and knowledge with others in the community.
objects: The purpose of the organisation is to provide recreational facilities and advance the social needs, health and wellbeing of any man aged 18 or over who is currently resident in Findochty and surrounding areas. name: The Stewart and Irene Storie Charitable Trust
activities: Subject to the powers over Capital below, the trustees shall pay or apply the income of the Trust Fund to such Charities or for such Scottish Charitable Purposes as the Trustees think fit.
objects: Subject to the powers over Capital below, the trustees shall pay or apply the income of the Trust Fund to such Charities or for such Scottish Charitable Purposes as the Trustees think fit.

name: Focus Youth Project SCIO
activities: 4 The organisation's purposes are:   4.1 The Advancement of Education through participation in a variety of learning opportunities for example outdoor education courses, information technology skills and software training, Duke of Edinburgh Award, Dynamic Youth Awards and Saltire Award Scheme. These opportunities will help members gain new qualifications and therefore build their social capital and prepare them for future working life.  4.2 The Advancement of Health to use issue-based youth work as an opportunity to explore and discuss a wide variety of health issues that affect young people. This includes healthy eating, sexual health, poverty, money management, peer pressure, mental health, body image and a variety of fitness programmes.  4.3  The provision of recreational facilities, or the organisation of recreational activities, with the objects of improving the conditions of life for the persons for whom the facilities or activities are primarily intended  4.4 Provide Services for 5-25years.

name: Stornoway Free Church of Scotland (Continuing)
activities: The principal objective of the congregation, in common with the Church body of which it is a part, is to maintain the public worship of God and advance the Gospel and kingdom of the Lord Jesus Christ, in obedience to Him and in accordance with the Holy Scriptures.
objects: The principal objective of the congregation, in common with the Church body of which it is a part, is to maintain the public worship of God and advance the Gospel and kingdom of the Lord Jesus Christ, in obedience to Him and in accordance with the Holy Scriptures.

name: Community Air Support Service (SCIO)
activities: 4 The organisation's purposes are: The advancement of citizenship and community development.  The provision of recreational facilities, or the organisation of recreational activities, with the object of improving the conditions of life for the persons for whom the facilities or activities are primarily intended.  The relief of those in need by reason of age, illhealth, disability, financial hardship or other disadvantage, and in furtherance of these purposes.  4.1 To promote communities free of social exclusion and injustice where everyone has mobility and access to the services they require.  4.2 To provide free flights to members of remote rural communities who need to travel long distances in the Scottish Highlands and Islands in order to attend essential appointments or meetings for health and/or well-being.  4.3 To bring much needed supplies, such as medications, equipment, etc. to remote locations across the Highlands and Islands.  4.4 To organise, advise and encourage community involvement in refurbishing and maintaining disused airfields across the Highlands and Islands.  4.5 To work in partnership with local businesses and organisations in order to encourage sponsorship of small airfields in the Scottish Highlands and Islands.  4.6 To offer free ?once in a lifetime? gift flights to disadvantaged members of rural communities. such as the terminally ill and severely disabled.  4.7 To collaborate and engage with local authorities, services and community leaders to organise events such as small air shows and displays in order to generate interest and involvement in the provision of an air service as well as promote local tourism.
objects: 4 The organisation's purposes are: The advancement of citizenship and community development.  The provision of recreational facilities, or the organisation of recreational activities, with the object of improving the conditions of life for the persons for whom the facilities or activities are primarily intended.  The relief of those in need by reason of age, illhealth, disability, financial hardship or other disadvantage, and in furtherance of these purposes.  4.1 To promote communities free of social exclusion and injustice where everyone has mobility and access to the services they require.  4.2 To provide free flights to members of remote rural communities who need to travel long distances in the Scottish Highlands and Islands in order to attend essential appointments or meetings for health and/or well-being.  4.3 To bring much needed supplies, such as medications, equipment, etc. to remote locations across the Highlands and Islands.  4.4 To organise, advise and encourage community involvement in refurbishing and maintaining disused airfields across the Highlands and Islands.  4.5 To work in partnership with local businesses and organisations in order to encourage sponsorship of small airfields in the Scottish Highlands and Islands.  4.6 To offer free ?once in a lifetime? gift flights to disadvantaged members of rural communities. such as the terminally ill and severely disabled.  4.7 To collaborate and engage with local authorities, services and community leaders to organise events such as small air shows and displays in order to generate interest and involvement in the provision of an air service as well as promote local tourism.

name: Gala Fairydean Rovers Football Club Community Trust
activities: 4.1	The advancement of public participation in sport and the provision of recreational facilities, coaching, training and volunteering opportunities, primarily related to association football.  4.2	The advancement of the art, heritage, culture and science through the restoration and preservation of the category A-listed stand at Netherdale 3G Arena.
objects: 4.1	The advancement of public participation in sport and the provision of recreational facilities, coaching, training and volunteering opportunities, primarily related to association football.  4.2	The advancement of the art, heritage, culture and science through the restoration and preservation of the category A-listed stand at Netherdale 3G Arena.

name: Church Recording Society
activities: (3.1) The objects of the SOCIETY are: the advancement of the arts, culture and heritage; and the advancement of education, in each case for the public benefit by: identifying, researching, recording and archiving the artefacts, natural features and histories of present and past places of worship, religious sites and buildings of religious use of any denomination; education and training of people to undertake these activities; rendering assistance to, and working with, others undertaking similar work for the public benefit; providing and encouraging education about the artistic, historic, cultural and heritage attributes of, and the significances of, the artefacts and natural features; and publications, media productions, lectures, courses and other means of communication; and by: continuing the The Arts Society Church Recording Volunteering activity of The National Association of Decorative and Fine Arts Societies (Charity number 1089743 England and SC39240 Scotland) ('The Arts Society') in succession to The Arts Society.   Nothing in this constitution shall authorise an application of the property of the SOCIETY for the purposes which are not charitable in accordance with section 7 of the Charities and Trustee Investment (Scotland) Act 2005, section 5 of the Charities Registration and Regulation Act 2019 (of the Isle of Man) and section 2 of the Charities Act (Northern Ireland) 2008
